column2: Early Morning to miss the crowds was worth it, then Lunch at Bubba Gumps Shrimp Co.
column3: Took an Uber to Santa Monica around 0630 am and was pleasantly surprised by the Pier at this hour and the fact that we had time to walk around and enjoy the views without the crowds that appeared later. Was very impressed with the amount of Bikes/Scooters etc that you could also hire from as little as 15 cents per minute. It was a beautiful relaxing morning and then a leisurely walk along Venus Beach. highly recommend, would also have been nice to venture to Malibu if we had the time. Unfortunate part of the whole USA Holiday was the depreciation in the Australian Dollar. Wont think of travelling again to the US until this changes, way to costly.

column2: Great parking if you get there early
column3: Pier parking was a maximum of $12 for the day on a beautiful winter Sunday. Well worth it for location between the pier and 3rd Street promendae. Both good places for strolling and people watching.

column2: A little pier with big personality!
column3: Us locals are good with it and have been for many many decades, but as a 'tourist attraction' it may disappoint. I can't recommend a meal at Bubba Gump's unless you're drinking the 'tourist kool-aid', but catch a sunset on the ferris wheel and you'll understand why the locals love it so. The end of Route 66, featured in such video games as Vampire Masquerade and Grand Theft Auto, and featured in films such as Elmer Gantry and The Sting.
This is a great place to visit in Santa Monica, it is actually a must. There is a great sense of history , and the outlook bact to Santa Monica from the water is a great way to see LA.

column2: Iconic Pier, lives up to its movie star status
column3: Iconic Pier, lives up to its movie star status, a must see, obviously touristy, but a great place to soak up the beach vibe

We stopped by the Santa Monica piers as it is on the LA to visit list. It has the same feel of Coney Island in New York.However, it is very touristy. I would say plan for an hour unless you have kids.
Great place to hang out and people watch, lots of touresty stuff here...but this is the Santa Monica pier...get over yourself and have some fun.

column2: Great place to spend several hours or even the day
column3: Stopped by the Santa Monica Pier during a stay in Los Angelas. Interesting sites and many places to eat. If you can time your visit to see the sunset, you will appreciate it.

Easy street parking along the main road (2$ per hour) go just before sunset and watch the sun go down behind the ferris wheel (from the beach side) then enjoy the view at night. Dinner options and snacks available too.
The Pier was not what I had imagined but still fun, relaxed and a gorgeous setting. Take your time to pop into stores, view the sights, eat, play and enjoy
Santa Monica Pier is the CA end of Route 66 which is SUPER COOL but other than that, it is extremely crowded and touristy. As long as you know that going in, you will have fun!

column2: Another one of California one visit is enough attractions
column3: Just not overly impressed. Lots of vendors selling typical tourist junk. A few overpriced under delivered eateries bathrooms with massive lines and were dirty and poorly kept. It was a hour visit including a meal and that was about it. The most attractive part of it was it was very pretty from down the beach at night.
Always look forward to visit the beaches of Los Angeles even in the winter. Lots of things to see and do and places to wat are great.
Had a good stroll along the pier. Had some funnel cake from one of the stalls. Short walk to the pier from the metro station. Didn't do any of the rides on the pier.

column2: The Santa Monica pier is exciting and fun for all.
column3: We had a business meeting and had a break. We drove to the pier. It was worth the drive. The food was great and there were a lot of vendors. The view was beautiful. We had a great time. Also they had something to do for the young and the young at heart.

Very good and well kept area.Saw a Sea Lion of the end of the Pier, although there were local fishermen trying to sell food to tourists which was off putting to see.Everything is typically overpriced - only complaint.
Plenty of things to do the kids loved, great selections of food, and the Ferris wheel was so cool being on the water.

Was in LA on a work trip decided to check out the Santa Monica icon. It was a fun stop, parking and getting there was typical LA fashion, lots of cones and redirects to get to the parking lot. 7 bucks for parking was a bit steep. But the pier itself is pretty much what you expect, lots of street performers and ‚Äúinteresting‚Äù people watching. I went early so the amusement park wasn‚Äôt overly crowded but steadily picked up through out the night. The park was really nothing more that a carnival on a pier and prices were comparable. You simply can‚Äôt visit Santa Monica with out riding the pier mounted feris wheel. There was a really obnoxious and pushy seal begging the fisherman for bait at the end of the pier. All in all, I hope make the trip back out and experience it with the family one day.
One of the best sunset in the entire world. I‚Äôve loved visiting the pier late in the evening, enjoing the Sun going into the ocean.

column2: Very crowded, hard to park, but cool and wait times for rides are good.
column3: Very crowded but wait times for rides are relatively short. Can be cold at night especially if windy.

column2: Long time staple on the beautiful Pacific Coast
column3: This long time staple of the west coast is a very cool place to visit or those visiting from out of town or for locals who want to spend a quick fun afternoon by the water.The attractions have increased in price over the years but they still offer enough fun for the family and dates to keep in entertaining. The ferris wheel has to be given a go, and if you are lucky, you will catch one of the magnificent sunsets the west coast has to offer.There are your typical food shacks and snacks and some more casual dining restaurants like Bubba Gumps.Parking is a bit tough on busy weekends, so take an Uber or bike here.

Like any other pier this place is also filled with lights and laughter. We spend the evening on the beach and then went to the pier around sunset. The food shops and the fun rides and the beautiful beach at the backdrop make the pier magical. There‚Äôs people from all places playing, eating, dancing, chatting away. It‚Äôs a beautiful place with beautiful people. Perfect for an evening with family and friends.

column2: So cool to just ppl watch
column3: I loved the energy of this place, the ppl the sounds the entertainers everywhere. It was so much fun and we were travelling with a 2 yr old and this was such a neat place to sped u9r Sunday.

If you want the iconic instaworthy picture with this pier on the background, my recommendation is to take the picture during Sunrise when there is no one around and the beautiful color pastel color of the sky.Sunset is beautiful but there are too many people to get a good shot and the sun just way too harsh if you don't equipt the right camera.We took these picture from the Original Muscle Beach overlooking the pier.
The weather was bad but the place should be a great spot for surfers during the sunny days.Kind of old school relaxed atmosphere.

Superb! Even in December - When the wind was not blowing we could walk around in T shirts! Take a look into the stores, buy an ice cream... Take a look at the fun fair - ride some rides... Watch the street entertainers... Look out to sea... Just chill, watch the World Go by!Loved it - Really cool go take a look - Go visit a restaurant!And chill :-)

Santa Monica pier lives up to all you see and hear about in the movies / docs/ pics etc. It is a must see if staying in this part of LA. Fortunately we had a great sunny day we visited. (December). Roomy wooden jetty to stroll with plenty of stalls, buskers, artists, artisans. magicians, musicians, famous people lookalikes - you name it. Great little fun park. Did ride ferris wheel , great views of Malibu & Venice beach. Plenty of food options, mostly american type fast food but no KFC or Macka's üëèüëè . Even tryed the local popular desert - funnel cake ( over sized donut really with heaps of strawberry topping and ice cream def. made to share.Internal Old style merry go round - piece of history. Also had a Bubba- Gumps shrimp restaurant - which we did eat at on our fianl night in LA. Had couple mojitos at end pier restaurant watching sunset. Enjoyed it immensely, a must see.
Amazing food, Busker‚Äôs, amusement park and gorgeous views. Make sure you go and visit. Day or night it‚Äôs a fun place to be!

Whats a visit to LA without visiting Santa Monica Pier?Just like in the movies, its busy, with people selling stuff and live acts its got an amazing vibe to it. We went on a Weekend there and it gets full, keep kids close so they don‚Äôt get lost.It was an amazing vibe of various cultures. Different smells hit you as you walk along the pier towards the park as people are selling fresh fruit, churros, hot dogs and more.Its got the beach vibe while you hear people on the rides scream on the rides, laughter of children, nothing better to spend the day just chilling and taking it all in.

I enjoyed Santa Monica Pier with my teenage children when visiting from Australia in January 2019. The pier was exactly as it seems in the movies. The amusement park is nothing special, but we actually had a lot of fun on the rides and playing the arcade games. We were there for hours. January is probably a good time to visit, as it wasn‚Äôt very busy. The views from the ferris wheel are awesome. It had a nice fun vibe.

We visited Santa Monica during the busy Christmas - New Year week, and it wasn‚Äôt enjoyable being out and about in the crowds. The Pier is one of those places that‚Äôs great to see once, but I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll be going back. The rides were quite expensive to go on, but provided a lovely view out of our hotel window. The Pier has all the usual tacky tourist shops, and dodgy looking food carts. I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll be like we were, and went despite reading all the mediocre reviews.

I was in Santa Monica for a fundraiser and had my mom with me. On our way home I took her to Santa Monica Pier since she had never been there. She had an amazing time just walking through the stores walking on the pier and walking in the sand. So glad I took her

We came here during the winter from Canada. There are a few carnival rides on the pier and a dine in restaurant on the end of the pier. We stayed for about 4 hours. We did some rides, ate at the restaurant and finished the day with more rides and a final ice cream snack before leaving. The weather was dry and warm which was perfect. The rides are less exciting as the big theme parks in the area but the point for us was to enjoy the scenery and visit somewhere new. there were lots of people but the ride waits were only 15 minutes or so at the longest but only 7-10 minutes normal. My favorite part was the rollercoaster with my daughter, we got a great picture from the automated camera located on the ride. My least favorite part was paying $15 USD to get access to the file online to download it. For $15USD you'd think they would at least email it to you. There were a couple street performers performing tricks on the pier, and some nick-nack booths. Worth stopping in for awhile if you've never been before. We caught an Uber ride here so no info on the parking situation.

We drove up from Venice beach to see Santa Monica and walk on the Pier and it was just okay. It was wonderful to see people from all over the world walking by and it was wonderful to see the sunset but not much to do (if you aren't interested in the amusement park).

There‚Äôs three things you need to know about the pier.1. Parking is not free but there‚Äôs different options. You have meter parking and various lots that you can choose from. The lots vary in price, but it‚Äôs never anything too crazy.2. The beach and pier entrance is free. The arcade and rides are not but you don‚Äôt have to pay for that if you don‚Äôt want to. You can just walk around and enjoy the view.3. The food on the pier is very limited and a bit pricey. You‚Äôre better off eating at the third street promenade (it‚Äôs a 5 minute walk from the pier). There‚Äôs a lot more options in different price ranges there.If you‚Äôre a local, it‚Äôs a good spot to visit every now and then. If you‚Äôre a tourist, you have to go and ride the Ferris wheel! üé°
A wonderful place to go in the late afternoon and early evening, watching sunset, wandering on the beach, riding in the Pacific Park, watching street performances and snacking. What a life!
Crowded, fascinating, interesting. Take a stroll along the pier, people watch, enjoy the views, take photos...

The Pier is nice - but when we visited it was so busy you literally could hardly walk to the end. Also the musicians were loud and not that great. Maybe it was just an off day - I know it is a famous place.

Word of note we paid too much for parking as we were confused and traffic was challenging. There is inexpensive parking down by the water front it‚Äôs just a challenge with lots of foot traffic on the streets and unfamiliarity to see the signs.Don‚Äôt pay the high prices and don‚Äôt pull into a parking place where someone is holding a sign flagging you in without a price being displayed. It‚Äôs going to be expensive... learn from us.Have patience and look for on the beach parking. Naturally, we saw this option after we paid $25 to park and started walking along the pier.It‚Äôs worth a one time visit to the pier as you get the beauty of the waterfront as well as the amusement park and the odd entertainment. Some artist like the violinist was incredibly talented but some were really oddballs! Fun day for sure.

Loved Santa Monica! Not overally much to do there for couples but it‚Äôs a nice stroll and beautiful views. Love the small shops and quirky people along the way ! Loved the pizza shop had a good pepperoni üëåüèº

My family and I had a great visit. We only rode one ride on the pier due to the amount of time we were able to stay, but riding the iconic coaster on the pier was so much fun. It's something our kids won't soon forget. The little shops along the way were nice to visit and priced fairly decent. We enjoyed the street performances along the way. I could rate higher if the rides weren't so expensive. The pier was also very clean.
The end of Route 66. A very touristy place with quite a few eating outlets. There are also rides, an arcade. Of course there are plenty of souvenir stores.

column2: A favorite spot for a Ferris wheel ride
column3: This Ferris wheel ride is a nice and relaxing break with amazing views. The ride is not rushed and you get a good amount of time on the wheel.
Surrounded by beach the beauty of the pier is stunning. Great restaurants, 100 year old merry-go-round, fun rides, and room to run for the kids.

Beautiful views and a lot of options for some nice photos. We took the Metro and were very glad we did due to the traffic. The Pier is a very easy walk form the Metro Station.I enjoyed some of the performers. Some I'm not sure they make any money due to talent level! We were there for lunch and it was not easy to get a table much after 11:30. We did get an outdoor table with a view of the ocean and it was fantastic.

What a beautiful place to visit. Even in the heart of winter, the warm sun makes for a perfect morning. Lovely novelty stores and views that go on forever. Ferris wheels for entertainment and food and stores to keep you occupied. And if you're lucky, you'll get to see a resident sea lion!

This is a must see to check off your list! We visited during the June gloom, but we had fun people watching! There is a parking lot next to the pier. There were several restaurants and food choices on the pier as well as merchandise. You must have your picture made at the Route 66 sign, but there will likely be a line of people doing the same thing!

We had to visit twice !!!On our fist visit it was a bit overcast and the sun was setting.. but the sunset was not a bit lackluster.On our second visit later that week, we spent the day, playing games in the arcade, riding the rides in the park and watching the second best sunset we have seen (Rick;s Cafe Negril Jamaica is the best) ... the view from the Pier to sea and back to shore is simply fantastic.There activities for all ages and all mobility levels, a simply fun place for a day trip.

We had an awesome day there, and the highlight was renting bicycles and cycling to Venice Beach. Even for me, the ride wasn't too far, and the views were beautiful. We rode our bikes back to the Santa Monica Pier just as the sun was setting. Gorgeous!

A quick walk up and down the pier is enough if you want the experience. It was very crowded, of course, but the many vendors selling junk at high prices clogged up the pier even more making it difficult to get through. We got a small cone that cost $7 which is typical of such touristy places. We did, however, enjoy the beautiful sunset.

column2: a MOST visit place if you are in the LA area
column3: This place is beautiful, you should really visit it if you are in the LA or California area, specially at night the lights are amazing and there are lot of options for food and attractions, you most go

column2: Uninteresting tourist trap - 5 minutes is plenty
column3: This was a disappointment! Very touristy unattractive pier selling cheap items you would expect from such a location. If you want to enjoy the crashing waves on the lovely nearby beach, avoid the constant out of tune noise from a 'music vendor' on the pier. I am sure that local attractions such as the aquarium are far more enjoyable. Worth a five minute visit to say you have been perhaps.
I was disappointed visiting the pier. Very Honky Tonk.Crowded with lots of junk to buy and eat. Amusement Park might be alright,but I didn't visit that part of the Pier
Touristy but you‚Äôve got to see it. Spend 5 minutes there, then move on asap! Full of rubbish shops and tourist food, but the views of the beach are lovely.
Fun time with kids. The rides are old school and the kids loved them. Funnel cake galore and lots of other eats. Finish it off with a delightful ride on the original carousel.

We went on a tour after disembarking a cruise. We walked down to the pier, where there were fast food eateries, coffee shops, street performers, arcade games and more! We didn‚Äôt stop anywhere, just walked down and back and took it in. The views of the beach from the pier are lovely. It‚Äôs worth a walk down to have a look.

It was packed - which does provide nice people-watching, but almost too much. Our favorite part was getting a seat on some risers (which fill up) about 20 minutes before sunset at the very end of the pier looking into the sunset. We watched the sun set while listening to great music. Parking is $7 and usually available right at the end of the pier.

Loved walking down the pier this morning. Such a wonderful view of the ocean. The stalls were just setting up and lots of people buzzing around. As I was leaving a group of old school cars were coming into the car park which was lots of fun.

Fun spot to visit for the whole family. Ferris wheel, couple of amusement park rides, swing on a trapeze and get caught in midair(safety net and safety harness supplied). Vendors and eats galore. Muscle beach is close by with random feats of strength and balancing to amaze you.

Nice stop on a recent so cal trip. I was a bit hesitant when we first walked up from the adjacent parking lot, as there was a strong urine smell. Luckily that went away as soon as we climbed the steps up to the pier. I also appreciated that there were a ton of public bathrooms on the pier, so no need to find one in a nearby store. There were lively performers, lots of spots for photo ops, and a few little trinket shops and carts. It was fairly crowded for January, but worth the stop.

column2: Always a fun place to walk around
column3: We enjoyed walking the pier at sunset. Views are pretty and pier animated. It is a fun thing to do and it is free to get there. There are kiosks that sell unusual items like a grain of rice with your name engraved on it. There rides (paid) for grown-ups and kids, restaurants and you can even be an acrobat for a couple of hours.

column2: Something for everyone! Amazing at sunset :)
column3: We were staying in Santa Monica and we actually went back to the pier three times for the sunset because it was so pretty! If you don‚Äôt want to do all of the rides, I recommend you at least do the Ferris wheel ride around sunset because it was amazing. The color of the ocean is so pretty. We also enjoyed the other rides.

column2: Capture the Culture of Los Angeles
column3: Santa Monica Pier is frequented by tourists and locals. Offering am amusement park rides and people watching of diverse people. Around the pier, you can observer surfing, volleyball, people sunning, and other beach activities. Fishing at the end of the pier. Excellent Photo Opportunities to capture a portion of the culture of Los Angeles.Paid Parking is available on the pier (drive through the entrance of the pier), and for slightly less cost, beach parking is available.
This is an awesome place and an icon if you are in LA. You have to say you made it here!! Pretty sunsets as well!
It's super busy which was pretty annoying, the beach is perfect to spend and chill out. The area is pretty cool. Worth a visit if coming to LA, would spend about 1/2 day and get some food here.

Tourist spot. Packed with ppl. But worth going to. Beautiful. All kinds of people. Very ‚Äúfeel like I‚Äôm a movie‚Äù kind of place. Gorgeous beach. Lots of restaurants on pier. But be ready for ppl trying to sell you stuff.

column2: Fun to see but nothing special
column3: It was fun to walk over the pier as it is such an iconic landmark for Santa Monica. Be however prepared for large crowds, loud music and overpriced shops, attractions and food. I much preferred downtown Santa Monica or a walk down to Venice beach.
Busy pier with tourist shops and fair-type rides. Parking right on the pier. Street musicians. Fishing. Too crowded for my taste.
You cannot come to Santa Monica without experiencing the Santa Monica Pier! Such a great atmosphere and plenty of things to keep everyone happy!

One of the most famous piers in the world. End of the iconic Route 66 which runs from Chicago to Santa Monica. Must get your pic with the sign. Has a small carnival which is a bit pricey. But end of the pier offers a great place to take pics of the Pacific as well as Santa Monica beach. The ferris wheel lit up at night is one of the most iconic pics of the area
We enjoyed being on the Pier viewing the ocean waves come into shore. Even though it is a busy place there is plenty room to relax apart from the crowd. Many interesting places to eat in the area.
Pretty area with a great atmosphere. The rides on the pier may be a bit overpriced but we did go on a couple.I enjoyed the buskers
If you're visiting you have to check out this place. The rides are expensive but worth it. Very instagramable
A fun little outing for the kids but it can be very crowded and the cost of the rides is very high for what you get.

Family visit to Santa Monica & the Pier on a sunny but cold day in December. The temperature was about 10degrees cooler than our visit at the same time last year.The pier was as busy as ever & there were lots of people of the beach in spite of the cold.The same sellers were selling the same tourist tat - you can get everything here.My teenagers kept remarking on how exactly the same it was to Santa Monica pier in GTA.....

Had a nice visit to Santa Monica and a stroll on this famous pier which has been a location in many Hollywood movie. There is a hustle and bustle about it, people fishing, souvenir salesmen, local performers and an amusement park. A nice and interesting place to spend a coupple of hours or having lunch at one of the restaurants.
excellent location by the ocean, attractions for all ages, great restaurants around, I will recommend it to families.

The pier is a busy spot for people watching, casual eating and carnival rides too. We walked to the end and upstairs to get pictures from above the crowds. Lots of trinkets for souvenirs and gorgeous beach views.

column2: Nice place to visit but expensive!
column3: Went here New Years Eve and watched the sunset off the beach then walked around the pier very nice at Night to see all the lights!! Tried to go on some rides but they were very expensive!! We did have hot chocolate and funnel cake. They were delicious!

It's a like a fair/carnival on a pier. Lots of people and overpriced! There are so many other piers along the coast, I'm not sure why this one gets so much attention (almost every city on the coast has their own pier). Venice beach is approximately 2 miles south if you walk/ride on the boardwalk FYI.One visit was enough for me.
Beware the gypsy people on the pier They are every whereEat before you goKind of grossThere was a cute seal at the end of the pier

I visited the Santa Monica pier on January 2nd and watched a street performer who was performing magic tricks in front of a crowd of about 50. He was a very funny entertainer and his final trick was amazing. He presented at 12:30 and ended at 1. Did anyone else see this? If so, does anyone know the name of the performer? I‚Äôd like to give him credits!

The Santa Monica Pier is a great spot for great views down the beach and the ocean. You can go on amusement park rides and play games at Pacific Park if that suits your fancy. There are lots of places to get a bite to eat on the pier or a number of stores to shop at as well.
out of lots of overcrowded tourist spots around, this one is definitely worth a visit. lots of street performers and vendors around. great views of the beach and mountains.

We visited on New Years Eve and suspect this is an exceptionally busy day as two attempts to get to the end of the pier resulted in us turning around. We would suspect that a visit here outside of holiday or weekends would be best if your timetable allows.
Its a place for a nice time, walking down the pier. You can buy t-shirts and souvenirs, eat, ride the attractions (mostly for small kids) and of course watch the waves rolling in

We went here to take a quick look and ended up staying a couple hours. Lots of food options, they have an amusement park with a roller coaster and other carnival rides, vendors, and lots of room to walk and see the sea. Fun visit but very crowded. Not sure if we would go back but maybe.
Great time with my daughter, between the rides, games, stores and restaurants. A very nice place with a beautiful views of the mountains and ocean.

column2: Ride the Ferris Wheel to Complete Route 66 Experience!
column3: While Route 66 actually finishes 4 blocks back from the beach (at Mel's Drive In), no trip is complete - so the book says! - without finishing off with a ride on the Santa Monica Pier Ferris Wheel.So, off we went to the Pier and it is exactly as it looks on the TV and is exactly what you expect. This is a tourist trap but when you are on holiday, these are the must do, once in a lifetime experiences.We rode the Ferris Wheel - $10 a person - and wandered around for a while. Weather was warm but overcast so we did not spend too long here. If we had been here longer we may have spend more time in the locality.

The sun shone its California magic on an old fashioned pier. There was some charm and families were enjoying the experience.Very friendly service at the official pier tourist shop.A walk along the beach was quieter.If you have a spare hour in Santa Monica then the pier is a good diversion for a walk.

column2: Touristy Pier with Rides and Crowds of People
column3: If you like the crowds and rides, this is the pier for you. Street artists (magicians, painters, calligraphy) can be found on the pier walkway.

The nice thing about Santa Monica Pier is being able to enjoy a sunny afternoon there even in December. It was pretty crowded on the day after Christmas, so I imagine it would be absolutely packed during the summer. It has a fun boardwalk like atmosphere with "street" performers, an arcade, rides (which cost $10 each!) and eateries. I recommend the Pier Burgers...yum!
Lots to see and do here on the pier, including the Pacific Park rides and Ferris Wheel. Watch the sun go down and enjoy the view!
Be sure to not show up expecting to get a meal quickly. It was extremely crowded when we were there and we almost missed our shuttle back to Hollywood while waiting on our ‚Äúfast food‚Äù
Spent last day of 2018 here. What a great experience. Lots of people. Very windy.Recommend dressing in layers.
Beautiful pier to have walked across, we enjoyed the views and the atmosphere. Attractions where a bit too expensive for me, but didn't let that spoil our fun!

column2: Made it to the end of the line
column3: Our trip to the pier was mostly for members of the group, wanting to get to the end of the trail...they traveled from IL to CA following Route 66. We walked the pier, and made some purchases to mark the occasion - put did do much else. The pier is very busy due to be a big tourist attraction, and offers things to do.
Visited here on a couple of occasions whilst in Los Angeles. Santa Monica is beautiful and well worth a visit. Lovely beach front and pier is lovely .

After living in Los Angeles for 20 years, I can say that Santa Monica Pier and surrounding areas are a great place to spend the day walking, exploring and enjoying the company of friends or family. There are activities for all age groups to include the beach and small amusement park. My family and friends always enjoy the carnival food like funnel cake... yumm!

Amazing experience. Parking by pier$10. Not bad. Very crowded on walk its holiday weekend much expected. We took sandwiches and drinks and we ate on the beach when we got hungry saving us lots of money like a soda $4 or water $4. The popcorn truck with churro popcorn by far to die for!! Avoid the overwhelming street performances by acting like I was taking a photo and kept walking lolThe rides looked fun but way to expensive so if you want to spend $30/$35 per person for all rides go for it. We had taken so many good photos and really enjoyed the experience and we can claim to say we have been to the Santa Monica Pier. Yes!
We spent an afternoon on the pier having lunch and visiting the weekend market. Craft was very good quality and we had lunch at Buuba Gump. It was a fun day out.
Nothing special outside of the view. The shops and food are overpriced and very crowded. Entertainers are placed for your enjoyment
Come to LA every year but what helps the choice of where to stay is this pier. Such a landmark and icon, always fun visiting it.

It‚Äôs a happy place with so many people coming and going. Got some medallion souvenirs and there was a penny rolling machine. Souvenir shirts were better in the specialty souvenir stores around the city than at the pier.

As far as I'm concerned this is the best part that this area. It was very cool the evening we were there but it certainly is a great place to watch the sunset. Everyone in our group got a bunch of good pictures. Quite a few people in the area I assume most were tourist. Even though it was quite cool there was probably 15 to 20 people surfing. They stayed until a half an hour after dark or so. That also was fun to watch. I would recommend coming here if you're in the area.
The atmosphere is very relaxing. Lots of street shows and quite amusing. Shopping is great and kids loves the theme park.

We were here on the last day when we visited Santa Monica.It wasn't very busy and we didn't do any of the rides etc. we just walked around a bit, watched the yoga session at the end of the Pier.It is good to visit once for all its fame and history but for us, nothing was worthwhile going back to see again.

Sadly, this bygone beauty has been destroyed by drug addicts and homeless people. It‚Äôs not safe. It‚Äôs disgusting. It‚Äôs a sad state of our society that these people have no where else to go and get help. It‚Äôs certainly not a place you want to take children.
Beautiful way to take in the views of the Atlantic Ocean and a fun place for kids Easy to get to and enjoy.

Tourist trap at its finest. This could be and should be so much more. The amusement park area is very run down. There is also some chain restaurants like Bubba Gump. There are also some good old fashioned burger and soda spots also. Go to the end of the pier for your chance to see some seals. We saw 1 guy swimming around. A piece of history being the end of the old Route 66!

Despite jammed packed crowds I still give the pier five stars. You can't beat the view. The all you can ride option is not cheap but certainly is worth a try given the lines are modest even on a busy day. I wish the F&B options were better but can be overcome by walking to the land side for options.
We enjoyed just walking up and down the pier and the sights. There was entertainment along the way and fun little shops. Restaurants were also within walking distance with friendly staff and service.

column2: Quick visit mid Dec, not busy at all
column3: We stopped in here in mid Dec. 2018, it wasn't very busy while we were there. We didn't do any of the rides, they were quite expensive. We walked around a bit, watched some of the street performers and had lunch at the end of the Pier at Mariasol. There are people trying to sell their goods that don't have shops on the pier that can be a but pushy but we just kept walking. It was alright, didn't find it to be anything worth while going back to see again but could have also been the time of year with not a lot going on.

column2: looks better from a distance, a bit too crowded
column3: If you are happy with crowds and fancy a rollercoaster ride above the Pacific Ocean Santa Monica Pier is the right place for you. I turned back after a quick look through Bubba Gump Shrimps menu and hearing that the waiting time for a table at 4:30pm on a Wednesday was more than half an hour. Not all the restaurants were that busy but you probably would want to eat at the most famous restaurant on the world famous Pier.Other than walking over some pretty old boards past the police station and jostling past too many people I cannot see the appeal in actually going on to the Pier (apart from 6am in the morning when you can hang out with just a very few anglers).It looks pretty though at sunset from a bit of a distance with the ferris wheel and the rollercoaster lit up and makes for a nice photo opportunity.
Rides on the pier are a bit expensive but you can pay by the ride. Each ride is about $10 per person. Mostly rides young teens would enjoy.
Something for everyone on the Santa Monica Pier. Fast food arcades street performers it's a great but very crowded public activity

Santa monica pier is just one of those places you need to vist it is beautiful day and night but even more so at night when it is all lit up. There is plenty to do and plenty of rides, ice cream, hot dogs, candy floss all the fun of the fair has to offer. They also have a great beach snd amazing sun sets over the pacific ocean.

column2: Great stop to watch the fishermen, disgusting restrooms!
column3: A fun place to stop. Bathrooms were very disgusting & gross!! I‚Äôm picky about clean bathrooms. That‚Äôs the reason for the poor score. Would rather pee in a cornfield.

column2: Good place to hang out peacefully.
column3: It was a good place to hang out. The beach is quite clean and is a favorite among the tourists. The amusement park on the left end of the pier is elementary and you can definitely go for the rides over there. But my focus was the pacific ocean and I spent nearly 4 hours gazing at the beach and playing with the waves that keep hitting you. The sunset is magnificent here and please do stay till the sun sets. You would not want to miss this, if you are around this time. It makes you feel humble.

column2: A nice place to spend time with many activities
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is an eventful place with a lot of activities to spend time. Apart from the carnival, there are street performers, cartoon artists etc. Be careful when you take photos of street performers as they will come behind you requesting money! Saw this happen to some travellers...We also spotted a sea lion at the end of the pier. Seems it is a regular visitor as people feed it with fish.A car park is also available near the pier (at a charge of $7 a day).

column2: It‚Äôs just too busy during holidays
column3: We only spent less than 2 hours in this area. Pier is okay and it‚Äôs too pack during holidays. I don‚Äôt like the feeling of squeezing in the crowd.
Visited when artisan markets were on. small charge to get in. really good unique group of artisan operators. well worth visiting.
View is nice, maybe too packed. It is free, so no problem there! Seems safe, it could have more restroom options.
UniqueStandard crazies for a place like this . Busy but space to walkNothing else to say :-/Fffgjjjuggdcvjbbn

column2: Nice place to spend a little time
column3: Great views of the ocean and the beach, a roller coaster and a ferris wheel, an old fashioned arcade and lots of people watching make this a nice spot to spend some time.

If you have a family and want to see a beautiful beach and ocean view while also keeping the kids entertained this is a good choice. NOT a cheap choice. The few restaurants on the pier are average, and expensive for what they are.Still would I recommend it for a day trip with kids.

column2: Beach is great. Pier is okay.
column3: The performers on the Pier are worth the walk. At the end of the Pier are fishermen who are fun to watch as well. Otherwise the Pier is filled with crappy stores and chain restaurants. The beach is a better walk. Walk toward Venice Beach and then walk through Santa Monica itself. The Pier is the lesser part of the trip to Santa Monica.

Was very iconic to go see but I felt the food prices around here were high and long waits to get into the restaurant the amusement park needs a grand attraction. I personally just see this as a tourist trap and is overrated.

I only spent an early morning down by the pier, so I can‚Äôt give a huge review, but what a gorgeous place. I can see why people want to live here. Crashing blue waves, mountains in the background, and miles to walk with your toes in the sand. I‚Äôll be back.

I had a wonderful time I came out here by myself for some inspiration on a new book I'm writing what a beautiful day it was a flock of seagulls everywhere I looked are the rides people screaming with joy this place definitely holds it down for piers in the South Bay if you guys have some free time I highly suggest visiting the Santa Monica Pier tons of beautiful women definitely the spot for a single guy or vice versa! üòÉüòéüòã

we had a blast watching the performers, checking out Santa Monica Beach and nearby Muscle Beach. Even if you have just a bit of time, check it out. Reminds me of the Sunset Celebration on Mallory Square in Key West
From time to time you catch a good yoga class here. Full of vibrant energy, a great place to hang out and enjoy the beautiful view.
Very beautiful place, highly recommend to visit and have a walk near the ocean <3 Also we‚Äôve visited Pacific park, from the bog wheel you can see a really beautiful view of city and ocean <3
A must when you are in the region. We rented a bike and biked from Santa Monica beach to Venice. You can easily spend a day at the pier and around
Pleasant, nostalgic atmosphere. Worth a visit if you‚Äôre in town. We took the metro light rail Expo line which was direct and cheap ($1.75).

The wood pier planks were challenging (with many rough bumps) to walk on for hubby who has trouble walking on uneven surfaces. Found the beach boardwalk much easier to navigate due to a smoother, mostly even surface. Enjoyed our Tuesday morning visit as it was far less crowded than our Sunday visit.

column2: What a fun place! Entertaining and fab location
column3: Lots of entertainment on this pier by a diverse range of people, some very good.Nice, safe atmosphere.Fun to see the beach where Baywatch was filmed.Shocked though that there was an entrance fee to the local vendor's market!

We arrived in Santa Monica just before sunset and our first stop was the Santa Monica Pier - it‚Äôs iconic not only because it is the Pier but it‚Äôs also the end of the famous Route 66. What you see in the movies is how it is in real life.The wooden pier is special- it has history, the views, restaurants, the theme park, the souvenir shops and more.You simply can‚Äôt miss the Pier

This is my first time to US and couldnt have asked for a better start.Missed a turn while going home from airport and ended up coming to Santa Monica Pier , i guess i was lucky to start my trip from this beautiful place.Loved the buzz around and the people performing various things.Great options for food from street food to fine dining places.Weather was great and had a lovely time with family.Awesome place to be alone / with friends and with family as there is so much to offer.

This is an iconic landmark and once you've been here, you'll start recognizing it in alot of films as this seems to pop up often in movies and TV (Goliath with Billy Bob Thorton for one). It's super touristy so don't plan a lot of time here and most of the restaurants are overpriced and underwhelming, but it's a fun spot to walk on the boardwalk (head to the end and check out the view of the coastline. It's fun in September when they have free concerts (used to be all summer then they inexplicably moved it to Sept-Oct so check listings to see dates each year). Don't waste your time on tshirt stores- much better options at Venice Beach but this is a must-see to just experience the Pier. Definitely head into the merry-go-round building- it's a classic (was in movie, The Sting).

We headed to Santa Monica after spending a little time in Venice. I ended up parking right on the pier and walking for about 45 minutes. Parking is only $3/hour on the pier.The day was as beautiful as they come and the pier was not terribly crowded on a Thursday afternoon. We all really enjoyed our visit.
This is a great place to see the sunset and then enjoy some carnivals games at an affordable price or stay a watch some of the street performers.
Well known for it's position on the Santa Monica skyline, the pier has attractions galore as well as buskers and eateries. Right at the end of the pier I saw a sealion. That's great!

column2: Not a whole lot to it...
column3: Not sure how this is rated as top attraction as not much to it. Very small and cramped. Restaurants are all mostly fish, so not good for all.End of pier okay but lookout point not exactly elevated.Had a market the day we went on the pier, and they had the check to charge 2.50 to enter.. lot of people turned away on finding out.Overall place to pass..

I have visited many piers in America but none of them were as amazing as this one. This is a long pier on the west coast of America with thousands of people visiting each day. The pier has a roller coaster, a ferrous wheel and lots of other activities to do. You also can take a swim at the beach. One of the best tourist places in Usa and a great photograph spot!

column2: So much to see and do!
column3: Brought my 2 teen kids for Spring Break and this attraction did not disappoint. From the gift shops, many dining options, to the ferris wheel all such a blast. And the views.... There were also some music entertainment on the boardwalk. Great vibe and a must see. We didn't know where to park but found a garage for like $20.
The scenery is so laid-back and relaxing. a great way to start your day or unwind your evening. Also great for photo ops!!

We were pleased we had visited the Pier, but it is very old & tired & didn‚Äôt feel like we wanted to eat there & happy not to return. There are other Piers along the coastline that have a better vibe & excellent restaurants such as Redondo Beach

My husband and I had to fight some traffic to get there from Long Beach but we where rewarded with a gorgeous sunset. The scenery is great and it‚Äôs fun to see the creativity of some of the vendors. The carnival stuff isn‚Äôt our thing but it was fun to watch others enjoy the amusements.. The carousel was a treat.. All original and in the original building! Reading the history so happy the pier was saved.. With that I‚Äôm an automotive/Route 66 enthusiast growing up near the mother road in Missouri. I‚Äôve been to the ‚Äústarting point‚Äù in Chicago and now the very end.. Now I gotta see everything in between!
Ride the scooters down to the pier. Worth the visit but dont expect to stay more then 30 mins. Nice safe atmosphere

Santa Monica is one of those piers you have to visit. The sunset there is beautiful to watch. Lots of rides for the family, on the day we went a lot of the rides were closed but we still managed to play a few games and win a teddy for our very appreciative toddler. We came here 3 years ago and had to bring our baby back to see what we saw. There's also restaurants here, bubba gumps is probably your best bet
Nice atmosphere, everyone enjoying the weather, and the vendors. Fun place to take in the ocean air, and take the family or a date.

This is a def must do- even just for 30 mins. Full of lots of street entertainment which you could sit and watch for hours. Lots of market type stalls which you can buy little trinkets and souvenirs if you wish.
It‚Äôs a delicious place. Beautiful. The combination of the sea, the place, the people, the restaurants, the park. It‚Äôs cheerful and nice.
Although electric scooters are not permitted we still were able to enjoy Santa Monica, we just parked the scooters and walked the famous pier, being from NJ it lived up to all the nostalgia.

We visited the Santa Monica Pier in June 2018 and thoroughly enjoyed the view from the pier. We had drinks in a restaurant on the pier and shopped at one of the little shops on the pier. It was rather fun and nostalgic and I highly recommend taking a walk on the pier and to walk all the way to the very end. It's really nice at night with all the lights on the carnival type rides and the lights around the city of Santa Monica. We didn't go on any of the rides but it was fun seeing everything on the pier and all the cool lights from the ferris wheel.

If you are in the Santa Monica area, visit the pier. We visited in the afternoon and found parking in a lot nearby, which was about a couple blocks away. The pier is a nice place to walk on the boardwalk or bike. There are eateries and shapes. The beach is just right there and the sun was slowly going down, so bring a sweater in November. Very nice on a sunny day. If walking back to the car, you can go shopping in the stores and mall.

This was the end spot for our Four day coast bike ride- began in Morro Bay- followed the 1 and PCH- great ride- seeing the agricultural, natural, beaches and iconic sight of central to SoCal coat line-Great camp sights along the way - get off the 101 and enjoy California's back roads- best local eats in Guadalupe! Cinnamon rolls in Shell beach- body surf El Capitan beach!Tent camp at night and road bike during the day- all the sights up front and in person- safer than you might think - good to great road condition, make this ride one of your must doexpqriences!
I always love visiting the Santa Monica pier. It has such a great view of the Malibu and Santa Monica coast. The rides and arcade games make it a great experience for the entire family.

What a lovely place to visit whilst holidaying. We're travelling from Aus. Having a down day and visited here. What as lovely place to visit. Well worth as visit. Beach is lovely, pier is great with a good selection of shops/bars/restaurants/shopping mall.

Good place to see the sunset on a clear evening. The beach is also clean. Good restaurants all over. But there are a lot of weird people around so be vigilant and be safe. There is a nice gift shop also. And yes the Pacific park is nice as well. Kids can enjoy the rides. Not really for adults.
"Eh" food and amusements, but beautiful appearance of the Ferris wheel at night makes it a Landmark. Te Eiffel Tower of S.M.

column2: Great for kids, old hat for adults
column3: THe big attraction of the SM Pier is that it is the official end of Famous Route 66. The pier attractions themselves are typical carnival rides and a few souvenir vendors selling some of the poorest quality junk you can imagine plus the usual hat and t-shirt guys. Young kids will find it exciting as I am sure we did when we were kids, but fir adults, it is a one-time attraction adjacent to a very nice wide beach. The choices for lunch were mostly unappetizing exceopt for the one restaurant at the end of the pier. Not terrific, but tl least they have O.k. food and great service. Enjoy it all once!
The rides were a little expensive, but the whole place was pretty clean. We really enjoyed reading the historical information about the pier all the way at the end.

I LOVED Santa Monica.Amazing atmosphere and the pier had tonnes to do. Great photo opportunities and glorious beach.We walked up to Venice Beach but might be worth renting bikes/roller blades as I was shattered at the end!
Lots of nice things to do near the water. Rides, Restaurants, the beach, items to purchase, snow cone shops to battle the heat.

An iconic pier - must see!Can get very crowded even in cooler times of year.Souvenir shops, coffee shop, restaurants, theme park, public toilets and showers, food stalls and many more all in the pier.Would come back again.
The walk around is lovely! The shops are quite expensive but the view on the ocean is great! Loved the atmosphere

column2: Eh. Teenage/child friendly but not so much for adults.
column3: SMP was NOT what we expected. If you like to play carnival games, this is the place for you,if not you will be disappointed. The stores sold basically the same items - t-shirts, cups, ornaments, etc. with SMP on them. Limited food choices. Nothing to do but walk the pier and have a cup of coffee. We found it incredibly boring and a waste of $ for parking. Definitely a one and done visit for the bucket list.
Visited in August 2017. Very busy, yet interesting spot with gorgeous views! Must see place in Santa Monica
Took a trip down to the beach to have lunch and a Ferris Wheel ride.Great place to visit. The weather was terrific, there were some live music entertainers and great coffee and beers available.

column2: Explore - Enjoy & Dine on the Pier
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is a great place to spend an afternoon, local musician's are always scattered amongst the pier filling the air with amazing music to go along with the fun filled atmosphere. It is also a great place to grab a bit to eat and stroll along the coast.
Stopped by in the evening all light up and so nice! We rode bikes and scooters during the day! Definitely worth it to bike to Venice beach!
A great place for some fun & great views for all the family. Has a fun fair for all the family, great ambience, good food at Bubba Gump Shrimp, very enjoyable place
One of the best options in LA! We only went to the pier, but it was all we need to get a great time.Prices are a bit high at the pier but you can walk and fine lots of places with variaty of options

We enjoyed the time we spent here. I didn‚Äôt think the Ferris wheel looked like it was worth $10 a person. We enjoyed playing some carnival games. There is plenty of places to sit and enjoy the views. We enjoyed watching people fish on the pier. There is a lot of homeless people who hang out on the peer.

We picked a nice sunny day for a trip to Santa Monica Pier. The rides were great fun with the kids ( we aren‚Äôt dare-devils). The old fashion arcade games were worthwhile. The view from the Ferris wheel was amazing. Then walk to Venice Beach.

Visited this week from downtown LA. I had always wanted to visit the pier and Santa Monica and was not disappointed.For some visitors from the UK, used to big seaside piers you might ask, what is so great and it is a fair question. The answer though for a place without the slot machines and Candi floss is, the vibe, the energy, it feels so safe at night, the interactions and wow the sunsets. There are only a couple of rides but this is a place you visit, just because.

We had a free day in L.A so cause its was 28degrees in Nov in L.A it was the perfect day to walk Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier. We took the bus down Venice Blvd with our backpacks on started our walk. We love Venice, muscles, buskers, dudes selling CD's, plenty of homeless peeps chilling, skaters, people on scooters, artists and us the tourists. Lots of shops aimed at tourists good deals if you want mementos of your trip. The walk is about 2hrs with lots of stops. Plenty of food but we wanted to eat at the Pier. Lots of toilets too which is great.At halfway mark you will see the rides at the pier.At the pier lotsa buskers, stalls, stuff for tourists and Pierburger which was yummy and filling (vegieburger super yum).We got some pics but we didn't go on the rides looked like more for kids so we decided to walk into Santa Monica where there are lots of shops. Then bus back home after great day out. Remember to sunscreen and a hat on hot days and bring a raincoat if its cold. It is a great walk.

So, I have seen The Santa Monica pier in countless movies and tv shows, so when in LA this is a must, right?- Yes and no, it‚Äôs a nice walk a long the beach and you‚Äôll get great photos from the pier but that‚Äôs as far as I‚Äôd go. The shops and restaurants are outdated and you‚Äôll find more interesting food and things in other places.
Lovely weather and nice day to visit the Pier. Super views. Super atmosphere. Pleasurable relaxing outing with lots to see, hear and take in on the visit
Was very nice to walk along the pier they have a few restaurant to enjoy the view while eating we took some nice photos, you will find all kinds of entertainment and talent, is well worth a visit

We went to Santa Monica on a Friday in early August. It was a wonderful day on the beach and evening on the pier. The pier itself is a free activity. There are amusement rides that you are charged to ride, but you can wander around the pier for free, no charge to get on it.There are several souvenir shops on the pier along with a bunch of restaurants. Also, they have changing facilities available for those who have spent time on the beach.

I had an overall good time at the good ol salmon urine. (That‚Äôs code for Santa Monica pier. Get it? Sa-mon-pier sounds like pee.) sorry that took a rather disgusting turn! Anyway, the views from the Ferris wheel are SPEC TAC UUUU LAR!!!!!! The Ferris‚Äôs ooh ya know what I just realized? Was Ferris bueller named after Ferris wheel? Probably! AHAHAHAHA! I‚Äôm such a smartieeeee! The Ferris bueller wheel (see what I did there) is also very well made and not as sketchy as others I‚Äôve been on. The rollercoaster has one rather- oooooooh yikes!!!- painful spot that made my stomach feel like it was being slaughtered, but otherwise it was pleasant. Anyway, yeah so that was my review of salmon urine. Make sure to like and subscribe!!!
Great day at the pier and beach. Lots of lovely cafes and restaurants around to enjoy some tasty treats.
There are way too many vendors crowding the pier and the fishing makes the place smell awful. I was not happy at all with the experience.
What a lovely walk along the pier I sat down had a coffee and took the view in ‚Äúnice‚Äù in a word. This iconic part of Santa Monica is well worth a visit
Nice day to come listen/to go evangelizing on the pier‚ÄîNOT!!The pier is a cute place.Not a place to come preach on loudspeakers!!!

column2: Good for an hour or so.
column3: Good to spend an hour or so walking round but not anything special. Loads of buskers and entertainment. We didn‚Äôt go in the fairground as it seemed to be aimed more at families.
There is so much to do around here! Tons of shopping. Great places to eat. And then there is the awesome ocean views!
This is a must visit for all holiday makers. It has a unique opportunity to see a diverse range of people ploying their artistic trade. The beach is beautiful

Like an actor well past their best, the pier somehow manages to still attract attention. Loaded with souvenir shops, fun fair type rides , dreadful buskers, and nice views, the pier has been and likely will be an attraction for years to come. Probably best seen once, there may be little reason to revisit.

Typical pier.Shops, takeaways and fair ground.Quite a lot of street performers and homeless so always someone wanting money.Would watch out for pick pockets.Really nice sunset photo opportunities but other than that pretty average.
Best way to travel is to rent a BIRD scooter. They are everywhere. Take the metro station, hop on a scooter or bike and head down to Santa Monica.
A wonderful day at Santa Monica Beach. Such a great vibe, colourful characters around and beautiful beach. Variety of tasty food to try. If you get the chance go

Santa Monica Pier paired with Venice beach is a great day to spend in LA. Yes it‚Äôs super touristy but you can simply spend the day wandering about watching the many street performers, amusing souvenir shops or hire a bike to ride true beach front.

column2: Covered in powdered sugar and smiles
column3: Where do you take a 5 year old to enjoy time together in the sun...by the ocean with lots of fun things to doSANTA MONICA PIERBring lots of money...charge your phone so you can take lots of pictures...wear sun lotion and get ready for fun.Fortune teller machines...bumper cars...carnival games...people watching...live entertainment and Funnel cake..Wonderful day covered in powdered sugar and smiles
Santa Monica Pier is really a good place to spend some quality time. There are lot of things you can do and enjoy here.
Despite being Saturday and being busy, we still had enough room to move around and really enjoyed our time at the pier.It was easy to catch the metro from downtown LA.
Great place to walk around and view but I love peirs. Definitely worth the drive over as we drove from Griffith Observatory. Beautiful while lit up at night.

Steeped in history a great place to visitLovely pier to walk around soak up the atmosphere take in the viewsReally a fun lovers paradise views down the beach to Venice and up the beach to MalibuThe carrousel is nice to see and there are numerous places to eat people watch and to be entertainedWorth a visit if your in the area

Stayed at airport hotel - short walk to bus from Aviation Bus Centre to Santa Monica- takes about 45 mins and costs $1.25 per person for single. You need correct money. Santa Monica pier has traditional fairground rides. Lovely walk past Muscle Beach towards Venice Beach.

The pier is an entertainment venue that is plain fun to walk along. Some decent eateries, but just people watching and ocean watching is worth it. Has fun tossing fish to a sea lion having fun near the end of the pier.

column2: End of the road for route 66
column3: If for no other reason, go because it's the end of the line for the old route 66. Bustling pier with a carnival atmosphere- best later in the day than early when attractions haven't yet opened.

We have been here 3 years ago and we enjoyed again the roller coaster, the views, the end of the 66 route sign.We went walking from Venice to Santa Monica pier and is a lovely walk to start your day.Be careful with the bikes and scooters.Don‚Äôt panic! There are plenty of restrooms all over the walk.Enjoy as we did.

Visited Santa Monica pier with my wife in August 2018. We spent a very enjoyable couple of hours. Cheap parking is available on the pier. There are places to eat,drink, buy ice cream. There are several souvenir shops as well as rides for kids. We will return.

An enjoyable beach!Nice location for family with children! My 5 year old kid enjoyed the rides there! We too!!A clean beach! Nice people all around!!I had a warmest evening, a beautiful sunset just before my coffee bean cup! Loved it and will go again!!14$ parking fee i think.. and its worth!
Great place to stroll and see the sites. Enjoyed time with wife and grandkids. Good food and things to see.
It‚Äôs really beautiful, the beach and the pier. I had a really good time and definitely keep a great memory.

We visited here on a Sunday afternoon after arriving in town. Parking was a little confusing but after this we had a great time. There were lots of places to eat and shop and plenty of people watching opportunities.

column2: The Warmth and Sunshine are Intoxicating
column3: The Pier is always worth a visit. The views of the Pacific are beautiful and the tourist shops are exactly that. We stopped to buy a few postcards, to watch the sun sparkle on the ocean, and to breathe in the salt air. The warmth and sunshine are intoxicating.
Lots of people and very cheesy . kids would think it‚Äôs fun very fair like atmosphere There is a fairwheel on the pier

It was a pleasure to see the grandchildren out doors , playing , laughing , screaming , but most of all enjoying themselves . It seems like life time since we last saw them on the rides . My wife and I haven't smiled and laughed so much as we did .

We had a 24hr layover in LA so we decided to hit some of the popular spots with the pier being on of them. The pier was honestly a disappointment. It ended up just being an overcrowded dirty tourist attraction with nothing really memorable about it.
We went there at the evening around 11 pm and the pier got closed. The restaurans are insanly expensive and not worth the money. the parking is far and cost around 2 dollars an hour

This was our family‚Äôs first trip to LA and the Santa Monica Pier was our first stop. We had an amazing time! Live music, lots of street performers, plenty of vendors, and breathtaking scenery!! Would highly recommend!!

Visited in oct 2018, its nothing too special, but its good to see the place you see on TV and Movies. Its a place you need to see and visit once, but after that nothing special. Its very touristy. The hot dog on a stick place near by is good. Great place to people watch.

Spent few hours here. There is parking but must pay meters. Ate at a restaurant after watching the sunset. What a beauty to watch. We did walk in the pier. Reminded me of Coney Island. Rides for kids.
Neat place to visit, eat and people watch. Even had the Zoltan that looked like it was from the movie Big.

Stopped in la for a few nights rented a bike explored the pier go to the end for great views and good food. Pick yourself up some souvenirs and be sure to get a picture at the Route 66 sign(end of the road)
Spent the evening on the pier and had an amazing time had our picture drawn would visit again had amazing food and was great to see the respect they pay there veterans every Sunday
This was probably a very nice attraction some years ago, now it just feels out-dated. You get a nice view from there but thats it.

The historic Santa Monica pier is great, highly recommend visiting as the views of the beach and coastline towards Malibu are breathtaking. A lot of little food stands and street performers make this area a great afternoon stop during your visit.
Nice to walk around and read about the history of Santa Monica pier. Good sea view if you go till the end. Has entertainment as Pacific park, street entertainment. Some do fishing.

Great place to go and visit and lovely and for young kids to wonder along. Beach nice too right beside it. Amusements were fun and a couple for the younger kids to go on too. We used UBER would highly recommend great service üëçüèª
Its not like the movies.Seems more like a theme park and there are homeless every where.It was a real let down in my opinion.

Have always intended to visit Santa Monica Pier and finally got around to it.Had a ride on the ferris wheel and generally enjoyed our morning there. Very touristy but sometimes you just need to be a tourist and enjoy it.
The pier is an awesome way to see the Ocean and the mountain view on either side. The big wheel views on a clear day are breath taking. There are many food choices on the pier.
We spent an hour here nighttime at the end of a tour of LA. We could see the Malibu fire in the distance with smoke and orange flames. The Pier was a vibrant and neat place to visit.
Nostalgic pier but needs more food options. Rides , boardwalk vendors, loud.. excellent views overlooking Pacific Ocean and Santa Monica beach. A bit dirty but a fun walk .

column2: Another Great Sunny Day at the End of Route 66
column3: Fun, fun, fun for everyone who loves the beach, the smell of the ocean, the Mountain Views, the amusement park, the crowd from all walks of life,...Santa Monica Pier has it all. Cast a line and catch those mackerels, and with luck, big ones like tunas, halibuts, blue runners... or just stroll around and enjoy the sights and sounds around you, the bicycles, rollerblades, skateboards, surfboards, motorboards, sun lovers, street performers, food and more.
What a relaxing break from the hustle and bustle of Hollywood - a beautiful pier with lovely restaurants etc. Even on a foggy day we enjoyed our visit.
An old fashioned attraction offering lots for all the family. A range of places to eat and have fun.

column2: Fun place and great for family!!
column3: I really enjoyed myself and wanted to stay longer, but it was part of the tour, so time was limited. Its also a great family place. They have rides and also an area for small children to ride, food and of course areas to relax on the beach, and it is well controlled.

My husband, son (18), son (9) and myself spent at least 2 hours on the rides with the unlimited wristband. Just make sure you want to ride most of the rides or you can purchase tickets to each ride separately.After that, we looked at the vendors and bought a T-shirt because a bird pooped on my husbands clothes. We walked down the pier and took pictures. It was fun just walking around and ‚Äúwindow shopping‚Äù.We ate at Bubba Gumps Seafood which was average, but worth it because we had a view of the beach. Afterwards, we went and sat on the beach dipping our feet in the ocean. We did buy a football to throw as well.It can get expensive there but we did make a day out of it. Definitely recommend!!!

column2: SANTA MONICA WEEKEND FROM LAS VEGAS!
column3: Excellent, laid back location. Totally opposite atmosphere from Las Vegas. Did AirB&B here. Do recommend a visit.
This is the place you see in all the movies... so you have to go. Nothing really unique about it.... but it is an enjoyable place to visit.

Typical Fair type of activities here. Street vendors, musicians, rides, and games abound. The Ferris Wheel was fun and afforded a nice view. The carousel was closed - but looked enjoyable too. Bring beach clothes since it's nearby and be prepared to walk a bit.

I realize locals might discourage a visit to Santa Monica Pier, but as a non local I thought it was worth the time. I visited at both sunrise and sunset and both visits were great. I am saddened to see so many folks who appear to live on or around the beach without shelter, however. That's tough to see and not unique to this town. A walk on the beach or above along the lovely park adjacent to the shore is perfect for people and pup watching and enjoying the view of the glorious ocean. I found plenty of metered parking and just a block or two away from the shore are tons of shops and restaurants. During the sunrise hour multiple classes on the beach were available (yoga & HIIT) for examples. And there are plenty of passionate cyclists taking advantage of the bike lane along the main beach road. Check it out! A simple pleasure!

The pier is iconic so we had to visit whilst in LA. The pier is what we were expecting and was enjoyable to spend a couple of hours here, plenty of places for food and drink and not as expensive as you might think.We saw seals in the water at the end of the pier, several swimming around and making noises, not bothered by onlookers at all.

The Pier is a busy place with dozens of options of nice restaurants, street vendors and some rides. It‚Äôs also next to the beach so you can easily spend a few hours relaxing, walking around and playing games on the pier. Parking can be difficult, without paying $20+. I‚Äôd recommend as a leisure day activity with friends or family.
Smaller and older than we expected. Not as many stores, rides or restaurant as we thought. Clean and tidy though.
My husband and I stopped here while traveling through LA. Cute little board walk with some small rides. Little shops and restaurants. Lots of transients around. Had a nice time.

column2: Good spot for a date night.
column3: Went here with a friend. Its a small attraction scene. The ferris wheel is nice though. Its a basic date night scene.
Iconic place and a must to visit when you‚Äôre in LA. Plenty to do and you can get great pictures of the beach as well
Arrived at the pier, bit chitzy, but some good entertainers. Long beach all along the beach to Venice beach and muscle beach. Quite a few bars along the way. Not the cheapest but what you expect.

I used to LOVE this place. Over time it got more sketchy and at night it‚Äôs not really a safe place to be. I would say go during the weekend but it‚Äôs SO crowded. If you can go during the week you‚Äôll have a great time.

column2: Great place to browse and people watch
column3: This was one of my husbands must see spots and we were not disappointed. The beach was awesome and the pier itself had plenty to check out we were also lucky enough to see some dolphins and a seal which apparently is apparently a frequent visitor to the pier

column2: Definitely worth spending an hour or so.....
column3: There isn‚Äôt really a lot to see, coming from the UK it‚Äôs a novelty that you can drive on a pier! Very conscious of the splintered wooden planks and a 6000lb weight limit per vehicle!Bubba Gumps was good, there is a sign showing end of Route 66 trail, a big wheel and roller coaster that looked a bit naff.But a pleasant hour just wandering up and down and people watching / snapping pics

I'd been excited to come to SMP for ages and had a very different picture in my head to what I encountered! It's OK for a walk and the views out to sea are great, but it's mostly just overpriced tacky souvenir counters. If you're in the area, come down, but don't go out of your way to visit. There's better beach spots in the city.

SAMO Pier is a lot of hype but fun to enjoy a casual walk with your significant other for nostalgia sake. The sunset was blocked by Malibu when I was there so that was a wash. The rides on the pier are in sad shape and scream for some TLC. It's just a pier and there's nothing awesome about it. Parking is expensive too. Aside from the "66" sign, I couldn't find anything memorable about it. I've been to nicer piers in Florida and S Carolina.

column2: Worn down and in desparate need of a refresh
column3: We were disappointed when we brought the kids there. What I remembered and what it is were drastically different. The arcade was run down and filled with broken games, the carousel is in need of some TLC, and I wouldn't get on the ferris wheel or the other carnival rides if you paid me.

column2: Santa Monica Pier Arcade-don't let your kids near this place!
column3: The arcade at the Santa Monica Pier is absolutely sketchy at best. It's disgustingly filthy, games do not work and the employees are straight up stealing from you by not giving your money back. 2 employees stole my 13 yr old son's cell phone on the day we were there. How this place is even in business says a lot about the pier itself. Do NOT allow your kids in this place. Pedophiles, theives, and the chance of catching an infection by touching anything in this place are reasons enough!!

So this is the end of Route 66The pier was easy to find and there is plenty of parking but beware some of them cost a lot. We found a multi-storey just off the main road and this was more reasonable, there is ample parking on the pier. The walk down onto the pier gives fabulous views of the coastline to the right and of course the Pacific ocean. Even with the sea breeze in early September I would advise sun cream as it was hot and there is no shade.As the walkway levels off you reach the pier. The End of Route 66 is slightly to the left, and a little further on, just look for the people taking photos. There are gift shops, street performers (we particularly liked the guy belting out his own rendition of a Route 66 song). a fair with a big wheel, restaurants and cafes.There is plenty to do and see and there is access to the beach as well.We went right to the end of the pier and gazed across the enormous ocean.I would recommend a visit there is something for everyone here

Wasn't as nice as we thought it would be. Granted it seemed to be a very old pier but everything was so old & a bit icky. Granddaughter had fun at the amusement park but, as said, it was all a bit shabby.

column2: Everyone has to see once in their life!
column3: Went on a Saturday around noon. Not too busy at all. Had a nice walk along the pier. Lots of sights to see. Saw things that I expected would be there. Great photo opportunities!

I have to tell you, the last time I was at SMPier was over ten years ago (and the time before that was in the mid-80s). Ten years ago I enjoyed the visit, but this time it really has gotten to be so much more of a destination in its own right. The beach, too, is lovely, but you can easily spend the better part of the day enjoying attractions. You of course have to do the carousel, and after that there are fun rides galore, aquarium, arcade, an ocean-front walk, even a trapeze school! Round out your visit with all sorts of food options in the area, it‚Äôs a great night out, or a full day.
It was one of the ‚Äòmust do‚Äô trios but I wasn‚Äôt that impressedMuch the same as any pierI wouldn‚Äôt go back
If you go, go during the week. It was very crowded and touristy. The boardwalk had nice views but not worth the crowd.

column2: A little gimmicky for my taste
column3: The pier is a little gimmicky for me, with the "loud" lights and noises. The ferris wheel is also $10/person, so for my family of 4, it's $40 for a trip around. It's iconic, and you have to visit, but set your expectations low.
Great place to spend with family and kids as there are many games and a roller coaster and Ferris wheel. View of the beach and mountains aren't too bad either.
Sort of iconic. Oceans nice. But crowds are too big and shopping is available in any mall in America. Much better to drive 20 min north to Malibu.

column2: Spend your time on the beach, not the pier
column3: Iconic! So it's a must-do, but spend your time walking the wide and beautiful beach where the views are wonderful and less commercial. The bike trail is nice for just that, biking -- but for walking, take off your shoes and head to the hard sand by the water. You'll love it!
A very touristy area with mediocre entertainment. Carnival quality food, if you must eat... find a restaurant further out from the pier. See it once just for curiosity sake.

column2: awesome pier! fishing rental on the end on the right side kinda hidden.
column3: best pier to be at in the la area. we parked on the short term parking. its $1 for an hour with max 2 hour so $2 for 2 hours. right next to the pier not alot of spots but if you circle around a few times and go out and come back in you should find a spot.lots of things to do on the pier, arcade, fishing, eating, people watching etc. just perfect pier and with the beach next to it, cant complain much. it is dated but it is what it is, at night time its awesome seeing it all lit up with the Ferris wheel etc. tons of people all the time.we did do the fishing rental that is at the end of the pier. it is a bit hidden kinda on the left building. very cheap rental but does the job. gives you pole, hook sinker for $6 a person. they also sell bait to and its like $4 or so for the bait. so total around $10-15 bucks to rent for the day. awesome deal for being on vacation and also trying some ocean fishing. really easy to catch the kelp bass if you dont care what you catch. cut up the bait fish into sections and just drop the line down to the bottom of the ocean floor and reel it up a few inches and hold the line and wait for the hits and then set hook and youll have some ocean fish caught!overall awesome pier, good memories. beauitful sceneryperfect weather this november 1-4 2018. avg around 70-75, nighttime was around 60ish. was in tanks and shorts no problem enjoying the cali sun!

column2: Beautiful day, excellent live music, perfect place to be
column3: Strolled out with my companion enjoying the sun, the sea, the surf and the local musicians. The other tourists seemed to be enjoying it, too.

column2: Great place to visit in LA
column3: What a great place to visit, Sandy beach‚Äôs. The pier is full to the brim with arcades, thrill rides and restaurants. Felt very happy and comfortable and I would highly recommend this area for s relaxing visit.

My friends and I came here and enjoyed ourselves however it was crowded and felt kind of sketchy what with the number of homeless people. A homeless person actually came in and stole all the tips from a restaurant we were eating at! The view of the beach is nice but besides that, I think it is a little over rated. The only truly amazing part was the Ferris wheel. The view from up there is stunning, especially during sunset.

Busy place full of busy people. It was quite foggy during our visit and you had to walk to the end of the pier to actually SEE the end of the pier. Overall fun to people watch and see the entertainment. Didn't go on the Ferris wheel because you just couldn't see anything in the fog. We did enjoy the seal hanging out with the fisher people at the end of the pier. Certainly a must see if in the area since it is used in a lot of movies and shows. There was a crew from E! News doing a segment on Nick Viall from the Bachelor when we walked to the end of the pier.
Wheel ride was the right amount of time with the right amount of stops to enjoy beautiful views and right amount of ‚Äúride‚Äù time. Really enjoyed it. Rest of pier is cute - worth seeing.

Large pier full of street performers, side shows and tourists. Nice place to stroll with friends and family. A few laces to eat, but better options to be found further into town. Good views of the bay.
Wow wow wow. We loved the beach and pier. We would go back in a heart beat. Wrist bands for unlimited rides on the pier and lots of different foods to try
It was my first time in Sta. Monica. I heard only in the movies. Good thing is we went there by weekdays. Weekend must be full packed. Fishing is quite okay with locals. It must visit in LA.

we walked out on the pier in the evening there were a number of places to eat and the atmosphere was very laid back compared to the east coast. at the end we watched people fishing.i would call this a kid safe environment with some amusement rides for them. glad we went out
