column2: Morning out on Santa Monica Pier
column3: First impressions, run down, few vendors closed down, needs some millions thrown at it, great views, we ate at bubba gump which was great, unfortunately quite a few homeless which we came across in all of Santa Monica, don‚Äôt give money, give food üëç worth a visit but only once üò¢

column2: The Pier is a Pier Is a Pier!
column3: Nothing to write home about. The only picture worth taking was the RT 66 end of the road sign. The homeless folks really do distract from the crashing surf!
Smells of weed everywhere!!! It is madness, only in the richer part of Santa M. you couldnt smell it. Please do something about the hobos on the street, it smells so bad.

column2: Enjoyable Location for a One Time Visit
column3: Got dropped off at the end of tour so I could spend some time on the pier. It is definitely a place for younger people and couples. There is a Ferris Wheel which would look great at night time when lit up.Like all these places, they look at bit seedy and garish but that is part of the atmosphere.Quite a few restaurants and cafes etc on the pier. Went to Bubba Gump Shrimp Co Restaurant for dinner (ticked the box but won't be back - see separate review).Glad I went to the Pier but probably wouldn't bother again.

I was surprised by Santa Monica Pier - I had been told it was a little seedy but wow, it really was! The whole place was surrounded by a lot of homeless or just generally odd people, Pacific Park looks waaay better in the photos and the food options weren‚Äôt too crash hot either. That said we had a pretty good afternoon exploring and getting to experience the culture of SM! There was a really talented freestyle rapper at the top of the pier who rapped about my friends and I so that made our day! We rented bikes from underneath the pier and rode out to Venice Beach which was fun.It was probably one of those places I‚Äôd tick off the ‚ÄòTo do list‚Äô and not be worried about going back again.

The pier makes for quite a fun experience with so many people walking its wooden planks. What made our experience more everlasting was the very hungry and demanding seal at the end of the pier. I think its a regular customer who persist to linger around until its fed (you can buy a fish for 50 cents to feed it if you want too) There is a relatively expensive restaurant at the end too but when in Rome... the Ferris wheel always makes a nice backdrop especially at night to all the photos. Lots of smiles and finger pointing from a huge spectrum of humanity and oodles of artists along its length performing their hearts out for a few tips. You'll have a nice time walking the pier... i did :-)
Went there on our way to SONY studio tour. You need about an hour just to walk around, more if you‚Äôre having lunch there. Nice views.
Many souvenir shops, panhandlers and Artists. Street magician was fun but otherwise nothing special. Parking is always a challenge or very expensive.

The pier itself is cool, it‚Äôs the last stop of Route 66, DUH, so grab your pic with the street sign! But there is A LOT of traffic, hard to navigate through but still a fun experience and you can pay about $8 for a Ferris wheel ride, I‚Äôd have you. But the beach is great! The waves and underneath the pier is great. Venture out, don‚Äôt just stay at the pier.

Santa Monica pier is a busy place. Tourists and locals mix in a hub of activity. Parking is pricey. At the entrance to the Pier there is parkettes with benches and trees and places to relax and enjoy the views of the ocean or people watching. The actual Pier is just that. A plank wood pier. Women selling homemade churros and local artists selling their work. Let‚Äôs not forget all the cliche touristy goods that vendors sell. Trinkets to take home in remembrance of your visit. There is food, drink and music every 10 feet. There is an amusement park. I cannot review that as we did not go into that section. Locals were seen fishing off the side and catching fish for personal consumption. It is a great way to spend the day or evening. Be warned this is not a cheap experience. People are selling something at every step of the way. However, the views are beautiful and well worth the walk.
Old pier with the usual cheap run down shops and eating places. Nice views out to see but not much else of interest
This is only good if you have children so nothing wild. Don‚Äôt get your hopes up for any exciting games.

Just a regular pier with rides. I didnt see anything special.Typical southern california pier. Shops restaurants rides!Free entrance easy access to the beach and parking lots.Walking distance to Venice Beach.

Nothing special. My family wasn't impressed. My two boys (15 and 17) enjoyed watching the musicians playing for tips. We made one lap out and back on the pier then left. Heads up: the rental scooters aren't allows in the Santa Monica Pier area so I would skip the pier if you are staying in Venice.

The Pier is a great place to just walk around. There‚Äôs a few souvenir shops that you can buy clothing and trinkets, food places and even performers putting on some type of show. When it‚Äôs sunny out, you can see all the way up to Malibu and down to Venice.

Went down here in the evening for a look around & spent the whole night till late because there‚Äôs so much to see & do. There‚Äôs restaurants, rides, shops galore, people fishing off the pier & with all the people it was a good atmosphere.Bought several souveniers as the prices were good.We had a great time & anybody staying in Santa Monica really should pop down for an evening.
This beach is full of different people, a lot of things to do especially in the summer. Good beach to go with friends
The end of Route 66 is there and you can see this marked. The pier offers a great ocean and beach view and you can shop,eat, play around. The ferris wheel is one of the best things.

The pier is dirty the pigeons dropping bears a pungent smell all over the place would never recommend to wait change clothes underneath it ...apart the beach is not very tidy !Would rather love to be at a nude beachüòâ

Even thought the weather wasn‚Äôt great, we had fun on the Pier today. There is a lot to see and we enjoyed the carnival like atmosphere. I‚Äôm surprised that the vendors are allowed to sell fruit and churros all along the walk, but they wouldn‚Äôt be selling it if people weren‚Äôt buying it.

column2: Tick it off your La list
column3: Iconic board walk.Good to see Santa Monica beachDrive down the board walk for parking cheap compared to surrounding areas to park.Lots of tourist shops and nix naks.Rides are going most of the timeWear a hat not much shade.Few places to have food.Entertainment from buskers.Tick done .Worth a look

Considered by many to be a Santa Monica must see location, I wouldn't make any special effort to get there. Yes, it's busy, plenty of tourists tick it off their itinerary, but it's got little more to offer than over priced souvenirs, low quality, overpriced food and a fun fair that has seen better days.If visiting by car, seek on street parking nearby, as the parking lot on the approach to the pier is busy, cramped and expensive.On the pier, Pacific Park amusement park has a few rides, including the rollercoaster and the eye catching ferris wheel, which costs $10. The selection of rides is very limited and many were out of service, plus some are suited only to young children, which could be a good thing for some but doesn't offer much value for money if you're to opt for the unlimited rides wristbands (these can be bought at a 10% discount online, costing about $30. Worthwhile if you are to ride several times, but could be a false economy if you get there to find little you're interested in or operational on the day)There are also games arcades, which my wife considered 'retro' in character, but I would simply describe as dirty and run down. We, with our nine year old, enjoyed some skee ball competition and liked collecting the prize tickets, but don't get lured into this futile reward system. You need huge numbers of tickets for the lamest of prizes, so play for bragging rights and move on.There are numerous buskers and street artists along the pier. Some display talent, but most, the 'musicians' particularly, are of little consequence, merely trying to get a share of that tourist revenue. I'd prefer to support them in their efforts than the souvenir and fast food outlets, but it was all fairly lame I'm afraid.On a positive note, the beach area was the location for scenes in Fletch (!!!) where Fat Sam plied his trade, while Gummy was beaten up by the cops under this very pier. No? My wife wasn't impressed by that information either. Sadly, those movie scenes, of homeless drug addicts sleeping on the beach, reflect an all to prominent reality. I can't assume they were drug addicts, but there is a huge homeless presence in the immediate vicinity. When I last visited this area, over a decade ago, I encountered many homeless people around Ocean Avenue, but their numbers have increased exponentially and while we had no trouble from anyone, we did have to pass a few guys on the beach promenade, with evident mental health issues, ranting at nobody in particular, which was a bit unnerving and certainly scared our young son.The pier really has little to offer other than cliched photo ops and while it looks more exciting lit up at night, you may also have to walk through dark areas when leaving, so know where you're going and remain vigilant. Admittedly I didn't feel as intimidated while visiting as this review may imply, but in brief I feel this is a failing attraction, which did little more than to highlight to me how society is increasingly failing it's most vulnerable members.
Fun and worth it at least once. Roller coaster is a classic and fun but tame enough that it's not too scary for kids.
Nice pier with rides. Places to drink and eat and take stunning photos. The burger place on the pier. Is very nice, staff were a little slow though

Dirty, lame, busy and full of drugs. This was, by far, the lowlight of our Southern California vacation. A complete waste of the $14 parking fee. We got out of our car and were greeted by a drug deal happening directly in front of us. We ignored them and walked on, looked toward the beach and saw close to a hundred homeless people sleeping all over the beach with their belongings spread all over the place. Not a safe feeling. We walked into the pier and it was the same story. We finally turned around after about 5 minutes, never to return.

This is a nice place for a walk and to enjoy some games or carousels. It was packed when we were there and it was also a hot day which made it a bit exhausting to walk around. We had a good time and enjoyed the hour we spent at the pier. Many small shops and stands along the pier where you can buy souvenirs. There‚Äôs also a lot of restaurants if you like to have some food while visiting.It's for sure worth a visit and there's also a large shopping mall across the street when you had enough of the pier.

This was nothing like what I was expecting. Don't get me wrong, it is a beautiful pier but it was way too crowded. It was over 100 degrees and very pricy as well. Someone had gone missing in the ocean the day I was there and complete chaos broke out. Not sure If I would return again.

column2: It‚Äôs for tourists but worth it
column3: If you‚Äôve never been to Santa Monica, visiting the Pier is a must. Lots of options for food and entertainment as well as walking on the beach or renting a bike to see more of the beach.
I went in the night (10pm) and it was full of color and all the attractions were very full with people.It is a nice place to take some pictures and buy some souvenirs.
It‚Äôs a nice spot to visit, especially if you can make it outside of main tourist hours or for sunset views.
Loved it here there‚Äôs all kinds of souvenir gifts and beautiful views and scenery as well as the beach is literally just a walk down a few stairs. Absolutely loved it here!!!!

We went there on Sunday afternoon as we decide that this is one of the places to visit since we are in LA.There were eateries such as Bubba Gump Shrimp Co and few others along the pier. Lots of souvenir shop dotted along the pier for you to grab something. You can also try one of a few ride at the Pacific park.The pier has everything for everyone be it young or old. You can just marvel at the ocean or just people gazing, it will be just as fun.The pier was crowded as it‚Äôs Sunday. We manage to buy some souvenir before heading back. Nevertheless we were had a great time there and thoroughly enjoyed it.

After dodging the homeless folks, (no we're not heartless, but it does distract you) and arrived at the pier, we found very limited things to do. Prices for most things were through the roof. Decided to go into town for lunch, but again prices were almost prohibitive. 8 piece sushi roll going for around 20.00, lunch 20-25$ per person. Decided to head over to the Sherman Oaks area for lunch instead, (sushi row).

column2: WALKING OFF A LITTLE JET LAG
column3: An Uber trip to the Pier after a 14 hour flight from Sydney and the sound of the ocean with a cool breeze was beautiful. A definite must visit for some time out. All the usual tourist additions, souvenirs and a singing Donald Trump. Don‚Äôt stay too long, but go!
Great way to spend the afternoon. Have always heard of this place so definitely had to stop. Lots to see and really pretty views of the ocean. Lots of places to get gifts too.

column2: Lovely old pier but very disappointed with the restrooms
column3: Great visit to the pier but try not to use the toilets as they were smelly, unkept and very depressing. Only 3 out of 5 toilets were in use, two had a old ripped handwritten cardboard sign stuck up with gaffer tape, to say not in use. The smell was awful both male and female. Surely Los Angeles can do better than this? Do they care about all the tourists that flock from all over the world to see their beautiful city? Such a shame because the pier was a nice atmosphere.

column2: The actual pier is a disappointment
column3: The beach itself is amazing. The actual pier is a dissapointment. Some ok street performers but some homeless guys stomping their feet stood next to a boom box is not what i would call quality.The shops here are tourist traps and everythings here is to take all your money for not much im return, it is also alot smaller than expected ... it has maybe 10 stalls and 10 shops/restaurants and thats all.The actual beach though is great.
Great place for a trip whilst at the beach. Bubba Shimps restaurant is at the beginning of the pier and a great place to have a meal and take a photo or two.

Spent a night here while visiting relatives for a few days. We enjoyed the ferris wheel and found the $10 pp for the ride was worth it. You see the ocean and the pier all the way to the end which h is the furthest westerly point in California and the very end of Route 66!There are a number of restaurants right on the pier. I think if I had it to do over again, I'd choose one instead on the street that runs parallel to the pier (see separate restaurant review).This is a great place for all ages with plenty to do for young and old alike.There are lots of photos explaining the history of the pier which are interesting. If you have found this review to be helpful, kindly let me know by clicking below.
Always enjoy going to the pier to eat and take in the breathtaking view of the ocean. On a clear day you can see Catalina Island. Cali at it's best
Love Santa Monica pier. So many great places nearby and absolutely beautiful . Didn‚Äôt do the rides but hung out on the beach for awhile. Everyone needs to come here at least once
Fun place to take first timers to. Lots of shopping lots of restaurants lots of Street Entertainment! Shows lots of the colors of LA!
Nice to walk around and then have something to eat. The original muscle beach is located next to the pier.

Found it underwhelming but could've been because we went for a walk there at midnight. Lights were on but nothing open, really just a Ferris wheel , a few carnival sides and restaurants. Not an overly large pier. They don't recommend to walk their late at night and probably best not to but even with a fair number of mentally unstable homeless, we felt safe.
There‚Äôs quite a few things to do at the pier. We went on the rollercoaster and it cost us $20 for the both of us. Lots of places to eat and great views of the ocean

We missed this during the last trip and went this time. Took forever to get there from Hollywood. The pier is lined with flea market vendors and junk food. Was absolutely packed with mostly foreign tourists on a Thursday night. There is no security or police presence and a mentally disturbed homeless person was following us.

because it is so visable a lot of people put it on their list of things to do. Once you have done a lap you realise that you could have invested the time in something else for a better return. The rides are old but not in a retro or nostalgic way. The food is the same as places up and down the coast (or anywhere realy) but they are busier and more expensive. Go and get you picture but dont expect it to be THE thing you do that day

We have stayed for 9 nights at Santa Monica and each day and evening we had a walk on the pier.We just loved the constant buzz and atmosphere and plenty to do here. However, it's extremely expensive as expected. We expected that so didn't matter too much. Pacific park is massively over priced for what you get. It still didn't stop us having fun and the sunsets on the pier are just beautiful. It's well worth a visit.

Walking along the pier there are a lot of musicians and even magicians. We had a great view over the city from the ferris wheel. Try out the Mexican restaurant Mariasol at the end of the pier, it was amazing!
Whenever I come to santa monica, I should have a walk on the beach. It is really awesome especially during early morning or at sunset. The place is really charming.
If you have nothing much planned, head up to the beach. There‚Äôs a Ferris wheel and a roller coaster to enjoy and a few good food outlets in that area. The view of the sea is breathtaking.

column2: A must see you don‚Äôt have to see
column3: No good restaurants, lot‚Äôs of noise, bad street crap to buy, and trash. For tourists only - hardly that even.

column2: A great place for a date or to hang out with friends
column3: Oh my god being at the Pier was so nice and refreshing. Driving from LA there, the clouds got heavier and it got a couple degrees cooler when we went but it still was so much fun. They have some cool rides and good snacks and being above the beach such a different experience. I want to go back again.

column2: The perfect setting for fun with a great vibe.
column3: Located on the coastal side of the big city, LA every tourist must make it a point to experience this spot. We stayed at the Residence Inn, LAX airport and took the Big Blue Bus #3 to Santa Monica. Streets around the pier are simple a sight to take in with people enjoying food and drinks on roadside restaurants and cafes. Take time to spend a good hour or two at the pier. The scenic beauty by day and the vibrancy by night must be experienced. Rides and attractions for kids to enjoy and lots of shops dot the pier from food, music to souvenier shopping. Dont miss this attraction for anything in the world ! the weather in October is just perfect to be around here.
...Just to say you did it. Iconic, good fun, worth a look. Restaurants, rides, games, views, buskers...
Visited quickly one afternoon during a trip for business. We walked around for a few hours, took lots of sunset pics and ate lunch.

Ubered out from West Hollywood to The Pier which took 40min with minimum traffic.Nice atmosphere but lots of odd people hanging around. Just got to be on guard. Security screen checks to get onto the pier which meant lining up. Rode on the roller coaster & swinging ship, played a few games. Got to see a friendly seal which was great.

Considered to be one of the tourist places to visit when in LA, though it was rather disappointing. There are some restaurants and the amusement park that will entertain you however there is also a considerable amount of homeless people in the area. This is a very sad and disappointing thing to see.

It's not the most sophisticated of experiences and there is the odd odd person hanging around (but no more than the rest of LA and no sense of being unsafe) and we enjoyed it. People selling tourist stuff (fine by us because we're tourists), mid range eateries and take away food (we had some and it did the job just fine). All up worth an hour or so walking up and down.

We visited on a beautiful day in October and a lot of places were closed and the Ferris wheel was fun but not worth the money. If you‚Äôre in Santa Monica it‚Äôs worth a visit....but it shouldn‚Äôt be a destination.

This was my first trip to California. I was told if I visited Hollywood to be sure and visit the Santa Monica Pier and Venice Beach. These two attractions are just a short distance from Hollywood. The Pier and beach is beautiful! There are plenty of rides, games, and food to enjoy. And there are plenty of souvenir vendors. You also can poise for a picture in front of the Route 66 highway sign - the end of the line for this historic highway.

The pier was an excellent idea. You can take in the sunset, watch for whales or dolphins. The Ferris wheel is so neat lit up at night. Fun for all ages. They have places to eat, ice cream, candy, even a man playing a guitar.

column2: Did not live up to expectations
column3: As a British couple visiting California for the first time, we had heard great things about Santa Monica.Whilst the town itself was quite nice to wander around, the pier was not very pleasant at all. Brighton pier back in the UK is much nicer than the slightly dirty, packed full of tourists pier that awaits you in Santa Monica.
A must for every one visiting L. A. Impressive construction, look at the wooden beams and floor. Bring something to drink because the charge you an arm and a leg for a soda.

This pier is really packed by tourists and locals alike. Right there by the beach a long alley fully loaded with all kinds of shops and restaurants. In addition to that there is a riding wheel and a roller coaster. The scenery is just perfect.

We came to the Santa Monica Pier since it was the end point of Route 66 and we finally finished the whole Route! Nice place. Very touristy. I was a little annoyed with the "Straw Nazis" trying to get people to stop using plastic straws. We have personally reasons why we need them. Anyway, tons to do and spend a full day! Wish we got there earlier. Was impressed with the street vendors and small booths. Stay out of the shops, the booths have cooler/similar things for half the price. I would pay the $14 bucks for parking (cash only) to save the hassle of driving around since the whole area is crazy busy.

column2: Not as nice as Santa Cruz pier
column3: I felt that the shops and kiosks sold the same items over and over. There is a section with rides; however, we did not visit this part. Very crowded (went on Sunday), but the weather was perfect and the Pacific was amazing.

You just have to love Santa Monica Pier! Such a fun experience! It is usually crowded, the views are fabulous, there is always something going on. The historic carousel, the amusement park, the restaurants - or watching the fishermen, and the do,Phons and seals off the end of the Pier.... all good fun. Some fun performances along the Pier. I always loved to come back.

I've been here many times. There's something for everyone. You can spend time on the beach. Or you can stroll along the pier and shop for souvenirs, crafts from vendors, performers, or try food from quick serve restaurants or sit down restaurants. There are rides for kids and carnival games. There is an arcade. It's a great place to people watch.
The pier was crowded but still a good vibe. Clear sky with an amazing sunset and lots of photos. Plenty of food and attractions or a nice beach to walk on.

Went to spend some time with family on a southern California visit. To be honest, this place is very overrated. It's not much to see on the pier itself. A few shops here and there, a few performers along the pier. Tgere are a few amusement park rides and that's it. I'd rather go to Santa Cruz boardwalk. Much more to see there.

column2: Love the nights on the pier
column3: So much activity mass of humanity,lots to do and see.Lots of buskers and people selling things.Many food choices and so many rides to enjoy.A must visit when in LA.

When in Santa Monica/LA, how can you not put the Pier on your list? A fun place to visit, very touristy and lots of people (if you like crowds), and always a variety of live entertainment on the Pier. The beach is one of the better ones in LA, and parking is fairly inexpensive compared to other local parking (around $10). The souvenirs and restaurants are very high so you may want to eat somewhere on Ocean Ave, although anyplace in Santa Monica on near the water is expensive.The carnival is fun although it is geared towards youngsters and we were traveling as an adult couple, so not much to do there.Tips: Wear sunscreen! There is no shady spots on the pier.

Really loved the atmosphere at the pier. The views were pretty and a lot of history there. Rides were way too expensive which is why I only gave 4 stars. Ocean was extremely cold but that was to be expected. Overall my favorite thing in LA! Expensive parking and it‚Äôs cash only!

column2: Must-do if you are in the area
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is a staple of California with many things to do. There are multiple food/drink options with many shops along the pier. There is the occasional street performer that are always fun to watch (and some were quite good). Parking was a breeze - drive down the pier and you can park on the left hand side right above the beach. That allows for quick & easy access.

Did a day trip here from down town L.A. very easy to get to we caught the light rail system expo line stops right at Santa Monica only 5 min walk to the pier. What a great place for families couples etc, plenty to see with street performers and heaps of places to eat, there‚Äôs also lots of seats along the way if want to sit down and just take in the atmosphere.
We had a fun afternoon here. The rides were pretty limited and not that exciting. But my 7 & 10 yr old still had a great time. Beautiful view from up top of the Ferris wheel.

You can see this place in so many movies it is definitely a place to visit in LA. Santa Monica is a nice neighborhood in general, while Hollywood is ugly. The only downside of the pier itself is there are a lot of birds.

I visited the pier as a simple something to do as I was staying in Santa Monica and had only landed a short while beforehand.It was well worth the visit, lots of fun things to do/see; arcades, rides, eateries, street performers etc. as well as amazing views at sunset!

This pier is home to some strange street performers. Kinda like a knock off of Key West. I thought it was fun. Looked like the families were having a good time. Was pretty crowded as it's not really that long from one side to the other. If your in Santa Monica it's worth a visit just to see who's performing....
We had a long walk! It was sunny and beautiful. There were some restaurants for fast food and bicycles for rent. You can spend hours here. Paid parking is available.

column2: Kids enjoyed it but lots of rides not operating
column3: Our family of 2 adults and 4 children visited the pier today. We purchased the day passes for the family. We enjoyed the rides and the children had a great timebut it was disappointing that several rides (4 that I counted) were not operating. Still a fun morning and it was nice that no long queues for any of the rides.

column2: Very nice place to visit and explore
column3: I visited here tonight to have a drink and watch the sunset. The pier is actually quite large and I could have stayed a lot longer. There are rides, carnival attractiins, restaurants, and street acts as well. There is parking all around and the nearby parking garage only cost me $3.50 for a few hours.

A beautifully restored pier- with a traditional fun fair and good restaurants/bars- we drank in the Mexican bar at the far end of the Pier it was very good. The buskers were all great and there are lots of stalls/ shops selling souvenirs

During my trip to USA "California Trip," was such a highlight I loved the Pier. and listening to the Chines guy playing violin was highlight I was visiting with my wife and the guy played a music composition which is my favorite "The moon represents my heart". A must visit if you are in LA. and if you are tired of walking you could use the lime E Bikes me and my wife shared a scooter as she did not know how to ride.

The Peir was great to visit, beautiful beach, nice views. The amusement park, games and Arcade are great but a bit pricey. Lots to do with multiple food and snack vendors and several restaurants. It‚Äôs very nice in the day time but very nice at night when everything is lit up with all the lights. Lots of parking nearby but as well a bit pricey, which was expected. Lots of washroom facilities on both ends of the Peir. A very nice place to see.
Iconic place to visit when in Los Angeles. Very clean. The pier is a lot of fun. Great shopping and restaurants, including some very authentic food trucks.
Beautiful beach and pier. The only down fall is waiting in long lines to get through security at the pier.

Santa Monica pier is a LOT of fun! A beautiful location and lots of fun things to do. We rode a few rides, checked out the souvenir shops and had lunch at Bubba Gimps. I had to visit the pier to add it to my Route 66 stops. Easy to get to off I10.

The pier is awesome but be prepared to shell out a lot of money! The wristbands are the best option but it was over 100 dollars for our our family of four. The food is standard amusement park food. Crowd gets a little interesting at night.
Another overhyped LA experience. Nothing to redeem it. A stream of bored families looking for excitement. No decent eateries. No beers. Dirty and dated. Makes Eastbourne pier look positively amazing.
this pier has all what you need ..wonderful beach, rides for kids and adults, only problem is parking over the weekends

Please go to the beach! Enjoy yourself and ocean. There is population of.homeless there that you may see naked if you go under the boardwalk! Just a warning!Make sure you walk around the beach and enjoy the waves!
Love this place, probably because I saw it sooo many times in a lot of movies! I really enjoy the atmosphere and the sunset!

Very good experience to be there in evening.lovely sunset veiw.beach is so so.This the tail of route 66.the streets of Santa Monica are fabulous.One can enjoying while walking only.street singers are good.lovely evening.

We went to SMP on a very busy weekend and enjoyed the experience. Great for souvenirs were you are not ripped off and plenty of good places to eat. The deck of the pier is quite rough in places so you need good comfortable shoes.
You can't go to LA and miss this famous attraction. Beach views, entertainment, food, live music.A city icon where the world meets

column2: The people are the best part
column3: I‚Äôm not sure I would go as a carnival but I enjoyed seeing people have fun. Food was available and what better place to see the ocean meet land. We came on a tour bus and I‚Äôm not sure without the surrounding access to Venice and Malibu via boardwalk would it be worth the drive.

Came here on a weekday to avoid a big crowd and took my kid to the pacific park. There are arcades too but we somewhat finished everything in half a day but it was nice strolling around the pier. Ended up walking by the beach and didn‚Äôt realize how big it is. I would definitely go back and try other restaurants

column2: Not what it used to be
column3: I visited the Santa Monica Pier with my husband on a Friday afternoon before the Beck concert at Hollywood Bowl. I visited on one other occasion - 15 years ago before meeting my husband. This was my husband's first visit. I remember Santa Monica and the Santa Monica pier being...nice. As a young adult, I thought "wow, it would be neat to live here!" Well, things change, and 15 years later, I thought the pier was the pits! What happened to Santa Monica?! For that matter, what happened to the rest of the LA area?! Santa Monica is not a place I'd want to hang out in, and it definitely isn't a place I'd want to live. This area has gone so far downhill. Homelessness all over, and because of all the smog in the area, we couldn't even see off in the distance out to sea. I grew up in NJ and I absolutely hate the Jersey Shore (except for the Cape May area). Well, if I had to pick between the Jersey Shore areas outside of Cape May and Santa Monica, give me the Jersey Shore any day. To us, there was nothing special about this pier, and we have no desire to visit again. So sad.

I went here to see (and get a pic) the end of Route 66 road and I was surprise of how many people were there.The place is fantastic and honestly even the prices of souvenirs and food are quite standard ( you're on TOP places!! ) I spent 3 hours walking around and taking picture , really a TOP One along with Walk of Fame . ( they have also wifi for free)
Very crowded, Saturday and Sunday crazy busy, go during off times is way and off season, way better then
If you love the beach this is a must place to visit, lots going on here you will love it day or night.
Beautiful sea front with lots of entertainment programs and visitors from all over the world. Somehow overcrowded which is understandable. The view is amazing.

This place was very crowded. There were thousands of people. The parking was horrible. The parking is not expensive but the lines drawn for the cars to park were so small that only a mini car could park. If you have an SUV and park you will not be able to get in and out of your vehicle.

column2: Its a stop you must make in your travels
column3: The end of Route 66. Many take pictures at the site. Amusement rides, aerialists, sea lions, great beach, concessions, bubba gumbo and street performers are but a few attractions. Nearby shopping for all price ranges. Beautiful streets and the metro link connects with most areas.

From the distance, you can see a ferris wheel and amusements, so was pleasantly surprised when the Pier also included a Boardwalk Type atmosphere, very typical of Jersey Shore Style. Much more classy than Venice Beach, down the road.
Loved this Pier! there was a lot of food to choose from and the shops had a lot of cute stuff! plus the rides were amazing! i loved the ferris wheel

Lovely walk along the pier but too many buskers for my liking made it very noisy and some of them you would pay to stop! The area is lovely and the walk between here and Venice beach was lovely and well worth it.
Been here twice but didnt really enjoy it the second time round, very old school rides, makes you feel young again and back in the 90's, the kids will enjoy it. its worth a visit once
Worth a stroll along the pier especially at night - gets very busy but plenty going on. Fairground rides, street food buskers etc etc

We decided Saturday afternoon to take a drive to Santa Monica Pier just to get out of the house and see something new. We weren't thinking (of it being Saturday night by the time we arrived). It was a little drive as we were coming from Huntington Beach and there was quite a bit of traffic.So for the traffic situation alone, I'd maybe recommend going on another day of the week. Unless you don't mind sitting in long lines that don't move very fast and don't get aggravated when it takes you a couple of times to make it through a light.Everything else about the pier and our adventure was pleasant, I'm just not one of those that do very well sitting in bumper to bumper traffic feeling stuck.If you go past the "Lobsters" parking lot and go to the 2nd driveway from the pier, it is actually better parking and cheaper (I learned this from the parking attendant at Lobsters). This will take you to a parking lot located under the pier where there is plenty of parking. It is $14.00 per car to park there.Once you park, walk to the pier, and you have arrived. There are vendors all along the beach and the pier, selling a variety of items, from food, snacks and drinks, to novely items. There is also free entertainment along the pier. Singers and guitar players, and mimes, etc.We walked all the way down to the end, grabbed a pretzel and sat down for a minute before heading back. Overall, we had a pretty good time and it didn't cost that much. Just what we spent on the parking and the little trinkets we purchased from there. I'd recommend seeing the Santa Monica pier if you get a chance and it is fine for any age group.

column2: Plenty to see and do here.
column3: Took the Metro from downtown to Santa Monica which is just a short walk to the pier. There's plenty to see and do here, lots of entertainment, plenty of good food outlets and is not to be missed on a trip to LA.

column2: Lots of shops, entertainment and food.
column3: Took a walk on the pier after dinner. The pier was lit up as it was dark and lots of people, actually crowded. Was a nice evening and great to go for dessert.
Amazing just like you have seen in movies. The whole boardwalk is so full of life and so much entertainment. There so much talent from dancing, singing, shows etc...
If you like a carnival/boardwalk atmosphere this is the place for you. Some interesting people watching, but very crowded & dirty. Its a total freak show.
Had never been there seen in so many movies and shows so I decided to visit nice but very expensive the rides.

So many times seen on tv, but in real even Nicer and bigger than tought. Please be aware of trafficjams So feel free to walk on the sidewalk. Lovely to feel the vibe and feel fit. Walking from muscle Beach to the pier Will take you about üòÅ thirty minutes.

I first visited the pier two years ago and loved it. On a recent visit with family I was disappointed that it was over run with buskers and people selling junk. It was loud, noisy and really not very little kid friendly.
Noisy, filthy and smelly place. If you never visited it might be worth it, but not to return. There are better places to visit.

It is our first trip to California and we have been doing lots of the tourist attractions, this was really fun. We went on the ferris wheel and got some pretty cool views of the beach. Gorgeous day when we went but we forgot sunscreen, we visited in the Autumn (Fall) and ended up sunburnt.

This is an iconic must-see. The Pier is a lovely walk, though it gets very crowded periodically. The scenery is lovely as you look beyond the Pier in every direction, and especially facing the mountains ;)

column2: Durng the summer its the best place to be. Great food, games and sites. Water is fun too.
column3: There is parking near the pier. I suggest getting there earl 2pm at the latest. The children loved the water and the rides. The pier is great for a leisure walk. You might even get to say hi to a pelican ir two. Great from from the end of the pier. Oh did I forget about the fishing, you can walk by and talk to the many fishermen or women out there. You can even get your rod and go for it.

With all the weird & wonderful things thrown at you in LA, being a Brit & staying in Santa Monica the pier is like being back home. I'm surprised Piers Morgan hasn't got shares in it. Amazing place well worth a visit.

I was very disappointed with Santa Monica. I go to LA a lot and try to stay in a different coastal city each time. Santa Monica was crawling with homeless people and smelled like weed. One of the gentlemen kept following us telling me how beautiful my daughter wAs. ThereIs also a railway a few block from the main entrance to the ocean which causes a lot of commotion at night. (NOT SAFE) I will not be staying here again. Manhattan beach is much better with lots of fun shops for the kids
Must visit attraction if visiting Los angeles area, parking is sometimes pain but manageable. Lot of kids attractions around.
It was a nice walk, hot and super crowded. Definitely not as you expect all in all I thought it would be a lot bigger.
Fabulous beach and lots to see and do, excellent shopping facilities, clean and friendly and very easy to navigate with plenty of eateries
Well this place and the beach is much better then Dirty Venice.I would come here again. Pier is nice and also the walk on the beach.

As recent transplants to Santa Monica we have visited the pier a handful of times already. It's a great spot for a day with the kids: access to the beach, options for food, close to parking and clean restrooms, and friendly staff. Highlights are photo ops, Pacific Park with the rides and games, and buskes and people-watching.I hate to say it, but as with anywhere in the. L.A. area, the homeless are a bit of an issue but for the most part they are out of the way.
it was a must to see santa monica pier and it lived up to all expectations. took some really great photo's and the beach was epic tooif you haven't already visited then you must!

Seen the pier featured in tv programmes. Thought it would be a nice landmark to see. Walked down the pier a few stalls & a couple of restaurants & quite a few homeless people. Fair ground. A lovely Sandy beach. Had had great sunsets.

I read some reviews and I expected the worst but we actually had a really nice time there. There were a lot of people but nothing you can‚Äôt handle. The ferris wheel was kind of expensive but overall we enjoyed our time there.

This pier is a must visit site. One can feel the fresh ocean breeze in their faces. Also there are plenty of stalls and restaurants offering diverse delicacies. One can spend a couple of hours there and get some souvenirs too

column2: Fun times at the Santa Monica Pier!
column3: My first visit to the Pier and I was overcome in how so very clean the whole pier area was! The surrounding beach area, restaurants, activities had something for kids, teenagers (well behavedüòä) and adults. This is a must see if visiting and a repeater for anyone who lives close by. Great eats from tacos, ice cream deserts, sandwiches and more. A wide assortment of rides and even a roller coasters Wowwwwweeeee. Looking forward to coming back!
It can be very crowded and the rides are mostly for little kids. However, there are lots of street performers and lots of fun places to eat or get ice cream.
It is a really fun place to go specially if you stop in the fair and play some games! Get ready for some big concentration of people but the popularity of the place talks by itself.

column2: Heart and soul of Santa Monica
column3: Great place for a stroll, lots to see along the way. We walked the pier in the morning when it was not busy, and then visited again at night when it was hosting a music festival with several live Australian bands. The event was well organised and it was a great night out. The pier is a must when you visit Santa Monica.

column2: A must visit, especially at night
column3: A great place to walk down, with shops, a few eating places, amusements and rides. Great to go here at night and see it when its lit up it looks beautiful
Must see place if you are around. Especially interesting for watching the large variety of people strolling around. Nothing special for the rest.
Great atmosphere, entertainers are goodLots to do & see also a lot of souvenir shopsGood photo opportunity end of Route 66
Carny rides, lots and lots of people and the ocean all in one package. What could go wrong? Definitely worth a visit.

column2: A must see location in Santa Monica, for the experience
column3: The Pier is not a lovely location but an interesting one to visit. depending on the time of the day it could be hot and unpleasant and it could be a nice walk on the platform while observing people and families enjoying the funfair. The beach looks beautiful from here and you can take picture and try to remember all the movies that were shot here. Again, this is a place to see once and remember, not a place for revisit....

I took a friend who had never been to CA on 9/21/18 around 1pm. It was crowded, as usual. We parked at the Promenade and walked. It was an overcast, smog-filled day so the views were obstructed. I have never been here when it isn‚Äôt crowded. It‚Äôs neat to walk the boardwalk to hear the creaking in the old wood beams and to people watch. I‚Äôve never eaten at any of the restaurants or gotten on any of the rides. Please be prepared to walk and wear sunscreen. There are a lot of panhandlers and you will smell the stench of bodily fluids near the park area.In my opinion, this place is an overrated tourist attraction. The beach is pretty but the water is generally always cold.

Came on a Friday when school was in session‚Äînot particularly a sunny day, not terribly crowded. Beach lot parking is pricey but convenient, we found on street metered parking that was close by for $6 for 3 hours (max). Meters take credit card. Walked down to beach and over to pier. Pier is super tourist trap area and crowded with people who can‚Äôt walk or function in crowded situations. Muscle beach is on south side of pier. Lots and lots of equipment of different sizes to use. Not fancy stuff but fun. Renting bikes or scooters seems easy enough (we didn‚Äôt do it) and you can ride for miles along the ocean. After we were done we walked up to the city and walked around the streets to look at the shopping area.

column2: Wildwood NJ Boardwalk on the West Coast
column3: It was a fun short visit. We walked the whole pier and took pics at the Rt 66 sign, the Pier entrance sign, and many other photo ops along the piers with the rides in the background etc. Good vibe, some local solo artists singing or playing intruments. Peeked inside the stores, overly priced t-shirts and souvenirs. Reminds me of a minature Wildwood NJ Boardwalk but in the West Coast and has a few homeless. Definitely a one time thing you should do if you have teens.

This beach/boardwalk is very fun and crowded on a Saturday in September. It‚Äôs neat to go at least once. Sodas are 4.00 average. My son and I shared a 9 inch pizza for 9.00. It got us full & tasted pretty good. Not too bad a price for this kind of place. People watching is fun. Watching musicians and such was a treat. The beach was too crowded for me. Felt more dirty than other beaches. I would recommend going on a weekday. Parking... good luck.
Visited for a short while. Crowded but very lively pier. Lovely weather while i was there. Ice cream is yummy too. Just had a stroll down but didnt experience the beach. Wished i had more time there.

There is amusement park named Pacific Park having Ferris wheel, roller coaster and other rides. There is Playland Arcade for kids. Several restaurants and bars are there. Several artiest show their talent on the pier. In the last is a shop dedicated to end of the iconic Route 66. Has good parking space. One can spend hours here.

This is a fun pier, it's where Forrest Gump set out to just run and run - hence Bubba Gumps Shrimp store; it has a view over the beach where Baywatch was filmed and houses the carousel where Paul Newman worked in the Sting. We saw a very cool street magician there.
It's very nice while sunny days..We spent nice day there walking on beach and pier also u can walk to 3rd promenade street It's full of life and activity
Dont forget find your country flag üòÇ and absolutly use scooter for see everywhere on the santa monica beach..
Went here for a short visit. Very busy venue with great views. Restrooms were under serviced with the amount of people visiting, but overall a great experience.

column2: Good place to kill a few hours
column3: I actually enjoyed the local shops and restaurants off the pier much more, but the pier is worth a visit. There's a great Mexican restaurant in the back that makes the most refreshing cucumber mojitos. We also enjoyed the musicians and just the walk along the pier. I prefer this over Venice any day.

It's amazing how much cooler it gets as you walk out on the pier over the water. Typical tourist place but some unique entertainment by various musicians along the way. Definitely entertaining. Prices all around not too crazy. A good stop to make.
This was our first visit to Santa Monica and the Pier. There was a building with a carousel, an area with amusement rides, musicians, restaurants and a beautiful view.
Really nice area with fantastic views. You can walk to Venice beach in 15mins and the area is safe and clean
Tacky, seedy. Lots of homeless people and it has an unsafe vibe, especially after dark. Best place to eat is Bubba Gumps but even that not the best.

Well worth a visit when staying at Santa Monica.Safe and entertainment options. The best being the buskers and the ferris wheel.Food overpriced compared to other places in Santa Monica and I would suggest eating elsewhere first or bringing lunch with you.Great for people watchers.I recommend hiring a bicycle and riding to the more vibrant Venice Beach.

So I found it a bit tacky. It's basically a carnival on a pier. Lots of carnival games (win a prize, etc.) and a Ferris wheel and small roller coaster and some other rides. Some good for kids. Overpriced food and touristy. Lots of street performer and kiosks of trinkets, etc. Great view.Would I recommend it? Eh, yeah, I guess. Worth seeing I'd say.

The Santa Monica Pier was beautiful. The pier shops are perfect if you need to grab quick gifts for folks back home and the quick to go food was great. The street talent was great with all sorts of music and dance performances. Fishing seemed to be good too as there were many fishermen that appeared to be having a good time.

Really nice little pier at the end of Route 66. There is lots to do on the pier and in the local area. The pier itself has souvenir shops, arcade games and a few rides, the main feature is its Ferris wheel. Will be remembered forever as it‚Äôs where my partner recently proposed.

Something about this place I just love. Let me clarify that there‚Äôs a limited number of things you can do, but still, I always recommend at least spending a sunset or an evening there. The sunsets are BEAUTIFUL. There‚Äôs a few rides (small roller coaster, a ferris wheel, a carrousel), restaurants and places to get ice cream, coffee, etc. Sometimes there‚Äôs music, you can walk around, sit on the benches and just enjoy the relaxing view of the ocean, I‚Äôve seen people fishing at night. I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs a must and an iconic place when in Santa Monica!

I think it‚Äôs pretty, but I‚Äôm from the east coast of Australia, so I‚Äôve seen very good beaches, and the beaches back home have clean toilets, no homeless people and nobody giving you a shifty look or trying to take advantage of you. Wouldn‚Äôt tell my friends to go there, I‚Äôd encourage them to spend their time another way.

column2: Lots of people, there for souvenirs
column3: I didn't expect much from Santa Monica Pier, other than a place for my friends and I to relax before heading to the airport. There were a lot of people on the boardwalk, lots of little shops with tacky and pricey souvenirs. An amusement park to one side, and fog all around us.A place to cross off the "Things to Do in LA list". Nothing spectacular in my opinion.

Basically a typical old seaside town pier complete with people trying to sell you souvenirs or charge to have a photo taken with them. Nothing exciting or different about this place. The fact it is the historical end of Route 66 is about all that sells it. A few food places but you will find better places just off the main strip in Santa Monica.
Walked the whole pier and took ride on the big wheel which gave you some lovely views, Route 66 ends on the pier so pretty unique and good photo opportunity, would recommend

We visited Santa Monica pier several times during our stay. It was very quiet early in the morning as nothing was open but it was nice to walk along the empty pier with a coffee and admire the views of Santa Monica and the open water. At the weekend, there are lots of musicians and artists who perform and showcase their work which adds to the pier's atmosphere. The Pier really comes alive at night when it lights up! Lots of places to eat and worth visiting Pacific Park even just to people watch! Worth visiting at different times of day.
Loved visiting the pier. There‚Äôs beach access & the pier itself has gorgeous views of the ocean/beach. The arcade and pacific park really topped off the whole experience
Nice beach. Very crowded when I visited. The scenry was very nice. I plan on revisiting the Santa Monica pier.

Loved the roller coaster and the Ferris wheel. Live music and convivial crowd. There were a lot of people there but not oppressively so and it's a short walk from the beach and to some good restaurants and shops (the 3rd Street Promenade).

The Santa Monica pier is a cool place to visit. It‚Äôs been a long time attraction, you can feel the history there. It is pretty busy as it is seen as a must do. The rides where fun and the Ferris wheel was great. Is you play GTA V the you will really enjoy visiting here as they have made a real good effort to capture the pier.Have funkiwi in Los Angeles

Typical touristy pier, not very well maintained, on the dirty side. There aren't any upscale restaurants, lots of homeless detracts from visiting the pier. The day we left a person was murdered underneath the pier.Santa Monica needs to do something about the very visible homeless problem!
Its a nice place for family with kids to visit, you can swim in the beach then hang around the Pier, parking is about $14 as I remember.

My daughter and I stopped by Santa Monica Pier not really knowing what to expect but we had sooo much fun! We went to Disneyland California the next day and sad to say we had more fun at the park that was on the pier. My daughter didn‚Äôt even want to leave. We loved that the lines were super short. Some had no wait at all. They even let us re-ride a lot of the rides because no one else was in line so of course my daughter loved that. There aren‚Äôt a lot of rides but the ones they do have are very kid friendly and she loved them all. We did some of the games on the board walk and she won 2/4 we played so that was nice that she walked away with something. On our way out we saw an artist doing names in paint and only $5! It was beautiful and my daughter hung on to it for dear life the rest of the trip lol. As we were leaving she walked through the sand and found sea shells. An overall wonderful experience. I would only advise watch where you park. I called myself parking on the street and when I came back was slapped with a $65 parking ticket. Yikes lol. But we had so much fun it really didn‚Äôt bother me.

The pier itself is full of old eating places and souvenirs. I was really disappointed. I don‚Äôt know how the rides were since I don‚Äôt like that kind of thing. The beach was gorgeous I think it‚Äôs the wider speech I‚Äôve ever seen.

column2: Great way to spend the evening...
column3: Lively place. Parking in the nearby mall is free for the first 90 mins. The mall includes "True Food Kitchen," something healthy to try.

The views of the ocean from the pier are fantastic. The wind cools you down from the hot heat from the sun, and the little park on property is nice! I love all the vendors on the pier. I think it is a nice shopping destination as well.

column2: An Icon that is a little tired
column3: The pier is a must if you are down by the waterfront in Santa Monica. It is an icon and the end of the old Route 66. The roller coaster and Ferris wheel are, just ok..... more fun at night when the lights luminate the pier.

column2: Used to be nice, now it's pretty much a dump.
column3: 10 years ago this place was great but now it's pretty scary. Becoming more and more ghetto and, 20 minutes after arriving, I got the heck out of there. Never again! We saw mostly low class, borderline ghetto people there.

column2: Perfect spot to watch the sunset
column3: They have banks to watch the sunset and also nice live music all the way around. Its a must see of santa monica or los angeles. There is homeless people but not as much as little venice.

column2: Love the view but too touristic..
column3: I put 4/5 because the view is beautiful, the beach is huge. It is a nice spot when you visit LA. Some people will say the water is dirty, some will say it is really packed and too many stores/restaurants for tourists.

column2: $3 parking on the pier - great value!
column3: Google maps took my car directly on the pier. At first I was a little worried I made a mistake. It was awesome to drive over the wood planks and they only charged $3 to park directly on the pier which made for the world's shortest walk.Along each side of the pier is someone trying to make a buck either by performing, making, or selling something. At the far end of the pier, tucked in a little nook is a souvenir shop with prices lower than anywhere else on the pier for the same stuff. You can get 8 postcards for $1, stickers for $1, and Route 66 license plate and shot glasses for a few bucks less than the other shops. It's a hidden gem.
A very lively area,must visit pier having lot of activities along with pubs & eateries.Nice lovely beach
Great great great place must visit their.Beautiful place n many kind of activities n excellent restaurants... n allMahesh SampatDubaiüá¶üá™

The pier and nearby Venice Beach are an iconic must see. The pier has boardwalk type games, an arcade, rides, restaurants , and various vendors. We rode the ferris wheel ($10/ea) for beautiful views. They have a souvenir shop on the pier. Parking can be a headache. We found out you can pay to park on the actual pier which I would definitely spring for so you don't have to walk as far as we did. Weather is always beautiful so the walk isn't bad. They're are bicycle and scooter rentals scattered throughout the surrounding areas. Parking is metered along the street or paid private lots.

This place was great to go to reminisce on arcade games and the typical fair atmosphere. The bars along the pier are reasonably priced and there's always live entertainment. The arcade games are old and need much more love but do not get in the way of our fun.
Always love paying a visit to the pier. Always very lively and entertaining. Lots of nice places to eat and drink.A lovely walk from Venice along the sea shore to the pier.

column2: Lots to see, not that much to do
column3: A really fun and vibrant pier. Not many people actually on the rides. A few little stalls and some (mainly seafood) restaurants. It‚Äôs colourful and the people are nice. Some good music from buskers and a few talented caricaturists too.

I guess in the UK we are a bit spoilt for piers. Visited this one as one of the things people do whilst in LA. It‚Äôs ok, not a lot on the pier and the price of coffees etc is way too much. Does provide a good view back to LA and the beach.
I hate to say it, but the Santa Monica Pier is tacky and touristy. But tourists seem to love it, so it's unlikely to change.
Love Southern California beaches, first time on the pier. Was fun but very busy and so was the beach but still amazing.

Lots going on around the pier. Plenty of people selling stuff and some surprisingly good musicians presenting their talents.We walk all the way to the end of the pier looking out across the pacific. We also found a great old carousel to have a ride on.Great place to explore and spend a few hours.

We traveled on a high school graduation trip with 11 teenagers and 5 chaperones. Our visit to Santa Monica Pier was great. There was so much to see on the pier and to swim in the ocean was a fun experience for sure!
Do people go to the ocean to ride Ferris wheels?. Shop for trinkets - or to enjoy the sand and water? Just a question!

a easy walk from where we staying, interesting place to visit so many homeless people sleeping on the ground don‚Äôt understand why. So now we go to the rides they have a roller coaster and lots of others to entertain the children with. Plenty of food outlets so you can choose what you feel like eating. To me it‚Äôs not cheap. But hey you do have a variety of places to pick from.
Santa Monica pier is a fun to see place but everything is mostly overpriced. It‚Äôs a good hangout spot, both close to downtown and the beach.

column2: Fun visit but not what we expected
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a must see when you‚Äôre in LA. But it was nothing like we had imagined. The beach is beautiful, the sunset was incredible and the bars just off the pier were great! But the pier itself is a little tacky and a complete tourist trap.We decided to use our trip there by hiring bikes and cycling to Venice Beach and back, we‚Äôd highly recommend this.

I visited briefly on a Saturday as part of a day tour. It was such a great place to visit. I had my heart set on riding the Ferris Wheel but it was closed between (I think) 12:30-2:00pm. Why would you close it on a Saturday afternoon? And the girl who told me it was closed clearly needed a break; she was quite abrupt.

Was nice while the sun was out, but we found it quite an uneasy place to walk from the pier to the train station at dusk. Lots of homeless, drugged/spaced out weirdos - one of which decided to call me (a mum holding onto my 11yo child‚Äôs hand whilst my other 2 children walked with their father a few feet away) the B word and only because I made eye contact. He pulled a fist at me and attempted to kick my husband who called out to protect his family. Will never return. My kids were petrified & this left a very bitter taste in our mouths. We had had. Such a great day until this point. I‚Äôd be very wary going there by transport. Never feel this unsafe back at home, ever.
The pier isn't very large but coupled with beautiful beaches, a fun vibe and a lovely crowd, and one can spend a good hour or two just soaking up the vibe of Santa Monica.

We visited Santa Monica Pier on Sept. 15th, 2018. We ate at Bubba Gumps and stayed and rode some of the rides. The pier was busy, but we found a parking spot quickly and easily. The pier is a must see attraction in the Los Angeles area. Be sure to take lots of pictures. Fun Fun Fun.
Found the pier a fun place for the kids 7 & 9 and some site seeing.Spent a couple of hours here playing side show games and we had dinner at the end of the pier with great friendly service.
Filled with rides, souvenir shops and seafood restaurants this is a must see in Santa Monica. Great view of the beach on a beautiful day.
Average and old. Lots of homeless around the park and streets. Went on the famous wheel for a ride. Beautiful view
Ah! Had an amazing time trying to win something, but I was too greedy! It‚Äôs a nice play to go and visit, have some fun!

Most random fun day trip I‚Äôve had in a long time!!! Blown away by my magical experience here!!! I was expecting scenic beach vibes, and I got that, along with SOOOO much more!!!You simply must add this stop to your Santa Monica experience!!
The Santa Monica Pier was nice enjoyed seeing the ocean and walking on the beach and having a good time with my friends.

I felt like I was in a movie. It might not be the best park, but it is the park we have seen in so many movies and it is also the end of route 66, with a great view. Definitely a place that we have to visit!

Interesting place to visit to see the ocean and the beach. The place has a carnival vibe to it. If you are not eating there or attending the small amusement park you‚Äôll be done in thirty minutes.Overall, it‚Äôs a bit of a tourist trap. Overpriced restaurants, trinkets for sale, mediocre street performers selling CD‚Äôs.We had a much better time up on the streets above the pier, browsing the shops and having a few snacks
It took us 30-40 minutes by train to Santa Monica from downtown LA. The beachside had lovely vibes filled with lots of people and palm trees. We loved walking and looking at beautiful sunset.
Was fun to see the Pier and ride the Ferris wheel. However, that was really all we did. There are more rides but we were not interested. Beautiful views!

Walked the lenghth of the pier which had rides, local painters and stalls selling holiday tat. From the Pier it was easy to get a great view of the beach and the famous life saving huts so familiar from the TV series Baywatch. A beautiful beach
Visited the Pier, it was beautiful. Walked the pier then suddenly one of the performers sang my favorite song, unexpected...thanks...

The pier comes alive at night with all the lights, amusements, shops and restaurants. This is the end of the mystical Route 66. There ia a lot of choices for drinks, food. Many entertainers with either music, songs or art.

This is a wonderful 'must visit' place. Alot calmer in the day but the pier comes alive at night with all the lights, amusements, shops and restaurants.You must catch the sunset over Malibu! Incredible
This place was difficult to get to on a Saturday. Great history so glad we went. However the cost of the rides, food and water was inhibiting.
Best deal to get is a wristband and the the kids have fun. We went mid evening before the sunset, was able to get on everything at least twice. Great ambiance. Could use some updating.

The end of Route 66!!!! Nice, fun pier to go to and have fun. Lots of choices for food and drink. Great for people watching. Many are entertaining with music, songs and arts. Get bikes and ride all along the coast. Even to Venice Beach!!!!

column2: Fun for families during the day
column3: By nightfall the crowd gets rougher, I definitely recommend going during the day. The rides are fun, the food is typical carnival fare, midway games are fun but pricey, You can get discounts on wristbands if you buy online.

This place is bouncing. Take a walk down the pier and get a photo under the Route 66 sign. Grab some tacos at Blue Taco then hire a bike to Venice beach. Train comes right into Santa Monica (need to switch lines at 7th street stop from Hollywood) so you don‚Äôt need a car if your staying in LA
We enjoy on 19 September of 2017 walk around the beauty of place and the beach there are a lot of restaurants and shops

This was a great adventure for our 4 & 8 year old. The rides, which open at 11am, weren‚Äôt crowded at that time. They loved all the rides, the game, the magician on the pier and fun Coney Island vibe. Beautiful beach here and unbelievably clear the day we were there. Parking is conveniently located next door for $14. Plenty of food/drinks and clean bathrooms.

Everyone has seen the pier on TV or in the movies - and for that reason it's worth wandering down to the end. It's old-timey and fun, and offers great views when it's clear, and even when it's foggy. Go and snap a few pictures : )

Culture, culture, culture. This was a massive culture shock for my wife. She actually felt a little uncomfortable here, which I can understand. However I loved it. Yes there were buskers and people selling everything and trying to screw you out of money, but it was a great experience.

Took a day to walk the pier. Clean and restrooms. Lots of amusement rides, restaurants, vendors, even a sunscreen booth to apply for free! Took about 3 hours, parking is 10-15 bucks for the day. Also rentals for bikes scooters and boogie boards.
I recognized the Pier from movies but I guess we hadn't our day. It was very crowded and very misty. No sunshine.
There is so much to do here!The boardwalk is great and to simply walk to the end and sit and enjoy looking at the Ocean is satisfying in itself!

column2: No trip to LA would be complete without a pier trip
column3: This iconic pier is always busy but still worth visiting and wandering along. The musicians we sat and listened to were really good.
Enough said!Way too many people here and it‚Äôs a crazy place.Tip. Head for San Diego Belmont Park. Way better but relaxing

Santa Monica pier is definitely a cool place to check out. Nice pier, ferris wheel, food, attractions, right on the ocean.. it's a cool spot. However I wouldn't say it's worth more than 1 visit longer than an hour. Parking is $25, but pro tip is to ask someone who is leaving for their parking pass.

I ended my pacific coast highway trip at the Santa Monica Pier. It was a decent place but there are homeless everywhere. Sleeping on the beach laying on the pier and definitely using the bathroom. I had to use the facilities and they were terrible. The Pier is historic and I walked around the point where a bunch of movies were filmed. If you‚Äôre in LA you should check it out. Lots of merchants and cool things to look at. It‚Äôs a year round state fair.

column2: Fun place to enjoy an evening stroll!
column3: After spending five days in a hotel conference room, we couldn't wait to take in some sights, which lead us from LA down to the Pier. The weather was perfect, people were wading and wave jumping in the dark of night, and the street performers were incredible (one contortionist was crazy good, couldn't believe my eyes). So much fun, I really enjoyed it!

column2: Beautiful place. with a Gorgeous beach
column3: Have been here twice with family. Both times were amazing. Gorgeous sunsetsNo big surprise that they had pricy restaurants and hotels but to be expected in an area such as this.
Started our coastal adventure at the Pier. A fun tourist stop and only needed 30 minutes to check it out. Fun to see!

SMP definitely has the carny-atmosphere thing going but in a nostalgic kinda way with the Route 66 theme. The free sunscreen dispensers were a nice touch. We got a free appetizer coupon from the tourist info stand up on Ocean Front Walk, so ate lunch at Bubba Gumps. Seemed appropriate since in the movie Forrest's cross-country run ends at the rightmost lightpost on the Santa Monica Pier. We were seated on the ground-level floor by a window with views of all those taking pixs or selfies of themselves under the 'World Famous SMP  Welcome Pier' pedestrian walkway sign. Was as-good-as-it-gets if you're into people watching.

We decided against going to Venice beach after reading reviews on here and hearing that it‚Äôs just full of canvassers and homeless people. We may have been wrong to do that but after being to San Francisco a few days earlier we couldn‚Äôt deal with more poverty and homeless people.As an alternative we decided to come to Santa Monica and the pier area.The pier itself was full of life, we saw the sunset from the pier. There is a kids theme park on the pier and some arcades, restaurants and gift shops. At the end of the pier is some steps you can sit on and look out to sea whilst a busker plays songs on his guitar. The atmosphere was very good. Prices were pretty good, you could get a caricature for $3!The beach walk next to the pier is nice too with gymnastic equipment which people use to exercise and others to have fun. The beach is perfect sand. Very clean.

Lots of fun stuff for the kiddos to do. A little amusement park, fishing, the beach. street entertainment. It was exactly as excepted crowded & loud though. Some out of control young adults. The Ferris wheel and the lights made for some nice video and photos though
Always wanted to visit what a setting ! Loved it plenty to do just strolled around soaking up the atmosphere and the sun . Got a great video on the iconic coaster made my day .
Santa Monica has grown so big! Taking a stroll there got us out of the city atmosphere and brought us back to our youth and playful time. A picture is worth a thousand words, so enjoy mine!

The allure and lights at night are enticing, but once there the pier is unimpressive and dirty. Walking to the pier just after sunset we saw rodents along the path and in trash bins about a half dozen times as there population seems out of control. We would try a day time visit next time and would enjoy the lights next time from afar.
This is a touristy environment with food and carnival rides to satisfy families. The food options trend toward the unhealthy (sorry); but, it's a nice walk that elicits nostalgia.

column2: Crowded and fun, but be careful
column3: A crowded, fun, place, lots of outlets for food and souvenirs and much better on the days it is closed to cars. Watch your wallets / bags as opportunistic thieves frequentlyeye you off in the crowds.

Fun to walk and listen to the street musicians. I like to walk the beach below the pier. Many restaurants in Santa Monica you can dine at. I like walking the street outdoor mall. Easy to get to using public transportation if you are not driving.

What a disappointment this was. Parking charge was very high and from the start street hawkers and beggars seemed to be in our face and wouldn't take a pleasant no thank you..had to up the No thank you to a point it became rather forcefull. I guess as route 66 starts here it's iconic but that's about it really, litter on the pier aLong with other indescribable made you look where you walked,not what we expected. The beach seemed a lot cleaner and the goods sold in the shops catered for " tourists" of course. We left somewhat disillusioned and let down.

very busy place and very unclean if you are a tourist dont think about it it is horrible.I think the county can get some sponsors and renovate the whole place it has the potential to be one of the best piers in the world

Nice beach and boardwalk however it was ridiculously crowded. They have rides and an arcade, food and ice cream etc. nothing really special if you have been to a beach boardwalk before. Santa cruise is much nicer in my opinion.
Was my first time in Santa monica pier and it was fun. Great places to eat and great scenery. A must vist if you come to LA.

We visited on a Saturday. We had parked at Venice Beach & walked all the way to the pier. Families were out & about & the vibe was very laid back. Food, rides & views. Buskers give atmosphere.There‚Äôs plenty of paid parking.

Was hard to find parking so we parked at hotel that were charging $25USD to park.Nice stroll at night with the kids. It was very busy when we went so just make sure you hold onto them with the busy crowds.Entertainment was good to watch walking along the pier.Another tourist attraction we were happy we got to see.
Pier area and beach are good, venture off and it's a bit dirty and run down. Pier stuff expensive but it's a nice beach side stroll from here to Venice and back, about an hour each way.

Had a great time on the rides and the pier. Our 4 year old loved it! We had dinner one night and lunch one afternoon both were good at the restaurants we went to. When walking at night be aware of your surroundings. We didn't have any issues but better to be safe. Depending on where you are walking the pier has many dark corners/areas that are best to be avoided.

Super busy, wall to wall people. The beach was absolutely packed, not sure if it‚Äôs just that being Australian we are used to more space but the beach was wayyyy to full for us. The pier is pretty dam cool tho, it‚Äôs huge and loud and colourful. Would be great to take your kids and go on the rides etc. we were lucky enough to score a park right on the pier which was awesome. It‚Äôs like a mini theme park just chilling out on a pier, you don‚Äôt see stuff like that in Oz, definitely worth checking out if you‚Äôre in the area. We didn‚Äôt go on any rides so can‚Äôt comment on them, we just walked around and took in the sights. Fun stop in on the way down the coast.

column2: Gotta check it out when in LA!
column3: I live in LA and still like to visit the Pier whenever anyone visits and wants to be shown around. Always a good time. It‚Äôs lively, lots to do with decent eats right on pier and amazing food within walking distance all over Santa Monica. Rides are fun too, but pretty small. Definitely spend a day in Santa Monica and see the Pier as part of your day.
Went down to Santa Monica from Hollywood. Loved the pier and bars and restaurants- plenty to do. Lovely clean beach.

Just by coincidence we arrived at sunset , the end of Route 66 plenty of people around we had dinner on the pier and then went for a walk around nice shopping streets bars etc , spent the evening here, next will stay over üòú
We visited the pier last Sunday after a few hours on the sandy beach, lots to do, bars, restaurants, gift shops and rides for all ages. Worth a visit.

column2: A wonderful way to spend the evening after a great dinner
column3: My daughter and I walked down to the Santa Monica Pier after dipping our feet in the Pacific Ocean.We strolled and stopped to listen to some entertainment (undiscovered talent) and check out the shops and kiosk. My daughter was thrilled to get stuff for her friends and a good price.
This beach is a must see. Great place for a bike ride and sightseeing. Definitely recommend. Very clean place.

column2: Long walk on a long Pier!
column3: It is very tourist driven attraction but a must do when you visit Santa Monica. It was fun. Places to eat and snacks, tee shirts to buy and rides for all.

Nice place, definitely worth a visit!Fantastic mixture of hurdles of people from all over. Nobody bothering you with trying to push-sell things, entertaining, great happy atmosphere.Definitely go visit Bubba Gump Shrimp right at the Pier!!!! Loved the Tom Hanks film Forrest Gump, but this place is a really exciting and fantastic extension to the film, if you‚Äòd ask me! Splendid food too.Nice beach too there btw!
Nice little walk especially at sunset. Nice food and chance to win a teddy bear at the arcades. Can get quite busy

This pier has everything you would want and more from a pier. The food restaurants on offer were extremely nice, the arcades and games were brilliant fun and lots of variety, there was an area particularly for fishers and great shots to watch the sunset or grab a picture.

Went on a Saturday night, was very crowded and was not that fun - rides and food were expensive, and there were homeless people all over. I remember really liking the pier when I was younger, but it just felt run down and dirty now.

Have been here several times over the years, one cannot visit Santa Monica without going on the Pier, the end of Route 66. Best at sundown for the stunning views of the golden sun dropping below the hills. A bit tacky but then all piers are.

Most days it's busy. But now that summer is official over this is the best time to just enjoy the area. Take time to walk the boardwalk to Venice Beach it's a nice easy stroll and not to far from Venice Pier. I recommend mornings or early afternoon. Safety might be an issue in the evenings.

column2: A must see but once is enough!
column3: Definitely a stop you‚Äôll want to make, but I wouldn‚Äôt designate more than an hour or so to see it unless you have small children that would be using the rides.It had beautiful views of the coast!

column2: Certainly a MUST on a busy day!
column3: On a holiday or weekend, this will be bustling, in good weather.Many hollywood movie scenes were shot here too.Plenty to see & do for the whole family.

column2: Take Time for the Street Performers!
