column3: By all means ride the roller coaster and (our favorite) the ferris wheel, sample some food... but make sure you also stop to enjoy some of the street performers. If you're lucky you'll be there when magician Frank DeVille is performing some of the best tricks you'll ever see. He got a $20 bill from an audience member who wrote his name on it before Frank ate it (looked real...) and eventually got to the point when he cut open a clementine that had a different guy's initials on it and - not kidding - the $20 was folded and inside the orange.... We were astounded. I'd go back again just to see that trick again. But who knows what else you'd find on the pier? You need to go and check it out!

column2: Bit tacky, many homeless and smells of pot, but we still enjoyed it!
column3: Second time visiting here. Remembered it as tacky a few years back and it hasn‚Äôt changed, except there are now many more homeless people with the pervading smell of pot in the air now it is ‚Äòlegal‚Äô. Someone was selling it on the entrance to the pier! Lots of people begging, selling stuff. Entrance area in the Palisades Park is very sketchy!That said, you can still enjoy yourself here! Enjoy the tack for what it is. It‚Äôs an old fashioned pier with fun rides but a touch on the expensive side.. we did go on the roller coaster which was fun and 10 USD a ride. First night the fair was closed off to a private event so be aware that can happen. We had a good lunch and few drinks at Seaside on the Pier. Recommend the roof terrace there for good views of the beach and ocean. Don‚Äôt recommend the amusement arcade really, very old and grimy machines with flies! Public restrooms at the end of the pier were actually fine and clean!

I visited here with 3 adults and 3 children. Parking was pretty easy if you are willing to pay $20. The boardwalk itself was entertaining. There were carnival style games for the kids to play that were rather expensive but I guess average for what they are. Not too many food options at the boardwalk. We were able to find the mall nearby and ate at the Cheesecake Factory.

column2: Rating says it all: a shame.
column3: Having seen so much of the LA coastline on tv and in films we put Santa Monica down in the ‚Äúto do ‚Äú visit list.The pier was underwhelming: nowhere near as big as it appears on tv. An overpriced amusement park, numerous tat shops and some restaurants. Because of its ‚Äúpopularity ‚Äú it‚Äôs also very very busy: if you can don‚Äôt park in the car park if you intend to leave after sunset as it takes AGES to exit: complete chaos and 30 minutes I‚Äôll never get back.Not a patch on piers in the UK. Felt a bit like never meet your heroes.

This was definitely a fun place to visit during our trip. We chose to visit at night when it was less hot, which was a good idea. Very very busy though!Fun for children! There is an arcade and a few rides also. Restaurants on the pier are very busy so book in advance if you want to eat there.
Kids loved it...need I say more?Old fashioned amusement park....loved the pretzel and my granddaughter loved the trapeze school

My family and I had the Santa Monica Pier on our CA trip to do list. I have to say I expected more and was a bit disappointed. Many homeless in the area as well as religious preachers. The boardwalk had shops, restaurants and rides, but it was kind of run down and dirty. Its not like you see on TV at all. Very crowded on the boardwalk which I expected. We did a quick walk through and took pictures of the surfers, but left to go to the Promenade area which was very nice.

column2: Great to Visit After Day at the Beach
column3: After a day at the beach in Malibu, we stopped by the pier. We had a great time walking around and people watching. We played some games (I won a stuffed Thor!) and took in the beautiful view. While we didn't ride any rides, they looked fun.
The nice place to walk together. Lots of couple come here to enjoy the sea. But beach is not nice as asia beaches.

The experience wasn't too bad for a holiday trip. The entertainment was pretty neat. The homeless on the beach for the most part were ok minus a few. Trashed out public bathrooms were absolutely disgusting with used diapers and defication all over them was yuck.
This is a very busy place and very touristy which is not my kind of thing. Walking on the pier once is more than enough for me. Too many other things to do and see in the area.

Had a great time at the beach! Not too crowded if you are away from the pier. We got there around 12 and got a spot very close to the shore. Beach was clean and the water was perfect. Although we brought chairs we could have been more prepared by bringing picnic food, drinks, an umbrella and toys for the kids. We could have loaded a mini wagon with all that stuff and taken the boardwalk to the shore...walking on the sand was a killer for our legs!The only thing that was a nuisance was the aspiring models in skimpy suits having pictures taken. Not cool when kids are present!Since we were hungry we decided to eat at Albright by the pier. Food was great, except for the rice-too soggy. Food was pricey by I guess everything is overpriced in California.None the less, we built great memories with the grandkids!
not my kind of thing. too many people and too noisy. it's good I went once but would not go again. too many other places and things to do/see
A good spot to feel the LA pier athmosphere. Attractions are fun. Forget about the food. Great place for pictures.

Been here plenty of times but my girl was visiting me from Dallas so decided to take her here. It was awesome! For tourists I would say be a little cautious walking around, there are quite a bit of homeless people in the area. In fact one of which stared at my girl and actually followed her for a bit until I approached him and asked what his deal was. Most of the street vendors are illegal immigrants and the day we were there was a bit sad because the cops decided to drop by and out of fear some of the street vendors took off running prompting the officers to give chase. Aside from those two things it was a lot of fun and will definitely take her back, there's almost always a seal around when I visit I am not sure if it's the same individual each time but it's always a delight seeing it out there.

The pier is the symbolic end of Route 66 which had been our road trip for the past 17 days. Plenty of usual pier activities but a must visit location because of its Icon status. There are better restaurants in town but it is a pleasant walk and lots of people watching to be done at the very least.

We‚Äôve always liked Santa Monica but it appears to be troubled now. Quite a substantial amount of homelessness (more evident than our 2014 trip). The rides are overpriced - $10 for a ride on the roller coaster. The only redeeming feature it had was Bubba Gump.

column2: Tacky and not worth the long drive
column3: We visited Santa Monica pier during a recent stay in LA. I expected so much more. The traffic was a nightmare and took nearly 2 hours when it should have taken 30 mins. We had to pay $14 to park. The pier had several shops and restaurants which were very tacky. There were tramps everywhere too. The beach was lovely and the views were great but it wasn‚Äôt worth the long drive and expensive parking.
I Love this place. The pier is beautiful and makes you feel good and relaxed. There is good Bubba Gump at pier
The beach is beautiful. White send very clean. But the traffic was terrible and the road light didn't let cars go through

We took our eleven-year-old daughter recently and she enjoyed a couple of the rides. The real attraction is the beach beside it. Riding the ferris wheel at night gave us a neat view and on a clear day would be great as well for some shots of the coast.

On a Sunday afternoon there were lots of people about but it was still easy to park a couple of blocks away. There are a number of rides to go on, food and live entertainment. We spent two to three hours on the pier and were never bored.

column2: Classic but be prepared for crowds
column3: Santa Monica Pier is one of the most classic sights of the city. If you take the time to wait in line for the ferris wheel you'll be rewarded with one heck of a view. Be prepared. It's extremely popular so very crowded at all times.
Much like a traveling carnival--food booths, trinket sales, street performers, arcade with video *and* pinball machines, and rides. Fun if you like that sort of thing. Scary if crowds bother you.

column2: A place you don't want to miss if you are in LA
column3: Great atmosphere, a lot of people, excellent view. You can expend a couple of hours there and then have lunch at one of the many good restaurants on the pier or within walking distance from it. Go in the summer.

Apart from the hobos asking for money this was brilliant for our boys.We‚Äôve been traveling about and to just let the boys have fun and eat candy floss and ice cream was a fantastic break.They loved all the rides and the best deal we found was to buy the all inclusive arm bands. Our 3 year old was allowed on every ride except the big roller coaster.Although it looked busy we didn‚Äôt wait to go on any ride and on the big Ferris wheel we got some fantastic pictures of Santa Monica.A simply must when visiting here with small children, just steer clear of the vagrant people as they‚Äôre drawn to tourists

column2: Disappointing & dirty. Go take a couple of pics and run away.
column3: We went at night hoping to find some piece of R66 history and evening fun/dinner. What a disappointment. Place is dirty & tacky, not a decent restaurant or snack. Ended up having a couple of wings on the go, which were overly greasy and spicy and took forever to be served. A shame as this could be a mythical place again.

Santa Monica pier in person is quite different than seeing it in films. You are quite literally in the throngs of the masses, especially in the summertime. I also think the venue could be upgraded: it has mostly retro and somewhat tacky offerings.It is what it is. Don‚Äôt bring your passport or your cash. Or your kids if you ever want to see them again Ha ha ha! I slightly recommend it if you must, but there are so many other things to see in Los Angeles it seems a waste of time to me.Happy travels!
After all these years this SoCal icon is still going strong. Improving in some ways, such as cleanliness. Restaurant at the end of the pier is great. Every time is a good time!

column2: Santa Monica Pier: History and Nostalgia all wrapped up in one
column3: When the official ‚ÄòEnd of the infamous Route 66‚Äô meets the likely origins of Popeye, you have to take time to absorb the history and nostalgia of the surroundings. This resurrected wooden landmark provides focus and interest to an already known and established Pacific Highway town.The pier is instantly recognisable from afar, with its Ferris Wheel and Rollercoaster framing many an iconic photograph for thousands of visitors.The pier is a hive of activity and caters for all ages across a broad spectrum of entertainment, eating houses and facilities. There are the regulars, local fishermen who throw numerous lines into the olive green swell 40‚Äô below, the local hawkers offering to read your palm or paint your name in a myriad of styles suitable for framing. The more established fun fare rides and a veritable feast of restaurants (Bubba Gump is prominent amongst others).The ebb and flow of visitors almost matches the tides that rise and fall around the pier and you have to remain patient when travelling the walk way from Santa Monica, over the Pacific Highway to the pier -it‚Äôs not that wide and small children and families don‚Äôt walk that fast, especially when climbing away from the pier.Nationalities from all around the world festoon this iconic landmark at all times of the day, taking selfies with the Route 66 End market post giving the pier a multi-linguistic feel, but all carrying that sense of excitement and awe as they take in the infamous sites and sounds.The pier, whilst not on the scale of the pyramids of Egypt or the Temples of Mexico and Peru, is a venue not to be missed and I would encourage everyone to visit it once in their lifetime if they can.And as the sun sets over the ocean and the lights of the pier begin to twinkle in the fading light, take in the view and relish this most iconic venue.

column2: Very fun! Great for a family.
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is a must if you're in the area. A lot of fun rides, amusement park food and the ocean all wrapped up into one. The traffic can be challenging during peak times of the day, but I'd you plan right or stay in the area it's worth the bit of hassle. And I recommend visiting at night...a cool, fun atmosphere.
This is a great place to people watch. Don't miss eating at Bubba Gump. This is the end of Route 66. Small carnival on pier, definitely a tourist trap.

Lovelly area and the carousel never fails to delight. Some upgrade works in the area so care and patience was required.Watch out for all of the e-scooters as they don't choose to follow the rules of the pathways.
Very crowded... lots of touristy shops... liked Sign Route 66 End...Clean restrooms... good snacks/treats... Great boardwalk... a great place to put on your to see list!!!

This is west coast and we loved it since it was our 1st time. The water was beautiful, the pier had everything and the weather was right. I have experienced many piers on the east coast such as Ocean City Maryland and Atlantic City, New Jersey but this was a knock out being it was beautiful and the famous Santa Monica Pier of the west coast. I would love to see it again.
Guess you have to have a look and take a photo if there, Stayed in Santa Monica but took nearly a week before we went out on the pier. Rides are very underwhelming.
Great vintage games!Rides seemed excessively expensive.Nice place to walk around for a bit.Seven more characters.

It truly is on our list every time we travel to southern california. Our kids look forward to walking around the peir and playing in the water. It is fun for the whole family! Also there is a Really cheap souvenir shop under the peir!

I wouldn't be rushing out of my way to visit this attraction. There was quite a nice atmosphere with buskers plying their trade as you walk towards the end of the pier where - well, there wasn't much really. On the way, you pass a few shops and a kind of a fair with a Ferris wheel and roller-coaster (very tame). But it doesn't grab you (some kind of claim to being the end/ beginning of route 66 aside) and say, "come and visit me again". So I won't!
Great pier, lots to see and do and there really is something for everyone. Not overly expensive either. Enjoy, we did.
Don't go. Very crowded and dirty. Too many vagrants on and around pier area. Not worth wasting your time visiting. We wasted 30 minutes of our trip there. Should have gone elsewhere.

I came by here with my friends the first time I ever visited LA and my oh my was it disappointing. Honestly, we‚Äôve all seen the LA scenes portrayed beautifully in movies, posters ever other Tv show... and I just have to say, it‚Äôs full of unwanted crowd, tourists, people trying to sell you stuff, and just an unattractive herd of crowd.

Very busy and crowded walk down to the pier, the walk down is ok, but that walk back up, it's like walking to school uphill in the snow only its hot. LOL Pretty view of the ocean and all kinds of food, pricey though. Nice for a sight seeing experience.
Great Pier!!! the biggest one I have ever seen. Very nice restaurants you can enjoy yr food. Full of entertaintment.
To spend a day with the family, is perfect.Just it is not free! The attractions cost approx 5$ each and the full day pass for the kids 7+ cost 36$. 17$ if 6-.

There are so many people along Ocean Avenue leading into the pier. There are people with designer shopping bags and absolutely horrible smelling unfortunate homeless people going through the trash there are people on the scooters which are not supposed to be on the past and there is absolutely no presence of any Authority police or anyone other than one woman staff member on a little bicycle telling people not to go through the trash the place needs to be hoes down wash and monitored so that people with large dogs are kept on leashes and that people who are going to the trash or guided or a skirted to a better place more suited for them to be taken care of rather than to be 2 inches away from a couple sitting on a bench trying to enjoy the view while they're digging through the trash it's very unfortunate but something needs to be done about it mostly everyday this whole park leaving in to the pier needs to be completely washed down and hosed to cleanse everything of the urine and the trash that is all over the sidewalks and even on the grass. There is absolutely no excuse for a city like Santa Monica not to clean and maintain this area better and to have our presence of nice smiling official people monitoring these parks and the entrance to the pier.
What a beautiful place!This is a must see in LA!Like in a movie!You can see everything!I feel in love!
I always wanted to visit this pier because of all the movies and I wasn‚Äôt disappointed at all. It was such a nice weather, a bit windy. There‚Äôs was a lot of people.

column2: First stop on our American adventure
column3: This was the first place we (we is my friend and I) drove to after we got off our 14hour flight. Even in our sleepy state it was beautiful. Being summer break the pier and the beach were packed with people but it is still a great place to visit. The pier itself isn‚Äôt too long so it‚Äôs an easy walk, it‚Äôs jam packed with places to eat and drink and not to mention the Ferris wheel and the roller coaster üëåüèºThere was a yoga class being conducted at the end of the pier overlooking the water and running crews coming and going throughout the day too.There were many places to buy souvenirs and street artists spotted along drawing portraits of people so anyone wanting the touristy experience, Santa Monica pier is a must.
Iconic spot that is a must do when visiting Santa Monica! Crowded and high energy with great people watching, rides, churros and other classic beachy boardwalk classics. Love this place!

column2: If you have never been, GO
column3: If you have never been to the Santa Monica Pier, then you should go if you are in the area. The surrounding garages offer free parking for a two hour time period. The garages are easy walking distance to the pier. I expected a more beautiful area, cars are allowed to park all along the beach, which takes away greatly from the view. The pier is large and a nice walk, with several souvenir shops and restaurants along the way. Street performers are very sketchy, and I could see it being a rough area and not family friendly at night. The view out into the Pacific is very hazy, even looking at the shoreline was a hazy. If you have never been, GO, but not sure it's worth seeing more than once. Remember it is the end of Route 66, as far as you can go.
A beautiful beach and lovely pier with lots of little shops and places to eat and drink and entertainment along the pier a lovely place.

column2: Great experience just few minutes away of crowded LA.
column3: When in LA this is the place that make you feel you are on holiday. Nice beach, surrounded by nice palm trees, restaurants and holiday atmosphere. The pier in itself is taking you to enjoy a great vista and a great sea breeze if you don‚Äôt want to go on the beach. Shops and entertainment will make everyone happy. Note that you can access the pier by car!
Lots to see. Your typical pier with games, stands and eateries. Nothing fantastic but worth a visit just to take photo under the sign "End of the Trail Highway 66"
The pier was pretty crowded but easy walk there was plenty of entertainment including musical acts lining the pier. Rides are a bit pricey.

column2: Not as nice as Venice beach
column3: We visited Venice and Santa Monica pier on the same day. The pier is too touristy for my taste. We‚Äôve decided that if it has a bubba gumps it‚Äôs not worth going. If you are there go. At Venice beach we played in the water. We rented boogie boards for $10 for 2 hours and the water the board walk.

What a great time we had at this pier! The beach was beautiful! The water was warm and lovely. The pier had other things to do as well. It is the end of route 66 which I found interesting. The bathrooms were gross but other than that, I would suggest everyone go and see it.

Had read so much about Santa Monica Pier, and it didn't disappoint. We were disappointed that the Adult Merry go round was closed while we were there, but the Pier was alive with small shops and buskers and artists. We thought it was great. The hop on hop off bus drops you right at the Pier. A great day out!!

The roller coaster is worth a go. Airtable hockey a must. Do both at nighttime.The best bit is the buskers that sing. Go all the way to the end of the pier, their is a outdoor seating area. Sometimes singers come and perform. Usually around 5-7pm. Well worth the walk there.

column2: Quintessential old time/new time too Pier w/rides, cotton candy & the works!
column3: Went w/visiting family this Spring (we live here but usually don‚Äôt go cause saving for the tourists:) The Ferris wheel was great‚Äîscary, but very safe, albeit expensive! Like most everything in SaMo, but lots of fun & worth it‚Äîespecially if u have kids or are adults who celebrate their inner kids:(

Santa Monica has always been images of fun and sun but that has changed. On walking to the pier there are any number of vagrants and mentally ill (or possibly on drugs) who hassle you for money or are mindlessly screaming. It is no longer enjoyable getting to the pier, these frightfully bold individuals have ruined the pier experience.
Parking is a big problem unless you take a private public parking which can cost 15$ and more. Lot of music and perfomances.
Certainly a nice visual but the crowds and cheap souvenirs everywhere make for an unpleasant experience in the summer heat. Go when it is not hot or busy.

column2: End of Route 66 Beginning of CA Fun
column3: The Pier has it all-- food, surf, sunshine, amusement park rides and great music. No trip to CA is complete without a visit
If you are going do research as to what is near by. When walking to the pier, sidewalks have direction plaques to point out attractions. Venice beach is near by.

column2: A pier full of character and things to do...
column3: Highlight for us was the Victorian carousel which has been used in many films. Enjoyed and would recommend the traditional ice cream parlour. Spent a good couple of hours meandering along the pier watching fishermen and enjoying the vibe as well as view.

We really enjoyed our visit to the pier as it has a real American traditional feel to it. We parked in the car park and set off across the sea front and then circled back through the downtown shopping area. Be warned, that was a very long walk. I would recommend setting up an account for the Bird/Lime electric scooter loan scheme, because you can pick them up anywhere. I wouldn‚Äôt cancel a trip to one of the local theme parks to focus on the pier‚Äôs attractions though - it is too small/tame for teenagers, and the rides are more appropriate for younger families. Overall, we had a lovely visit though and would recommend it.
The charm of Santa Monica pier is huge wood prank on the pier, feel rustic and charm.this pier is a fun place for teenage and a romantic for couple as same as 20 years ago... just only few change ...

column2: One of the awesome places in California
column3: You will like this place and fall in love with its relaxing walk-side with music and fashion every where but i gave it 4 stars because it is little crowded but if you like to swim you must visit Venice beach.
Ok for young kids for about 2 hours. Mostly carnival type entertainment. Beautiful view of water and beach.
It offers you a wide view of the ocean and it has different entertainment activities available, but I don‚Äôt find it ‚Äòwow‚Äô.

column2: Family visit of Santa Monica Pier
column3: We visited Pacific Park which is an oceanfront amusement park located on the Santa Monica Pier, and the major cool thing about it is that it looks directly out on the Pacific Ocean. Apparently, it is the only amusement park on the West Coast of the United States located on a pier. There were a total of twelve rides in Pacific Park, including a roller coaster that is short and finishes in a minute or so but circles the majority of the park which tells you how small is the park. The roller coaster that you're allowed to do twice in a row is the main attraction with the wheel that we skipped. We bought bracelets that allowed us to access those attractions.A small ocean facing park that the kids enjoyed but you do only once for an hour or so.
We went to the Santa Monica pier during the day and at night, there is always something happening, street performers and plenty of food to eat. Great views from the pier also.

column2: Touristy and noisy but worth a (very quick) visit.
column3: Visited a few times.Very noisy, food/drink very expensive but lots of it looked tasty.All very touristy with the rides, music, touts etc. But I guess you have to visit if you're a tourist heading to Santa Monica beach.

I found Santa Monica pier dirty, dated and overpriced. It was nothing like I expected it to be and I left feeling let down. We took a trip on the big wheel which lasted about 5 minutes and cost $10 which was a good experience however it moved quickly leaving no time to enjoy the view.
This was a very interesting place I think that is is used on the bold and beautiful a lot to see and do also a great place to find food ice creams and gelato family friendly

On our trip down Hwy 1 we decided to check out the famed Santa Monica Pier. What a disappointment. We paid an astronomical $40 to park and made our way to the pier with thousands of other people. There were people hawking fruit for sale, Trump haters barking at people on megaphones, people shouting about salvation and the end of the world, and cheesy rides and tourist trap shops. The beach was overrun with people and you could barely stir them with a stick there were so many. Really commercial, noisy, trashy and dirty. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money on the stop.
Yes its a pier but a very busy pier with not a great deal else. Its free to walk along but very busy and noisy.Better off walking down the main st area with its nice shops and coffee bars.

This was the end point of our route 66 trip, so it was a much do trip. So glad we did. The weather was perfect and we thoroughly enjoyed walking the full length of the pier. We had some lovely food in Albrights before we left... Do it guys its a great day out.

A lot going on here. Super busy with people and parking took a little bit but we found a lot right at the entrance of the pier below a restaurant.Lots of good people watching and seeing the coastline The local music acts along the pier were amusing and talented and the. Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier was a perfect place to unwind with a margarita and some chips.

We parked on the beach lot, which cost about $14. There is a mall just up the street with better rates but it is quite a hike to the pier. The pier itself is crowded with a lot of vendors, restaurants and carnival rides. Ate lunch at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co overlooking the ocean. I found Huntington Beach to be better with its more friendly bike lanes and expansive walkways to stroll down the beach.
It is a nice pier but being there during the summer holiday it meant it was just too busy. Also the 100's of traders didn't really help! Might try it again when it is not high season.
Very nice pier full of good restaurants, bars. Very huge, sandy beach. It was very crowded, hard to find a park.
We found the pier very crowded, which is understandable in the Summer, but also a Police incident kind of spoilt our experience!!

Walking through the pier seems like you are in the movies. The amusement park leave much to be excited about but just the ambience at night is amazing. In the day walk along the beach to venice beach. does make one relax.

Enjoyed short walk along pier but very crowded. It is full of the usual souvenir shops, cafes etc. Didn't go to the amusement park as we had just done Disney. Pleasant views from here. Preferred cycling along the beach path.

You can‚Äôt come to Santa Monica and not go to the Pier! A true icon. Try the Pier Burgers! And Big Deans Ocean Cafe too! Grab an ice cream. Ride the Ferris, especially at night when the whole Pier lights up! Just stroll the Pier and enjoy!
This pier Is fun for youngsters. The Ferris wheel is beautiful especially at night. There are rides and food, and it isparticularly pleasing at night. There is paid parking nearby.

column2: Great weather. Great day at pier!!!
column3: Very impressed with parking fees (right on beach) and the cost of meals. We ate at a restaurant that hat umbrella tables on the right when you first enter onto pier. Very pleasant staff. Good food. Great view!!!!

I guess when in Cali one of the ‚Äúmusts‚Äù is to stop by Santa Monica Pier, so we did just that. We walked most of the pier but it was way too crowded. Restrooms are crowded and dirty. Restaurants on the pier are so so. Lots of vendors, carnival rides, and people trying to make a quick buck (a young man was selling back flips for $2). We have young kids (2 and 5 years old) so for us the Pier was not worth it.
Very scenic and nice the pier is so iconic being the end of Route 66 very cool to see and experience the area.
Visited during the start of the school year in hopes of less crowds, but it was still too crowed to be enjoyable. Lots to see and do if you are willing to stand and wait.

There is a large car park next to the pier so getting here is easy. Then you can enjoy the pier. It will be crowded but with a police station on the pier (where the jail used to be) it felt safe wandering around. There are snack bars, restaurants and rides - or you can fish off the end of the pier. There are the expected free toilets but also a sunscreen dispensing station! The pier also has a souvenir shop to mark the end of Route 66 which starts in Chicago. The beach and sea complete a fun day out!
We parked near by and the beach was clean and beautiful. The pier is full of old fashioned but fun games lots of places to eat. We really enjoyed our day
I stop at the pier every time I'm in Santa Monica. Lots of people and entertainers on the pier. Gteat for people watching.Easy access to the beach.
My favorite place when I visit LA.Love the carnival atmosphere! It can also be peaceful and relaxing at the same time when you just sit at the end of the pier and fish or just take in the sunset.
The pier is always beyond crowded, but it's worth the effort. Super view of the coast line, and if you can bear the lines, take one of the rides.
It's iconic if you are in the area make the trip happen it is worth the crowds and noise. Take your time, walk the pier and then walk the beach...it will be a lifetime memory.

column2: We loved Santa Monica Beach and Pier
column3: We visited Santa Monica beach and pier three times during our week in LA. Loved the beach, clean fun waves to swim and play in, great fun on the pier and a nice town too.We even saw filming of Grey‚Äôs Anatomy on our last morning at the beach too!!
As with most tourist hot spots the prices for rides are outrageous...but if you can get past that it is fun!!!

Didn‚Äôt find the place special. Was crowded and the beach was not any good. Just spend few hours and left for Venice beach which is much better and happening.There are nice restaurants right across the streets.

column2: Kinda fun, bring your bathing suit.
column3: Santa Monica Pier has some small rides and a couple of restaurants including a Bubba Gump Shrimp. Really known better for people watching and then utilizing the beach and ocean below. Official end point of Rt 66 and there is a marker indicating as much. Good picture opportunity.
Traffic was awful. Parking was really tough and took over and hour to navigate. See it during the week day.

column2: Interesting to visit once but dirty and busy. Not our favorite beach.
column3: We had never been so decided that we wanted to visit. We went for dinner and to walk in the evening on the beach and pier. It was extremely busy and pretty dirty everywhere. Lots of food and entertainment options all around the area. Our kids didn't try the rides but we ate and looked in the shops. Our children are 12, 10 and 8. They thought it was interesting and liked people watching. We enjoyed the evening but wouldn't go again. Lots of public parking a few blocks away.

Went to the pier as we had go Los Angeles card and the fun fair is included (as is the aquarium but it on the day we went). The pier is lovely and there are a number of rides, stalls and food shops. There was a decent police presence so despite the crowds it felt safe.

I have been to LA countless times, but for some reason, never stopped by Santa Monica. While the area as a whole is great and worth a visit, The Santa Monica Pier is a definite must go. The place is electrifying. So much activities to do and things to look at, buzzling with people. It will now be one of the LA tour stop I'll have when friends and family come over the area for a visit.

After a swim in the sea it‚Äôs worth a visit .There are rides and food . Watch out for the 7$ ice cream cone . They don‚Äôt do small here . It‚Äôs hot this time of year and rather crowded .There is a metro about 5-10 minute walk away .Maybe Venice Beach is better .

The Santa Monica Pier has rides, games and food that you would find at most boardwalks. So, if you like those things and are in the neighborhood it is worth a visit, but there is nothing unique or much above average to be found.

column2: Expensive and run down! but good for sunset.
column3: Its about time the Pier gets a renovation with new rides etc. The restaurants are expensive and even the photo both is $7 for 1 photo. Great location to watch the sunset.

It took more then an hour to find a parking and it was very difficult to reach it.The pier is nice and interesting. On Saturday night probably too crowded.No way to find a place where to eat (we were ten people) every restaurant was full and none accept reservations.

Travelling from England with teenagers who were keen to visit the ‚Äòfabulous‚Äô Santa Monica. Don‚Äôt bother!The pier is full of strange people preaching anything from Jesus to Trump, the sea and beach are both filthy and slimy with litter everywhere and the smell of weed is EVERYWHERE (has made me realise why is should remain illegal). Complete waste of a day.Everything for sale was either over priced or sub standard - the churros were hard and dry and the rides were $10 each.Parking is a nightmare - they close the car parks with spaces still in.Only good thing was Bubba Gumps - as the food and atmosphere was excellent!Drive further to Santa Cruz - beautiful!

This is a fun place to hang out. Several restaurants are on the pier as well as souvenir shops. There are lots of locals playing music and people fishing. You can watch the surfers or go on some carnival rides. Relax and have fun!

Personally I‚Äôd rather go to Brighton pier.The rides were pretty boring. You‚Äôll pay $4 for a vending machine coke.Might just be the Brit in me but you shouldn‚Äôt walk along a pier without fish and chips in ur hand and that wasn‚Äôt on offer!

I watched this place a lot of times in a movie. Like my fave " Raise your Voice and Kissing Booth". I always want to see this place way back. The view is perfect. There is a Pub on the pier called Maria Sol. It is nice to just relax and get a drink there. There are people who plays instruments and playing classic songs.If you just want to be alone and enjoy the beach. The rides looks fun though I didn't tried it anymore. I love, love the place so much.

column2: Extremely Crowded Place - Maybe too much
column3: Even if the view is always nice, the place was extremely crowded.Cannot avoid to say that Area like whole LA is full of Home-Less which anyhow does not give a clean and nice image to the city also since sometime same are under effect of drugs and alchol and have extremely bad behaviour not nice at young kids eyes.Would recommend to be careful.

Filthy and kitschy! What a pity for this excellent location, just on a long broad and fine sanded beach, with unobstructed horizon towards the ocean!On the other, it is not surprising, as the US and especially LA/Hollywood are the inventors of kitsch par excellence! Everything is blink blink, but cheap and fake! The crowds though like it and keep cramming into it, in a vicious circle of lost quality and high visitor numbers.
Weather, sound of music and tasty food are few reasons to not miss the Pier! Easy to find it and to spend a wonderful afternoon there!
The crowd is overwhelming and takes away the experience but it‚Äôs a beautiful place to visit and a beautiful beach.
This is a very lively place that offers a wonderful view of the ocean. Santa Monica Pier is also a great place to watch the sunset.
It‚Äôs the classic California experience to go to the beach, on the pier that has amusement rides and games on it.

column2: ICONIC, EXPENSIVE, BUT STILL GOTTA GO
column3: My 4th time there, have always gone on a weekend when crowds are at their peak. The pier is wall to wall people with long lines for the 2 restrooms(one in the middle, one at the ocean end) but makes for lots of interesting things to see. There was a fantastic live band, lots of cool kiosks, at one point a disturbance requiring no less than eight squad cars which came slamming in one after the other. (It is very safe, whatever happened they seem to have gotten it under control quickly.) There are lots of restaurants serving the typical burgers, tacos and pizza- prices are outrageous, though- $16 for 2 tiny tacos and two drinks. As always, I rented bicycles below and just to the right of the pier. There are several bike rental places for about a quarter of a mile towards Venice. $34 for two bikes for the two hour round trip ride up to Venice along the beach walk, past Muscle Beach and into Venice to ride over the canals. Plenty of less expensive places to eat in Venice via bicycle, and most rental places give you locks for free. There is a bike lane on the road in Venice and people seem to be used to tourists riding in the streets. Parking for the Pier is not usually a problem, even on crowded weekends there is usually room in the lot, $14 for the day and includes beach access next to the pier. (The beach was wall to wall people, also.)Ride tickets are $10 each ride or $20 for a ride pass. Lines for the rides move quickly, only a few minutes wait. Overall, will probably not be the best time of your life but still gotta go at least once.

Santa Monica Pier and beach was beautiful. Lots of activities going on like riding bikes, scooters, boogie boards, muscle beach sun bathing etc... the Pier lots of games, rides, souvenir shops, music and a seafood restaurant
A good short walk with shops and food or drinks. You can walk up until the Ocean and gaze at the waves or ride rollercoasters at the amusement park. Fun to visit with friends or family.

column2: Avoid the weekend if possible... a must do even if it‚Äôs crowded
column3: Santa Monica Pier has a charm to it because of movies, it being the end of Route 66, and well because it‚Äôs Santa Monica Pier. We recommend walking to the end first and then working back towards the beach. It‚Äôs crowded and everyone is selling their wares. Instead of getting caught up in the madness, go look at the ocean and listen to the waves and then find the cheep eat, souvenir, or whatever else you came for. You‚Äôll be glad you did... you made it to the end of Route 66!!!
This is a small version of a pier like you‚Äôd see in Wildwood NJ. There are rides, games, performers and eateries.

We were in California and felt he had to go see the pier. We drove from Los Angeles with the kids. The views are wonderful. We had to put our feet in the ocean. OMG it is so cold and it was June! Crazy! We had lunch on the pier and took a lot of pictures. Then just walked around the beach. Fun place and we felt we had to see it. Oh and there is a great Mexican Restaurant on the end of the pier overlooking the water. Good food and service

We came on a weekend and it was very busy. With all the amazing beaches California has, there is no reason to come here for the beach since parking is a pain and the beach is very busy. The rides and attractions on the pier were very busy and not very good. The street performers were more like scam artists. The show we say, the "performer" refused to do the act since he felt he was insulted by the amount of money the crowd had given him. The shopping nearby is all the regular mall stores so why fight the crowds and traffic when you can just go to the mall. Overall, I don't recommend.

We visited with kids on a Sunday not sure it was the right decision. We paid $25 for parking only to see cheaper parking at the pier. I don‚Äôt know where all the people come from it was just to crazy in the hot sun and chaos. I would recommend going late in the afternoon and maybe during the week. We didn‚Äôt get a chance to really experience the Pier.

After a short walk from the big parking lot at Santa Monica Pier we arrived at the perfect spot to fish. The temperature was so cool conmpared to the scorching Valley just 20 minutes away. This was our first time fishing here. For years we have walked past pier fishers and commented how fun it looked. Today was our day and what ‚ÄúA‚Äù day it was. We took chairs a small cooler and tossed our lines over while watching a perfect sunset on the Pacific. Babe would you like to come back; and we both smiled and said Yess!!

Amazing atmosphere with all the street entertainersThe place was buzzing with all the LA locals and tourists catching the sunThe inside Vintage Carousel was fabulous and beautifully restored and maintainedAll the normal kiss me quick seaside stuff for those that like it!You even have parking down there for $14 all days which we thought was good if you a car full and make a day of it!A must visit

column2: Awesome round trip at the coast
column3: We spend a fantastic day traveling around from Hollywood to Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Venice Beach to Malibu!This day had everything. Shopping excitement in Santa Monica, great lunch at Bubba Gump at the Santa Monica Pier, a hot but nevertheless great walk to Venice Beach and a perfect finish at Malibu Beach with my beloved Gallery and Mr. Brainwash Pop Art. We all loved it so much
It's okay, honestly nothing special. Souvenir shops and overpriced rides. Views are okay but lots of panhandlers trying to make a buck. Did get some boxed water at the pier from a yoga event.
A fun filled relaxed time with family. Great weather great interaction with locals and good food and great service

column2: Pier is great for a photo op but rides expensive
column3: The pier is lovely, very interesting to walk around. However the rides and games seemed very expensive.Lots of a great places to eat.There are nicer toilets in a nearby park. Do not use the ones just before the entrance.Lots of homeless people one of whom got in my face and made my sons feel uncomfortable.

column2: Super fun ever if you are here alone
column3: Traveled here from Monrovia all alone using an Uber from Monrovia Hotel where I was for business for the week the weekend came and I stayed an extra few days went here on a Saturday about 6 hours has a nice Beach very busy not many seashells but nice Sandy Beach they also have an amusement area was a huge ferris wheel no you can't ride the ferris wheel alone no single Riders so made friends with the couple next to me who let me join them in their Ferris wheel cart I took their pictures and they took mine it was a load of fun 10 bucks for one ride real great views from a pie they also have other amusement rides since little stores would definitely go back
I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed the Pier. The rides were reasonably priced (compared to the food pries) and my kids really enjoyed it!

column2: Bring your money cause it can get expensive!
column3: 5 hot dog on a stick and 3 lemonade was 50 dollars. Riding the roller coaster was 10$ per person. Parking was 15$.Otherwise it's a great iconic stop for everybody! They have really cleaned up recently! Barely and homeless people begging for change or eating out of trash cans or dead people under the Pier(long story).Use the bathrooms on the Pier though!!!If your going for people watching or just to enjoy a nice sunny day I highly recommend.

column2: Lovely spot and worth the trip
column3: Beautiful spot! Must see for any tourist and the park down there is lovely to experience, especially with the big ferris wheel.Lots of places to eat, casual and dine in plus the beach walk is great.

column2: Very crowded but nice views at night
column3: Well worth a visit but to crowded on Friday night. We only went for a ride on the roller coaster as the lines were very long. 10 $ each is a bit pricey. Lots of places to eat but we went elsewhere for dinner..

column2: Dated and in need of a facelift.
column3: Iconic pier has seen better days. Rides are tame and expensive and the actual pier itself (from floorboards to toliets/showers) needs some investment.Beach is great with very strong waves.

We are beach lovers at heart and the pier is brilliantly busy with a good mix of souvenirs places, food outlets and rides! The views from the pier are amazing! We went when they were promoting Shark Week and saw some treat pieces of art for Shark statues and got the mandatory free shark foam hat!

Summed up in one word: schlock.A veritable zoo of people. Hokey tourist junk vendors. Fun amusement park, gorgeous beach views from pier extending way out over the Pacific.Keep hands in your pockets and enjoy the sights.

This place was very recommend when we were in LA. We went there in the afternoon and thought the weather was perfect I did not like the place very much. It is dirty, crowded and not much to see. We enjoyed walking through 3rd street much better. It is much nicer, clean, nice shops and good ambience.

We visited the pier as a starting point for a tour we did, how found there toilet lines ridiculously long, especially when you you a little one and I also have Crohns Disease. Given there is one of the most iconic beaches in the world right at your feet more shower blocks and toilets would be highly recommended. The beach was littered with garbage which is a shame for such a beautiful stretch of sand! Park was great although a little busy due to road works.
What used to be a low-key outing with a nice atmosphere turned into an overcrowded attraction where everyone wonders why everyone else is there.

Nice pier, great views, it‚Äôs best to cycle from muscle beach where there is plenty of parking.Everything on the pier seemed over priced the arcade are had a lot of broken, worn out machines and the staff were somewhat lacking in being polite.Rides were also nice, however way overpriced for what they were for 10 bucks 1 adult for a 2 minute ride.Even a small coke was 4 bucks.Go for the location, views and forget spending money here!

This historical wooden boardwalk pier is worth a visit even though it is exceptionally crowded and full of the usual tourist shops and trinkets.There were some entertaining performers and some very good views of the ocean and the beach from the end of the pier. There is also a fun fair and other small attractions.Quite a nice walk as long as you don‚Äôt stop to buy.Also the end of Route 66!

column2: Great place to visit when you're in LA
column3: We enjoyed a wonderful day at the Santa Monica Pier. The kids enjoyed all the rides. We also enjoyed some of the food and the atmosphere was wonderful. It's a bit of a tourist trap with too many people there at at any given time. The beach was also phenomenal and will always be in our memories. The pier is a place that everyone needs to visit when they go to Los Angeles

Went with family, including kids and rode a couple of the rides they have on the pier, the Ferris wheel and roller coaster. It was very expensive but we all enjoyed it. It was full of musicians playing (some very good, some not so great) and a few restaurants and shops, people fishing and exercising. Full of life. We had a nice time here.

The beach, broad-walk and pier in Santa Monica were like a scene out of a Ballard novel (a combination of High Rise and Super-Cannes). Unless you are into some of the worst elements of what the American culture can produce then avoid Santa Monica and Venice Beach at all costs.Dangerous at night, grotty in the day. It is clear why most American‚Äôs chose Miami Beach.
Was nice to be by the sea but the pier is so packed. There are rides and eateries like you would find on any pier. A definite must do.
Lots of people but must be different at day to appreciate the pacific ocean.Lots of things to see and do.Kids friendly tooo

Santa Monica is a beautiful place.From the pier you can see these beaches full young people and families all having a lot of fun and stuff. It's very crowded though so I'd suggest either going there early or walking a little far from the pier.I can't say much about the theme park and the arcade games because I didn't go to them but they're very family friendly. You should definitely try them out if you have the time.The only disappointment was the aquarium below the pier. It was very small and pretty boring. I guess maybe if you have little kids it could be interesting somehow because there were activities for them but as a family with teenagers it definitely wasn't worthwhile.Nonetheless Santa Monica as a whole is still a very beautiful.

column2: Santa Monica Pier is a blast!
column3: Our flight arrived early in the day so we headed straight to Santa Monica Pier. Parking was a breeze‚Äîwe were there early so we were able to get extremely close and all day parking is inexpensive ($14). Rode rides, played games, it‚Äôs expensive but we had a blast. Ferris Wheel is a must as it offers great views. The roller coaster is kid-friendly, no big drops. Stick to the arcade games outside, the indoor arcade can easily be skipped. A lot of the games inside were out of order and some that didn‚Äôt have signs would take your money and still not work. Following lunch on the Pier we walked in the surf down to Venice Beach which is a people-watching paradise, then took a $6 Uber back to get the car. Great way to kick off an LA vacation!

column2: There is a lot of better places to visit..mm
column3: This ia as average place about I dont want to write a review.... at all was average and dirty... is this famos santa monica??? Iam sorry... better places:manhattan beach,all beaches in Orange County....Really If You dont have a lot of time,dont go there... because its lost time here

We spent a nice afternoon on the pier, enjoying the views and also some of there rides on Pacific Pier. The West Coaster was good fun and it was nice to have a look at the midway games and other rides. Something that you should try and do whilst in Los Angeles, you only need an hour or so and then you can enjoy the surrounding stunning beaches

Bustling with visitors, this is symbolic of the country‚Äôs pride in its attractions. I found historical interest as well as excitement in the views. Visited the room at the top of the carousel where they shot a scene for The Sting. Did not take the giant wheel or other rides. Next time maybe. An amazing place. By evening impromptu performances were just beginning.Read the book about it , they have copies on sale. I was lucky. Listened to the stories from the man who wrote the book. Priceless.

We love the vibe, and beautiful view, bike rental is plenty and not expensive. We used a public bike rental for only 6 dollars an hour, and 16 dollars a day. the dedicated bike trail along the beach is amazing. No need to compete with pedestrians !A lot of shops and eateries around. We loved the juice bar. Parking is relatively easy.Relatively clean and modern compared to some areas in DTLA.Venice beach is a bit over rated in my opinion, but worth checking it out I suppose. Like Newtown or Bondi.Warning! Police is on duty to catch any electric scooters on the bike trail!

I came, I saw, I will never go back. Just nasty, dirty and filled with unsavory types. There is a police station right on the pier, what does that tell you? The rides looked chinzy, the souvenir shops were second rate and it just crawls with every type of tourist plus locals trying to scam you out of a buck. It was a nice walk on the beach to get there, but I should have just walked right on by!

We visited the pier hive of activity people everywhere but a very enjoyable experience plenty of fast food outlets ,good views off the beach, fun park on pier is reasonably large, tourist gift shops that sell all tourist stuff,

Nice walk along the pier. Waves great , more powerful to the left of he pier. Muscle beach (the old one) gives people the chance to show their balance/ monkey bar and tightrope walking. We read the new muscle beach was down at Venice beach. This is like an outdoor gym and is only as good as the people who turn up to use it so was disappointing. Many laces to eat in Santa Monica and great shopping . It's got it all!

column2: A simple day at the beach
column3: Took a beach towel and hung out with my kid at the beach and the pier. Rode the Ferris Wheel and ate at a hamburger stand on the pier. A beautiful day with some beach fun.

We stopped into check this place out it was so crowded I brought 2 bottles of water for 4 dollars down a little a lady was selling them for 1 dollar each what out for thatPushing through the crowd for what this place is known for there is not much there the little stores there could be more we did not want to go to the fun park the sign End of root66 that was it could be more to it but just disappointed had a quick look and left
Not normally keen on piers but this one has something over others - certainly at sunset anyway. As busy as it is, you can still find peace and space if you seek it.

column2: Grandkids on the Pier, What a great way to spend a beautiful Summer afternoon.
column3: Ok, so for about 12 bucks you can get the kids a bracelet to ride all the rides, a bargain, especially in Southern California. We loved the rides, they were well run, clean and lines very reasonable. Don't ve scared off by the crowds, many are just hanging out. Park right at the pier, don't waste your time looking for parking off site. IT is 15 bucks but well worth it.

This place is beautiful, wonderful, and lively. It has a playground and restaurants on the sea and when you visit the area you should go to the third Street shopping street in the area I advise you to hire bicycles to take a tour of the area.
It's one of those places you shouldn't miss when in Los Angeles. You can take a walk down the pier. There are restaurants and souvenir shops on either side of the pier.
Everybody needs to go. Beautiful pier and amazing ocean view! I will just suggest to the city to check the wood screws. Some are dangerous and can cause a severe accident

Of course you have to go because you saw it on a film or show and yes it's very well known. So by all means go. Just be ready for lines and lots of people as you should be. The restaurants on the pier arent so great but if you're not looking for that you'll be fine. Watch out for those on bikes or rollerblading and be ready to over pay for parking and to play any games.
A lovely pier with plenty of eateries and a great arcade! There are toilet (restroom) facilities too and a number of entertainers line the pier. Beautiful at night.

column2: Beautiful place to walk and visit
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is a true gem! We visited the pier nearly every day that we stayed in Santa Monica. It was walking distance from our hotel and there was so much to do. We went to Pacific Park and took tons of photos, we watched the sunset off the pier. It was really a magical place. I do want to make sure you realize that this is truly a "tourism trap" and that it is a place for people to sell things, we did purchase several items from the local vendors on the pier because they had good prices and it was all part of the experience. If you don't like touristy things, this may not be the place for you! I would highly suggest going to the end of the pier just before sunset and taking some photos, the view is magical. It is not the cleanest pier I have ever been to but I feel like that is expected since there is constant foot traffic.Sidenote, the corndogs just off the pier are SO GOOD if you need a snack!
Beyond sketchy. Felt incredibly unsafe the entire time. Homeless and panhandlers everywhere. View is tremendous, but the crowd was enormous. Teens and 20-something‚Äôs May enjoy it. But not for me.
Lots of fun to visit to see all the activity on the beach and on the pier. Would recommend a morning or late evening stroll to get best views of sunsets and sunrises.
Very nice place! Loved, loved, loved the experience! This is one of the most iconic places to visit if you are travelling to L.A.

Wasn‚Äôt overly impressed but it‚Äôs a nice old pier. I enjoyed the old feel of the ambiance. View would have been really nice but it was cloudy. You do have to pay for parking, cash only.Good to visit once, we went super early so it wasn‚Äôt too crowded.Bought very nice smelling sunscreen at the gift shop. Nice to walk around, listen to find street music.Don‚Äôt know if we would go back but it was nice, quiet, and relaxing. They have benches along the way and some fishing areas.
There is so much going on at the Pier, and it is iconic, so you have to go...ride the ferris wheel, check out some shops, and just take in the atmoshere.

The pier is very busy with various stands selling food and souvenirs. Many restaurants are also along the pier. It‚Äôs definitely worth seeing when in the area, not only to embrace the atmosphere, but also to enjoy the beautiful views from the end of the pier.

We had a meal and then went for a walk out to the end of the pier. There were heaps of people out enjoying the weather and there were plenty of performers and buskers to keep people entertained. It is iconic for the end of Route 66 sign as well and we had to do that. Well worth a visit.

I was looking so forward to coming here with the kids. I honestly didn‚Äôt feel safe. There were a lot of people selling things, protesting, etc. the arcades were not clean. We took a picture of the sign the end of Route 66 and left. Wouldn‚Äôt take young children

column2: Get there before lunch or you queue for parking
column3: I parked on the North parking lot which is a bit further from the pier but I am ok with walking at $12 per day parking.The sea was cool but not cold for the 30+¬∞c. Sand was hot under you feet and the beach stretched for miles. Water can be rough with wave knocking me off my feet.Beach facilities was good with rest room and fresh water shower on the beach near the parking lots.The pier was hectic but nice, food ok but souvenir shop was too expensive compared to elsewhere such as Monterey. So good to look We did.not feel like buying.

column2: Ride the Ferris Wheel at Santa Monica Peir - Check
column3: We visited really just to ride the Ferris Wheel. Line wasn't too long on a Sunday night. Worth the $10 to say you did.We got there about 7:00 pm and walked the pier and then back to a restaurant with an upper deck - can't remember the name and can't find it on Google Maps for some reason. It was above a walk-up fast food type place. Waited about 15 minutes for a table, but it was worth it. You get to get out of the crowd!

The pier was nice, we went at night and it still seemed lively. There was a bit of a queue to park, but parking was fairly easy and standard LA price.We only went on the wheel, which was fun, but a little overpriced for a standard fairground ride.
If you are visiting Southern California you've got to experience this place once! It is just a classic experience that you've got to try. Nothing extraordinary to do but well worth the trip
The famous Santa Monica pier is a must see one time. Great views out on the pier of the coast line. It was very crowded. Bathrooms on the pier which was helpful.
We had a fun time. The pier is great. Crowds were heavy and price of rides is a bit high but it‚Äôs worth it for the photos!!!! Go enjoy!!!

This is probably a must-do for the LA experience but it‚Äôs not very enjoyable. Masses of people and parking is difficult especially at sunset. Souvenirs and food are very expensive and not much variety. We enjoyed the street performers. Pretty at night but watch your belongings.

column2: Too crowded on a hot day
column3: This pier is more of an entertainment area. There are a couple of cafes and restaurants plus many small shops. The walk to the pier is nice, busy with people enjoying the beautiful scenes of the ocean and also sandy beach.The walk would be more comfortable on a less hot and sunny day.

We got there at sunset so it was lit up. People were performing and fishing off the end of the pier. The food was a bit pricey though and not much room to sit. Parking was hard to find but it was a great walk and experience

A very famous attraction that did not let us down. The neon lights at night and the whole seaside feel gives this place a happy buzz. Somegood rides and plenty pf places to eat. You are probably better off eating and parking around 2nd or 3rd streer and walking down.

There‚Äôs something about this pier that‚Äôs both kitschy and nostalgic. Even though it‚Äôs very crowded, it is a place to definitely visit while in LA. You don‚Äôt have to stay long, just long enough to walk to the end of the pier and admire the water views. Or stay awhile and ride the Ferris wheel for even better views. We found parking in one of the buildings just 2-3 blocks away, and parking was free if you stayed under 3 hours. What a good find.

Visited for a few hours as part of an organised trip. Busy spot in Summer time. Had a half hour talk giving the history of the Pier. Kinda interesting but not required.There are many amusements, food stalls, restsurants and shops etc located along the length of the Pier. Some of these more iconic than others. Do check out the Forrest Gump seat and the End of Route 66 sign. You will queue for a photo opportunity at both those spots.Public restrooms are available. Lines will exist.For us the best part of the visit was the fantastic sea views. The Pacific looked stunning and the sea breeze divine.Car parking is available but of course there is a charge.

It was great to visit as I suppose you see it featured in lots of movies. Enjoyed watching the locals fish off the pier and the buskers entertain. We didn't go on any rides or eat at the pier but enjoyed out walk. You could easily walk from the train station to the pier. It was nice to see the ocean and enjoy the summer breezes but full of tourists like us.
Great summer sunset & lots of events for the family to participate. Summer heat is quite unbearable so bring your sun tan lotion of lots of water to replenish your loss of water

We loved our time there. Be prepared for traffic, parking issues and lots of tourists. But, it was all worth it. I‚Äôd suggest trying to find parking closest to the pier, there‚Äôs usually some great hidden parking stalls near the pier, you just have to be determined and patient to drive around a bit to find one. If you can‚Äôt find one close by there is a parking garage up the road from the pier entrance. There‚Äôs quite some interesting entertainers there especially at sunset. Best part of our time there was playing on the beach, eating churros, and watching the sunset. By all means, go enjoy the rides and shops too üòâ
Good place for a promenade. You'll find a lot of thing to do.At the old arcade, yo'll find back oldies video games... I went back in childhood :-)

We went to Santa Monica to visit the beach and see what the hype was about. It was ok, quite busy with tourists and some locals.Great for families as the kids can enjoy the rides or hit the beach.We had lunch at one of the food courts at the nearby shopping centers as there was limited options for food at the pier.
II was staying at a nearby hotel and decide to walk to the pier. Yes it's touristy but fun. Restaurants, ice cream, other nearby hotels. Plenty of rides and fun for all. Great views. Take it all n

We saw a sea lion in the water and you can fish off the pier, but unsure about the exact regulations as we did not actually fish ourselves. There were live performances and people asking for donations. I can‚Äôt upload video, but there was a older man that was painted in gold and later taken by ambulance out of the area. We had some explaining to do with our children because we watch him perform, gave money to him, and he gave our Granddaughter a Slinky toy. She was upset to see this and we hope he was ok. There are people there trying to make a dime and just be prepared for that type of thing. Several people shouting how evil the world is and how you should repent before you go to that hot place. No matter what side of the fence you are on this it may be place that you discuss things beforehand with young kids. We ate at Bubba Gump‚Äôs and we participated in a trivia contest about the movies. Public beach, but we strictly were tourists that checked this off bucket list. Been there- Done that!!

column2: Great place to escape during layover at LAX
column3: We decided to spend our layover on this trip at the pier. Definitely plan for traffic and on you way back. We had a great time at the pier. We partook in the amusement rides and games. We then walked the pier which was full of artists and musicians. We then went down to the beach for a bit to relax and enjoy the water.
Nice view. Lots of things to do. Rides...great sunset. Live music.I would go back. Good for all ages

Recently took a couple of our grandchildren (ages 10 & 12) & they enjoyed themselves. Only a handful of rides however it the location that is the draw- right on the ocean. The "all you can ride) ticket seems reasonably priced. Its an experience- not in the class of a major theme park but then again they aren;t on the ocean either.

This is a fun place with rides, food and a relaxed, carnival beach atmosphere. Hit the waves or just view the horizon and waves... fun for all ages. Even more beautiful at night with all the colored lights
In former times this was an amusing place to go to, but now its just dense crowds and noise, punctuated with low-grade amusements. The carousel even operated without music.

Considering all the hype about this iconic landmark I was expecting something much more impressive. It was nice to finally see it, but in reality it's just a small amusement park. I would have enjoyed seeing the historic carousel and other historic buildings there, but they were closed when we went. It certainly has a beautiful view and a broad beach below, so in good weather I can see how it would be a popular haunt.

I can‚Äôt imagine how such a touristic place is not prepared for an electricity outage.The theme park had to issue refunds to all its visitors and the restaurants stopped serving people, so we had to leave.

This is another must see on a trip to LA. You can‚Äôt be mor iconic than the Santa Monica pier. Lots of shops and restaurants along the pier and all of the blocks around the area including the 3rd Street Promenade.

This is a fun space for young people, they have food, souvenirs, an arcade and some games.There is a mall and good restaurants around and now they have some cool scooters that you can get for almost free!

Have lived in Los Angeles 36 years and I have been here twice. The rides are good for kids. There is action and noise. As a localI rarely come here, but there are mobs of people who do. Convenient to the metro, so more folks can come from in from the LA sprawl. Sometimes there are nice events/ music.

Once one of my very good friends shared an anecdote about Santa Monica, that the first time she saw it, she was so mesmerized by its beauty that she had decided to marry someone from Los Angeles only so that she could settle in there and visit Santa Monica anytime she wanted to. Well, I wasn't fortunate enough to visit it that early in my lifetime to think likewise :)In reality, I would still not blame her because it was one of the most complete beaches/ pier that I have visited in some time. The beach line is long and the background across the driveway is picturesque. There is ample parking and even if not the cleanest of all, it is a relatively well maintained beach. If walking on sand is not your cup of tea, you could take the pathway kissing the road to reach the pier. The ocean of course is a view to cherish and there are so many activities that children could do at the beach.The pier also was unique with the ramp nosing to a fair distance into the sea. There is variety in terms of places to eat, things to do and then just to gaze at things. I loved sitting on one of the benches and staring at the sea gulls, listing to the talented street performers, looking at the waves going past the wooden pillars.My little one enjoyed running around chasing the birds and even after spending a good 4 hours we were so not ready to leave. There were stunning photo opportunities and we did not miss too many of them.The only thing that did disappoint me was the quality of the food, If you have a choice try something in the city or maybe eat at somewhere where I did not( They were so forgettable that I can't remember their names)

Unless you are planning on swimming and making a day of it and going on rides, huge waste of time. The pier is uneven and hard to walk on for seniors and those pushing baby strollers. There are vendors for food and people selling stuff, some blocking stairways. You wait in lines to park, pay $14.00 plus dollars, then walk to the end of the pier and back about 15 and you‚Äôre done. If I had to do it again, I wouldn‚Äôt!
So a stroll on Sunday night was crazy busy! People everywhere! Returning Monday morning around 9 am was pleasurable because we could walk faster and peer over the fencing.

We wanted to tick this off the list. It's a nice historic pier but gets very busy in the summer. They could do with controlling the hawkers selling buckets and spades etc as the block steps on and off the pier as this causes problems.

Nothing beats a walk down the pier with the ocean breeze in your face. There is every kind of fast food item you can imagine and some sit down restaurants. Amusement rides and games for the kids, street musicians and performers. We love going there at night because of the light and the singing/musical talent. We even say a Mariachi singer dressed as the President. It gets a little crowded, hold onto you kids. The beach gets a little sketchy at night with the increasing homeless population. We were never approached or panhandled, just be careful.

Had a nice time at the pier at the end of a Saturday. Yes, it was crowded, but that was part of the attraction. Lots of fun things to do and see. The only problem with the pier is getting there. You really have to know where you are going to park first and then have about three other options because the lots are usually filled after mid day.

Fun, fun, fun, with the park rides and game booths and f&b options. It is a very leisurely walk down the pier. The indoor game shop could be revamped for a better and more modern appeal and also some shops are closed for renovation. It'll be better if all shops are open.

Was described to me as the Coney Island of the west coast, it's not, it's crowded with a few fairground rides and fast food. Had the ticket as part of an explorer pass. Saw the price of the tickets, wouldn't pay it for what we got. The only one of our family that enjoyed it was the 5 year old and even she said the rides were slow.

Ugh! I guess it‚Äôs one of those things you have to do if you come to Santa Monica but as soon as you do, you regret it. Honestly, if you can just stay up by the sign, you‚Äôll be fine and say you saw it. You‚Äôll miss a million churro and mango sellers, as well as being sweating hot and running into 5 thousand children.

I was here last year and had an amazing experience. This year it wasn‚Äôt as good. It is very crowded, as to be expected. This time I went and I could smell a lot of weed, like it was making me nervous because I don‚Äôt want it to show up on a drug test type of smell. There were a lot of passed out homeless people in the area. They weren‚Äôt bothering anyone, but it was very disturbing to see people just laid out on the way to the pier. Guys with signs begging on the pier. I hope they can clean it up and get some help for the homeless people.
The rides here are most suited for children. The pier gets rather crowded however you do get very good views both towards the land and the sea.
We spent an enjoyable couple of hours wandering around the pier. We had a go on the roller coaster which was fun. Lots of tacky souvenirs to buy and lots of wacky people.

column2: A landmark for all times of day
column3: We stayed just a 20 minute walk from the Pier which we walked towards most days. Iconic landmark and a night looks stunning. It's a bustling hive of tourists and locals, offering fairground rides, food, live music from organised to busking. It's the END or BEGINNING of the famous Route 66. You can park on the pier too. People fishing, movies being shot or just to sit and while the time away. It's a living breathing community. I have been there as a lone traveler and also with teens.
We had a blast. Lots to do with teens. Don't forget to bring a jacket as it gets a little chilly when the sun starts to set.

We went to the Santa Monica pier on a Sunday morning around 10:30AM. It was very crowded since it was a weekend but we still took our dog and walked all along the pier. It was neat seeing the iconic pier and had beautiful views on the beaches and Santa Monica. We enjoyed listening to a child violinist who was very talented as well as a singer at the end of the pier, and there are all kinds of art/souvenir stands in addition to the typical fair food vendors and fair rides. There was no parking close by that we could find that was under $20 but we parked at the civic center for $2.00 and walked which was very convenient and saved money if you are willing to walk a little to get there. It was neat seeing the end of Route 66 sign and taking photos with that and the Santa Monica pier signs. Might be a little overrated but it is iconic and worth it if you are in the area already (and would be fun to take kids as well).

Santa Monica pier is a must-go-to place if you‚Äôre planning on visiting. It exudes an air of hard to find true remaining authenticity in Santa Monica spirit that was here during early times. I would recommend coming early in the day avoid most of the crowds or late in the evening to see the sunset and have a margarita at the end of the pier!In general the restaurants that are on the pier are pretty decent and I would definitely go for a few rides if you have the chance. It can be a memorable and romantic experience.
Certainly something to see - bit of a circus sideshow atmosphere but fun - exactly what you would expect and without the sleaze factor of venice beach

column2: Fun place to spend an afternoon/evening
column3: Beautiful beach and surrounding scenery with food and fun. Likely one of the most beautiful areas in S California.

Okay Santa Monica Pier can be a nightmare full of too many people and long lines. It also has a great theme park on the pier, how many places can you ride a rollercoaster next to the ocean. Love the games and walking the pier just brings back good memories. Plus it's fun to watch the beach goers from the pier.
It was one of the better beaches I have been to, lot of attractions, food, music, arts and people even the strange ones.
This was on my bucketlist. I am so glad we went. It was crowded, but we loved the boardwalk. The view was spectacular. We walked around the beach too. It was a lot of fun!

Walking on the pier we were able to see far out into the ocean and some of the houses built into the hills. There was a lot of rides and entertainment for small children and adults. UCLA also provides a sunscreen station that or provides free sunscreen. It is very pretty when the lights are in at night too.

We're glad we visited it, though there wasn't much to see. The rides were definitely targeted towards children - so we would recommend visiting here if you have young kids. But the adult scene wasn't super exciting. We saw all we needed to within 30 minutes of arriving. Gorgeous view of the ocean and clean beach nearby, though.
Crowded and a ton of kids playing pokemon Go. Food is a little overpriced but still good. Not a lot to do but the scenery is amazing.

column2: Santa Monica Pier was a let down
column3: I took my grown daughter to the Santa Monica Pier, as I enjoyed it years ago at night. Driving there on Sunday morning, there were so many homeless people, she did not even want to get out of the car! WE drove all the way down and she kept asking me to leave, that is how bad it was. It was Sunday morning around 9:30 am. I felt bad even taking her, as I had no idea what it has turned into since my last visit years ago.

It was interesting to visit and nice to be able to say we've been there since it is an iconic part of American roadside history, but really it's just a pier with rides on it. Every 50 feet or so you pass another extremely loud performer- really I wish they would have a decibel limit, it would be so much more enjoyable.We walked to the end and back and then spent the rest of our time on the beach and swimming- which was much more fun.Traffic and parking was a complete nightmare.

We went there on a Sunday night.. parked a ways away..but who can complain when you are walking next to the ocean.. lots of people to watch.. we just came to see the sunset and was not disappointed. It is a really cool place to visit and it is a short walk to a mall area..

Similar to Jersey shore boardwalks we frequently visit back home. We went there to say we did it. Went on a Saturday afternoon and it was bustling with people. We took our pictures and left. Definitely get a taste of local culture on the pier.
Good old traditional pier as described. Visited on a Sunday and traffic was mental. Loads of cars bumper to bumper. Very busy and buzzing area. Defo worth a visit.

Yes - good to see this famous pier, but really over crowded and over rated. Imagine the amusement park at Southsea put on the Bournemouth pier on a good day in the summer and you‚Äôve more or less seen it!!

Pacific Park has some nice rides, and the price didn't seem to be too outrageous as far as theme parks go. Good assortment of amusement park food and entertainment. The view from atop the Ferris Wheel is great! Make it a part of a day on the Venice Beach Boardwalk (about a $5 Uber ride - or a long walk - away).
