column2: Too many tourist on the pear
column3: The pear lost its end of route 66 spirit with so many tourist and small vendors here an there. If you want a fair, let's go there

Very busy place, got there morning time and beautiful pier and beach, water around pier is quite dirty from rubbish and we did see a few homeless people eating out of the rubbish bin. Must do is a bike ride from the pier to Venice beach it takes around 20 minutes and can do at your leisure, lots to see along the way and if an eye opener but so glad we did it !!

column2: Iconic pier amid nice coastal area
column3: A pier is a pier and SM is tacky just like the rest of them. Rides are in expensive and not very thrilling so I would suggest saving your money and people watching before having a drink at one of the cool bars along the front.

We decided to stop at the famous pier while driving Highway 1. What a mistake! This beach town reminded me of Seaside Heights, NJ or Wildwood, NJ. I felt very uncomfortable walking around. It was very crowded. Nothing special. There were rides which we avoided. Honestly just couldn‚Äôt wait to get back into the car to continue driving. Traffic was terrible and easiest parking is the parking garages. We parked, walked to the pier, walked to the end of the pier, then walked back to our car and left. There are so many other pleasant beach towns along Highway 1, skip this one and head to another.

My husband and I visited on a very busy Sunday evening. It was heaving with couples, families and groups of friends; and there were a few buskers too - enjoyed the older violinist doing covers of pop tunes. We walked all along to the end of the pier, past lots of kiosks selling food or souvenirs, enjoying watching the visitors on the beach and in the sea. There are few restaurants including a Bubba Gump. The fun fair glows as the sun goes down. A proper tourist icon.

I absolutely LOVED Santa Monica Pier! Ever since the Lost Boys came out when I was younger, I had always wanted to go see this place! Lol it‚Äôs beautiful! The water, the pier... loved it! I love people watching also! Rides are a bit expensive, but we did the Ferris wheel of course, and it was great! Although the only down side..... I didn‚Äôt see any vampires here... haha go see this attraction!

The first thing I noticed on the pier was the noise. Loud announcements were coming from a speaker telling people that Jesus could save them. Two people were handing out brochures about Jesus. The walk to the end of the pier was crowded and claustrophobic. We passed cheesy souvenir stands and musicians ( some were great; others were horrible). At the end of the pier where people were fishing we were rewarded with a nice view of the ocean and a cute little sea lion swimming around and poking its adorable face out of the water. There are not too many places to just sit and people watch. It‚Äôs like being stuck on one of those moving sidewalks at the airport. There is a swimming beach nearby. I heard the water was freezing so we didn‚Äôt want to try it. But some people were in the water. There is a lot of nice shopping near the pier, especially the Third Street Promenade.

First thing we did in Santa Monica once parked. Obligatory pictures in front of the Route 66 sign. Long pier very similar to those in England. Therefore expect all sorts on it. And that includes the people. Plenty of tourist shops and places to eat. Lots of rides but not open at 9am. Big Parking lot right in front of it handy and $14 all day parking. A must if visiting Santa Monica.

column2: Off the plane, to the pier....
column3: This is a good place to stretch your legs and start to appreciate what LA is, a huge city, with a stunning coastline and natural beauty, and lots of people out in it. The pier is the end of old Route 66.The pier and surrounding area are very walkable, and the little amusement park is recognizable from several movies. There are places to eat, public restrooms, and, of course the ocean.When approaching, keep going towards the pier if you want close parking. Because of the elevation change between the town and beach, It appears the road ends. We ended up parking in town an walking, which was actually a nice stroll. Santa Monica was actually cleaner and newer than I expected, and there were renovations happening on one of the main streets. Lots of folks walking and biking. There must be some homeless issues still, because some sections did smell like an outdoor urinal.
Visited to join star's home's tour. Plenty small barrows selling tourist items. Can be busy, and we didn't get time to tryout the rides, completely,

column2: Nice place for a quick visit
column3: Nice historic pier that is crowded. Lots of touristy souvenir kiosks and street performers along the way as well as several restaurants and ice cream shops. Fishing off the end. Seemed to be mostly tourists when we there during day and early evening and not a lot of locals. Parking for $15 is nearby on beach.

I went early before the evening crowd. Its a nice Pier with Playland arcade for kids and adults if you like rollercoaster or wheel tours. There are a couple of restaurant directly on the Pier, Bubba Gump shrimp,Mexican Mariasol, and more as you step on the Pier. Lots of gift stores. I walked to the end. I enjoyed reading the history of the Pier, and finding out Santa Monica claims "Popeye" the sailor, cartoons I watched as a kid, was based on a real sailor's life in Santa Monica, Olaf Olsen. Really! I thought "Popeye" is from Chicago! I thought the place too touristy. Its worth walking to the end. Bring towels to hang at the beach after or before.

column2: Oceanfront amusement park, housed on an over-sized pier
column3: Oceanfront amusement park, housed on an over-sized pierSanta Monica Pier is packed with eateries, rides, games and other amusement park attractions, and also a portion which is like a normal pedestrian pier. We came here with young kids, so it was exciting for them, and we got much joy watching them being excited, happy and enjoying things not available to us when we were young. I‚Äôve been here many times, as I used to be associated with a business located nearby, on Santa Monica Blvd.This is a pier like no other. About 70% of the surface area of this irregular-shaped pier is over land. It is home to eateries (including Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., Mariasol (Mexican), The Albright (seafood), Pier Burger(Had burgers and fries here. They were great.), Ristorante Al Mare (Italian), Rusty's Surf Ranch (seafood and bar eats), Coffee Bean, lots of fast food eateries, and more), Pacific Wheel (Ferris wheel), Guro Loop (This made my head spin), West Coaster (roller coaster), Pacific Plunge (cabled free-fall ride), Sea Dragon, Santa Monica Pier Carousel, souvenir shops, Pacific Park‚Äôs rides for little kids, entertainment arcades with over 200 games, and more. On weekends and holidays, the pier is very crowded.At the deeper end of the pier, we saw a few people fishing, and some had caught fish.There are many things one can do in the vicinity of the Pier. The biggest being enjoying the beach. After enjoying the Pier, we walked two blocks to 3rd Street Promenade, for shopping and people-watching.
Fun, lots to do, plenty of restaurants nearby. Loved Bubba Gump's right at the pier, plenty of night life, shopping, bars, restaurants, so much fun.

column2: Good to Visit at least once
column3: The pier was really cool with the rides on them. It was fun to drive onto the pier in park there as well. The rides are not that great if you've gone to Universal before or while you're in Southern California unless your kids are pretty young these would not be exciting rides. Not as many jobs as I expected but the beaches were nice and clean and the bike paths were nice the exercise areas where need so it's worth a visit at least once.Now my best advice would be to spend one day here and then spend the rest of your time in Huntington Beach. Huntington Beach is so nice compared to every other Beach we went to lots of room tons of beach very very clean and lots of shops and places to eat. Huntington Beach was the best place we saw and we will stay there next time we're in Southern California

I visited Santa Monica Pier during my trip to LA. I didn‚Äôt stay very long so I wasn‚Äôt able to experience the entire area. However, the area is a major attraction with lots of things to do and the normal street performers. It gets crowded in the evenings and finding parking may be a little difficult. I didn‚Äôt see any free parking close by so be prepared to pay about $15 for parking.

First of all we enjoyed this and recommed going to have a look. But the ride prices we felt were over the top. Maybe this was because we had been to universal studios the day before. We did enjoy visiting this iconic location and worth a look.

We were excited to visit the Santa Monica Pier, we have been to the Santa Cruz Board Walk in the past. We were very disappointed. Very crowed, very few rides, and very over priced! I guess it‚Äôs nice to say we‚Äôve been there, but save your money and go somewhere else!

First do not miss the carousel. It is old and beautiful and free. The ice cream parlour has good drinks to cool down on a hot day. The pier is definitely a hub of activity. The buskers are good fun to watch. The amusement rides are good fun. The stalls have interesting gift options. Do not forget the end of Route 66 sign. A perfect photo opt. A great way to spend the afternoon. You can even go fishing off the pier if you want to
The gyro loops is a lot of fun, but you have to pay extra. Other rides are mostly for children under 8.

Had a good afternoon at the pier, a few seedy characters around but that‚Äôs expected. We had the LA go city card which made it cheap. The rides were a little tame for our kids but fantastic views and the weather was perfect..
like in gta V, only there are too many people and enjoy the place is complicated, but we must remember that it is one of the most famous and deserving of the city, of course we must see.
Whether you stay on the beach or just experience the views this is an amazing stop! There is a lot to see and do. A piece of history!

I wanted to see this iconic landmark, but it is quite rundown and dirty. The wooden surface is uneven and hard to walk on. The facilities are old and shabby. The ocean offers naturalsplendor and should be seen at other locations.
Ventured here just to hang out. The pier was nice,plenty of activities for the entire family or you can sit and relax and people watch!

This was my first trip to the pier. We took Uber there as I don‚Äôt like driving in LA. Uber is the way to travel to the pier. Traffic and parking is very tough to manage.FYI sometimes they shut down traffic heading down to be pier because of crowding. When leaving we had to meet our Uber driver at the top of the pier.Overall it was a neat visit. Plenty of street entertainment, lots of eateries and excitement. The sunset is beautiful as it sets over the hills.Unfortunately not enough time to visit the beach.
Just great atmosphere! Always the best! If you can devote full day is great with its food option places and touristy shops if not still great for half a day - friend shop/food catch up kind of place.
This is a great beach! It's clean and the water is great.. Be warned it will also be crazy crowded or at least it was when we went but it was still wonderful.

Great atmosphere / pretty beach views but way too tourist filled. There were too many people, it honestly isn‚Äôt as ‚Äúbeautiful‚Äù as it seems in pictures, honestly kind of gross. Not something worth going out of the way for

This place is crowded.. but not to the point where you can't move, well I hope that's not gonna happen. My first visit in Santa monica pier is 10yrs ago but it wasn't as crowded as it is now. It's still a great place for a side trip if you dont live in LA, it's worth going, just to see it for yourself since this place is always featured in many movies and TV shows.

column2: Touristy pier. Dirty beach. But good people watching place.
column3: We visited back in September 2016 (TripAdvisor wouldn‚Äôt allow me to put time before sep 2017) and had a fair experience. While the entire area is crowded, it is fun to enjoy the sight of a Ferris wheel, a beach, and all kinds of people walking by and laughing.

column2: Nice for a couple of hours!
column3: We chose our hotel based on being near the Pier. I must say, I am glad I saw it, however-some restaurants, rides, shops....DONE. Definitely not a destination. Enjoyed it but not worth a return visit or missing out on something else.

It‚Äôs old, but that contributes to its charm. A must go to spot at any time of day as part of a trip to Santa Monica. Features some rides, arcades and everything a pier would have in its prime. They even have Zoltar, which definitely took me back to my child hood

I always feel like I am stepping back into my childhood even though I did not grow up in LA. It is because they used the pier in a lot of TV shows. Especially 3's Company. The carousel is still there.
Go early and get parking right next to the park for $16 or park further for cheaper but expect to bake in the sun. Bring sunscreen! Lots of food for reasonable price which was surprising.

column2: Nice place to visit for anyone spending time on Santa Monica beach
column3: A very nice place to visit for anyone who is spending time at Santa Monica beach. It has some entertainment, ferris wheel, roller coaster few others rest rooms and several places to eat. The place is kept clean.
The pier was very busy and a lot of entertainment and plenty of things to do. The breeze is awesome a worth visiting

column2: A must do and see while visiting California!!!
column3: I came here on a Thursday afternoon while visiting LA. Commuted here from the 7th Street Metro Station downtown LA and took the Expo Line and this was the last stop. This is a very convenient way to travel to/from without the hustle and bustle of driving and trying to find a parking space. The train station is a block from the entrance of the Santa Monica Pier, once you walk over the bridge you are entering into a fun filled adventure which takes you back into time of a old timer boardwalk. I live in Chicago and we have a similar attraction called Navy Pier its nice but not as much to do and see as they have here.We walked the Boardwalk grab some food, took lots of pictures which is spot on for a good scenic op and headed down the walkway towards Venice Beach. This route was so nice, everyone walking or taking in the scene by renting a bike or scooter which is a brilliant idea. However, we just walked there and enjoyed the route. Once we made it to Venice Beach there were a lot of vendors, stores and eateries. We spent the entire evening there as the sun went down. We opted to do the scooter rental back and that was nice because after the long walk we enjoyed the ride back. Again, this is a definite stop while visiting the area. I highly recommend it.

Busy but lovely location. Fun fayre is good fun on the pier and easily accessed by foot/bike or electric scooter which are good fun! Restaurants available on the pier and toilet blocks available along the route from Venice beach!

column2: A must see on your LA visit
column3: We jumped off here from the hop on off bus tour, and enjoyed our visit, the carousel was stunning, and the pier was full of interesting characters. The view on the beach on a sunny day was superb.

If you a lucky you will catch a look of the Harley motorbikes finishing their tours at the pier. Lots of food outlets, people fishing, buskers and tourists. My husband had chilli chips here 3 years ago and couldn‚Äôt wait to try them again, he wasn‚Äôt disappointed.

Starting to get very run down, many many homeless. Few restaurants and seems very tired. Good to see as an iconic location but was disappointed to see how run down it is becoming having not been here for a few years.

column2: Reviving the aquarium in Santa Monica Pier area.
column3: I am looking to work with heal the bay a non-profit organization that revitalize the ocean they are going to be rebuilding the area for families to get into something else that interstate adults while ENT the children.

column2: If only ONE thing to visit in SM, THIS is IT!
column3: You'll feel like a kid again visiting this! After all the TV ads, movies, shows you've seen this in and to FINALLY be there yourself, is FANTASTIC! You do NOT want to miss the Ferris Wheel at NIGHT!!!!!!!!!!!! What a show with all the color!Something for EVERYONE one here!

Hoards of people, mostly tourists strolling along the pier. there are souvenier shops and bars lined on both sides. it was like a fair with the giant ferris wheel at the end. the sea and shore was also full of bathers.

column2: Mom with 18 yr old daughter and her 18 yr old friend
column3: Santa Monica Pier is amazing!!! Long down ramp to walk down and that meant a long walk back up so if you need help please advise!! Once your down to the bottom it‚Äôs a carnival üé° with food ü•ò games, rides, vendors, tours and the ocean. All day passes for adults are $32. Not bad at all. The food choices are great. The ocean is just down the end of the Pier! Uber took us from the Homewood Suites in Redondo Beach!! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Have a great time on your next vacation to The Santa Monica Pier!!!

Ÿäÿ™ŸÖŸäÿ≤ Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿ£ŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿ± ÿ®ŸÉÿ´ÿ± ÿßŸÑŸÜÿßÿ≥ ŸÅŸäŸá Ÿà ŸäŸàŸÅÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÑÿπÿßÿ® ÿå ÿ≠Ÿäÿ´ ŸäŸàÿ¨ÿØ ŸÅŸäŸá ŸÖÿ∑ÿßÿπŸÖ ÿå ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÉÿßŸÜ ÿ¨ÿØÿß ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤ ŸàÿßŸÜÿµÿ≠ ÿ®ŸáThis is where Albert is most popular and offers games, where there are restaurants, the place is very excellent and recommended

column2: Kind of dirty but still a fun time
column3: I love the souvenir shops. It was your average beach scene but still a nice walk down to the pier. Great places to eat.
Enjoyed our trip to the pier - very busy but great fun. The rollercoaster does two loops so it‚Äôs not quite as pricy as it first seems.
Its worth a visit just to say that you have been to the Pier.Over priced food and rides.Spend an hour there max...
The pier was an interesting collection of people from all walks of life. A bit busy and crowded but beautiful views and lots of touristy things to see and do.

The Santa Monica Pier is definitely a tourist trap. We went on a Sunday and it was so packed with people that it was hard to walk around. It felt very dingy. If you enjoy things you would do at a local carnival, you'll enjoy the Pier. I'd try to go on a weekday, as I've heard the weekends are the busiest.

We took our children to the pier and couldn‚Äôt believe how expensive the rides were.The rollercoaster was $10 each!The pier has all the usual pier things with different games, rides and popcorn stalls but be prepared to spend a fortune!

column2: Funny place ... great for people watching
column3: Brought some Irish friends who were visiting to the pier ... they loved it just like the movies, or pictures you see of LA. Teens did rollercoaster ... $10 per person per ride is expensive but it was a one off thing and they can say they did it. We had ice cream & pizza .. everyone enjoyed & was happy

Every city has places where there‚Äôs loads of tourists and here you‚Äôll thousands of them. So crowdy, especially weekends. The amusements are mostly for kids, but hey: a ride at the Ferris wheel is a great thing if you wanna look on things from above. The rest? No, I‚Äôd say have a look at it from a distance and save your money for some shopping or hire a bike/electric scooter for a tour at the boardwalk instead. Do not eat here unless you love fast food and loads of people being noisy and screaming.

We visited in the morning on a Friday so we did not have a problem parking and walking up and down the pier. Restaurants and rides are not open so we just walked on the pier and the beach and took lots of pictures.

Hordes of people wandering around looking for things to do or eat. Rides for the kiddies and older 'kiddies' and many places to spend your money on all kinds of "stuff". Very crowded and not very exciting.

column2: A place to kill a few hours if you have nothing else to do
column3: lots of rides for children and a place to kill a few hours if you have nothing else to do. It gets very crowded on weekends.
Loved the Pier. Safe and a lovely walk. Beautiful views of bay and Santa Monica mountains. We loved it.

column2: Throngs of people..but it was nice
column3: Went on a Saturday. Couldn't believe the throngs of people a bit too crowded for me. It was a nice carnival atmosphere. Expect long lines if you go.

We did not play the midway rides. We went there for the ocean scenery. Right at the sunset, breathtaking beauty. Swimming, playing with sand, walking along the beach, having sunbathing, it‚Äôs definitely a great place for kids, family, couples and more. Love it!

Lovely beach surrounding the pier and the pier itself was full of things to look at. There were a variety of places to buy food, see art and there were even rides. The Ferris wheel is great, the view is very nice. I liked that it was solar panelled. It was just a bit too expensive for the rides.

We were on a day tour of LA and visited Santa Monica Beach and Pier. It was quite windy the day we visited. There were plenty of places to buy souvenirs and there was a merry go round which is really old and very reasonably priced to go on if that‚Äôs your thing! I think it would be great in Summer time. I‚Äôm so glad we got to visit this famous place in LA

We were only in LA for 2 nights, so we tried to do a lot of stuff but going to the pier was well worth it. We went on Saturday, so it was crowded. We parked on 5th for 8 dollars flat rate. Look around for a good lot the prices range greatly.The pier was very interesting and it is a piece of history, it is almost like being in a movie. It has several amusement rides and restaurants. It is a good 1/2 day trip to day trip.There is a lot more to do then just the pier. There are lots of shops, especially on 3rd and Malibu is just a short drive north.
Had a great time with my teenage kids. Good people watching. Great roller coaster and rides - tremendous setting.
Lots to do. Rides and attractions. Shops for missing items and souvenirs. Food of all kinds. fishing from the pier and people watching.
Probably for the young at heart or those with kids in tow. Amusement park vibe with an ocean view. Lots of people, lots of diversions. Interesting.

The pier and attractions is a little like stepping into the past. You can find pac man and galactic machines in the arcade. Particulary good for families w kids with lots of rides. A lone Japanese musician was playing on the end of the pier which made for a beautiful peaceful quality despite the crowds at the edge of the pier.
Always s lovely day out. The pier is small but has a couple of great restaurants, a few rides, and good parking.
There were so many people on the pier it was incredible! There was also a great band playing! This place is so popular, games,restaurants!
We spent the day there and had a great time, the game arcard brang back some memories and the views wew outstanding. Easy trip from west hollywood on the hopon hopoff bus.

column2: Beautiful beach but pier was dirty
column3: Santa monica is absolutely beautiful. The Pier although nice from a distance, it was dirty and not well maintained during the day. There were many people on the pier bit a lot of trash and unkempt.

column2: Perfect place to see the sunset
column3: The view is stunning and this is the perfect place to see the sunset! There are many attractions for kids and lot of food. More pictures on my IG (kelledstyle) ;-)

This is a cant miss if you are visiting LA. What a fun experience. Definitely do the coaster and Ferris wheel, no matter your age. We had a blast. Even if warm, take a jacket. Much cooler here with a breeze.
Nice experience.After Soviet my first impression was USA is totally different planet and after Santa Monica I realise that people in US love to relax.We had good time I'm speechless. I love USA

Stopped by the pier on my last evening in town. Took the metro from downtown which was quick and simple. The pier was crowded but a neat place. Great views of the Pacific, lots of family oriented activities, and decent restaurant options. All on the pier!

As a Chicago native with the exception of the ocean vs our lake, I find this to be kinda meh. For kids it's probably a lot of fun, but it's not horrible. The rides are just 'ok' and the carnival games are what they are. However, the view and the performers make it decent. I heard a very talented 9 year old violinist here.Another addition on the rides- I personally think they're overpriced. I got a wristband as part of the LA Go pass so I tried out 3 of them. The ferris wheel is always relaxing, but I wouldnt pay the 10 bucks they charge tbh.
The views are great from the pier. They have limited rides & games but we still enjoyed our time there.

column2: Great time on the beach in family
column3: We were not lucky, by the time we got on the beach, it was cloudy but we still enjoyed the atmosphere at the beach. Lot, and lot of people. If you get there by car, expect to pay $15 for the parking. There are many restaurant along the beach where you can eat. In terms of the beach, it is very clean despite the number of people who visit. I preferred Santa Monica beach to Venice Beach, specially if you are with kids. Venice beach are more for teens or young twenties. Santa Monica Beach has an entertainment park which kids below 10 will love.

If you have time on your hands in Los Angeles, I suppose it's worth the effort, but I wouldn't bother. It's not nearly as interesting as the Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco, and is very touristy. Go if you're desperate to see the end of the old Route 66, but that's about it.

column2: Fun to visit, not a must see
column3: The boardwalk has many visitors from all over. Street performers and political activist. Food vendors and some dated carnival type rides. The ferris wheel did look fun but $10 a ride seemed a little steep. It was an ok visit.
Very touristic, nice view but nothing special, especially at busy times. We liked more the biking along the beach.
It is one of those tick the boxes place, if your in Santa Monica you have to do it. I've done box ticked

I could not tell if this is the place that locals go or tourist. As a tourist, I would not ride any of the rides. I did not even look at the prices, but I am sure they would have been disappointing. The pier could use some updating as far as maintenance goes. Maybe if I was a teenager, I might have enjoyed it more, but then again, the kids all said it was boring. We paid $15 to park, so we decided to leave the pier and walk around downtown. That was slightly better. Found a few good places to eat and it made up for the lacking pier. There was also some kind of police activity around all the electric scooters on the trails. There maybe some restrictions about renting them and were they can be used.

We went here in December, and it must have been the best time to visit. While there were still people around, it was nothing like the amount of people in late June / July when we went again. It was hard to even walk to / from the pier and the beach because of the amount of people. Smells of urine and pot all around, which was disgusting.Lots of good people watching and being next to the ocean was awesome, but there are better beaches in the area.
A bit dirty, too tourist. Thought it would be better maintained, Santa Monica beach...a variety of restaruants

You have to visit this place at least once in your life. It's like stepping out of real life and into a movie or video game!The pier has food, fun and music, it's a thriving and great place to hang out. From the rollercoaster to the famous wheel, even the food and coffee is great! There are a range of activities for kids too young for the rides including a huge arcade and multiple fairground games!I really think the pier is perfect for a couple first date, or a family experience! Also check out the shrimp at Bubba Gump, even if you're not a seafood person, it'll surprise you ;)GO AND ENJOY IT!

We had such a fun time at the Pier! Parking was super convenient and not too pricey. We paid $12 for 4 hours. We decided to get wristbands so we could go on unlimited rides (they were super pricey if you paid for each ride). The rides were like what you would find at a carnival, but we had a blast. The short lines were an added bonus (especially after spending 3 days at Disney & Universal). There are lots of places to get food from sit down restaurants to quick bites (hot dogs, pizza, hamburgers, etc.). We were a little bummed because it was overcast when we were there, but we'll definitely return so we can spend time on the beach as well!

It seems to be mostly for kids but the pier rides were still fun. Def get an LA go card for the deals here. The ice cream at Scoops was the best thing but it's expensive- 7 and some change for one scoop! But I could barely finish it so I guess its worth it.

My teenagers were big Hannah Montana fans years ago so they wanted to visit the place where the final scene was filmed. The Ferris wheel was so much fun and the roller coaster was a great thrill! We had a nice lunch at the restaurant on the pier, and we even hungout on the beach for a few hours. Definitely worth a day trip here if you are in the area!!

All of the family thought this visit was a bust. We have teens and a 7 year old. While it was enjoyable to see and get a few iconic photos, it wasn‚Äôt the great pier amusement park we thought it would be. Personally I was expecting a bit more old-timey and classic. It was more modern carnival. Prices were high, which I wholly expected for this venue. It‚Äôs a crowded place (we were there on a Wednesday morning). Parking was easy and cheap (I think we paid $2 for two hours). I am glad we stopped to experience the pier, get a few photos, ride a coaster on the pier, and check it off the must-visit-list. We were there less than two hours.
For me it's a must see in Los Angeles. Very very crowded though (we were there in July). Lots of places to grab a snack - nice
Is it really necessary that everything on this pier has to be so filthy?I guess it‚Äôs better that the alternative of washing it all into an already dirty ocean because of this pier.

I wish there was more to do there but it‚Äôs really great to see it. It‚Äôs special in its own way and really great. Lots of food and shops. A ton of people. Like crazy amount but still great. Its a quick stop nothing long. But we just walked around the beach after.
If lots of people in confined spaces is your thing, then this is the place for you. Just people everywhere. Too many for my liking. Neat to just say that's somewhere you've been.

Santa Monica pier was everything that we had imagined it to be. We visited it on our last night of our whirlwind tour of the USA. We had a go on the big wheel then our last meal with our fellow travelers at the Bubba Gump restaurant . With this being the official end to Route 66 it was a fitting end tour our Journey across the USA.

column2: Trip to Santa Monica Beach and Pier
column3: We had a blast at the beach and pier in Santa Monica! The beach is big and clean and the water was wonderful! That night we went back to the pier, bought wristbands and stayed until closing time! This was the best day!
This is a very crowded place but worth the experience. Very interesting people around and beautiful beach views.
With all the tackiness of a busy pier. So you know what you are getting when you head down. No surprise really busy at the weekend and pricey given the captive audience.
I highly recommend to visit the pier during the week...otherwise you will be stuck on the pier without doing anything...
Nice place to slide back in time - still a miracle with the big ferrywheel over the ocean - opens at 11am for fun

As my partner and I had just finished driving Route 66 after 3 weeks this was the 'finishing post' for us.We were there 4th July weekend so very busy, but there was a great family atmosphere, everyone enjoying themselves.We had our photos taken by the guy in the Route 66 booth and claimed our certificate.

column2: Nice atmosphere on a sunny fah
column3: Well worth a visit for a great atmosphere on a sun shining day. We love the walk from Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier and will always come here during a visit to LA. Definitely the nicer part of the city.
Was a little bit underwhelmed with the whole Santa Monica Pier. But saying that I‚Äôm glad we went and experienced it. Would still recommend for others to go and experience it too

Can't think of a reason not to visit Santa Monica Pier if you're in the area. It's free! I think the weather is just about always lovely! Best people watching! Random acts-music, magic, art. Fun snacks. Easy breezy vibe!

Came her to watch the sunset, managed to catch it while on the wheel. Absolutely magical! The fair itself isn‚Äôt anything spectacular but the views and the whole atmosphere of the place is wonderful, an absolute must see
We visited Sabra Monica pier at the sunset and I fell in the love with the place. Amazing view of the sea and the colours in the sky. Like in the movies ;)

Went here at the end of our Route66 trip and were seriously underwhelmed. A nothing special fairground, some shops and several places to eat. Kind of expected a bit more. The best part was the views of the Pacific and along the beaches.

I visited here with my husband and son late afternoon/ early evening. We sat on the pier which was so lovely, looking over the beach, watching the sunset as live jazz was being played in the background. I felt so at peace there.We loved that there was a park right next to the pier. Our son enjoyed this! We also managed to find a fantastic restaurant just opposite.Overall, lovely evening.

Extremely busy pier. Seemed like a huge tourist attraction, was really nice to see. Lots of sellers by the side selling art, drinks, food, plenty of food stalls around the place. Plenty of restaurants to eat at. Bubba Gump restaurant was excellent. There is also a little carnival üé° rollercoaster was $10 p/p they let us ride it twice which was great because it was over quick enough! Nice to see, but wouldn‚Äôt run back in a hurry due to the fact it was so busy.

We enjoyed our day at the Pier during the heat wave. Great way to beat the heat as it was 15 degrees cooler here than at our hotel near Universal. We spent the day on the beach and rented umbrellas and chairs in the pier (which made our day!). We had great burgers and ice cream for lunch as well.

We went during the week so hopefully less crowd. Get their early (we arrived about 1 pm) to park right on the pier. The cost was about $15 all day. The beach was great and the water warm. Fun to walk along the shoreline and under the pier. When the sun went down there are a few restaurants within walking distance. We grabbed a bite to eat and then afterward took a walk along the pier at night. The sights and sounds plus the all the people were great. If your looking for a day and night adventure this is one good place. The only bad part is the traffic. Have patience! Enjoy!!
Spent some time here recently with my family. It is always busy no matter when you come. We arrived early in the evening and caught the sunset which is great from this location.

column2: Fun place to spend an afternoon
column3: We spent an afternoon here shopping, riding the rides, and enjoying the views. We were there on a Sunday in July so it was very, very crowded but it was still fun. Be sure to walk thru the park leading up to the pier for some amazing views!

column2: It's Great, If You Don't Expect TOO Much!
column3: For what it is, the Pier is GREAT! It's a kitsch, crowded, touristy state fair surrounded on three sides by the ocean! Personally, I love it, but I know not to expect too much from it. The rides are fairly expensive unless you get a wristband and do a bunch of them, but I still jump on the Ferris Wheel every time, just because it is fun (especially with all the lights at night). The people-watching is great, the food is fun, and who doesn't like standing out at the edge of a pier and pretending you are Leonardo DiCapricio in Titanic: "I am the King of the World!" Read up a little on Historic Route 66, and it is a bit poignant to stand on the spot where it once started/ended. Plus the street musicians and performers give you plenty of live entertainment.You can rent scooters or bikes if you want to range farther down the beach
What a perfect place to spend the day! We rented electric scooters to get around, inexpensive and worth every penny. Loved the views, the entertainment and people watching!

I am a admirer of this beach and simply love this area of Los Angeles. There is so much positivity , hustle bustle around this place. The true spirit of California is seen here. The pier is very enjoyable for all age groups.
Vibrant fun place to visit. Lots to see on the pier. Plenty of street performers (Magicians etc)Great views of the beach

Nice place for friends and family, many games and attractions you can do for the weekend and the beach is there as well. The parking lot is big and you don‚Äôt have to walk that much to get to the pier.
Loved it here! The beach was lovely and it was great to see muscle beach! The scenery is so accurate to the game ‚ÄòGrand Theft Auto V‚Äô!!!
Nice place for kids and family! Enjoy the beach and the pacific park. Lots of little shops. Nice place to spend the day!

column2: Nice views of the beach, carnival feel
column3: We walked to the pier from our hotel, which was just down the beach along the bike and walking path. The pier has all the typical carnival-type amenities, ice cream, funnel cakes, Bubba Gump Shrimp, rides, souvenirs and the famous ferris wheel. Fun stroll for a family of four (two teens). Worth a look-see!

column2: Worth a Quick Trip - Better from Distance
column3: Hard to go to Santa Monica without at least walking through the Pier. It is a worthwhile walk-through but not worth more than a hour or so. Very cramped and, at times, bordering on seedy. However, not dissimilar to many amusement park-like attractions. The view of the pier and the Ferris wheel from a distance is spectacular. Closer-up, less so.

Wow! Wonderful LA Icon. Crowded to the hilt and kitchy as hell, but a true LA experience. I fondly remember a quieter boardwalk from my youth but those days are over. This pier is bustling with young families. Families dressed to impress along with families crusted and dripping wet sand as they cap off their day at the beach. Bubba Gump, Japadog, various small food vendors and the occassional churro and fresh fruit vendors hawking their goods to a buying crowd. Halfway down the pier you have iconic Pacific Park which is a small amusement park for the whole family. Follow the pier to the finale which is a Mexican Restaurant and a fishing area. The pier is a must see if you are a tourist or just an Angeleno poking around their beloved town.
Really wasn‚Äôt much to see, just a pier with a few rides, arcade and some stalls. Great photo opportunity though
just walked around here. didn't eat here but it's very beautiful. we parked on the peir. it's reasonably priced but after 2pm.it was named packed

column2: Fun place full of history and a great view!!
column3: Not to be missed! Classic rides with great ocean view. Lots of shops and eateries. The classic Route 66 sign is a great place for a photo here!!

Family of 5 stopped here on a Saturday, lots of people coming & going at all times. Parked 3 blocks away & walked down to pier. Food, Vendors, & Rides plus great view on both side of beach with Historic Route 66 sign.

Drove 2 hours from San Clemente to get there, the parking lot was almost full and the pier was packed with people going back and forth; plenty of shops and places to eat, the view is amazing and the feeling to see the waves smashing the pillars is awesome; the perfect place to visit if you are in California.
We went just to walk the pier. The beach was really crowded. It was neat to see the view from the Pier. Ate at the Mexican restaurant at the end which was good.

I‚Äôve been here a few times, most recently with a friend from out of town. It is always packed, but that‚Äôs part of the charm. It was hot as heck the day we went , so always being sunscreen and an umbrella if you are going in the heat of the day. I haven‚Äôt had a chance to go to any of the restaurants, but I did go on the carousel on a previous trip and it is fun. The street artists are always good fun. We walked all the way to the end of the pier this time, and it was oddly *not* crowded, and a street musician was playing some chill music in the background. It was nice. I do plan to come back to the amusement park in the future for sure.

Great day overall. We were 5 boys on a family trip ages 70, 39, 17, 12 and 9. There was something for everyone. Beaches were nice with great waves for boogie boarding. Kids enjoyed the arcade and going for a bike ride along the beachside bike route. Did a leisurely bike ride to Venice beach and back followed by ice cream. I recommend getting to the beach around 10 or earlier if you want a good spot.

column2: A Must do in Santa Monica
column3: Full of atmosphere and views of beach, this is an excellent spot to walk around and get into the holiday spirit. Whilst we didn't eat at any of the venues on the pier, we just soaked up the atmosphere and excitement of the fun fair.

We came here as we were staying close by in LA. and thought we should come out and visit. It was pretty average. Looks like an old fair ground on a pier....I couldn‚Äôt see why people would come here although the beach was lovely.
Not a great beach if you go by the hype, but good for a casual evening trip with friends and family. Too much crowded by the way. Parking is mess.

We are not a Disney Family, but we did like this place. It is the iconic end of Route 66. An America Landmark and a place if you are in LA that you have to visit to really enjoy the Beach Culture, epic views and people watching. If you have kids the will be totally into the amusement part, food and fun.

column2: Do much to do and eat!!!!!!
column3: Santa Monica Pier is such a fun place. From places to eat, shop for clothes or just sitting at Bubba Gumps' and enjoying the view, fabulous!!!!!
If you are in need of the sea breeze and a spot of fun and food, then the Santa Monica Pier is a great place to stop! Plenty to see and do for the whole family!

I have been here on at least two separate occasions while visiting CA. The most recent time was insanely crowded. Maybe because it was during the peak of summer? It was way too crowded for my taste, but it's definitely on the "must do" list if you've never been before. I would say plan to come during a slower tourist season maybe.They have people selling water out of coolers for $1, which is nice if you didn't bring any water with you. Very hot and sunny in the summer so make sure to wear sunscreen and maybe a hat and sunnies! Enjoy!
Santa Monica Pier is a must see location. Beautiful views and so many things to do. Highly recommend visiting the pier. Get there early as parking fills up fast!
Just stopped short, didn‚Äôt enjoy the amusement park. Lots of people but looks like a great fun. Food and beverages are expensive.

There are plenty of amenities including a funfair on the pier. We found drinks, games and giftshops as well as karaoke, all with the magnificent beach backdrop. This adds to the range of attractions on offer at Santa Monica.
I‚Äôve visited LA many times. The iconic Santa Monica Pier is fun for all. Rides, shopping, restaurants, fishing, entertainment. It‚Äôs absolutely a great place to go for a day!
Lots of people. Lots of street performers. Talented folks. Glad to say I‚Äôve been there. It probly appeals to the younger crowd

column2: Overrated, crowded and smells like alcohol and ...
column3: Heard so much about this place. Went at night. Found it to be dirty, over-crowded, and highlighting the city's ever-growing and depressing homelessness crisis.This place is no different than a state fair with the addition of untalented street performers. Lots of unfortunate homeless folks around, some passed out on the beach. Very depressing. While these poor individuals suffer, the rest of us rack up credit card debt on useless paraphernalia (things that will end up in the dumpster or a garage sale) and food that neither tastes good, nor is it worth the price tag.LA, in general, is a disappointment. I visited here as a child a couple of decades ago and had so many fond memories. Now its a big dump that stinks of excrement and glorifies the unrealistic dreams of so many disillusioned individuals who come here with high hopes and end up passed out, homeless, on the beach.If you do decide to visit the pier, free 90 minute parking is available 8 min walk away in a large parking lot on Broadway and 2nd St.
Such a lovely pier with lots to see and do it has street entertainers a few rides and some lovely handcrafted pieces for sale. Totally worth a visit if you are in the area.

A really unique place to visit. Food, shopping, street entertainers, carnival/amusement rides. We did not eat during our visit so I cannot comment on the food but the ambience was great! We enjoyed a couple of songs from a band called Liliac. Once we were finished enjoying the pier we ventured into the surrounding downtown Santa Monica area. Lots to do & see! You will need to pay for parking but it‚Äôs not too pricey for a few hours of fun. Definitely worth it!
Second most visited besides Disneyland! Insane chaos. So many people. Typical tacky souvenir places and carnival typeAtmosphere. Worth seeing but if you miss it , not missing much.

My advice? Go! What a great day we had. I think you should buy the unlimited ride tickets for the kids and then enjoy them enjoying themselves!Roller Coaster was a big hit along with the Dragon ride.Parked at the main lot for $15 all day. Close to the pier and the park.Ferris Wheel is awesome and it is powered by Solar. Pretty cool.You can enjoy the pier, go to the beach, have dinner at some nice places and not spend a fortune.

Well we had to come and say we saw. Parking was very challenging and the crowd was large. There were street performers and vendors along the worn beaten wooden boardwalk. Being from Florida it is hard to compare the beaches anywhere else but this definitely is quintessential LA! If I had younger kids I am sure they would have loved the playland area on the pier.

column2: Great spot even if it is a bit touristy
column3: This is one of those touristy places that you have to visit while in Southern California. There is so much to do and see. It was a nice break on our vacation to spend the afternoon at the beach and on the pier.

The scale of the pier is the first thing that strikes you as you wander down. There are lots of vendors and musicians along the length of it. There is an old school fair.It‚Äôs iconic but actually a worthwhile diversion.

column2: "Monica, Don't Leave Me" Please! "Santa Monica Stay With Me"
column3: At the end of the day, the family and I, just did not want to leave the Pier. We had a wonderful time enjoying rides over and over again. Mingling with the talented music entertainers and photo paint artists. The pizzas was expensive and small, (one size for all), but good. When leaving, I thought of (The Fast and the Furious) (MONICA,,,,,,)!!!!!!
We started out day with trapeze lessons for our teenage daughters. An afternoon at the beach, and spent the evening riding rides and playing games. The pier made for a day of family fun!

column2: A Los Angeles classic pier by the ocean!
column3: If you go to LA you MUST go to the Santa Monica Pier! We learned the interesting history of the wooden wharf is the place to be, with its eateries, shops, high-tech arcade, roller coaster, giant Ferris wheel and other rides, famous 1922 indoor Looff Hippodrome Carousel which is a National Historic Landmark, and had fantastic views of the bay and the mountains. There is also a landmark sign that says you made it to the end of Historic Route 66. We didn't get to go in the evening but others say the sunset is beautiful from there as well as the Pier all lit up also. The views of the ocean and Santa Monica beach next to the pier are so worth the visit also.

I enjoyed the Santa Monica Pier, the view is stunning! You get amusement park, beach, and mountain views! It‚Äôs not far from the ‚ÄúBarbie House‚Äù (pink/purple beach house) and it‚Äôs within walking distance from Third Street Promenade‚Äôs shops and eateries.

We went there on a weekday evening and was quite amazed to see the crowd even in the middle of the week. It was a nice experience to see how folks were going about with their activities, be it a roller coaster ride, fishing on the pier, getting tan, enjoying a snack or even splashing some water....It was quite a difference from DTLA we were seeing for the whole week.

We enjoyed this pier the most on the west coast. We rented bikes from Venice beach and ride to Santa Monica. It‚Äôs an awesome ride, and the pier is great. Super views, great restaurants and attractions. It‚Äôs also the end (or start) of Route 66

Supr busy during the summer break when we visited, ikon landmark foe the area on the large big beach and of course end of route 66.Lota of trinket type shops and booths, cafe, restaurants etc. And of course lots of people. I must do check out of this old girl and stand out landmark your can't miss.
We had promised the kids and our nephew and nieces to take them to the Santa Monica pier with its Pacific park amusement. They loved it!

column2: Fun afternoon for a family outing
column3: Visited with wife and two kids and family had a blast. Tons of great fair food options as well as rides and game for kids. Must do if you are in Santa Monica.
Minimum wait time in the lines. Great food options available on the go & great sir down restaurants!
The pier is very active with families, beach-goers, musicians, and revelers. There is plenty to do and experience on the pier.

Yes the pier is packed with people but it really is a fun time. All the shops and places to eat and performers on the pier were great. They do have public washrooms as well. It‚Äôs a fun thing to do during the day or in the evening. Great to walk around the whole area including checking out muscle beach! Rent a bike or a scooter and travel up and down the paths!

Too crowded, too many people with religious fervor and unofficial food vendors blocking the flow of people, the street performers were not impressive, rides looked sketchy. Probably worth walking to the end once, I am glad we did, but really unimpressive overall.

It was super crowded and not with great people. Beautiful sunset but I think you can have that sunset from much less crowded and cleaner places that are easier to get to and are less populated. We went to check it off our tourist list but could have better spent the time somewhere else.

column2: Don't know what all the fuss is about
column3: Average pier and beaches.... restaurant choices also not the greatest if you are planning on coming here to see it, it really is a non event
It's a perfect tourist trap and no trip to SoCal is complete without a visit. A perfect spot to have lunch and people watch.

column2: A Fun Place to Spend some Time
column3: Ideal place to spend a couple hours on a sunny day or at night. There are some great opportunities for pictures here, along with good food, as well as cool places like Downtown Santa Monica and Venice Beach just within walking distance.

Visiting this famous landmark is a must when in Santa Monica, it has a variety of funfair rides, stalls and eating spots we had a look round before descending the steps onto Santa Monica state beach were you can walk a few miles to Venice .
An experience that you shouldn't miss. It's like an old-time amusement park. Rides, tourist shops, restaurants, and great views of the ocean.
The place is nice but significantly smaller from the pictures or what you would expect. Attractions a little over priced
Spent a few hours here and loved every minute. There is so much to see and do, especially with the little theme park, great spot for lunch and then some fun

column2: Can‚Äôt Go Wrong at the Pier
column3: Whether you have $150 to spend for your family‚Äôs fun day or zero, you can all be enterained at the Pier. For free, you have the view, the beach, the ocean, the great people-watching, street performers, an acrobat school, & the joyous squeal of kids on the carrousel. For just a few bucks, you &/or your kids can ride the legendary old carrousel or y‚Äôall can check out the awesome Heal the Bay Aquarium under the carrousel, or enjoy a ride on the iconic Ferris Wheel. And for about the price of 1 adult admission to Disneyland, a family of four can get unlimited ride wristbands for Pacific Park Amusement Park at the Pier.Food options range from cheap-yet-overpriced amusement park junk food and lower-priced burger n‚Äô beer-type joints to mid-range Mexican and seafood places all the way to high-end establishments like The Lobster. Plus some eateries adjacent to the Pier, including the first (I believe) Hot Dog on a Stick (it may not be the actual original stand but it is near the original stand‚Äôs location).Overall, with the usually wonderfully pleasant weather, it‚Äôs an affordable way to spend a fun afternoon.

Came to the famous Santa Monica Pier on a solo visit from Ontario Canada‚Äîfirst time to California. It‚Äôs a really neat place, very eclectic. The earlier you go the less people around which makes it easier to navigate. FYI like most tourist attractions things are over priced‚Äîforgot my sunscreen and it was $15. It was a neat experience and great photo opportunities there as well along the walkway prior. And 3rd Street Promenade is a very short walk, a place worth seeing too.
Santa Monica pier is kind of a must to visit when in LA. But it is crowded and there's really not that much to see. Okay shops and okay places to eat. Nothing more and nothing less.

column2: A vibrant and fun place to visit
column3: This is a busy tourist place but well worth the visit. I enjoyed the stroll along the pier to the end where we watched yachts sail past and people catching fish. There was so much happening everywhere, lots of laughter and vibrant colours.

Myself and my family visited Santa Monica Pier one evening. Well worth a visit if you are in the area. A lot of the locals doing their activities(singing, magic) on the pier. Amusements and arcades were very busy and lots to do. Make sure you bring plenty of money.
You should see it - fun, lots of tourists and all the expected chaos that brings - but a must see for sure.
We didn‚Äôt spend long just a couple of hours.But it was warm and friendly, lots of happiness from all the kids having fun. It was vibrant full of bustle with plenty to do.Well worth a wander.
The pier is a beautiful place. we ate lunch at Marisol's nice Mexican restaurant. the pier had lots on entertainment and shopping as well as the amusement park
Yes, i have seen Santa Monica pier in movies, but thats all. It is expensive and out of date. We took sone pictures and used maybe 20 mintes there.
It is like visiting Brighton Pier in California, some interesting characters to add to the entertainment value. It is iconic and part of our bucket list.
This is a classic site to see when in Santa Monica but it's really a carnival, yet a nice view from the pier
Extremely crowded. Can check this off the list of iconic places and feel I never have to go back again.
This is an iconic pier at the end of Route 66 and well worth a visit. Loved the oldPhotos at the end of the pier showcasing the pier‚Äôs history.

Going to the beach should be a must for everyone and going to Santa Monica Pier is a good option. The iconic boardwalk is a must see and yes there are lots of people but it is a part of the atmosphere. We went to see and to go swimming in the waves and ended the day by eating on the pier watching day becoming night.
Walked the pier and the beach, typical touristy shops but a great walk and fun people watching. I need to bring my fishing rod next time!

You can‚Äôt visit Santa Monica and not visit The Pier, would you go to Paris and avoid The Eiffel Tower? Or Rome and not see The Vatican? Well then you have to slip on some comfortable shoes and walk the planks. These planks that are a century old and have had thousands of happy visitors and locals alike spending time riding the rides, eating fun foods and even dancing the night away under the stars. Yes it‚Äôs a typical tourist trap with overpriced souvenirs, junk food, and peddlers of photos, knick- knacks and portraits, but how many folk can say they where at the end of the famed Route 66, even better have their photo taken with the historic sign. Santa Monica Pier is fun, iconic and a must if your lucky enough to make it to L.A.
This was a nice place to walk around and spend a few hours. The pier is nice, great views, the usual tourist stuff, good people watching, the beach is clean. Worth a visit one time while in the area.

column2: The End of Route 66. Muscle Beach. On the California must do once list. Beautiful Old carousel.
column3: Beach is clean, pier has overpriced souvenir shops, nice for a quick visit, but check out the old wooden 100+ year old Carousel inside the Hippodrome. I think what i like best about here was after having visited Chicago and finding the start of Route 66, and then driving some of it after camping in the Grand Canyon, to find an End of the trail sign for the end of route 66!

column2: Nice place to spend with friends / family
column3: I liked the Santa Monica Pier. It is a good place to spend a few hours there with friends or family. We had ice cream there, which is always good! It also offers nice views of the beach and coastline, and a romantic place during sunsets.

Really nice view.That is all i got from here.For photographers - this is the best point for sunset.However hard to swim or whatever inside the ocean - interesting smell and massive bugs in the sand. Yaaak...üòÅüòÅüòÅ
Plenty to see do and eat down this pier. The good/big rides are $10us the others range from $5-$8us. Perhaps stay away after 8pm with young kids as it gets quite ‚Äúcolourful‚Äù at night!
Nothing special rides are ok nice to say you have been but wouldn‚Äôt return as busy busy with nothing really to see

Spent an hour on the pier as part of the LA Tour, headed straight for the Mexican restaurant at the end with the yellow roof, to drink several margaritas. It was a hot day and for a Monday the beach was packed but still a pleasure to walk down the pier

column2: The town is nicer than the pier
column3: We felt the town was much nicer than the pier area, it has nice shops and is kept well! It‚Äôs a refreshing break from Hollywood area!!

column2: Still a nice place to take family and friends
column3: There are a variety of activities to keep everyone happy. The place has been around for awhile but it has been well maintained. You can enjoy the scenery and people watch for free or blow your whole paycheck. It's up to you.

Walked about 1/2mile along promenade to pier. $14 dollars parking. Promenade is run down and dilapidated. Closer parking is available. Busy with visitors but generally happy, relaxed atmosphere. Funfair with stalls and rides. A little expensive in my view but seemed popular but no long queues. Fast food stalls and drinks. Buskers and portrait artists.Nice view from pier.Sandy beach. 200y to sea.
Didn't ride the rides, some looked a little sketchy. Walked the pier. The arcade was our highlight. Classic games, plus new. Skee-ball, coin games, etc. Great views. Great beach!

column2: Must see when in the area
column3: This attraction is very popular with tourists and locals. Offering a great view of Santa Monica Bay - extending from Palos Verdes in the South to Point Dume in the north. Food restaurants, music, souvenirs, even a ferris wheel.
This place is lovely with an amazing atmosphereJust like you see in the movies, it felt very special.Lots of places around to eat a nice place to enjoy the afternoon
It was very many people but a place I am happy that we visited. The pier offers food and many other things. It was a pretty nice too park on the pier :)
Cool place lots of stuff to do you know it's a tourist trap but who cares you go for the experience . The environment feels more friendly than Coney Island.
Nice boardwalk and good for families but it‚Äôs very touristy and you‚Äôll need to deal with the crowds. If you are looking for a Californian Beach experience head to Malibu.
Had a fun day in Santa Monica while visiting LA. We strolled the pier, then rented bikes and rode them to Venice beach. Very easy, short ride along the boardwalk. Great day! Highly recommend!

As a local, we frequent the pier. Our son loves the arcade, the amusement park and we make it a fun family night. I definitely recommend a visit, but only if you are visiting in the off-season (NOT THE SUMMER). We recently went in July and were so disappointed. Not only had our favorite little Italian restaurant been replaced by a seaside cafe, but it was super crowded and filled with several homeless. Granted it was a record-breaking hot day, but not what we expected. Avoid it in the summer months, but otherwise a very fun place to see.

column2: Nice pier, something to do for everyone
column3: We enjoyed the pier, rides were fun, a little pricy. Cost $20 for 2 of us to ride the Ferris wheel. Went on a Wednesday, and it was packed. Little scooters all over to ride, that was fun as well.
This place is a must if you're around LA. The ocean breeze is fantastic and relaxing. Also a great place for photos. You can buy some souvenirs and have lunch there as well. Beatiful!
This is worth a stop just for watching the people, vendors, street performers, etc. Parking can be a bit difficult though.

column2: Fun destitation and a must see
column3: The pier was one of those must see places. It is a iconic location often seen in tv shows and movies. It is a very happening place with much to do whether it is the rides, the restaurants or the museums. A lot of fun and awesome sunsets.

Went on July 4, so probably more crowded than usual. There are a few rides, but very expensive, so took a pass on them. Lots of food vendors and carnival games. Not a peaceful, relaxing place. Big beach area all around.Still fun to walk around.
We went to the Santa Monica Pier just to have fun and hang out for a bit but it turned out to be a great insta pic spot. Totally didn't expect such great pictures (also due to the perfect weather).

column2: Back to see the changes in last two years
column3: It‚Äôs two years ago since we were last here and a few things had changed but much the same.As we drove down from Getty Center we had to get parking, we use large public parking area to the right of pier. This is an all day price which was $15 and there seemed to be plenty parking. There is parking on the pier it‚Äôs self and I think this is on an hourly rate not sure of the price.There are plenty of places to eat from very cheap to mid range pricing.The thing you will not see on the pier are Sea Gulls, plenty of Pidgins but no gulls.Great place for kids or adults.Again an other must visit.
It‚Äôs worth visiting, during our first visit to LA we planned an afternoon trip in the month of July. It was bright sunny day but it was chilly.There is ample parking space, work repeat visit.
We love going toThe Santa Monica Pier and watching the people go by and just watching the ocean. Such a great place to visit, people watch and grab a bite to eat.

column2: Pop by have a wallk around
column3: Since you're here might as well pop by . famous spot for a wallk . bit overcrouded if you ask me . too many people trying to sell you junk . bit of a rip off prices . just go for wallk ignore all else

Its a fun place, very popular, great views and some nice restaurants, plenty of places to buy a t-shirt and the rides are fun. Its crazy busy on the weekends, we were there on a Sunday and a Monday, Sunday was Fathers Day and it was a zoo but Monday was pleasure. We walked from the pier to Venice beach and back. Its a fantastic walk with lots of shops, cafes, places to eat, muscle beach. Do yourself a favor and visit on a week day if you can.
A rwally cool place and a must see. But we went there in the weekend and it was very crowdy. A lot of fun to see,

The iconic Santa Monica Pier is lovely to visit before the crowds arrive. If you prefer to stay away from the crowds, go north along the beach towards Palisades Park. We did some biking there which was awesome!Frankly, I prefer exploring the shops along 3rd Promenade which is just a stone‚Äôs throw away from the pier.

The pier carousel is a must visit, so quaint and antique with an old style soda stall next to it. The general pier itself is lovely with some fairground rides and stalls a coffee shop, food stalls, burger bar and a couple of souvenir shops

column2: Pretty much as expected from movies
column3: The pier is buzzing with activity and my kids enjoyed the rides as the roller coaster and wheel offered great views over the beach and pier. The beach close to the pier is not the cleanest so better to go further down to the Pailsades area. Food vendors pricey and very average.

Bay watch beach big but not clean beach , urchins and homeless people thron the area , we were warned by our tour guide to stay in group since these people try to snatch from tourist their bags. Water on the floor and beach was not clear and clean...

Kids really enjoy going here and experiencing all the rides. Its best to go when it's not crowded like it is on the weekends in the summer. Great location near Third Street Pronenade and the Tree Beach which has fantastic views. The pier is a great experience atleast once.

column2: Nice place for a walk a to watch people
column3: Nice place for a walk. We did not visit the shops nor the restaurant as they look pretty touristic. Interesting people and artists to watch.
Nice to meet and go with family, alone or with a partner. Biggest tourist spot in Santa Monica. There is no way to let go, but there is nothing super interesting. As children they love.

My husband and I visited our son‚Äôs family last weekend. Our 18 year-old accompanied us and our son has a 4 year-old. There were plenty of exciting things to see, hear, and eat. A lovely breeze refreshed us from the unusually hot weekend, rare for Santa Monica, we‚Äôre told. Overall, it was a wonderful time!

You get some absolutely beautiful views from the pier and have easy access down to the beach. There is a mini amusement park with rides to keep kids and adults entertained. Please of food options, but not the healthiest choices. The games in the amusement park area are so expensive it's offensive, so beware.All in all, it can be a part of a pretty fun family day!

column2: Can‚Äôt Miss Views & End of the Famous Rt 66
column3: We love coming to the pier and bring all our family & friends here. There is a marker/sign for the end of Route 66. Check calendar in the summer for concerts on the pier.
the pier is probably best to visit late afternoon-evening time. It was extremely busy when we visited sunday mid-day, so we couldn't really enjoy the pier fully

I was very excited to go to this iconic pier but was kinda let down. It was very crowded and we had to pay $14 to park in the lot near the pier. The carnival on the pier is jammed together and $6-10 per ride. The food places had long waits and pricy snacks. Overall it was just ok...but I saw it. Wouldn‚Äôt go out of my way again to see it.

column2: One of the nicest beach areas in LA
column3: You won't be dissapointed by visiting this place, there are so many things to do there, a lot of activities and sightseeings...and it's famous because it marks the ending point of route 66. Also the beach area is amazing, the sand is soft, pleasentful...If you are looking for a place to chill, this is it!

column2: View of Ocean & Beach, End of Route 66 sign. Otherwise kind of overrated!
column3: Visited with other young adults and no kids. We took a quick walk down the pier, looked out at the water for a bit and stopped at one of the restaurants for a drink. It was certainly crowded and we were glad to say we had visited, but probably won't go a second time.
Have a nice morning walk, pre-rush. good for getting Zoltar future or just a coffee on the Pier. If you come during the day expect thousands with you.
Weather was amazingWater is cold cause of oceanPrices are okAmazing plaze for relax and restRate 5 star
If you are hungry while on the Pier, I would recommend Pier Burger! Burger is wonderful and the hotdog is very yummy!

I visited the Santa Monica pier after swimming at the world famous Baywatch beach so we were looking for some warm food and drinks after the swimming. We had no problem finding both of these and a whole lot else at the Santa Monica Pier. The place is always buzzing with activity you have to wonder howcome nobody seems to have to work at this place. Anyhow we spend some time trying a few rides which my 8 year old enjoyed tremendously and we walked the length of the pier enjoying all that it has to offer. There was also a private party being held at the pier which added to the vibey feel of the place! Look not everything is beautiful and there is a seedier side to the place that you should look out for and be aware off, but on teh whole it is still a family friendly place to visit imho.

Ransom of success it's overcrowded parking is quite difficult but at sunset it's a great place to walk around it worth the effortUnfortunately like almost every where in US it's loaded with disgusting fast food

You won't get out of there without stopping here. Its well worth it, and a big hit with kids. From here you can walk over to Muscle beach area to take a quick look, and hang on the beach probably on Santa Monica side if you like. The pier was once called POP before a fire burned it all down and it was rebuilt in better quality.

We were tourists, expecting a tourist trap, and this place was too much even with that mindset. People were everywhere, so crowded. We did it just to say we did it, but got out of there pretty quickly.

column2: Old fashioned sense of fun. Worth a walk
column3: It‚Äôs still like the set of a 1960s movie a little faded but still a great walk out to the sea. Great views. Better off dining back on the main strip better food available at lower prices!
It was neat to see. Not a whole lot to do. The view was a bit hazy but pretty. I'm sure it may be busier at other times of the year.

There was a lot to do here, and since it was so crowded it's hard to get in to do anything. The view of the ocean is beautiful, so that in and of itself is worth the visit. The pier is crowded but is full of restaurants, stalls selling souvenirs and snacks as well as activities. It would be a fun family outing.
Such a great experience.wondeful place.................family friendly very very safe.lots good food and fun amusements and golden shopping.........
Perfect roller coaster for my 5 year olds first time! The Ferris wheel has the best views. Can‚Äôt wait to go back with the kids!

Located at the west end of Route 66. Wanted to see at least once. It‚Äôs busy, crowded, plenty to see and do. Has an amusement park at end, at night it is lit up and looks cool. Several food options available. It was nice to see, only spent a few hours out there, probably don‚Äôt need to go back for awhile.
The pier at santa monica is full of activities and amusement park rides plus good restaurants. The beach is nice and cold.

I don‚Äôt know if this place was crowded because it was July or super that day but what a let down. Just gross and stinky. Traffic is awful. It reeked of urine. A lot of homeless people and drug addicts. I saw addicts vomiting in public. Nothing against homeless people because hard times can happen to anyone but it‚Äôs just sad to see a tourist attraction riddled with junkies.
Just like from movies. Vibrant, crowded, colorful gem on the Santa Monica Beach. Plan your time wisely as traveling there might be a pain in the a...

Looked forward to this most of all on our west coast trip. Enjoyed the walk down the boardwalk and managed to catch a picture perfect sunset that evening.Things I didn‚Äôt like, watched a guy catch a shark and then kill it there on the pier. Once again the parking in So-Cal takes forever and the crowds hamper the entry and exit from the pier. Thought about the Ferris wheel ride but it was so over priced that I decided against it.I would suggest going there late enough in the day that you can catch the sunset. It really is one of the great places to do that.Probably my most favorite memory of our west coast trip so far.

column2: How could you not visit if in LA?
column3: An iconic place to visit and made the trip on Independence Day eve and despite the large crowd, it was well worth it. Take in the vista, enjoy the roller coaster, have an ice cream and take a photo and tick it off the list. There‚Äôs also lots of good places to eat on the pier and nearby.

column2: Fantastic atmosphere, great buskers and lovely breeze off the water
column3: Lively place to visit, buskers were amazing, lots of people but it didn‚Äôt seem overly crowded. Man fishing off the end of the pier and a great walk after travelling. Had lunch at Bubba Gump Shrimp which was fun.

My family‚Äôs been to this pier several times before but each time is still so refreshingly entertaining! We love the many variety of baskers, the food esp fennel cake, the relaxing walk and just the atmosphere is fun!
We have all seen the pics of this California pier, a must see, although very touristy, recommend hiring bikes to cycle to Venice Beach
We always enjoy our trip to the pier. The rides and games are cute, and it‚Äôs a fun evening or daytime activity for the family. Definitely a must-do while in Santa Monica.
We spent the day biking along the path which was fun as expected however beware of small children and pedestrians wondering onto the bike lanes during busy periods.

It‚Äôs where Ryan Gosling walked along in La La Land and had a waltz with a lady before her husband gave him daggers.It was larger than I expected, a fairground on it at the beginning with a Ferris wheel.Great atmosphere and people fishing, selling donuts, candy floss, drinks, etc.A must visit.

column2: Kids enjoy a couple of hours of fun
column3: Nothing special but nice if you are with kidsand plan time on Beach and Venice anyway. Parking available closeby.

We enjoyed sunset and liked the ambience during summer time.. There are lot of food vendors, snacks and a many games for kids around the ferris wheel.. there are also plenty of souvenir shops around .. We stayed until dark.

column2: Santa Monica Pier... great ocean views, good food and amazing amateur performances!
column3: I have been to this pier, several times before in the past. But this trip was fun, because I had more time to spend at it, by myself. The Russian girl with the violin was wonderful, the man who played guitar, wearing a full headed Don Trump mask... That was my favorite... So funny... especially singing in Spanish. The only part that disappointed me was that I bought a chili cheese dog, but the vending booth did notbother supplying plastic utensils!

column2: Fun and a must visit (2hrs is good)
column3: Fun. Quintessential pier setting w hotdogs and pizza and musicians and street acts and little rides. Fun!
It was more kids but it was still fun to walk around and people watch and great views of the shoreline when your way out on the pier

Went there today and it‚Äôs just beautiful! Crowds were in full force due to holiday but still manageable. It‚Äôs pricey to park- $14 and rides can be up to $10 a piece. Wrist bands were I believe $30. But the history of this pier and the views make it worth the stop. Beware of traffic getting here- 1 mile took 1 hour for us. Food on pier is plentiful but pricey
Loved Santa Monica! It‚Äôs beautiful, clean and lively. Next time we come to LA we will definitely stay here. The pier is retro fun, the beach is beautiful and the bike path is great. Awesome time!
The views and attractions, great combo for a sunny morning!The rollercoaster is ok but not really trhilling. Anyway, it is super worth it and it‚Äôs a must see in LA!

Were advised to give this place a miss on weekends as it‚Äôs too crowded. Glad we listened. We went on a Monday and whilst busy - not unpleasant. The pier is a nice stroll out with views of water.The stalls selling souvenirs on the pier are far more expensive than the ones down tvs main strip at Venice beach. My daughter bought the same jumper she looked at on the pier for half the price down the strip at Venice beach.The amusement park has a great atmosphere but if you want ‚Äòscary‚Äô rides you won‚Äôt find them there. But a great thing to experience.Hired bikes from down on the bike path (Shutters) and then rode to Venice beach and back. The electric scooters for hire are very cheap but we didn‚Äôt have time to give them a go but they appeared very popular

column2: A fleeting visit - not long enough
column3: This place bubbles with activity. It‚Äôs full of vibe, and freshness, and enveloped by warm Pacific Ocean breezes! A def must for those visiting California!

column2: Pier Amusements and great view of the coastline
column3: Santa Monica had a great array of restaurants - pier has an amusement park and loads of souvenir sellers and artistic performers.There is also an historic merry go round that is working and worth a look.

I grow up seeing this place in many films, now I Finally got the. Chance to come here myself, a truly iconic landmark with beautiful Scenery. You ain‚Äôt seen California and till you come here, good vibes nice people family amusement park what more can you ask for, beach on both side shops in the middle Venice beach 15 mins walk away. Also Opposite the pier is a outside Chess club and outside gym love this place

We visited here at the end of our epic Route 66 road trip. We got here early so it was reasonably quiet - that meant we able to get a parking spot on the pier itself.As an end point (albeit not 100% the true original end point!) of a 2,400 mile journey on the mother road, this place seems just perfect.

I had a layover flight of 9 hrs, so I decided to visit Santa Monica (one of my pending stops in LA). From the LAX airport is a free shuttle that dropp you off next to the bus station of the Santa Monica bus (the tkt is $1.50 one way -- take cash and singles, the machine do not give change). The trip by bus is around 40 min.I enjoyed a nice sunday, sunny , people on the beach, was really cool! Good for a nice walked , have lunch and enjoy an ice cream.

We only had about an hour due to being on a bus tour. The place is busy but well worth the effort to go there. There a number of eateries and of course there are the rides. It‚Äôs a must do when visiting LA.

column2: Iconic place. Well worth a visit
column3: Visited with family. Nice place known from movies and an important part of LA for all. Easy to recognize and easy to like.
