Diffirent small businesses and local artists colored the day without impressing to much. Parked at Venice beach and walked to the pier. Approximately 2 kms. Pavement for walking only, separated bike lines. You can even park at the pier. Plenty of parking space on weekdays. Close by the pier if the pier is full. The parking is affordable (9-18$ pr day)

This pier is amazing eclectic. The musical pier entertainment always impresses me. LAviolin artist left us in awe. The rides are a little better than a roaming carnival but $10 each for the bigger ones. For some reason there were more than I could imagine homeless type people that weren‚Äôt physically aggressive but when you come in their vicinity their stench was more than words could describe and quite an impression one would not want for this establishment. The Dippin‚Äô Dots and funnel cake hit the spot and left us happy despite all else. Enjoy.
We were here in December 2017 and January 2018. On our second visit the crowds were ridiculous! Very touristy but if you're staying nearby it's worth going for a look as it's such an iconic spot.

Perhaps it‚Äôs because we had just visited Destin Fl but we were all surprised at how dirty the beach was- my son described it as looking like mud. We had a unique expedience but wouldn‚Äôt go back. The prices for rides was crazy, $5 per ride. The beach was crowded and dirty. We were surprised at the number of people trying to sell mangos, toys and other items on the beach.
A bit overcrowded on weekends, but is an attraction in itself. Cheerful atmosphere, any kind of performers, nice places to eat, it's all amazing!!!! Don't miss it!!!!

Family of four (two 16 yr old boys) visited the pier as part of a tour. It was fun / interesting seeing all the odd folk on the pier. An hour is enough but would have tried the seafood restaurant if we hadn‚Äôt been on such a tight timeline.

My favourite part of visiting Los Angeles was going to Santa Monica Pier. It is a lovely (and clean) beach and it is a much nicer experience than Venice Beach. There is a great midway with lots of cute shops and restaurants. Lots of families are around so it feels very safe. The view is very nice and it is the perfect place to relax. There is cheap parking nearby at the mall and there are a ton of great stores for the whole family. I could spend an entire day here.
I was here on a Friday night so it was pretty crowded, but saw a nice sunset and lots of entertainers. Several places to eat and lots of people watching and nice views of the ocean and the shoreline

column2: The Western Terminus Of The Famous Route 66
column3: I like the Santa Monica Pier even though it's crowded. There is a good deal of shops and activities. Little hard to get on to the pier from the parking lot. It's crazy to think this is where Route 66 ended. It's also not far from the western end of I-10. Definitely a good place to visit and see the Pacific Ocean.

column2: Has to be done - but maybe just once/twice!
column3: This pier is iconic but until I got there I had no idea it was the 'finish line' for Route 66!In common with many US piers, you can drive onto it and park and on the day we visited, there were a number of people photographing their cars having completed their Route.Personally, the fun-fair/kiss-me-quick/tacky souvenir shop element doesn't appeal - although I did go up on the Ferris wheel for the view. Walking right to the end, you get a fabulous view of the beaches and coastline and there was a guy at the very end playing a saxophone - fabulous sounds on a hot sunny day.Part way down there was a kart giving you the opportunity to choose from a huge range of fruit to make your own (huge) fresh fruit pot, which was lovely.In the evening, go down to the beach to get that iconic photo of the sunset behind the pier.It all 'has' to be done but it's not somewhere I would want to visit time and time again - been there, done that.
The Santa Monica Pier is a fun thing to do. It can get very buy here. Great to people watching. Lots of street artists.

We visited on a Sunday afternoon. The weather was fantastic so the pier and beach area was especially crowded. We found parking in a garage a few blocks away and walked down to the pier. My two teenage boys weren‚Äôt interested in riding the amusements as we had been to Magic Mountain the day before. You can walk the entire length of the pier at no cost. There are vendors, performers, and some restaurants along the route. Very scenic and tourists should enjoy the sights. Glad we visited the landmark.
It is a pier, with a very small number of amusement and tourist aimed shops and food stalls.It was good to visit the famed carousel.

This is must visit for families with small kids. My teenagers were just interested in the electric scootys called Bird and Line(must do). Lot of activities for small kids and awesome food and gaming arcades. Be ready to spend as everything is expensive. You must swim at Venice Beach in case you really want to as the water is not too warm.
Schools out so it was super busy on a Sunday night. We enjoyed it the people watching.I don‚Äôt think we need to go back. Good exercise going up the ramps.
Go here on a weekend it‚Äôs crazy it‚Äôs fun it‚Äôs absolutely humming. Great to people watching and have a fun evening

When in Santa Monica, one feels that it is a requirement to check out the view from the Pier. It is in so many movies and tv shows, we just felt the need to do it! Our Lyft driver dropped us off on the boardwalk. Note that there is a hill down from the famous sign to the pier itself. If you walk down, remember that you have to walk back up! Not terrible, but something I wish I had known!There is access to the beach from both sides of the pier. As you walk down the pier to the end, there are a bunch of street performers, artists (all independent but seem to miraculously be selling the same things), along with restaurants, arcade games, and amusement rides. Cool view from the end. Had to sneak in between folks who were taking selfies and those who were fishing!We were there in the late afternoon before dinner time. It was quite busy. Glad we went to say we went, but I don't know if I have the desire to return.

If you‚Äôre willing to spot any celebrities, this is a must for you, this is one of the most famous attractions in Santa Monica! It‚Äôs close to Third Street Promenade which is a very nice shopping street! And the rides here are fun and they are not very crowded. After all rides there are many restaurants like Bubba Gump or Pier Burgers. Family recommended!

Nice place to stroll down and look out over the beach and ocean. Lots of shops selling gidts/t shirts. Few street performers. Also the Pacific Park rides and arcade. Didn't go on any but they looked quite traditional but brightly coloured.Worth dropping in on if you're in the area/at the beach for the day but not necessarily worth a trip across the city for

The main attraction is the rollercoaster, and while it is incredibly tame, it does provide some spectacular views of the beaches either side of the pier. There are a variety of small rides for children, and loads of carnival games.At night , the big wheel lights up, and looks spectacular, as does the rest of the boardwalk.
If you ever visit Los Angeles, CA. You cannot miss to visit the Santa Monica Pier. Very nice and peaceful place. I used the visit to meditate meanwhile I admired the sunset.Highly recommended

We when early in the morning and was not very busy, which was great. But by late morning started to get very busy, crowded and found ourselves moving out of the often.When not busy very nice walk, could with being cleaned more regularly.

column2: Over priced, dirty and full of forceful sales people
column3: I took a quick visit to Santa Monica Pier with my wife, 10 yr old son and 7 yr old daughter while visiting L.A.The first issue was with local parking. We pulled into a parking lot at 2pm to be met by the attendant. $35 for the day I'm told. Um, no I don't think so. So we drove to 2 st to parking structure 6. Parking Structure 61431 2nd St, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA3 hrs for $3.10. Normal rates for a multi storey parking lot. Don't pay the rip off rates, use the city parking.The pier it's self was dirty, and very over priced. $10 per person for a ride on the ferris wheel and $15 per person for the small roller coaster.Beware of the food sellers who are vert pushy. Not a great experience, and one not to be repeated anytime soon

This was an interesting and fun place to walk through! You can park and go in, or you can walk across the bridge to get here. There are lots of rides available and lots of food that you can get as well. Many people do performing in this area, such as singing and other music. Go and enjoy yourself!
The pier has a different vibe during off-hours.Give yourself a chance to check out both sunrise and sunsets

No thanks. The two above words is all I would be to know I‚Äôm am not interested in returning. They also let preachers yell about Jesus through microphones and others handing out religious pamphlets. It was annoying, overcrowded, the beach is super dirty and gross. It‚Äôs a nope for me and my family.

column2: Family Fun at the end of Old Route 66
column3: We had a nice evening at the Pier, but we went the night before a local parade was scheduled, and the crowds were off-putting. A second visit there later in the week to pick up a souvenir was quieter. The amusement area is relatively small, but looked like it would be fun for families with younger children. Other than that, it's what you would expect from an amusement pier. It's an historical landmark, marking the very end of Old Route 66, which I found interesting.

column2: Worth it for a stroll, park in the garages two blocks east
column3: Our family visited there twice in two days, and each time was different. There are various street performers touting their magic, music, or art. We dined at a deli which was overpriced, but the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier was our choice the next day and delicious! The Marisol also employs a professional photographer who takes pics of your party. My father purchased a picture for us, not sure how much they cost. Don't waste your money on the midway, although I have been on the ferris wheel in years past and enjoyed the views. We just told our boys that we'd be going to Universal Studios so the little Pacific Park amusement center would be underwhelming. The boardwalk/beach area was very crowded on the Friday afternoon, you have to watch out for all the Lime/Bird scooter riders and the pedestrians, as well as bicyclists. Also beware the numerous homeless people sleeping under the trees on the beach near the bathrooms.

A fun little spot to spend a couple of hours. Rides on the boardwalk are expensive. $10 for 2 - 30 second rides on the rollercoaster. As a first time visitor to the area, glad we spent a little bit of time there.

column2: Just knowing it's considered the best was exiting.
column3: I could see why it's famous,I guess on the West Coast anyway,has coolarray of restaurants at beginning and a Bubba Gumps,plus some tshirt and gift vendors before entrance.Fair prices for ride tickets,ice cream,etc.considering the name of this pier.
We had a great day here. Weather was great. People we encountered were friendly. A must see when in the area.

Beautiful beach and pier !! Would highly recommend hiring electric scooters to travel along the beach front - if you download the app ‚Äòbird‚Äô you can pick them up by using the map as it shows their locations and charge - scan the barcode and you‚Äôre good to use as much as you want ! Really well priced and great way to travel !!

Everything is filthy and it‚Äôs so crowded. All the time. Homeless people everywhere. I wouldnt eat at any restaurants on the pier. I wouldn‚Äôt go on any of the rides- I‚Äôd head over to disney or universal for rides. The water looks pretty but the beach right next to the pier is packed. Need less people and cleaner stores and restaurants.
Definitely a beautiful view! You can also shop at stores nearby and eat on the pier at a variety of restaurants.

column2: Pier Pressure of the Best KInd
column3: Good old fashioned fair atmosphere. Rides, games and food. All the parts of a fair permanently at the Santa Monica pier. I like to visit Bubba Gump. Great place to relax or have lots of fun. Go on the rides or go all the way to the end and just relax. HIghly recommend on a trip to LA.

We went there because it was the end of Rt 66- which we had been traveling down- and had a sign showing "Route 66: The End of the Trail." There were lots of rides, eateries, musicians and things on the pier, plus it's just fun to watch the beach from the pier. It's a great place to go. And would recommend Bubba Gumps Shrimp House on the pier as a great place to eat.

Everyone told us we had to go to Santa Monica Pier so we headed out early to experience the pier and beachfront It was way too crowded for our taste and we hurried back to ‚Äúour beach‚Äù Venus! Less people same beautiful sand and air! But don‚Äôt get me wrong the Santa Monica Pier and shops were very nice.
Nothing so special, this place seems like Coney Island in New York area everything is focused on tourists.
Felt like a sardine, way busy on a Wednesday evening. The surface is rough watch your step. I wasted ice cream but not soft serve. Soft was everywhere but I did not find traditional ice cream :(
Family friendly a little tack, carnival games and crowd. We had fun. It can get a little cool at night. Felt very safe.

We spent the day here with our kids. Surfed, rode bikes and hung out on the pier with our dog. Weather was good and not to crowded. One of the street performers was playing that song and dancing (if you've seen him he's hard to forget)

Sorry but there are better places to spend your time. I did not enjoy the chaos of Santa Monica pier at all. This was my second visit and I only went reluctantly because friends I was traveling with had never seen it. Now they can say been there, done that and they have no desire to go back either. Also... hold on to your wallet!
The pier has lots of paid and free activities giving you lot's of choice in how you experience the pier. The crowds can become quite large during peak seasons but don't let that turn you away.

I personally love the vibe and atmosphere of the pier in SM. I have tons of friends that live in the area and we never get tired of the gorgeous sunset on the beach or the cool people working out off to the side.There are tons of things to do and you can spend an entire day just venturing around from store to store.
This is a place for the family. There are rides, good food, entertainment, bikes, and scooters. I would recommend this beach.
Loved Santa Monica Pier, old school fun and lots of entertainment for the whole family. The beach is beautiful, fine soft sand and close to amenities.
We had a blast at Santa Monica pier and beach we went on the rides ate funnel cake and pizza. They had lots of things to do.

I'm a central coast beach girl so I was not a fan of this LA beach. A day at the beach should be fun and relaxing, however the amount of vendors constantly bugging me was very annoying. Repeatedly coming by shouting and hawking was incredibly obnoxious. The most fun part was the arcade with some old school classics like air hockey. Parking lot fills up and a bus blocked the exit. It's $15 to park. At least I can say I saw it.
A thrill to be so close to the Pacific! Great music and a seal came to to pier! Relaxing and beautiful!

column2: Just to hang around a couple of hours
column3: Its not a big deal. Really its just a boardwalk with a few restaurants and a couple of souvenir shops. If the day is nice, is worth to walk around and see the seals in the ocean playing.

Love this place! It gives a nice view to the ocean. You can sit at the end of the pier and enjoy the view. It also offer plenty of restaurants where you can eat fresh seafood. It‚Äôs fun for all ages.
On our trip to California we visited the Santa Monica pier twice. Both right about sunset awesome. The only negative is the parking. But it is a must do if your in Southern California.

We stopped at the Santa Monica Pier to take photos mid morning on a Sunday. We found a parking place on the street not too far away, but wish we would have known that there is parking directly on the beach by the pier (you could not see it from the street). The Pier seemed hard do walk on because the planks were not even/flat so bring good footwear. A few nice little shops and rides. Great photo opportunity with the rides and end of route 66 sign, too. Overall a nice stop and liked that it wasn't so busy.

When you are one time in Santa Monica, you should also visit the Pier. At the end you have a view over the ocean and during night time you have interesting light effects. The place is very touristic. A lot of expenisve Souvenier shops and food places (Restaurants and Fast Food). You also can visit the park of joy. Worth to see is also the End of Route 66 sign.
This was a nice little tour. Not a place that you could spend the whole day, but, easy a couple hours. After touring the pier, we went down and spent some time on the beach.

We visited thinking we might see something a little different at this famous fair, unfortunately it is the same old carnival games, junk food and questionably safe looking rides as every other seaside fair we've seen in Britain. Everything was very overpriced and after a short walk to the end of the pier we left.It was fun to see the unusual light display on the Ferris wheel at night but overall not our scene.

column2: A Cheesy Amusement Park at the Pier
column3: Standard ride attractions here, ferris wheel roller coaster, etc. Other rides you would expect to find at a traveling amusement park, the pop up kind you see in your neighborhood for a few days.The surrounding area is populated with tourists and lots of homeless people and druggies. Park near the Promenade, walk to the pier and take pictures for free. I wouldn't recommend coming here for tourists, there are better piers to visit without the traffic and homeless. I recommend Hermosa Beach Pier and Malibu Pier.

Parking was $14 if you park in the lot right next to the pier. We also go there a little early so the rides weren't going and the aquarium didn't open until 2pm. That might be skewing my review a little and it didn't help that it was a very cold and cloudy day. The beach was nice to play on but otherwise there was just a lot of touristy shops and kiosks to shop at. Not much for us to do with a 2 year old.

The new thing you will see is that there are electric scooters everywhere. You can rent them by using your phone. I tried with an Ipad and it didn't work. You must have a driver's license and a credit card to open an account. The beauty is that when you are done with it you just leave it where you are. You don't have to return it to a special location. I rented a bike from Sea Mist rentals. Everything went smoothly. You must pay cash. Rode all along the board walk. Best to go early to avoid the crowds.
It was everything you expected it to be. Super crowded but fun. Reminded me of John Belushi in 1942 the movie where their plane took off from the pier
View from pier was beautiful, ocean and hills. Wide range of entertainers from musicians to snake handling, fun place to people watch. Crowded and very hot, wear sunscreen.

column2: nice to walk down the Pier
column3: Enjoyed a walk along the pier, lots of eateries and rides for the kids to do. Nice breeze off the water.

We visited the pier on a Sunday and it was overly crowded. Not much to see or do unless you‚Äôre planning a meal at one of the restaurants or going on the few rides. Rides are very expensive at $5 to $10 a ride unless you buy the unlimited pass for $33. Not many rides so I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs really worth it. We had the Go Card so that was a really good deal and the way to go

column2: Relax on the pier & people watch
column3: Walked from our Marina del Ray accommodation to the Santa Monica Pier and had lunch at the Mexican restaurant Mariasol at the end of the pier and spent time people watching and taking in the views of the beach and the water. Crowds weren‚Äôt too bad when we were there which was during lunch and a quite warm day.

Santa Monica pier is a nice place to visit. Lots of food places and activities going on around the area. Very much like Venice beach you get quite a range of personalities in the area. We visited during the day, not sure how it is at night.

column2: A little bit of movie history with a lot more
column3: First let's start with the positives , once you get there it's very beautiful , with lots to see and do l. It's very much like in the movies. Walking distance to Muscle Beach,Venice Beach and some other spots worth checking out along the boardwalk. Festive atmosphere which is suitable for the whole family. Beautiful in summer! The negatives are few but something that LA all over could very easily resolve.......traffic! Traffic in and around Los Angeles is like being in a bad their world country! Parking to get to the beach is an experience on its own and even if you want to only go for an hour or 2, parking by the Pier is $14 for a car which feels like extortion as there is no turning back once in a queue. In saying that if are in the area the history with all the movies and shows filmed in and around LA Santa Monica Pier is worth getting to!

column2: Good Old Fashion Carnival. Worth doing once for fun!!
column3: It‚Äôs touristy AND that‚Äôs half the fun. Reminds me of being a kid and going to carnival. Enjoy the ferris wheel at least. Great views and can be romantic. Can see Santa Monica to Malibu and to Ranch Palos Verdes. If your lucky, you can see whales and porpoises depending on time of year. Do it!!

Sunday afternoon visit - pretty much a ‚Äúchecked it off the list‚Äù visit. It was a bit too crowded with humanity for us....but very interesting. Better than Venice beachfront for sure. Our older teens enjoyed it. We paid for a great parking spot in Shore Hotel parking deck - right in the middle of the action. Btw that looks like a great hotel. Bought some souvenirs and took pictures under the end of Route 66 sign.

column2: Interesting with great view of the Pacific
column3: Really wanted to see the beach while I was in Cali and it was recommended that I go to the pier. Great landmark, with street vendors, street performers, and a great view of the beach. Definitely a must-see if in the area. Shopping and food near by
Plenty of things to do on the pier like watch the magic show, fishing, games,etc. Good time but you‚Äôll see some freaky people along the way. Not that bad of a scene.

column2: Carousel, ferris wheel, people watching, views, and food...
column3: The restored ferris wheel is a piece of history that was lovingly restored. Take a ride. It's for kids of all ages, even those in their 70s. There is a range of food, from cart with churros, and cotton candy to Andy Gumps for fish, and new fine dining upstairs at the restaurant on the end of the pier. Views of Malibu and Palos Verdes along with vendors hawking, hats, t-shirts and arcades. It is a busy place on the weekend, so go during the week if possible. Parking is below the pier or in the city parking lots a few blocks away.
A lively area with lots going on but very crowded and dirty on a hot day. Worth a quick look but don‚Äôt spend too much time here.

We visited the pier while on family vacation and there was something for everyone to enjoy. First off you can enjoy lunch from several different places on the pier while looking out over the Pacific Ocean or stroll through the multiple shops for necessities or souvenirs. The arcade and fair type rides were also fun for the kids. It‚Äôs a great place and a must see in Santa Monica.
We came to Santa Monica just to visit the pier, and were slightly disappointed. It has an amusement park and some restaurants, but that‚Äôs about it. Go to have been there..
Blackpool prom in the sun.However much much better lolQuite busy, vendors selling everything lolPlus this is where the famous Route 66 ends :-(I'd go back again plus they've a Japadog vendor!

I came here with my husband and 17 year old son. We all really enjoyed it! A great atmosphere, pretty views, and a nice time was had by all. Plenty of things to see, vendors to shop, and places to eat. I would recommend this!
This place is still a great place to take kids. It was really busy when we went, but there is ample parking OFF the pier on the beach.

column2: Awesome place for rides, fun rides & food.
column3: Was staying in Venice Beach but came here with my nieces. Fun place for rides, fun & food. You can also take a walk on the pier to Venice Beach & Muscle Beach. The 3rd st promenade is also walking distance. And you can find some nice restaurants off the pier as well. Follow me on IG: @sara_lv731 for more pics & videos
Worth seeing but nothing amazing. There is a very nice beach and I enjoyed walking the board walk not as busy as the pier.
Great atmosphere in this touristic attraction in Santa Monica. Lots of small shops and some nice spots for a light meal. Recommended!!

column2: A lovely way to spend a couple of hours
column3: Visited as a family of 3 (2 adults one very teen 12 year old).We are from the uk and it was our first time to LA.Sat Nav (GPS) took us easily to the Pier from our hotel in universal city and we readily found parking ($15 all day - right next to the beach) although the sat nav appeared to want us to drive on to what looked like the actual entrance to the Pier. We later discovered that you could do that but at the time we weren‚Äôt convinced!The pier offers the usual pier type entertainment - souvenirs , buskers, artists, arcade games, refreshments and fair ground rides.My husband and daughter went on the Ferris wheel üé° (¬£7.50 each), the views from the top were great as visibility was good that day.We walked to the end of the pier where locals were fishing.It was memorial weekend when we visited and we had thought it might have been busier than it was. We had a very relaxing and enjoyable time there.

We have visited the pier a lot over the years, and it tends to change very little. Probably one of the most recognisable piers in the world, it never sleeps. It is always busy, and can be a very interesting place to spend time as there are so many different people and characters. The pier to us, looks tired, something we think it has done for a while, but with everything from, restaurants, fun park attractions, souvenir sellers, to buskers, you won't be disappointed. You can park on the pier for a fee, which is quite reasonable.Go to the end, sit on the stairs and watch the people and sea, it's relaxing.

What can I say except that the people watching from this location is superb! The street performers were awesome and the atmosphere was a happy one. We had an amazing time strolling the pier (which is free to walk on) and taking in all the sights and sounds. I will definitely visit again!

We visited for the day, whilst we were based in West Hollywood. It was a great day at the beach that has a classic Cal feel. The pier is a real gem and is buzzing, with stalls and entertainment. We walked along to Venice Beach, about 2 miles, and it was an easy walk. Be careful of the sun as the beach is an open expanse, with a lovely breeze the day we were there, typical high sunburn weather.We wandered around the town after the pier and the beach and there is a great shopping mall near the pier that has some easy food places in if you don‚Äôt want to Q at one of the sea view restaurants.

The view of the pier at twilight from the beach walk was enticing enough for us to venture out to the pier.It was pumping but you get the impression it‚Äôs like that every night.Lots of people, colour, sounds and sensations make for quite an experience.Felt safe despite the crowd and vendors on beach front and bridge.Plenty of great photo opportunities to make lasting memories.
Recommend bike riding up to Venice Beach. Busy place but cool as. Good shopping on 3rd street at Bloomingdales
I think this is one thing you have to do if you visit LA. This pier is constantly seen in movies and TV shows and lives up to it's screen reputation. Fun, not fancy, full beach experience!
Lots of shops and an amusement park in the very iconic Santa Monica area. The Pier is famous and doesn't disappoint. We felt safe and it was a fun family experience.

column2: So many great picture opportunities! Fun place to visit!
column3: Although it was very crowded on a Tuesday afternoon when we visited, it was well worth it! There is parking right by the pier for $14. Follow the signs! Since there are no other fees to pay unless you want to, I felt this was a good deal as it is literally to the side of the pier. Very convenient! Yes, there are people trying to sell you items on the pier in addition to actual vendors that pay to sell on the pier, but we weren't bothered by it as it's all part of the experience, The rides were for littler ones, maybe 8 and under so my teen boys did not ride them. There are vendor trucks and few restaurants on the pier, but so many more to the sides of the pier off the beach and just over the pier bridge. I loved that you could sit on the beach and get great pics of the pier from it. We put our feet in the water, but there were many people swimming and boarding ...but it was cold water as expected! There are so may great pic opportunities everywhere you go here.We walked around, sat on the beach for 45 mins and enjoyed lunch outside. Were were here for about 2 1/2 hrs. I could have stayed longer!I hope the details in my review were helpful.
Santa Monica pier is great for kids and family.A lot of rides and games to entertain them. We got some ice cream on the pier and sat watching the sunset over the pier.

Santa Monica Pier is a "must-visit" when you're in the area. There is a ferris wheel, carousel, trapeeze, places to eat, things to buy and great views. You can walk up to 3rd street from it and find lovely shopping. Go early to get parking. You can rent scooters, bicycles etec to ride the boardwalk - even to go Venice from here.

column2: Must do if you are a tourist
column3: Of course you need to do the trip if you are in LA but join it up with Venice beachUnless you want to spend the day at the beach sun bathing or going for a swim , you can knock it over in 2 hours add extra time if you want lunch, plenty of course

column2: All you expect it to be.
column3: We wanted to at least see the Santa Monica Pier once, so that is where we headed to. It what one can expect it to be:) Lots of, loads of, tourists like us. All walking around having fun sitting in the sun. Taking a drink selfies, grabbing a bite and just do nothing. We did not feel like going to the beach here so we only walked to the end of the pier and left after a while. Oter thing to check of our bucket list!
Really fun place to see and the surrounding areas. You should rent a bike and go all the way to Venice beach from here
Great spot to walk and shoot some photos. Disappointed that merry go round was not operational but the Ferris wheel was perfect for shooting sunset photos. Go early, it gets very crowded at night.

Have heard and seen so much about the Santa Monica pier that we had to say we had been there. So on that note... I wouldn't go back. Very crowded and over-rated. A tourist trap. The street entertainment was all about getting your money and providing very little show. Takes a long time to get there if traveling from other areas and the parking is terrible. Pretty view of the ocean but you can find that in a less dense area.

The Pier is one of the ‚Äúmust see‚Äù things in the area. I feel it‚Äôs a bit overrated. Of course it is nice to see and you get a nice view of the beach and the sea. If you travel by car, there is a lot of traffic close to the pier, so make sure you have enough time. Close to the pier there is nothing special to see except for the beach.

We had a great time at the pier! We actually parked in a parking lot payed $25, and walked over 20 minutes. I suggest parking at the parking lot right at the beach. Love the entertainment and great restaurants!

column2: An Interesting Look Back in Time
column3: Great place to see a different life style. Rides, arcades, street performers, and even people fishing. Was lucky enough to see a seal looking for food. Worth a couple of hours!

We visited Santa Monica Pier through the above and would recommend them thoroughly. What a fantastic place with everything possible available to eat, drink or souvenirs to buy on the pier itself, so really a leisurely walk is all that‚Äôs needed. Of course Santa Monica itself is beautiful.

If you visit Santa Monica, you have to go here ...It's a very nice place for everyone. You can see Venice Beach in all its splendor. You have a beautiful view of the city, but also of the ocean ....Lots of attractions... A great place !

column2: Don't miss this during your LA Trip!
column3: Don't miss this during your LA Trip! Santa Monica Pier is a great upbeat place with beach, shopping, restaurants, theme park. You name it, they have it!

Beach or pier. Large clean beach. I headed for the pier / Lots to see and do on a lovely warm day. You can go on the rides, people watch, get food or a drink. Easy to get round if you are disabled . Had a couple of hours here on a coach holiday

column2: One of the best sunsets I‚Äôve ever seen
column3: A nice attraction park, with good restaurants, the end of the iconic Route 66, and a breathtaking sunset. All in one place
Four of us visited this pier- lots of attractions; great location; good street entertainment. However everything seemed expensive but that‚Äôs the way it is I guess!

We drove the Route 66 and got to the end of trail in Santa Monica Pier. It was aroynd 6pm and it was totally packed. The pier activities were quirky! There were amusement arcades, fair rides, shops, photo ops, even had a 3 DJ 'Hush' disco!

After all the reviews I read and all the hype, I was expecting something amazing. This pier is overcrowded with tourists, expensive food stalls/shops and is really outdated! I thought it would be romantic, but its really not, but then again I guess I am spoil with the most amazing beaches in South Africa that absolutely outclass Santa Monica!
Maybe I was expeting something especial but it's something you can see but not a "must to do".It's a pitty because the location is nice, but it looks old and unsafe..
Iconic location, the end of Route 66!Ate at Bubba Gumps on the pool pier, watched the ferris wheel and visited some of the shops.
Very busy on the weekend and lots of street vendors to take in. We rode the ferris wheel for $10 each. The views were nice. The staff does a nice job.

Fun to visit the pier and beach, but be prepared for crazy traffic,tons of people on the pier and beach and have time set aside to try and find parking. The parking situation is insane. We drove around for almost an hour trying to find a spot in one of the little parking g lots. There is a charge to park too. It's not much, but be prepared for that too. The pier was hard to get around on with all of the people, but still fun to look around. It was worth going to once, but won't be back any time soon.

Been here so many times and I never fail to come back for more. I'll will admit that I don't always come for the concessions. There's just something about a nice long stroll that brings peace to my heart and then sometimes I'll enjoy my favorite brew and take everything in. I don't know about everyone and what everyone likes. All I know is that it's nice to visit and everyone young and old can enjoy it.

column2: Love it! Go as soon as stores opens, not earlier
column3: Start your visit as soon as stores opens.. I came too soon and only see fisherman‚Äôs. Kind of sad vibe.. As was taking too long to get running, I prefer to rent a bike downstairs and go by seaside until Venice Beach. Back after couple hours, the Pier looks like other different place, full of people and movement. Liked a lot.

column2: Good place to take a walk or bicycle ride to on Saturday Morning
column3: Rode a bike from my Doubletree hotel in Marina Del Rey up the beach and back. You can lock the bike on the pier. Stop at Ben and Jerry's on the way back. Be careful transiting the heavy street traffic around the MDR harbor before you reach the bike trail.Enjoy
This p[lace is a must for all the people visiting Venice and Santa Monica. Take a few (3) hours to enjoy and experience all the attractions as wel as the good food in the restaurants...

column2: Tourist trap with all of the tourist trappings!
column3: There are so many other piers to go to. I guess this place is iconic, but really carnival like. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend eating there or staying too long either. Crowded, cheesy, your better off going up a few blocks to Santa Monica‚Äôs 3rd street promenade. Way more classy.
There are alternate routes to get there to avoid traffic on the interstate highway. Finding parking can be tricky. Lots of restaurants and souvenir shops. And of course the rides.
We went to the pier and the view over the beaches was nice, but not really a must be place - at least not for us.

The Santa Monica pier was rented out for a party so my family and I didn‚Äôt get to enjoy the rides...the whole point of the trip!!!! The food was nothing special, the only thing worth mentioning is the fruit man cart. Beware of hecklers: people handing out bracelets demanding donations.

Very nice place with clean beach and winderful market place , lot of shopping options with luxury aswell daily brands , clothing to footwear to cosmetics to cafes n resturants . It has it all ,really like that place , must visit in Los Angeles, USA
The pier is full of color, activity and life. It was fun to people watch, in addition to the beauty of the ocean. Lots of live music.

While in Los Angeles on vacation, my 2 teenagers and I spent several hours at the Pier of Santa Monica. The Sunshine and the waves were refreshing. The nearest parking lot is $14 all day. We parked at a parking garage a few blocks away at a fraction of $14. We didn't mind the walk.

First time in Los Angeles area so we wanted to experience the Ocean. Chose Santa Monica area and weren‚Äôt disappointed. Walked down to the pier just before sunset. Touristy, Street entertainers, amusement rides, plus the view and sounds of the ocean left us with broad smiles and great memories.

column2: It is an Iconic Must See
column3: Realistically, it overall isn't perfect, but it is such an iconic place to visit. I mean if you drive all the way here, you have to get out and step on the beach then walk down the pier to the end. It is the end of Route 66. The Ferris wheel is beautiful especially if you see it at sundown. It was a great experience and I enjoyed dinner at the restaurant at the end and watched the sun go down. Great pictures, fun, relaxing spot!

It's worth walking out to the end of the pier just to see the views of the coastline and some nice photo opportunities. There are also plenty of food outlets, souvenir shops and of course the amusement park for entertainment.

column2: It but tired but a must do
column3: She is a little tired now but really is a must do when you visit Santa Monica - a little on the drab side but the people watching is fantastic and the kids will love it - not much for us older folk to do here but enjoy the kids happiness and waste some cash.Must do

Got of a cruise ship and had some time to spend before heading to the airport . Relaxed in the sun by the beach. Ate nice food and admired the views of Santa Monica before hitting the road on my travels again.

Just walking to the end and back you'll see such interesting characters! It's usually always busy, so take your time and enjoy the experience.There are restaurants at each end, so plenty of options to choose from.

column2: ONE OF MUST SEE PLACES NEAR LA GREAT EXPERIENCE
column3: One of our must see stops in the area. It was a lot of fun. We went early on Sat. morning and we got close parking on street. Pier is truly magical. Just what you hear it is. Corny but its supposed to be. Ate hot dog at Japadog and it was great. We planned to ride ferris wheel and when we got there the park was closed for a private event CAN YOU IMAGINE HAVING THAT MUCH MONEY. Broke my heart not to get to ride this famous wheel. The pier is great fun. Recommend it to any of you.

column2: Great place for an afternoon outing.
column3: Loved the beach,the atmosphere, the people.Lots of ships, shops and food. All kinds of people great place to watch people. Musicians and a lot of unique things there. Highly recommend for a family outing. Easy access we had a person who needed handicap facilities and staff was very happy to accommodate. Lots of parking and places to sit and rest. It had everything! Highly recommend for young and old. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

column2: A must see for first time L.A. visit
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is one of L.A.'s top tourist attractions. You should check out the places under the pier also. The iconic Hotdog on a Stick or Big Dean's for a beer and great burgers.
Crowded with visitors but nice to see all races enjoying togther the place with peacful friendly interaction. Don't miss it

Anytime I travel to LA I plan an afternoon at the Santa Monica Pier. The atmosphere is fun, inviting and filled with local artist sharing their works and musicians playing their original tunes. Fishermen are almost always present dotted along the boardwalk as you enjoy the rides, dine on fun-fair-food, or enjoy the fine-end- dining found at the end of the pier. The perfect way to end your day? Stroll out to the end of the pier and take in a beautiful sunset sinking down below the horizon of the vast pacific ocean.
Lots of fun rides and attractions but not ad much for small children. But we had a great time anyway and the arcades are fun!!
If you are in Santa Monica, you must go to the pier. Take the stroll down the pier to the end and just watch people. Or enjoy one of the rides.. It is a must if you are in Santa Monica

This famous pier is located a few meters away from the Famous "Hotel California". What am I talking about? Remember the song Hotel California by the Eagles, the pier is close by. It sucks that they are changing the name of the hotel :(Anyway back to my Santa Monica pier review :) The pier has a small amusement park for children and adults, fast food restaurants and restrooms. Take a lovely walk out on the pier and enjoy the amazing view and cool breeze. Don't forget to take photos by the famous Route 66 sign post. There's free parking if you're driving for both sedans and mini buses.You cannot visit California and not go down to the pier. Ok, so I'm going to play the Hotel California song now. Enjoy :)
We felt like kids.....strolled though and enjoyed and ice cream and the scenery was fantastic. Highly recommend.

Santa M√¥nica beach and all beach area here is just wonderfull. Beautiful large beach, very clean , well served.And than of course the Santa Monica pier. Maybe you don‚Äôt like the attractions of the pier. Or you may find the restaurants too turistic. But it is a great stroll where always something happens.A nice landmark.
This was a great beach location with lots to do! The famous Muscle Beach is adjacent with lots of activity!

The Santa Monica Pier is a place you should visit when you are in the area. There just aren't a lot of places like this around. You won't likely be there long but it is worth the visit. There is no charge to get onto the pier and it is usually crowded. It is definitely family friendly.
A must visit spot if you are near by the Pier. You will find some souvenirs with good price and snacks.
If you‚Äôre in L.A. Then you have to go to the beach and if you‚Äôre at the beach you have to go to the pier at Santa Monica! It‚Äôs busy, fun, has lots to do and has great Ocean views. Enjoy.

column2: Always A Fun Time At The Pier
column3: I have been going to the Santa Monica Pier for many years. I always enjoy my time at the Pier. People watching at its best. The water is always beautiful to look at. You have food, rides and fun.
One of the must- see stops when visiting Southern California. Restaurants, shops, games, rides....something for everyone.

This was a great time for us. We found ample parking in Lot 4 South which was close enough to the pier to walk and enjoy the sights along the way and was $10 for the day. The ocean, shops, musicians, and artisans were fun to experience. The end of Route 66 brought us to the pier along with the ocean of course. We saw a sea lion and dolphins which was a treat. After purchasing t-shirts and eating lunch we headed to the ocean. The beach was not overly crowded and so we just sat and enjoyed the view. This would be a perfect family trip in my opinion.

The Ferris wheel offered an unexpectedly beautiful view over Santa Monica. It looks like a tiny attraction but you easily overlook the buildings along the coast for a beautiful 360 panoramic view of the entire coastal strip. There's a cost to this: ten dollars per person. Unless you have a valid Go LA Card, which offers unlimited rides for the entire amusement park, all day long Luckily I did. The pier itself wasn't that special.
Good to visit for tourist site seeing but we only spent 15 mins actually on the pierAfter a quick look around we hired electric bikes and rode down to Venice beach, now that was cool!

We went here on a Friday afternoon. It wasn‚Äôt overly crowded on the pier and we didn‚Äôt have to wait very long for anything. We rode the Ferris wheel for $10/pp. The ride actually lasted about 6-7 minutes which was longer than we expected. We had to park at the Wyndham hotel nearby for $20. What we liked about the day was seeing the sea lions off the end of the pier, seeing all of the interesting talent/ both good and mediocre, and the beautiful views of the water and hills. We didn‚Äôt eat here as we waited for Venice Beach and Abbot Kinney. The pier has a carnival feel but is quaint and fun. The Route 66 shop was cool just to look at and watching the fishermen off the pier was enjoyable with music playing in the background. There are lots of photo opportunities here and overall it was a fun way to spend a few hours. We wouldn‚Äôt likely return but families with younger kids would likely enjoy the rides and games. They do have a wristband that you can purchase for endless rides.
We stayed at Venice Beach and walked up to the pier. Wow, just fantastic. Beautiful beach and views. The carnival on the Pier was a buzz. I highly recommend a visit here.

Was surprised how many people were on the pier. It is a popular spot with plenty going on. A good place to go and just watch what is going on from dancers to singers performing on the pier. Lots of stalls and shops selling small goods and food, a lovely evening out.
Spent some time wandering around taking in the sights.We were here before summer when it was fairly quiet and during summer once it got busier. Enjoyed both. Has a good vibe to the place.
It was okay to just visit and go. Not a lot to see. I was expecting more but it‚Äôs a great place to come and relax.

Visited pier to complete our Route 66 trip. The pier and beach are fabulous, the only negative are the amount off homeless people that are about . There are street performers plying there trade with homeless sitting close to them with begging placards. I offered one some cookies but he refused.says it all

Very Popular spot. Kids can enjoy rides and amusements. The adults can rest or visit the small shops. Plenty of places to sit and relax and take in the views. Places to eat on the pier with a variety of street vendor selling churros etc. Restrooms are available.

column2: Super Fun! Plus one hidden spot
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is just pure fun. We took our family there and met another family. We ate lunch, let the kids ride a few rides, people watched. It was a great day. One tip: just buy parking. It‚Äôs impossible to find so save yourself the time and heartache.There is also a hidden old fashioned soda fountain. When you come down the main ramp, do a u-turn to the left. It‚Äôs in the old carousel building. They have killer milkshakes, malts, and real soda-pops.

column2: Worth a visit, lots to see
column3: The pier has a lot of activities as well as places to eat and drink. Well worth a look around. Also has fair rides and an arcade so plenty to do.
Nice place for entertainment, for a walk or just to relax offers a range of bars restaurants and shops

column2: Short trip while in downtown LA
column3: 30 min metro ride from downtown to get away from convention for a bit! Easy to use Metro that you get pass at any station and load with fare. Pier is always fun to walk around, can sit at beach or rent a bike or stroll along the path toward Venice beach not far away. Recommend you find the end of Route 66 sign and watch some local buskers. Seems like there are a few parking lots nearby if you have a rental.
Here you find the end to Route 66! Lots to do on the pier, so much fun! Carnival, beach access, food and more.
Very nice facility for friends and family to hangout anytime during the week. Well maintained and safe environment

The pier its self was quiet busy, yet you could easy take a look around and get a good look a things. Some entertainment on pier.Beach area also quiet busy.Not as clean as I would expect for this type of area. I wouldn't revisit this area.Although go a few streets back to the shopping area, this is very clean and a different atmosphere.

As we were staying in a hotel near LAX, we thought we would visit Santa Monica Pier as it wasn‚Äôt too far from our hotel and you can get there without having to get a an LA freeway.We weren‚Äôt too sure about parking so we ended up parking about 1 kilometer from the Pier (USD15 for parking).You can park right next to the pier - we found out later.The Pier was interesting, I guess we were expecting more, things looked a little run down and in need of some TLC.It was a nice day to visit and there were lots of people about. There were plenty of spots to get a drink or food and souvenirs.Back on land, there were some nice restaurants around and a very nice boutique shopping centre.Santa Monica Pier was ok, nothing to write home about though.
Lovely day and lots to do or just people watch on the beach. Few good rides and fun street entertainment. Took subway there and back. A must do on your list if visiting LA.
We took a uber to see the Santa Monica Pier. It was in a Saturday, so it was busy. Walked the pier, ate a little and walked the beach.

The pier!!! OMG. I love this place!! It is beautiful, entertaining, and inviting!! There is so much to do too! There are some rides on he pier, you can hang at the beach, or you can watch the sunset!! Also, they have bird scooters around here so you could park by the pier and ‚Äúscoot‚Äù to Venice in no time!! I HIGHLY recommend this place!!

After lunch and a stroll we visited the Santa Monica Pier with our 5 year old who couldn‚Äôt wait to have a go on the rides! Buying the wristbands for the little one is well worth it. If I remember correctly a child wristband was about $18. Lots of different rides and a great day out

We used the backdrop as a photo op this time, but we‚Äôve ventured onto the pier before. This is really a must-do attraction for Santa Monica, as it is very easy to access and you can stay for as little or as long as you want.

column2: Over crowded carnival. The view of the water was nice.
column3: We walked the pier to find a carnival rides and games. Nothing really special but the view is nice. Very crowded!!

column2: Good views, lots of activity, fun rides
column3: Overall, good experience, The views from the pier are good. The rides are fun, and can be done individually. Lot of good food options. Some good live music playing. Great way to spend an evening as a couple, or with family. Parking is a little expensive.
Great day out in Santa Monica beautiful pier with lots to do, places to eat and fair rides Also beautiful beaches miles and miles of sand.
The pier has food, shops, entertainment by local artists, and an amusement park. What more could you want?

The Santa Monica Pier is one of our go-to things in LA. We make it out twice per year to unwind. The people watching is one of the best parts. There are plenty of performers working for tips as well as little souvenir shops. We make it a point to eat at Bubba Gump's on the pier. The ferris wheel is $10 per person and well worth it. You get great views of the area. Probably the best view around. Parking is $14. I suggest pulling in to the parking lot and pulling away as far as possible from the pier. Park as close to Hwy 1 as possible to avoid congestion when leaving. People always look for the closest spot and if you leave late, it can be like trying to get out of the old Disneyland parking lot back in the day. Have a few $1 bills for the performers. Tip a $1 and they don't mind posing for a photo or taking one with you. If you ant to park on the pier it's self, get there at the crack of dawn.

column2: Cool Place but way to busy.
column3: Walking down the Pier was cool, the weather was nice, pier performers were funny. We visited one afternoon which was chill and again one evening which was crazy. Way too busy for a small area. Kinda of a mix between commercial and recreational.
The Santa Monica pier is interesting but definitely take a stroll down to Venice Beach and take in the scenery, including the people.

column2: Only go to tick it off your list
column3: It didn‚Äôt have the wow factor .. but go if you‚Äôre near by, the beach‚Äôs are huge we walked from the SM pier to Venice beach, (4.5k) there‚Äôs a great path and lots to see, markets, shops, entertainers.The pier itself has lots to offer. It was super packed and long line up to eat on the pier but loads of other places around to choose from.

column2: Great for walking or people watching
column3: We stayed close to the Pier and at night would walk around the Pier. The food is overpriced, but it's worth checking out!
The pier was very interesting with vendors, rides, entertainment and restaurants plus the walk way along the beach. It was also the end of Route 66. It was worth the stop!!

This is a very beautiful site! Lots of activities and food options for everyone! Please be careful of your belongings. A visitor from Europe had her newly purchased Tshirt stolen (in a plastic bag) while she was on the beach! My suggestion is to just ignore all the weird characters that hang out here!

The iconic pier was very disappointing. After an uncomfortable cycle along Venice Beach, I already had low expectations of the pier and I was proven correct. The pier is run down and filled with arcades and tacky souvenirs. The view is nice and sun down, but then you want to be off the beach asap as it doesn't feel too safe.

Amazing place!!! Beautiful sand beach with incredible vibes! Music playing along with a few rides on the pier too.A few places to eat along the pier too as well as more places if you walk up to the shopping centre.You have outdoor sports, exercises the lot.Such an incredible place for kids, families, couples no matter what!A MUST GO to when in LA

My kids had a blast, it's fun, lively, and a great tourist spot. The beach is clean and maintained. The rides and arcade is very outdated and not in the least bit clean. Lots of fun restaurants and places to stop for a drink.
If you want to experience the Santa Monica Pier when it‚Äôs fun and busy, then a Saturday afternoon will give all of your senses a workout. You can spend money and/or just walk around.

Visited the pier as a ‚Äúfirst stop‚Äù when I arrived in Santa Monica. A ‚Äúmust do‚Äù I suppose, as it is considered an icon. It is fairly popular with quite a few visitors there at the time. Good views across the beach and a nice vista across Santa Monica, looking to the Santa Monica Mountains and up to Malibu. Amusements look fun but I didn‚Äôt ride them. Rollercoaster, Ferris wheel, Trapeze school and others. A range of buskers all vying for attention. Typical souvenir sales. Restaurants with standard tourist-precinct food. An enjoyable stroll and worth a visit. My friend and I spent an hour or so there. Mostly enjoyed the nostalgic feel of the place. Took some nice photos.

So much fun to people watch & sight see. Good FOOD to try & rides. It was cold, windy on Sunday night @ 8pm yet people were still swimming in the ocean, taking wedding & group pictures on the beach, surfing close to dark. Lol. Loved it. A must do. Rides the Ferris wheel if you can, mesmerizing!
This is a place you must go when you visit LA. Here you can find everything like restaurants, shops and the view is breathtaking from the pier

column2: Quick trip to see the sights
column3: We stopped here for a few hours while on a California trip. The pier is an iconic place and of course dated. The walk around was nice though and I‚Äôm glad we did it!
Large beach with long stretch of yellow sand. Long walk to the water, which is quite flat. Not a lot of amenities so bring own food & drinks

Lots of people! Lots of vendors selling their souvenirs on the pier. Street artist waiting to sketch your portrait in pencil or clay. You will see it all!You can park on the pier if your lucky to find a spot. Lots of pay to park garages with a short walk to the pier.
Fun place with a carnival feel to it. We did not go on the rides but walked along the board walk and visited Bubba Grump Shrimp for Dinner which was fun and tasty.
A great place to visit with the family. Lots of activities for kids include a merry go round, aquarium, roller coaster & more. Lots of food choices and cheap parking at $3 per hour ($15 max price).

We were able to spend 2 hours in Santa monica pier. We were dropped off by our bus tour in there and we walked by the shore. Great experience since We came from Canada and we arent located by the coast line. We enjoyed the scenery. We went to the pier and took pictures and buy some foods. It was so good! We have great time

column2: a lovely walk on the pier
column3: We took a lovely walk on the pier. It's fun to walk out and feel the sea breeze and people watch. It's a classic place to go while in Santa Monica

We really expected more from this pier . The parking was a nightmare to find and then so expensive . The shops were dull , and the shop at the end of the pier which is supposed to celebrate the end of route 66 well that was awful . Expected more . It could be so much more.

Great to see the end of Route 66 commemorated here. But that's about as far as it goes. The pier itself is a bit scruffy and in need of some tlc. Still, it's a box-tick trip that you have to do if you're in town.

column2: You only need a few hours
column3: The pier can be done and dusted in halfA day. Yes its an icon, but there is so many people smoking weed and homeless about it really ruins it. Their county really need to helpThe homeless out as it disappoints the pier.
busy. great viewpoints. lovely beach. not good for swimming due to current strength. expensive parking but you can go a few streets inland and park for free.

Decent amusement park right on the pier ! Nice folks, decent rides and a lot of games to be had. Worth a visit. Huge arcade but crowded. Plenty of shops and food as well. Barkers along the way. You can be schooled, saved, and entertained along the route to the entrance.
The Pier was a lot of fun and I enjoyed myself but some of the rides and attractions cost way too much money which was disappointing.

There are some rides and games, restaurants, souvenirs shops and mexican churros !!!Is possible to go down to the beach from the pier and have a walk.Parking is $14 down by the beach or park on the street for $2 hour
Small and very typical of pier entertainment. Food is carnival type food. A few rides. Vendors. Not a lot of time needed to see it.

So many things to do here, whether for the beach, or the pier or even just to sight see. One of the most iconic places to go when in LA. We had so much fun here with my little boy and husband just sitting on the sand people watching.

column2: TRUE REVIEW OF SANTA MONICA PIER
column3: Visited this Pier recently for the first time.Its obviously a very Historic pier and right at the end of Route 66.There are various shops and listings with reference to Route 66 dotted around the pier.The pier is showing signs of age and wear and tear plus there are quite a few homeless people around the area.

The pier has lots of food, games, and rides. There are street performers along the pier. The beach is wide and clean. Parking though it seems easy is a nightmare to get out - worse than a concert- I would park in one of the decks across the street next time.
Vibrant area with alot of tourists found this place very relaxing to just sit and watch everything shops were great and a good variety

column2: Fun Experience for my first time visit!
column3: As a tourist, I find my experience to be enjoyable! The Santa Monica Pier is the quintessential spot for tourists to see when they first visit the city, and I didn't regret visiting! There's carnival-style food, games, mini rides, live performers, and a great view of the ocean, so there's plenty to do. However, what makes me rate my experience 4 out of 5 stars comes down with my personal taste and interests. The pier is more catered to families with young children, and as an adult solo traveler, I ended up leaving earlier to go to the nearby beach as there were more crowds coming in the afternoon.

The Pier is a must see when you visit Santa Monica, for the historical value. The rides are sub par. If the California coastal society will permit it is time to improve the rides. The shops are very typical for a midway.

As a tourist with limited time, I definitely wish we would've spent more time in Venice than coming to this area because it was so ridiculously crowded for my taste and kind of dirty. But we fell in love with a restaurant in the area, "Cha Cha Chicken", and luckily that made the time worth it, but Santa Monica Pier itself? I don't think I'll be back.

This place is a centre for crime. We parked our car at a secure car park. When we got bank everything from our car was missing.Reported it to Police and we were told that there are gangs who operate in this area. They specifically target rental cars. They have all the master keys.Please be very careful when you park your car in a car park. Try and use on street parking visible to people. Less chances of getting robbed.Our holiday was ruined as we lost luggage, cash, passport, IPad, laptop etc.

column2: Pier was Okay but not a Destination
column3: When in LA the Santa Monica pier is always a top place that people have to see, we spent 15 minutes there walking the pier then went to the beach. The pier was nice but nothing special. The walk along the beach on the bike path and the outdoor gym was more entertaining which is located next to the pier. Many bikes and scooters to rent and take along the path!

This was an absolute treat by my girlfriend whilst staying in Los Angeles, she took me here cause she knew i loved playing the video game (Grand Theft Auto) and it was a surreal moment when i stepped foot onto the beach and got taken back to the best childhood of my life

Clean pier location for a fun amusement area. Several restaurants, bars, side talent all along the pier. Parking is somewhat of a challenge, but it works eventually. Outside dining from at least one place near the entrance was dog friendly , near the entrance.

The entire Santa Monica beach is extremely nice for people watching, especially all the young men working out with their buff bodies lol. It is full of tourists and it can get super crowded, yeah, but it's still worth the visit.

Not sure what it‚Äôs like during the week but this pier hive entertainment watch local buskas etc don‚Äôt even have to spend a penny or a dime in this location had great couple of hours loved the entertainment
This is a great place to walk around and people-watch! The end of Route 66, this place is also steeped in a lot of history. Cool place to visit.
Tons of people just hanging out and enjoying the nightlife. We were there at 11pm and still so many people. It is safe but there are some bums.
Go for the sighs.. Beautiful sunsets and nice park for the kids. Cheap parking on the Pier and worth the history lesson about route 66.
I agree that‚Äôs the place where you have to be. It‚Äôs a must in your vacation but, don‚Äôt get your hopes to high, to many people doing between nothing and everything.

column2: Great walking pier but park is separated
column3: The pier itself was a fun evening walk with the kids to people-watch and watch the sunset. We were hoping to enjoy the rides but it is gated off from the pier walking area and there is an admissions fee ($30) for rides and food. We did not know prior.Great spot for pictures though!
A Go-to placeThis is definitely a place on the tourist trail.Lots of movie icons üé• üçøA MUST SEE! ‚ÄºÔ∏è

Nice day on the pier. The rides are nice and they have an unlimited ride wristband which is worth it of your wanting to ride more than one ride.Nice views from the ferris wheel and plenty of food choices to eat from.

We stopped here for a few hours on our way down to Laguna Beach. My daughter and I loved the Ferris wheel and coaster. Beautiful views of the city and Pacific Ocean. I recommend wresting tennis shoes as the print is a bit I level and harder to walk on in sandals.

column2: Reminds me of Blackpool pleasure beach!
column3: Whilst on a brief trip to Los Angeles we had to check out the Santa Monica pier.It‚Äôs very old school and reminded me of a place in the UK, Blackpool pier.Fast food and churros a plenty along with some fun rides for the kids - light up toys sold all over, had a great atmosphere. Prob would not go back again as there just isn‚Äôt that much to do ( unless it‚Äôs a nice day and you had some time at the beach also)

column2: So many fun and distracting sights and smells
column3: We just missed the sun dropping below the horizon, but its such a beautiful and fun spot to explore! It may be the lights and sounds of the boardwalk rides and games or smells of churros and waffle cones, but the whole experience is always so nostalgic feeling. A must see if you are kn the area!

If you must go, go. If you are not close to the area don't bother, better yet, just drive past it so you can say, "I saw it". Cheap trinkets everywhere and bad entertainers :( The view is not spectacular once you get to the end, just a bunch of tourists pretending it's exciting. Sad that no love has been put into such a popular landmark!

magnificent place and exactly as seen in the 80s or 90son the pier there are many refreshment points and gadgets.I advise you to park in the neighboring streets but avoid too expensive "public parking" 40 $ daily rate.on the pier you can rent a bike to reach Venice Beach along the busy but fantastic cycle path.

Visited with my husband on a Thursday after noon. This was our first visit to the pier after several recommendations. There were not very many vendors there and it may have because it was mid-week or due to the gloomy/cloudy weather. We saw several aspiring muscians performing, a magician, and a clown but did not venture over to the "amusment park" side of the pier. There were crowds of people coming and going but other than that not much more going on. It was beautiful to see the mountains line the horizon into the ocean. Santa Monica Pier...been there and done that. No desire at this time to return.
Great place to walk specially aroud the sunset! Little crowded but that contributes to creat the perfect enviroment!
First, who do not know here ends the Route 66. Here you can buy and eat very good things. There are also many things to discover

This is by far the most disgusting place we have ever seen. It was full of homeless people, it stunk, the beach was dirty and full of grifters!!! The pier smelt like urine. Not to mention the mostly naked man with a BLACK snake chilling near the steps as you walked from the pier to the garbage covered sand. Don't even bother going.

A good location if you really want to check the boxes when you visit LA. The pier itself is alright, very busy with a lot of tourists. There are shops and restaurants you can stop by. The view from the pier is good. Parking is insanely difficult.
I was impressed by the sizes of the boards and their age.This place is DIRTY and SEEDY. Needs a total hose down. Everything is old and in need of repair.

column2: Reminded me of the old Coney Island!
column3: Our limo driver took us here to enjoy a good part of the day shopping, eating, people watching, etc. The pier was so busy and upbeat! A great day was had by all. Don't miss it!

Great place to visit if in the area. We visited as part of an LA tour. Lots of photo opportunities, lots of food, drink, stalls and street performers.We said we‚Äôd stay in Santa Monica next time we‚Äôre in LA. Really loved the area.Worth a visit.

If you are in Los Angeles, the Santa Monica pier is rather a must-see. People watching, boardwalk vendors, a small amusement park, and most important...the views! Take a ride on the ferris wheel for the most amazing view around.

This Pier is nothing different to any other Pier I've been to ...maybe apart from large numerous of people that ask you directly to donate/give them money.At the moment the Pier is undergoing some works but it does not affect the access at all (just a bit more noise).

column2: A Memorable Beach visit on Memorial Day 2018
column3: What an Epic Pier(end of the road for Route 66) and clean beach with so many fun attractions. Got there early (I arrived 10am) on a holiday. Left at 3:30pm to what appeared to be thousands of people on the Pier. Parked in a multi-level garage closeby and adjacent to a premium shopping mall but no mall parking validation. Super convenient to get in and out of the area quickly. Perfect spot for families and CA Fun in the Sun. No dogs allowed on the beach. Thankful for all the VERY visible law enforcement and life guards on duty.
A nice place to visit to kill some time. A few places to eat and some photo opportunities. Can get busy. Nothing special but good to tick off the list.

We visited here a six years back on Christmas. We loved the experience of being at the ocean on a relatively warm, day in winter. We quickly decided to move to Los Angeles and after some time to make it happen did. It‚Äôs not the best thing about LA, but we do still love to visit from time to time.

Visited here on memorial weekend - along with hoards of others. Some good views and a few nice terrace-type bars or cafes.Heaps of shops selling tourist type stuff, plenty of churros sellers and a few buskers.An entertainment park type set-up at the end.Not worth a special visit, but if you are the neighbourhood...

‚ÄòEllo chaps!Santa Monica Pier is a‚Ä¶well by now you know, it‚Äôs a pier. In Santa Monica, California.It‚Äôs about an hour‚Äôs drive from downtown LA, about half an hour from LAX.The main draw of the pier are the live artists singing for tips, the slew of restaurants, and the amusement park. Yeah, on the pier. A park on the pier. Rollercoaster, ferris wheel, and jug drop game.The ride prices are based on how much you want to do, and don‚Äôt seem bad.Near the pier is a large, extensive beach, with plenty of walking and outdoor gym/playground gear.It‚Äôs no wonder this area is an attraction for locals and tourists alike.
It's definitely a must if you go to Santa Monica but I would say it's overrated. Don't regret going though.

column2: Always leave feeling better than I arrived
column3: The pier is a bit tacky but it is an enjoyable place. Watching the sunset on the end of the pier is amazing. Reminds me of a simpler time. Always some characters on the pier to keep everyone entertained for a while
Great for a stroll on sunny day, but some of the attractions are better for kids. We hired bikes from the pier and spent an afternoon on the boardwalk which was worth it.

column2: A Very Good Place - not Great - but a Must See
column3: I have been to LA and this area a hundred times and love all of it. And with saying that, It is hard to say that the pier is overrated but that is how I feel about it. Its a legendary iconic location with tens of thousands of pics being taken of the pier and ferris wheel etc. It is fun so dont get me wrong but it isnt Great or Excellent and it is a little too gritty now which is unfortunate,.. Years ago it was great - not now. If you go at night you will be fine but not without worry like it was at one time. Fun and memorable and a must see. Try it during the day too - beaches are massive!

We were lucky the day we went as it was not too busy and you would walk along the pier without it being overcrowded. Plenty to do and see and the views along the coast in either direction were stunning.
One of things what is what you expect, busy, a little tacky but not to its detriment, plenty to see and places to get souvenirs and snacks or drinks. A great view of Santa Monica from the end.

Santa Monica Pier is well worth a visit when in the area! It has a selection of rides that would keep children occupied! What makes the pier so interesting is the street performers! Some incredibly talented people perform there everyday!

If you ever go to Santa Monica, you are most likely going come here and it might just be the highlight of your day. It was for mine! I mostly loved the view of the ocean and the great part about this pier is that you can‚Äôt miss it! (Mostly because of the giant Ferris wheel) There is fast food along the pier and I would recommend the Bubba Gump Shrimp restaurant.

column2: Typical tourist trap, not worth the visit.
column3: This place is like so many others in the US (Navy Pier, Wharf in SF) and not worth the time. The 3rd Ave Promenade has great shopping and is just a couple of blocks away. Highly overrated.

column2: 2 day stay - across the road from the pier
column3: Iconic, fun, smaller than i pictured and packed most times of the day. It‚Äôs only open 11-8pm - slightly disappointing as i wanted to take night pics from the wheel. It was so cold too. Some great food in terms of burgers etc. All in all good fun once though. Doubt it would be much different a second visit. Street performers are fun to watch but remember to tip as its poor form not to. Easy access to the beach - nice to have wooden walkways most of the way to the water & seats.
An iconic place but mostly just a bunch of tourists and kids. It was mostly a tourist trap with junk stores and poor quality food but all in a neat setting.

Got parked up off the front early on sunday. Paid about $5 for multistorey parking lot near Mackies. Parking by the pier on the front was $14 per day. Walked on pier which was great. Watching the shops open up. Walked along front then to Vennice Beach. Which was a little shocking when youre not used to seeing people exist living rough on the beach/sidewalks. Dont get me wrong its not full of homeless, but theres a few. Yes you get asked for change by one or two. The shops and stalls sell loads of seaside tatt. Tshirts, beachwear etc. We stopped for a 'cawffee' at a nice little cafe and people watched. It was Mothers day so busy. Then walked back to Santa Monica. We then revisited the pier which is very 'seasidey'. Rides shops stalls and a fair. We found the shopping center or Mall. Lots of upmarket shops,bars resturants etc. Visited "Vonns" which is a supermarket to get some bits n bobs. A bit like Asda.
We enjoyed the uniqueness of the pier. It was a good place to grab some food and enjoy a different view of the ocean. The place does get pretty busy on the weekends.

A great place to spend time with family and friends. I spent almost a day enjoying the beach, food and view there. One of the top attractions in LA, a must visit. There are many public parking area along the beach and there is one just besides Monica Pier.

We got the all rides pass and didn‚Äôt regret them! We had loads of fun on the rides however found the carnival games very expensive so chose not to do them. A really famous place and worth the visit both in day time or night.

column2: Classic Pier on a perfect day
column3: A great place to stroll and spend a few hours enjoying the views, having fun at Pacific Park or enjoying a meal.When we visited there were several entertainers at work on the pier... a magician, several musicians and caricature artists as well as many souvenir vendors with their carts.Spend at least one or two hours enjoying this sight.
Crowded, but it‚Äôs a sunny holiday weekend! Great people watching. Lots of expected chain stores and expensive shops, but a great time!

column2: Must get a ‚Äúbird‚Äù scooter to see it all
column3: We were only in LA for 2 days so when we arrived we saw these bird scooters around everywhere and decided to try them to see as much as we could as quickly as possible!We went about all the way from Santa Monica pier to Venice beach and back and it only cost a few $There is so much to see along the way so you can just get off and then pick up another one when you see one.The beach is lovely and clean and the pier is great, there are some great spots to have food also.There is public WiFi but it sometimes goes offThere are public toilets which seemed better than UK public toilets in terms of cleanliness

column2: Spend an entire afternoon here and didn't want to leave
column3: My friends and I drove here from downtown LA and the commute wasn't difficult at all. It was our first time seeing the Pacific Ocean and we were not disappointed. The beach was so beautiful and not crowded. We loved the pier. It was buzzing with activity and is very family oriented. There are several carnival rides including the ferris wheel which we went on for only $10 each which was really worth it. We stayed until around 10pm and enjoyed every minute of being there. There is a nice Mexican restaurant near the end of the pier but beware it isn't open very late.

Beautiful beach, nice food joints, other entertaining activities. Its one of the busiest places in LA, weekend gets more crowded. During my LA stay In visited this twice, spent almost whole day there. It gets colder/windy by evening but offer great tourist experience. Do try out nearby food options, some of them are real good!

This was a very nice place to visit. We had a great meal at at restaurant at the end of the pier also. Lots of rides for kids and big kids alike. And so much better than the very over rated nearby Venice and Muscle Beaches.Santa Monica pier is also the end of the ‚ÄúRoute 66‚Äù journey, so I found out on our visit.This really is a must see, even if it‚Äôs only for a short time.

column2: With friends despite the rain and the cold.
column3: The pier was lovely. Felt like a beach fun fair with the beautiful scenery in the background.I'm not sure whether I liked it because of my group of friends (14) or whether I was really hurt to see the number of homeless people digging through bins for the food.The number of homeless people in Santa Monica did shock me and I'm a Londoner!
