column2: Perfect Memorial Day & Summer Weekend Destination
column3: Spring in Santa Monica is gorgeous. Clear, brisk weather off the ocean, amazing views, people watching, shopping and food. The Pier is the place to start, then shop on 3rd street, and walk the board walk to Venice. Its a full day of fun for the entire family.
Went during sunset and it was gorgeous!! It has rides, places to eat, the beach, bring a sweater it can get chilly
It‚Äôs a place to go! We were there a Monday night and was very silent. We didn‚Äôt have too much fun. But you must go here. We enjoy better Malibu and Venice.

Santa Monica Pier is a touristy place, but it‚Äôs a fun touristy place! Lots of choices to eat, from local to chain (Bubba Gump‚Äôs is a favorite).The beach is pristine. There is a little parking near the beach, but there is a convenient parking garage at 3rd street that has the first 90 minutes free and inexpensive prices after that. The small shopping center is next to the parking garage.There are places to fish, a couple of entertainers on the pier, and the carnival rides.There is a marker /photo op for the end of Route 66.
Fun to visit. Some people may spend a long time, but we usually stay for a bit over an hour in the attractions. Nice view of Santa Monica from the Ferris wheel.

column2: Sunset at the Santa Monica Pier
column3: Unfortunately I found the pier overrated. I guess because it's been featured in movies, etc it does give one a romantic perception of the place. Good to walk on to say you've been there but nothing really to see apart from timing your visit with the sunset which is beautiful from the pier (or the beach, if you're there too).I'm not sure about the rides and stuff there as I personally did not go for them, but a little small area compared again to what you may have perceived from movies. Pleasant enough but not to spend hours and hours of your time. Do take pictures with the iconic ferries wheel and walk to the end of the pier for a 'Santa Monica pier location' shot.Look down and you won't miss it.
I love the beach in this city and I feel like visiting there again with someone special! It‚Äôs very great that they have an amusement park besides the beautiful beach!!

column2: Great place for a family outing in the evenings
column3: We visited LA in May, and we were at the pier of Santa Monica for dinner on a sunday night...lots of things to do, local vendors, street food, souveniers and lovely ocean views. Parking is expensive thou.
It‚Äôs very unique and family friendly. We ate at the Mexican place at the end of the pier and it was very delicious and great customer service!
Santa Monica pier had a fabulous view. You can visit the beach walk the pier, and swim then have a quick meal. There are street walk performers who dance and sing.

The pier is great, lots of interesting people to watch and things to see.Parking was easy and not overly expensive.The amusement park isn‚Äôt cheap but it‚Äôs ok and the views from the roller coaster are cool.

column2: It‚Äôs kitsch but it‚Äôs always fun
column3: A walk on the Santa Monica Pier is always a source of good vibes. It‚Äôs often crowded, but happily so, and with all sorts of people from families with your children to retirees, different ethnicities (more than most places in Santa Monica) and different styles. There are fully adequate places to eat and drink but one comes for the Pier itself - and of course the beach below, which remains perhaps LA‚Äôs best walking beach.

There is something about Santa Monica that always leaves me in awe! Despite being overcrowded by tourists, the pier is a very special place. Definitely take your time there and make sure to park your car far enough to enjoy the beauty of Santa Monica before you reach the pier.
Nice beach walk and fun on the pier.Worth seeing although not masses to do here but you couldn‚Äôt come to LA and not come to Santa Monica

column2: Must do but expensive and crowded
column3: You have to do it when your in Santa Monica, but it was not the highlight of our trip. I thought my 13 Year old daughter would love it and it was just okay.

This was a glorified carnival. It had really expensive rides and carnival games. We spent forever in traffic from LA and then got swindled for parking (Do NOT park with SafetyPark!!). We went on a chilly day, so we were disappointed we couldnt see the beach. Overall, it was expensive and overrated.

We only had a couple of hours in LA, and decided to hit up Santa Monica Pier and Griffith Park. Santa Monica was really cool and interesting, and unlike anything I've visited before. The weather when we visited was cold and cloudy but I still enjoyed it! We got there pretty early so parking was quite easy and plentiful.

Historic Santa Monica Pier is still a great view of the Pacific with lots of shopping and food vendors. The ferris wheel and carnival atmosphere is fun. Loved everything about it and the weather was great.

The Santa Monica Pier is a great place for all ages. Whether you are planning to come with your family or to go on a date this is a great place full of activities for everyone. It is fun to go during the day to see the water but it is also very pretty at night when all the lights on the rides light up, I would recommend going at night. With the rides just like a carnival they also have booths with food and there is actually a restaurant on the pier where you can go to eat and enjoy the lights. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who loves carnivals and having fun.
awesome place to relax, eat, hang out or just look at the sunset. There is parking and you can just walk on the beach.
Worth the trip! Interesting people watching, good food and great shopping.Had a great day out.Too cold for swimming but plenty of sun.

This Pier in Santa Monica is something to see the Restaurants with carnival rides great views of the beach.Although,I've been here before thanks for the recommendation Friddle the Pier at Midnight Is such a sweet cool spot in 2009 my journey in southern California was Excellent!.-Anthony
It has a small Carnival and basically a short walk of a pier. Few food and shopping choices. Just a touristy place.

Santa Monica Pier is fun but definitely a popular tourist stop with LOTS of foot traffic and the shops and restaurants nearby are built as such. The pier itself has the typical souvenir vendors, musicians, and carnival like foods. Walk down to the end for a great view of the coast. Parking can be difficult and we found the cheapest and best parking to be down in the general lot close to the beach and beneath the pier. Most hotels and parking garages up from the pier will charge 15-20 for parking.

Decided to visit before we went to a Dodgers game. Pier carnival opened at 11 I think and was a lot of fun with all the street performers. Headed down to Muscle Beach where we wish we had more time, maybe next time.
The Pier is nice but it is serviving on it name. It is defferently a tourest location. My wife wanted to visit the pier so we did. The town of Santa Monica is a much nicer place to walk around.
On my last evening I went for Dinner to Santa Monica and spent a walk at The shore ! Its a really relaxing atmosphere with a lot of good places for food !

Our first stop along the PCH was the Santa Monica Pier. It had stunning views of the ocean and Santa Monica. We went early, so the rides weren't open yet, but we walked around and got coffees. You can park at the pier for only $1 an hour, so definitely do that if you don't plan on being there for very long!
If you're visiting Santa Monica you have to come here. Having said that it really is nothing special. Lots of tacky souvenir shops, buskers and stalls. Good views of the shoreline and beaches.

We loved our brief visit to the pier. Enjoyed take away lunch from bubba Gump as we sat on the peir people watching. Wished we had more time to explore the little stores and rides. We only had about an hour. Give yourself a few.
Great place to visit and see its very busy though. Beach is also great and clean and well maintained
Awesome and iconic, load of little shops and great wee rides, definitely worth a visit! We went to the Mexican place at the end which was great, huge drinks and good food

My young daughter and I visited this place in May 2018. The weather was beautiful. First off I would say parking right at the pier is worth the $14. It is only a couple minute walk to the pier itself from the parking lot. It also has easy access on and off the main highway. Take your camera as there‚Äôs many great photo opportunities. It was crowded but not crazy when we visited. Lots of cool shops and vendors not to mention rides :)
all i ever dreamt is real!! it's unbelieveble.. the park, the panorama, the ocean, restaurants, music... if you are in LA you must see it!

column2: I don't know what the hype is about
column3: What is the hype of this place? Other than the fair grounds their isn't much to this pier. The Route-66 shop is about the only thing worth seeing as the shop has money from around the world post on the walls and ceiling. The souvenirs for route-66 are a cool. On the peir there are annoying people playing American Idol flop-out music trying to earn a buck or two spoiling the beautiful sound of the ocean and nature.If you want a better beach and more natural setting, I recommend Huntington (Surf City) south on California 1 (~40 min south of Long Beach).

column2: Nice for an hour or so
column3: The pier is nice to look around for an hour or so with a stroll to Venice beach but that‚Äôs about it. Rides and games too expensive to play. The best thing is the shops and restaurants in Santa Monica itself. Great bargains and designs on offer and lots lots of restaurants.

The pier is good for rides and arcade games. It‚Äôs very busy and crowded. There are some eateries on the boardwalk. It‚Äôs good to do one time but unless you‚Äôre going on the rides again,once is enough.

Great experience! A must do if in Santa Monica or area. Loads of shops, eateries, amusement park. The games remind of the state fair at home. One can simply browse alongside the water like me or soak up the sun on the beach. It was within a short walking distance from our hotel. This could be an all day affair with the pier being the destination. I highly recommend.

column2: Great place to visit , definitely worth staying nearby.
column3: We stayed nearby in the Wyndham and had a great time in this location. We ate at Bubba Gumps which was a pleasant experience with tasty food and good service.

parked at the pier and super easy to access everything . plenty of gift stalls and shops to get what you want as a tourist .quite busy at times but a pleasant feel about the place and lots of choice for food / drink .beaches are all nice with the usual views of endless surf /sand .really like Santa monica

We spent the morning here from 8 to noon and watched the pier get very busy by the time we left. The pier is accessible whereby if you have a handicap pass you park for free along with their being elevators at one of the restaurants. The parking is limited though. We didn't get a chance to get there at night to see the lights which are supposed to be really nice. The cost for someone to write you name in animal letters is $1/letter plus a mat for the artwork. Coffee and food is reasonably priced. All n all it was a fun time.
Best free entertainment. We tipped the guy in the sparkly white jacket who sang Make It Funky because he totally made our day. Oh and there is a contact high at most times.
Eric was amazing and helpful. The entire staff was helpful. property was nice and clean. This is a family oriented property
The pier is very busy with lots of hussle bussel... and if you love to people watch then Santa Monica is the best place to see all and be amazed.

If you like people watching you will get a eye full at the Santa Monica Pier. Crowded as expected, it attracts a lot of visitors from all over the world and provides an endless amount of beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean and the surrounding beaches. Though I never witnessed any issue, be mindful of your personal belongings and be sure to enjoy the street performers....some of them incredibly talented. There is a park at the entrance to the pier that attracts a "baked" clientele and lingering nearby will give you a gratuitous high. No worries.....it's fun and crazy...just as you would expect at a seaside attraction.

The Santa Monica Pier is a people watching, carnival atmosphere end of Route 66 and a must experience for any nostalgia buff of Americana. Enjoy the sights, sounds, smells of this grand, yet personal tourist experience.

It‚Äôs a beautiful spot for pictures and walk arround the only thing about it was full of people on that Saturday and I don‚Äôt like it.It‚Äôs advisible to be awere in places like these from pick pockets, nothing happened to us however that was how I felt and saw it.

Not a long pier but good views, lively entertainment from a variety of entertainers. Choice of food and drink outlets, including Bubba Gump. Close to the sightseeing changeover bus stops so a good time to take a walk between tour routes.
Really clean boardwalk with stunning views all around. Good access too via boardwalks. Didn‚Äôt try the rides but maybe next time !

On a local's advice we skipped Hollywood and headed straight for Santa Monica. The shopping was fabulous and the Pier is magical at night. Easy access via the train and plenty to see and do for the whole family. Definitely coming back!
This is one of the really fun things to do in Los Angeles. The pier is great and has plenty to do between restaurants, the roller coaster, ferris wheel and plenty of other activities!

You probably have to walk to end of this , but it is a tourist trap. Guys hawking all the usual junk. Cheap food outlets , with more junk outlets. The rides seemed busy with young children.Should you do it ? Of course.

Accidentally found it when driving on route 101 north. So excited to see it in the rear view mirror.. it‚Äôs strange driving on a wood plant bridge to park the car in the lot. Nice little walking and shopping area. Definitely going to see some strange people but nice to watch.
Santa Monica pier is fun. Wear comfortable shoes when you come here. Lots of shops/stores/restaurants. Good for family/friends/kids/couples.

column2: Fantastic spot to watch the sunset!
column3: Great spot to watch the sun go down over the beach.Great vibe and atmosphere on the pier with restaurants and amusement rides.

While the Pier is a little outdated and rickety, it holds a lot of history and charm for the city of Santa Monica. I loved the views and ocean breeze as well as the incredible street performers. Would love to see them update the restaurants!

We went for a quick stroll on the beach but it‚Äôs a Sunday. As expected, there was a ton of people - both locals and out of town tourists. The mood was very festive with a lot of street performers. I will revisit soon but will go on a weekday instead.

The pier is great for a walk. But there weren't many shops open when we went through, not sure if it was because it was December? We did get some great pictures though, and hopefully we get to come back when it is more lively.

column2: A must visit in Santa Monica
column3: You can‚Äôt go to Santa Monica without a visit to the pier, expect crowds but it kind of adds to the good general vibe. Lots of stalls for souvenirs that were quite reasonably priced due to all the competition. Probably worth heading into Santa Monica city (not far) for something to eat and a bit of a rest from the crowds, lots of options and healthier choices than at the pier.

column2: A MUST SEE IN SANTA MONICA
column3: Nothing like a walk on a pier. Right to the ocean and more if you like the fair style and the beach life this is where it is at. Lots of performers as well as music at the pier entrance. On Sundays they pay tribute to all the fallen soldiers on the beach that have given their lives in the last wars.Flags fly everywhere and snack foods fill the pier. Only a few blocks from main attractions.

column2: A nice walk on a cool evening!
column3: Wanted to see the Pacific and the Santa Monica Pier was our choice! The end of Route 66 and a place to put our toes in the Pacific......the breeze was blowing and there were people to watch....

column2: Just to tick it off the list
column3: Nothing special really. Looks run down and it was just something to tick of the sight seeing list. Looked good at night with the pier lit up.

Took a very short trip here to start my Route 66 journey.It was early morning so the pier was pretty much shut. It seems to serve as a great hub for the beach and parking is fair at $13.Plenty to do on the pier and worth a trip for the history of it.

For some reason, Santa Monica always has a great importance for the visitors. Everybody would like to step by around Santa Monica Pier and actually it worths. Feeling the breeze, walking along the way, looking to the ocean and having some fun.. all these are provided by this place. It is so easy to walk, usually there are some personal shows. A lot of place to buy magnets and etc.
Was an interesting place to see, more children orientated. It was also cold the day we went. We had fun overall

Rushed over at about 645pm (sunset was about 725pm), traffic & parking looked to be a nightmare but thankfully we managed to get parking at the pier itself.Headed onto the pier to take photos on the beautiful sunset, of course there were hordes of tourists but you‚Äôd be able to get your own sunset photos in peace nonetheless.Great colours & setting for sunset.

We made a very quick dash to the pier during a one night stop-over on the way back from holiday in the South Pacific to the UK. We had both always wanted to come here having seen the pier and surrounding beaches in movies etc., so it was a must do, especially to watch the sunset.The pier itself was packed (Sunday evening), full of people, noisy, vibrant with all sorts of stalls, performers and the like. We come from a seaside area in the UK and likened Santa Monica Pier to piers back home in their heyday...and then some !We were both very tired so we didn't hang around the pier itself for too long, went along the beach a few hundred yards to watch the sunset, but had we been a bit more 'refreshed' I'm sure we would have explored the pier a bit more.Great attraction.

Stunning Views of the sunset, lots to do & eat. Parking isn't free but there are lots of spaces. Go at the right time & you can watch the sunset when it is less busy on the beachfront or go during the day when it more busy on the sand.
On a sunny day, make sure you go to Santa Monica. You will enjoy the view, the weather and the walk. Also, you could have lunch or go shopping. It's the place to go to on a good weather day.

column2: Epic landmark- a must do in Socal
column3: This pier has been featured in countless movies, and is an important Southern California landmark. It is where Route 66 ends and the Pacific Ocean begins! There are restaurants, attractions and street performers all waiting to greet you. If you have never visited- this is a must do!

column2: Fun on nice weather days, to people interact and depends on events.
column3: We enjoyed it and there were many events taking place in the area while we were there. Amusement park is fun to watch the people though expensive. Do a ride band? Also plan to pay for parking in the area. Eats on the pier can be pricey, may be best to just get drinks on the pier though they are pricey also. Like anything the pier is what you make it. If like to walk park in the area and walk to the pier and beach areas to enjoy the activities taking place. You can safely walk for miles from the pier. We enjoyed the walking and seeing everyone enjoying the beach area activities.
Our first time here and we had a Great time. All sorts of things to do on the the pier and a walk on the beach is just steps away!

column2: An hour spent at Santa Monica pier
column3: Easy parking, great Mexican food and beautiful sight! The Ferris Wheel had a amazing view. Walked down to the beach and waded in beautiful place!

Late night stop, maybe a little too late as the park was closing up. It was a peaceful walk to the end of the pier, wondering what the fishermen below are catching. Local musicians and artists set up shop along the way, the fog started to roll in, hauntingly cool. Don‚Äôt forget to take a stroll down the beach path toward the water. Bring a jacket, it‚Äôs pretty windy and cold but worth the scenery. Get there earlier to enjoy the amusement park.
Beautiful beach views, fun boardwalk with family friendly activities, tons of junk food, and touristy vendors. Worth visiting this iconic spot if in the area.

And I clarify. Yes it is accessible, but difficult to navigate. The old wood planks on the pier make it difficult to navigate in a straight line. Bathrooms are ok, with accessible stalls, lots of graffiti. People are friendly. If you park at the beach, their is a public elevator for disabled in bubba hump shrimp company. Lots of street performers as well.

you only need to visit here for a couple of hours unless you want to relax on the amazing beach. we hired bikes but make sure you check out the prices as they vary. we paid 25$ for all day rental. the rental place was very near Shutters hotel. the pier is good old fashioned fun and the beach is fantastic. very clean.

First we ate at Bubba Gumps. The view was amazing but the food was meh. We sat next to this weird druggie guy who talked on his phone the whole time. Ambience! Thankfully they don't charge for that. Next we went on the ferris wheel which was worth the price gouge because the sunset was beautiful. I liked the museum - we learned all sorts of cool stuff. This was a weekday, so tolerable.
Have to go if you are in Santa Monica. Food is not cheap but it is so fun to see! Busy place, full of character! Great view of the water as well. Can't skip in Santa Monica!

Inexpensive and fun! The Ferris Wheel was our favorite- amazing views. Kids working at the rides had great personalities and made the short wait in line easy to take.Walked down to the beach and waded in- beautiful place!
Definitely a must on any visit to SM is the iconic pier. We just love the park and rides and pier concerts and all the goodness the Pacific Ocean has to offer!üåàüåüdo yourself a favor and go.

column2: Great if you like crowds, noise and really schlocky souvenirs
column3: We visited about a week ago. The weather was perfect. Not too hot, not too sunny.It was far more crowded than I ever remembered it. Even in the Playland, which used to be one of my favorite places - so crowded with machines and people that there was not even enough elbow room to play the games.Lots of people making music on the Pier. That was actually nice.Not many places to just sit down and visit with friends.Most of the eating places had long lines.The rides looked a bit rickety. And the ferris wheel..well, it didn't move often. So if you got on, expect to stay on it for a long time. That might actually be a good thing if you want a private place to chat, make-out, or propose - and see the sights. The view from up there would be amazing.The food offerings were routine.The souvenir shops? Really, things looked so tacky.The shops on the Venice boardwalk have better looking quality of souvenirs.Incidentally, this is the end of Route 66 - so you will find some of that paraphernalia.A word about parking -Find your way to the Santa Monica city lots.(From Colorado Blvd, turn right).They are much cheaper (but don't accommodate vehicles needing high clearance).We ended up stuck in traffic for so long that we just copped out and parked in the old Sears parking lot for $20. Way too expensive.(20 more feet and we could have turned on to 4th St, if we had known).It's not a long walk to the Pier from that area.Bring your own hat (sun) and lotion.Eat elsewhere.There is much better food directly across the street and on the 3rd Street Promenade.

The pier is smaller than I imagined, yet still really neat and worth making a special trip to (despite the horrible, awful, snail's pace LA traffic we had to navigate to arrive). We parked on the pier and it didn't cost any more than any of the surrounding parking lots several blocks from the beach- I think it was around $12. We got there in the early morning, so it wasn't crowded and it was early April, too, so we kind of lucked out in the not-too-crowded department. There is a small amusement park on the pier (costs money) and a Bubba Gump's as well as a few other small eateries and some very tacky tourist shops. Watched people fish off of the pier (that aspect is filthy, because the fish guts weren't cleaned up) and enjoyed the wind and views from the end of the pier.

Not worth the crowds and idiots milling about trying to make a postcard. Best to avoid. Lots of sketchy characters hanging around also, selling drugs, having gang meet-ups, etc. look from afar but otherwise no need to bother.

column2: Best beach after Miami South Beach
column3: If you don't care about going in the water ( which you should not plan on cause is super cold) this is a great beach.. something to do for everyone. Highly recommended to take a bike and ride to Venice beach and back. Stroll on the pier or take advantage of amazing shopping and high end dining on 3rdStreet .. the best experience in LA hands down. Parking could be hectic so use spot hero if possible. Get a sweet treat from Carlos bakery if you have a sweet tooth.. not cheap but delicious .

We caught the train to Santa Monica and then the big blue bus down to Venice beach and walked back up to Santa Monica Pier. It was a lovely sunny day and an enjoyable walk the pier itself is extremely busy and just bursting with people. Glad we went but would not bother again.

column2: Great adventure with small to mid sized kids
column3: This is a very small but good amusement park and arcade on a pier next to/ over the ocean. Roller coasters and other attractions are good for beginners and for a fun family time. Parking is easy unless you are there mid-summer, in which case its quite crowded. If your kids like rides, get the wristbands, the individual tickets go too fast. The best part is that members of your party that don't want to get on the rides do not have to pay which is very different from big theme parks. This is a great place to visit for the day or after the beach for a couple of hours. Our family goes here frequently.

What a great way to finish our Route 66 adventure. A lovely bustling cool vibe about the place. Loads of street performers, great food, I could spend more time here. The guy in the Route 66 cabin was a legend and made us feel super welcome an all round nice guy.I highly recommend a visit here
We strolled to the end of the Pier, watched/listened to the vendors. Had lunch at Bubba Gumps (excellent food!), Sat on benches soaking up the sights and sounds. Fun to experience!!

column2: Get there early for great pics!
column3: I read some lukewarm reviews on the pier, I believe the pier was one of the highlights of my brief escapade from LA. The key is to get there early, I was there by 8 AM and was able to enjoy the area and take great pics before the mob came.

This was our final stop on a Route 66 road trip from Chicago to LA.Classic seaside pier with amusements. Not as good as some of the British piers like Blackpool or Southport but still worth a wander around.The pier marks the end of Route 66, so it‚Äôs an absolute must for anyone travelling the Mother Road.Parking on and around the pier is easy to find. We went for a walk from the pier along Santa Monica Beach all the way to Venice Beach and back. Easy walking and lots of people to watch!

column2: Worth a walk, but Santa Monica itself was the place to go
column3: You have to walk the pier, it‚Äôs part of going there, but the city itself was the most enjoyable part of the day. We were there early and parked by the beach . I thought the parking cost was reasonable. Google Maps got us there from universal and it was an easy drive
Beautiful place , gets a bit chilly in the evening take a jacket , kids loved it , few places to eat , great pics at sunset , kids loved the roller coaster .

column2: Great to Pass the Evening with a View
column3: Simply riding a ferris wheel is one thing, standing on a pier another, but do both with a sunset view in a cool ocean breeze where everyone is happy -- that's fun. A few good rides, a selection of food booths, and lots of t-shirt shops, etc. Touristy? Yes. Worth it. Absolutely!!!

Lots of cool shops, was cleaner than other piers I've been to in California. Wouldn't hesitate to return. Stopped at the restaurant on the end for dinner but the wait was 25 mins so we went elsewhere.

I really enjoyed walking around and seeing all the different people, venders and musicians. It is a very unique experience and Pier. Avery popular photo shoot for visitors, TV and Movies üé• over the years. I really enjoyed my time there.üëçüá∫üá∏

Nice stroll on the pier the day before Easter. Plenty of people watching, tourist shopping, and picture extraveganza. They offer local talent and amusement rides, and local restaurants. A little something for everyone. Easy access to the beach for a stroll or dip in the ocean.

Tourist trap with plenty of cheesy souvenirs. Chain restaurants with average food and service. Great view of the ocean and nice to walk around but I wouldn't spend more that an hour maybe 2 at this location.

Another Sunny but breezy California busy afternoon. Street players line the boardwalk. Took a $10 per, on the iconic ferris wheel just because. We sat across from each other to balance, tried to slide to get a couple selfies and LOL the car started to rock, so not being a thrill sealer stayed put. The boardwalk is fun and lively. Two resturants also on the boardwalk, parked right off the boardwalk. Plus this is the Western end of Route 66, so get you're kicks on 66.
Good for families with small kids or teen, a lot of fan, many activities. I recomend rent a car o a bike and go to another beach near, all are very nice
We walked the pier on a Sunday afternoon. Great place for people watching, but not the place to go for a peaceful walk. Lots of musicians every few feet on the pier.
We were disappointed in our visit. The boardwalk was not well kept up and there were so many homeless people lining the vacant bridges and entrance to the boardwalk. Very sad.
Just your average pier with rides and food, worth a visit but only spent maybe 20 mins on the pier then headed to the beach.

column2: Great place to come on a nice day
column3: The weather wasn't great when we came so only spent a couple of hours here. But there's a lot to see and do, and there is a Bubba Gump Shrimp which is always good!
Something to see in life but not so amazing how they says. I visited it in the morning, maybe at night is nice.

The day we visited was a sunny one with only a light wind and the temperature was not high enough to warrant a swim in the ocean, but there were people swimming.As you enter the pier under the big sign, there are many people performing for money.Besides the permanent shops, there are many other people with pop up stands, or no stands, trying to sell you something.Walking the length of the pier you will pass the amusement park, the end of route 66 sign, and old style penny arcade and many more attractions.It is a good place to visit, but there is no need to spend a lot of time here.
If its for fishing, buying souvenirs or just to relax and enjoy sea-breeze this is one of my faves spot to visit when in California!

I have been visiting this pier for 30+ years and have seen many transitions as the area waned and grew. It is definitely on an upswing and well worth visiting! The pier has many little gift shops, snack stands, and a restaurant or two. The amusement rides are fun, but the best value is in riding the famous carousel for only $1.00 and getting an ice cream cone right in the same building at their old fashioned ice cream counter. You can walk down to the beach right behind the carousel building and play on the well-known rings and monkey bars, rent a bike or scooter, or venture to the shore line for some toe-dipping fun! Just be aware of your surroundings as there is still a noticeable presence of homeless people milling about and if the pier parking is full, drive two blocks towards the shopping center (around 2nd/Broadway) and pay nothing for the first 90 minutes and a dollar or so for each hour afterwards.

Went here because it‚Äôs so iconic. Finding parking was not difficult. Plenty to see and do on the pier.Performers playing music, little shops to buy your memory trinkets.Ice cream was great on a warm sunny day.Must visit at least once, not sure if more times is necessary though.

Santa Monica Pier is an interesting place to visit for a look around or if you want to enjoy the rides and fair ground activities. Photo shoot spot ouside Bubba Gumps if you want to be Forest Gump for a minute or 2. Plenty of food outlets. Can stay for hours or just wander through and enjoy the atmosphere
Great to people watch, but mostly gimmick and touristy. Great view of the beach. Clean bathrooms, parking is expensive

column2: Good all in package for kids
column3: Kids can ride all attractions as often as they want for just 18 Usd. Great selection but count in some wait times.

A mission to get there from LA city, takes over an hour as traffic horrendous! Beach nice but had to pay $70 for 2 sun beds & a parasol & that was the rate whether it was a few hours, half a day or more! Pier very tacky a bit like Brighton, to be avoided.

column2: Santa Monica Pier | Old fashioned fun
column3: I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect of Santa Monica Pier it doesn‚Äôt have the same polish as some of the other piers but it has an old school charm about it. The Pier was crowded on the day we visited but I like hustle and bustle so that wasn‚Äôt an issue, though you are very conscious to keep your bag close to you. Everything was reasonably priced and the queues weren‚Äôt too bad especially given that we went during spring break.The highlight for my children aged 6yrs and 8yrs old were the vintage arcade games which they thought were hilarious (but where are all the colours Mum?).If you are there in the evening you must take a quick walk on the beach to get a phot of the Ferris wheel lit up it‚Äôs beautiful.

I suppose people want to see this because it‚Äôs popular, but it‚Äôs not worth it. Try manhattan beach. It‚Äôs less crowded and has an all around better vibe. Still cool to see this though if you haven‚Äôt before.

We stayed in Santa Monica for one night to rest after landing at LAX from Australia. We're glad we did as the pier was a few minutes walk away and is open every day.There's lots to look at if you don't want to spend much - buskers, the views, etc - and of course heaps of rides and activities if you so desire.The afternoon gets very busy to an uncomfortable level so we made it a quick trip, but we ducked down again the next morning right on opening and it was quite pleasant. No bumping shoulders, no waits for rides so the kids were far happier.And the morning sees empty beaches so you can always go down the stairs directly to the beach for a stroll.The ride tickets are bought from a ticket booth, the line moves quite quickly.There's a few eating places here, but you can always walk a few hundred metres back to the mainland for other eats.

column2: Locals and tourists mixing it up
column3: It has everything you would expect on a pier - rides, shopping, lots of fried foods (a couple of nice seafood restaurants (not Bubba Gumps...), and a great view. Seemingly never ending wide beaches and plenty of activity (biking, boarding and walking). A definite stop as you make your way up or down the coast.
Walking along the beach and on the pier made me so happy! It was busy but organized and well kept. It‚Äôs a beautiful backdrop to every photo!

NOTE: TYPE OF VISIT: FAMILY NO KIDS(This wasn't option, so I had to mark 'friends').Eight adults without children had a blast here! Unless you count those of us who acted like a kid again. This place brings out the kid in, no matter how old you are. The sun was out and the weather was perfect.So many vendors on the boardwalk and lots of singers. With hundreds of people on the beach and pier, the coast guard and police helicopters kept busy flying over. We paid the $10 per person to ride the ferris wheel. (It's not as large as the one back home in Washington state, but still fun). We even saw two seals near the fishermen off the lower dock. After spending over 5 hours on the boardwalk / pier, we where too tired to walk on the boardwalk down on the beach. Maybe next time.

Arrived at Santa Monica Pier late back from Santa Barbara. Parking was a little confusing to find. Lucky parking wasn't too bad. Got a spot easily. However still paid even it was at night.The Pier was still packed with people and selling stalls. All the fun rides and restaurants were still open. As we already had had dinner before, we didn't experience any restaurants there. But the one at the beginning of the Pier looked good.One thing I didn't like was the small stalls (hawkers) on the pier. It's just not nice to see.I recommend to go there early, maybe have a swim in the ocean too.

It is at the end of Route 66 and also a fun place with amusements, rides, food and numerous characters. In some ways it makes you feel a bit like you are in Key West, with the characters present. We arrived in a motor home and parking was $58, but admission to the boardwalk and beach is free, which reduces the pain of parking. Car parking is much cheaper.
A fun place for the whole family. Parking is available. Shops, music & a few rides.Definitely check out the sunset while here

I wish we could have gotten there at a different time. We arrived late in the day. Parking was fine once we figured out exactly where to go. The big parking lot was the best choice but we weren‚Äôt sure exactly how to get there and ended up in a jam packed smaller lot that had no spots and hard to get out of. Since we had spent our day in Malibu seeing Pepperdine, we were pretty tired when we got there so we really didn‚Äôt get the full feel of this iconic place. So, my opinion is to go earlier in the day and really try to enjoy all it has to offer. I‚Äôm only giving it 3 stars because we really didn‚Äôt get to experience it all.
Santa Monica Pier is very famous sightseeing spot. At night is very beautiful! And beach can be so relaxing!!

For years I have wanted to visit the Santa Monica Pier. We finally decided to visit, and I was sadly disappointed. First off traffic and parking was a nightmare. I missed the city lots and ended up paying $40 for ‚Äúpublic parking‚Äù off of Ocean Ave and Colorado Ave. The pier was very congested. We stopped at Pacific Park to ride the Ferris wheel. It was $10 each to ride. The staff was very nice. The ride was lackluster. I‚Äôm considered petite at only 5‚Äô3‚Äù, my view from the seat was poor. The cabin was well constructed, I felt very protected and secure, but there was no thrill. We walked all the way to the end of the pier, the views were great. Walking back to the car was a challenge for my husband who has mobility issues. The pier is very steep, and there are no provisions for disabled people, as far as I could see. I was hoping for an elevator, but there was none I did find a switchback walkway off of Appian Way. Overall, we chalked it up to been there done that, wouldn‚Äôt do it again.TIPS: Look for parking off Pacific Coast Highway, not Ocean Ave. If you have mobility issues, park on the pier and show your handicap sticker. If you plan to go on more than one ride, buy a pass, it's much cheaper and to save more buy them online.

column2: Great to visit, is what it is though....
column3: Great to visit, really quirky amusements and entertainment, worth a walk up and down the pier for sure! Looks great at night all lit up!

Came on a loverly Autumn day where it wasn‚Äôt too hot and not too cold. A fantastic walk along the beach to the pier, great photo opportunities and nice people.I thought that parking was going to be a nightmare and when I arrived to find 2 lots closed due to refurbishment my anxiety rose even more. But if you continue along past the pier (coming from Malibu) there is a HUGE parking lot with a flat rate of $10! Perfect. It‚Äôs about a 10 minute walk back to the pier, but like I said, what a great walk!We also had lunch at Bubba Gumps which was brilliant!!!

This was a great place to view the ocean, shop, and eat. Musicians are all over singing and playing interesting instruments. Great prices on souvenirs and beach wear. Their are activities for the kids to do but we were just a couple on a trip this time. We ate at Pier Burger. It was good.It was very windy that day (wind gusts up to 30 mph) so we didn't stay long. It was cold. Everyone was friendly.
We walked the pier twice and loved hanging out here! We didn‚Äôt even go on any of the attractions or have any food. We just had a grand time hanging out! Super cool place
Visited in the evening and most places shutting too early. Would think that it would be better in summer.

We spent the entire afternoon and most of the morning here. We had 2, 3 1/2 year olds and there is plenty to do for everyone. We got them the wristbands to ride the rides and they had a blast. There are plenty of nice rides for this age group and picnic tables if you want to pack a lunch, which we did. There are also several food options and restrooms available. We also rode the ferris wheel and had a lovely time.

We went here after dinner to have a fun last night in LA and it was the best time. The Ferris wheel is amazing. You really don‚Äôt realize how high up it goes until your there. The rides are awesome because there‚Äôs some stuff for adults and some for children. Must go place!

The iconic Santa Monica pier is a great spot for Some people watching, walking around, great ocean views and photography.It‚Äôs conveniently located and easy to get to from most spots in town.It‚Äôs Visitors are of all ages.The rides are fun, but not a must.If in town the pier should be visited
Was lucky enough to go twice in 2 days! Beautiful area, lots to do and see. Highly recommended. Food at restaurants around have good prices and food was great!

Loved going here. Connecting with the ocean is always priority for me. There was an artist there who was doing and exhibit about multiculturalism also. There were several other artists there and tasty snacks. I had a great time with my family.

We were staying at a nearby hotel, so headed out to walk the pier several times. It really is a fun atmosphere and we felt totally safe the whole time we were there. For a treat walk ALL the way down the pier to the Mexican restaurant, it's way out on the end and is really good.

My children really enjoyed the pier and the rides it is quite expensive therefore it is important to allow enough time to use the full day pass.Although it was a chilly afternoon/evening it was really busy. It is a must do and the views are great.

The ear is the organ of hearing and, in mammals, balance. In mammals, the ear is usually described as having three parts‚Äîthe outer ear, middle ear and the inner ear. The outer ear consists of the pinna and the ear canal.

column2: Fun for the kids - especially at night
column3: The kids enjoyed the rides and the views. It's expensive to ride, so plan to spend a couple of hours and get the day pass if you have the time.

Even though it was a cooler day for LA, it was still packed out here, so definitely be prepared to be dealing with a crowd, especially if it's a fine summer's day.The views are beautiful and there are plenty of places to stop off for photos. You can see right back along Santa Monica and Venice Beach.The iconic Pacific Park with ferris wheel and roller coasters is about halfway down the pier. There is no admission fee, so you can come and go as you please, and you can either pay per ride, or pick up an unlimited ride wristband depending how badly you want to go on everything. This is great if you're just after a trip up the ferris wheel. There is a discount for buying online in advance.There are plenty of souvenir shops out on the pier, with clothing, knick-knacks and all the usual fare. A couple of my favourite spots were actually the little carts that were parked along the pier, the souvenirs were a little more unique and there were even a few US made things to pick up. I grabbed these magnets to add to the fridge collection.There are cafes, restaurants, and bars out on the pier, from something for a full meal at The Albright or Bubba Gump Shrimp, or snacks and coffee at the Park.

Very crowded today. Which was surprising because the weather was so cold. But we still enjoyed our family outing. You may even run into a celebrity or two while you‚Äôre there. Lots to do and see. Many restaurants to choose from. Parking is a nightmare, so get down there before the crowd.

Great fun to wander around the pier and the amusements. My daughter particularly liked the carousel which is always a favourite of hers. Great to amble along by the beach and kick start our holiday with a relaxed vibe.

column2: Great walk, lots to see and do
column3: Walked along the pier, great street performers and things to do. Walk along the beach and see the skate park, gym and shops.It‚Äôs a must to see and cheap as well!

Admittedly we went in the morning when t was closed so we couldn‚Äôt really pick up the vibe of the place but it looks like your typical travelling rides except for the large roller coaster. The pier is nice for a walk though. Parking at the pier will set you back around $14.

One climbs up and down the fairly steep bridge to cross the beach road. But it is worth it. The pier is not particularly long but it has a wide central wooden promenade that allows for fairly spaced musicians and the usual stands. The overall effect is not tacky and that is part of its charm.
The heart of Santa Monica. Very nice place to visit. Much much busier on the weekends.Lots of little place to eat or have a drink along the way.Love watching the kites

It was A lot of fun. Lots of street performers and the little theme park. The good however is pretty overpriced and not tasty. The ice cream I had there was probably the worst I've ever had. The churros were good though.
Another iconic LA landmark that just has to be visited. Went on a beautiful day and just strolled around the beach and pier.

I had no idea that the Santa Monica Pier was such a tourist attraction but found it was really worth a visit. Buskers, stalls and rides were interesting to see and a lovely view of the beach and hills. We also had a nice lunch and there are plenty of options for food depending on your taste and budget.
Lovely to visit. Parking was $14 and you needed cash and the pier closed at 8.30pm (Thursday night) so get there early.

column2: Fun to walk down but not worth staying
column3: If you‚Äôre into over-priced crappy food then enjoy! Otherwise, come and have a look and the Ferris wheel and stand above the Pacific Ocean and take in the sea breeze. Then leave.
Don't bother...too touristy and difficult to make your way to the pier.... all selling the same crap.

The restaurant at the end of the pier offers some fabulous vistas of the ocean and Pacific Palisades while being close enough to the shops and attractions that the pier boasts. Try and spot wild sea lions on the west side of the pier!

Visited Santa Monica recently the pier was a must very vibrant full of interesting stalls musicians and planes to eat. It's old with wooden wallkboards giant Ferris wheels rides for the kids and something for everyone and it's free to go
This is a very touristy site. lots of people between the beach and the pier.. Fun place to walk and watch people..

column2: Nice beach. Good restaurants. Small theme park for kids.
column3: It's a good place for a stroll on the beach side, there are some good restaurants around with a variety of cuisine to choose from. There are many paid rides for kids to enjoy at the small theme park too. I saw a few people with fishing rods near the pier. The beach is nice and clean and perfect to spend a sunny afternoon or partying at the clubs around from evening. Avoid going there if its raining, a lot of small puddles come up.

column2: Great beach, dining, shopping and fun on the pier
column3: A lovely beach great for photos at sunset. Good shopping and dining across the road. We had a great Mexican meal at Red Os - they have a happy hour between 5 and 6. The pier fun fair is expensive but we enjoyed the $10 Ferris wheel ride. We used Uber to get there which saves the hassles of parking there. Traffic can be busy weekend evenings even after 9 pm.
Lines were quite long for the rides--but it was over Spring Break!Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier had great service & fabulous margaritas!!
A great place to have fun, lots of show and many games.Some snacks shops and few restaurants.Great view of the ocean.I like the place at night night, but it‚Äôs not safe to swim.

It's hard to describe what is really special about Santa Monica Pier and the beach next to it. I have been to better piers and I have been to better beaches but every time I visit Los Angeles (I lived there a long time ago) I feel a need to go down to the pier to see if those fried clam sandwiches are still available, have one of those not so great but cold lemonades. Walk all the way to the end and then make it down to the beach, take off my shoes and dig my toes in the sand. I am often introducing someone new to the scene and they always seem to love it.
Pier was just ok. Nice to see it and walk on it but overrated in my opinion. Heavy crowds and commotion. Beach was nice though.
We had fun on the rides, had a bite to eat. Watched street acts and people fishing with a hungry seal swimming by üòÄ
Yes there a lot of travelers but it is defintiely a must visit! Great for people watching (especially muscle beach, just saying ;)) and also for taking nice shots.

Boy, did I get a look at our tax dollars at work!!! üò≥üò´ The beach sand is FULL of bandaids, cigarette butts, plus every other human filth u could think up!My daughter nearly stepped in pile of human feces on sidewalk. üò≤Numerous homeless probably needing more than beach front stroll.Disappointed & disgusted.
Get your kicks on Route 66! Everything from churros to delicious seafood on the Santa Monica Pier! The view is breathtaking. *le sigh
This was a nice place to people watch. Great beach, amusement park, places to eat and street performers. Check out Bubba Gumps for their shrimp macaroni.

column2: One of those must do stops
column3: This is a fun place to relax, enjoy meals, activities and people watch. Always seems to be a hopping place for adults or the whole family.
the sunset is beautiful, the parking only costs 10 dollars the day of sunrise at sunset, according to the season of the year.

column2: A Tourist Place. Good Photos Though
column3: Tourist place. Don't expect wonders. However, it's a decent place for photos and to soak up the atmosphere. Some great singers busking there. So do check them out.Rides should be fun for kids though.Tip: Parking is ridiculous at the Pier! 14 bucks per entry! Go park at 2nd Street. Stayed for 3.5 hours for 4.9 USD. (You get free 1.5 hour and it's a 5 min walk away)You are welcome!
I can‚Äôt imagine how a touristic is not prepared for an electricity outage. The theme park had to issue refunds to all visitors and the restaurants stopped serving people. So we had to leave
Had fun here with friendsGot to see the skaters on the beach; just like you see I'm the movies.Great day
Came to Santa Monica pier to do the touristy stuff and to be honest not as fun as I expected, we had more enjoyment walking between Venice and Santa Monica pier than anything else!

column2: The end of the road for Route 66
column3: A nice stroll soaking up the sun and fun. Good coffee stops and a great atmosphere. Just be a bit wary of drunk locals.

column2: What‚Äôs a visit to LA without Santa Monica pier
column3: Santa Monica pier is always going to be on your LA visit list. Great for a nice day shopping and eating out
Super touristy but worth the time spent. This was my 2md time visiting but the 1st time I've been at night. The ferris wheel was lit up like a Christmas tree on steroids! Amazing!

We‚Äôre staying in Santa Monica for three days so have visited the pier a few times. Of course the evenings are much busier, but great family ambience. Would definitely recommend to come. Good mixture of rides, food, buskers and souvenirs.
Once you‚Äôve seen one pier you seen Them all. So many tourists a little chaotic. Hold onto your kids!
Its a must go. Even though parking is a headache this is a beautiful place to have fun.With kids no kids soll or couple its a place to go.

column2: End of route 66! What a fun day!
column3: We came here not really knowing what to expect but what a fun day we had. Rode the Ferris Wheel and walked the entire length of the pier. We came early in the morning (around 9:30 - 10) and what a perfect time. It wasn't super busy. Not at all crowded. So many things to see. Lots of vendors, buskers. (One really strange guy that sings and dances. He was hilarious and really fun to watch.) Bought a few Route 66 souvenirs (of course!). Also rented some Bird scooters. What fun they were. You just download the app on your phone and find one that is available to rent. They aren't crazy expensive and we had a blast on them. It was hard to find 2 that didn't have dead batteries. But once we did we went up and down the bike path a few times. All the way to Venus Beach! For an activity we didn't really plan to do it was one of the highlights of our trip!
A lovely, bustling pier with plenty to do and see. It was nice standing and watching people fish and feed the seals. Plenty of places to eat.
Cute pier with games and family rides. Great place to take pics. You can't visit Santa Monica without visiting the pier.
Despite the small number of rides, the kids had a great time on all of them. Spent a few hours here with kids ranging from 10-14.
The pier was really crowded and not really that impressive... it‚Äôs nice for a couple of pictures but not much else

We were in LA in early April so going to the pier with rides and activities for the kids was perfect because it was too cold to fully go swimming. My son had fun walking the pier, we ate, rode a few rides, and put our feet in the water on the beach. There's a place on the pier that rents umbrellas and chairs pretty cheaply so you don't have to bring a bunch of gear if you want to hang out on the sand. It was a fun day.

We had a few hours to spend going up the PCH and wanted to visit the Santa Monica Pier !! It was nice and cozy and there were beaches all around. Bicycles are available for rent and the boardwalk itself had lots of shops and stores to buy souvenirs. There were also rides for the kids. Pretty cool place !!
The pier was smaller than I imagined, however stunning views from all angles! Fun rides, a few food venues and parking all around.
The place is great but also the amount of people there, amazing place, you can get what you want but the prices are also

We only had half a day before flying home so we drove up to santa monica. Found parking easier. Weather was beautiful and sunny. It was everything i pictured.We walked around the beach and boardwalk.Road on the ferris wheel for a better view.Was a lovely way to end out trip
Really enjoyed this. Lots of people performing, little stalls and a good little arcade for kids. Nice atmosphere.We didn't go on any rides but thought the pier was great and worth the visit.

Went here with my 12 and 16 year old daughters. We rode a couple rides and enjoyed people watching at the pier. Only downside was that rides were quite pricey, $10 for a roller coaster that wasn‚Äôt that big or that long of a ride for example. After that we walked on the beach a bit.

Enjoyed walking around Santa Monica and the pier. It's absolutely beautiful around this area. We got there first thing in the morning, so found parking very easily and got to walk around the pier & the area before the crowds came. We did the Ferris wheel and although it seemed a bit pricey - the ride is fairly long and the views are worth it.

column2: Had a Great Time at S M Pier
column3: We went to this historical place with the granddaughter walk around and let her ride the rides, had a wonderful time here very reasonable. lot of things to do and a great atmosphere to

column2: An upscale version of Coney Island
column3: This place was nice to visit. A family oriented place, lots to do, very casual and laidback, easy going, great ocean views, and great ice cream and funnel cake. For those of us from the Northeast U.S., it may remind you of Coney Island, but more upscale. Walk across to the promenade on Third Street. It‚Äôs an upscale shopping street, pedestrian only. It‚Äôs like Lincoln Road in Miami‚Äôs South Beach.

Santa Monica Pier is a place to come and visit whilst visiting in Los Angeles. Plus being of historical interest too. Walked along the whole length of it. Was very busy the day I went. Enjoyed the walk along it and to be able to see what it had to offer. There was a small amusement park on the pier too which I did not go into but interesting to see. A must see, plus to see where Route 66 starts from.

The pier is like going to a carnival or fair for the day. It can get pretty pricey if you want to play arcade games. There is a restaurant at the end of the pier but I don't suggest it. It's over priced and there is much better food in Santa Monica.Tip: Get there earlier when it opens at 11am and it's not bad. By 2 in the afternoon, it was getting really busy.Parking tip: There is a $5/day lot on weekends about 2 blocks away on Main Street. You can cut through Tongva Park which is a really cute/cool park that also has public bathrooms you can hit on your way in and as you leave. It's cheaper and allows you to avoid the busy traffic on Ocean. I think that same lot has a $14/day cap on weekdays.

You have to visit Santa Monica Pier. It's an amazing place to chill in and relax. I recommend the restaurants there are around this Area. They are amazing.Also if you like the games and rolling coaster, you can ride in the games and rolling coaster it has. They are not extreme a lot but it's funny.Hope you enjoy when visit Santa Monica PierInstagram: Dieg0barrera
Had a lovely time walking the pier twice . So fun to people watch. Had drinks and guac at the end of the pier. Loved it.

column2: Classic carousel on the pier at Santa Monica
column3: Who can resist a carousel? The Santa Monica Pier has beautiful completely restored and revitalized carousel. The detail in the painting of the horses, carriages, walls is beautify. On the wall there are posters explaining the history of the ride and details on what it took to renovate. Price to ride is nominal, but the genuine fun of the ride is special. Don't miss it if you are in the neighborhood. Also of interest to our party was the airplane ride. Round and round, up and down. Fun for the 3 year old.
Beautiful views of the beach and the ocean - and lots of fun people watching, too. Variety of boardwalk eateries and shops. You don‚Äôt need to spend any money to have a great time here!

column2: Neat place to visit but not if you‚Äôre using mobility equipment.
column3: Left the teens behind at the travel trailer and decided to check out the Santa Monica Pier.First challenge was maneuvering my knee scooter down the ramp and then onto the pier made of boards. Nope, it didn‚Äôt occur to me that the pier would be a boardwalk and I know better! So, the use of a knee scooter was a major challenge because of the knots and gaps in the wood boards but I managed to make it to the end.Several street performers were available to listen to while each one sang or played their music. One guy would artistically write whatever name you wanted and create a large name card. Several overpriced gift shops, rides, and other stuff. The most fascinating thing to me was the colorful Ferris wheel and all its LED lighting and ever changing designs.We visited after 8pm but there were still a lot of people there. This pier would be a great place to visit if you wanted to chill out and people watch and listen to the performers.Gotta visit at least once! Next time we‚Äôll come by during the day when it‚Äôs light out. And when my sprained ankle is fully healed!
The place is litterly electric and the re is so much to do here because there is roller coaster and a Ferris wheel üé° here and everything .
Visited in late afternoon. Enjoyed the performers. Kids got a name sign made in Rainbow art which was really cool. Didn't get on any rides. Nice to walk the pier and take pictures.

Great place to visit for a family outing. Great place to take pictures while also a thrilling experience. It get's very crowded with guests so I would recommend if coming from recent flight to leave personal belongings at residency. The Santa Monica Pier aquarium right below the carousel is also a great place to check out when at the pier.
great fun on the pier , can spend day easily entertained with watching water and people on the beach or eating on the pier with game rooms there also.
Loved the pier. The atmosphere was fun and crazy and busy. The view beautiful. Hard to park later in the day so earlier the better. Lots of good choices. Lots of entertainment. Glad we visited.
Loved this beach and pier ! Lots of good food and a little bit of shopping. The scene here is peaceful and fun. I‚Äôd definitely return !

This is just a place you have to visit if you are in the area. It just feels nostalgic. The street performers have designated spaces and some are better than others of course. The day we visited there was a fantastic magician on the pier that we really enjoyed. There are rides, but we didn‚Äôt ride. It was just a fun little outing. We ate at the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier and the food was great. You could tell it would really be a fun spot on a warm night. Unfortunately we were there on a gloomy cool morning. It felt like a safe place to be with plenty of parking. I wouldn‚Äôt plan on spending a whole day there, but definitely worth the effort to get there for the experience.

My sons had never been. A visit to LA is hardly complete if you don't walk the pier. People watching is fun. My youngest ride the small roller coaster. My wife took pictures of all the hustle and bustle. My eldest took selfies to show his friends. It is what it is and it's never boring!
Was a very rainy overcast day when we visited but so worth a look and a meal Old carousel beautiful some works going on in buildings on the pier
The Santa Monica Pier is the must famous beach In LA and i really love the place and the atmosphere of the beach

column2: Worth a visit. Go in the evening.
column3: We enjoyed a wonderful couple of hours on the Pier after sunset. The place is gorgeous with all the lights and the crowds were likely smaller. Lots to see and do. People watching is free if you want to save some $$s
This is a nice pier, but very crowded at times. It is close to food and great shops. Great place to visit!!! This is like my 2nd or 3rd time visiting. Always enjoy it

column2: A Worthwhile Visit, except Parking Costs $$$
column3: Parking around the Santa Monica Pier costs a lot and most parking lots close at 7pm. We wanted to watch the sunset and the Ferris Wheel light up, so we ended up paying USD$25 for "all-day" parking. It was crowded all along the boardwalk. Several unlicensed vendors, "churro ladies" were calling out from the bridge to the pier, selling churros at USD$1 compared to the much higher prices at licensed carts on the pier. Many street performers, artists & food vendors line the boardwalk, making it a very interesting walk. A diversity of people were fishing by the rails. They have the convenience of benches to rest on, fish-cleaning facilities, and multi-level, wheelchair accessible balconies to fish from. There's even a small bait & tackle shop at the end of the pier run by very experienced anglers. I love that a visit to the Santa Monica Pier can cost as little or as much as the visitor wants to spend: from just USD$6 for parking before 7pm to spending on carousel rides, spending at the arcade, spending on trapeze school, spending on amusement park rides and games in Pacific Park, and of course, on food!

It was a great trip! I‚Äôm glad we rented bikes it was worth it :) the weather was good. Traffic is a joke better to leave after 8 or 9 am or 7-9 pm avoid during the day it‚Äôs bumper to number üöó üöôüò°

column2: Touristy, go once sort of place
column3: This could be an arcade pier anywhere - cheap food, performers, crowds, wind... I guess it would be fun for youngsters, but don't waste an Uber trip there if your time is limited.
It was a stop for us because it was a famous pier. Nothing exciting unless you are into carnival rides. Food court feel too. We stayed long enough to see it and left

Got to spend a great couple of hours at Santa Monica Pier last month. Weather was perfect for March! We didn‚Äôt go on any rides, instead enjoyed the stalls and entertainers spread out along the pier. Good selection of places to eat as well.

column2: A nice day out although very crowded
column3: It was a nice day out and a good experience , there was city WiFi on there if that interests anyone. The were lots of food places and an amazing hotdog cart just on the pier (Japadog) not to expensive either, would recommend highly. There were few shops and other things to do and views were amazing off the pier in you could see seals and sea lions swimming if your lucky. Some great entertainment at the end with a superb drummer.

column2: Very cool to see in person, but probably only need to see once
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is very cool to see. Pictures come out very nice. We were there before sundown. Mostly tourists. It was busy. The beach is nice. Fun to play on all of the rings and swings. We ate at the Albright and it was really good. Had the Mahi Mahi tacos. They had some street vendors and little shops. Had fun and took a lot of pictures. Don‚Äôt think night time would be very safe to be there though.

column2: Showcase stop with out of towners..........................
column3: Found parking easy in near by city garage........we walked onto pier with lights blazing on Pier sign, Ferris wheel, merry-go-round and many folks strolling and enjoying the evening.Great range of food options, attractions, etc. Walk to end of Pier and check out fishing experts. Excellent people watching location....................

I am sure this pier is an amazing place to hang in the evenings. We visited in the morning and there were really only life around 10 am, but an must visit with great walks, interesting people and nice restaurants and street vendors. Beautiful view and touristy feel. A must visit when you are around Santa Monica.

column2: An iconic location that has seen better days?
column3: While in the area, it was recommended we visit this location. Locating on-street metered parking for $2/hr was a good move as the public parking ranged from $15 - $20. Walking along the scenic Palisades Park just north of the pier provided a great view of the beautiful beaches, the ocean and the pier. We walked to the entrance ramp that leads directly down to the pier. This was quite steep for approx. 1/4 mile. I imagine this might be an issue for those with walking restrictions that might want to make use of a drop off location at the entrance to the pier at the bottom of the hill and before the paid parking lot. If you have never been to an ocean amusement pier or boardwalk before you may find this a very exciting and different location. If you are from the Jersey shore, the coast of Maine or Connecticut where boardwalks and piers are common and filled with seasonal fun you may not find this to be worth the visit. Many traditional rides, traditional food offerings, t - shirt and novelty vendors abound. If you walk all the way out to the end of the pier you will see a lower level that is used by folks fishing off of the pier. A large, multi - level restaurant anchors the end of the pier but it was too early for us to take in a meal. I will say the end of the pier facing back to the beaches make great photos as evidenced by the incredible number of people using selfie -sticks to be part of the photos. It did appear that a large number of deck boards had been replaced recently and there is a small but informative history of the pier dating back to 1914. Additionally we learned this was the end ( or beginning) of the orginal Route 66 from Chicago to LA. We enjoyed the walk through and then proceed up to 3rd Ave Promenade , about two blocks from the pier, for some shopping and people watching.

column2: Fun place to go, no too special though
column3: I didn't have much time in LA, and we're not fans of Hollywood stuff, so we figured Santa Monica should work. It was enjoyable overall, but didn't make me love LA, it's pretty average and very similar to attractions I've seen in other cities. Some street performers, a lovely sunset, a beach (chilly in March though), some cheap rides and a few unattractive cafes. The souvenir shops don't have anything interesting to offer, although I would have loved a souvenir from LA, couldn't find anything worthy, just regular touristy stuff. If you only have one day in LA, I don't recommend this place. If you have more days and the weather is good, then maybe you will enjoy Santa Monica.

Very clean, few different arcades and restaurants including bubba gump. Local entertainers along the pier who were very good. Route 66 sign on the pier for pictures. Good views of the beaches and fun fair. Lovely break from the beach. Would happily go back.
Santa Monica Pier ... Is a must visit if your in LA there is entertainers along the pier and the food stop off a Bubba is amazing ...
The famous Pier was busy. We watched the sunset, and the kids enjoyed the Arcade. So fun, and a memorable part of our Spring Break Vacation!
Not a lot going on here, it was okay to visit but not really that great of an attraction. Some old rides which are not cheap and a few vendors.
Nice crowded place with lots of activities and food diversity. Not enough courage to have fruits from street sellers though.

Went to Santa Monica pier in order to see the iconic pier, but found myself on the pier sorrounded by cars and a roller coster. Why is anything beautiful spoiled by the american urge to squeeze the last dollar out of the tourists.
Not sure what the hype is. Place is filthy. Places to eat were even filthy. Santa Monica needs to clean the place up.

column2: More fun than I would have expected
column3: Went here twice during a recent trip to Santa Monica and LA. The weather was spectacular. Kids enjoyed the arcade and the games were in decent shape. Ride the West Coaster roller coaster. It‚Äôs very tame but you get amazing views from the top and you get two rides for the price of one ticket. The souvenir shops have typical stuff in them but surprisingly were not overpriced. Parking there is tough. We walked from the hotel.
Our two grand-daughters (2 and 4) loved all of their rides. Particularly good that we could call an Uber right onto the Pier to take them home.

column2: Tired place but great for people watching
column3: On a very busy Saturday, we checked this out and it about met our expectations, which were pretty low. Great people watching but the whole thing was a bit tired.
Certainly the nicer part of LA. The pier is exactly as you see it on tV but is really aimed at children with the types of rides it has. not a lot of quality food options here either.

I brought friends from out of town here and we walked the path to Venice Beach and back. Even though it was a rare, overcast and at time rainy day. The lit up Ferris wheel makes a good instagrammable moment. Good variety of restaurants in the general area.
It gets really crowded so finding a place to sit down with a blanket is a little hard but the views are really amazing.
Nothing abosolutely amazing about this place... Yes it is a famous location, but there is not much to see there... just another pier with activities around it... Been there... not again !!!
So much to do with such great restaurants! We stayed right in the middle of the action so we could walk everywhere.

yes, it's touristy and lots of people...came here at night with the family and loved our time there...went on the roller coaster and the scrambler, played a few games and looked around and took some pics...then to dinner with a uber from the pier, very convenient from our hotel at casa del mar. what a great night!

There lots of vendors and performers at the pier! You will have a chance to take stunning pictures and have a very relaxing and fun time at one of the most iconic beaches in the world! Definitely would recommend!
Popped down to the pier last night, was very busy, but made a nice walk. Plenty to do for families with kids.
Well maintained pier worth a stroll down, doesn‚Äôt cost anything to get on the pier but rides you have to pay for which is normal, if in Santa Monica it would be rude not to go and see

Hoping to capture some of the nostalgia, the seedy nature of the scene is a bit overwhelming. It is what it is, but classing up the area a bit could do it a lot of good. It's a tourist trap, but it needs to hold on tighter to its history to warrant a visit.
Kids attrations + Sun + Beach = Kids Fun! This is the ingredients to have one amazing day in Santa Monica Pier.

We recently moved to Los Angeles, so we‚Äôve been trying to get to know our new home a little better. We both really enjoyed the beauty and lights of the Santa Monica Pier! While we didn‚Äôt go on the rides, we still enjoyed walking along the pier and taking in the sunset.At night, the pier truly comes to life. The lights and the shows are even more magical against a dark city. Of course the pier is a great attraction during the day, it just seems to take on a whole different vibe. Overall, I would definitely recommend for both locals and visitors.
Attractions were closed in morning when we went, but still good to get a view of the surrounds while buskers play. And saw our first seals of the trip...

column2: Gross. Don't waste your time, it stinks and there's garbage everywhere.
column3: We visited this place on 3/27/18 and it was gross. The arcade is packed with people with B.O and the food options are also poor. I would consider it a classic tourist trap. The only fun thing about the Pier and the beach area to the south is the people watching. Lots of "interesting" folks to observe and enjoy the spectacle. Parking in the area is also a nightmare - be prepared with plenty of patience! My advice though - don't bother!
Easy to get to and lovely to walk round when it's not too busy the famous wheel is awesome love the place
Walk along the beach to the pier. This is a classical LA experience. adjacent to the pier is a side show of tightrope, rings and other acrobatics.

column2: Love to visit Santa Monica Pier ~ Fun and beautiful!
column3: Love to visit Santa Monica Pier. It's fun to see the sights, the people, and the Ocean has a beautiful view of the sunset. I love to hang out here. The street vendors, etc. The food in the Santa Monica area is great. The Rides on the pier are great. My kids absolutely love coming to Santa Monica.

We were at the pier for a quick day trip. It has something for all ages. Be sure to ride the antique carousel - a cheap and fun diversion! We also highly recommend partaking in the free tours that are offered the visitor center at the east end of the pier. Our guide gave us a fantastic historic overview of the pier as we strolled it‚Äôs length. Highly recommend!!
I liked the pier and pacific park but it was too crowded and anything out of the ordinary. It was cool to have a walk there but too much noise and people with noisy instuments.
Went to the pier on a whim and it turned out to be a very good afternoon. The history, shops, food, games and rides really made it the all around experience for our family.

I think it goes without saying that if your in SoCal near the coast you should visit the pier. It‚Äôs an iconic California landmark that many people would recognize from pictures and movies. It‚Äôs a cool place to walk and people watch. I like coming at night to see all the lights.

column2: Interesting only because so near the city
column3: Sorry. Not a fan. I have seen alot of boardwalks and this is just one of many and not very special. There are performers that are interesting but I was not impressed overall.

Went with my partner and Daughter. We had the best time. So much fun. It was a great sunny but cool day. The roller coaster was the highlight. I love rides and even though this isn‚Äôt the biggest or fastest coaster I have been on, it was just fun. Lots of side alley games as well, try your luck at winning a prize. Gift stores and places to eat.
Nice place for a good walk under the sun.Lot of shops for tourist.Street art a bit everywhere.Some bars and restaurant.

I loved stopping by the Pier during my trip to LA. Beautiful views and the swings on the beach were a nice treat.It was windy and cold when I visited but I could tell it would be a great place to go on a sunny summer day.

So I visited Santa Monica Pier with a large group and mainly hung out at the beach. There is a staircase down to the beach just past Bubba Gump Shrimp. From afar it looks like lots of restaurants, shopping and tourists. Be ready for crowds.

The pier is pretty. The kids had a good time. They walked to the pier and back several times. The only problem is that you have to pay 30 for a wristband and then extra for the ride the kids really wanted to go on. It should be included.

column2: This Stop Gives You A Local Flavor of the Area.
column3: This stop provides you with a stunning view of the ocean and the coast line. It also provides a local flare of the characters in the area. Just a nice stroll for a relaxing day.

In my opinion the visit is only worthy for pictures and walking. Shows are a scam (the same Route66 mug doubles the price here than Hollywood Blvd). Arcades are fun but I think they take advantage of people's nostalgia.

Good place for a later afternoon early evening stroll, though it is very busy. You can drive your car and park in the carpark off to the side of the pier. Big Ferris wheel and some rides. Lots of souvenir shops and some places to eat and street entertainment. Walk to the end and watch the sun go down or go fishing Went in march so really windy and cold so take a warm article of clothing

Very crowded and parking is insane so be prepared to drive to several parking lots before you find one that isn't full. Everything is expensive, but food was decent. Rides cost a lot, but you can get a band for a fair price if you are staying for the day. Worth a one time trip, but won't visit again.
Went on a Sunday and waiting time. was an hour at bubba gumps. Drove back to Anaheim and went to red lobster instead.
