We went on the rainiest day of our vacation of course. Very easy to find parking. The beach area was very clean. I could have stayed for hours watching the waves roll in.

column2: Stunning ocean views and lively characters
column3: We took the bus from Beverly Hills down to Santa Monica (about half an hour to 45 minutes) and had one of the best leisurely Sunday afternoons I've ever had. While the pier was very busy, it just added to the atmosphere that everyone was there to have a good time and enjoy the sun. The views of the Pacific Ocean were also stunning, accompanied by a live violinist entertaining the crowds. We didn't get chance to go into the funfair, but still appreciated the iconicity of it, and everyone there seemed to be having a great time.

Santa Monica pier is one of the best piers I've visited. From the beginning to the end and back. Although we didn't go on the carousel this time it's so big its housed in its own building, which also has a cafe. Outside back on the pier you have all the gift stalls, novelty stalls, a couple of restaurants and of course Bubba Humps Shrimp Co restaurant and gift store. There is a mini fun fair with a spectacular Ferris wheel, which changes its pattern and colour continually. Bungee jump is very popular as is the fishing off the end of the pier. The fisherman can be seen catching the fish then throwing them back into the group's of waiting seals.

column2: It is what you make it
column3: It is what you make it and it is really a hive of activity and the focal point for the area. If you like it is a really brilliant place just to sit and people watch. A lot of activities located here at the pier with rides, cafes and restaurants, and a really good spot to view the sunset over the Pacific but there early to get the best spots. It costs nothing to go on the pier so it is simply what you make it; had a great time.
Everything the pier should be. Pricy but all sorts of foods and amusements. Artists performing and a fun way to spend some time. Good eatery @ Albright‚Äôs - tables in the sun.

Old pier with rides, places to eat, and tourist shops. More cheesy then I thought it would be. I am familiar with the Jersey shore, but the boardwalks in Jersey seem nicer then the Santa Monica pier. Went once and is enough. For families will be fun

column2: Tourist spot with carnival atmosphere. Once was enough for us.
column3: For $30 you can get an all day ride band. But how many times can you ride a small ferris wheel, tiny coaster, and scrambler. They also sell individual ride tix for $8-$10. There are a few restaurants.  Souvenir shops, fair food, and street musicians line the rough wood boardwalk. Parking on a spring day was $10. Not sure if it's more in the summer. Tons of Sandy beach. We heard it is packed towel to towel on hot summer days.The best part was getting off the puer and walking along the paved path northward. Lots of volleyball to watch. Be careful of bikes, scooters, and skaters that share the path.

column2: Meh. Good spot to people watch and ad lib their conversations from afar.
column3: I mean, it‚Äôs the pier. Flocks of sea gulls attacking each other for loose morsels, music artists of varying skill fill the air with sound fading into one another. But per one former professional now turned hip-hop karaoke performer, he loved it and wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Homeless people with signs juxtaposed against gaggles of egotistical teen girls taking endless selfies made me almost jump over the pier, but I noticed the arcade had skee-ball, so I was saved. The little kids meandering about was pretty cute and the fishermen casting out was romantic in a way. Unfortunately, the churro machine broke down as I was in line, so the pangs of hunger in my stomach echoed the pangs of sadness in my soul at this odd little corner of the world.

If you are in LA you have to go to Santa Monica Pier! Tons of people watching and the beach is gorgeous. No need to plan anything special, you can just spend the day walking and taking in the sites. I was most impressed with the views of the mountains up against the ocean. It was breathtaking.

column2: Nice place to walk around but crowded.
column3: If you are in Santa Monica, it is nice to walk to the pier. It can be crowded, particularly on weekends. There is a carnival atmosphere in the middle which is fun for kids. It can be a bit windy and cold.
Homeless the bigest issue. People on thr streets its not good sign of Santa Monica beach.Good parking.It could more coffe shops.

With its amusement rides, shops and numerous vendors, the Santa Monica pier is a true tribute to a bygone era. While the weather did not allow us to sample many of the rides, we did enjoy the carousel (cash only for a ride) and of course the ocean view. I am not a big fan of Mexican food, but the meal I had at Mariasol was very authentic and there are many choices for dining from national chains to street type vendors. Definitely worth a stop if you are in the area.
This Iconic pier deserves a visit. Not to forget when you go to LA. And there is an excellent restaurant at the beginning of the pier where you can eat lobsters.
Went with my 20 year olds and there was something for all of us to enjoy. Beautiful views and plenty of benches if you want to take a break or just people watch.
One of only two things I would recommend doing in Hollywood. The other is Universal. Beach is nice. Pier is fun. Kids had a great time.
Easy to get there with Google maps on phone, parking only $3, fun to stroll. T-shirts for woman were thin, everything looked manish on shirts. Loved.

It's an iconic spot in LA and you can't not go there but don't expected anything particularly fabulous. It's a pleasant walk down the pier but it's probably best viewed from the beach at sunset. The kids will love it!
Grew up going to Coney Island in NY.We had a nice walk. Enjoyed the musicians, artists, & vendors, but it was nothing special.
My husband and I come here often it‚Äôs beautiful to watch the sunset.we and fish it‚Äôs very nice to talk to the regulars they always have interesting stories and something going on.
If kitsch and crowds are your thing, then hooray for the pier. Otherwise, visit the beach instead and steer clear of the pier

I have been to the pier multiple times over the last 9 months.Good to take business associates or the family.There are many rides and a couple of restaurants on the pier. My favorite guilty pleasure, funnel cake and ice cream!!You‚Äôre on the pier and it feels like vacation!Best to go during the day or early evening.
I strongly recommend visiting this area. You should spend at least one day there! Lots of places for parking, beautiful people walking around!

The Santa Monica Pier was amazing. The pier have several places for food, and several shops. There is a nice size arcade located on the pier, and a great view of the beach.This is great for family time, date night, and me time. Choose your kind of night and enjoy it.
The Santa Monica Pier is a tourist attraction similar to the boardwalks at the NJ Shore. There are restaurants, bars, shops and restaurants. It was an ok place to visit for a few hours.
There is a lot to see and do but is crowded. We had a sunny day and enjoyed our visit. Bubba Gumps was good to eat at buy wits can be long so go early and book your spot.

This is not a family friendly destination. The entrance to the pier is laden with vagrants, junkies, and "activists". The pier itself leaves a lot to be desired. A few restaurants, a couple rides, assorted vendors, some street musicians, and an arcade. Nothing special.
The Santa Monica beach has to be seen to be believed and the pier is an excellent vantage point. The plethora of street sellers, musicians and entertainers make this an interesting place to visit.

column2: A visit to famous Santa Monica Pier
column3: Very popular place in Sant Monica. Ferries wheel, restaurant, play fames right on the beach. Lot of great restaurant are close by

column2: Fresh air and fresh fruit...good reason to walk the pier...
column3: The pier is always a fun place to people-watch‚Ä¶After eating lunch at Gilbert‚Äôs on Pico, I took a Blue Bus westbound to downtown Santa Monica, which I was able to board with my Metro TAP card. The Santa Monica Pier shows up in many movies and television shows, so there‚Äôs that, and the people watching. However, my purpose to walk the pier was to, of all things, get a pound tub of fresh fruit‚Ä¶and I mean fresh. They cut the fresh fruit (includes cucumbers, too) of your choosing right in front of you. Watermelon, pineapple, apples, you name it. The dollar amount is comparable to store fruit, but this is so much better, squeezed with lime and a sprinkle of cinnamon‚Äîthe varieties of fresh fruit with all those flavors teasing your taste buds while walking in the open sea air, there is nothing like it. I paid about $7 or $8 for the small tub of fruit and I ate every bit of it and wanted more; I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever felt healthier! Its a good naturally sweet snack, a good alternative to other less healthy choices. Don't get me wrong, I love cotton candy, too, but the fruit is fabulous. The vendors work hard in the hot sun‚Ä¶it is a long day for them, so tip them‚Äîthey really appreciate it. Between the fresh air and fresh fruit it was a good walk on the pier.

It's awesome, don't get me wrong. And this may sound contradictual, but there are too many tourists.. went there at 9 am, and place was already packed. Nevertheless, still a great spot that you need to see once you're in LA.

column2: A must see in Santa Monica
column3: This Pier is is a lot of fun. It has a great view to the ocean. There is also amusement park, restaurants and shops. Food is expensive ...maybe better to bring snacks and drinks along. We parked our car at the hotel room and walked over the five blocks...did not have to pay parking fees.I really enjoyed the musicians entertaining visitors. The violinist was exceptional and Caribbean music was beautiful. We really enjoyed our walk on the Pier.I highly recommend it.

Este Pier √© um dos pontos msis visitados de LA! √â o ponto final da Rota 66 que parte de Chicago e atravessa o pa√≠s.Tem parque de divers√µes ao estilo antigo, com roda-gigante e um lindo carrossel!A noite a energia do lugar √© incr√≠vel com m√∫sica, luzes e pessoas se divertindo!O local √© super seguro! De dia √© legal ver o mar e fazer aquela caminhada b√°sica.This Pier is one of the most visited spots in LA! It is the end point of Route 66 that leaves from Chicago and crosses the country.It has an old style amusement park with a Ferris wheel and a beautiful carousel!At night the energy of the place is amazing with music, lights and people having fun!The place is super safe! By day it's cool to see the sea and do that basic walk.
A must see - especially with children. Not high on my list of things to recommend to see, tho.Its exactly as it is on TV shows and in movies.

column2: Had a great time at the Pier
column3: We had a great time at the Pier today. It is a great place to get an awesome view of the ocean, coast with green hills, or people watch. We also had a great time riding the rides at Pacific park. It has a roller coaster, Ferris wheel, sea dragon and more. If you plan on going on more than 3 rides it is worth it to get the bracelets so you can ride unlimited rides. My 8yo could ride all the rides the park had to offer.The one thing I would suggest doing is packing water and snacks in a back pack because food and drinks are expensive (5$ bottle of water).Overall had a great time. I would go back.

This is a place to stop and visit. There is a nice pier with many stores and places to eat. Also there is a park with roller coaster, games, and many other things to have fun.You can also rent a bike and have a ride around the bike way. We had so much fun in this pier. I really recommend this place.
We came here just to hand out for a while, plenty of entertainers to listen to, the girl at the end of the pier was awesome, sorry I didn‚Äôt write your name down but you play guitar and sing great.
Stayed in LA for one night for transition to Mexico. Came here after 20 hours flight to better cope the jetlag.Amazing walk along Ocean Ave to enjoy the sunset and watch the pier.

column2: Anything to get away from the Shore Hotel tenement
column3: It was great to be so close to the pier. We were just so sorry that the hotel ruined our stay and charged like they were 5 star instead of the being barely 1 star

We stopped here because we've seen it on tv and movies so much. We aren't really into the carnival games and rides, just stopped for a few to check it out.We tried to rent a bike there to ride down the beach but it was taking too long and was like $20 per hour and they closed at 4pm and it was already 3pm. Googled other bike rentals and there was one right in front of (just off) the pier (2 minute walk) and it ended up being $21 for 3 bikes for the hour and it was no hassle and quick and they were very nice.
What an amazing day. So much to look at great ppl loving California. We will be back soon. Next vacation
Beautiful place, with plenty to do near by. We stayed for sunset and it was amazing! A Holiday highlight

column2: Walked to end of the pier
column3: Just a fun thing to do while in Santa Monica...played some of the arcade games and rode the roller coaster...can get pretty crowded though.

IF you've never been then yes you have to check it out at least once. Overall it's kind of run down but still romantic, we did the Ferris wheel which was fun for couple of starry eyed tourists. Everyone who was working on the pier was very nice though so it seemed like they enjoyed being there which definitely made it easier for us to enjoy ourselves. Overall now that I have done it once I likely wont return here for some time but I'll be back someday.

column2: Must see it but not wow
column3: If you are tourist, must visit it. There are a lot of restaurants and shops but it‚Äôs very crowded. Like the view at night.

I love this old slice of California! It can get a little crowded on weekends and it doesn't have the most modern attractions, but it's great for a quick stop. It's right next to the Santa Monica beach and bike path.

Came here to see the end of Route 66, the pier was nice, lots of shops and restaurants on it. Of course souvenirs are quite expensive so I'd recommend buying something back in the town.It's not the best pier I've been to, but it's cool that it marks the end of the famous route.

In my familly it‚Äôs tradition visit Santa Monica Pier every time we arrive to LA. It‚Äôs really beautiful and there a lot of people, but not in am excesive way.Also the music give a great ambientation.I think the sunset gives that pier something special.
Hated it. Crass,tacky and depressing. Pretty carousel to look at.Sorry Santa Monica. I liked the rest of you
Always a great time! The Pacific is way too cold for me in March, but the kids don‚Äôt care!! Rent some bikes for a leisurely ride down the beach and people watching.

You must visit Santa Monica pier if you are in LA. This place I packed with fun, amazing sunset and beach. At the same time you could buy great food from the food trucks nearby. Next time I visit this place I‚Äôll bring the whole family from Norway.Just on downside, the place is super crowded...

column2: Lovely pier with places to eat
column3: Lively pier with lots of eating places. Nice way to see the ocean. It is easily reachable from downtown LA via the Expo line on the Metro. It is only a 5-minute walk from the Metro station.

column2: Very chill place to go in a sunny day
column3: You can walk from Santa Monica to Venice beach along the beach. It is a very chill place to go and also get some sun! It took us around 4 hours to finish the walk

column2: Unique pier with amusement rides, restaurants, shops, street musicians!
column3: Amazing pier. Possibly the best one in America. Plenty of nearby parking, and some parking on the pier. Pier is in great shape, and is super long and wide. Plenty of shops, a nice variety of restaurants and treats . Rental bikes available. Interesting street musicians( see picture of Lenny Hoops, awesome musician who happened to have a full size trash can for donations : that is positive thinking!). Amusement rides included small coaster , Ferris wheel, and good variety of smaller rides. We enjoyed ice cream shakes at the ice cream shop. There is an aquarium located beneath the pier, but we did not visit it. Amazing carousel on the pier, in an amazing wooden building.Tips : wear comfortable shoes. Any type of clothing goes. Pets are welcome, tons of people walking dogs. Be sure to bring bathing suits for dip in ocean, but temp of water in March is only 60 degrees! Sandy beach is beautiful and wide .
I have liked this place. It is like Coney Island in New York but Coney Island is off in winter... I liked riding on the Ferris wheel. I advise to visit The Albright. It is the seafood cafe. üòÑ

column2: Famous and must walk to say you have
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is always in the movies and you see it in the postcards but to tell you the truth, it is a tourist destination and that is what you have to expect. The beach is a little on the smelly side but walk out along the pier and see the attractions. Tacky souveneirs to take home or have lunch at the bubba gump shrimp company. Be prepared to take a jacket as it is so far out into the ocean that the ocean breeze is quite chilly. It supposed how far out it actually is and it is quite a walk.
Certainly worth checking out when in Santa Monica. Feels like you are in the movies. Very entertaining and a great to people watch.

Touristy but worth a visit. Located on the ocean just down the palisade from downtown Santa Monica. There are several restaurants, lots of touristy shops, nice vistas of the beach, and of course rides for the kids. The carousel and its building harkens back to years ago. Lots of street performers.

I have read another review and the person said that wasn't much to see. True and false in the same time.I think it's a must see for every tourist, it's a place with american simbolism.It's the end of Route 66.Acording with the weather, you can do many activities, on the beach, or walking on the pier. The parking was ok for us and the fact that is right there, no need to park far away it's a big plus.You can spend here 5 minutes or 5 hours, as you feel and wish :)
It was a very nice visit to Santa Monica Pier the sea view is amazingI eaten in number shrimp üç§ very nice and tasty food .
Great trip & fun rides. Amazing attractions and food stalls. You can easily spend the whole day there. Loved the music played by the artist.
Lovely day out for all ages. Amazing scenery, views and ambience! A must do when visiting California!
Not much to see so not much to review on. Parking was a nightmare and I couldn't imagine spending more than hour there.
One of the best experiences in LA. Great place to walk on the beach or pier or even do souvenir shopping.
Great views and we saw dolphins when we visited in March 2018. My girlfriend's American dream came true when we saw lifeguard huts. Clean and lots to do.

column2: Santa Monica Pier is a fun place to walk around for a few hours
column3: Located in Santa Monica, the Pier is a fun place to spend time while visiting the city. You can either park on the pier (limited parking) or lots next to the pier (or up near the Third Street Promenade). Lots of stores to visit on the pier, along with a small amusement park, with rides and games that the family can play. There also places to eat (sit down and fast food) along with restaurants to churro's, funnel cake and cotton candy. Fun place to walk around and people watch and spend part of the day.

If you want to be surrounded by people taking pictures, eating cotton candy and having a great time, then you should check out the pier. It‚Äôs always busy and buzzing. Always someone playing the guitar and singing for the crowd. Bring a couple bucks for these artists! Or grab a post card and a t shirt. It‚Äôs a tourists dream and a locals nightmare. There are some fun bars though just off the pier. And the parking is much cheaper.

column2: Really touristy...at least it's free though?
column3: A Tuesday...at 2pm...this place was slammed. Call me surprised but a ton of kids and teenagers were here. I guess no school on Tuesday? Heavily commercialized. Parking, shockingly, is available for cars on the wooden per at non-ripoff prices. Beat vanilla ice cream ice ever had. Otherwise chintzy.

Whilst in the LA area you must visit this land mark pier and the end of route 66. So much happening if visiting on a rain free day. Restaurants, vendors, entertainers, people fishing and an array of fairground rides. Beautiful views over Santa Monica and the ocean.
Great place to relax. Must try funnel cake with ice cream. A lot interesting act by street artists performing on deck.
Nice pier with good entertainment. Food vendors are good. Definite tourist spot but ocean and Mountain View‚Äôs are so worth the trip.

You will want to visit and you should. Don‚Äôt expect to be blown away with the atmosphere, dining choices or rides. The prices for the rides are outrageous! $30 for 3 people to ride a Ferris wheel!Enjoy your visit but even gamescare $5 a pop on the midway!If you take kids not knowing these prices, you will go broke quickly!
The SM Pier is a good place to visit although it is a typical tourist place. I was expecting more. Visiting the pier can be done in less than one hour. Dio not expect too much.
Nice place! Beach looked very clean. We went on a rainy day, so we couldn‚Äôt really enjoy the rides, but we will definitely go back.

If you're venturing to the Santa Monica Pier you should definitely prepare yourself to stay for the sunset. The sunset is one of the best views ever and the Pier lights up at night and the smell of the nearby restaurants seems to fill the surrounding air more intensely. There are vendors that sell pocket boomerangs that are pretty cool for kids or teens. Depending on arrival time and the day of the week the pay parking can be a nightmare but it it worth it to experience the beach and pier. If you're in Hollywood, California be sure to make the trip.
We had fun walking around and riding the roller coaster. Lots of little stores and carnival type food. Wear a jacket it gets chilly at night.
Santa Monica Pier is a must visit when you are in Los Angeles. It is the place to watch people and soak in the sun. A day at the pier would be a day well spent.

If you visiting California it‚Äôs a must do!!!This is why California is so great this place is amazing I will love to live here!!!Great people,great food,bike rentals the beach is really beautiful and very very clean I love it!!!

It probably took us longer to park the car than the time we spent there. Parking rates on the pier are reasonable though. We walked the pier and were able to see a Beautiful sunset. There‚Äôs a small amusement park, places to eat and vendors selling souvenirs on the pier
This is also an amazing place to visit; located near the metro station & the 3 rd promenades where you can shop & eat whatever you want, from poke to pizza, to crepes or burgers.

column2: First trip to the west coast.
column3: We went to Las Vegas and had to drive the rest of the way to California. Santa Monica pier was a must. Being able to park on the pier was a bonus. Lots of food and activities on the pier. There was an arcade and amusement rides with plenty of room to not be crowded.

My wife and I wanted to visit Santa Monica Pier while we were in LA for her birthday. Traffic is terrible around her (not the Pier's fault), but parking is ridiculous. We saw lot after lot with plenty of open spaces, but the entrances were blocked off with "lot full" signs. No one was monitoring parking, and modifying the signage as conditions change. We drove around for 45 minutes, then finally gave up. If you plan to visit, show up at 8 am, or take a bus and walk in.
The most famous and nicest place in Santa Monica. You may find souvenir stores, local performers and an excellent view of this marvelous beach.
This is a must see place when in the area. The beach is nice, lots of souvenir kiosks & places to eat. Great way to spend an afternoon! (Kids would like the games)

Myself, boyfriend and extended family drove from Las Vegas to Santa Monica Pier in a Mustang. A fabulous end to the trip. So much to do on the pier and highly recommend a trip into Bubba Gump for something to eat - that sea breeze really works up an appetite.

column2: Classic pier experience - and the end-of-the-road
column3: More entertaining on a nice day or warm evening than I experienced on this trip (cool night in March) but still worth doing. The street performers are a highlight typically. Note the display at the end of the pier associated with the terminus of Rt 66.
Wonderful time seeing the pier area again after many years! Hasn't changed much! Still full of people and tons of lovely shops and good food!!
This is a nice place for people to look around or walk around Santa Monica Beach. They have some restaurants, big Carousel and some attractions too.
It‚Äôs okay. Some street performers on the pier, rides and games for the kids. Take about 5 minutes to walk from the front to back. Great place to take photos.
It‚Äôs part of the LA tourist circle... extremely crowded, and noisy. Beware of pickpockets, and don‚Äôt plan to stay long.
Great place to take friends or visitors to walk the pier and watch all the tourists - $$‚Äôs can go fast at carnival attractions - busy & crowded almost all the time - enjoy

column2: Variety of sights, rides, and entertainment
column3: Nice walking along the Santa Monica Pier. Rides, various vendors offering their talents and entertainers too!

column2: A trendy spot that's usually crowded and expensive!
column3: I'd say this place is fun if you are still out of town and HAVE to see all the traps, but otherwise skip it. Go to the many other peirs around So Cal for the same experience and save your money.

We came here with our 18 year old daughter and her roommate visiting from college. Parking can be challenging and not cheap. The pier was clean, but LOTS of people. The weather was cool enough that you needed a sweatshirt by 2:00, but not freezing. There were interesting people performing and some small shops. Food places were quite crowded and seemed clean, although due to the climate there, they didn‚Äôt appear clean. We did not go on or near the rides. It was fun to look out over the waves and to watch beach goers.

column2: Wonderful day at Santa Monica Pier
column3: This is a great family place to visit. There is a small amusement park on the pier with kid rides. Great restaurants to eat at. And beautiful walks along the beach. You can also walk a short distance to all the downtown stores. Always have a great time in Santa Monica.
Love Santa Monica; the pier is awesome and the beaches are beautiful, no oil rigs in site. The streets are lined with unique shops and eateries. Be sure to bring your walking shoes.
One of the nastiest places in the area. If you like vomiting homeless you‚Äôll love this place. We will never go back.

column2: A fun day out with a 6 year old
column3: There is lots to do on this pier from rides to games to food to a carousel! And underneath is a cute little aquarium! When you‚Äôre done you can go to the beach!

column2: Didn't live up to the hype
column3: We visited the pier around sunset. The sunset was beautiful, however the pier was super busy and had annoying street entertainers who took away from the overall atmosphere who were with on their political rants or playing their music so loud I could not have a conversation with my friends. We knew it would be a tourist trap but this went way beyond that.
I grew up with the Southern California coastline so anything by my Pacific I love. This is an iconic stop in LA County.
We love walking on the Santa Monica Pier, as it is the best people watching that you can find and there are a lot of choice of fun things to do and food to eat.

This place was great, the only thing i wasn‚Äôt a fan of was the traffic line to get in and park, BUT i figured if there is a line then it must be good! So we went and explored the pier! It reminded me of like a huge open outdoor fair with all of the games/ food etc.

I wasn‚Äôt planning to go to the pier but my hotel was close by and I decided to check it out as a solo traveler just finished with work. I‚Äôm so glad I did! There is so much activity going on ranging from amusement rides (which I didn‚Äôt do) to musical entertainment to souvenir shops to viewing posts on the pier, plus some eating spots. The views are amazing as you get to see both sides of the beach. I suggest you be there for sunset. What a treat! I walked out onto the beach and joined many others in taking photos and basking in the scenery. It feels very California and the pier is a lot like Times Square. Worth a visit even if you aren‚Äôt into amusement rides.

It has an amusement park with some good number of rides, beach, lot of food options etc. Will be very crowded during evenings. You can see many people enjoying games like beach volleyball, throw disc etc.
It was a cold evening but we had fun on the rides. There was a roller coaster, ferris wheel, scrambler, drop type of ride
Santa Monica is happening. Great shopping. A million restaurants. And this pier.A must when visiting LA.Enjoy a day outside on the Pier. Decent rides. Incredible location.

We wanted to visit Santa Monica Pier just so we could say we had been really. We parked up and walked to it, on the walk to the pier we didn‚Äôt feel all that safe and this was during the day. Their wasn‚Äôt really a lot to do on the pier and a few places where closed. It wasn‚Äôt really for us but do be cautious of this area.

Some beaches are made for laying on and catching some rays. Others are made for play. Southern California beaches are made for play. Whether cruising and watching the crowds or playing Frisbee... California will always be California. Even when I lived in a more remote area in Laguna during my college years, I never really laid on the beach. People were playing basketball or jogging, rollerblading or on skateboards. Great food stops, music stops and lots of things to do.

The pier was a nice place to visit. Plenty of shops and places to snack. There are a few rides for the kids and the views are great, especially at night at the end of the pier looking back at the city. That said, one visit was enough. I probably wouldn't go back a second time.

We have always heard about the Santa Monica Pier. This was one of our must see attractions. We were not disappointed. The atmosphere was fun and the food was fun. We even went on the Ferris wheel, what an awesome whew from the top. My husband was thrilled to be at the end of Route 66!
Beautiful views. A few crazy vendors around trying to get money from tourists. To many people packed together in area for my liking. Good to see once.

column2: Nice place to visit in LA
column3: We Visited the pier of SM one sunny evening on mid february. Really nice place, a lot of people, specially tourist as us, a lot of things to do and watch. Good plan for a few hours.

As a local I have grown up with this place.Nostalgia is the word.Watching the children scream and smile like I did as a child.It really does warm the heart.Bring a blazer though as later in the day it can get a little cold.
Such a great place. Beach is good. Hire a bike and cycle to Venice beach few miles along the bike lane. You will not regret it.

When in the city, I felt we needed to give the Santa Monica Pier a visit. It was fun walking around, but we couldn't see spending more than 1 or 2 hours here. Some great photo ops, and the beach is nice. Be prepared for a ton of people!

A classic LA icon. Not everyone‚Äôs favorite place but great fun for kids of all ages. Grandchildren from 6 to 16 all had a wonderful time on the rides and in the arcade. Rollercoaster and Ferris wheel were the most popular rides and the arcade was a great way to keep the kids engaged. Don‚Äôt go there to eat. No good or even mediocre restaurant on the pier. Great people watching.

column2: A carnival attatched to a pier
column3: This is the ultimate tourist trap with high priced diabetes-inducing fried carnival food, meager carnival rides, and a lot of people selling tourist junk in the stores. It didn't help that the winter wind was cold in February. With so many proper theme parks in the LA area, save your money and just hit the beach.

column2: Cute area but couldn‚Äôt enjoy due to weather
column3: Cute area to spend an afternoon with lots to do but the day we visited was unusually cold and windy so it was difficult to be outside.

Great arcade and rides. Classic pier atmosphere with lots of music, tourist shops and restaurants. You can also walk into down town Santa Monica from the pier which is worth doing. Beautiful beach too!

column2: Not as nice as we expected
column3: The pier was fine, but it was not as nice as we had expected it to be. There were not many rides that cater two older kids and the things that were there were just mediocre. It‚Äôs fun to visit for an hour but not much more than that

We were only staying a short distance away so caught the bus, $1.75 for each adult to travel.The pier is just like you see on TV shows although slightly smaller.Shops and cafe on the pier it self.White sandy beach with lifeguards and we saw sea lions surfing in the waves.A lot of homeless people around which is sad to see.Tour guides wanting you to buy tickets at $85.00 when you say no they immediately drop to half or below. It‚Äôs a place to spend a few hours unless you sit on the beach.

column2: Great family stop and great views!
column3: The Santa Monica Pier was first built in 1909 and is a must stop while visiting Hollywood. Couples can have dinner and admire the sunset over the ocean. Families can have some cotton Candy and enjoy streat entertainers. Bubba Gump has a restaurant on the pier if you want to have drinks and a few beers. Robert Downey Jr buzzed the Santa Monica Pier in the first Ironman movie. Many movies were shot there. A must for tourists.
December in Santa Monica and the weather was nice. Lots of tourists and locals roaming around. The beach busy with beach goers. The pier is easily walkable.
It was good to visit and see, lots of ppl , rides are nice, lots of walking, restaurants, good sunset sight !

We came on a Thursday afternoon and stayed until sunset. It is an incredibly beautiful setting and the people watching is pretty awesome. Watching the street performers was hilarious and at times jaw dropping. Pacific Park was a fun amusement park with nice employees. We snapped a ton of pictures. The beach was quite clean, surprisingly. We could‚Äôve parked right at the pier for $10 but made a mistake and parked in a covered garage across the street for $21... that was a lesson learned. The amount of riff raff was actually at a minimum, which again was very surprising. We were very happy with our decision to come!

If it wasn't for the amusement park, this pier would be nothing else. Definitely catered for the tourists with the overpriced food and your usual souvenir shops and restaurants.I had more fun trying to track down the nearest Jack n the Box.

It's like in the movies, so much to see and do, so many people from all walks of like and backgrounds all gathered on this pier, souvenirs on the pier are on the expensive side, went to the restaurant at end of the pier, had nice Mexico atmosphere and nice service. Had the wet burrito, was that big on the plate only manages to eat half of it, definitely recommend it

column2: Great beach day walking the pier
column3: First time on Santa Monica Pier in a long time. I enjoyed the slack line park my friends created. The Buzz Pop Cocktails were amazing as well. Weather was mid 70's and perfect for February. Only downside is parking sucks

Visited here a couple of days back. It was a lot of fun even though it was windy. Such a nice walk and everyone seems to be having a good time or at least free minded. I enjoyed all the people trying to sell you fruits and the walk. It is a must see.

Loved being here as a tourist. The whole vibe, cute amusement park, sunset, beach, everything combined makes this place a one of a kind, magical place to be. Only thing is that food and drinks are overpriced but thats probably common in such touristic places.

column2: "we had a great afternoon at this Pier"
column3: This is a must visit place, there is a lot to see and do. you will see people working out at the beach, entertainers,you will be able to buy your souvenirs and enjoy the beautiful views of Santa Monica, CA.

Rent bikes, walk everywhere, enjoy the sun & sand. A great beach & pier anytime. All kinds of food is available. Bikes are affordable. Head down to Venice & Marina del Ray for a great couple of hours.
We had never been to Santa Monica and were worried about things to do with the kiddos, and this was perfect and we had so much fun here.
Cool place to hang out for a few hours. Kids young kids would enjoy the carnival type amusement park. Ate at the Bubba Gump Restaurant and was good but pricey.

It was amazing to see the end of route 66. We had photos with the sign on the pier. We rode on the wheel and the rollercoaster. We ate at bubba gumps and enjoyed the beach. couldn't be more different from Worthing West Sussex. Even hired bikes and rode to Venice Beach which was lots of fun and very safe.
This seems like you can not travel all this way to not go to the pier. It was alright the rides were very over priced but that is to be expected.

It was our first time here at the Pier. We came at night, and were able to use our GO LA pass to get on the roller coaster which was cool. Lots of kids and familys having fun. It was even just fun looking at all the lights sparkling in the distance.

Visited at sunset, what a beautiful picturesque place. So much going on. Entertainers all along pier, carnival attractions & of course the iconic Ferris wheel. Lovely walk along pier soaking on the atmosphere.

We visited the pier on a Friday afternoon, walking to the end of the pier and then getting to the rides as they were opening. We bought the unlimited band (highly recommend) and rode as many times as we wanted in an hour. The view from the Ferris Wheel is awesome! Our 8 year old loved the rides. We kept our bands on and went back after dinner to experience the roller coaster in the dark. Very fun. We did not eat on the pier - we chose a restaurant nearby on Ocean Ave.
Nice spot with live music, rides and views all around the pier. Route 66 ends here, from Chicago. We had a nice beach walk from our hotel to get here.

Got into Santa Monica later in the day, and decided to walk the boardwalk in the evening. Perhaps because it was at night and dark, it seemed to invite all kinds of people and we decided follow our comfort level and not stay very long. We enjoyed all the lights and action of the Pier from the hotel, and it was just as beautiful as depicted in advertising.

column2: Fantastic Spot on Pacific Ocean Coastline
column3: One of the few places I can recommend being fun for all in Los Angeles. The Ferris wheel on the Santa Monica Pier can be seen in numerous tv shows & movies and is part of a great little amusement park that is ON the Pier.You can park directly on the pier; just drive down the big hill and follow the signs. You could also park in one of the public lots up the street, but it's a pretty steep walk back up (especially if you're pushing a stroller or have tired, small children with you). Touristy shops line the pier and there's a Bubba Gump restaurant at the base of the pier. The view of the Pacific is incredible.My absolute favorite thing on the Santa Monica Pier is a once in a lifetime experience - The Trapeze School of New York (Los Angeles location) has a spot where you can take flying trapeze lessons. There is nothing quite like flying through the air looking out over the ocean. If you're looking for a really unique activity to do that's not the typical L.A. vacation, check it out.

column2: One of LA's Best Beaches! Bring the Whole Family!
column3: The Santa Monica pier was a super cool place for the whole family, and you must give the better portion of your day to being there. It's a pretty long walk across the bridge especially if there are little kids with you and they may get tired out pretty fast. Once you are actually at the pier, there is a lot going on. If you see some people with a spinner offering you 2 free nights of vacation, it's most likely a scam. It was fun to play, however. There was also a small basketball court which part of the all-star NBA weekend took place, which was cool to see. The mini amusement park was really awesome, and a lot of the carnival game booths on the side were really fun, and the prizes all large and possible to win. There were a many rides, and the coolest was by far the roller coaster, which is very easy but goes around twice. There is also a boat swing, frogger, and more, which gives people of all ages a ton to do. Each ride varied from around $5-10, yet unlimited rides for the whole day was only $18, so that would be super fun to do if you have the whole day. The ticket booth in the front has a huge line, but if you sneak your way to the back entrance, there is a booth with almost no one in line (don't tell!). The beach is worth walking around in, but personally the amusement park was the best part. Since everything is nearby, people can choose what they would like to do and meet up right after, making it the ideal situation (much like Coney Island in NYC). If in LA, this is one of the coolest and most fun experiences at little to know price, so you should make your way down to the Santa Monica pier!

column2: Just as i had imagined it to be!!
column3: The beach first of all was simply breathtaking the sheer size beach blew me away andthe homes on the beach are beautiful. The Pier was exactly how i imagined it to be , It was almost caught in a time warp and i loved it, hopefully get back some time in the future and spend more time there.

The Santa Monica Pier is an iconic destination for tourists and locals alike. Stroll the boardwalk, eat street food and play arcade games.Pro Tip: Kick off your shoes and walk out to the sand. Stand under the pier and take it in from a different point of view.
I would skip - way to crowded with a lot of people and nothing out of the ordinary in terms of attractions.
I know you are going anyway haha, so I would just say to use your money and time wisely! Good place to take kids, family, dates...

The hardest part about a visit to Santa Monica and it‚Äôs Pier / Boardwalk is the drive. When you finally reach the ocean it‚Äôs like the rest of the city melts away. If you are lucky enough to find a beach-front hotel you can relax and enjoy the view of the Pier and then visit it at night when it‚Äôs all lit up!
Well worth a walk along the pier and take in the bracing fresh air. If you like additional entertainment go for a ride on the big wheel

What a terrific place. I just walked and looked, took in all the sights, but there is lots to do. Loved the old carousel. Street performers. Ice cream shop. (My salted caramel milkshake was so good!) Beautiful beach.

We really liked the pier, the views were lovely and there‚Äôs lots going on on the pier. The children enjoyed the arcade. The ice creams etc on the pier are very expensive so we didn‚Äôt buy too much.

column2: a little messy but still good fun
column3: The Santa Monica Pier gets lots of visits due to many reasons : fun , sun , sea , and more fun !!Kids will love this place for its carnival games and rides and adults will love the views of the pacific ocean and enjoy great cuisine . Parking does get crowded so do come early to truly enjoy the world renowned pier!!

column2: Nice place to be at sunset.
column3: Boardwalk is full of street performers and gift shops. Tourist trap but nice to see at least once. Great for people watching.

column2: Great place to eat and hang out
column3: Lots to see and do. Good food options. Great views. We ate at the restaurant at the end of the pier and the food was good and the service was fast.
The pier itself is iconic and a must if you‚Äôre visiting Santa Monica Beach. Shops are quite expensive, But take a look at the last shop from Route 66 at the end of the pier.
The Santa Monica Pier was very busy with numerous people busking or selling their wares.Beautiful sunset is to be experienced. A must to visit together with a stroll along the beach.
We stopped here by accident. We ended up spending 3 hours soaking up the atmosphere. Great old style fun with a great view. Would definitely stop off and have some fun

Santa Monica is a lovely town and a visit wouldn't be complete without a visit to Santa Monica Pier. It has a lovely buzz about the place and lots of fun activities for all ages. It also provides lots of photo opportunities.
Enjoy your day at the beach and pier is full of activity and shops. Should stay specially at sunset time to view teh sunset.
I went there with my family at night and although a little apprehensive at first, it was definitely worth it. The atmosphere was great, the rides cheerful and very cute little stalls.
It is a smaller than I though from th movies. Lively place and good view to the city beach. Worth a visit.
The pier has rides and crowds. I enjoyed the eclectic crowd more than the rides. Fun to see the yoga, hula hoops, skaters. Cleaner than Venice beach.
First time to the pier. It was a cool experience. Lovely views. Prepare to pay for parking. Metered parking is $2 an hour.

We are on holiday during the Winter, but took a stroll along the pier and it was a pleasant experience. We saw buskers, souvenir stalls and fast food outlets. Fishing is allowed on the end of the pier. The floor is old and uneven with a funfair on the side. Entrance to the pier is free.Worth a visit.

Neat place to visit. We went on a beautiful Saturday afternoon so it was very crowded. Lots to do on the pier and also a beautiful beach. Tons of restaurants across the road from the pier. Parking was scarce but was worth the time to see it. Came back a week later at night. Gorgeous view of the Ferris Wheel as we drove down the PCH(pacific coast highway).

A little touristy by the views of the beach and mountains are spectacular. We got tacos at a little place here and they were sooo good! A bit crowded but not so bad that you can't get away easily if you need to.

column2: Great place to visit and lots of things to do around
column3: We visited LA as a family with kids. There is lots of things going on at the Pier itself, and there is broad walk around. You can also go to the shore itself and spend time on the beach. They have 3 streets parallel to the beach with walking zones, lots of restaurants and many cheap city parking garages (Streets 2,3,4). There is mall right there too, you just walk off from the pier and continue one block straight, mall will be on your right. So great place to be overall. In the evening it is very safe and again tons of people walking around, sitting at the cafes and going by the water. They have very nice illumination at the streets 2,3,4. This is probably the most alive place in LA in the evening.
Spent a few hours exploring Santa Monica and you must go checkout the iconic pier. Great views of the coast line, entertaining buskers and good for people watching.
Nice stroll. Great street musicians. Great food. Did not know it was the end of the famous route 66. If you love people watching this is the place to be.
Leisurely stroll in the pier. Amusement park is nice and clean. Lifeguard shack at the end of the pier is a small testament to the history of the pier.
Great spotNice locationTourist area but must be seenClean and tidyOrganised despite being busyLovely area and great place to visit
This is the place. Wow. People watching at its best. So much to see plus it‚Äôs the finishing point of Route 66. Plenty of activity.

column2: Something Fun To Do On A Saturday
column3: We went to the Santa Monica Pier to let the kids have fun on the rides. There is parking right at the pier and it was a flat $12. I read that online but there was so much traffic that we just parked at the Shore hotel for a flat $15 and walked a block over to the pier.There are a lot of people and a lot going on. It was cool to know that it is the end of Route 66. Your typical boardwalk and food. We ate at Pier Burger, walked to the end of the pier and then went to the amusement park.We had the LA Go Card. A great value for everything that we did in Southern California including the Santa Monica Pier Amusement Park

column2: Fun for kids, adults, couples, or groups
column3: The Santa Monica pier has a carnival atmosphere with a ferris wheel, arcade games, souvenir shops, and other games. It is beautiful any time of day, but especially nice at sunset, especially on a rare clear day without the smoggy haze that is so common. The pier has restaurants and souvenir shops or stands all along the pier that overlooks the beach and the ocean. Great places for lunch, dinner, snacks, or drinks.There are people performing music, some extremely talented (an impressive violin with an amplifier and another playing an acoustic version of "Hotel California"), and some more unintentionally comical like a man in his 50s that performs in a gladiator-type skort and dancing the Macarena (yes, I know it, I admit it :) to a rendition of Prince's "When Doves Cry."Another thing to mention, but not to be concerned about, there are usually panhandlers asking for money, but none of them were aggressive or dangerous. I went 3 times in a week, once for lunch and twice for dinner, in a group of 2 to 4, and there was never a problem.Great views, good variety of restaurants, a good place for tourist souvenirs, and you can take the stairs to the sand, and go down to the shoreline if you want. They also have a shower and a foot shower (don't pull the wrong handle!) to rinse off the sand. The water is very cold in months like January, even though the high when I was there was in the mid 70s to mid 80s, but considering there was snow on the ground back home, it was nice to enjoy the warm mild weather, the view, and the seafood!

Heading from LA up the Pacific Coast Highway today Santa Monica was our first stop. It was one of our favourite places in LA and taking time to stroll along the Pier and soak up the atmosphere was well worth it. Great views and plenty to see and do if you have the time. We only stayed long enough to walk up and back as the road was calling!
Park close to the beach, $7 per day. Lots of entertainers. The restaurant at the far end is where you want to go.

Lots of fun and not very crowded. Beautiful beach day for February, awesome for people watching. We rented a tandem moped-like bike and cruised down to Venice Beach. Make sure to stop at some thrift stores for designer labels. Ate lunch at Shutters- great day! Ride the roller coaster (pricey though)!
They have shops and places to buy food they have rides like a and games even a little game room the beach is so beautiful

Loved our stroll along the pier. Not sure if rides don‚Äôt operate during the week or not? We went to ride the Ferris wheel one week night and it as well as all the other rides were closed. We found pier parking to be easy. Look out for the monks, the try to give you a bracelet and then want $10 for them.

When I go to Santa Monica Pier for the 1st time what I had on my mind was just the beachBut when I reach there it was mind blowing and to be honest if you're the 1st time travelled to ST definitely you will enjoy the activities there a loootMany more activities to do !!!Highly recommended
Great place to go on a beautiful day. It is crowded but spectacular setting . Definitely take out of town guests.

column2: Fun place to hang out near the beach
column3: Lots of shopping & food, street vendor shows as well....great place. Surprisingly there is also clean bathrooms!

When in LA I park up on Ocean Park dr then walk down to the pier and to its end. Definitely people watching but please note the area is loaded with food trucks BUT lots of homeless on the walk overlooking ocean. Lots of people walking, jogging , dogs etc but on clear day a must walk to enjoy just be aware of surroundings.

Its not a mind blowing experience to come here, but its still nice to walk up and down the pier, in a leisurely fashion, no rush, and take it all in.There's the overpriced souvenir shops, entertainers, an amusement park, and restaurants to keep you busy, or you can just look out at the nice views over the water and beach and up the coast.We parked on the main drag and walked down, and that seemed a cheaper option and a nice way to see some of the beachfront town as well.

Great place to end up after a long day of touring the LA area. Great Mexican restaurant on the end of the Pier. The pier was clean (cleaner than the rest of the area) and we felt safe. We saw a cool bicycle parade that was all lit up and that was cool. A beautiful carousel at the beginning of the walk out into the pier. The colorful Ferris wheel overlooks the ocean. Quite a beautiful site.
This place was so much fun. Great place to take pictures, people watch. We rented bikes and rode to muscle beach on Venice. Really cool place.

column2: It's got to be on your list.
column3: I read mixed reviews on this site about Santa Monica and the pier which almost put me off going. When we arrived at the pier on Sunday afternoon about 2, it looked very busy and generated a oops maybe we made a mistake moment. Saying that when we entered the pier it felt very comfortable. Lots of food stalls. Live music. Fair ground rides and souvenir stands. Regardless of being the end of route 66, I just thought it was a fun place to pass a good hour or so. The people were very nice and no hassle or pressure at all and the sun set to die for. Bubba Gump shrimp company restaurant was a great addition sitting at the start of the pier. The food will not set the world on fire but the service and experience was a great end to a very nice afternoon. Don't miss this one off your list.

We took 9 teens (17) and 3 adults to the Pier. It was a gorgeous day in January so we walked Venice to the pier. Enjoyed the rides, walking the pier to the end, shopping and eating. Neat place to visit and walk around. Only warning was food places are limited as far as sit down restaurants. Alot of walk up carts and windows, but not full service restaurants right on the Pier. Bubba Gumps is very popular and we put our names in for a party of 12 and waited about 45 minutes. They were great about moving orders, food, etc. I would return here for a fun beach day plus!

column2: Nice sunny day in the pier
column3: Usually jammed parking can be a challenge and the food is boardwalk or amusement park quality. Be careful with your belongings. Worth seeing but the view is just amazing specially from the Ferris wheel.
was surprised not seeing a lot of tourists on Wednesday night with a super nice weather & clear moon

Spent a lot longer here than expected due to the number of rides and stores crammed into this small area. Ended up riding the coaster and ferris wheel, got some great views of the sun setting from up there. There's also a pretty awesome arcade with some old classics like Centipede and Street Fighter II, as well as air hockey and Foosball tables, very fairly priced (most games were between 50 cents and a dollar per go). It went from just taking a look, to spending a few hours on the pier before taking a walk on the lovely beach.

I went to the pier 3 times in the 4 days I was there. Twice at night and once during the day.It‚Äôs a really fun place to visit. Tons to do and see! Family friendly. Rides and games for the kids. Street performers riddled the pier. Everyone was just having a freaky great time. The lights at night are awesome. Walk to the very end and turn around to see the lights!!There are people fishing off the pier day and night. We stopped to watch them fish for a bit while drinking coffee from the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf.You could go down to the beach and play in the ocean or just sit and watch/listen to the waves crash against the shore. Plenty of places to eat and gets snacks.Easy to get an Uber to and from. It‚Äôs a must see if you‚Äôre in LA.

column2: Every now and then you have to go to the Ferris wheel over the ocean
column3: There is a place that ALWAYS takes the blues away. When I am on the West Side, during the week, I try to get on the Ferris wheel over the ocean for a quick attitude adjustment. There is something that can be cured by flying alongside seagulls high above the water below. If you want to do something SUPER special and the wallet is thin, jump on the metro to the end, and walk to the pier. A whole new world is there.
Touristic area, fast food, beaches & sun. Busses access available.Highway usually very crowded, take time to go by car.

column2: An old gem in a modern town
column3: The pier is reminiscent of Blackpool back in the day. Lovely wooden pillars and walkway.Rides and street entertainment makes it a fun place but for sheer beauty sit on the bleachers at the end of the pier and watch the sunset over the oceanGreat fish restaurants

column2: Great way to spend a sunny day
column3: I don't know of it was the weather, the location or the fun, but it was a memorable day and will return. We enjoyed the rides, saw dolphins off the pier and had a great day.
I‚Äôve only been here before the attractions are opened but the views are nice and fishermen friendly.

Atleast need to spend 1 Full day to enjoy Santa Monica., good shopping, beach attractions, food and other lot of things to explore and enjoy. Easy to access and ample parking spaces. FUN all the round from morning to mid night.

column2: A must visit to know end of Highway 66
column3: The breeze and buzz of activity was amazing.For the lovers of history and cars, this is supposed to be the end of the Highway 66 - one of the first highways to stretch from the East coast to the West coast.

i recently visited this establishment while we were on a layover for 2 days before connecting onto vancouver it was a pleasant day and we visited the arcade, roller coaster and the ferris wheel: which gives an amazing view of the city i will definitely visit santa monica again on holiday i would highly recommend to tourists and locals alike.

column2: Good place to spend a couple of hours
column3: Loads of entertainment here. There are busker, restaurants, stalls for shopping and fair rides. Parking is easy to find with a walk to the Pier.
Just adjacent to Santa Monica beach, the pier is filled with a lot of activities for all age groups. We all saw a few seals swimming nearby. As with all things in So Cal, bring sun block with you.
A good place to visit especially if you have young children. Plenty of rides etc. good to see this place still exists. Very touristy but fun.

Our first time there. Glad we went. So much history since it opened in 1909. We didn‚Äôt go to the amusement park but there were lots of people there, riding the Ferris wheel and other rides. There were several entertainers singing, dancing or doing magic tricks as we walked along, making it fun. But the views of the beach and the ocean were what drew me to want to go back. We had lunch on the patio of a restaurant at the end of the pier and it was delightful.

Opened in 1909, the 1400-foot-long Santa Monica Pier is one of the most iconic seaside piers on the west coast (and all) of the USA. It has been featured in countless films, television shows, music videos and even video games (Grand Theft Auto V immediately comes to mind). It has been designated a historic landmark since 1976 and has a rich, storied history since its opening. (Seriously, read a little bit about it and discover some of its more darker past during Prohibition and the WWII era. It's fascinating!)It's also REALLY cool to visit. At just over ¬º of a mile long, the pier offers lots of entertaining options to keep you busy for a few hours. Most noticeable/famous on the pier is the Pacific Park seaside amusement park (with its legendary Pacific Wheel Ferris wheel and West Coaster junior roller coaster), along with 10 other rides. Additional options include the original Hippodrome building (with its original indoor carousel) from the 1920s, a trapeze school(!!), the Santa Monica Pier Aquarium, plus numerous shops, restaurants, bars/pubs, entertainers, and other attractions. At the far western end of the pier, you will see numerous anglers fishing, as well as find restrooms and a somewhat upscale restaurant for memorable dining. The pier is fun during the day, but it's at night when it REALLY comes alive, with all the lights, music, cool ocean breeze and entertainment options that give it a magical quality. You never know what you're going to see there, from Chinese Acrobats, to musicians playing exotic and foreign instruments many Americans aren't accustomed to seeing, to fortune tellers, magicians, and other acts. It really is a neat place to visit. The Santa Monica Police Department has a station on the pier, so police presence is regular. I've never felt unsafe while visiting.It's busy though. Even at night, the pier can be so packed with people that walking gets difficult. I've seen lines for the rides at Pacific Park an hour long at 11pm before. Finding places to eat, places to grab a drink, and a place to park your car can be a real challenge. I recommend avoiding the Santa Monica Beach/Pier and Pacific Park on the weekends in the summer because it just gets to be too busy to truly enjoy yourself.Despite its popularity and overcrowding issues, if you find yourself in LA with time to kill and you haven't been to the Santa Monica Pier, you HAVE to go. It's one of those life experiences that you will be glad to cross off your bucket list (even if you never intend to return again)!

Wished I could've stayed longer. Views were great. Lot of entertainment on the Pier. Little Rock band put on a concert, some guy shirtless dancing and having a good time to some funny tunes. Only thing I disliked was PAYING 4$ FOR A WATER!!!

We were fortunate to visit this attraction on a warm January day; it was glorious! The air was clear affording wonderful views of the ocean. Parking was easy as we went on a weekday. On can actually park on the pier and there is a parking lot at ground level. There are public restrooms available, also. The pier was lots of places of places to eat, some shops, as well as several interesting buskers, or street musicians.
Nice to see the ocean. Great Mexican restaurant. Strange characters singing and dancing everywhere. Lots of trinkets for sale. Gets crowded.
Very nice place to go and spend a while. It has a lot of activities and fun things to do for all family members. It is very nice for pictures.

The sunset is amazing here, I don't know why the colours are so nice compared to some other places I've been. The beach is huge, there is an amusement park, lots of food, and you can rent bikes or skates about 10 minutes walk away.

Santa Monica Pier is simply a fun place to be at, especially if you‚Äôre into people watching!Many places to eat, grab a coffee and watch the bay.We rented bikes and rode all the way down the beach-a wonderful two hour ride.There is a small amusement park as well to add to your fun.Every few feet, there are musicians, artists and even a dancing native, showing off his strange moves!The Pier is definitely a place to visit and spend the morning.Walk around Santa Monica and visit the shops, restaurants and if your lucky, the farmers market will be in full bloom.It‚Äôs a wonderful place to shop fresh and organic vegetables.

Just as a must-do attraction of LA, we came to Santa Monica pier without expecting to take any rides, or eat there, or enjoy the beach - basically nothing that a tourist would do. We took a stroll along the pier and enjoyed the sunset; the views and buskers made the atmosphere a simply beautiful place.

column2: A nice walk and interesting atmosphere
column3: If you are looking for something to do in L.A. for an hour or so, go for a walk along Santa Monica Pier. Many colourful characters and stalls, a gorgeous carousel complete with icecreamery, and a beautiful beach. We didn't try to go on any rides, or buy any food.

My son wanted to visit this pier as of course has seen it in many tv shows. Needs a bit of an overhaul and is looking really really tired. Nothing to see really and some dubious buskers, a little on the weird side and everyone has their own CD to sell. Does anyone even use a CD player anymore.......
Crowded and a very interesting mix of people. The pier itself is a fun walk and people watching but not much for food. Fairly long walk to the promenade area and not much to choose from for food.
Beautiful view of the ocean & walk along the beach. Santa Monica Pier was crowded & expensive for the kids to go on the rides.
While some relaxing time away here, take it slow, check out some kiosks. Nice view of the beach and the city from the pier. Take some fun rides if you feel like it.

We went in the evening...around 8 p.m and you can see the bay from the pier, it's a nice view. There's a park where you can buy tickets and enjoy in a rollercoaster or the wheel of fortune (I don't know if this is the correct nameü§î)There are places where you can eat, buy some momorabilias or just enjoy the different artist that there are in the pier. If you like to take pictures...this is a great place. You can park there ($2 √ó hr) You can visit the end of route 66. You have to go there!!!

Lines were looong! Waited an hour to get on rides. I also waited 45 minutes in line to get a cup of coffee Finally walks away because the small coffee shop was so full you couldn‚Äôt move. We had a difficult time just walking on the pier. There were so very many people. I also expected it to be cleaner than it was. Couldn‚Äôt find any rest rooms either.

The Santa Monica pier is a remnant of the past. There are many performers and small stalls lined along the pier. In addition to some carnival rides and arcade games. The pier does offer some spectacular views of the beach and scenery.

column2: Very nice place to visit if you need some beach time
column3: It is very much talked about tourist attraction in LA. Not very close to downtown.The food is delicious there and so are the shops. There are street performances along side every day.Honestly just too busy.
Absolutely like seen on TV. Great beach, great walkway, tones of activities. Reasonable rates at the parking lots
Quite a beautiful place in LA about 30 min drive from the down town... it has good view .. lot‚Äôs of energy around with restaurant , pubs and coffee shops .. nice place to spend a good evening

It's a nice walkYou can treat the kids to a few mechanical games and enjoy a funnel cake or a nice coffeeThere are artists who sale their talents like you name on a rice grain... paintings etcIt was nice.

This has always been on my bucket list, and was a crucial part of my visit to California. We arrived at this area by UBER just outside of the main arch welcoming you to the pier. It was a beautiful day with the sun shining and you could see up and down the coast for miles. The pier has many attractions and restaurants which would appeal to everyone. The first place we saw was Bubba Gump Shrimp, but only visited the shop on this occasion. You will notice that there are several souvenir shops on the pier, but luckily they sell different things compared to Hollywood which was great. The funfair is the main attraction on the pier and proudly stands out. Its such an iconic attraction, and its great to see that it was always busy with families. There is a restaurant at the end of the pier, and an amazing viewpoint over the ocean (I took far too many photos at this point) I personally would highly recommend this location as it is full of little stalls and has an amazing history behind it.
The beach, the city, the attractions...it‚Äôs a magical combination. We even saw dolphins. All the musicians made it even more pleasant

Just travelled to the pier for the first time. You park you are out 10 bucks but the rest is free. It was sunday and we decided to drive up from LA to see it. For my last couple of visits to LA I have tried to visit a couple of piers each time. (malibu, Huntington, Venice, etc..). This was the most fun of all so far to date more to visit you know. You can buy crafts, go to amusement park, visit Arlington West, listen to preachers, m.usic, etc... We left befor everyone was piling in to watch the sun go down from the pier. I would go back again
Caught the bus from Hollywood and spent a lovely afternoon wandering the boardwalk and pier. A few venors onnthe pier, fun fair we didnt go into it.
A nice famous pier with plenty to see and do. Lots of performers and had lunch at Bubba Gump which is cool!

column2: Amazing part of our 2 week road trip! (Sunday visit)
column3: We are visiting from England on a 2 week road trip!The pier was pretty busy but everywhere tends to be in LA we have quickly realised!We spent a while on the pier - there are plenty of places to eat although we didn't need food. There are also loads of great people from all walks of life and people entertaining others. There are lots of little stalls selling fridge magnets, souvenirs etc!We parked on the pier and this cost us $3 an hour which we thought was really reasonable and there were plenty of spaces.Recommend a visit - the beach is beautiful!
Gets really busy! But great place to come to see the sun set. Lots to do here win funfair rides, restaurants, snacks and games!
Reached in the morning and enjoyed the shopping street and the pier. Very lively. If have time to visit. Took Uber in both direction from Hollywood where we were staying.

column2: Even if you are Californian, a walk on the Pier is a must
column3: This eclectic venue is a slice of Southern California with its historic carousal, its fried seafood eateries and a multitude of individual craftsmen along the way offering all sorts of beach souvenirs . Crazy of course, especially on the weekends, but still a gotta do kind of experience.
Great to be at with your significant other, fun to explore on the pier, even cooler underneath. Got a good long nap at the beach LOL. Highly recommend.
A trip to this attraction is recommended. It has a lot of shops, bars, restaurants and the Fair. The Ferris Wheel provides a great view.

We went there on our second evening in the US. We had the LA GoCard which was usefull for getting in attractions. We just had to show the Care at the ticket office and recieve an all in ticket. Great times we had there!You can alsof purchase single tickets.

We came here to see a number of attractions. First we wanted to walk the iconic Santa Monica Pier, Wow - It did not disappoint, but was amazing. There were places to eat and drink, gift shops, street performers and the view of the northern beaches was just stunning. People were friendly and helpful and always had a smile. A great place to wander with young or teenage kids.
great place to visit just so relaxin ..for a drink or go on the ferrus wheel.or listen to the music.love this place

I absolutely love this place the beach is clean and The pier is a must see when visiting the LA area. The train runs to downtown. A lot of eateries and shopping. Numerous places to rent bikes and just take in the sunset.

I‚Äôm really not sure what is the big deal with the pier. They have a few rides for kids but I would never take my kids there unless you are prepared to grip their hands tight as you walk past the many people who are either homeless, drunk or high. The food smells like a heart attack waiting to happen and it‚Äôs too crowded to take a picture without someone else coming out. No reason to go here.

What a cool vibe there is here. Real characters singing and dancing and also the rides with the distinctive Ferris wheel.The beach is beautiful and wee souvenir shops dotted along. Definitely pleased we made this trip here.

Don't forget to grab an ice cream before you walk onto the pier, or to stick your head into the aquarium below, where you're greeted by a friendly staff that's willing to share with you about how they take care and then release endangered animals like nurse sharks etc.Be wary that it gets insanely crowded on weekends, but if you're around to catch a view of the sunset it's worth a million!

The view and scenery was breathtaking. This was our first time seeing the pier. There is something for everyone with vendors food and crafts and just everything. This place is for families and everyone. Don‚Äôt miss an opportunity to experience this magical site!!

column2: Great if you have not seen before
column3: My first time to see Santa Monica Pier and i really enjoyed it. A great vibe of people milling around and so many interesting little vendors displaying their wares or various talents. Superb views around the beaches and headlands from the end of the pier. Highly recommended.

column2: Great food - Way to many people tho
column3: Love the food options on the pier, in the weekends it can get crowded however not overly crowded - Stolling optional

We road our bikes out to the pier and enjoyed ourselves. Our kids are too old for the rides but it's such a fun place to visit and the view of the mountains and ocean are wonderful. There are neat food stands for snacks and while we didn't park a car there seemed to be ample parking openings when we were there.

When I‚Äôm in Los Angeles, I avoid Santa Monica Pier at all costs. It‚Äôs very crowded and touristy. Definitely stop by if you‚Äôve never been before, but it‚Äôs not a place I‚Äôd recommend for a group of adults to visit together on a weekend in Los Angeles.
Really good place for our morning stroll. Has a good funfair if you fancy some thrill seekingLobster restaurant nearby really gorgeous
I have been here before and there is a lot to do for the whole family. It is a very crowded place. There is a beautiful view of the ocean. This time I was not lucky enough to find parking.
Loved Santa Monica pier :)just a really chilled out fun place to be :)If in La check it out I can‚Äôt wait to go back again ,

There‚Äôs probably not much new I could say about the pier. It‚Äôs a must see destination with shops, amusement rides, street entertainment, great views of the ocean and surrounding mountains. All for free. Easy access to the beach and available parking.

This pier has an amusement park. It has some activities to do there, but I was bothered by how dirty it was and how many sketchy people there are. I was a bit creeped out. I have been there and seen it, but I will never go back.

column2: Great visit ! .. dont miss this pier ..
column3: Its a great pier with a really nicd view , theres plenty of places to play, eat of all kind of food , ice cream, candies etc.. walking there is a great experience and theres a parking near the entrance .. Its a must if you visit LA as a tourist and of course is a must to get up.on the Ferris wheel !! the view is amazing ..
Very crowded but it was a weekend, ate at the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier, busy but not a long wait. Food was good and service was fine. Would go again.
We walked out on the pier everyday! Lots of great views and people watching to be had. Lots of entertainment in a small area.

column2: I visited early morning so it was boring
column3: Later that day the Pier put on her glad rags and looked pretty good from the road.The Ferris Wheel was attractive but certainly not The Eye!I personally find these places tacky with games of chance which might as well be a straight out donation.So even though it did look attractive from a far it didn‚Äôt call me to spend time there.
We enjoyed our time there, was beautiful, lovely to walk around listening to so many pier performances, a good get away.

Santa Monica is beautiful, such a cool atmosphere around the pier and the beach! The pier is fun to walk on, and see the sights. And it's the end of Route 66, which is cool! A great place to people-watch....

As a European/Asian I miss to be in the real (not in a concert etc.) crowd. That gives me the feeling to be a member of a society. Santa Monica is a great place to be among nice people and the Pier in the location where you can see them all.
Went here with my 7 year old daughter. It was good to be on the pier. We did the aquarium and the rides which was a fun couple of hours. This is a best do while in Santa Monica
I have been looking forward to seeing this place for years!!! I was very impressed with the beauty and the views! Great for families!

We went on a thursday evening and then on a saturday evening: not the same vibe at all! It was very calm on thursday and we were almost alone. Some musicians were playing calm music.On saturday, it was crowded but we loved the atmosphere! You must go there just to walk around, dip your feet in the ocean et watch the ferris wheel.

column2: Go at sunset to people watch.
column3: Find a spot to watch the sun go down here. Interesting people to watch and always some entertainment. The shops and restaurants look so touristy they are best avoided. See the sea lions swim by.

My husband and I spend our birthday at the pier yesterday.What a blast we enjoyed every minute of itWe did not get on any of the rides but walked around, enjoy the sunset had a good dinner and listen to all the artist a long the pier.If you are big rides don't expect too much this is the old fashion carvival games,rides and food SUPER CUTE !!Unlimited Wristbands $29-39Popcorn $8Parking $10-20 or free (only on Sundays) a long the streets if you lucky enough to find oneJust to give you an idea.We will defently go back with our kids.
It was a bit of a disappointment. Things looked old and well worn though still quite heavily visited. Not sure I would come back for a second visit. Food and other items were quite overpriced.

It‚Äôs fun to see the carnivalstuff on the pier, see and hear the performers, see the fishermen clean out their catch (if any) and sit on the beach.My partner was stung by a bee on the beach; dont know if thats something that occurs a lot but it was painful for an hour and less painful the days after.Fun for about an hour. City wifi available if lucky.

Beautiful location easy to navigate an easy bus ride from Hollywood would recommend a good pair of shoes also 3 blocks from the pier is a great shopping area with no traffic in it only pedestrians great variety

There are rides and souvenir booths and food vendors and craft displays all along this walkable boardwalk raised high above the beach. This is a nice family attraction. We saw people doing yoga in open areas near the pier itself.

I've spent a few years exploring segments of the historic Route 66 and finally made it to the end of the line. Living in the desert, it was refreshing to visit the coast and see the ocean. I came mid-week to avoid the crowds and that worked out, well. Dogs are permitted on the pier, but not the beach.
