This is a must visit while in Santa Monica. The beach is beautiful and the pier is fun for the entire family. We parked our car and rented bikes to get a up close and personal feelOf the area. The shops are average beach shops with towels and souvenirs and regular goodies . Of course many smoke shops are also on the beach especially when We ended up at Venice. Venice beach has a huge skateboard park , this was only about 15 minutes from the pier. I enjoyed myself and can‚Äôt wait to get back!!

we have been there , and done that no need to returnYes it's unique , it has history however it's just a PierLost of sellers selling not muchThe fair / rides are expensiveLike I say go see it , tick it off the list and move on

Great atmosphere huge beach - easy access by public transport great for families, couples or solo when you need a place to wander and thinkLots of side shows going on acrobatics etc only downside was the food not so great and expensive if I went again I would take a picnic though.All in all great day out oh and wait to buy souvenirs from the guy in the shop at the end of the pier near the sea he is nicer and better priced than the vendors who have stalls on the pier

We were in Santa Monica for Christmas and we really enjoyed soaking up the atmosphere on the beautiful Santa Monica Pier. There is lots to do on the beautiful Pier and an afternoon stroll is an absolute must.

column2: Fun place where everybody will find something to do
column3: Nice bright ambiance with filled with people from all age groups. Ran into a guy playing songs of Bruno Mars in a sitar. Yes, you read that right. Good food, lots of gift shops, benches to sit and just gaze at the infinite waterbody ... magical :)

Ticked it of the bucket list but a very sad lacking place to visit. Beach is dirty, homeless everywhere and drug addicts as plentiful as tourists. Shops on pier selling junk at expensive prices.Rides üëé keep your expectations low especially if you are from Australia.

column2: Reminded us of Home and Years gone by
column3: This is your typical old fashion pier by the sea with some lovewlt gift shops and the famous Bubba Gumps restuarant which is a must to experience as the food is fantastic,just make sure your hungary as the portions are BIG!!

column2: Think the pier needs a make-over
column3: I think if you are rush for time, you can skip this place. Pier looks old to me. Went early evening so not as crowded as I expected, perhaps everyone was already done for the day. Souvenir stalls scattered around the pier with many buskers trying their luck but I thought it contributed to noise pollution - hip hop dancers, someone trying to sing a western, another girl singing the latest pop hits. I tried very hard to discover the charm of this place, but failed.

Always a great place to visit and re visit! Plenty to do for everyone! The usual shopping, eating, plus more physical related activity for the young and active! Was with my family and we just added more memories again visiting this wonderful pier and it‚Äôs neighborhood! Perfect Weather too!!

We were on our way to Venice and took a wrong turn! Parking was $10 and crowded. There are a lot of vendors selling stuff, some in a kiosk and some just selling fruit out of a bin. Hey everyone has to make money so I wasn‚Äôt bothered. On the pier we tried to find a frozen banana, my favorite beachside treat but no luck. We walked and enjoyed the area, but it was very crowded on the pier. The boardwalk was a nice walk with lots of people watching!

This was my third trip over a 12 year period and the pier was looking worse for wear - I still think it‚Äôs a must see but would be good to get it upgraded to keep the icon looking good and worth the trip
We took the band for all rides and got onto each and every ride here. It was a fun time for sure. Everyone will enjoy here

I love the pier, it reminds me of everything I loved in childhood - rides, fairground fun and food and cute little stalls selling souvenirs both cool and tacky! The mush do for me is the wheel and have a fortune from Zoltar

column2: A fun place to see at night...great food...great views!
column3: Went at night and the place was just beautiful. Lit up like a Christmas tree!... we got there a little late so the amusement park had just closed, so check closing time. Quirky little souvenir shops, buskers and yummy food. A happy place to be! I dare you not to sing the song! ( all I wanna do is have some fun...until the sun comes up over Santa Monica Boulevard!)

We took our young children here and the rides were perfect for all ages. Nothing too crazy here. The atmosphere was great. The beach was great. The Ferris wheel looks AMAZING at dawn! We highly recommend this attraction!

column2: Great place for walking and sightseeing day or night
column3: We visited Santa Monica Pier during a summer evening in August. We parked near the mall in the city area, it was quick walk and parking wasn‚Äôt expensive. We walked by sights as we made our way to the pier. We stopped at a burger place on the pier that was good. We walked around for a bit and went through the amusement area. This is a fun place for a date night and for a walk.
Dropped in on way to Venice Beach - kinda ‚Äòcute‚Äô but wouldn‚Äôt say spectacular.Bubba Gump had an hour wait, the Beach Burger Bar was nice instead.
Make sure to go day and night to see it lit up. Very pretty and a great day with kids! Bathrooms are the cleanest too along this stretch of Santa Monica.

My husband & I enjoyed a quiet morning walk on the pier. The view was beautiful & fun! We saw a seal & a dolphin swimming around the pier. I'm sure it's a fun place when all the shops & rides are open but it was great for a nice walk back in history. You can see old pictures & read about the history of the pier. Even in the morning there was one musician playing pleasant music & a few souvenir shops were open.
We walked from Venice beach and compare to Venice which is so clean Santa monica is dirty and saw like 2 dead birds on the beach were kids was playing.

The pier was right outside out hotel so went down in the afternoon for a sightseeing and lunch. This was one long walk with restaurant and gift shops on the right side.we saw quite a few people fishing and saw lots of sea lions right below the pier. Sunset was an amazing sight. Just that the place was lot windy. I definitely recommend this place
Walking on the pier at Santa Monica is kind of a right of passage. The offering on the pier are second rate amusement park. The people watching and views along the beach are first rate.
What a great way to ring in the new year! Watching the East Coast celebration fireworks from the roller coaster was awesome!

column2: See it, but save your money
column3: Great to go, see the view and take pictures. But certainly do not need to spend any money at any restaurant, store or ride. Again, great to go and have pictures.

column2: Another One for my Bucket List
column3: I've been visiting Sourthern California at least annually since 1978. But I never made it to see the Santa Monica Pier until near the end of our last visit. The occaison was prompted by a visit to see my niece who had recently relocated from Brentwood to Santa Monica. We planned to meet for dinner after she got out of work. I went a little early so I could see the Pier. Found a parking spot a few blocks from the Pier and got to it just after sunset. The Pier was crowded with people and the lights had just come on. The Ferris Wheel and roller coaster were carrying lots of people. Lots of street musicians with skills that ranged from ear-hurting to pretty damn good. Lots of shops with stuff I think only tourists would buy. The restaurants weren't that interesting in that they were often-seen chain reataurants that charge higher prices because they are on the Pier. Even so, most of them were full of people. At the end of the Pier, there is a second floor observation deck and I'm sure the sunset views are absolutely stunning. Wouldn't recommend that visitors go out of their way and through heavy traffic to come here though. Unlike the Piers in Huntington Beach and Seal Beach, there isn't much room for people to fish.
Great place to visit just from an historic perspective. Not showy, more touristy. Fun place to "people watch".

I will preface this by saying we have small children so the rides on offer were perfect! We had a lovely day visiting this iconic landmark, a place we had only read about or seen on tv. It was full of rides and games that entertained my 3 small children and the view! Who could complain about the gorgeous Santa Monica beachfront. We have absolutely loved Santa Monica. Such a beautiful part of the world. Great for tourists!
You can't go wrong visiting the pier. The art and food vendors, souvenir shops, the rides, the beach, the people watching - it's a fun time for all.
We enjoyed walking around the pier, there is a great atmosphere and nice places to eat and have a few drinks.
We went to the Santa Monica pier for my sister yoga and it fun for me the water is so cold and the food Is great we will return soon

The end of historic Route 66. A mix of everything from t shirts shops arcade games food vendors fishing and amusement rides. It‚Äôs a must stop. Be prepared for a lot of people but sit back and soak it all in
I wend last weekend...Very crowded but fun. We rented bikes which was cool but hard to navigate the crowds at times. Fun ride down to Venice Beach!

The pier has a Ferris Wheel, a Roller Coaster and a Merry Go-Round Carousel. There are two swings that are massive and each seat can accommodate 5-10 persons. There is also a high Trapeze for adults. There are multiple stalls where you can win prizes. There are lots of places to eat - fast food or you can eat at Bubba Gump Shrimp co - excellent.

Just like in the movies the views are great. When you arrive you‚Äôll notice the throngs of people taking pictures with the pier sign, which as expected it‚Äôs instantly recognizable. The actual pier is a tourist trap however, worth visitting to check it off your bucket list . Lots of typical touristy shops overpriced, with lots of tourists so expect overcrowding. The boards have seen better days so if you plan on wearing high heel‚Äôs or have some sort of a disability or difficulty walking you may need to be a bit carefulNot to be missed are the views from up on the promenade, both at sunset and at nightEnjoy

We visited the pier in early Jan and it was still warm and enjoyable. Walked around the pier for a while enjoying the views and some of the rides. Went down to the beach and rented bikes for $30 and road down to venice beach and back enjoying the atmosphere.
Was a great first time visiting here. I like fishing and I had a blast watching the people fish there.
It is a must go to place when in L.A., but not worth the hype. The town of Santa Monica is worth the drive. It‚Äôs historical and picturesque...explore the town!

We visited Santa Monica pier on a very hot friday in december. I've not visited in well over 20 yrs but not much had changed. There are rides for the kids & plenty of stalls selling hats, t shirts & vendors selling ice creams & food.Lots to see & do. Lovely old fashioned pier.Walk to the endear great views back to the beach.

Santa Monica Pier just of Broadway was a nice visits free of charge loads of buskers and stalls souveneer shops all over easy to get round. We watched the local fishing from the end of the pier and there's a small park for rides ferris wheel and other little attractions. The beaches surrounding the pier go on for ever either side. There are a few beggers about that's maybe the off putting bit however you don't need to interact with them lots of police about. And you the Santa Monica place close by to do your shopping overall a good time was had by all.

column2: Dense fog, but loved the visit
column3: The pier is so vibrant and lively, no matter the weather. It was a dense fog day, but with the lights up we had lots of fun!! Do try the blue ice cream with chocolate chip near the Pacific park!! My son enjoyed the carousel. There is local music and some people singing music and playing instruments along the pier while you walk.
Very dirty place, so crowded and unsafe!!!! Low quality food and restaurants!!! Overall I won‚Äôt go back there.

We had a fun afternoon renting bikes and going up to Santa Monica pier. If you have a big chunk of the day to ride the rides the unlimited pass is worth it. But if you are only staying for a short period of time I thought the rides were a little expensive as it is $35 for unlimited rides for adults and $20 for unlimited rides for kids. Or each ride individually is 5-10$.

column2: Fun place to skate and bike
column3: Enjoy a nice skate or bike ride around the Santa Monica pier. Beautiful beach and also fun place to people watch.

We visited this pier along with beach next to it in June-2017.- 2 families, 4 adults & 2 small kids - 5, 6 year old- after the beach fun, we strolled around the pier in evening after it got dark.- nice live music + sound of crashing waves..very soothing and fun- we didnt eat anything here- parking was ok, bit tight spots here due to limited space for a minivan. Do consider other parking options especially the beach as getting out of this parking lot at busy times can take ~10-15min+- decent restrooms

column2: Go to the very end for sea lions!
column3: Okay, this is a tourist trap of all tourist traps - but it's fun. If you go to the very end of the pier, you can see sea lions swimming around (which is so fun!) Avoid the garage if you can, some friends took 45 mins just to get out of the garage one day. We parked on the street by a meter and had no problem getting in/out. Great location to walk around, some fantastic street musicians there as well. We did not eat there, but the restaurant at the very end looked nice. Yes it's a tourist trap but $8 to play skee ball is a little excessive. ;)
The pier is a great place to take some photos and enjoy the beautiful view. There is a lot of restaurants around the area too. Nice place to take your kids.

Went to Pier to kill a couple of hours and relax in the sun & sand and crisp ocean air! Had amazing food at The Albright:amazing bread bowl of clam chowder loaded with clams! Insanly yummy fish and chips! Worth the drive and parking is ample.

column2: Stop and take some photos, but don‚Äôt plan a long stay.
column3: We went on New Year‚Äôs Day- so was super crowded. We parked in a lot on 4th street and enjoyed the walk to the pier- it was cheaper and allowed us to see some of the area.Pros:Good photo placesGreat viewsMerry-go-round is very pretty - it‚Äôs inside. At the start of the Pier, not with the other rides.Cons:Large crowdsRun downArea around Pier is dirty with many beggars and homeless- gives it an unsafe feel.Overall, I am glad we stopped by, but was also disappointed. Checked this off our bucket list and moved on.
Visited Santa Monica Pier while on holiday.It is a nice area for a walk in the evening although it can be very busy

We came to see it as a part of an LA trip. It is iconic. The rides looked like fun and there were several shops but it looked sketchy traveling from Ocean Avenue due to beggars and homeless milling about. It‚Äôs likely safer for families during the daytime. Worth the visit but be cautious.

Right at the end of Route 66 this pier exists with an amusement park, beach surrounding both sides, restaurants, and of course a great atmosphere.The small amusement park is great for kids, there is also an older style arcade.The walk along the pier is great with live music playing at almost all times of the day.Must try the fresh fruit for sale! With chilli and salt, it‚Äôs the best! Genius!

Amazing pier, better that the one in Santa Barbara. This is a place to visit with your family and little chindren. The pir have an attraction park (have to pay to enter) that iI recomend to visit in the night.The pier is a must to visit when you travel to L.A.
Maybe this place has history behind , maybe it colorful and picturesque but it sure is also full of homeless people , dizzy tourists , dirty places and horrible traffic .

Even at 5pm in January, when its completely dark outside, this place is busy! We parked near the Pier, walked down to the end, and enjoyed all of the street entertainers dancing, singing, etc. We looked out over the ocean and across the coastline to all of the little lights in the distance and enjoyed the view! We bought a ticket and rode the Ferris wheel, which was worth the 10.00 per person! The views were awesome! We had so much fun and we were only there for an hour.
kitschy, old pier, worth a quick walk out and back, didn't eat there so don't know how the food was, but something to do at night, vendors line the pier, about what you'd expect, still old-timey.

Santa Monica Pier is a must see place in Santa Monica! Try to go there early by 10AM as the parking would be extremely difficult to get in the afternoon. The pier has so many attractions for people with young children. Ferry's wheel and roller coaster are the biggest attractions for kids. There are a few good restaurants there too.
Overall good. Had more expectations. Lots of venders and music.It‚Äôs definitely a must do but don‚Äôt expect much. Parking is $15-$20.
A very old place with attractions for all ages.Good restaurants and some shopping too.If it's your first time in LA you have to come.....

column2: Still good to waste time here
column3: Came back here to remind our teenage kids of their visit 8yrs ago. The pier rides and amusement stalls are definitely better suited to kids under 10, but we all got a kick out of walking around again.We arrived at 1:00pm and couldn't see the end of the pier. A massive thick fog was everywhere and it was quite cool. We had come from Griffith Park for a swim, where it had been clear blue sky and really hot. It was eerily strange. So we walked around and walked down the beach towards Venice Beach and noticed the fog lifting. Still being on Australia time, we ended up going for lunch/dinner at Bubba Gumps about 3pm just as the fog lifted to again a clear blue sky. We luckily got a table right on the beach level western corner. It was very full, but it was fun watching the hawkers play set up and move cat and mouse, according to the police patrols. We were then treated to a gorgeous sunset as we were finishing our meals.

A visit to Los Angeles brings up images of its iconic beaches. I found the beach views at Santa Monica Pier just incredible. But this is not a beach for the introverted looking to chill out. Instead, this is a super social beach with terrific foot traffic. There are people everywhere moving in every direction. For the most part, the garbage is disposed of properly, but there were times I came across the dubious smell of pee in places I did not want to smell pee....Also, the surrounding Santa Monica area is completely pedestrian friendly, with so many opportunities to travel by bike, skateboard, etc. Parking around this area was reasonable, but I would encourage visitors to come here in the morning for easier parking.

Well, Santa Monica lived up to all expectations. What more can you ask from an actual park on the pier?Our 16 & 10 year olds loved it with games & rides. Shops & entertainers everywhere but none were pushy.Water, Lights, laughter, Fun & enjoyment.
Honestly thius is a tired old pier. Fairly sad old amusement park and so me tourist restaurants. More fun to be had grabbing a bike and riding the boardwalk. Needs a major update

Bring a bottle of water and some snacks when you stroll here.You will feel like you are in a painting with the awesome view.Be entertained with the local entertainers. Drop a dollar or more for the talents they share.Try wearing bright colors (uniform) if you are coming as a family( with small children) This helps in finding each other quickly.If you want to try fishing .. you will be blessed ( with a catch - if you are patient. )
Not big at all! Dirty, trash everywhere, & nasty bathrooms. We did enjoy the bike trail though! But it was extremely crowded.
Santa Monica Pier offered tons of fun for everyone. We had access to the beach, great restaurants, arcade room, rides, and nearby shopping pavilions.

Okay let‚Äôs start with the obvious it‚Äôs not that incredible but it still is somewhere you have to go when you‚Äôre in Los Angeles. You just have to go on a walk to the pier and on a sunny day it‚Äôs a treat and a free one :)

column2: Fun in a 'kiss me quick' hat sort of a way
column3: For those of a refined taste, look away now.The Pier is a Santa Monica institution and it's still fun in a typically tatty sort of a way. It does keep reinventing itself by way of different attractions, new eateries and things to do, so it's worth popping back every so often to see what has changed. Our kids loved it and the vendors (and hawkers) were all friendly and polite but - to coin a phrase - it is what it is. So accept it's a tourist trap, it'll be busy, you will spend money on rubbish you don't really want or need, and enjoy the experience.

column2: Fun, festive atmosphere. Gorgeous ocean views.
column3: Tip: Weekend parking can be a challenge as it gets super busy, consider side street parking a couple blocks away or pay a little to park in the Santa Monica Place mall or nearby parking structures and walk to the pier.Do not let the crowd deter you, there is probably not a better place to catch some of the most beautiful and gorgeous views of the Pacific Ocean and the Southern California coastline. The golden sunset views are particularly breath taking. Take your time to explore different parts of the pier, walk right to the end, there are so many different photo op spots.The colorful amusement park next to the pier, the many interesting shops and restaurants present a fun, festive atmosphere. Do hold on to little kids as it gets really crowded.

Everyone should visit the Pier at least once if for nothing else just to see where ‚Äú The Mother Road ‚Äú ends and meets the ocean! She has been here forever and despite trying to upgrade she is old and tired.
The pier is the same as before, nice views but the carny rides and games are a bit cheap. We enjoyed the plain piers in Manhattan Beach and Hermosa Beach much better.

column2: A treat for the tacky tourist
column3: I would not normally consider myself a tacky tourist, but this is a visual icon of the SoCal coastline.I think it transcends tackyville if you start and finish by walking, biking or jogging from Venice beach - about 3 miles away.‚ÄòTwas a beautiful December Monday that my best friend and I capped off a great 5 day business / vacation trip with a stroll to the amusement park on the pier.

column2: Great sites too see but very busy.
column3: It's a must if your in LA obviously it's packed with tourist but that's not surprising. There's lots to see and do and the views of the beaches are great!

I‚Äôm not sure what all the hype is about this place. It is a tiny pier with some rides for kids. I guess being from the east coast I‚Äôm spoiled by all of the boardwalks with huge piers and tons of rides. Makes this look like your local parking lot carnival. Like I said, worth seeing once as there are great restaurants in the area and certainly good if you have small kids as older ones would be bored. Great to be there at sunset and then to watch the rides all lit up. Parking is easy at the pier but you‚Äôll pay for it. Up the street at the top of the road on Colorado is a lot with the first 3 hours free. Enjoy!

Just what you would think an american seaside pier would be like.Rides, souvenir shops, places to eat and get a coffee,do go as early as possible at the weekend as the crowds became enormous later after lunchtimeGood access for people with restricted mobility and walkway in to the town when you have had enough

column2: A fun place to spend some time
column3: First off, give yourself time to park, the place is usually packed and if you can, park on the pier, it is cheaper than the surrounding beach lots and worth waiting in the line. Also nice to be able to get right in your car later in the evening. I have even parked on the pier when going to the beach and not the pier. Great views up and down the coast from Pacific Palisades to Point Dume in Malibu and on a clear day Catalina Island. Also a short walk to the 3rd street promenade in Santa Monica. Easy to make a full day at the pier if you desire or just a couple hours if walking and having a meal.
The pier itself is good for a few hours, has a few places to eat, a mini theme park and street entertainment. I would recommend a visit and then heading to Venice Beach to spend the rest of the day.

Very pretty and just what you see on tv.Plenty of tourists and so many things to see and do, everyone is there for the same reason to see the sights and take it all in. Do the ferris wheel and really enjoy the view.People were friendly,the homeless beggers are annoying

There are an unlimited amount of perfect photo spots on the pier, it is located right on the beach, but be sure to bring footwear as the sand tends to get scolding hot overall it was a great spot to walk and hang out for a few hours!

Great attraction on the beach. The gondola ride is fantastic, great views of the area from up high but at $10 per person it really adds up for a family. The arcade games are extremely pricey at $5 a turn,Awesome to visit, just be selective about what you go on when you are there.
We had a ton of fun at the pier. Traveling with husband , teenage daughter and 8 year old daughter. We all equally enjoyed the pier.
Filthy boring and useless with heaps of drug stuffed homeless .... The buskers are pathetic the shops are ok but really such a top location under managed - Total miss!!!!

There are rides on the peir and restaurants, the best part is watching all the performers that are playing, dancing, singing and whatever their talents are , throughout the day.. People fishing, people swimming , riding bikes, its a great lively spot to people watch and enjoy the nice long beautiful sandy beach.

The Santamonica Pier is a classic. Most of the rides and restaurants have been updated and the prices are a lot higher than when I was a kid but the Carousel remains an affordable and beautiful and nostalgic attraction and is worth a trip every time I visit.

I visited the pier on Christmas Day. Little did i know that i wouldnt be the only person with that great idea; it was packed. It was a fun time though. Spent about two hours on the pier walking around with family. If you have little ones who dont like to walk, bring strollers. Plenty of amateur performers and souvenir shops.
One word - Crazy place to visit on Christmas Day - more people there visiting than all the other places we visited!Very little parking , long lines - traffic was a nightmare !

Cool place to visit, but the reality is that this is an old dirty pier with homeless people perched at every exit. Credit the police presence that keeps things moving along. They did have the nicest parking attendant I‚Äôve dealt with though!
I enjoyed spending 1 1/2 hrs here. Liked walking down the whole pier and seeing the shops. Lots of food choices. Disappointed how much the rides cost so I didn't bother. Still had a nice time!

column2: A must see LA icon - interesting place with lots of entertainment
column3: Visited the pier and we loved it.....lots to do, see and place to eat.Very busy place with lots of overseas visitors. Get their early if you want to park and see the pier without huge crowds

column2: Great place to visit and see the sunset
column3: We visited the Pier and it was jumping with activity and music. The views from the pier was amazing as well as the vendors.
If your looking for flashy and expensive tourist attractions then check out the pier food and retail. It does have great views of the city, ocean, beach, and mountains from the pier.

My family visited the pier a few times and loved it! Lots of great restaurants and always something going on. While we were there there were talented singers, musicians, booths with items for sales Ferris wheel with lights displaying an array of Christmas images. There‚Äôs something for everyone!

column2: Interesting place and lots of fun.
column3: Lots of rides, weird performers and lots to eat. There were many performers singing and dancing and entertaining the many visitors. I couldn‚Äôt believe how many people make their way to the Santa Monica Pier on the weekend. It was just crowded at night and cold. The age ranges from little kids playing games and enjoying the rides to grandparents and older. Lots of fun and an interesting place to visit. I was surprised to see many foreigners visiting the US.

column2: One of the best places to visit when in LA.
column3: Santa Monica Pier is wonderful and there are lots of restaurants and stores around the area. Of course, the beach is great too, though it was cold when I was there.

column2: I think it‚Äôs had it‚Äôs day
column3: The old pier looks like it‚Äôs had its day. Run down and the rides looked like they were very old. Markets were average and the only highlight was the view of the beaches. Sadly we were disappointed but ticked it off our list.

Visiting from Michigan in December the weather was beautiful. Find the parking closest to the pier if only walking around and shortly leaving, it‚Äôs $3 an hour. We payed $20 for an hour in the main rd.
The pier is run down and sad. The stalls sell cheap market kitschy stuff. I believe this is a young tourist nightlife spot. It‚Äôs one redeeming feature is the beautiful beach and the walkway.

My fianc√© and i came here for some fun on our anniversary. We enjoyed the games and rides, but a lot of the snack vendors, like dip n dogs and popcorn, were closed, and since it was kind of like. Carnival, we felt we missed out on the carnival experience. Other than that, we had a lot of fun!
A beautiful serene view of the ocean and the fun activities available at the pier makes it one of the incredible places in LA.
Beautiful Pier, lots of great scenery. Homeless living under Pier was a little sad though. Great photo opportunities. We walked along each front to Venice Beach which was nice

We came here after going to Venice beach.. it was very nice and being able to watch the sunset on the ocean here was magical.the pier was fun, very interesting people there but it makes the trip memorable

column2: Modernized but keeps the traditional personality
column3: Viewed from the street, the Pier does not look like much. The Ferris Wheel is fun to watch at night. Once you go into the area, it really opens up with more attractions, rides, food, merchandise and personality than expected. Great for kids, families, dates.
Love Santa Monica Pier!! The beach is nice but the atmosphere on the pier is wonderful!! Have to ride the Ferris wheel, great view and the pics are silly cute! Lots of restaurants to choose from!!

We were trying to kill a little time before we headed off to the airport to fly home from our trip; and this was just the place to do it!There is so much hustle and bustle here, but not in an overwhelming sense. You can hear live music from extremely talented individuals, go fishing, grab a bite to eat at any of the restaurants/cafes, or just walk down to the beach (which is almost pure white sand) and enjoy the wide, open Pacific Ocean view.It was a perfect was to end our visit in California. We really hope to come back again soon!
This was a fun place to visit with beautiful sunsets and the whole California experience. Overall was worth the traffic
This place is beautiful especially at night. There is everything from rides to gift shops, street performers, variety of food and games.
A beautiful place for tourists, conference goers and locals. Nice restaurants and bars. Nothing great to write home about but worth a quick glance before you go to better parts of LA.

More pot smoking homeless and trump impersonators , people scantily glad that need more clothes, bad singers and bad trapeze artists and who really gets their name engraved on a piece of rice? View are gorgeous..a few edible fun stalls and good little rides for the 5-18 year old set...wonderful stroll on an authentic wooden pier and views and if you need a freak fix..you came to the right place. This is la at its wackiest :)

First time in Santa Monica I was assuming that there would be plenty of rides, they only had two. But has little shops along the pier and performers. The beach was beautiful and volunteers were cleaning it and it‚Äôs definitely kept up nicely. I‚Äôm still impressed how clean it was. It‚Äôs a nice little stop if you are around that area.

The Pier has a lot of history and it is big enough that it feels relaxed. And the large expanse of beach on both sides allows you to get away from it all.Or check out the gym with all its Horizontal bars, rings and tightropes, and watch. Or get in a workout. Lots of bike rentals and segways to make the pleasant but otherwise lengthy walk to Venice Beach a breeze.
Great place to check out during your stay. Great views. Love the scenery and landscaping. Also the beach and boardwalk. Really enjoyed it.
Its the first time here for me and i just love how its feels like stepping back in time. Its really an interesting place that is worth a visit if in L.A..
Great afternoon with the kids!So much fun here, have been before and will be backGreat fun rides, restaurants at the end of the pierKids love it here

A must do while in SoCal! Go late afternoon/dusk for beautiful sunsets and pictures of the Ferris Wheel and roller coaster. Park near the 3rd street Promenade and walk over the bridge - parking by the beach is a bit crazy.

Beautiful beach. Nice place to see american culture. Performers on the boardwalk, kiosks selling stuffs and food. Also some rides if your kids like it. We had a good walk on the boardwalk.Huge parking. Forgot how much my husband paid...but something like $10 or $15 fixed rate, not hourly.

Thirty two fifty for an all day pass on some really basic rides!! We didn‚Äôt buy them. Ok value in the arcade especially for pinball or air hockey fans. Food was expensive and not too appealing. Boardwalk crowd and musicians made the atmosphere nice on a Friday evening
Long stretch of lovely beach. Along the pier, there‚Äôs games, Ferris wheel and restaurants and the atmosphere was very lively. The sea breeze makes it a nice getaway.

Santa Monica is a fabulous beach, we really enjoyed our afternoon here. The pier is fantastic too; so many people, so much to do and such a good vibe. Great views from the end of the pier of the beach and coastline.There are guys selking ice cream, hot dogs, popcorn at al and lots of performance artists, especially on the landward end of the pier.So much energy here and a lovely place to spend a sunny day

column2: Because you are in Santa Monica
column3: Had some time to kill because our flight arrived 5 hours before our hotel room was ready. So ws took some time out tp visit the pier.Nothing spectacular. Old, in need of repair. Plenty of homeless suffering from mental illness would make some people uncomfortable. Smell of cannabis is rife. And the stalls and shops are not worth your hard earned.Look, you go because it is a done thing to do. Take some photos and move along.Its only a 5 minute walk to the 3rd street market area.Food wise I didn't think it was worthwhile spending and $$$.Trip Advisor tip: Stay away from the park area. Its riddled with homeless and they WILL confront you for $$$. And get an uber or ride share if you need to travel there. It will save you about 50% over a taxi.

We came here for the day. Pier has the sort of arcade type stuff you‚Äôd see in the Uk, but was still fun. Beach was much nicer and warmer.Took a walk along the Ocean Front path which was really nice.Be aware that lots of stuff is shut on a Monday including the aquarium.

column2: Not too crowded this time of year
column3: We strolled along the pier and found it to be very nice and not too crowded, but enough going on to make it worth visiting. The roller coaster and Ferris wheel weren‚Äôt running in the afternoon while we were there so check before you go what their running schedule is if that‚Äôs what you want to do.
Went to the Santa Monica pier had a very good time took pictures walked around we went thru the week to avoid the weekend crowds Beautiful beach to enjoy....

I mean it‚Äôs Santa Monica Pier... you‚Äôre somewhat obligated to stop by at least for a bit. I love going here at night to people watch, listen to the waves and the musicians playing on the pier and of course catch a great view. Grab a smoothie in venice and walk the path over to the pier. It‚Äôs maybe a thirty minute walk and way better than getting a taxi.
We had a great evening trying out a few of the rides on the pier. The view from the Ferris wheel was great and the roller coaster fun. We then had a meal at Bubba Gumps -yum!!

This place is so beautiful. You could wear a bathing suit soak up the sun on the beach or wear something comfortable & enjoy the board walk. It's a mini theme park on the pier, so kids of all ages are welcome. Live bands & singers. You have painters, balloon makers, dancers & all types of entertainment out there. The food is phenomenal. I don't recommend the gift shop because the prices are ridiculous. The pier normally have sea lion sightings--I was lucky to see a few while I was there. It's great for a date night, family outing or just a place to clear your mind.

column2: Fun place for a day visit
column3: Fun for a day! Great place to watch the sunset. Typical junk food available plus nearby restaurants are very good. Clean environment.

We visited LA and I wanted to see what the hype was for the Santa Monica pier. Parking was $7. The pier was nothing special for me. This would be a good place to bring kids. The pier had a lot of games and rides like a carnival would. Lots of little knick knack shops.

column2: A must do if you've never been to Santa Monica
column3: Great for a family day out or lunch by the water at Bubba Gumps. Parking on site and heaps to do. Wander and take pics or get involved on the rides. Tuna of fun!

column2: Take a stroll down Santa Monica Pier
column3: Free fun entertainment and the beautiful blue sea! Street vendors, live music, characters, food, all walks of life, token games, pressed pennies, Ferris Wheel, Aquarium, unique original art, and much more. Bring your sunscreen, grab a cool drink and enjoy the unusual.

column2: Great vibes for people watching and feeling the culture
column3: The pier is a great place to come solo, with friends, your significant other or fam! Although it is touristy - it is great time. The pier offers talent and artists like no other, great food options and of course, a great view of the ocean and mountain range. Hit 3rd street within walking distance for more great shops and food.

column2: Don't Miss if You're in LA Doing the Beach Thing
column3: Brilliant. An absolute must if you're near the beaches in LA. We were here late on a Sunday night, 2300-0000, and the pier had a real vibrant feel to it. People were out enjoying themselves and making full use of the pier's amenities. Lots to do here...even if it's just people watching. Be sure to check out the arcade, choker block with all your retro favourites.

column2: Fun place to spend some time
column3: Have been coming here since I was a kid. Still drive up from San Diego a few times a year to visit and walk the pier, eat at the restaurants and people watch. Many changes over the years so always seems like something new to see when I visit. Great for photography as well. Fun for families and people of all ages.

column2: Just a whole lot of fun
column3: Fabulous from up close or even afar, particularly at night when the lights really bring it alive. Beautiful. Look out for regular live music concerts. They add another dimension. Fun place Santa Monica.

column2: Not Pretty or well maintained... Carpark overwater!
column3: Santa Monica Pier is not pretty, has no connection to the environment and is something that is more disappointing than enjoyable. It's almost like a car park overwater.Overall if you visit Santa Monica you will likely visit the pier as part of having a beachfront walk, however it is underwhelming.

column2: Cool place for Christmas at the beach! Connects to the boardwalk!
column3: Great place to go with family and friends! Cool light show! The pier is located very close to Main Street, Venice Beach, and 3rd Street Promenade! The boardwalk is good day or night! If you are a people watcher it is a cool place for you too! Pet-friendly everywhere except the beach and fun in the sun or evening! Walk or ride bikes to it all! üëçüèΩüëçüèΩ

Yes, it is an icon for road trips. We drove a Corvette for a bit of Route 66 in California and Arizona, toured up the Pacific Coast and made a picture stop at Santa Monica pier. Breezy, cool and restful.Not much to eat or buy there. It is a spot that marks completion of a sports car touring. It is an accomplishment in life.

What an awesome idea and place. I'm sure this is not that special to someone who lives by the ocean but to this inland travel Santa Monica pier is a one stop shop of cool. First of all the beach. The ocean is right there with the powdery beach. A great place to sit and relax and talk in some rays. Also, they have swing sets, ring swings, places to rent bikes and ropes to test your balance. So, you have the option to relax or be a little active. They have an aquarium below the pier. The pier itself has all kinds of fun. They have an amusement park with a roller coaster, Ferris wheel, several skill games to win prizes. Burger shops, coffee shops, fishing. Soda jerks. Pretty everything to keep you entertained all day. The most unique thing I saw was this pier was the end of the old Route 66 hwy. so they have an old shop and several things dedicated to the history of this highway. History buffs will love I'm sure. Can't wait to go back here.

Had a decent time just walking and people watching. Didn‚Äôt ride anything and not sure of the prices but the parking was very reasonable! Vendors along the pier selling things but not super pushy! Just a short walk to the mall
Took an Uber from our hotel in Venice beach to the pier.Good to have carnival feel after dark and also get the vibes and soul of the city with basker-like boardwalk entertainment.
Though a massive clich√© and totally derivative, you still must make this trip to the Lourdes of LA. Long live the Ferris wheel.
nice and relaxing place. Just atch out from the crooks at the pier on the route 66 shop, they always try to take advantage of tourists.

First time goin to the pier the rides were not to bad. The creativity that was expressed in the board walk was amazing. The view of the beach and Santa Monica from the Pier was simply beautiful. I will certainly return to see the pier again.
Nice place to visit, but it was pretty dead on Monday evening. Not sure if that's always the case, or just that one day.
Beautiful pier with amazing views all aroundGood place for a coffee a sit down and take in the breathtaking views, also some good entertainment on the pier

There‚Äôs not really a lot too do around the pier, unless you go onto the beach or you‚Äôre inclined to visit the funfair/theme park although if you haven‚Äôt got some young children in tow you‚Äôll probably give the latter a miss.This pier is great way to burn some time, enjoy the world around you, and watch the beach life (although that gets boring after a few minutes!)There‚Äôs plenty of shops and a few eating places on here, but beware you‚Äôll definitely be paying a premium for anything on here!Overall though, it‚Äôs definitely a good place to spend around half a day or so (for some, even less than that)

The Santa Monica pier was the high light of our weekend trip. The pier was clean, and not crowded when we went that day. The weather was perfect for walking. Was able to take nice pictures and enjoy the view. A lot of restaurants and souvenir shops too. There is a arcade too. When u plan to visit Santa Monica you have to visit the pier. Enjoy your trip
Anywhere close to this area you must walk the pier just because and get your picture by the end of Route 66 sign!
End of Route 66 and a great place to spend a couple of hours. Parking nearby, reasonable price. Some nice little shops.

column2: The end of Route 66,fair and ferrous wheel,Old time themed pier,Nostalgic
column3: Remember when all sea sides had a pier,well this is it,fair,good food,beer,even a police station ,car park,views of Pacific Ocean,it has it all,even a memorial at the end.Well worth stopping here.

Getting there is easy and no problem parking ($2) Just not that much to see. Lots of seagulls and an occasional pelican. T shirt vendors, knick-knacks and souvenir shops. Bubba Gump shrimp had a 25 minute wait (which we didn't).

Santa Monica Pier is very relaxing and over the years attracts more people and has gotten bigger with restaurants and shops like El Torito here and the small shops that are exclusive to the beach life.

We were there with a group of friends and all our teenage daughters. We hung out on the beach for awhile and then made our way to the pier. We stopped for cotton candy and ice cream. We only had time for one ride, so we chose the roller coaster. It was a lot of fun! There were a lot of activities to choose from and plenty of food stops. A great way to spend an afternoon!
This is a great tourist attraction and a must to visit to watch the sunset and then it lights up and looks spectacular definitely ride the ferris wheel too!

column2: Very nice place to spend the morning or afternoon.
column3: You can go and enjoy the ocean breeze and the sound of waves, ad well as grab some snacks or a full meal.

The weather is great, the views are awesome and there are several food locations here including Bubba Gump Shrimp and Pier Burger. The shops are a little pricey but you're paying for the view and location so it's understandable. I would like to come back here in the near future and spend more time.

The pier is full of life, food, rides and frivolity. The ferris wheel offer spectacular views of the California coast line. This is also the end of route 66. Great photo opportunities and carnival games to choose from

The carousel is the perfect place for AFM cocktails. I went here with my Heattwave Productions colleague every night of the AFM for carousel cocktails, and it was great fun.I recommend going to the pier in the day, or early evening, as crime can be a problem there. A woman got shot at the pier the same evening we where there. Unfortunately gun violence is an everyday problem in America, so use common sense. Visit this place with a friend or family member, and try to leave before it gets too late...especially on the weekend.

The pier didn't disappoint. Street performers, live music, lots and lots of people make this place wonderful.Restaurants and bars were packed and it created an amazing atmosphere.We also rented bikes and had a ride to the Venice beach and back.

Neat place with restaurants, rides, and entertainers. You have a great view of the ocean from the end of the pier. We were there at sunset and got great pics. We spent about 2 hours there and that was enough. Glad I got to see it, but prob wouldnt visit again.
This place was great but shady at night and a lot of people during peak hours. Beautiful sunset view you shouldn't miss. Saw a seal for the first time ever.
This nice small fishing pier has a little bit of everything for everyone. Something for passtime like fishing, amusement park for kids and big kids
I was lucky enough to have good weather for this visit, the pier and Santa Monica in general we're great fun.

column2: Has to be seen but a bit trashy really!
column3: It was great to see this Pier as it‚Äôs so famous. However, the tourist trap is evident. There are lots of beggars and buskers and souvenir shops and not a lot else. We went on the Ferris wheel which was great - but otherwise it wasn‚Äôt anything to write home about.
The view was absolutely beautiful. Weather was great able to walk along beach and pier. Unfortunately the smell of urine was all around every bench and the site of homeless people was very sad.

I really like the Santa Monica Pier for beautiful beach views, especially at sunset. You can walk to the end of the Pier and there is seating for your viewing pleasure. It's great for those who enjoy carnival style rides.

column2: Must see stop on a girls road trip!
column3: Our girls road trip wouldn't have been complete without a stroll along Santa Monica pier. Music, games, rides, food and incredible views of the ocean.

The pier is great fun, we saw a group of local dancers put on a show, got locked inside the creepy room with the carousel by accident, thought we saw Daniel Radcliffe (possible) and had beautiful views of Santa Monica.Really enjoyed it.
What a great place to visit. Lots to see & lots to do. What an amazing experience!! Great place to see a magnificent sunset
Lots of people eating and having fun. The pier is one of many things to see in the immediate area. Nice place to start and end a beach adventure.
Lots of things to do. You can walk the beach, rent bicycles, roller blabe. Lots of shopping and restaurants.
Santa Monica Pier is a lovely place to visit with great views of the beach, live music, food and shops.
It was really cold the day we visited, but we still enjoyed it. I really enjoyed the souvenir shop and picked up some reasonably priced trinkets.

I walked up and down the pier about 3 times and had a good time. The views of the beaches and surrounding areas were good, especially at sunset. Most of the entertainers were excellent and worth watching/listening to.
Super place to visit. Wonderful lots to do and see! Views are amazing too from the pier! On Birthday 21/11/17

Often crowded, but still a fun place to spend some time. The Pier has a beautiful carousel, a big Ferris wheel, and a medium sized roller coaster. There are several restaurants, as well as, food stands. You'll find some talented street performers and artists. Great for people watching! Grab an ice-cream coneand just enjoy the experience.

column2: You have to watch the sunset here
column3: Go on a weekday which should be less crowded and parking at the location is much easier. Watching the sunset here is a must so check the twilight and sunset hours and make sure you arrive beforehand and get a good spot!

Came there as a child and it hasn't changed too much in 60 years other than the addition of the amusement park. The carousel is still there as well as the fishing area at the end of the pier. A true trip down memory lane!

column2: Overrated, but check it out if it interests you
column3: We were at the pier in the Summer for vacation and again in November while in town for a wedding. In my opinion, it is loud, over commercialized and over crowded. However, I realize that some people really like this type of atmosphere. If it is your cup of tea, then I am sure you will have a great time.I will say that walking on the beach just south of the pier was very enjoyable and not as crowded.

This was not quite what I expected-- a little seedy, the usual T-shirt and souvenir shops and carnival- type food with a ferris wheel and a small roller coaster. I guess I had the impression it was more extensive and up-scale. Plenty of buskers looking for money. It's fine for a quick up-and-down walk but that's about it.

Awesome place to walk around and hang out. Great veiws of ocean, beach and mountains. Lots of shopping and places to eat and hotels right across the street in surrounding neighborhoods. Definitely a go to spot while in socal. Restrooms, food and games on pier.
This is a great pier, with lots of nice rides especially for kids. Well kept up, the experience was excellent.

The whole atmosphere wasn't really what I had expected...maybe it seemed smaller or something...BUT, definitely glad we checked it out! It was definitely entertaining...we took our pic by the "end of Route 66" sign (actually there are quite a few photo opts)....the artists are interesting (some are really good)...variety of food choices (from Bubba Gumps to a hot dog on the Pier)...of course the normal touristy shops. It's nice to walk out on the pier and to look at the coast. A lot of interesting people with interesting pets too.

You can‚Äôt go to LA and the beach without visiting Santa Monica Pier. The historic end of the Route 66 trail as well as an area packed with amusements, rides and food. Great for kids and big kids alike but not overly large, so it can be ticked off in a few hours. The area is gorgeous by day, right over the beach, but is also beautiful to visit at night. Food options are your normal takeaway-type fare foods, but there is a decent variety.

column2: Great but don‚Äôt go on weekends with kids
column3: The area may be trashed by Friday night and Saturday night partiers. I would not recommend taking kids on a Saturday or Sunday morning as lots of alcohol bottles and trash laying around.

column2: A beautiful pier with interesting sights
column3: The end of Route 66 is an amazing landmark. I enjoyed good food and beautiful sights. Not a lot of place for parking, but we found a place.

column2: Must see during your visit, but...
column3: Must see during your trip. Iconic. Agreed. Worth a ‚Äòshort‚Äô visit but unsure you need more than one visit and perhaps 60-90 mins max. Decent burger joint at front end (see other review of Pier burger) and not much else - absent a few carnival rides and a couple of other food options. Younger kids will certainly enjoy. Was underwhelmed by the beach, as a matter of fact, water was deemed unsafe to swim the day after Thanksgiving. Other drawback is a rather narrow path that serves as main ‚Äòentrance‚Äô on and off.Happy we got to see it for sure!I‚Äôd make it a visit but a short one...
I‚Äôve been there a couple times. Definitely a worthwhile tourist attraction. Will visit again next time I‚Äôm in LA.
Skip this unless you want to walk amongst sad vendors and third rate musicians on a dirty pier holding tight to your wallet. Terribly touristy. Highly disappointing.
This pier can get very busy. There are lots of toilets and a few things to do on and around the pier. Sfrom the wnd there are some nice views along the coastline.

We arrived right at sunset and it was gorgeous! Walked down to the ocean and stuck our toes in the water even though it was soooo cold! As the sun set and the lights came on at the rides it was just an atmosphere of fun! Definitely a neat place to visit!!
Great sunset and very nice to see from Santa Monica pier! A must see when you visit Los Angeles! Also a excellent place for a morning run or walk.
It is very worth going there. It's something very different from the rest of the city. Rent a bike and enjoy Santa Monica and Venice beach. You will love it!!

We spent the evening at the Pier. We had loads of fun! Myself and my sister rode only the Ferris wheel, my daughter & son(adult children) each got a pass. I have to say it would be expensive for a family of four.
Great area to visit while in Los Angelos! Take the time to visit the ending of Route 66! Have a little fun while you are there!

column2: Fun in a Carnival like environment...
column3: Fun in a energetic environment. Had a nice meal at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. All in all, a great afternoon...
Love this place! Everything about it. Even the rides are fun! The pirate ship looks like it‚Äôs for kids... well it‚Äôs not! It‚Äôs really scary! Lol such a cool atmosphere! Beautiful beach

Sadly the pier was not my cup of tea. Very pretty to see it at night, all lit up, but by the light of day it‚Äôs just lined with stalls peddling their wares to tourists. Might be ok if you had kids. There‚Äôs an arcade and the rides.I enjoyed watching the guys fishing off the pier while an inquisitive seal swam around watching them.

Have seen it on movies as well as on TV. This time it was real. Can walked from the metro station. Clean but noisy & crowded. Still it was fun Live music, Eating places, Vendors. Lots to see and do.Incredible view at the end of the pier. Clean and cool sea breeze refreshes on a hot summer day.No need to spend money on rides. Just be there.Must for all visiting LA.
Beautiful location. Would have loved to spend more time their. Clean location. Nice views.Would definitely visit again
It is a very pretty pier. There are so many restaurant and choices to make. There are also reasonably priced rides to take and the Ferris wheel is breath taking.

column2: It is simply the Santa Monica Pier
column3: Really fun to go. Have lunch or dinner at Bubba Gump :) When in Santa Monica you have to stop at the Pier. It is just so Cali. You don't need to do anything. Just walk around enjoy the view and be happy you are in California...

Pretty cool place with tons of shopping and restaurants with breath taking views of the ocean! Went on a Tuesday afternoon and it was packed and lots to do and see! A must go to while in LA, we took the Metro from downtown LA and it drops you like a block away from the pier, tons of stuff to do for the whole day
The Pier was such a fun time with our daughter and her friends. They went on numerous rides and after went to the aquarium. Highly recommend visiting the pier for a great afternoon!

The pier at Santa Monica is a must see attraction for anybody who is staying in Santa Monica, LA or any of the surrounding areas. The restaurants and souvenir shops are great, the pier is clean and the neighbouring beach is amazing. Would definitely recommend!
But I'm glad! Beautiful sunset, there's an amusement park and lots of local people that compose the scene very nicely.

Want the iconic Hollywood treatment and movie feel minus the crowds of Hollywood? GO. This is the spot we all dreamed LA would be. Crowded yes- but walk all the way down to the end of the pier and you'll get some elbow room. Plus a stunning 180 degree ocean view and the romance of "LaLa Land" brought to life. Day or night. Always worth the trip. Always a great time.

"From Chicago to St. Louis to Albuquerque to Santa Monica Pier" as the song says... get your kicks on Route 66... the end stops here and a great sign to see on the pier. Huge wide beach and fun amusements on the pier make this a must stop and see.
the very end of route66if you want the traditional baywatch feeling, with souvenir shops and street attractions visit this placetry Bubba gump at the front end for a schrimp meal also

Great to see so many people enjoying a community icon. Lots of sights and sounds for the casual stroller plus a year round amusement park. Parking at the base of the pier is $10 flat rate for the day.

column2: Sand and ocean - what more could you want?
column3: I loved this place. The pier made me feel nostalgic, with its tasty seafood and old-timey amusement park. We walked from the Pier to Venice Beach in the soft white sand beach, with our feet in the water, and back along the boardwalk.

column2: I think it is coolest place on earth.
column3: Trip down by Metro and a short walk to the pier via reasonable food outlets. The pier has everything. Stalls, loos, trapeze, big wheel, funfair, singers, mime artists, craft stalls and an ambiance to die for. It overlooks Baywatch beaches and wild life. Pelicans,Terns Dolphins and Sealions can all be seen With a travel fishing rod I caught mackerel . Fishermen were helpful and talkative. A Sealion had half of one fish I caught.A beautiful and atmospheric place to spend a day.
Nice place to go for a stroll but very busy. It is just a pier with some novelty rides. Very much geared up for tourists.

We visited with family early in the day. No rides were open yet but that was ok. My brother in law advised that they don‚Äôt come down there at night. After experiencing the cast of characters we encountered during the early afternoon I understand why he doesn‚Äôt go there at night. For those familiar with seaside heights NJ, it was a smaller west coast version. We got some great boardwalk photos with the family and moved on to something else.O yea the smell of the Devils lettuce was quite pungent.

column2: Santa Monica Pier is more than you can imagine
column3: I‚Äôve been to Santa Monica Pier in November. In this trip I was with my wife and our two kids. We simply love this place. The environmental is incredible and The Pier is amazing. Next to the Pier there are lots of restaurants and stores. You and your family can walk on the beach sidewalk and see beautiful and happy people enjoying the good life of California.
Really nice visit - should definitely be a part of your trip. Rides, food, and of course the beach. Nice little afternoon for families.

My wife and I recently visited Santa Monica Pier with friends while in LA preceding a cruise. We rented a car and drove to this famous landmark. It is a nice area with nice shops on the streets adjoining the pier. There was also some nice craft vendors in the area. The Pier was a nice walk with plenty of things to see. The beach was full of people surfing and sun bathing. There was also volleyball players on the beach. There were a number of people fishing from the pier as well. This was a nice experience and we were glad we went.
Great place to visit on a summers day, plenty of activities and nice views. Great ice cream stalls and fish shops.

Having been to SoCal many times over the years, I have never been to Santa Monica Pier, but have always wanted to go. Well I can finally say, I went,and now I probably won't go again. There is a lot of history there, but it is a total tourist trap. When I'm in the SoCal area, I frequent Laguna Beach, and Seal Beach. After SMP, Laguna and Seal are a lot better. The boarwalk was so packed, you could hardly walk. Trash everywhere. I don't mind homeless people, or even begging, but when they are yelling at you, and/or urinating on the boardwalk and beach that's where I have a problem. I only rode the roller coaster, because of the history, but I didn't ride any of the other rides.The boardwalk had signs everywhere NOT TO FEED THE BIRDS, yet everyone was doing it. One lady was placing bread on her head, lap, and chest area, and had pigeons literally landing and sitting on her eating the bread off of her body! With all of those birds, there were bird droppings all over the boardwalk. The beach was less packed, but a lot of litter and debris scattered the beach and water. Bubba Gump, and some other restaurants are on the boardwalk. Lot's of stores for shopping or souvenirs line the boardwalk. If you plan on driving and parking, pack some patience. I didn't drive or park there, but it looked like a mess. Long lines to get in and out of the pier, and the parking lot. Like I said, I'm glad I finally had the chance to visit, but I probably won't be back.

with the neon lights. This iconic pier is a great spot to go walkabout at sunset. Take in the ocean air, beachfront views and marvelous sun setting over the Pacific. I think that this pier is a must-have-a-wander attraction when on the Westside...again preferably at sunset.

This is a high draw-card for new visitors & tourists to the area and I would say a "MUST DO" if only ONCE because of its Famous name and Historic attributes. To be able to say you have been there, done that is a tick off the bucket list.Unfortunately, don't believe the fair/carnival is that great & there aren't many things to do or look at. Having said that, I am happy that I can say (with my photos), that I have experienced this world famous location.

Went for a short stroll. Got a few hundred yards. Kicked the ball back toward the road and called it a night. The boards make that distinct sound every time you walk on them. Cars are permitted, so there's another, much larger sound - however similar.
I didn't really think it was worth it due to the amount of people and the traffic. It really isn't all that much to see or do on the pier.

The pier and its attractions are a must. It is touristy, campy, good fun. I have been coming to the pier since 1979. My hesitation is in the last several months the area has deteriorated tremendously. A lot of trash and waste on the beach and on the streets. Also some very angry and disgusting homeless people. I really do not mind the yelling or begging, but in 5 days I watched several urinate and or defecate on the boardwalk. Hey, Santa Monica - get yourself cleaned up, please.

We went here to spend the day but it was a place where I would say we only spent a few hours. Glad to say we went but not overly impressed it had a feel of history about it though. It was a nice pier.

column2: A cozy but very touristy place
column3: This is where the legendary route 66 ends and the ocean begins. There are tons of street performers here and interesting shops. Not a place where I'd spend a ton of time but it's definetly great for a few hours.

column2: Iconic so must see if in Santa Monica
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a wide jetty but not very long. Iconic because its in the movies. Lots of tourist and souvenirs to purchase. Great atmosphere with the show rides, it's a must visit if you have time

If you visit Los Angeles, you have to visit Santa Monica Pier. One of California's surfing communities and a great place to crash on the beach or walk the pier. The pier has some small carnival style restaurants and a few souvenir shops but a great atmosphere. A few singer-song writers set up on the pier and perform. Some of them are actually very good. Then you have some of the harmless, bizarre type that can be entertaining in their own way! The kids loved them enough to video them so they were funny! You have to do the pier rollercoaster or the wheel just to say you did it. There over-priced but offer a great view of the ocean and beach!
Worth the visit.Nice view from Santa Monica Beach. And exotic street artistsInside parking lot is not big, but cheaper than external ones.

We went here after our plane landed at LAX. It was too early to check in so we thought we would go check it out.It was very crowded. There's not really much to do. There were some rides. The rides were expensive and crowded. There were a few souvenir shops but they didn't seem to have much to choose from.We walked to the end of the pier took some pictures and returned to our car. I don't know think we were there more than an hour. Now that I've seen it, I have no reason to go back.

column2: Very touristy but a bit of fun
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is a bit of a tourist trap with junky souvenirs and average food but it comes to life at night and it's a nice spot to watch the sun go down. It can be a bit smelly on hot days.

Went here with two friends, did the roller coaster, checked out the Arcade, but that's really all there is. Seems a bit run down and like it needs some TLC. Would still go just to say you have been but you really only need to spend like 30 mins here and is it worth paying $7 for the parking?
There are much more interesting things to see in LA than the pier. It‚Äôs a brisk and boring walk. I cant understand why anyone would give it more stars

A must-see for anyone visiting Santa Monica! Between the food, rides and the people-watching, there‚Äôs always a great time to be had at the pier! Try going on the weekdays to avoid huge crowds. And don‚Äôt forget to check out the awesome Ferris wheel!
A healthy crowd of day trippers enjoying the hazy Californian sunshine. The pier is stuck nostalgically in the 70's at a push the 80's.

column2: Great place to spend a few hours
column3: The pier is quite long and has restaurants, amusements, views, fishing, etc. There is parking but I travelled by light rail from LA. It was a great day trip. Recommended.

So this was one stop that we can now check off our bucket list.....really nothing special to see. We parked right there for $10 and walked the pier. We probably would have gone on the Ferris wheel if it were open, but we were there Sunday morning and nothing was running. On the plus side, the public bathrooms were surprisingly clean!! Probably why I rated this place 3 stars....

So if you like crowds, amusement parks, and tourist traps, then you'll enjoy it here. I came here as a college student who had little money, hate for roller coasters, and dislike of crowds...so it definitely wasn't the place for me. My friend and I actually ended up chilling underneath the pier which was actually quite fun to see the waves roll in. There were street magicians which were fun to watch and a lot of bathrooms. do it at least once so you can say you've done it:)
Nice walk and areaAlot of places there for lunch or dinner and to walk around the area and beach ... the pier is very nice as well ... recommended
Beautiful place to visit away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Easy to reach location by bus and metro. Something there for all the family

column2: Lot of fun and lots to see and do
column3: Good day outParking hard and a bit pricy $9 for 4 hoursGood lot of restaurants and barsHeaps of things to see and doSo much fun

column2: Nice spot to visit. Great a night too.
column3: First place I visited in LA. Great view on the sea, nice atmosphere. Was great to be there and recognise a place seen in so many movies. Just great to wonder by the sea, have a drink or too, a bite, and just relaxe and appreciate LA.
Friendly place, very crowded, not much to do beside to see the view..Make sure you have a coat with you cause in the evening it's getting cold

column2: Very nice area to spend with family
column3: Fun place with lots of activities. Specially with kids it will be more fun. Water, beach, and outdoor entertainments.

column2: Awesome fun, give yourself a treat
column3: Always a must visit when in Santa Monica, fun activities, rides and entertainment. Street or rather ‚Äòpier‚Äô performers who are truly entertaining. An iconic Santa Monica land mark that doesn‚Äôt disappoint.

column2: Worth a quick visit but 1-2hours more than enough
column3: This is an iconic location but not much to do so plan it as part of a third street promenade, main street, beach time, type of visit. You will only need an hour tops to see this location

This pier has a super good vibe full of music bands and park attractions. If you had been in Brighton pier (in the UK), well it is very similar but with the most amazing weather. The beach is a proper sandy beach. We rent bikes in a place just outside the pier and went along side all the path which takes you from Santa Monica to Venice beach. This activity I really recommend it! it is the perfect thing to do to feel the proper Californian vibe... Definitely, you should visit this place.

column2: My kids grew up loving 'Santa Monica pier'
column3: And onetime a while ago- it was my first trip out with a new baby in a stroller and my 5 year old son had ran ahead too fast in the crowd within seconds after I panicked and was yelling my sons name security was there in a flash and found him so it's really a safe place even though it is extremely busy - the kids love it - great day out for everyone :)
If you have a day to spend in Los Angeles or the Santa Monica area you must go to the pier a lot of vendors very entertaining and a lot of souvenirs to choose from.exciting day for all ages

column2: Interesting Must Do....but Don't Go on a Weekend Evening Unless You Like Crowds
column3: We walked down to the Pier twice during our stay. It was really busy but people watching was more than a bit fun - but in general nothing unique. We did not go on any of the rides, but many kids were running around and appeared to be having fun. We did not eat - and the food was really expensive. But, it was fun.

It was a beautiful Saturday and an afternoon at the beach was our chosen activity. Pier was not crowded and it was very pleasant. Beach is nice, again not crowded. As with any tourist area you have to be mindful of theft. Happened to witness an older gentleman take someone‚Äôs unattended boots.

Was our first time visiting Santa Monica amd the pier. We had so much fun! My mom really liked being there and enjoyed the games arcade too haha. Lot to do from dining to a marine aquarium to learn abit about the sea life that from the area and literally able to touch certain sea life creatures. Worth it. Mom realllllly wants to visit again. See you soon Santa Monica

First time visiting here and what a great atmosphere even tho it was a week day. Such a big pier to be able handle heaps of tourists which creates a great vibe. There are some tourist souvineer shops, food and drink outlets and restaurants on the pier plus the famour Amusement Park. A great place to stroll around and take in the view. An absolute a must to visitParking available and easily reached with public transport

column2: If in LA, stop by here for a mini theme park experience.
column3: Plenty of movie scenes and commercials have been shot here so if on the west side of LA, this is a fun place to stop by. This is not a full theme park, simply a Boardwalk with some small rides.Time: You won't need to spend much time here. Probably under 2 hours.Traveler Tip: Great place for a date night with your significant other or to take the family. Not too far away is 3rd Street Promenade which has plenty of dining and shopping.I'm a fellow traveler so I appreciate when other people have given me tips. If these tips were helpful, please let me know by hitting the like button. Even if this review helps one traveler then it's worth it to know I'm helping others and paying it forward. Safe Travels!

I love this place, it was amazing walking the beach and then my boyfriend proposed to me and I love this place even more, the beach was clean and the park is pretty cool. We ate and had some drinks at the Mexican restaurant here and we enjoyed it a lot. There was also a lot of great talent on the pier, I highly recommend going here.

column2: Really needs a makeover and some security
column3: The pier is an amazing historical place.Looks absolutely breathtaking as you approach.Out on the pier is pretty dirty and full of hawkers trying to sell their wares.Performers were worth stopping and tipping.The walk along from parking to the pier is full of homeless and junkies though, so be careful. Would not recommend a visit after dark unless carrying.

It is is a great alternative to go there if you have a long flight and you had to wait in the airport. You can have great views of the ocean, great walk, shopping or restaurants. A good place to kill time!

Very well maintained beach despite the horde of homeless people who call it home. The beach area itself was well groomed and the boardwalk kept clean- The kiddie rides are always a hit while Bubba gump is there to satisfy your shrimp craving and a smattering of small shops. A must visit if you are in the coast..

column2: Good fun time here with my girlfriend
column3: Ferris wheel and other fun fair rides to enjoy, lots of buskers and fun people. Nice stroll and sit in the sun enjoying the sea air and views

column2: Must visit place when you are in LA..
column3: The place is outstandingly beautiful and the most beautiful times are early in the morning or sunset time when the sun goes in sea and the entire environment is very much energetic, most beautiful thing is unlike other beaches it has lot of activities for kids and for all ages.
Admittedly is was off season but there really is not much here. A few food stands, gift shops and some non operational rides. The beach beside did look very nice.

Stopped by to check out the famous Santa Monica Pier! It was such a great place to bring your family. There are rides and arcade for the kids. The views of the ocean are beautiful. There are vendors selling stuff and there are several restaurants as well. There is a fee to park which wasn‚Äôt a big deal. We had a great time walking around enjoying the views and people watching.

It was neat to see this but once is enough. Lots of people, little shops of course with tourist stuff and the rides definitely oriented towards little kids. Fun to say I have been there, seen it, but not something I would feel like I had to return to. Santa Monica itself if gorgeous...do the pier, rent a bike and enjoy the great flat trails along the beach or get the Bird App and rent a motorized scooter. Super fun!!!
Beautiful beach, fun people and great vibes. Plenty of photo opportunities and things to do with family.

Went double dating to Santa Monica pier and was not allowed to go on rides or fully experience it. Smh but I was dam impressed. It's a fair on top of a pier on top of an ocean.!! Lots of cool vendors from what I was able to see. Just go. Find out. Live what I couldn't.

Went to the amusement centre, a lot of old school games that brought back a lot of memories. The theme park I would defn try next time when I bring the kids over. Walking down there are street performers that were quite entertaining. The pier is kept pretty clean and the view of the coastline is pretty amazing. There seems to be two car parks. The one crossing the bridge is closer to the pier (convenient for strollers and wheelchairs) whilst the below street level carpark requires stairs and a short walk.

Loved the pier, gets quite busy with both locals and tourists. Take a look around before you spend your money with a vendor, you'll probably see it elsewhere cheaper... especially with anything to do with Route 66...Take care when using the photobooth... the backgrounds for selection is not the pier itself (as is advertised on the side of the photobooth).Very fun, couple, family, and travel-group friendly.Foodie trucks available up on the main road (cheaper than food in the restaurants and eateries on the pier).TipsUse Uber to go everywhere in the States. It's so much cheaper than a taxi... (Sorry Taxi Driver people!)

We had an enjoyable day at the pier. Did not go on any of the rides. Good photo opportunities and nice to sit on the sand with the kids enjoyed playing in the water. Buy your letter names here rather than at Disney and save up to $50!!!!

This place does not live up to the hype. Over priced across the board, save your money and go to universal studios instead! $40.00 per person for ‚Äúunlimited ‚Äú rides or $8.50 per ride ( usd ) is a bit steep considering there are like 6 rides. Very sad that it wasn‚Äôt like it was portrayed

This was an ok place to go. I‚Äôd heard tons of great reviews and recommendations, so I must admit I was a little disappointed, it wasn‚Äôt somewhere I‚Äôd want to stay long. It‚Äôs got an arcade and some rides.
Always something to do or see. Gigantic beach, large pier, fun rides. Carnival atmosphere and food. Worth it.
Pub up the end was a winner, the rum I had gave me a buzz on pretty quick. Well done fellas. Go the free pour
I was here three years ago and figured I'd go back again. I like the atmosphere and it's great just walking around and looking at things. Took the train there from downtown Los Angeles.
The santa Monica Pier includes restaurants, shopping, roller coaster and other atrractions. It has been seen in may movies and games. It is a must see in santa Monica
Great place to spend an hour or two if you are interested in old piers, Forest Gump or Route 66. Musicians every 50 yards or so, mostly very talented but some not so.
