It is not only the pier that you should visit. You should walk down to venice beach along the path and even up the other end towards Malibu. There is a path with an underpass, which comes up to a small street leading you up the hill. You will arrive at a place where you will see a lot of people exercising on steps (over 100 steps). If you are lucky, you can even catch sight of celebrities exercising as well. From there, you can head straight back up towards 3rd street prominade. Lots of walking for sure.
A beautiful place to see street acts, play at the fair or just stroll and watch the seals play in the sea. Beautiful sunsets as well.

Santa Monica Pier is just another boardwalk but it is an iconic must visit. The boardwalk is small compared to many others, like Coney Island. It is a bit run down and you see the homeless hanging out there. But, there is a wide variety of carnival foods as well as small eateries and Bubba Gump's restaurant. There are rides, a ferris wheel, arcade, performers, artists, and people selling their wares. A little bit of fun for all ages. The place is crowded and the atmosphere is electric. Most of all, its the best place to view the full expanse of ocean and beach. Come early and see the sunrise or come later and enjoy all of the lights.

It's a cool place to walk around, not that many spots to stop and enjoy some food etc but the pier is cool to walk around, done it once, got the photos and saw the old zephyr shop but other than that, unsure if I would visit twice

Pier is looking run down and unkept. Noticed several empty locations. Couple of rides, and places to grab a bite. Good for a couple of photos but only if you are going to spend the day a th e beach other wise the pier by its self is not worth the $15-20 parking fees seen at more than a few lots. If your driving be prepared for the traffic, skateboarders and bicycles. Conjested and very tight quarters.

We had to stop at the Santa Monica Pier! We went super early in the morning and watched the sunrise! If you're looking for some peace and good picture taking - I would recommend doing this in the AM. We parked right at the entrance to the pier, and basically had the pier to ourselves! (minus a couple early morning fishermen!)I could see how the pier would be lots of fun during the day as well, lots of rides and places to eat!
We visited twice on vacay ..tge viewd abd tge ocean was amazing..one day was hit and tge other day we went was cold..but we still enjiyed ourselves..its definitely a different atmosphere which I like
Pier was okay, a bit dirty and filled with homeless people. Wasn't as exciting as the Ocean City, MD boardwalk. Beach beach tho.

column2: It is like tou have been there before
column3: Once I got there it was as if I already been in the place because its so famous. The place has many activities and some snacks options. Must see!!

The pier was fun had a few games and rides and a beautiful view over looking the ocean. Loved the street performances by locals singing and or dancing. Big Deans is a hole in the wall bar with food right next to the pier. This is a dive with really good food and local craft beer. If you want a local experience it is a must.
You have to get here! You will love the activity, the shopping, the food, the entertainment and the scenery! SO much to see and do, plus take lots of pics!
If you go to Santa Monica, then you must go to the pier.You can eat, walk, watch steet artists, watch fishermans, watch the see....

I had been to the Santa Monica Pier the last time I was in California many years ago and decided to go back. Was quite disappointed in the pier this time. It was crazy, crazy crowded even though it was near 100 degrees. It's definitely a tourist spot and the parking lot was full even by 10am. Views from the pier were beautiful, but the smell was really bad. The water was brown with kelp/seaweed every where and it smelled. I don't remember it smelling like this last time I was here, but there was definitely a foul smell and I believe it was coming from the water. Pier is a tourist spot and is terribly over crowded. You wouldn't catch me swimming in the brown water here...I think you can actually see the brown water from one of my pictures. Blech.
Music, jugglers, costumes, food, mementos, crowds, all together on the Pacific. This is street life/theater at its finest and weirdest.

Came to Santa Monica about a week ago while I was in L.A and I really enjoyed it. This is a must see spot if you visit L.A you have to visit Santa Monica. The pier itself is smaller than I thought doesn't take long to explore but the atmosphere is a lot of fun, specially if you have kids. We parked in the lot for $12 all day parking and it was better than finding a street parking.
Persuaded my husband to ride the Ferris wheel with me, and we both loved it! Views were amazing, and lovely, relaxing ride.

We just took a week vacation and visited Santa Monica Pier. It was a awesome experience. There's lot's of games to play and you can easily win the kids stuffed animals. We rode the Ferris wheel and it was a little pricey but the views were awesome. There are some strange people here so keep your kids close but overall it's a pretty cool place to see.

We stayed at the Shore Hotel across the street from the pier, we took a walk over to the pier and I was very surprised to find so much going on. There was street performers, carnival rides, food vendors, restaurants and all in a very family friendly safe environment.It's great place to go for a date night too.We had a great time and will be going back again

The entrance to the pier is a well known postcard picture. He amusement park is quite recognizable too. Suggest renting a bike which allows you to go to Venice beach and beyond. Plenty of parking nearby.
A must stop in California for families with kids. The place is very nice and the kids have a lot of activities.

Santa Monica Pier has a very nice view of the beach and a big ferris wheel. It is quite small... you could do lunch and take a few pictures and hang out at the beach if you want. I stayed for about 10 mins while I took some pictures but didnt stay for anything else (it was too hot).Would recommend if you are visiting the 3rd street promenade (shopping and eateries) as it is walking distance or if you want to lunch and hang at the beach. But just for sightseeing...not sure if it is worth the ride.
We had to ride the Ferris wheel - beautiful view and enjoyed the lights ! Iconic and fun -Staying at Marina del Ray we took Uber over and back. Very glad we did.
Busy with booths and rides ,food and drink ,a few poor live singers ,water was 4 dollars a bottle on the pier but got a free bottle of juice one street up
It‚Äôs good. Not as good as every movie and marketing scheme tells you, but it‚Äôs good to walk through and take a look. Lots of rides for kids. Few places to eat too.

column2: Nice beachside location close to shopping precinct
column3: Another iconic tourist destination but really, there is not a lot to do. Some small retail outlets, amusement rides, street buskers and dining at the end of the pier. On a warm sunny day it is always good to be on the beach so this place will always be one that I'll visit on my trip to LA.There is also an excellent shopping precinct a short walk from the Pier so in all, it's a good day out by the sea.

The Santa Monica pier was and has been on our list for years. It is as amazing as we thought. It is a picturesque setting and the pics from the pier would have been amazing if not for the sea fog.The sea fog burned off after we left but stillA great place.
Love Santa Monics Pier. More peaceful at night. Filled with tourists, musicians, rides, souvenirs, stores and restaurants.

Any and everyone goes to the pier if they are close. We were staying across the street from it, so it was pretty natural to go there. Very nice experience. Lots to see, just be on your toe's.... there's a lot going on around you.
Santa Monica is the quintessential California pier. Crowds, overpriced carnival food, cliche rides but fantastic views, unparalleled ambiance and super fun. Don‚Äôt miss it if you‚Äôre in LA

Went at noon on sunny day. Had our 4 year old grandson. We took him on dragon ride 1st and he became scared. Had to stop the ride. After that, he didn't like any of the rides, even the kiddie rides, however, he loved the arcade and the stationery .25 rides outside. He has been on big rides before, so, just not his day.This would probably have been better at night when the rides all lit up.He liked the beach, but out of time by that time.Unique in that you drive and park on the pier. Unusual for us.

column2: Super Touristy But Worth A Visit
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is super touristy but deserves a visit. At sunset you can take amazing photographs from the pier.

column2: A Must See & Do in LA !
column3: This iconic attraction is a must see and do if you are in the area and is obviously very touristy. A vibrant pier with a lovely mix of nostalgia with a nice blend of souvenir shops, eateries and entertainment with glorious views in every direction. Shame about the homeless rifling through the waste bins but this is an epidemic through out LA.However,it is safe and enjoyable and an experience everyone should enrich their lives with.

We traveled from Australia and made the trip out to Santa Monica as it was listed as a top destination. We did not like it at all. My sister lives in LA and said it was over-rated and she was right. Apart from the amazing sunset out over the Pacific ocean, I was really underwhelmed with the pier. There were a lot of tourists and I found it cool the cars could park so close to the pier. They did have some cool street artists performing flips and dancing.
We had a great time at the Santa Monica Pier, There is food you can eat and the big Ferris Wheel ride was amazing. Good place to visit and see the night light in Santa Monica.

I had great expectations from this place, but they were not met. It's not bad bad, but old. I knew this place from television and it looked like that, but still...Anyway, I walked from Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier and it's nice to have a goal along the walk. There are few restaurants and bars, but the entertainment park doesn't look that great. Maybe it's nice for small kids.

Can be a bit crowded but well worth a visit. Just to take stroll on it is nice. Needless to say that the views as magnificent. The mini amusement park is a bonus. Smart to make dinner reservations in advance
The Santa Monica pier is full of amusement rides and street artists. There is a merry-go-round at the beginning of the pier that is over 100 years old.

Visited the pier on a Beautiful day.Had fun walking to the end of pier with a number of interesting things to look at. End of Route 66 sign, Ocean, gift shops, street performers, food as well as a small amusement park.Amusement park offers a few rides and games. There is no fee to walk through.Parking is available nearbyCertainly worth a visit when in LA.
So beautiful and relaxing, although it gets busy and touristic at sunset time but the view is really worth it, and there are some nice performers which will keep you entertained..
It's ok for family and groups to have fun times - but certainly not for couples or ppl who wants to chill or relax . The place not to my expectation .

column2: Great way to spend a day!
column3: Heat wave!! Only place to spend it is on the beach! Loads to see and do, plenty of sightseeing and amazing sand and ocean waves

column2: Where you can be a grown up kid!
column3: We visited the pier with friends, dined at Mariasol (Mexican restaurant), played games and rode the giant ferris wheel. Great place to view the beautiful sunset or people watch on the beach. There are also a few gift shops and street acts. Neat place to hang out!

I spent my childhood and teenage years enjoying the pier: the. Endorse, the food, the people watching, the games, the fishermen, the carnival atmosphere. Not a lot has changed, and our foreign visitors enjoyed the stroll, but it‚Äôs lost it‚Äôs charm for this LA native.
This place was amazing. It was foggy when we arrived. Then the fog cleared and it was beautiful. Iconic. The food was great and the rides and vendors selling stuff was fun.
While almost all piers have a tacky side this is a bustling pier full of life from the fishermen and hawkers to the small theme park

Me and two friends arrived at this destination in the evening and it was buzzing. Lots of people, performances, eateries, shops and amusements. The view out to the sea and back to the land was beautiful. Could easily walk around here for a good 2 hours and it is so close to the muscle beach. Definitely aimed at tourists and had so many there, but created a great friendly environment. Would visit again.

Great place to watch a beautiful California sunset. The pier itself can get quite crowded though. It‚Äôs a good place to People watch though. Had a ‚ÄúCherry Ricky‚Äù soda drink at the carousel there - deeelish!

The pier is a must see when in Santa Monica, the entertainment is good too and its nice to browse through the gift shops, however the price of $8.50each to ride on the ferris wheel or small rollercoaster is very expensive and the band you can buy is too expensive as there aren‚Äôt enough rides to take advantage of it. However that said take a walk along the old fashioned board walk and take a look back at the coast it‚Äôs lovely enjoy
The pier is close to the train line and easily within walking distance.The beach here is lovely also.There are lots of places to eat and drink
This place was incredible! So many dining options, and it was great to read about the history of the pier! Definitely a place to visit while in California!

My wife and I took our two kids (age 3 & 6) to SMP as part of our week long spring break vacation in the LA area. We really enjoyed the visit! It is a bit of a walk over to the pier but worthwhile. We enjoyed the classic carousel, Ferris wheel and many of the other rides and games. The views at night were gorgeous. This was a highlight of our trip with the kids. Highly recommend!
One of the iconic places to visit if in Santa Monica. The official end of Route 66. You have to see the merry go round. At night it is stunning. Lit up beautifully
My first time to visit this area. I had a great time walking around taking in all the sites, and views. Great food. Plenty of room for everyone. If your in area highly recommend it to anyone.
My girlfriend and I went to see this place.It was very romantic with a lot of activities like music, dance, hand crafted and moreGo will never regret

column2: If you're there, by all means head out on the pier.
column3: We went on a Sunday and it was slightly crowded, but there are many things to look at, starting with a 6 or 8 different performers dancing, playing or singing. The ferris wheel is a little pricey at $8.50 per person, but c'mon - you know you want to see the view so do it. We also bought tee shirts in one of the shops, enjoyed a glass of iced tea and watched some dancing.

column2: A Lot of Things To Do
column3: Very cool area with many different things to do. There are nice restaurants, a roller coaster and Ferris wheel, shops and a great boardwalk. Not to mention that there is beautiful beach on either side and a wonderful view of the ocean.
This is a madness place. Various street performers, fun activities, food and showers and toilets adjacent to beach.The ride and gamemfor kids are very welcoming and views are not to be missed.

Definitely worth a visit. Very crowded but a great way to take photos of the beach and grab a drink while watching the sun set into the ocean.There‚Äôs a great little amusement park for kids.Just something you have to do while in LA.

The iconic Pier is really showing its age.A nice to do "once only" Walk to the end of the pier for a bit of people looking and to say that you have done it but that's about it.I don't know what I was expecting exactly but i wasnt expecting junky tourist rubbish like faded magnets and $10 music cds.The rides are cool to look.But if your staying in close proximity I guess you have to go see it... just once

Though from a distance the pier looks quite pretty up close it‚Äôs a little tacky and while there are a few rides and small carts there‚Äôs not a whole lot to do there. There are a few eating options but most consist of fried food - I think I expected something a little different but definitely glad I visited
Took my daughter for the weekend and she loved it! Beautiful pier with tons to do and eat. The best part is the beach is just a few stairs away. Parking is cheap, which is nice.

column2: Showing age but still worth a visit
column3: The pier as a whole is truly showing its age. With its restaurants, entertainment and shopping it is still worth a visit. The rides as today's standards go are also showing their age, but for the location still have value.

Spent an evening at the pier after a day at the beach. Saw the Pacific Ocean eat the sun, enjoyed the crashing waves and performers as well. We did play at pacific park as well and truly allowed ourselves to be taken back in time for some nostalgic fun. Keep in mind this is very touristy and that also brings with it its share of homeless as well. Never felt unsafe at all, but certainly something to be aware of.

column2: Worth a 30 min visit in the day time...
column3: Nothing to see hear folks....Like I said above...Worth a 30 min visit in the day time...Better food choices can be food else where on land.
This is one of my favorite spots when in the area. You could spend a whole day here! Love the food stands and riding the Pacific Wheel. Always looking forward to visiting this place.

Santa Monica Pier brings to mind the old school beach board. Being from the East Coast, I was excited to see how the West Coast handles their beach boardwalks--Santa Monica Pier wasn't a disappoint. Whether you are talking a tour or the beach is your final destination, Santa Monica Pier, the beach, and the boardwalk is a worthwhile experience.
What a wonderful day leisurely stroll friendly people and plenty of fun for everyone recommended for all
Great pier to lookout to coast and check out the beachAdvice to watch the sunsetAmusement park has plenty of rides and fun

column2: Interesting peir bad crowd and bad service
column3: The peir and ocean looked beautiful. The arcade was fun. However, the smell of people smoking illegal substances. It was very difficult to steer two young children into an area without the smell or a unkept individual. The resturants were packed and service was slow. At Bubba Gumps the waiter forgot to bring tomato sauce for our kid's pasta and meatballs. We asked three different wait staff over 20 minutes to bring some pasta sauce for a meal it should have been standard on the kid's menu. Funny thing is the kid's meal was ordered first. Very disappointed with the crowd and service. We wanted to go into the water, but the water was brown at the shore, which was weird since the water was blue at the end of the peir. I would not reco.mend this place for families with young children.
A nice place to visit. The Big wheel and a few rides, but many places to buy holiday t shirts and hats for friends and family. Nice places to eat, too.
This is so beautiful! Just like in the movies!! It is a great place to wonder around and the restaurant on the end of the pier was lovely

column2: A bit dated but you can say that you have been here.
column3: We came to this place because it was the end of the Route 66 trip and the end of route 66 is on the Pier. As a spectacle it is worth a look but be prepared to pay for the experience. T shirts on the Pier over $30 and food very high priced. The merry go round was good value though and it was a step back in time

Santa Monica had a very layed back vibe which is a welcome break from the concrete jungle of L.A. We spent most of the day there and took a hop on hop off tour to Venice as well. A must see for all visitors. Best of all it is the end of Route 66. How cool is that!!
Plenty of parkingRides are safe for the kidsFriendly and caring staffBeach, amusement park, souvenirs & Bubba Gump

column2: Average way to spend an hour
column3: Nothing great about the pier. You overlook the ocean and have overpriced gift shops. It's nice to say you did it, but unless your eating there it won't take long. There are homeless and beggars so be ready for that.
The most visited space in Santa Monica! Interesting people, nice restaurants and activities for all, at a cost!

A nice pier with great views of the beach. Myself and a friend went in later September when the beach was quiet I would feel if it was during the weekend or on a school holiday it would be too busy to enjoy your time. There are street entertainers some were good singers or dancers others felt embarrassing or not as good. I would go again but probably wouldn't stay longer then 2 hours.

A typical pier with tourist trinkets for sale and buskers.Rated as average at best as the water and sand around the pier looked very polluted. The pier itself was noisy with all the buskers.On the upside our lunch at Bubba Gump's which was nice.

An old fashioned boardwalk pier with great neon at night. See the roller coaster and ferris wheel at night. Enjoy the foods and don't miss the "penny arcade" for vintage games and skee-ball. Also don't wish to be BIG when you speak to Zolar for the Movie "BIG"

My family has always wanted to visit Santa Monica pier. We had the opportunity to do so last week, and my kids enjoyed the carnival rides. The area was rather dirty and had a foul smell. There were many random vendors dancing or singing for money. The beach was filthy with trash.
Loved the Pier, lots to see and plenty of cafes. I waited about 4 minutes at an ice cream counter,and the man gave me a free ice cream because I‚Äôd waited so long! How‚Äôs that for service?
Great fun on here with lovely views of the beach and sunset. Several souvenir shops and photo opportunities. A must visit. Muscle beach next door and it‚Äôs the end of Route 66.

This is the kind of place that kids would love, being able to see past the tarnish, touches of grime, and multiple cart vendors selling the same instant artwork based on your name or putting your name on a grain of rice. As an adult, it was a nice enough walk out to the end of the pier and back, but nothing had much holding power beyond that. The ride area felt cleaner, and would be a fun place to take kids for a bit. At night, it's quite lit up. The ferris wheel offers fairly interesting light shows.
Nice walk, end of route 66, tourist trap but that makes for the best people watching. Grabbed some food (nachos and salsa is a good bargain) some good views.
Watch the sunset. A place to pick up a rapidly drawn portrait of yourself or a couple. Avoided as an adult the expensive rides, junk food and tacky souvenirs. So a free area to enjoy nature.

column2: the story of popeye originated here, also end of route 66!
column3: the history of the pier is an interesting read, the amenities could be cleaner as the are always being used but not much care in cleanliness.the rides on the pier are average but we had a good time here!
It so lived to my expectations and more. Regret not staying another couple of days. A must place to visit.

The pier is just one of those destinations that you must see while in Santa Monica: neon sign at night, Forest Gump reference with the pier, the arcades, pier performers, roller coaster and tons of "carnival" food. We visited both day and night and we preferred the night. You can get the real feel of the pier at day (not really a great site but nice to see the ocean in the background). The rides were fun. Hardly a good selection of food until you leave the pier. But you can always visit the restaurants right across the street. Bring napkins to the restrooms. They ran out both times we were there. Overall it was a fun experience for a visitor to Santa Monica.

fun atmosphere, and very nice especially in the evening with all the lights on, mingling with the crowd, enjoying the attractions. Some great restaurants in the area, parking can be tough, go to the public ones

I had seen pictures of the Santa Monica Pier which were taken at a distance, and so this place was on my list of things to do in Los Angele. I have to say it looks better in photos than close up. It's basically a tourist trap with cheap trinkets and a few carnival rides. Would recommend the Manhattan Beach pier instead for those looking for an ocean view.
The pier offers great eating choices and and a fun side with the rides and entertainment. It gets quite busy on the weekends and easy to walk around during the week.

What a nice feel of England on the west coast of the US.A wooden pier with a mix of funfair rides, food concessions selling ‚Äúsugar‚Äù and assorted tat for sale - excellent.Superb sunset views from the end - catered for by two excellent viewing platforms. Has to be done.It is iconic and deserves the place in the hearts of all those who live in or love Santa Monica.

This is one of those places to visit simply to have the experience. It's outdated and dirty. The water looks brownish-yellowish; I've never seen ocean water look like this. There are many people fishing off the pier which I thought was disgusting considering what the water looked like. This also made the restaurant located at the pier undesirable.The vendors had typical tourist merchandise and the only fruit vendors we stopped at to get a snack were ridiculously overpriced.
Nice to stop here and see this place in person, but one time is enough. There are so many homeless around and we even saw 2 men doing drugs. It was nice to walk to the end of the pier and then leave.
For walking and hang out,pet friendly, aquarium close by but when I was there it was closed.Very close to downtown and shopping mall.

Nice feel about Santa Monica pier. Saw the sunset the day before from Venice beach but can imagine its just as good if not better from here. Still, cant really go wrong - was a gorgeous sunny day, not a cloud in the sky and nice sea breeze. Lots of little shops and a couple places to eat on the pier as well as a couple of rides.Nothing extraordinary but it was nice, not overdone and not tacky. The beach looked really nice as well, and you can get some great pictures of the beach and shoreline from the pier. We paid $2 to park right by the pier as well so you can't really go wrong.

We love parking and walking along the beach at Santa Monica and the Pier always looks great as you walk towards it. When you get there it is always a little bit disappointing although there are good bits (views, end of Route 66, Big Dipper) to counter the bad (crowds, cheap tacky stalls, overpriced food).
I always enjoy the experience of Santa Monica Pier. Always eat at Buba Gumps--good service and good food. I enjoy ataching people and did alot of that.
Stopped before catching our plane home. It was great! Live music and colorful people. Everyone was super nice. Lost of homeless around was the only downfall.

Look, unless I‚Äôm really bored, I avoid ‚Äúpiers‚Äù like the plague. I‚Äôm not into the carnival atmosphere. Cheap junk everywhere. At least some of the street performers were OK. Do yourself a favor and go 5 blocks to the east and find real stores and things to do.
It was beautiful! We walked the boardwalk and beach, had a refreshing margarita and listened to music. It was the perfect day!

column2: Wonderful place to relax in the sun
column3: I was fortunate to be able to make it out to Santa Monica on a recent trip to the US. The metro from LA is the best option for public transport and while it can be a little long, it is well worth the trip.A stroll along the pier is an absolute must and I would recommend getting there early in the morning so as to avoid the crowds.The pier itself feels so grand and old with the end of the pier offering great views of people just fishing and watching the boats sail past.You would be crazy to not go to Santa Monica Pier.

Pretty good. Something for everyone there. Amazing views of the cost. You can fish from the end of the pier. There's street entertainment on the pier but they kind of expect you to give them alittle something if you stand long enough to watch.
Awesome ... to experience the pleasant breeze of the ocean and spectacular view of the Ferris wheel made this stop last of Route 66 one of our favourites .

Loved the beach area here and the pier. It was a holiday weekend so it was super crowded. I will go back again when it‚Äôs not so busy. There are some nice rides for the kids and a lot of kiosks to buy souvenirs. Several great places to eat as well. The traffic and parking is really bad though so time yourself accordingly. There is only one road in and out of this area.

column2: Saturday evening on Santa Monica Pier
column3: The end of Route 66 and a popular destination for families at weekend and tourists alike. This is a must visit just like the Hollywood sign. It‚Äôs popular with locals for fishing. Plenty of parking locally. The are numerous restaurants on the pier and around the area.The Pier has lots of shopping, street performers and the amusement park with plenty of rides for adults and children. Don‚Äôt miss it.

column2: Great place to be at sunset!
column3: This is such a nice place to be on a warm summer evening. Gets crowded but has a nice feel and lots of entertaining things to see and do.

A trip to Santa Monica pier is a LA must do day trip .Either a walk or bike rental to Venice beach , a Ferris wheel ride and some old school carnival games .Also a sunset margarita at Mariasol ( skip the food ) is a perfect way to end the day .
We enjoyed a nice stroll at the pier, great views and pleasant atmosphere, lots of musicians and artists.

column2: A must if you are in LA
column3: I really love Santa Monica, for me it was the best of LA, really nice beach, the walking street was a nice place to go shopping and dining. We were with 2 kids under 4 and they had a blast.
Plenty to do at Santa Monica pier.We did visit the gaming arcade but found it sad to see the poor condition some of the games were in. It was still enjoyable way to spend some time.

The pier is obviously some kind of an icon spot for the locals and I appreciate there might be a bit of nostalgia around it. Seen with 'fresh' pair of eyes, the place is rather rowdy, crowden and dotted with 'souvernirs' sellers - it was hard to buy something non tacky even if you wanted to. What I liked however, is the great viewpoint over Santa Monica beach towards Venice Beach and Malibu. It is pleasant to look down at the surfers and beach goers.

column2: Cap Off Your Day. Go at Sunset.
column3: We love to stop by here at least once on our trips to L.A.. We went at sunset, so we could enjoy a nice view and walk to the end of the pier, as well as catch some dinner. We had a nice surprise at the end of the pier, as there was a seal who was going back and forth for photo opportunities. Obviously this seal is being fed along there to keep hanging out. All the same, it was a unexpected.The parking can get crazy, but it is fair priced at $12.00. If you are coming in the main gate, they want you to pay cash at the booth. If you do not have cash, they have a machine for you to get out and pay at next to the booth for you to make the payment instead. They offer 3 different types of parking. Some is up on the pier, one down on the beach, and another across the bridge. All within walking distance and not too far away from the pier.The pier has always been crowded anytime we have ever come here no matter the time of year or whether chilly or not. There is an amusement part on the pier, and it seems to stay busy with the rides packed as usual. If in the area at sunset, it's worth the walk to catch those views.
No doubt it is a a tourist trap, but still a legendary place to go. I bought a surfboard for my daughter.

Family of 6 2 kids aged 9 and 10 travelled to the pier. The water looked dirty. The food options on the pier were limited and expensive.If you intend on riding any of the rides its on the more expensive side.The kids loved the arcade!

We visited his attraction numerous times on our recent trip to Santa Monica from Australia.This is an iconic attraction that most people associate with Santa Monica. The Pier has numerous attractions ranging from restaurants, souvenir/tourist-type stores, and other quirky shops. At the very end of the pier is a theme park. Good fun for the family. Also check our Pier Burgers and the Bubba Gump Shrimp Factory. The Pier can be very busy, but it certainly wasn't overwhelming. We felt very safe here during both the day and night. There are a lot of entertainment on the Pier with busking/street performers. Lots of live music. The Pier also provides great photo opportunities as you look back on the Santa Monica coast line. The Ferris Wheel is another great photo opportunity of the coast.This place gave us a real feel for Santa Monica and the people/culture of the area.I highly recommend this if visiting Santa Monica.
Visit the pier around 5:30pm and wonder around to take in the atmosphere and watch the sun set into the water

Loved my experience of Santa Monica pier. Beautiful day, great view of the beach and ocean. Was lucky enough to see some dolphins. Rode the big wheel (Ferris wheel) you have places to stop in for food, drinks and snacks. Nice little shops/ stalls to buy pretty souvenirs. Definitely would love to go back when I visit next time. Lovely beach!

Didn‚Äôt think much of the pier. Looked tired, run down. Rubbish food and a couple of stores. Some carnival rides. The beach was nice. Santa Monica itself was pretty but the pier didn‚Äôt overly impress me

Santa Monica pier is so easy to get to with metro direct from downtown L.A. aswell as great bus links.It has a basic fairground with a ferris wheel, bumper cars etc. It is safe and family friendly.People see their ware on stalls but are never in your face or pushy about purchasing items.The end of route 66 is signposted at Santa Monica pier so that's pretty cool to see.The pier it's self has restaurants and quick eats with plenty parking either on the pier or very close by.The beach goes on for miles at either side of the pier which makes the area very open, fresh and scenic.

The view from all around the pier was beautiful. I walked the entire pier to see all sides during the day time before the rides and most attractions opened. It looked like maybe they are replacing wood and doing repairs to the pier because of stacks wood and workers present. I would say the pier does need work and that‚Äôs why it didn‚Äôt get 5 stars. Most of the buildings need updating but there is a sense of nostalgia for the 80‚Äôs. The arcade even has the Zoltor machine which was pretty cool.Bird poop everywhere. Dirty fish skinning boards. Pier just needs TLC.Parking was $12 all day. Go before 10am and you should be fine. Shops along the street leading to the pier were too notch as well as the food. Many sea food places to choose from.Multiple music vendors make the pier noisy with their instruments clashing with each other looking for tips. Homeless scattered on the beach below.Overall it‚Äôs what I expected from a historic place and the views were wonderful. Just needs work.

column2: Worth the Walk to the End of the Pier
column3: I'm a sucker for a walk along any pier so to walk the boards of Santa Monica Pier was a must do activity during my trip. I walked onto the pier at 15:00 with the weather sunny and clear which is a bonus having walked many piers in fog and rain. This pier is a famous landmark and it didn't disappoint. With its Ferris wheel and indoor funfair ride it was a delight to view as I walked to the end. The view back towards Santa Monica was also great together with the view along the Venice Beach shoreline (a planned walk).

Not being a lover of piers in the UK, this did nothing for us. It was packed but why, only those enjoying it could say. It basically mirrors piers we have here so has the usual 'trashy‚Äô shops and fast food outlets albeit with much better weather than we get back home.We aim to visit Santa Monica again but this will not be on the to do list.

My first time ever to visit this pier! After we had dinner at ‚ÄúMeat‚Äù we walked the pier. Nice assortment of pier vendors and as well individual pier performers. They have a pretty big Ferris wheel too. Lots of food vendors to choose from. The pier looks like a popular spot for fisherman too. Well worth your time to walk it!!!
So much fun. Didn't want to leave. I hope to return one day. I felt so happy there and really did not want the day to end.

column2: So much better than Malibu Pier
column3: Great choice of food and quaint traditional fairground which was complemented by a variety of street musicians performing on the pier. Don't miss the opportunity to get a photo at the end of Route 66 or the original muscle beach just to the right as you leave the pier.

We arrived at out hotel and decided to visit the pier that evening. It was about 7:30 pm when we arrived and found the amusement park shutting down leaving only a couple of chain restaurants, a bunch of souvenir vendors and snack carts, and a large number of "acts" trying to attract your donations. It was not worth our effort to visit.

A stroll on the Santa Monica Pier is a stroll into nostalgia....From a distance, I see its iconic 108-year-old arch entrance arch sign just as when I first glimpsed it over 40 years ago while carrying fishing gear.Near entrance, beefy male attired in tight brief performed with boa constrictor seeking donations while other street performers jump over 6 hunched over recruited volunteers.As I step on Pier's wooden planks, I see the historic hippodrome with the original 1922 Carousel of hand-carved horses. To my left I see the video arcade where $5.00 in quarters enabled us to play for long time on Street Fighter.Further on my left, I see Pacific Park with its yellow roller coaster and iconic US's only solar-powered Ferris wheel where once I shared a chair with my dear friend Robyn and mentee Charlie.To my right, I peer down on the swimmers and sunbathers enjoying themselves on world famous beach. Kids are running up and down wet sand as waves splash in and recede.Further down Pier, I pass vendors peddling caps, purses, drinks, snacks and Route 66 souvenirs. Artist is sketching kid while onlookers admire work. Musician is singing for donations. Magician is bending and unbending fork with mind power.Everywhere are visitors and tourists enjoying the sun and warm Pacific Ocean breeze -- great place for families...At end of west end, I check for fishing conditions at tackle shop, The Last Stop of historic Route 66 that connected 2448 miles away with Chicago. (Fishing is slow with some mackerel being hooked -- water still too cold...)It was here over 40 years ago when sun was just rising on my first visit that I bumped into my fishing friend from Northern California who also was fishing the Pier for first time! We had lost contact for 7 years, yet here we accidentally meet.Pier has warm place in my heart -- many good memories....Unfortunately, we got skunked. But it was still fun to flip line and hook at special fishing landing at far west end which is built lower than Pier for fishing
This is pretty cool place to catch the great Pacific Ocean sunsets and views of the mountains that line the coast as well.

Although there were realy many people, it was a nice visit there. some street art, some merchants, many many people.if u come here by car, u need a ticket for parking, which is about 12 $. otherwise u wont find a place to park ur car .

column2: Old time pier but not old time prices
column3: We stopped here during one of our stops on a tour. It was a blast from the past reminding me of when I was a child from yesteryear. A beautiful Merry go round indoors and a big Ferris Wheel were 2 of the stand out rides for me. Tons of food vendors lined the pier so you definitely won't go hungry. Just bring your pocketbook because everything was extremely expensive. 1 cone=$9.I was amazed to see the amount of homeless people sleeping right outside the entrance to the pier. This is not handicap easy since the wooden slates on the boardwalk would be difficult to push a wheelchair on plus there is a steep hill leading down to the pier.

It was fun watching playing air hockey and the old-fashioned arcade games. Also, the rides are pretty aged, but what it lacks in updated rides it gains in nostalgia. The ferris wheel is the best way to get the best view of the pier, Santa Monica & the Pacific Ocean all at once. We used our Go LA Cards, so the rides were free & unlimited. It would not have been worth it to purchase ride-by-ride (in my opinion).TIP #1: No smoking on the pier!

it's a boardwalk. great for kids and if you're a local..it's a nice walk in the mornings and evenings. easily accessible to the beach as well. lots of things to see/do on the pier. my favorite restaurant is the Albright on it. Weekends are jammed packed. Don't let the mass crowd fool your from afar. Once you're down there...pleasantly it doesn't seem that crowded. I know..odd.

I took my nieces here and they loved it, they wanted to ride the roller-coaster and the ferris wheel, which were both fun. A single ride ticket costs $8.50. There were a lot of people there even on a Sunday night. One of the little gift shops there was cute and had so many different souvenir options. The Beach burger place was a nice little joint to eat from. The meals were a little overpriced but the service was quick. All together, the visit was really nice.

The pier is an old and beloved Santa Monica attraction. People of all ages are sure to have a great time. There‚Äôs a museum, kid rides and food places. Plus the view of the ocean is unbeatable. Tourists flood it in summer so try to stick to going on a weekday, but off-season you‚Äôre sure to have a great time!
It nice to be a part of Southern California history. Worth a trip when visiting the greater LA area.

You are in Santa Monica, you can't some skip the Pier, it is a must visit place, so lively...so full of people, just so amazing when the weather is sunny and nice, it is surely worth your whole day visit.

Santa Monica beach is great, but you can skip the pier unless you are specifically going for an amusement ride. The pier is overcrowded and the surface is not level in parts which makes it hard for some walkers. Also, if you are hungry there are better food options across the street looking directly at the pier.

Well California is one of my favourite places to visit in the US. There is so much to and see, and plenty of beaches to visit. This trip we chose Santa Monica pier and Oceanside beach in San Diego. Santa Monica is the one beach people think to see as it's in movies and tv shows, the Ferris wheel is the most recognized part of the beach! I wanted the kids to see it as teenagers as they had forgotten being there as little kids. They enjoyed walking around and spending the day, but found it to be a little crowded. We have been to many other beaches in California on previous trips so, we spent another day getting surfing lessons on Oceanside beach as we rented a condo nearby. The area is really nice ,less busy than most places as it's not very touristy,more locals than anything. There were plenty of restaurants to choose from and our first time visiting Joe's Crab Shack ! This was probably my most favourite family trip ever and I look back on the pictures often and regularly. The kids enjoys the excitement of Hollywood Blvd and seeing the sign is a highlight !

This was our second visit to Santa Monica, we really enjoy the pier. Everybody is here to have fun, there are some funny entertainers trying to earn a living and plenty of places to eat and drink. The beaches either side are fantastic for some relaxation and there are excellent paths to either walk, cycle (bikes available to hire), skate etc. along to Venice and further. I have only ever visited during the day time, but I imagine that it would be great in the night too.

So much fun for adults me and my husband rent bikes and ride from Venice till the pier and it‚Äôs amazing, be sure to ride the Ferris wheel at sunset time for a beautiful breath taking view. We highly recommend
Santa Monica Pier is always fun in the evenings. The lights and all the people make for lovely "sightseeing".Be careful tho, pickpockets are also always around !
It is as I expected, a throwback to the carnival piers. Great experience with fantastic beaches either side.

A stroll along Santa Monica Pier is an amazing way to soak up the atmosphere of the area. Its always packed with people from all walks of life and offers a mixed bag of trinket shopping, busking entertainment, carnival rides and a great Mexican restaurant at the piers end. Its easy for a few hours to pass by on a stroll up and back. If you're an avid "tourist photo" taker there's the opportunity to snap away under the sign that signifies the end of Route 66.

It's an experience, an eye opener the characters are hilarious, it is expensive, but it's entertaining! People are crazy, you will see and hear so many differences here, the food is crazy because there is jut so much sugar and saturated fats but you cannot deny it is fun!

Lovely pier. Looked even better in real life than it did on the tv. Eating icecream looking out at the Pacific ocean. One thing i didnt like was the homeless situation. Its uncomfortable for them to be around so much. Whilst i didnt get approached by any of them, it still makes me very nervous. There was police cars on there but still a nervous feelingPlenty of shops on the pier. Good fairground. Except the couple of homeless on there had an excellent time

The pier is a place to visit in santa monica. Great for people watching a couple of nice re restaurants. Souvenir shops galore and nice views of the ocean. Only drawback this visit was the amusement park was closed for a special event. Shasta ok though as I found out it was for the special Olympics. Great cause!

Popped onto the pier in the evening, just after the sun had gone down, driving from LA up the West Coast. Lovely atmosphere, music and performers dotted along the pier. I imagine it's a lot busier during the day but it was a lovely atmosphere when I was there and nice seeing it all lit up against the night sky.Had my go at a twist on the classic end of Route 66 tourist pic.Classic pier experience and some good fresh air after being stuck in the car driving!

column2: Sad and not what we had expected
column3: We are spending the weekend in Los Angeles before joining a cruise tomorrow. We have the whole day free today so decided to head to the beach and had heard great things about Santa Monica and Venice beach. We were awake early after flying in from London yesterday so caught a taxi from our beautiful hotel (Beverly Wilshire) to Santa Monica pier (USD 40 for an LA Taxi). There are so many homeless people it is very sad. So many people living/sleeping on the beach, not just a couple here and there but the whole way from Santa Monica pier to Venice beach. The walk is fantastic and great to see so many people exercising and having group gym lessons along the way but you just can't get away from the poor homeless people. Great to see a couple of food kitchens along the front, both of which had long queues....but again very unexpected. The plan was to sit at an ocean front cafe, have breakfast and enjoy the view but we couldn't face it so decided to return to downtown LA this time using an Uber (USD 15). The beach was great and so wide but honestly these 2 iconic places just weren't what we had hoped for. Santa Monica pier was dirty with a number of homeless men rooting through the bins searching for food. It made me think of how much help and support we have for the homeless back in the UK. I can't recommend sorry!!!
Nostalgia all around. And the refreshing scent of the pacific. Beautiful views. Must see when driving the PCH.

The Santa Monica Pier is fun if you want to have a beachy carnival feel. We went on a Friday evening and they were playing a big screen movie. The carnival games are expensive but it's part of the carnival/fair experience. It's worth a stop when visiting Santa Monica.

Being that our last day in L.A. was spent around here this was a great choice for our last activity.Though it was quite busy our luck got us a close carpark and possibly the last 2 seats at the famous BubbaGumps restaurant.From the beautiful merry-go-round to the roller-coaster and all that's in between, you will enjoy this seaside spot.Don't forget the prawns and margaritas.
End of route 66 is very touristy but well worth a visit.Walked the boardwalk from Venice Beach.Initially very quiet but busy by lunchtime

This place is amazing my first time the beach is just magic the people are frendly the food there is well priced there is things going on everywhere so much to see so much to do no words can really do it justices its s must see for everyone

Went for a trip here from Hollywood during our stay on a warm Saturday afternoon. The place was rammed, traffic & people everywhere getting in each other's way.I was hoping for a relaxing afternoon with a few drinks and a meal at the beach, but in reality it's just junk food, souvenirs & buskersbetter options I think
Loved the time spent here. The place has got attractions for kids, friends, good food and an amazing view of the beach.
Fun place to walk on the broad walk at the ocean. Carnival rides for children. Clean with several restaurants. Parking is expensive
The Pier is Great at night. This is typical entertainment as u know from American movies. Cool coasters, carousels, popcorn and hotdogs. Like it!
I enjoyed the atmosphere here. The entertainers kept things lively and I enjoyed a churro from a vendor. It‚Äôs a must see
Had a great afternoon here, could have spent more time if the schedule had allowed it. Great views, interesting shops, kiosks, definitely worth a visit
Any cities have a place to rest soul and a place to see street artSanta monica pier have best street art similar music and painting

column2: Made me feel like a kid again!!!
column3: What an amazing experience!!! Having the ocean under you from the pier, the entertainers performing along the pier, the ferris wheel and other rides was so incredible! It made me feel like a kid again - I wanted to experience everything, but the absolute best was watching the majestic sunset - an unbelievable experience and I could have spent hours! It was relaxing and extremely fun!

column2: Meh It's your basic tourist trap beach pier
column3: Nothing super special except for the awesome view of beautiful water and the mountains. Its your usual tourist trap with high priced rides and over priced not very good food BUT it is one of those been there done that's, that you just have to do while in Santa Monica

column2: Try by Day and photograph by nigh
column3: The Pier at Santa Monica has enough to keep a family interested for hours with rides stalls, and amusement arcade. The coaster is tame and good for the whole family. Great views along the beach and ocean from the ferris wheel. Enough eateries including Bubba Shrimp. The best time to visit is just in time to catch the fabulous sunset over the ocean and gran some great pictures of the Pier attractions illuminations.

We reached this place and we parked the car right on the pier where there were lots of parking spaces on a hot Monday September afternoon.Despite all this the place was packed with tourists and the restaurants were making a roaring trade. The street 'gymnasts' were also attracting lots of tourists and the little shops were also busy with people.Even with all this, you can simply relax in the quieter areas if you do not want to live in the fast lane and simply enjoy in the sights and take on the atmosphere.
Nice Air Squad show , beautiful sunset , having fun at the roller coaster , lots of art craft, nice view of the beach .
It's good to go and look st but it's super busy and the rides are below average. You really have to go there to say you did it however don't expect something super special!

The rides on the pier are expensive unless you get a wrist band and stay for awhile. There are vendors all over and lots of atmosphere. The only drawback is that any food items are expensive and the place was super crowded.

There is a lot of different attraction here.There are many different attractions here. The amusement park with its spectacular beach and sea view, and the amphitheater, fishermen, music makers and other shows ...

column2: Busy but well worth a visit
column3: Visited here on a hot weekend day and although packed it was fantastic. Loved walking up the pier and seeing the end of route 66. The place was amazing. Feels happy and vibrant

Take a walk down the beach and onto the pier around late afternoon time. And make sure not to miss the sunset! Great vibes with small amusement park, restaurants, and people. You can also enjoy fishing at the pier.

We stopped here for a quick 2 hour visit to walk around, eat, and have ice cream. A little crowded and very sunny with little shade, so make sure you put on some sun screen! Also finding parking was difficult, be prepared to walk a little ways from your car to the pier.

column2: Great night out to enjoy the breezy!
column3: Love the view of ocean and be on the ferris wheel. Made my experience a positive one to enjoy the LA in the evening. Sunset view is amazing from the pier. Worth a visit if you stay in Venice. Perfect spot to ride your bike on the path and come back.
Wether you want to eat and go on the rides, or just simply go to the beach this is the place for you! Although there is a parking fee, it really is worth it!
Heaps of People traffic jam overpriced drinks and food tacky souvenirs not really worth a visit but interesting

column2: If you're in Santa Monica go visit - once!
column3: Good views of the coast from this pier.Pretty standard pier attractions. But certainly good to visit.
Came here to complete a Route 66 trip. Very commercial but still a lot of fun. Only complaint is the number of panhandlers around the area
Awesome boardwalk, lovely ocean beach and views, iconic historic skate park, lovely place to bicycle or walk. Gift shops. Awesome stop.
Quiet enjoyable, but can be shaddy at late night.Still worth visiting.Do visit once if you are in santa monica.

Great iconic place. Well worth a visit. Parking is available on the pier. We went on a Tuesday and plenty of available parking in the afternoon. Great views of the beach areas. Very busy. Great beach for kids and looked a good swimming beach. We didn't spend a long time there as went to Venice beach. Could have missed Venice beach out and stayed here longer. Rides were $7-8 per ride. We did the small roller coaster. Not immense ride but more iconic than anything. Great atmosphere.

column2: Worth a look just because it is the Santa Monica Pier
column3: Nice to have a stroll out to the end of the pier and have a look back around the coast. There are food shops out near the end and other stalls that sell the typical touristy souvenirs. It‚Äôs worth a walk just because of what it is and because of the history. Have a look at the information boards at the end, near the restrooms.If you wander out around midday you can have lunch and maybe spend 2 hours in total including the walk out and back.Most shops / stalls don‚Äôt open til about 10-00 am.

A great place to visit any time of the year but especially in the summer months. Some old time favorites still exist like the carousel and the amusement arcade. A small but complete fun fair is there including dodgems small roller coaster and the Ferris wheel.many places to eat and drink.abd ample parking. A must if you find yourself in Santa Monica.
A good place to spend an afternoon with kids.The kids got board waiting for rides.But enjoid the location on the sea.

column2: Great if you like crowds, addicts, homeless and body odor....
column3: Brought my son to see the pier and the Pacific Ocean on a recent trip to LA. I was told that the Santa Monica Pier was a great place to go. I couldn't have been more disappointed.We walked down Colorado and across Ocean Avenue to head down onto the pier. In doing so we passed several men between 18-55 who were tweaking. We passed another 4-6 people who were passed out on the curb or in the chairs for customers to use outside of restaurants.Once we crossed onto the pier things improved, though it was very crowded with a ton of people heading over onto the pier and to the beach. My son really enjoys arcades so I was hopeful that Playland would be a good time. Unfortunately, it was one of the worst arcades that I've been too in a long time. The place was packed with games, more than should have been in that confined space. But they were mostly run-down and over priced. They have a bunch of air hockey tables but they are all stacked in like sardines. That makes slipping the $1.00 in quarters a bit tough if the table next to you is in use.Bubba Gump's looked good, but we weren't in the mood for food at that time. Otherwise, the rest of the pier is forgettable in my opinion.

column2: View from Ferris Wheel is great!
column3: This is a good old fashion fair. Rides are somewhat small but still fun, just like the old time fairs. Lots of good food everywhere like fennel cakes. Lots of games too. Many small shops as well.

Well worth a visit this pier is about 1/2mile long and is bustling. Would recommend eating and/or drinking at Jims which is situated at the start of the pier. A variety of musicians and singers located between the various stalls perform on the pier and create a pleasant atmosphere. For those interested in history the pier marks the end of historic Route 66.
The pier is ok, but there are better places to visit. You can walk the pier and see everything in about 30 minutes.
Was there at 11 am when it's not so busy. It's a nice place but if you want to try the amusement park it doesn't open until noon.

column2: Great wooden pier, with easy parking - iconic!!
column3: Loved this pier - being able to drive onto the actual wooden pier, park easily, for a very reasonable fee and see the beautiful beach and the Pacific stretch away from you - what's not to love!!A little tacky - obviously, but well worth a visit - just wish we could have been these in the evening to watch the sunset!

It has been 20 years since my last visit to the pier and it shows. I found it to be very run down and literally a waste of time to have stopped there. I guess if you have never been you might want to see it.

I can only assume I missed the wonderful vibrant delightful place this is in all the reviews and have gone blind. I can only hope this place is different at night as I visited during the day but I'm not holding out any hope at all.Parking was east and close by the beach weather was hot sun was out so a great start sadly that's where it ended.Walked up onto the pier to be met by about 6 police offers and a guy covered in his own poo now I didn't see what happen could have been anything just not a nice thing to see.The pier it self is very worn and run down glad I didn't pre book the park tickets as it would have been a waste of money took one walk round (1 minute walk at most) and decided against going on any the rides.Toilets - unless u can hover don't bother absolutely disgusting and full of drug users and homeless and people looking in bins tho they do provide seat covers if you have to go.Now as a fitness fan I was looking forward to walking to muscle beach and taking in the sights - nope didn't happen eitherWalked with the misses for about 5 minutes the smell off drugs in the air police moving people on some weird woman shouting at random people , homeless people everywhere decide to sack the idea and spent the day in Beverly Hills/Hollywood areaComplete waste off the morning

column2: Not much going on but worth seeing
column3: Unless you're going for Pacific Park, churros, funnel cakes or hotdogs it's probably not really worth going to the Pier. There are a handful of restaurants and interesting stalls but nothing spectacular. Oh and there's a lot of people that like to fish here... it looks better from a distance.

Enjoyed the pier and all there is to do. Loved riding the Ferris wheel and the lovely view it affords the riders! Beach is so pretty. Went in the late afternoon / early evening and it was just a perfect family outing!

column2: You just have to visit at night
column3: Jetlagged and trying to stay awake, headed for the iconic bright lights of the pier on our first night. Ate at the Mexican restaurant right at the end, shared a main as it was plenty and you get a big bowl of nachos to start you off for free. Dined watching the Ferris wheel illuminate our first holiday memory. Loved it. Tip: Parking is difficult but if you're prepared to pay $20 for convenience then park over the road from the pier entrance at one of the hotels. For a tired traveller it was worth it! Enjoy!!

Very busy tourist spot on the shore, it's one of the things you'll have to visit. Get an ice cafe and walk a long the beach and pop into one of the many restaurants. Be aware that you'll properly be a little disappointed because it's not as polished as you see in he movies.Restaurants are a little overpriced, but it's all about location location location.

When I was looking into beaches to visit.. this one was closer geographically to where we were and it didn't make sense to travel to Malibu (35+ miles away) and Laguna (60+ miles away)... Parking was $12 bucks we went on a weekday it was actually empty... we layed on the beach and then walked up the pier for tacos at the very end of the pier.... bought some souvenirs overall great time there! I will be back!

I recently visited the boardwalk and beach and I was really impressed. Beach was excellent and the boardwalk was really iconic. It really was a real American experience and if I am in the area again I will be back.

Our visit to Santa Monica Pier was late afternoon. The Pier was jumping with lots of energy and activities. There were singers, dancers, magic shows and vendors. Watching the sunset from the Pier was absolutely beautiful. A visit to Santa Monica Pier is Priceless.
Worth a visit if in Santa Monica . Great views across the beach. Entertainers and small fairground On an old fashioned pier
Went there in the afternoon after spending a day on the beach. It was busy but not annoyingly crowded. It's nice to have a walk there and have a drink or eat in one of many cafes and restaurants.

We visited Santa Monica pier twice during our visit. The first time during the day, the second in the evening.Both visits were different and had a different feel to them. The evening was fun with music and the pier lit up. We had dinner and then wandered down the pier to people watch. During the day, it was quieter but we enjoyed being able to see everything with less crowds. We were lucky enough to see 2 local seals off the end of the pier begging for fish from the local fishermen! If in LA, take the time to spend either an evening or an afternoon here.
This is such an iconic location that we had to stop by and check it out. Friday on sunset and the place was humming. Very picturesque.

The pier is colourful and vibrant place to be always filled with mostly tourists and locals. There are many rides and restaurants and some performances hat goes on in evening.You will see many people fishing at pier and enjoying cool Breeze there.Must visit when in LA.
Still fun for adults, has lost some of its luster however teenagers young adults it's got to be still a blast

column2: It's nice to look at the ocean from above
column3: Being from NYC, it was as if I was in Coney Island..one pass though and I was good to leave. There isn't much to see. Very short pier with many vendors and lots of crazy homeless people around.The only really nice thing about the pier was overlooking the ocean and beach from above.If it's you first time in Santa Monica, it seems like a must do...but I wouldnt get hyped about it.

I know this is one of California's iconic piers but they need to think about a few sympathetic upgrades in places as do parts are a bit tired and dated. Otherwise great atmosphere and fantastic place for the amateur photographers to get those shots.
Third time here and still worth a visit ,Love going here for the food and views and the rides.Loved it here
Other than the fact that this place is so iconic, it is also super fun and pretty! If you're in LA, this is one place you have to go.

column2: A must visit in the area
column3: A great way for tourists and local to spend a few hours with lots of food and souvenir stalls. A ride on the ferries wheel is a great way to gain an elevated view of the area

We were pleasantly surprised by the Santa Monica pier. I was dreading cheap arcades but what we found was an old school amusement park with very sweet carnival rides for children, as well as some restaurants, pier musicians, and a great view of the sunset. A pleasant surprise!

The Santa Monica Pier is a classic tourist destination but worth the visit. When I was there, we saw a sea lion at the end of the dock that was cute and plenty of people were fishing (and actually catching fish). There is also amusement rides and the end of route 66 sign that people take pictures with.
Very hard to walk straight. The wooden surface is very very rough. Pushing a prom would be really hard and even harder forSomeone in a wheelchair. Very tacky.
If in the area you must visit the Santa Monica pier. Lots of individual performers. The views are amazing. It was always packed but worth the trip.

column2: Santa Monica Pier, it‚Äôs a must go see‚Ä¶!
column3: Another lunch-stop during our coach tour of western USA, and we find ourselves ‚Äòdropped-off‚Äô at the Santa Monica Pier for a couple of hours. Looking down onto the Pier from the road, you could tell that it‚Äôs a colourful and busy place, but you could also see that it is a tourist magnet. When down on the Pier, there are the usual ‚Äòfairground-type‚Äô things like roundabouts for the kids, mini ferris-wheel and swings, but there is also a mini ‚Äòtrapeze‚Äô set up where your kids can actually learn how to swing in a trapeze act! Now that‚Äôs different. There are many tourist shops, Restaurants and market-type stalls selling all sorts of stuff, from ornaments and souvenirs to T-shirts, food and swim-wear. Then there is the sign that tells you that you are now at the western-most end of the famous Route 66, and it‚Äôs ‚ÄòThe End of The Trail!‚Äô; and of course, this is the main photo-stop of the day! There is another sign further onto the Pier that then tells you that you have a mere 2448 miles to go, to get to the eastern-most end of Route 66! Now that trip‚Äôs just been added to our ‚ÄòBucket-List for the future!‚Äô. Looking out to both the left and right sides of the Pier, the beach is very large at this point, and there are quite a lot of people on the beach typically sun-bathing, playing ball, swimming in the sea and generally having a good time; and of course, the weather is absolutely gorgeous. If you do get the opportuninty, you have to go and see it for yourself.
Had a great day here. Lots of live entertainment including the fantastic family group Liliac. Plenty of variety of food and drink. Good atmosphere .

The Santa Monica Pier is still one of the most iconic places in Southern California. It's energizing, lighthearted and a fun place to visit any time of day. You'll get a different experience at 7am than 7pm, but both are still interesting times to visit.Here's why the Santa Monica Pier is so cool:1. Nostalgia-inducing boardwalk with a fun amusement park2. World-class people watching3. Unique food carts and quintessential "fair food"4. Stunning views of the Pacific Ocean5. Romantic place for a Ferris wheel ride6. Live music from local performers7. Learn about the history of Route 66

column2: Iconic tourist destination you must visit if you're in the Santa Monica area
column3: The pier is famous and part of LA history. Route 66 ends at the pier and it's worth going to get your photo taken under the Route 66 end sign. The pier is also beautiful at night when it's all lit up, with the ferris wheel changing colors. On some summer nights, they also have bands playing which is fun. But once you see the pier, there's really not much to do there. The rides are very overpriced and none are made large enough to comfortably fit an adult. My kids (ages 9 and 11) rode a few and then asked to leave. They wanted to get down to the beach.
After being to Hollywood , rodeo drive, we went to Santa Monica and Venice beach was a fabulous day , we crammed in so much as we were only in LA for two days
i have always loved Santa Monica Pier from afar. Up close- not so much. Touristy, poor restaurants, watch your purse. Get a photo and move on.
Its the best beach i've ever been to with the right mix of cleanliness crowdedness and vibrance! if you're in L.A you must visit this beach.
It's busy and obviously popular. It's noisy. Full of gift shops etc selling mainly tat. It's like Blackpool. Nice beach. Did not like it.

Stayed at Venice Beach for 3 nights, in an Air BNB a street back from the beach. Great venue, a little loud at night, close to shops, restaurants & public transports. Hired bikes and rode along the beach to Santa Monica lots of fun, Santa Monica again lots of good shopping & restaurants, we lucked upon a farmers market. Behind where we were staying at Venice is a street called Abbot Kinney a fabulous find again full of great restaurants and shopping. A must see if staying in Venice or Santa Monica or surrounds.

Visited 3 of LA's famous beaches and this was the best option by far. Wandering up and down the pier was like transporting back to a location you would have seen in moviesNot far from the pier is a mile long promenade with shops and eating locations. This is a must visit option in LA
A good place to hang out during the day with friends and family. Weather was awesome to walk around and enjoy the many different attractions.
We visited with our kids and we loved the atmosphere. It can get rough so probably not a place to go to really late at night but at dusk it is very beautiful.

column2: A lot of activity and very crowded
column3: We popped onto the pier after a full day on the beach. It's a traditional old wooden pier with a few fishermen and great views across the beach either side.If you like fairground attractions there are a couple of rides. Most of the eateries are fast food style outlets and the traders are selling your traditional souvenirs. There are a few buskers which adds to the atmosphere but the whole place is very busy all day. As we were leaving in the early evening there were hundreds of people coming onto the pier to enjoy the evening ambience. Parking is nearby at a cost of 12 dollars regardless of how much time you stay and the rest rooms are kept clean n tidy by a regular janitorial service
Went here with my dad, we had an amazing day! We went in papa shrimp which was lovely the food was outstanding

The pier includes a mini-fair feeling with a variety of rides for kids and young at heart individuals (bumper cars, ferris wheel and others), along with vendors who sell tshirts, board signs, name on a grain of rice, musicians, etc.Access to the pier is free, the rides cost (don't know how much).Walkers be warned, the pier boards are uneven so watch your step.There are a variety of restaurants on the pier, but didn't try any of them.Be prepared for tourist glut, lots of people at any time of day taking pictures or just milling around.
Amazing music and beautiful views of ocean and sunset.. also end of Route 66 has effected me deeply about this place.
We made a quick visit to the pier. We enjoyed the views the pier offered of the water and the city. The pier had several shops and places to eat as well as several rides.

column2: What a Great Ending Point for The World Famous Route 66
column3: WE drove in and found a great spot for two cars to park together along an aisle end cap. Oddly enough, by the end of the day, two other convertibles found their say over to park beside our convertibles. Their drivers both reported a keen sense of bonding among the cars; kinda like it's own little miniature car showThere are some neat vendors and small shops to check out after you get your obligatory photo standing on the pier under the Route 66 ends here sign. Our visit was on a weekday, I can only imagine the walls and walls of humanity a typical weekend brings.We went sign shopping for the "gotta have it" garage sign along the way and wouldn't you know that we would find exactly what we were looking for. How did that happen? This is definitely a great place to go to watch people, beautiful people for sure.

Pier was full of families walking around and looking at all the attractions. They have a lot of street vendors with permits on the pier, and a whole lot of fishermen on the pier taking up space, be careful guys get kinda mad if you walk down by their areas. It must have been big day, because a group of your athletic women and men where there giving free hugs to everyone.They have a roller coaster theme park area that is pretty pricey. I purchased 6 ice creams and paid $40 dollars. Each ride was $8 dollars to ride, so with a big family can cost a pretty penny.

I had no idea Santa Monica Pier was filled with so many tourist from around the world. All types of Europeans and languages were present the Thursday afternoon I took my Nigerian tourist friend to visit. It can get busy but it is a fun trip. Its a must see!!

You don't need to spend any money, just go to see the sight and the people! There are the typical carnival rides and then there is the main attraction - the wheel. There are gift shops, clothing, tourist chachki, food carts and then there is the Mariasol restaurant at the end, along with a historic map of Route 66. There was also a televised public debate with an audience going on while we were there. 'Street' performers, face painters and fishermen were all doing their thing along the pier. Great way to spend a few hours in the sun.

We visited the Santa Monica pier on our last day of the tour and it was nice to see the beach and the Pier in glorious sunshine. There is the usual attractions associated with the Pier but we found a nice surprise further down the street in the Hotel California which made for a nice photo op. There are lots of bars and restaurants up and down the Promenade to choose from and people watching is always good fun.Great place to round off a trip to LA

Nice place with sea breeze. A lot is going on, full of people, if that is what you are up to. But the gift shops are full of cheap tourist stuff made in China, you cannot say that the place is clean, there re a few junk food eateries, plus a shrimp restaurant ( not sure how good it is but it does not look as fine dinning).
Lots going on at the pier , but like me I was mainly there as it is the end of Route 66 ! Plenty of memorabilia to see and buy

Was on the west coast recently on business trip and didn't want to spend the last night in the hotel room eating crappy hotel fare so ventured to SoCal iconic location for some people watching, listening to the pier musicians, and some good local food nearby to the pier. Lots of parking either at the pier location on the beach of two blocks in a garage very reasonably priced. I love to people watch and it didn't disappoint and I got some tourist photo opps also. Fun hour or so just hanging with a nice breeze on a September evening.

column2: Very touristy attraction in west Los Angeles, CA area
column3: If you want to stand in line for very expensive, short carnival rides, this is your place. It's super crowded and lots of junk food. Fun people watching and beautiful views of ocean but it's super touristy so be ready for the experience.

Another must do visit whilst in LA. We parked in one of the public car parks on 2nd street and walked down to the pier. It's very pleasant despite the crowds and there are lots of activities, foods outlets and photo opportunities along the way. Nice to chill out for a while at the end. Worth a visit.

Very touristy, as expected. Nice history lesson at the end of the pier explaining why it was built, how it was used and how it has survived. Very expensive and very mediocre eats from burgers to Bubba Gump and a few others here. Lots of vendors with touristy magnets and signs as well as a few musical performers. Glad I went, so I can say I've been there. Expensive parking as the head of the pier too. But then, everything in L.A. costs an arm and a leg to park at.

Wow. Place is crawling with homeless people crazy people and beggars. Great weather but very uncomfortable place to walk around and relax. Over priced food and drink to top it off. Take your tourist picture ma and leave!

column2: A most visit but only 5 min
column3: Of course you shall visit the pier but just to tick it of the list and then move on and experience more fun and beautiful places!

Santa Monica pier was super pretty. I've never seen anything like it. My husband and I were visiting L.A. and decided to drive to the pier, which was a 30 minute drive from downtown L.A. where we were staying. We parked on the pier for $15 and then waltzed to the restrooms right next to the parking lot. It was an absolutely beautiful day. It's a great place for selfies and to spend time with someone awesome. I also got a mangonada from a fruit stand on the pier. It was very yummy, but I'm pretty sure they jipped me. Good thing I was in a good mood. It's not very big, but definitely go check it out. It looks like a southern California postcard.
Pretty cool place to hang out at night. Not much activities though, just walking up and down the pier. Did not enter the fair area as too crowded for a family with a child sitting in the stroller.

Don't get me wrong, santa monica is a nice place to be. I am specifically referring to the pier in question. It's like they crammed a carnival on the dock which is now very old very dirty very crowded and honestly without the beach as it's surrounding, I'd give it zero stars. Nothing to see here don't waste your time

column2: The pier rides were expensive but if you can get a deal they are lots of fun!
column3: We went as a group of 6 (my husband and I, his parents, his sister and her boyfriend), and we all very much enjoyed our visit.We had purchased the LA Go card, which saved us a lot on tourist attractions. A wristband for the rides at the pier were included in this, and this helped a lot as they were VERY expensive for what they were! However we were there mid week in the evening and got to go round on the ferris wheel about 6 times before they took us off, and the rollercoaster twice each time as they weren't busy. The small drop tower and Shark Frenzy were a lot of fun too.The pier itself offered beautiful views, good entertainment and some good food - Pier Burger in particular was a great choice for food as it was relatively cheap and a great burger.
