Good spot for outdoor activities, open beach, windy area.You need to be Super lucky if you want to park inside.Beware of some people who dressed up with costumes and intending to take photos with you. They will con you to pay!Also, I think the restaurants there are overpriced.

We found the pier to be a good afternoon out and was on our list of things to do in California. We parked down the road for a flat fee of $20. The pier itself can be difficult for those using a wheelchair as the boards aren't easy to manoeuvre on.Our kids enjoyed the games and rides at Pacific Park. It wasn't too expensive.We really enjoyed the aquarium downstairs and our kids loved getting up close and touching some of the sea creatures that are different from home. Lots to do, many vendors, variety of food options.
Simply spectacular. Bucket list. Must see. So many things to do and do many options to eat and so. It's a must

column2: Classic Run of the Mill Amusement Park on a Pier
column3: It's a family oriented place to visit. Lots to do for the family. Rides for the kiddos. Trapeze school for the athletically adventurous and lots of souvenirs to waste money on. The views are nice and the place was fun to people watch and see the side street entertainers.

column2: An Inside Look at Santa Monica Pier
column3: Santa Monica Pier should be a definite visit when in LA... Lots of FUN and great for Kids, Families and Couples!Gorgeous Sunsets

People all over the world have seen the Santa Monica pier portrayed in various movies and TV shows. The real thing is much better. Plenty of street vendors, beach type shops, seafood restaurants, and of course the iconic Santa Monica pier amusement center. No visitors to LA should skip this experience

The variety of humanity, smells and sounds just totally amazes me at the Santa Monica Pier no matter when I visit. Yes, the boards are getting worn out, the concessions sell cheap goods but the overall experience of the sea air and live entertainment is worth it. Go with an open mind and take it in.
Best place i have been to based on movie locations. I couldn't ask for it to be more authentic. Enjoyed the rides and not so much the food but the experience was worth it
A fun place to walk; the colored Ferris wheel at night is a must see. some pier fishing is available for $4.00 per hour. eateries are mostly carnival food and the shops are touristy.

column2: Great visit for friends and families
column3: Lovely place to visit, with a bit of nostalgia attached. Plenty to see for both adults and kids. Eateries busy, but plenty of choice nearby. Parking on seafront expensive, use the multi-storey in shopping area.

Enjoyed the half day at the pier. Parking in area is a complete rip off. Best to load a parking app on your smartphone and find some meter parking if you can. I would do it if I were a first time visitor. Next time - I think hiring a bike would make it worth a second look. Street entertainers in vicinity are excellent. Felt very safe.
Not worth a detour. Scruffy and very tired, particularly when compared to piers in UK and elsewhere in Europe; it could have been so much better but probably beyond recovery now.

Not that interested in venues such as this. The old pier structure is great, but the carnival atmosphere is just not that exciting. Vendors are overpriced. Suggest walking around it and looking at it, but not doing anything on it.

What a superb place to visit !!!The pier has it all , fun fair rides for all the family , lots of shopping opportunities for souvenirs and nice places to eat , it's a definite must visit attraction.No hesitation in recommending 10/10

column2: lovely to check out while passing through area
column3: We were in area on a coach trip, stopped off here for about 3 hours to stroll pier & beach. Lovely warm day, busy tourist area, but we really enjoyed it. Plenty of choice up pier if fancy bite to eat. Got some great pictures aswell.
While it was interesting to walk around Santa Monica Pier, we really didn't find ourselves actually doing anthing on the Pier. As it is fairly iconic it is definitely worth the visit though!
The most authentic thing of this pier is it's wooden construction that creaks under the cars that drive up there. The rest is tourist shops and restaurants and we've all seen plenty of those.

The pier looked a bit tired as did the attractions and the prices from the vendors was super high one place charging $6 for 1 scoop of ice cream!It was very busy when we visited with a lot of random vendors some playing 'music' if you can call it that and others selling random stuff.There were quite a few homeless people on the pier begging from tourists and a lot sleeping on the benches.The best bit was watching a seal playing with the fishermen on the end of the pier nicking their bait each time they cast a line.I wouldn't rush back to the pier itself but the beach and Santa Monica shops are nice.

Bit put off by the homelessness and some dodgy people hanging around but if you ignore all that and walk down, it's a pretty nice beach. Beach itself is clean and quite peaceful as we went on a week day so not much crowd. We walked from this beach to Venice beach.

column2: Iconic Santa Monica Pier lives up to the hype
column3: As a local I never get tired of visiting the Santa Monica pier where everyday feels like vacation! My family and I love the entertainment, rides, shops, and of course breath taking views of the ocean.

I've seen some piers this year and Santa Monica Pier is still my favourite. Especially in the evening it's an amazing place to watch the sundown.Besides that, they offer food, some roller coaster rides are available, people do music (some do that really really good) and you can buy souvenirs in the gift shops :)I like to finish the day by just strolling around for a little while :)

Fun to stroll and people watch. Lots of cute shops, ice cream and food options. Rides for kids. Old school feel of carnival with beautiful views of beach, ocean and city. Fun place to bring the visiting family then head to 3rd street promenade.

column2: a must to visit but not so special
column3: a must to visit but it is not so special actually. just perfect for a 20-30 stroll to see everything. Some artists performing songs, playing instruments etc on the Pier, there is a small leisure park for children and 2-3 restaurants. The Mexican restaurant at the end of the Pier is okay and not too pricey. It's a pity that you see so many drug consuming and dealing people on your way to the Pier. It's no aggressive atmosphere but I wish they would light the ways to the city and show more police presence.

Go early to get a parking spot right on the pier. My friend and I arrived about 930 on a weekday and there was tons of parking and barely anyone on the beach.There are washrooms available.For changing clothes: lines are long so changing there can be a time waster.Wear your swim suit there.Around noon the crowds start piling in.There are lots of places to eat availableYou can also rent bikes!
It's a fair on a pier. It's not that much fun and way to crowded.There are a lot of homeless people near the entrance to the pier. Just ignore them and they ignore you.
We spent a few hours on the pier one day. There were lots of restaurants and shops and some very talented street performers! We rode the big Ferris wheel and there were some great views from the top!
The beach was clean and there was an array of street performers to watch. We ate at Bubba gump (delicious) and walked the boardwalk! Great time!

The place is nice to walk and go to the beach but the first time we went (weekend) to get parking was imposible and at the end we decided to leave.Second time we went it was crowded but not as much, at least we got parking close to the pier.As I said the place is nice but for me wasn't worthed to stay stock in traffic and try to get parking for hours. There was some parking lots further away but quite expensive.The beach is big and there are nice restaurants along the pier.We went for a walk to the main street with all the shops and was ok.I think this can be a place for visiting once unless you are crazy about the beach. I'm not.

My husband and I only walked on the pier because I wanted my 10,000 steps. I am not a big fan of places like this. A lot of OK restaurants, carnival like atmosphere, too many people, junky stuff to waste your money on.....I could go on but I do love the water and the lights on the Ferris wheel.

A worthwhile walk on the pier filled with restaurants, artists,singers, a ferries wheel, fishing off the pier and a beautiful view of the beach and the mountains.Tremendous amount of activity and people watching..an overal fun activity

column2: you have to see it yourslef
column3: best to go there at the very morning when it is not too crouded, many fishermen, at the end of the pier there is shop with suvenirs about route 66
If this were your first visit to Santa Monica beach, your eyes will be drawn to the ferries wheel. Lots of vendors to keep you interested.
We went to the pier for the Fourth of July, it was a bit crowded, but bearable. We got the all day wristband, definitely worth it. Clean and all employees happy and friendly!

column2: Relaxing walk from here to Venice beach
column3: Caught the red, then yellow bus from Dolby theatre. Walked on the pier then along the board walk to Venice Beach (5km). Lunch in a cute cafe.

Loved the arcade, we changed a 20 bill into 80 quarters and had a blast! Driving games, bowling games, coin moving games, tickets coming at us and we walked away with a small bouncy ball but loved it.The pier was fun, but as we had been to theme parks all week we didn't need to go on the rides.It was Labour Day so very busy but well worth the trip

column2: Park at 3rd Street structures and walk here
column3: The pier is good to stroll but you don't want to spend too much time there unless you're going to fish or sit on a couple rides. The food and casual walking is best done on 3rd Street Promenade. The Pier is good for some coastal photo ops and selfies. Other than that, you won't get much out of it. You can however, walk down to the beach from the Pier and hit the water or layout (if you come prepared for a beach day). It's your typical old school pier and that's it.
Dirty, worn down and not as nice as in the movies. At bit expensive. No need to go here unless you want to take pretty picture.

Other than a nice place to have an evening stroll, it is disappointing. Several vendors with different wares (your name written on a grain of rice, etc). Standard T-shirt and cap vendors. An abundance of fast food. A couple of street musicians.

Whether you're going to drop a fortune and go for a ride, stroll up and down and enjoy the sights, sounds and buskers or grab a bite the pier is a treat. Mid afternoon is a quiet time as the place comes alive at night. If you're going to be there for less than 3 hours go right up and park on the pier. Longer? Drive over to 2nd ave. The city parking lot is only $7 flat rate and it's a short walk.Make sure to go to the end, climb up the stairs and get the experience from all angles. Maybe you'll luck in and see the duty seal at the end looking for treats from the fishermen.
The title about sums it up. Nothing authentic, nothing unique, nothing worthwhile going back to. Sunset/people watching might be interesting.

The Monica Pier is nothing more than a tourist trap. It appeals to teenagers who are looking to hook up. Even visitors to the US, selfie sticks in hand, find little of interest here. It is not well maintained, so there is trash everywhere. Do yourself a favor. Take a photo in front of the iconic sign at the entrance to the pier, and skip the pier itself.
Had a wedding to attend in the area and came to Santa Monica to re visit 3rd Street Promenade. It was wonderful to sit and sip a mimosa while the city bustled by.

This place is nostalgic and beautiful but it is so crowded. You almost can do nothing because of the crowd.I enjoyed just walking and then go to downtown which is exciting. The beach is good for taking pictures and walking.There are showers to wipe out the sands :) Yay!

column2: Worth Visiting if you're in LA
column3: It is certainly worth visiting if you're in LA. If you're driving you should note that there's a lot of parking space and it is decently priced. There are a lot of places to eat and just walk around and enjoy the breeze and ocean view.Worth noting that it is super busy...
Came here on two seperate days one time on a Segway from Venice beach, great selection of eateries, rides, shopping and entertainment. Fantastic place for sunset!
Don't waste any more time if you in LA go to see this great pier is fool of fun (street artist üë®‚Äçüé§, cocktail bar with a breathtaking view ecc..) very nice place all together...

The pier is like old time East Coast Summer activity. There are people everywhere, lots of things to do, tons of food and the fishing locals provide entertainment. Try the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier for margaritas and nachos.
Everyone should experience this pier at least once. So much history. A fun walk with the family. Great local talent.

The Pier is a collection of all your favorite snacks, carnival games, and theme park rides. While incredibly family friendly, it can also be a fun date spot just to help make you feel like a kid again. Even if you're not a big fan of rides the Ferris Wheel is a must. With the glorious view of Santa Monica and the ocean you'll truly be in awe. The best time to visit the pier and ride the Ferris wheel is the afternoon, and sunset. Make sure to come on through after a day of exploring the 3rd Street Promenade as well.
We spent an afternoon here while visiting Santa Monica and we had a great time. We purchased the unlimited ride band for our 7 year old which cost $17 and she loved it.
Loved the pier its so busy with lots going on.Bubba Gump has a great wee shop with cheap gifts to buy

Great and enjoyable place. We spent about an hour here just walking around and taking photos. Unique place! Parking was reasonable at $3, per hour. Several places to eat and several attractions offers. Beautiful views of the surrounding areas from the pier.

column2: If you have lots of time to spare, go here!
column3: Santa Monica Pier is very lively! I had an amazing time here. My boyfriend and I spent about 4 hours just around the area, we played games, ate a lot lol, watched the people swimming, we also enjoyed the scenic view of the ocean. You can do a lot of things here, as well as ride the Ferris wheel and other rides that the pier has.

As I'm sure Santa Monica Pier gets extremely croweded with tourist as most places in the area do. I decided to go early Saturday morning around 9 am. It turns out I was able to get there with minimal traffic and was able to find a decent parking spot. I. Most stores were still opening up but I was happy that it wasn't crowed. The views were great with out the shadow of someone's selfie stick. I was able to get my souvenirs with no lines and was able to sit on a bench with my breakfast and look out into the water with no one around. It did seem Coffee Bean was the only place that had breakfast besides the larger restaurant at the end of the pier. I then went down to the beach which there were a few people but nothing crazy. I was able to lay my towel out right infront of the water.I suggest going early for a quieter experience! I had a great morning!

We looked forward to our visit to Santa Monica Pier, as it seemed like one of those iconic places in songs, movies and television.To be honest, we were a bit underwhelmed on the day that we visited; admittedly an Autumn weekday during school time and the weather was not great. It was disappointing that the rides were closed. One of the park attendants, kindly agreed to start up the roller-coaster so that the boys could enjoy it, which I thought was very generous. However, a lot of the restaurants and cart-shops were shut, and we were VERY disappointed by the aquarium.In any case, we decided not to judge it on one visit, so we came back on a different evening.WOW, it could not have been more different!The place was buzzing, the general vibe was more festive, and everything was open. I'd never tried funnel cake, and it was an instant favourite with everyone. (especially in the cold weather.)We left with a much better impression... we'll probably go back on our next visit to LA, but definitely in the evening only.One word of warning, there's a pretty steep hill leading up out of the pier... my elderly father and mother-in-law had to stop a couple of times to rest. (They have some mobility issues).

Santa Monica pier was good to see, can tick it off the list. It is iconic. The pier had lots of people in a good way. The gift shops are average but the atmosphere was relaxing even with the crowd. They have a coffee shop, bubba gump shrimp, rides for the kids. Sunset was beautiful.Worth a look!

I've been up and down the west coast shoreline from Washington state to San Diego and so far this beach is my favorite. If your looking for remote getaway this isn't it. Its live here people moving all directions. Come prepared with a beach umbrella and water.
Great place to walk around and enjoy the view! It's great for families, couples and even a solo trip! You can just walk around the Pier, dine, shop, go to the rides or simply walk around the beach!

column2: If you've got the time why not go
column3: Beautiful spot, the ocean is beautiful and the pier is full of over priced little touristy things. It's not a must do but it defiantly do it if you've got some spare time to kill. Super close to shops if you wanted to hit up some classic clothing stores after and the food around it is pretty great too.

Got to park right on the pier! Parking was very reasonable. Fun to walk down to the end of the pier. The ferris wheel was huge! The vendors were not in your face. There were entertainers singing and playing instruments, but they weren't pushy about collecting money.
Everyone has seen the SMP in a movie or TV show. It was great to see it up close. Lots of vendors, perfirmers, rides and of course food...definitely need to stop here as part of your trip to LA

The view of ocean from here is wonderful. There is a beach just beside it and good street shopping is available. Food is also available. The pacific park is good for children to enjoy with rides. BEWARE of snatchers.
This area is the worst of Santa Monica. Urinated places of homeless people as well as the main Shopping Promenade of Santa Monica.
Great place to go on weekends. The pier is charming with great views on both sides. Good boardwalk food and shops. Try Big Deans across the street
Busy, packed with tourists like us. Silly souvenirs and general tat. Just how it should be. Definitely worth a visit- a nice evening stroll Lovely view of sunset

column2: Lots to do and see on the pier!
column3: Many activities available on the pier. Many performers and artist willing to work for tips!They have different rides available as well. You can get a really cute picture on the pier with the mountains in the background.There is a yummy churro stand that one should check out!Parking seemed difficult to get to on the pier but you can park along the city streets and walk to the pier.

We went to the pier on a hot day. The breeze coming off the ocean cooled it to a comfortable temperature. It was a look at what California is imagined as: impromptu band, a man dancing wildly, fishermen fishing shark, beggars, men sculpting and people walking and watching.

What a lively place, and with that famous sign over the entrance. It's a real tourist attraction and a must see if you are in the area. the pier has attractions and restaurants aplenty. It reminds me of Brighton pier, or some such place in England (but with better weather!). The beach along the Santa Monica coastline is long, flat and beautifully kept. There is a cycling/jogging track all the way along as well for general use. It is so beautiful there, the Pacific looks absolutely stunning.

We traveled Route 66 all the way from Illinois. A welcome sight to see the Santa Monica Pier at the end of the road. It's an American icon. Old boards large enough to hold a small amusement park, small self parking lot, and lots of eateries and gift shops. Fun place to watch the ocean, people swimming and enjoying the beach. A festive place. More parking available off Ocean Ave nearby.
There is some old charm about the pier and worth the visit but food available at smaller food places poor quality. Great for families spending a day out

column2: Old Fashioned Pier with Carnival Games
column3: The SM Pier is not worth a trip only to see the Pier, but if you are already visiting Santa Monica, it's probably worth taking a look at. But, don't go on the weekends, it's really just too crowded. I like the bumper cars and the view from the end of the Pier. I used to play beach volleyball on the sand courts right next to the Pier and listen to the free concerts while playing volleyball, which was a terrific experience! Exercise and free entertainment at the same time.The Pier itself isn't that great, and of course, there's the homeless problem in Santa Monica which doesn't help the Pier's attractiveness. If you are visiting the Third Street Promenade, you might as well walk over to the Pier, too, and check it out.
Love this place. Excellent and tipical from here. Far from city. I recomended To wear sunscreen. Parking available

For someone like me that has a 6 years old, I'm always looking for ways to make the trip fun for her. This place has all much activities that my daughter didn't want to leave. They make your money worth. The rides let you do the rides twice so that was nice. We bought the unlimited rides for my daughter and it was worth it. Nice setting, very romantic, reminds me of back home

The pier is iconic so it's reason enough to visit but there isn't a lot to do there. A few restaurants on the pier itself, a lot of little popup stands selling souvenirs, and the amusement park... do take a ride on the ferris wheel. The pier is also filled with people fishing off of all 3 sides. The beaches go on forever on either side with an icredible view for miles. IF you plan to hit the beach give yourself most of the day.

Incredibly busy when we visited which was on the Sunday before labour day. Packed with people and hard to find a good spot. Had to buy a sun umbrella but don't pay more than $10, prices start at $15 but can definitely go to $8. Water here is cool and the waves awesome but the water is dirty. May be due to the amount of people in such a small area but it wasn't crystal by any means. A good place to see if you're around the area but I would avoid public holidays. Also, the water is quite a walk from the parking so be aware of that. Final point is there is only one set of showers to wash the sand off you. The queue was unreal. They need to fix this.

Loved being on the pier - it was a little windy but that actually helped lower the heat. There was entertainment, seal sightings, Ferris wheel rides and loads of people watching opportunities. A fun day out for families, couples and friend groups

column2: A beautiful day on the SM Pier!
column3: I am a lifelong resident of Santa Monica and rode the Ferris Wheel for the first time - oh what fun! The ride operators were so nice and the view - stunning. Dinner at the Lobster was delicious.
Must do!! We visited on the day we arrived and were not disappointed. The Mexican restaurant at the end has good food and beer and is not too expensive. A must do US experience.

Great place to walk around even for the people watching. We tried a couple restaurants, the roller coaster and walked along the pier and the beach. I'd go back for sure. The parking was fairly reasonable as well: $3/ hr up to a max of $15.

column2: Everyone should visit at least once in theif life
column3: Great park experience right on the water. Really fantastic for kids and teens alike. Rollercoaster actually extends out into the water...huge ferris wheel, plenty to eat and drink for everyone. Walkable from the bike path, easy access to the town and hotels. It's a great way to spend a couple of hours with or without kids.
Enjoyed visiting this historic land mark. The view from the Ferris wheel is well worth the ticket price.

column2: A place to be at sunset !
column3: Great place for sunset. Otherwise it is noisy and crowded, especially on weekends and holidays, but it is the End of Route 66, so it is a place to visit !!!

Really fun place to visit with kids. Rides are pricey for what they are but I completely understand the cost given the location. The beach was very fun and dynamic: lots of people, kids, and surfers. Definitely worth experiencing.

What a fantastic place , you can park at 4th street and it's a short walk to the pier . The atmosphere is fab lots of things to do and seeThe Ferris wheel at Pacific park is a must do the views are amazingThe coffee house on the pier serves good coffee. If your patient and look into the sea we saw dolphins and sealsThe beach is really nice but be careful the breeze makes it feel cooler than it is don't get burntA must do if you are visiting LA
Pier and boardwalk is a great feature to Santa Monica but the Pier is too touristy and crowded. Bad food and cheap tourist trinkets cover the Pier. Homeless are plentiful.

Always something to do and see, this pier offers many fantastic restaurants a great roller coaster, and views of Santa Monica beach, many tourists and locals come to the pier to sit at the bench or walk around.
Typical pier activities / amusements, chain restaurants and takeaways, musicians, fishermen. Excellent views of the sunset.

Was a fun place to visit, great that it was open late at night.Unfortunately they don't let single riders on the ferris wheel, which is a pity as a great way to see santa Monica and why I ubered there from Venice. Fortunately a lovely family split their group so I could ride with one of them, was great to meet such friendly kind locals.Roller coaster was fun even though old school.Pier burger was delicious!Great fishing from the end of the pier and fish cleaning stations available.Good buskers and fun vibes.Avoid bubba Gump shrimp, very rude and poor service.

Good to walk around near sunset if you are not a beach-goer. It gets quick crowded to look for parking spaces and eatery around that time. Sea breezes from the Pacific Ocean is always nice for everybody.

We visited prior to doing s 6 hour tour of L.A and then returned to pier at 6pm (on a Saturday) after tour had finished but you couldn't move so we didn't stay. Fab seeing a sign on the pier to note the end of Route 66!! Lots to do but very busy.

This is a nice place to visit if you are nearby. It's a lovely old-fashioned pier with an arcade, rides, and places to eat. Yes, Bubba Gump's has made its way in, as other modern places, but it still overall has the look and feel of the past.

We got to the pier a. It late for our overpriced burgers and chips.Locals where out and all you could smell was pot.I don't mind this but just saying!People where fishing off the end and plenty of different food and stall to choose from all priced to suit a tourist.
went to the pier on a hot day good vibes everyone happy the sea breeze was kooling heaps to see and do nice places to eat and theres a big wheel to ride on would take kids there all the time
We went there twice to visit but just too crowded to even walk out on it. The street entertainment was great but that is the only positive. beach itself was crowded, hard to walk and enjoy

I thought there would be a lot more restaurants and cute shops. Very disappointing! I'm sure the arcade and amusement park are nice if you have kids. I was looking for more of the San Francisco Pier 39 experience. Not worth the $12 parking fee.
I am driving route 66 backwards, so had to visit this iconic landmark. Pretty much as I expected. Parking next to the pier was a reasonable $12
An amazing landmark of the LA coast. Big pier but a bit touristy for my liking. Still a great place to visit & to people watch. Plenty to do on the pier & nearby.

The Pier is a must do...even if you can't actually ride the attractions. It's a beautiful beach. We live close to Panama City Beach, Florida and it was an awesome experience to see such a difference between the beaches. My opinion remains that Panama City beaches are pretty hard to overcome. The white sandy shorelines along with our beautiful blue waters are mesmerizing.

The end of a perfect trip. Sorry to see it! But a must if you have just done the mother road. Your excited that your there and then the realisation that your nearly going home sinks in. Shop at the very end of the pier (the last route 66 shop ) is very good for those last minute gifts.

A fun place to have said you have visited, but the amusement rides are certainly not worth the amount charged. A 45 second "roller coaster" ride was 8.50 and didn't do much rolling.Visit, but don't plan on it being a destination.
As much as this attraction looks fun, it is a mad house filled with locals and creepy people. If you have to go get there at 5

Family of 5 spent a great day at Santa Monica Beach & Pier. Parked at lot 3, walked along seafront, sunbathed and swam. We had a late lunch/early dinner at Rusty's Surf Ranch. Service & food was excellent and ideal for us as a family that had come from the beach.

It's pretty much what it says it is . Not really much different than what we have in England . Well looked after well with some fair rides , street entertainers , food , and a great view out to sea . The big wheel is a must and gives you a lovely view up and down the coast . If you are down this what there is no reason not to have a walk around has a very tame rollercoaster that young children and adults can go on and not scare themselves to death .

Was there on a hot day on a holiday weekend. Surprisingly it wasn't horribly busy. There's plenty to see. Quite a few people selling beach umbrellas and fresh fruit. Everyone was pretty chill. Only thing that was a total turnoff were the bathrooms. They were disgustingly filthy.

Having completed Route 66, had to go on pier for obligatory photos at the sign, this is in the middle of the pier and it seemed if there were lots of successful completions as there were lots of people having photos at the sign!!! (Did not see this many on our travels!)We had a very expensive snack and drink in one of the outlets on the pier.We all agreed that it's a tourist thing for the sign to be there, and it should be at the end of the route at ocean and Lincoln intersection.
It's fun but crowded but that's to be expected. Views are beautiful and we saw seals in the water around the pylons at the end of the pier!
Crowded, expensive, overrated. A waste of time and money. I should have known better - well at least I can say "I've been there!" :-(

You haven't been in California if you haven't been in Santa Monica Pier. Totally worth it.Tip: If You're going to stay for less than 2 hours, park ON the pier. Yes, drive in with the car. If you need more than 2 hours, then the parking lot near the pier is cheaper.Stroll around, feel the vibes, and enjoy. If You're lucky you can spot a seal playing under the pier.And Don't miss the gymnastics are, 200 meters south the pier.
By far one of the tourist hot spot. It will be crowded but the views are worth it. This is the end of Route 66: another milestone.

This is a place for the tourist, there are rides and places to get things to eat, but for me, I have lived here most of my life, and i wouldn't go again, I had a visitor from out of town, so I took them

column2: So-so, but we visited at night
column3: The rides at the pier seemed very expensive for being rides aimed mostly at kids, and we had very bad phone reception so couldn't take part in any Pokemon raids (which was one of the reasons my friend brought us here). However the views from the ferris wheel were spectacular even at night, and the other guests seemed to be having fun on the other rides. The games arcade looked fun but we didn't have any cash to spend on the games unfortunately. Plus the end of the historic route 66 is here!
I have friends that live right across from the pier. It stays crowded.till closing any night. A great adventure for family n wheel chair friendly. .
Kids will love the pier with all its rides. Seemed kinda cheesy and very crowded to me. Probably worth tolerating for your kids sake.

Must see the end of the original route 66. Touristy as expected and parking can be a nightmare, but worth walking around the pier to experience the westernmost point of route 66. Filled with the usual types of vendors but fun to spend an afternoon. there are amusement rides if children are involved.

It is lovely to come here all time around, but in the evening the atmosphere is especially great. It is fairly small but plenty to do and to shop. The restaurants are too expensive and we decided to go into town instead, but otherwise this is a must do!

column2: All roads lead to the Pier
column3: We caught Lyft to get from Downtown LA to Santa Monica Pier and it was a beautiful day to hit the beach. The Pier offers beautiful views of the ocean and Malibu. The iconic pier is a delight to stroll around and loads of fun. We sipped on cherry icee's while watching the rides and the beautiful ocean before taking a (long) walk to Venice Beach.

Lovely pier full of charm. Very busy on weekends. I felt it was too crowded. Lots of food stalls, free entertainment, carnival rides and eateries. Good ocean views and beach views. We ate on the main road with views of the pier where it was much quieter and had lovely local restaurants with tasty food.

column2: Excellent Day at the Beach Whenever Visiting Los Angeles
column3: Santa Monica is a small community located within 8 miles (13 km.) from Los Angeles. Santa Monica itself is a small (only 8.5 sq. mi.) trendy seaside community, that is an excellent option for dining and recreation whenever visiting the Los Angeles area. The beach is spectacular.The Santa Monica Pier is over 100 years old and it's located right on Santa Monica State Beach where you can find plenty of food and activities. The pier has plenty of restaurants, bars, carnival style foods (like ice cream, funnel cakes etc.). It offers outdoor summer activities, music concerts, arcade, and an amusement park with a carrousel and a large ferris wheel. Different tours can also be booked as several tour operators are available in the area. Segway and electric bicycle tours and rentals are also available. Locals tend to roller skate, cycle, jog or walk the general area since Santa Monica is relatively small. You can also enjoy a day at the Santa Monica State Beach. I also found out that the pier is located at the very end of Route 66 and interestingly, the character of Popeye was inspired by a local Sailor. You can read his story and see an actual picture of him. I enjoyed my day and hope you do too.

We had a lot of fun and ate very tasty ice cream. For dinner we ate at the famous "Bubba Gump" and I was a little bit disappointed. We ate hamburgers and Cesar salad which wasn't the tastiest dinner we had eaten. But maybe the shrimp dishes are better. Over all it was a nice experience and we would like to go back.

This place is better in the evening if you ask me. The Ferris wheel lit up against the coast is a sight to see. There's restaurants and carnival rides. Vendors and performers lined up against the pier. An LA must see, and great for tourists.

I didn't think I would enjoy myself at the Pier thinking it was just dinky rides and large crowds. That was until my boyfriend brought me into the arcade to play "a few" games. $10 worth of quarters turned into another $5, then another $5, oh hell I'm having fun let's throw in another $10. It was worth every penny.My only complaints were that some of the games being very old, were eating quarters and not recognizing that you'd paid. A few also seemed to not be working properly. Also, as is typical, the prizes you receive for your tickets are pretty dumb. We opted to trade ours in for candy instead.I had such a wonderful time, i will definitely come back.

Santa Monica is that place that you always saw on TV, so its 'skyline' its already known.However, it worth a visit.It's nice to see the sunset from the beach of the fair, but it's nice to know that, usually, is especially overcrowded.There are several attractions and places to lunch and dinner.Parking close to the pier, or crossing the avenue, there are car parks for a fee as well.Nice for adults but, especially, for children and toddler.In my opinion, a little bit old fashioned, but this is part of this pier too.
Great fun pier. Rides will never challenge those of a big theme park, but for $20 unlimited rides, plenty of rides and great couple of hours can be spent here
Great day out for visitors to LA hire a bike across pier good fun. Sand on the beach nice, soft and pebble free which is bonus m.

It's nice but not nearly as nice as other piers I've visited, for example pier 39 in San Francisco is much much nicer. We went there at midday, quite packed and returned in the night since our hotel gave us free tickets for the Ferris wheel. Much more enjoyable! But not nice enough to stay for dinner. All in all, I would recommend a short visit!
Whether you are looking to ride a ferris wheel, watch the entertainers, grab a bite to eat, stroll through the shops, or just people watch.....you can do it all here.
The santa monica pier is very nice and it has an excellent view! It is full of people but it is pleasant to go and walk around!

column2: Nice place on the beach side
column3: Drive to Santa Monica pier car parking, lot's of parking available for $12 per day.A place with lots of activity, shops, restaurant, artists.Nice view to the beach and the pier is nice setup.Weekend lot's of people. But fun with all the activities.Some great young bands were there.
There were lots of people, food, and amazing street performers. One visit is enough. Unless you're really into packed destinations.
Visiting the Santa Monica Pier is a must every time you're in Los Angeles. There's lots of fun activities, the view is great and there's a playing arcade as well.
Absolutely terrible; just made for taking money from the tourists..dirty place! overfilled not only with tourists but homeless people.

A really cool pier to relax eat and enjoy the view. Even though it can get really crowded it's an amazing experience.The pier features a lot of attractions like the park with it's rolercoaster and many other things. Souvenirs can also be bought all over the pier.Must see for everyone in every age category!

We had visited Santa Monica many times before and never the Pier. This time it was on my list to do. We parked at least a couple of miles away and walked there which provides people watching at its best! At the Pier we played several of the carnival games, ate at the foody hot dog stand - yummy! And watched the boardwalk show with my husband a "white tall man" (term used at the show ) getting selected out of the crowd to dance. It was a good show using racial slurs to exemplify how easily people judge based on color of the skin & national origin. It was well done and ended on a good note! It was a great afternoon!

column2: A little touristy for a local
column3: Fun to see and take pictures but sooo busy and too touristy for locals, especially on the weekend. We brought our bikes and rode down the coast and enjoyed some drinks on Venice boardwalk and ate breakfast on Abbot Kinney Blvd. The crowd in Venice is a bit mature for young family.

column2: A must visit in Los Angeles
column3: Quite a scenic 75 minutes public transportation from Hollywood Boulevard, worth the trip to experience a totally different and breezy atmosphere. Nice selection of caf√©s and bars, and a relaxing walk on the promenade
For us this was then end of an epic road trip along route 66.The pier is lively and vibrant.Sunset is great to watch from the Pier.Doesn't disappoint and worth a visit.

Walked down from our hotel enjoyed walking down the beach and pier. On the pier there were several performers which were fun the watch. At the end there were some bleachers where you could watch the sea and let the world go by. So. E food options on the pier but we didn't eat here.

My family and I were exploring while on vacation and we stumbled across the Santa Monica pier. We have never been to California and we found this on accident. We all loved it . There were interesting people and events going on with plenty of food options as well. There was also cool little shops everywhere. Even though it was packed there were still places to sit and hang out by . We even saw a seal at the end of the pier. My teenage kids really enjoyed this place. There were some great areas for photos too . Place is clean and has restrooms available. One of the highlights on our trip so far . Would definitely recommend and return too .

column2: Iconic but full of religious zealots
column3: It's a great location and a must see at the end of Route 66. Very popular but rather spoiled by megaphone weilding zealots proclaiming the rapture and/or intoning sinners to repent before it's too late..

It is a fun place to walk and people watch. Typical souvenir shops. There is a Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier and Bubba Gump Shrimp at the beginning. I was amazed at how big the actual beach was.

column2: End of the Line for Historic Route 66
column3: Great place to spend the afternoon. It is the end of historic Route 66 and there are a few signs commemorating this - plenty of people taking photos with the sign. There are things like a carousel and mini amusement park which seemed to be popular with families with kids but it's a great place to people watch and just spend the afternoon enjoying the sun. Amazing that this beach is literally minutes away from downtown Santa Monica and a Metro train ride away from downtown LA - it has a much more laid back atmosphere.

The pier is kind of a mix bag. You have performers and musicians, fishermen, carnival like area for kids, and some restaurants. It has a bit of a nostalgic feel, something from a simpler time or maybe it just reflects all the movies and tv shows it has been part of.The best part for me was just walking through and taking in the sights, including catching a glimpse of a young seal below in the water.
Amazing, wonderful, nothing like itWhen weather too hot it was cold thereJust seat watch solo shows and enjoy
That's amazing: GTA is the same. It's a good place to visit. Santa Monica in general in my opinion is the best city in CA. I would like to go there to live! I reccomend to you
The Pier is OK. Not amazing, not terribly bad. There are many places worth visiting in LA - not this one. Go to Redondo Beach Pier instead. The beach next to it is dirty though.
Sunset at the beach alongside the pier is a beautiful experience, seagulls and the fresh breeze, the high palm trees, the California vibe in all it's expression
Beautiful place to visit with family or alone. Parking can be challenging, my recommendation is to park in one of the parking garages and walk to pier. Bring your c√°mara!

My eyes opened so wide when I saw this pier.The long,wide,beach by the pier leaves you astonish.The Pacific ocean opens wide in its glory.Owesome place to visit with families and friends,Enjoy the rides and games at pacific park,while you are there.Worth visiting!
Lovely place, very friendly, clean, nice breeze, full of lights after sunset, childlike fun, nice pictures can be taken as well. Must see visiting California. Cool atmosphere!
Lots going on here. A really energetic place where you can hire bikes and ride down the beach path to Venice beach. A great day out

Lots of fun to be had here, our teenagers enjoyed the attractions on the pier, (my wallet didn't!). The amenities are well kept and the shops provide everything you need for a day at the nearby beach. Definitely recommend.
Definitely a tourist trap, but then again, if you are here at the right time, the view can be stunning and magical. Parking is another story all together.
I think the ferris wheel on this beach is a must do. Very busy beach and it was busy at night time as well. We ate at Albright restaurant and the food is great and fresh!

Whether you like to shop, see nature- Aquarium, listen to music, go on rides in the fair, go fishing, go for a stroll, see and sit close to the ocean - it's all here waiting for you. If you go in the night you'll see it all lit up... Various places to park at the pier or close by- perhaps see that on-line

column2: Worth a visit if you're there
column3: Certainly if you're going to Santa Monica beach you should checkout the pier.There are some rides & stalls which are fun for a walk around, and fortunately the cafes around Santa Monica are within walking distance.
Been there done that, seen it bought the T-shirt. Parking can be problematic, but accessible. Lots of buskers and entertainment (Ferris wheel, roller coaster ect). If in Santa Monica visit it once.
The place is very busy and beautiful at night. The parking is terrible and you can spend a huge amount of time looking for a parking place.

We love the pier. We bought day tickets and they proved great value for money. We spent most of the day there, headed in to Santa Monica for dinner, then continued the fun in the evening until late. Its a great atmosphere, fantastic setting and a real fun day out
It's a shame that this place can't get cleaned up. Amazing potential to be a family destination but it's full of derelicts and is so filthy.
Overpriced chain food and crowds of tourists. Everytime we come here it's hazy and the waters choppy but great place to people watch.

Perhaps mark train was correct whe he offered "take a long walk along a short pier"There are some great restaurants and fun things to do on Santa Monica pier. But the rides at palisades amusement park are the reason most people come to the pier. When my boys were three years old -- I bought them annual passses and took them to the pier every day for a year. They really loved it. I only wish it opened earlier. 11am is too late for a family with young kids that get up at 5:30am.

column2: Great place to spend the day
column3: The Pier provides everything to make it the perfect spot to enjoy the day. The beach is beautiful to just sit and relax or swim. The pier is loaded with entertainment for all ages. Kids have an amusement ride area, plenty of shopping and great local entertainment for adults from musicians to artisians and even psychics. The mexican restaurant at the end of the pier is great for dinner.

We spent the afternoon at the pier and beach. While the pier was OK, the beach was disappointingly dirty with broken glass on it!Within a stone's throw from the pier you would not expect that level of unsafe filth.That said, the shopping mall area is very classy and well appointed.

We spent three hours on the beach and the kids had a lot of fun playing in the water. Lots of seagulls on the beach and it is fun to see the kids trying to chase them away. Lots of people on the beach and plenty of public parking is available. You do not have to pay parking fees after 7PM local time. Kids will like the Coaster ride on the pier!

Every single day is a good day to visit the pier. Parking is tough and traffic around there is busy but you can easily overcome that. Park at the 3rd street Promenade and walk over, take the new Metro Expo line from anywhere east of Santa Monica or take the Blue Bus.The pier has an amusement park that is fun for all ages and has a nice selection of rides for young kids. The arcade is perfect for teens. Fast Food is plentiful but there is a shortage of places to sit and eat. You're better off walking out to the food trucks and sitting on the lawn on Ocean Ave and enjoying the view.We take all our out of town guests here. Early mornings are less busy (pier opens at 10am). Evenings are packed.Take a jacket for the evenings.Take a hat or sum protection for a day time visit.

Great place to go for a walk and feel the ocean. It can get very very crowded on summer months so it won't be that great relax time at the beach, but you get to see a lot of people and performers around so.. you can still have a good time.

column2: Do it to say you've done it
column3: The rides are about $9 each, but they're not good enough to buy a wristband so.... If you have the family, pick one, cough up your $50 and be done with it. Typical pier-fare; trinkets, funnel cakes, musicians, and people. Lots and lots of people. Tough to find parking if you get there after noon. ALso traffic is awful in the afternoon and evening.
We spent a couple of hours on the beach, the sand is sooo soft! The kids loved being in the water and the fairground kept thementertained for a while.

column2: Cool place to while away a couple of hours...
column3: Iconic Californian location. The start, or finish (depending on your perspective) of the historic Route 66.Plenty of activity from street performers to religious zealots spreading the word. Choice of tourist attractions and places to eat.
Standard pier, probably good for small kids due to rides. Great for a photo from the beach but that's about it.

column2: Iconic but too busy and cheesy
column3: Maybe I was expecting something better, especially because I had been at Disneyland the day before. I just felt it was cheap and cheesy. We did go on a Saturday, so I figured it would be crowded.I am glad that we went because it is an iconic place and I had wanted to see it. Palisades Park was nice, and we walked along 3rd St Promenade as well.I recommend stopping simply because it is so well-known!
Not hugely different to a lot of seaside piers around the world. More hawkers maybe but the food, rides etc are pretty standard. Worth a visit but nothing special.

Spent a couple of hours here and enjoyed the buzz. There are a few buskers singing their songs which added to the atmosphere. The rides were typical fun fair style. Only did the mini rollercoaster (actually better than Harry Potter's flight of the hippogriff at Universal, and it's longer without the 60 min wait, here it's 5 mins!) and the swinging boat and both were fun.Good snack choices too. Gets super busy at night, which I believe creates the happy ambience all round.

column2: Great options but very very busy!!!
column3: Weekends are mobbed but lots of fun to be had here! Rides for little ones and the bigger ones and lots of food and sweet options. We are waiting for a quieter day !

Yes, its fun. The rides are pretty cool. There is a roller coaster and a ferris wheel and some arcades and carnival type themes. There is also a Bubba Gump restaurant and of course the beach steps away.The characters at night are a little shady at the park around the entrance but their is a good police presence at all times. Parking is also available on the pier.It gets very crowded weekends and summers
This is a fun place with lots of food options and walkable. It is an amusement park and is so colorful at night.
This is a great place to stop by with the kids. Awesome views out to Venice beach. For the adults the Ferris wheel is a bucket list item we loved it
Love the pier! There are more attractions today - including the ferris wheel which gives you a full view of the SM Bay. Very fun evening for our family!

It was a busy evening but fun nonetheless. Some odd characters can be found there doing odd things for money. But, it's fun in its own way and the views are great. I wouldn't pay to eat there but it's an experience if you're into that. We walked from there to the other end o Venice boardwalk and it was a great walk!

My dad and I walked along the pedestrian path in between he bike path and beach taking in the sights to the pier. We didn't do any of the carnival rides, but did enjoy live music on the pier and watching all the athletic men and women show off their strength at muscle beach. It was a pleasant way to spend an afternoon. Our only regret was not renting bikes to ride along the beach.

Stopped at the pier while on the way to LAX for last minute fun, before taking my 3 Grandaughters to LAX to fly home. It was fun, but alittle expensive for the rides. $8.50 per ride or $17.50 for a all day pass, if you have the time to spend. The arcade was definitely a hit.

Visited this on a day trip during our travels. A bit disappointed with pier as only contained a few tacky shops and some restaurants. There was a fun fair so if you have young children they may enjoy it.
Loved this quaint fairground, My daughter and husband got the wristbands for unlimited rides and had a great time, lots of food outlets there too

After visiting on business I knew I had to bring the family next time I came back to LA. We arrived late afternoon when the place was buzzing with atmosphere. And just headed to the end of the boardwalk to sit and watch the street performers and stare out to sea.. you know you are then on holiday...

column2: Still a classic spot to visit
column3: The whole area just brings a smile to the face. Do you see homeless people? Yes. But admit to yourself, if you were homeless, this is where you want to be.. Great views of the ocean, quirky merchandise, sun was shining, it was a great spot to spend some time.. Classic Americana.

Cool place with lots to see and do! Isn't free from the shadyness that surrounds the area though, and walking to our hotel afterwards felt pretty unsafe, even at fairly early hours.Liked the arcade, the rollercoaster and the view from the tip of the pier.
A great place for strolling around and people watching. Music and shops and entertainment all day. We enjoyed spending the day here.

Visited twice once at night and once on a lovely sunny day. At night is great when all the rides are lit up and also it's a bit cooler however I'd say its more busy at night than in the day. There's restaurants, fast food places, sweet stalls and other little stands. People fish at the end of the pier and if you're lucky you will see a heron or two sitting perched on the side. Nice place to spend an hour or two although if you go too early most places wont be open.

Our family spent 8 days and 7 nights visiting the greater LA area and the Santa Monica Pier was one of the first stops. While most of the pier was . . . pretty disappointing, the END of the pier - with those views of the sunset - are worth it.
This is a nice place to spend a few hours at. Nice atmosphere with amusements and vendors. It's similar to coney Island.

column2: A Perfect Place to go for a vacation.
column3: If you decide to take a trip to LA, you have to take the time to drive to Santa Monica and go to the Santa Monica Pier. There is something for everyone - young/ old and young at heart. Great views, arcade for kids and teens, different kinds of food, a merry go round, beach, playground and you can go fishing too. They have everything. You can spend at least half a day here. Make sure you try the Japadog - Japanese style hot dog. Celebrity chefs like Giada and Anthony Bourdain have tried them. Parking is not a problem. Public parking costs $17.95 for the day and it's free for the first 90 mins. Don't forget the bathing suits -- you won't be able to resist the beach.

Everything is great, ice cream! View of the Pacific! Rides for children! and Shrimp Galore!Exotic drinks. One of the best beaches in the country. But there are plenty of people!It is very pretty. One of the less costly activities in pricey Santa Monica!

What a beautiful happy place this pier is. A very chilled walk along where you could listen to the street singers or just get lost in your own little world. Lots of street side eateries on the way down and back up the other side. Just a really nice place to be at.
It was my first time going to be a beach and this place was a wonder! So pretty and just amazing. I had a great time there ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Santa Monica is so busy, and the Pier is the centre of everything that happens. You have got restaurants, bars, gift shops, arcades, stalls, line music, amusement parks al in the one place as well as the stunning beach views and at sunset the views out towards Malibu from here are unbelievable.Everything is expensive on the Pier and you can eat, drink and make merry up in the town long into the night.Ton Hanks sprung to mind on a couple of occasions as Zoltar (from Big) is still there and this is where Forrest Gump turns around after running across America!Went down a few times to the Pier so loved the busyness and the bussle of it all.You don't need to walk down the ramp to get to it, it is accessible from the beach path but the view you have in front of you as you go down from the promenade is amazing, especially at night.

With 10 hours spare in LA we took a taxi to Santa Monica, OMG this place is terrible, a Sea Front town that has a terrible homeless issue. The Pier its self was dirty and needed modernizing, the rides do not open until 10am, the public toilet are the worste I have seen, excrement and paper every where, and a general smell of urine in locations.If you have spare time do not visit this location. Wish we had just stayed in the airport

Santa Monica Pier is such a treat. It's location is second to none in California and it provide a great day of fun making you feel like a kid again. The rides are fun for the little ones and the area has the feel of an old style carnival. The food is what you would expect in this setting and the Pier is landmark that must be visited.

Great place to visit. Tons of shopping, great restaurants, good viewpoint for photos of the beach and mountains, amusement park. Also, a great farmers market. We stayed in Hollywood, but wished we had stayed in Santa Monica instead. It is definitely worth a visit!

column2: Looking for the land of movies üé•
column3: A typical place where all has been touched by a camera. You see the movies eating your path and dizzily catching you in as a star for a day. For families, couples, alone walkers, fans, old child, sneakers, speakers, slickers, sinkers, smothered, s people in this case. S=Starz of the daily life. U got it?
beautiful views, nice eateries though a bit crowded, nice view of the sunset, couple of rides that you can try( i didn't) fishing here is quite good if you want a good catch

column2: Must visit if you are in LA
column3: Food, fun, and the ocean! I love this place! I've been here multiple times and always enjoy walking around the shops and restaurants. Parking below the pier is $12 and only accepts cash so come prepared.

I only come here for guests, but I think it is a good staple for guest itinerary. It'd really be 3 1/2 stars for the delight santa monica pier gives movie lovers. Kids seem to love the rides and junk food :) Parking looked a mess, so we walked.

The pier is a must visit when in the Santa Monica area. There are places to grab a bite to eat, there's Pacific Park amusement park, and there are a number of tours that leave from here for various things like stars homes, downtown LA, etc.Pacific park was fun, but would be better suited for younger kids (say 10yo or less). My 14 yo teens were only interested in three rides, the West Coaster, Pacific (Ferris) Wheel and the Sea Dragon. There are the usual carnival games, popcorn/candy carts, etc. It's not an all day park, maybe only a couple hours if that.

So this place only gets an average rating from me... I know its a iconic landmark, but seriously... its way better in the movies.Granted, when I visited it was packed with people and thats a negative for me regardless of the location...but expensive parking, overpriced food, condescending street preachers, and people peddling various unneeded wares didn't add to the experience. The beach was grossly overcrowded.Is it worth a visit? Yes... but make sure to do it during the non peak season or during a weekday. If you're going for the beach, there are probably nicer options in the area.

There were big crowds and a concert on the beach but the pier was big enough for everyone to find something to enjoy. Beautiful sunset and a slight chill in the air made it worth fighting the crowds. Great people watching too!
One of my favorite places in the country, make sure to walk to the end of it and enjoy the most beautiful sunsets.
Great fun with our two 8 year olds, surprisingly clean and lines weren't too bad. I'd avoid on a weekend as it is super busy!

Gods it's awesome there. The vibe the atmosphere the people.We did it as part of a tour and loved it so much we went back twice.Watch the live shows. They are free but make sure to give Love where it's deserved.

I've been to the pier a few times and the most recent was one of the busiest due to it being summer. It's a pleasant walk if you park further down the beach and walk up. The amusement rides are fun but nothing special. There are a few restaurants along the pier but nothing I would call 5 star.
Lots of action, a good viewpoint for photos of the beach and mountains. Amusement park and food options.
A very romantic place to visit in the evening. There's a really cool atmosphere. It's worth getting on a huge wheel (although it's not very high) but it's still fun

Parked at Santa Monica beach and walked passed Muscle Beach to the pier, nice little walk and got to see the pier from a distance and up close. There is a fairground on the pier but we didn't visit it so can't comment. When we came back to the car it was 10:30pm and the pier was brightly lite up against the night sky, did look quite extraordinary.
lots of fun in the sand.. seen some sea lions.... lots of places to eat and lots of places to shop at for memories.
Very busy but had lot's happening. Enjoyed Mexician bar at end of Pier, needed beer on a hot day. Good experience.
Sea breeze, fried food, rides pop corn on a summer night. All good . Love coming here. There's something for everyone

the pier is definitely a to do in LA... its a blast.. interesting people doing stuff on beach and the pier has a amusement park.. its touristy but on weekends lots of locals go there too.. bext lunch place and value is "Albrights" right on the pier... expect tonpay for parking but oblt runs about $10-$15 for all day and then walk several blocks up street ftom pier and enjoy the promenade area in Santa Monica. Rent a bike for $20 and cycle a few minutes to Venice beach area which truly can be a spectacle... there is too much to see in LA but if you only have a few days.. these areas will make the trip for you

Didn't take any photos as was not impressed by the place .. the beach was full of homeless people .. lot of dirt on the beach and considering the drive from LA not sure i will come to to Santa Monica as its a very average place with a Pier

Its a nice walk down Santa Monica Pier lots of people though. We stopped off at the amusement park. Save you money. Everything seems a bit tired and cheesey, but I think it is more suited to the little kids rather than the big kids. Right down the end of the pier there were loads of fisherman all throwing a line in. It was great to watch because there was a few seals waiting for the catch to come up. Great views from all directions a must do when in LA
Went here to try sightsee and try the beach..kids had fun.. lots of food and shopping options if you're not prepared..

column2: Good pier with lots of activities and restaurants
column3: Really enjoyed our walk along the pier. Proper old fashioned entertainment. Loved looking at the old carousel and also the roller coaster and big wheel although didn't go on any of them.Several choices of restaurarants and generally a really good ambience. Great views aping the beach in both directions.
It's classic. Great opportunities for pictures. Always a nice breeze. Little crowded during peak season, but worth the trip.

column2: Crowded, Hot, but a great view
column3: We were here on a weekend in August, so it was roasting hot and absolutely full of people. It is well worth getting out to the end of the pier, though, where you'll find great views of the Pacific Ocean.
There were so many people it was unbelievable..... I did not care for that but it was nice to quickly walk down to the shore and back.
We took a quick visit to the pier on a trip to move my daughter from Kentucky. It was very beautiful and relaxing.
Got a chance to spend the night with a special Friend and this action packed pier made everything wonderful...

The wood planks are all over the place, a litigators heaven. This place is generally a little tired and could use some TLC.It's glory days are long gone, I hope it get some much needed attention soon. Still very much iconic, right next to Hotel California and greatly illuminated at night.The rides are expensive for what they are. The up side was the indoor carousel right by the start of the pier and also Soda Jerks for the Ice Creams, also right next to the carousel.We ate at Bubba Gumps on the pier and that wasn't great either. I don't like to give negative reviews but that's what it is im afraid.
Amusement rides , funnel cakes and souvenir shopping. A nice place ... after waking thru Venice beach ..

We visited on a Saturday and it was absolutely packed. There are some good street entertainers and it's great for Pok√©mon but it is extremely busy. We walked on to the beach for a quick paddle and I have never seen so many people on a beach in all my travels. Worth a quick visit and then head up the coast to a quieter spot.

column2: Santa Monica pier for food, beach, entertainment and Pok√©mon go
column3: You can take the train to Santa Monica. The pier is 2 blocks from the train station. The pier has a rollercoaster and arcade for kids. Restaurants, Food vendor, beach vendors who draws your picture and artist that spells your name in colorful pictures.Lots of Pok√©mon to catch. You can catch quite a bit here just walking up and down the pier. The network connection at the end of the pier is not great.Many poke stops to reload balls .

It's really lovely place if you wanna play you can go there of you don't wanna play there's also a place to go even when you see the sunset üåÖClean place and the sea over there is so beautiful üòçAlso there some pikes you can take at least 1 hour

Was a fun afternoon trip after a morning on the beach.Rides are fun but small and a few are charged extra but not too many. We used the go la card so had free entry ... worth the visit especially if using the go la card

Pros - Perfect blue sky. Lovely ocean water. Plenty of fit bodies and cute kids running around. Video arcade, amusement park, merry-go-round, and big Ferris wheel made our children very happy. And the beach is literally right there.Cons - Pricey unhealthy touristy beach food. Also, it was very crowded on the day we went. If you want to feel sand under your toes, just walk 10 minutes in either direction away from the pier and the crowd thins out.

The Pier has several eating establishments including restaurants. It has it's own Amusement Park. It has plenty of stalls and many buskers to watch/listen to. It has seating all along the sides so you can relax and enjoy the view. Very popular place. We went there every day of our trip. It's a must do in Santa Monica.

We got there at 7pm and it was perfect, You can walk in the pier, enjoy the view have dinner and enjoy the rides. I recommend to purchase the unlimited ride ticket as is more convenient. They have a section for kids under 42". They have a couple of restaurants at the beginning but they also have food stands and an comunal area to sit down and eat. We saw a lot of people at the beach when we were leaving.
It's a good place to come on a summer time , but it's busy , just come early and you can enjoy the amazing veiw üá∫üá∏

column2: A Great End To The Day
column3: We visited the Santa Monica pier after a day of walking around Hollywood and it was a nice end to the day. The sunset was beautiful and the area was lively. They had some sort of twilight concert going on as well. It was nice to hear some of the buskers as you walk along and see people just having fun dancing. You can venture into the frigid waters and there is an area to rinse off afterward. I liked that they had a boardwalk for those who done care for getting sand in their shoes. After stopping at the pier, there are numerous spots to eat in the immediate area. I found Santa Monica to be a far more enjoyable place than LA.

column2: Expensive but if you have GO LA card then it is included
column3: My kids 12 and 14 really liked the rides on the pier but the tickets are high around $34. If you have the Go LA card then you don't have to pay since it is included. Bubba Gump is pretty good place to eat but if you wait too long it can be a wait to get a table.

We were here on a Saturday and it was very crowded but we were able to eat at a restaurant on the pier with less than a 30 minute wait, let the kids ride a few rides at Paradise Park, and dip our toes in the Pacific Ocean. The beach was packed to say the least. Not many places you have the beach, shops, street performers, restaurants, amusement park rides, volleyball, fitness performers, gymnastic rings etc etc all in one location. Beautiful scenery and top attraction but go on the weekend in the summer and don't be surprised at the crowds. One of the favorite things my family enjoyed was watching the fitness buffs do their strength displays in the Muscle beach area. Very entertaining!!

Had an enjoyable stroll down a packed Santa Monica Pier on a Friday night before heading off to dinner.The imagery and references to the Santa Monica pier and area in popular songs and tv / movie culture is hard not to know so being here to see it for myself was amazing.Finding parking when arriving proved very challenging and it was a little too busy for my preferences however it was overall a good experience.A recommended must do when in LA.

We visited Santa Monica Pier twice during our recent visit to LA. It doesn't appear as crowded during the daytime. Plenty of seating areas to relax and watch the world go by. Take a picture by the iconic Route 66 sign. Place really comes alive at night-time. Worth the visit even if its only to say you have been there.
Beautiful place, the ride in Ferriswheel was awesome. It gives you a view of the ocean and beach. Very cool pier.
Beautiful to visit on a nice day. There are vendors, artists and rides. Fabulous views. There are great restaurants nearby, such as the Lobster.

Parking right next to it and not a long walk up and down the pier restaurants on the pier and fair not to expensive. Little stalls and music players filled the pier. It was also near the shopping mall and an inside carousel place which does amazing ice cream, drinks and desserts. Obviously near the beach and ideal place for picture taking.

The Pier offered amusement rides in addition to the visible ferris wheel. There are a number of restaurants with music. One on the outer end of the Pier. Plus smaller food & ice cream stands. Souvenir shopping of course. But also artists doing portraits, cartoonists and even two gentlemen sculpting faces in clay for sitting patrons. Street performers entertaining. Its a pier so there are people fishing from the far end. Caution, I did see signs saying don't eat the fish caught from this point on the pier. A seal in the water was entertaining people.

column2: Exploring Santa Monica Pier and 3rd Street Promenade
column3: We all enjoyed our experience in this area with the pier, shops, restaurants and people watching. It is worth the trip.

column2: Iconic place to visit and worth spending the day there
column3: Santa Monica is very iconic and I'm glad we visited. I had an LA Go Pass which included the rides on the pier. Great day out and worth renting a bike to head over to Venice beach. Enjoy sunbathing or walking around. I even liked the lifeguard huts/towers more than the other beaches I visited. I recommend looking up parking lots before heading over. One place up the street from Santa Monica Pier was wanting to charge $30 for the day. I googled and found one between venice beach and santa Monica pier right by the beach for $8 for the whole day.

column2: End of the line on Route 66
column3: We really did enjoy Santa Monica and were so fortunate to be staying a very short distance away on 2nd Street / Broadway. This was an ideal location to explore Santa Monica on foot and we were there for 4 days, a large part of the time spent on the pier.Yes the weather was brilliant, clear blue skies and high summer temperatures in late June and the crowds were large.There is entertainment for all and the exercise is good for everyone. We spent a lot of time at the end of the pier watching the fishermen cast their lines and land their catch. There is Pacific Park with the iconic Ferris Wheel, plenty of shops and bars and street entertainers.Note you get good views across to Malibu and south to Venice Beach.This is just such fun place to hang out which made for a very relaxing few days after driving the entire length of Route 66 from Chicago, Il, officially 2,448 miles which we added a few more on our many side trips off the Mother Road.Would readily recommend this attraction to anyone.

column2: Reminds me of Blackpool, only nicer!
column3: A great place to visit on a sunny day. Lots of souvenir stalls and places to eat. Amazing views of the Pacific Ocean and Santa Monica beach.

column2: Fun , nostalgic time for every one
column3: Spent the weekend in Santa Monica and had to go to the pier.There are a lot of rides similar to those boardwalk amusement piers along the Jersey Shore.Ferris wheel is all solar powered and is 90' high.Roller coaster and that old pirate ship that swings are among the adult rides we did.Bracelets for adults run $32.50 and $17.50 for kids for unlimited rides. or $8 per ride. It's worth the bracelet.There are also numerous restaurants, arcade games, carnival games and your great variety of odd balls all over the pier.Parking is available on the pier but costs a mint and you can only come and go at certain times.The aquarium which I did not go to is on the beach level.A must do in Santa Monica
Sunny, interesting, great people-watching spot. It just screams southern California! If you get there early parking is easy and abundant - even on a nice day.

column2: Great views and fun for kifs
column3: This is an amazing place for the kids. Not only is the view spectacular but it offers shopping and rides for the kids. Definitely worth the trip to Santa Monica Pier.
Walked the pier prior to opening and decided to hang out in the ocean ... pier didn't have much of anything on it for the price of all day bands.. Santa Cruz puts this boardwalk to shame
I really like this place cause it is typically American. Food, attractions, games, shops and Road 66. Dont't miss the sunset.

We walked down to the pier from our hotel - walked to the end - turned around and walked back. Did not do any if the rides. Touristy stands and shops are spread throughout along with musicians and such peddling their trade. There is a park near the top of the pier that was overrun with homeless folks. Sad to see. I can say I did it but will probably not go back. There are free concerts there on Thursdays nights in the summer.
The kids loved the rides. Bought the wrist bands. As long as you go on more than 5 rides it's worth it. Fun afternoon.
Great place to visit for a view of a beautiful sunset.Also lots of places to eat or grab a drink. Very clean and tidy too

Seems this is a must do. You're over the water. We walked all the way to the end of the pier and while there a giant seal came up and we took pictures before it slipped back under and left. He was looking for handout from the fisherman fishing off the pier.

column2: Everybody gets there so prepare for heavy crowds and crazy traffic
column3: This is the most visited spot in the SM City I would say. Decent breeze, noisy! But just within 15 minutes walk it gets less packed. If you want to have lunch (seafood) be there early and reserve table, sometimes one hour waiting should be expected. Make sure you try CHURROS ($ 2 for one, $ 5 for three) from latina women that sell this 'mexican donut' along the walking way towards the pier, delicious! Coffe, restaurants and fastfood are available. Free restrooms. Amusement park. Beach access with shower. Parking nearby (it's huge). I keep coming back, the air by the ocean feels much better than in DTLA.
This is simply just a pier. Nothing special about it, just exceptionally busy. The beaches either side are just beaches...
In the nighttime, it gets crowded with street performers. Its fun and it's an experience. Get a funnel cake and sit on one of the tables. Enjoy the scenery.
Nice to visit with family there is many games for the kidsTry the shrimps restaurantBut not the place for swimming , better to go down to Venice beach

I think it is a must see place. Lots for kids and family with rides & beach. The walk along the beach to many dining options is a plus. Plenty of parking if you are in a car. Hotel options are also really good.
Nice view, great fresh air, long beach, great landscape and nice restaurant. For the bold you have rollercoasters !

I really don't recommend. This pier is filled with homeless and smells like piss. Also, what really freaked me out was that this guy was just lying on the ground because he just got stabbed. I only saw this once, but it wouldn't surprise me if it happened again. After that, I really didn't feel safe.

Amazing to see the pier it looked like you've seen it on movies We were there on a Tuesday so we stayed all day at the beach and in to the evening because it was concert night So at sunset we shared the beach with 30000 other peoples and dogs

The pier is a nice place to just relax and take in the sea breeze. It's a nice place in the morning and late evening when the crowds are thinner. Decent food choices available when you get hungry. It is a very touristy place so prices do reflect that. A nice thing to do is to get an ice cream, take a seat at the end of the pier and watch the fishermen reel in their catch.
Next time I won't use a tour guide as we could see enough... but spending a whole day would have been fun.

column2: Fun place to spend an evening.
column3: Lots of hustle and bustle of people along the pier. Cool at night when the rides light up, especially the ferris wheel. Always someone playing music. Also vendors selling their wares. Fun family place.

column2: An amazing highway 101, Los Angeles Beach Must See.
column3: The Pier has been and is the center piece of beautiful, peaceful Santa Monica. Much fun for the entire family on the pier. Walk, skate, or bike the boardwalk to Venice, and or Sunset Blvd. Summer sunsets are among the best in the world.
crowded pier, every corner is busy, beach, restaurant. walking along the the wood bridge, watch people, fresh air, sunny day, but a bit cold
Movie fans shall not miss it of course, but also fun for strolling, eating or visiting the little amusement park. Beautiful scenery.
A must-see. Stroll along the wooden bridge, grab a snack or hire a bike & go for a cruise. Easy, cheap and fun. Must-see!!
We have visited this place very time we are in California and it's always a blast for the whole family!
