column2: Fun on the Santa Monica Pier
column3: Great fun place for all the family. Lots to do lots to take in. Go there and see, have fun oh and that sum lotion ...lots of.
Apart from the title itself, had an amazing time strolling around the pier. It is very mesmerising..

column2: You've gotta check it off your list
column3: It's super crowded, but kind of a must do.Great performers singing on the pier. The views are amazing!We loved the fresh fruit cart for a wonderful snack to hold us over until dinner.
Great view of the ocean from the wheel. Lots of small rides here for the kiddos as well. The coaster wasn't working during my visit.

The Santa Monica Pier is a fun place to visit with kids though it is extremely crowded. There is a variety of rides that are fun but all have long lines. The food is not very good. I recommend going there noon or before.

column2: Great day in the west coast
column3: A wonderful day spent on the Pier. Great food and great shops. Immerse yourself in the local foods treats. Some great photo ops. Spend the day.

Blown away by how cool this place is. There's something for everyone. We had dinner at one of the restaurants along the pier (I can't remember what it's called but I assume any of them are fantastic!!). Loved the performers, touristy shops, rides, everything! At night the place has the greatest atmosphere, the beach has so much sand and the rides all light up.

Couldn't come to L.A. and not visit here. It is the California of your imaginings and dreams. Classic pier location, sunshine, fun, souvenirs, eats, and Pacific Park classic theme park. Lovely views from the end of the pier back along it. We loved it!

The theme park offers a lot of different rides and games.Personly, my favourite rides are the dragon swing and the roller coaster as they are both thrilling and have short (ish) queue.Also, it is a great thing to with anyone at any age at any time of year. :)
First of all it's very very crowdy and to park near the pier parking are very expensive. We have paid 30 USD even if we have stayed there 2 hours. On the pier there is a fairground.
It's just mandatory to come here, to visit the pier and the area.It's colourful, and very very animated with games for children, music, etc.

It's a shame the weather wasn't good but we walked up and down the pier and had a great fish and chips lunch at one of the pier restaurants. Great little souvenir places in the street opposite the pier that were a bit cheaper than the pier shops.

column2: A seaside pier at the end of Route 66 WYSIWYG
column3: Very very busy, lots of typical pier stuff, the kids went on the roller coaster and had fun, good selection of bars and eateries. Lots of street vendors, cartoonists - spent a pleasant hour and a half there - it was enough

Great visit to the pier, lots to do and see, most of the vendors are not too pushy and it's a unique experience.If you're in the area you need to visit. Good food options lots of touristy stuff to see and just a generally good vibe!

It's fun tourist destination for the whole family. You can take a picture in front of the Route 66 sign. You can also find good food and fun rides. If you want you and walk from Venice Beach to the Santa Monica Pier which makes for a great outdoors adventure. You are able to walk along the coast line or you can rent a bike. Cute shops along the way as well. Highly recommend.

The Santa Monica Pier is open 365 days a year. Admission is free.Recreational and entertainment center featuring restaurants, retail establishments and amusement park.The world-famous Santa Monica Pier offers a variety of entertainment, dining and shopping experiences, including the thrill rides of Pacific Park; a historic 1922 Carousel, an old-fashioned soda fountain, and an interactive aquarium. As you stroll the Pier, enjoy lively street performers ‚Äî from musicians to artists plus fabulous vendor carts and don't miss some of the best sunsets along the California coast.Had a great time hunting Pok√©mons there.
I love the Santa Monica Pier. It is always a pleasure to amble along the Pier and take in the sights, have a drink and just watch the sunset. An absolute must do if you are in Santa Monica.

column2: A journey back in time. Fun for kids and younger teens.
column3: We had our grandkids (ages boy 12 and girl 15) with us for a day visit to the pier. We bought them day-passes so they could go on almost all the rides as much as they wanted. You can also pay for separate rides as well. There was one ride, for two-people and it swings them around upside-down - they had to pay 5 dollars a piece for - they paid this themselves and they thought it was worth the price and did it twice (this was the only ride not includes in their day-pass. There are lots of fast-food restaurants and games as well. I was glad they could experience an old-fashioned American carnival place. It was nice to walk around the pier as well. Great views - take the ferris-wheel for wonderful views. The kids enjoyed it. We liked watching them have fun! This was a journal back in time for me as I had ben here as a child. It is also used in many films and TV programs. (My entire family misses P.O.P. (Pacific Ocean Park) Which was near here in the 1960s! Sad I could not share that with them as well.)

column2: Very busy, but worth a visit if only to mark off your bucket list
column3: We visited as a family of 7 in July 2017. It was a place I had always wanted to visit and there were some parts that were great like the beautiful vintage carousel and the pier itself. Unfortunately the pier is way too over crowded to really enjoy, and the public restrooms are sadly lacking for the amount of users.The restrooms just off the pier were in such a poor state of cleanliness my daughter ( who was in dire need of a restroom) refused to use them. We were so looking forward to spending time at this world famous location, but left a little deflated by our experience.

On a hot day there is lots of fun to be had. Rollercoaster is tame but loads of fun. Ice cream everywhere and the beach is ready for you to sunbathe and swim.Be prepared for LOTS of people.It's definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.
Typical carnival plus rides for younger folk and a roller coaster, would be great for teenagers, good atmosphere with plenty of people, food options and a few buskers, views to beach.

Santa Monica Pier is a great American landmark, and with its famed arched neon entryway and amusement park jutting out into the Pacific, it's supremely picturesque as well. The pier marks the end of the famed Route 66, the Santa Monica beach on either side, an aquarium beneath, many shops, and food offerings,and the beautiful Pacific Park. The park is a small amusement park with a great couple of rides, and games but nothing to rival the much larger Coney Island or any theme park, but a wonderful slice of Americana none the less.Enjoy it

This is a historic landmark and it was cool to see as it offers amazing views of the ocean and mountains. Other than the amusement rides, there's not much here. The shops just offer tourist gear, no boutiques or specialty shops. The "entertainment" on the pier is in some cases not quite suitable for kids. Other than the view, not really a great atmosphere.
Loved this old fashioned pier. All the usual - ice cream and candy floss, souvenir shops, arcades and funfair. Lovely views too!

We spent a little time on the pier, riding the ferris wheel with gorgeous views. The teenagers did the roller coaster. As you might expect, it was a carnival atmosphere, crowded and not so clean. But a fun evening activity.

column2: Not Bad but doesn't live up to the hype
column3: Very busy even outside of holiday season. Wouldn't recommend hanging around for more than half an hour, just take some pictures and walk around a bit and you've seen most of it.

If you walk to this pier be prepared to be engulfed in a human wave of people from start to finish. It was not fun or interesting at all. The only thing I liked was the Route 66 sign on the pier that marks the end of Route 66. Very touristy. Lots of people trying to get you to part with your money.
This is a major tourist attraction but all of the shops and restaraunts are highly priced. Views are great though and you meet some real characters there.
A bit tacky but had an obligatory picture by the end of the trial sign. View from the pier is great. Couldn't find any decent places to eat tho which is a shame.

There's lots to do with arcade games, rides and a few places to eat.We went on the Ferris wheel which offered fantastic views when at the top, we also went on the rollercoaster which was also fun.Lots of parking available, usually around $12 for a full day of parking so quite reasonable

This is a must stop place in Los Angeles and the specially Santa Monica! This is Storico location offers incredible views of the beach and some of the coolest world-class sunset views you'll ever see. Stroll to the end of the Pier and enjoy drinks and lunch or dinner there. The restaurants are wonderful. You can also buy walking food on the pier. A trip to the pier would not be complete without a visit to Pacific Park which includes roller coasters and other amusement rides and games. I'm glad I took the time to visit the Santa Monica pier with my family.
Great spot to visit, clean and tidy, easily accessible with ample parking. Tourist shopping, fair ground food and rides with an ocean beach view. Beginning and or end of route 66

column2: Nice to say you've been there
column3: Nothing spectacular but it is a must for any visitors. Take the ferris wheel ride for a good view and photo opportunity.The burgers and drinks are way overpriced. Bring a drink/water with you to save $4 or more.
What a place! Amazing views and lots to do. If you are in LA a visit to the pier is a must! After all it is where they filmed Baywatch!
I can now say, been there done that.The strong smell of a certain legalized plant is overwhelming. Bathrooms disgusting, bring toliet paper for sure.This trip not necessarily needed.

column2: Clacton meets Mexico with a bit of glam.
column3: It's a Pier, and a busy one at that, a few rides which the kids enjoyed, nice view back of Santa Monica beach. Overrated in my opinion but plenty of people like cheep cheesy piers....

The Pier is a must. Great vibe and fun for entire family. The food was good, the rides, especially the ferris wheel, were great fun, and even though we didn't win at any games, we nonetheless enjoyed them.

Who new this was the end of route 66 (or beginning) fun shops fun activities fun amusement rides Crazy People just enjoying life as Sheryl Crow says in the songFun Along The Santa Monica Pier#and who can pass up the Original Hot Dog On A Stick.
So much activity and fun to be had at the pier. You can enjoy rides, food, people watching, games, or beach time.
Very crowded and pricey. Almost 50 dollars for my family of five to ride the Ferris wheel. Great views and nice memory.

This is an iconic place but not overwhelmingly special. Carnival type rides and games, and a few places to eat. The Mexican restaurant on the pier is only so-so. Offers great views of the coastline and is beautiful, and crowded, towards sundown. It's an urban attraction so be watchful of pick-pockets or people who've just had a few too many, while you enjoy. It can get cool along the coast even in the summer, so keep that in mind as you dress. The Metro Expo line station is just a few blocks away, and there are plenty of other restaurants near the pier.
Was at the beach and thought we should go to the pier. Not impressed. Nothing really to do. Only thing going for it is the views.

This was a nice way to spend part of the afternoon. It has your typical arcade, souvenir shops, and food options.We took some nice pictures, played games and didn't realize this was the end of Route 66, which was fun!!I would go again for a few hours.

The Santa Monica Pier is a nice pier and has some rides and other attractions but it doesn't offer anything truly special. It is worth a walk down if you have time to kill, but I wouldn't go too far out of your way to visit.

column2: Family vacation adult child and 10 year old
column3: Pier is large many vendors nice to see if on your bucket list. Has carnival rides on the pier. We didn't do, 10 year old not interested, lines were long. Pretty crowded for a Monday afternoon. We weren't expecting it to be cool at the end of July, it was! Bring a light jacket.

It's a tourist trap...we all know it...but my kids wanted to go there so we went. All the carnival type games are $5.00 USD per person. It was fun for my kids but probably not something we want to do again. There were several homeless people asking for money, religious persons preaching (hari-Krishna), food was super expensive (dipping dots was $7.00 for a small cup and 7.50 for a larger cup). So...overall it's a rip-off and we all know it but we do it ! :(We mostly were just playing games while waiting for our reservation at the Bubba Gump restaurant (another review)
This place is always buzzing with lots of unique people and shows everywhere . Nice places to have dessert and Pacific park is a must

column2: First stop after getting off the plane from Toronto
column3: My wife and I are big fans of Three's Company TV show from the 80s. This pier was out first stop after getting off the plane. I wished they had some sort of plaque or something to Three's Company so that tourists could take pics with it and say they were there. It was crowded for a Wednesday early afternoon.
Very busy. Can hardly walk with all the people on it. It's good to have a look though. Also the end of Route 66

column2: Santa Monica Pier ‚Äì The end of the road!
column3: This landmark pier is located at the western terminus of the old historic route 66 and now interstate 10. The pier is over 100 years old and houses the family amusement park called Pacific Park. The pier that stands today is actually two adjoining piers with the original long narrow pier opening on September 9, 1909. The second and wider pier to the south, known as the Pleasure Pier or the Newcomb Pier was built in 1916 for the purpose of housing an amusement center. This area attracts a lot of people and is a cool place to visit if you are ever in the area.

Volunteer street performers begin, crowds, discount souvenir shops, carnival-like atmosphere. Walking the pier is free, but expect to pay $12 for parking. Some typical tourist restaurants like Buppa Gump, but there are more local restaurants toward 3rd Street Promenade (you may have to walk 7 or 8 blocks inland to find them).A place with lots of energy and bustle.

column2: Compared to Santa Barbara Wharf... meh
column3: It lacks upper class food, quality views, peace. If your all about screaming kids running around and vendors that resemble a fair than here‚Äôs your pier. The pier was closed to parking (I wasn‚Äôt in car) but the lot was barely half full. The road to move cars was full of pedestrians and it looked as if driving through a protest.Everything is overpriced, dirty, and lacks class.

It's not cheap and it's packed in summer but our kids had a ball. There are lots of rides that feel safe and even the extremely dirty and overpriced games arcade was a hit. A fun few hours when in Santa Monica. Just don't eat there as there are heaps of better places.

We hired bikes and road the excellent cycle path - which started near the Pier. As you can see from my Photos, the Pier was rather busy and as we had bikes we were not able to get right onto the Pier, but it was clearly very popular and had lots to attract all those peoples and all those cars that were parked close by.

column2: Interesting place to visit, can be fun, but very crowded in a summer evening
column3: Interesting,place to visit, good views, can be fun, but very crowded in the evening. Lots of alternatives to eat

column2: If you are in town, go.
column3: The pier itself is worth walking and people watching. You will see artists, fishermen and all kinds of people walking around. They even have a trapeze thing that you can pay to do it.

column2: Such a fun place to visit
column3: This iconic landmark is a must-see stop. Make sure you take your picture in front of the Route 66 sign. Ride on one of the amusement park rides or play a game. Walk out to the end of the pier and watch the fishermen. Eat in the restaurant at the end of the pier. Lots of fun little things to do and of course shops to browse or purchase souvenirs. Crowded with lots of tourists and the local homeless as well as artisans and street performers. But if you're out in California, be sure to include this landmark.
Some fun rides and very nice restaurants as well as great views across the Pacific but everything is incredibly expensive

column2: Day is quiet, Night is when it all happens
column3: If you want a nice evening come down here for a few hours. It truly comes alive toward sunset & in to the evening. The lights are good. The rides are tame but fun. Music, food, people. This is a great place to spend summer evenings.
Great beach and great Pier. We had a wonderful time visiting. Great music and good. Great stores and great prices.

Arrived around 10am so not many people around but that changed within a few hours. Enjoyed watching the people fish and just enjoyed people watching. Lots of entertainment and places to eat and drink.
The pier is very nice in the morning but it gets quite packed in the evening. It attracts a lot of nut jobs at night so you have to keep a watchful eye
We arrived at 10ish in the morning and were glad as by mid afternoon it was very busy, pier had lots of shops and stalls and it was nice to stand at the end of route 66
We visited the pier mid afternoon. Lots of shops and entertainers on the pier. Place to eat and beautiful vistas. At night the lights of the Ferris wheel are spectacular(pics below).

I'm sure the Santa Monica Pier and Beach are nicer when not visiting on a warm Sunday afternoon.... However, that's when we happened to be there and the beach was so crowded, there wasn't enough room to put down 2 towels next to each other without overlapping with someone else's towels or "area", and we walked from the pier up the beach about half a mile searching for a spot. Our kids were trying to jump waves and were consistently pushed over by the tons of people also trying to jump waves. The pier itself was miserable, as it was hard to move to the volume of people, and the lines to every single place on the pier were way too long.

Santa Monica pier was everything I imagined it would be and I loved it. The fair was fab and theirs lots of little souvenir stalls. There's lots of photo opportunities on different levels. It's also the end of the Iconic Route 66, you can have a photo with the sign and theres plenty of Route 66 souvenirs.

Family L.A. Vacation side trip worth visiting. It's crowded, it's touristy ... but it's still a fun little spot to check out. $7/ticket for the rides which seemed reasonable as you get multiple turns on the ticket; two consecutive rides on the roller coaster and I think we went around 4+ times on the Ferris wheel which had nice views including watching a pod of dolphins travel slightly off shore. Kids enjoyed.

column2: When People Talk About the Good Old Times
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is not just for tourists. I have lived close by for over 60 years, and I never tire of it. This weekend, I took a 9 year old granddaughter and her 3 year old cousin. We had a ball. After the Ferris wheel, the view from which is a spectacular aerial shot of the Santa Monica beaches north and south, thronged with bathers, we selected one ride for the older child followed by one for the younger. (Height separates them as to eligibility to get on rides.) In all, we enjoyed perhaps six different rides, steering away from the carny attractions that make throwing a ring around a bottleneck look easy.Both kids were excited, with no let up. I, on the other hand, refused to join in the whirling seat that looked so vomitous or the human centrifuge, which was vomitous. My granddaughter laughed her way through both rides, despite a corn dog. The kids rides were a bit too small for ole granddad, so the two youngsters sat in a tiny airplane or boat and went round.A note on the corn dog: it was good. So was my turkey club sandwich. That's amazing given madness all around as seemingly thousands walk up and down that pier on our beautiful weekends. Eat there! You will be surprised.Then go on the merry go round. That is truly a whirl back in time. There's a Wurlitzer to boot. If you want something that requires more than sitting on a wooden horse, rent a bike next door and ride down to the Venice pier and back. And stop along the way and just people watch or shop. It is a unique hour, and righteous exercise!Note: take a bike lock to be sure your bike is there after you stop and look at Musclemen or shop for trinkets. We saw what looked like a live snake held by a muscular bare chested man, but the young one, hauled in a little convertible trailer, fell asleep (probably just as well), and missed it. Not unusual.If you live in LA, be a regular. If you visit LA, it's a must.
Great place to visit and see a few street performers. Loved the park rides and not excessive in pricing. Would definitely recommend the location for families visiting.

It's a nice view of the beach and the water. But don't bother. It's so touristy. It's loud and full of colorful hawkers and performers looking for tips. Not a pleasant beach experience. But if you want to check it off your "done that" list while in Cali then go for it! Very crowded.

column2: A fun filled day that included a quick tour of the pier
column3: We enjoyed our day touring the Pier and the local shops. I personally wouldn't spend a lot of time on the pier. It is busy and touristy but certainly a thing you should go see.

If you enjoy playing Pokemon Go or your family likes small rides/arcades/average beaches you could easily fill a day here. There is a lot of neat history to the attractions here and no shortage of things to eat and buy. Despite the many homeless people around and huge crowds it feels pretty safe, partly because there is a police station on the pier. I think the pier is prettiest in the evening. The lights on the roller coaster and carousel are best appreciated at night, and sunset views here are gorgeous.I highly recommend the flavored sodas at the carousel house if you are here. Do not eat at these restaurants though, as they all serve mediocre food at a premium.

We walked to the Santa Monica Pier after walking through the Third Street Promenade. It is a fascinating place in a number of ways, but it really is an iconic place that has become a very crowded tourist spot. Many of the people on the shopping side the pier looked bored, but it is a popular selfie-taking spot (with the ferries wheel in the background). We did have a good funnel cake during our visit, and there are a number of restaurants on the pier that sport great views of the water and the shoreline. It was great for people watching. Overall, worth a brief visit, if only to say that you have been there. But also no need to plan to spend more than an hour or two at the pier, even if you plan to ride the carnival rides.
It's been years since we had been here, much more run down, and dirty. Walked around for about 30 minutes and couldn't wait to leave. Major disappointment.

It was crazy busy there thus summer. Had intented to do some rides but couldn't believe how many people were there...hope it was constructed well and still safe as sooooo full! A must visit place at Santa Monica.
This is fun to do and have done when in LA. A lot of crazy people and crazy acts, etc, Nice to sit down and watch the sunset

It's a great calif thing to doAnd it's been kept like a relic fromThe past. People, atmosphere And family fun - this place has it all and the beach is stunning - goes for miles. Santa Monica Pier puts you in a good mood. Heaps of food avail - although you may have toSearch for health food . Third street promenade is nearby - so you won't starve . Visit there after.

column2: Very Touristic Spot. But a must.
column3: We went there at 10 PM. It was not too busy. Nice rides and a lot of street artists. Especially musicians. Just great to be so close to the ocean.

Beautiful place on the beach, with some fun rides for kids. Good atmosphere, sometimes there are shows of local people. There are restaurants and cofee shop near by. You can spend few hours over there.

Rides WAAAYYYY over priced, but atmosphere was fantastic. Definately try to go doe sunset. I tried, and clouds covered in last few minutes. :-(It's funny blindfolded me and put me there, I might guess I was not in the US. A lot of international people.A lot of street entertainers were decent
Very pretty location. with nice beach and a walk on the pier. Loved it! Our 8 year old enjoyed spending time here :) a must go in L.A.
I loved this place, just walking around enjoying the view and the many street performers made it even better.
Only place we've seen a pier with a Ferris wheel and roller-coaster but otherwise touristy with some shops, buskers and fresh air. A must-see if you're in the area but don't need much time there.

column2: Get Your Kicks at the End of Route 66
column3: This is a must visit if you are in Santa Monica. The Pier is an iconic symbol and is still super fun place to see. It stands as the symbolic end of old Route 66. On our visit it was a super hot day in California but the ocean breeze was nice and cool. Vendors set up along the pier, the midway, people fishing and people watching across the wide beach at Santa Monica. Parking can fill up quickly, we parked up the street and walked down to the pier. Fun for all to be had

Santa Monica Pier was great lots to do here and plenty eateries. The pier attracts a lot of attention and the beach is so busy. To park here you pay a one off fee and get to stay the whole day which is good if you arrive early and spend the day here. You wouldn't be bored here always lots to do & see. We had food and drinks in a restaurant on the end of the pier this was nice with the nice views as well.
This place had beach, a variety of restaurants, grab and go food and a set of carnival rides.Very fun!

column2: All the fun of the fair!
column3: This is a really busy pier with lots going on, various entertainers and several eating places including the small fairground. You can also fish from here, plenty to keep you occupied and good fro people watching.
A packed place but worth the stop. Busy beach but plenty of it. Pier has amusement rides and tons of junky food and touristy stands. Fun.
The Pier was busy and vibrant.Worth going down for a look.We hired a push bike and rode to Venice beach and back. Something I highly recommend you do. I hadn't ridden a bike in 10yrs.Do it

The Santa Monica Pier affords some wonderful views. Licensed entertainers line the pier and there are games and carnival rides. Be sure to dine with a local restaurant if you choose to eat on the pier as there are a number of terrific choices.

Everything it was build up to be. An amusement park, shops and places to eat. Very busy but lovely views out to sea and of LA. Lots of pigeons!! Lots of things to do for all ages. We had a quick visit manly to see the end of Route 66. Beach wa so huge!
Beautiful place, great view but beach is too crowded, as well as the pier.People eating by the beach and there were no garbage bins near the beach - huge miss from the local authorities.

We really enjoyed seeing the pier with the Amusement Park and all the vendors. It's really clean and inviting. We ate at a small ice cream parlor and enjoyed it very much! All kinds of people to see if you like to people watch lolThe city of Santa Monica was fun to explore as well. Lots of high end shopping!
Lots happening on the Santa Monica Pier. You can walk the pier in a few minutes or you can choose to spend the day.
We walked to it about 40 blocks. Not to crowded and a lot to see. We played on the beach and went into the ocean. Lots of rides and places to see.

column2: Nice athmosphere despite of the crowd
column3: Santa Monica Pier is worth visiting as it is recognizable from many movies and tv-series. Santa Monica Pier and Beach have way too many tourists for our taste but amazingly the Pier does not give you the feeling of claustrophobia even though there is a small amusement park/funfair on it and we were there in the middle of July and in the middle of the day. The athmosphere is easy-going and jovial.
Certainly a busy place on the 4th of July. Lots of souvenir shops. arcade ( quarters, not tokens ),..and midway rides.

column2: Go for the end of Route 66 and the views not the food
column3: Always bustling and full of life but it's also a tourist trap heaven with lots of street artists and sub par restaurants with high prices. Come take photos, enjoy the views and then hit the beach.

column2: Overrated and not much to do
column3: After doing research on the internet and talking to friends, visiting Santa Monica Pier was added to our itinerary for our first trip to California. We found parking a few blocks from the pier and walked to it. When we saw it from a distance, we were a little shocked of the small size, but decided we had to check it out anyway because so many people raved about it. The pier offered nice views of the beach/ocean and there were a few little shops and food vendors. However, it was pretty disappointing and we got bored very quickly. We are used to large amusement parks and boardwalks from the Jersey or Maryland beaches. I don't recommend that people go out of their way to visit this pier if on vacation to California.
Maybe that's the style of party and drinking but we took our family there and it was very dirty, people drunk and over enjoying themselves. Not for us :(

So we had to visit here at the end of our Vegas to LA road trip, taking in some of Route 66.Found parking easy a few blocks down.The pier is busy, but there seemed a nice atmosphere and the weather was lovely for just wandering.We stopped for burgers in the last burger bar on the pier and they were such good value and great tasting.A few fisherman and oddly a few bible preachers that was a little off putting.

column2: Unique experience, but crowded and overrated
column3: My two teenage boys and I added the pier to our "must do" list while visiting California. Needless to say, we don't need to ever do it again. It was nice to see, but we aren't sure why it is so popular. The beach looked like all of the others and we are used to large amusement parks in Ohio, so the rides weren't worth the long lines. There were several local musicians that were nice to listen to and local vendor wagons, but nothing worth trying to find parking or fighting the crowd.

column2: Great pier, would like to return.
column3: I visited here during the week on a tour from Vegas and stayed a few hours. Seen the welcome to Santa Monica Beach & end of the Route 66 signs. Seen lots of shops, sellers, and eating places, we ate at Rusty's Surf Ranch- was great. Also visit Bubba Gump restaurant on the pier. Lots of rides for those who are interested. I walked to the end of the pier, was great to see. Would gladly return.

column2: Good to see, little to do
column3: The pier caters to a certain type of traveler. For those traveling as couples, it is nice to sit and enjoy the beautiful California weather. However, you will run out of things to do very quickly. The pier is a fantastic place for families with young children. There is a small amusement park on the pier. Other than that, there is only a few restaurants.
Beach was great, lots of places to eat and shop, weather was great....we went for my daughters Birthday , live music on fire,
Just a typical Boardwalk with a California twist, lots of fun things mainly for kids and families, the beach was nice, but super crowded since we went in July!
So much to see and do for all ages, you can go on the rides or just sit and people watch. Plenty of food options.

We spent the entire day at the pier! But I'll be taking sun screen next time ;) For $35 we had unlimited rides for the whole day! The cues weren't too bad at all and the food there was great and reasonably priced :)

I was underwhelmed by Santa Monica. The pier is very overcrowded and overwhelming, and also felt dirty. The beach was extremely crowded! I do not care to return to Santa Monica. There are certain street that are nicer and cleaner than others, but overall I wasn't very impressed.

column2: Popular beach boardwalk in upscale urban area
column3: Came here on a weekday late afternoon and stayed till early evening. Saw the sign marking the end of Route 66. There are many shops, dining places, street performers. There are many rides available for those interested in rides. We enjoyed just walking the end of the boardwalk.
So many choices for a terrific time. Scenry, shops, ridea and restaurants. Check out the historic carousel.Would be special to be there at dusk/sunset.
Lots of hustle and bustle, was just like the movies with the roller coasters, and skaters. Enjoyed the visit. Don't need too long there to get the vibe.

I was really impressed with how nice the Santa Monica area is! The Pier was very nice and well kept up. There were lots of attractions for the kids! It had lots of restaurants. It was a busy area though. I definitely felt safe. I was really impressed with the Pier and would definitely go back!

I went with a group of friends and we had such a good time. You can find a lot of cute stores in the pier to buy souvenirs and stuff like that, however, it does get crowed at times. The rides are really fun! You get a beautiful view of the ocean and this place is really cool to take photos. Personally for me, the water is TOO COLD to get in, but is a nice place to stroll a bit.

We drove down the coast and stopped at the Santa Monica Pier. The beach was great! We even saw some sea lions froliicking in the ocean. We rode the ferris wheel and took photos. It was getting very busy when we were leaving around lunch time. They had artists, musicians and some freaky people. Great place for people watching!

I meandered around every part of the pier and loved my time there. Did not ride the ferries wheel because the line was too long for my patience. The beach area is everything I envisioned it to be. Worth every mile we drove from South Mississippi.

column2: Must see if you're visiting. Avoid if you live here.
column3: The pier is one of those places that you have to see if you visit, but avoid if you live in LA. It is extremely touristy and crowded, but if you haven't seen it before you need to go. They have a restaurant/bar at the end of the pier, rides for kids, a fairly big arcade, ice cream, shopping, carnival games, etc. The views from the pier are magnificent as well. I am really glad I did it when I moved out here, but won't go back until my family comes to visit. It is extremely crowded and getting there can be a bit of a hassle.

We walked the pier in the morning. The amusement rides had not started operating yet and the only people there, outside of a few fishermen, were vagrants who were sleeping on the benches, a depressing site.

Love Santa Monica pier - there is always something new to see and enjoy, whether live performances or a silent disco! Lots of stalls selling souvenirs, bars and restaurants offering selection of food and drink. Very touristy but an enjoyable experience, whether you jump on some of the rides or just take a stroll on the pier. Beautiful to walk down the pier at night and look back at the Santa Monica shoreline.

The pier was widen and now has more rides and vendors. It also has Bubba Gump and Mariasol restaurants. Unfortunately, lots of people were smoking weed. So beware of second hand smoke especially with your small kids. Not coming back.

It's nice to see it, a lot of people, parking some times it's difficultbit they have pubic parking close. They have a lot of different restaurants at the pier. Prices are high. The view at the beach is so beautiful, and it's interesting to see the pier.

There's nothing better than standing on the edge of the pier looking out into the ocean and feeling the breeze on your face. This visit, some children's groups were playing music from the 80s and 90s for a small crowd that had gathered and I didn't want to leave. This is a must stop for anyone who hasn't been to California but also for the locals. I always want to carve out more time to spend there - hopefully next time!
But if you decide to skip the walk down the full pier, you won't have sacrificed anything. If you're looking for postcards, though, or a bunch of souvenirs, this is the place.

The pier was full of people and life, the other pier I have visited was the Brighton one in the UK. They take you back to being a child, the smells, the food, and the people. Thus one had the added bonus of a lovely beach with soft sand beside it. Which my 10yr old took full advantage of and swam in. Worth the visit for young and old, if only to people watch.
The pier offers a beautiful view of the ocean. Many places to grab a snack or coffee along the pier. Plus access to the beach. Nice place to spend a beautiful day

column2: Beauty and the Beach/ Beers and Burgers
column3: Great place to people watch and Big Dean's has great Beer and Burgers. From the peer head south on the walk path and Venice Beach is approx 2 miles away. That's where the real people watching experience is..... Must stop at Boardwalk Cafe and get a Colette Burger, if you already didn't hey one at Big Dean's :)That's a delish blue cheese burger. Watch people from all over the world.

stopped at the pier after a bile ride down the coast. apart from being the official end of Route 66 theres not an awful lot more to see. However its still a must see, the type of people attracted to this place is amazing, you can just sit and people watch for hours. a walk on to the pier gives you great views up and down the coast, you can also chat to the guys fishing off the pier. its worth planning a visit into your ittinery.

column2: South end on sea, With sun and lots of homeless
column3: Not a great experience, you come across the homeless everywhere. The best thing you can do is ask for your spare food at the end of your meal (as they portions are gigantic) to go with plastic cutlery and then give out to the homeless.

As a local this isn't someplace we visit unless a visiting guest insists. It's very tourist and youth focused. The views from the pier are nice, and it's an excellent spot for people watching. No dining options of note (there are some great spots nearby in Santa Monica). The beach below can get pretty insane, and it's a long walk (we like Will Rogers State Beach to the north). The bike trail below is excellent and runs for many miles along the coast.

A great place to have some fun especially with friends and children. You can have a ride with a rollercoaster too but don't miss the pier itself, there is a great view! There are some shopping area but should be more restaurants...

If you're in Santa Monica then you're going to do the pier. It's a bit "meh". Nice views and some nice merchandise but ... nothing special. I'd wander a mile down the road to Venice Beach to soak up the atmosphere as the pier is nothing that special. We went to Pacific Park which was included on our Go Card. Again - fine, quite quaint but at rack rate? Not worth it. Nice roller coaster, all quite low tech (that's a compliment) but won't use up more than 90 minutes of your time unless the queues are horrendous.

We had finally come to the end of our Route 66 journey and where better to end this than on Santa Monica pier at the end of the road sign. Perfect end to a perfect journey. Very busy pier but easy enough to get around.

This pier is mainly for buying souvenirs, entertainment and eating. All the shops are selling similar things and food. It is quite boring.One of the restaurant called "Beach Burger". It is quite nice. You can try it.

The Pier has a lot of energy, the food is not bad (This is the only place place outside of Vancouver to get Japadogs) and the performers were fun to watch. Where else can you get jostled by an old Caucasian Michael Jackson, trip over active fishing lines all while eating a redhot buried in Japanese condiments? Fun place.

column2: Better than what it looks like in the movies!
column3: Loved Santa Monica Pier! I couldn't help but smile the whole time of being there. Plenty of food to eat, souvenir shops (people don't hassle you to buy things either which is good), and of course the fun park. The rides aren't too expensive but they aren't cheap either. We went onto the Ferris wheel which gave us a great view of the pier and the beach.Venice Beach is a fair walk from Santa Monica Pier, maybe about 45 mins walk but you can hire bikes which will make it shorter.A must if you are in LA.

column2: Lovely attractions with a beautiful outlook.
column3: It was a little tricky to get to from the centre of town and took a while in an Uber but was worth it. It was freezing when we went with the breeze off the ocean so go prepared! The rides were lots of fun, not for major thrills but a good laugh. We were there in the evening and caught the ferris wheel to watch the sunset, it was amazing! The place had a wonderful vibe and would recommend to families or those looking to escape the city for an afternoon.

Lots of things are going on. The amusement park. People trying to attract audience to show their singing or playing skills. A nice promenad. People fishing. We got there to book the Malibu celebrety tour and took a walk until we took off to see the neighborhood.

My wife and I were here on a nice sunny weekday afternoon and enjoyed the stroll, the shops and amusement rides along the pier and a very talented one-man-band performing at the end of the pier. It's an easy walk into downtown, over to Muscle Beach and in and out of the shops along the beach.
So busy & a lot of people. Fun atmosphere for kids. Lines were so long for everything. Not a good place for someone who can't walk long distance on uneven ground.
This was our first time to the pier. Its pretty old,and very crowded. Not many options to eat, but the views! they are really nice, took great pictures. The weather was nice, a bit chilly but nice!

Visited with my family including teenage and younger children. We had a great time there's something for everyone including fast food and some rides. The views are great along the coastline too. It is busy but somewhere like this is going to be popular. You can just sit and watch the world go by or get involved in what's on offer. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

We visited the pier and were very disappointed. Without a doubt, no worth $25 for parking. There were only a few places to eat, very little to see and only a couple of amusement park rides.Not worth fighting traffic to get here.

If want a place to gawk at the locals and to absorb the ocean views, this is the place to go. It's very crowded with tourists and the rides/games are pricey, but this is one of the landmarks to see when in So Cal.

Fun to visit. Especially if you love the ocean. People watch, hang out, grab a meal, hit a ride or two, even head down to the sand and jump in the ocean. Totally worth the time and effort. It was busy the day we went cuz there was a free concert that evening. We enjoyed it and would go again!

We thought the Santa Monica Pier would be fun as we were travelling with kids. But it was crowded and dirty and we didn't find the place pleasing at all. It was a disappointment obviously for all of us. It's probably nicer in other months when there are less people.
This is the place to be in Santa Monica! There are lots of things to do and see for people of all ages. It can get very crowded at night and the lines are long to get ice cream and ride the rides.
Nice way to spend a couple of hours.. I biked from Hermosa Beach so I gad a bit of a time constraint.Would recommend

Great place to have fun with friends and eat lunch! Great place for pictures also!! Souvenirs are sold around the place. If you have kids its definitely a must place to visit and have fun with kid with different games. The place offers a great view.
A great place for family visit. Bunch of rides, shops, & eating spots. I feel like I'm back as a 10 y/o kids wandering around the rides. Lovely place
Our family had fun here, just to visit somewhere iconic. There is a great restaurant out on the end of the pier.

column2: Always very crowded and not much to do there
column3: It's crowed during the day and at night. Not sure why.. There's nothing to do there. That's just me. There are different street performers each day. Locals go there to fish at night. Vendors sells stuffs there on the pier.
Would not go late at night with children. I did not feel safe with my 2 teenagers and we were at pier appx 8:30PM.

I have reviewed this in part on the beach review but this is for the park holding the rides. This is ok but no Brighton and was expensive at $30 for a wrist band . The rollercoaster was a bit tired , the pirate ship was ok. There seemed other rides but it was so busy we went for a walk instead. There were Food outlets but they were very busy and no real seating. Loved the pier itself but the park was average

column2: Basic entertainment but amazing view and weather
column3: It was fascinating weather in the afternoon and evening. Late evening you. Red a jacket and that's in July especially with sea breeze.

With time to kill prior to Disneyland I took my family to the Santa Monica Pier.I found it to be incredibly beautiful and a fun short stop for photos and picking up small souvenirs- especially when I found this is end of the line for Route 66.A few issues were:I found getting there/parking to be extremely challenging. Parking was affordable and the beach walk to the pier mid morning/afternoon was comfortable and not too crowded.We left at 3pm because it was getting incredibly crowded and the personalities were getting to colorful for my liking (not vegas colorful - but not family friendly per se).In summary if your a tourist seeking beach attractions this was a great beach spot (photo view from pier to the North) and activity location, however, go early and leave early.

We stayed in Santa Monica so the pier was walking distance. Although a main attraction once you actually get to it there is not much to do. Yes they have the carnival rides and a few stalls. It is definitely a must if you are in LA to tick off the bucket list but typically 30mins there is enough- if you dont have any kids.We stayed for the sunset and had ice cream.

column2: Doesn't live up to the reputation...
column3: I'm afraid the movies and what not will set you up for disappointment when visiting the pier. It's just a run down pier, with cheesy food stands, and mediocre rides. My advise... skip it.

We were on a mission to complete Route 66 in Southern California over two days, so we started on the Santa Monica pier, even though the sign says the "end of Route 66". We stopped in to the 66 to Cali kiosk shop at the start of the pier. We talked with Ian for quite a while and he is a wealth of knowledge for anything relating to Route 66 and they have some great 66 items, everything is made in the U.S.A and I love to support that.After speaking with Ian, we walked the pier, watching tourists and kids have a ball. Everyone was enjoying a beautiful sunny day with the rides, attractions and little shops.We arrived early and were able to park on the pier making it easy to get around. The pier is a fun spot to spend a morning or afternoon in a beautiful beach town, surrounded by the Pacific Ocean.The pier is just that a wooden, iconic Southern California pier, it is worn and made with wood planks, but is full of fun and a tradition when in the area. Do it at least once, you can't help but smile.
Overpriced for poor quality goods and services. A waste of time and should be avoided. Aside from it being a well know part of Santa Monica, drive by and just see it from your car.

The Santa Monica pier is filled with Hobos. They come directly up to you to either sell you something or just exchange mean comments to you when you walk by them. I saw a lot of them yelling, talking to themselves and digging through trash cans for food. My children were frightened. We wanted to walk down to Muscle beach but was on guard the entire time. Not worth it and won't ever come back to the area. The beach was nice and fantastic views. We stayed at the Georgian hotel and it was just okay.

We thought we would just pop in and pop out for a quick visit. You can't! We got there close to sunset, rode the roller coaster and of course the Ferris wheel (a must). Grabbed some food and some souvenirs and we left. We were tired and hungry from driving from San Francisco the same day but very easily could have spent the entire day and enjoyed the beach as well. The pier is so big! We paid the premium and parked right there at pier parking. They had a sunset concert going on so not only were there tourists but also locals as well. It's nice to know that locals don't shy away from the pier.
i recommand you to visit santa monica pier, nice view from the pier, the sea, the beach, we saw 3 dolphins jumping just close to the pier, beautifull
Although this is an attraction of Los Angeles, it was nothing special. Just a long beach with a pier and a few children's games for the kids to have fun.

A cool way to spend an afternoon, the pier is pretty cool and has some basic rides and eateries while the sunsets are spectacular. Back on land, 3rd street has some great shopping and plenty of places to get a good meal. I'd much rather spend my time here than at Venice Beach.

column2: You've Got To Do It ... Once!
column3: Went for a walk out on the Pier which I just felt I had to do as it's one of those famous landmarks that you want to see! I also visited there about 5 years ago when it was very quiet ... today was so busy which makes it difficult to walk along the pier, let alone stop and look at anything.An interesting place to go and make sure you take your picture on the bench outside Bubba Gumps! However, just choose a time when you can stroll along and enjoy it rather than spend your time trying to dodge people and prams!

The place needs a good wash-- smells bad and could use a bit of a make over. Still enjoyed by kids and even spotted a tween celebrity from musica.ly that kids recognized and were excited to take a pic with.

column2: Crowded but nice to take pictures
column3: It's a very busy and crowded area and parking will take some patience. They have crossing guards to help pedestrians cross the streets safely. The pier has some restaurants and shops as well as vendor booths. I didn't play any games or go on any rides, but they looked fun. The pier is a great place to take pictures.
Fun, food, entertainment--all on Santa Monica Pier. Lots of cheap places to eat, and the ferris wheel at night is a must do. Great for the young and old!

I did a job walk for repair work on the pier and did the full tour.It is pretty much the same as I remember, a carnival by the ocean with the benefits of a beach and pier.Restaurants, shops and rides with one of the older carousel's on the west coast. Great views and street entertainment with fishing at the end of the pier.Down sides are that it gets very crowded at night and during the summer. Parking is $12 and sells out the later you go. Go early and bring your chair and towel for a full Beach day.

The Pier is iconic-- your trip is not complete without a stroll to the end. But it is crowded and so be prepared for that. There are parking lots on 2nd street and Broadway or Santa Monica that are much cheaper and just a few blocks away. And you can see the Promenade too!!

The Santa Monica pier is a must see but it is also super crowded most of the time. I've been there numerous times but I feel like it continues to get more crowded. Really good place to take a picture though!

column2: Has a bit of everything for all ages.......!!!
column3: Been there twice and loved my visit. The water is clear enough to enjoy unlike the Long Beach and then you have the pier to enjoy the evening. If you have kids, they will absolutely love it. The only issue I had was with the shower facilities which were not working properly. Should have some sort of paid facilities where you can clean up after a dip in the water.

Love this place. Water was blue and clean. Small but nice board walk. Took photos with historic Route 66 singe. But the best part was Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. Could relate with the move easily. Waiters are friendly and know what they are doing. Their food was good too. We enjoy the pier a lot.

column2: Santa Monica Pier is a MUST see!
column3: If you find yourself in Santa Monica, you MUST visit this iconic destination. The only issue my family had was a broken ride we were on. Luckily we had a guardian angel in front of us holding down the bar.

This was my second time visiting Santa Monica so I took a stroll down the Pier at about 5 PM on the weekend of the 4th of July. Busy place but good people watching. I was going to buy a few postcards but didn't have anything under a $20 and the vendor didn't want to break it. Not a big deal but I found it odd. I kind of think that once you have seen it you don't need to go back. Although I did the next morning for some cardio on the beach. It was so quiet and peaceful...such a change from the night before.

column2: Santa Monica Pier great for families
column3: My husband and I walked from Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier, took us about 90 mins but was a very nice walk to do on a Saturday afternoon. The pier was huge with the Big Ferris Wheel which could be seen all the way back to Venice Beach.Lots of places to eat and cute little touristy shops and markets to see. Highly recommend! Be prepared for the crowds and they are huge and although we didn't drive, we could see the parking lot was choc-a-block full.
Actually won at basketball and knocking over the clowns. Way more fair and better priced than the county fair.

We went over 4th July weekend and plenty going on with concerts, carnival rides, and other entertainment. Seems to always be a must to stop in on.Nearby shopping is good with street entertainers as well!
Pretty for a stroll. Rides are limited and it appears to need a bit of a facelift. Walk all the way to the end for a pretty view.
It was a good experience to walk this pier being the end point of Route 66. Heaps of eateries and entertainment options. Good for people watching. A good view of the beach from here.

column2: Fun in the Sun at Santa Monia Pier
column3: Santa Monica is a great place to visit for a full day of sun, fun, eating and shopping. In addition to the beach, there's the famous Ferris Wheel which is surrounded by other rides. Santa Monica Pier has the typical beach junk food, but there's also restaurants including Bubba Gump's Shrimp!If you walk up the hill and over the highway, there's a park area great for walking and leisure activities. Across the street are more restaurants. However, walking a few blocks further you run into the 3rd Street Promenade where you'll find shopping and more restaurants. The 3rd Street Promenade area is blocked off to cars, only encountering them when crossing over to the next block of stores. You can browse the stores or window shop.I've visited the pier 3 times and each time, I spend almost a full day there. It's great family fun; something for everyone.

I never miss an opportunity to visit the pier when in SM. Always something new to discover and it offers visitors free live music, various choices of good/ beverages and amusement park rides. Great views of SM and the ocean. Not to miss when in SM.
It is a landmark of Santa Monica. Fairly large for a pier. Some attractions for kids. It is a kind of "check-in" places in LA. Although is fun to jog along the beach and just pass it by.
I like to travel up from Orange County to here because its always got great weather and interesting people and things to see. Its always a great time to visit.

This is 100% a must do if you're in the area at any time of day! We did it just after sunset/ dinner and it was awesome! Bright lights, reasonably cheap - $30 USD gets you unlimited rides! Our favourite was definitely the shark ride!

This was our stopping point for our Route 66 trip. The pier is crowded with shops, restaurants, people, performers, an arcade, and several carnival rides. It's a fun place for an afternoon, but that's about all. Check it out, walk the beach, and maybe eat something if you want (it's kind of pricey, although the pizza I got was better than I expected). One of those bucket list things.

This pier is huge in comparison to most on the east coast I am used to. A lot of people, and a ton going on. It was nice to see the pier had more than just rides or games on the water. The far end had fishing and dolphin watching, as well as people just relaxing to a sunset.
It's a busy part of town however for good reason.If you're into people watching and just admiring the weird & wonderful then you'll really enjoy it here.

The pier was smaller than I thought it would be, but it was crammed with varying levels of entertainer from a talented drummer all the way to guy who couldn't sing or play the guitar killing Eric Claptons "Wonderful tonight" but he was entertaining. The funfair was worth playing the little games on just be prepared to end up with soft toys!

Crowded, loud, obnoxious, but you must walk to the end of the pier just to say you've done it. Don't get food there, it's over priced and mediocre. Walk out of the pier and onto the street for actual food. Not what I imagined, but had to walk to the end of the pier regardless of course.

column2: Too Crowded for me but glad I saw it
column3: Busy, expensive rides, pier performers, and lots of food. Glad that I went and saw it once. I don't need to see it again. So many lovely parts of California to see...the Pier was not one of them. Just very, very crowded. If I had the option, I would bypass Santa Monica.

column2: Overcrowded, overpriced and a generally a rip off joint
column3: It's a pier like any other, except its very crowded and has lots of overpriced shops, restaurants ams a couple of overpriced rides. In addition there were some people trying to dupe you into signing up for some sort of time share deal by entering a 'free' draw.If you have more money than sense &/or like overcrowded places, then this place is for you!
This was a must stop for us and trust me you want to visit here. The pier takes you back to a long forgotten past and was so much fun.

I visited with my husband and my four year old daughter. The food selection is a bit limited but we didn't mind and we both waited in two seperate lines. Once we both got our food we realized there wasn't one empty table so we had to wait in the 90 degree weather with a hungry four year old. A bottle of water costs 4 dollars which is pricey but we purchased two and then headed to the ferris wheel. The price for the ferris wheel was 8.50 per person and I wouldn't pay that price for three people based on principle. Instead we went to the arcade for air hockey and ended up at chuckie-cheese. It's nice to walk around but it is very expensive.

column2: Nice place for a couple hours.....
column3: I was in town with my 2 teenage girls.... the rides there are better suited for younger kids... but we rode the ferris wheel.... and walked around.... fun to watch the " street performers..... we went July 4....so it was packed... I'm sure other days are a bit more relaxing..... we had a nice time all in all.... I would recommend definitely if you have small kids and if you're kids ( any age) like watching performers and the ocean.....

Very touristy, but loads of fun! This pier has shops, restaurants, amusement rides, fishing, and all sorts of street artists and performers. What a great setting, over the water with the ocean breeze. Great place to walk and explore and find about anything you need, and lots of things you just want. A hopping place!

This is a great place filled with entertainment, street artists, beach, bicycle riding, boardwalk, etc. Be sure to arrive by afternoon so that you can take advantage of the whole place before sunset. Because of the hills, you won't be able to get a good sunset view. If you get to Ocean Av., you will be greeted by expensive parking and restaurants. Park slightly away and enjoy the evening dinner in the area's appealing restaurants.

I was so excited about visiting Santa Monica Pier and it didn't disappoint!Colourful, bustling and lots of friendly faces makes it an ideal place to spend a few hours and maybe have a meal at Bubba Gump (although the wait time was too long for us, should have booked).Weekends are extremely busy though where they have live music and traffic is often at a standstill trying to park.Definitely worth a visit and a go on the fairground rides.

After the constant buildup of how awesome the Santa Monica pier is we were left vaguely empty. Yeah it was busy and yeah there were some real people watching opportunities but the attractions, shops, food and general atmosphere was a disappointment.

This place was my biggest disappointment on a recent long visit to California. Very crowded and expensive and it wasn't as large or have as much to do ad I thought it would. Some of the food was pretty bad too. On the good side, it only cost $1.25 to park for 2 hours at parking lot 6.

column2: Went just to say I've been there
column3: I wasn't impressed with the pier or restaurants. Seemed to be a mini tourist trap. Beyond walking to the end of the pier, there wasn't anything that was tempting to spend money on.

Coming from a seaside area in the UK we are very used to typical seaside piers. All the usual things, cafes, fairground attractions etc. Can get very busy and when it does you just have to follow along with the crowd! Probably wouldn't bother with the Pier next time as there are much nicer things to see in Santa Monica.

This was a place we had to go to and it didn't disappoint. The kids were very excited to go and had a blast once there. Must see on your trip. Rollercoaster and Ferris wheel on the pier. Beautiful views as well.

Went here after dinner. Nothing extremely special except it is an iconic place featured in many movies. Was very crowded (uncomfortably) and most places had a line to get in. The view of the mountains were beautiful and there were plenty of street performers to watch. Was a good place for me to check off my bucket list.
Basically the have the stuff you get at your county fair stuffed into a pier....only not quite as good. It was crowded with basically a fair atmosphere of vending etc. I saw no reason to return.

Went to the Pier on June 20th. An amazing sunset and a vibe that cant be described.Took my 13 yr old daughter and we had an amazing evening.Rode a lot of ride, played some games, enjoyed the view and listened to music.A cant miss place if you are in the area

We arrived on an evening where there was a scheduled concert so the Pier and surrounding area were very busy. Difficult to find parking, but we managed. Area was clean, security was available as were extra port-a-potties for the larger crowds. We decided not to ride at the pier due to crowds.

This pier is massive! Cars drive on half of it and there is a parking lot, on the pier. Lots of interesting people to watch, places to eat, and buy souvenirs. There's also a game room and some carnival rides. Street performers abound. Fun and a must see in Santa Monica.

column2: A good combination with walking along the beach
column3: We cycled along the beach from venice beach to santa monica and enjoyed it very much! Its a good advise to do the pier also. The people, the music, the sea -- its a happy place to see!

We came here expecting this to be the highlight of our trip. We were a little disappointed. There were so many people we could barely got a picture in. We had to wait over an hour just to pay for parking. It might be better on a quieter day but I would stay far away on any Saturday or Sunday.

Sta. Monica Pier is your typical boardwalk. I visited late afternoon when the lights were just starting to come out. The sounds and the lights- they come together with the generally happy crowd of people. It is a happy place. I could feel everyone just wanted to have a good time with the rides, the eats and the simple sights.
There were just too many cars and people on. Saturday afternoon that we decided to go back at 7:30 on Sunday morning. It was still and quiet. Peaceful looking.
We loved visiting the pier. Loved the atmosphere. You can park quite close. We had dinner in the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier it was delicious. Kids loved the rides and games.

This is a place you have to check out when you are here. Don't expect too much though. Depending on the day it can be super busy. If you are lucky you catch a great street entertainment. There is always plenty of that going on. We enjoyed it. It's not a place to hang out though for my taste. It's easy to get to and plenty of parking all around.

column2: a lot of great people watching
column3: the pier is almost always crowded, so people watching is pretty good there....if you like looking at touriststhere is a Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier where you can outside and look at the oceanthere is a giant ferris wheel for a great view of the area, and at night it's a wonderful light showthere is an arcade with air hockey and a bunch of games......and a little roller coaster and those sorts of rides for little kids...... during the summer there are free concerts on the pier every Thursday night
Not many rides, but lines weren't that long. Seemed kind of dingy to us vs the beauty of rest of SAnta Monica. Could use some updating.
Kids had a blast! We got wristbands through our Go City LA card and was well worth it! The rides were fun. The Gerri's wheel gave a great view of the ocean and area.Tons of fun!

column2: Perfect for tweens, teens and families!
column3: There are a few rides, games, shops and eateries here. We LOVED the pier and it had a lively night crowd which our teens loved. We were there late and enjoyed every moment! The rides are kind of pricey. I would compare this to a small town county fair.

This is better to view from afar .... up close... not really much to do.. a few restaurants and rides if you have young kids... and more homeless people than young kids.... the homeless around here is really really bad!!!!

Ok let's be honest the Santa Monica Pier is iconic! It's beautiful and very cool at night from a distance! Stopped after dinner to check it out and to get an ice cream cone. Place is down right dirty. Smelled of garbage and just a lot of unsavory looking people. Sadly disappointed! But cool from the distance. It does not appear to stay open very late so check the times if planning to take a walk to the pier.

column2: Came back to my childhood favorite
column3: Love the Pier, lived in LA and moved up North to Sacramento! This is a must visit if you come to LA, fun, fun fun!!! Enjoy the rides food & outdoor concerts!
We visited during our stopover in LA, we enjoyed the pier but we weren't overly impressed. The view of sunset was good but harassment from vagrants was annoying.

column2: 1998 since I've been on the pier
column3: Been a few years since I've been here but looks somewhat similar. A few new restaurants and stands but still same good old family/first date kind of fun. Walked over from Third street promenade area.
Must visit when you are in LA, great live music,lovely beach, relaxed environment, good shopping area, kids friendly

We had a great time at the Pier. The place is full of tourists. Lot of restaurants. They have a mini aquarium for kids. They even have a place for a lot of games for kids. Lear Trapize. Over All, had a lot of fun at the Pier.
Not as large as I expected. Nice walk near the ocean and interesting historical information. Would be great if you have kids and don't want the large theme park atmosphere.

I visited Santa Monica by my friend car and use car park that far from the bay but not bored .When you walk to the street have more shop and more food store to sightseeing and there have a little code weather in the Evening.You can bring you dog to walk around and have some seat when you want to relax too.When you walk to the amusement park with the food court there too.There have souvenir shop and some restaurant.You can walk to the beach for take some photo and there have car park at the beach too but that was expensive too.
Nice place to walk around. Very touristy but worth the walked over the pier for some great views and fun people watching
This is a nice place when you enjoy the beach landscape with a small attraction park , bars, and restaurant. You cannot miss the picture at Route 66 end of Track
Fun, touristy atmosphere. Neat places to eat and fun place to people-watch. Excellent view of the beach and ocean.

My three daughters were petrified. They wanted to leave. Wet crowded and many "strange" people. A few restaurants that I do t think I would eat at. A few gift shops that you might find something at. Beautiful view of the beach. Walked to end and walked right back.
Beautiful clean pier. Love the Mexican restaurant at end of pier. Excellent service and friendly staff love the music .

This was our final stop on Route 66 after driving from Chicago. We parked in the carpark on the pier and posed for a photo in front of the Route 66 sign on the pier. Felt a great sense of achievement. Then spent a couple of interesting hours exploring the attractions.

Must see when in Santa Monica, very touristy but well worth the visit. Lot's of fun rides, had dinner on the pier and was a decent as well. Check out the carousel, not many around and it is beautiful.

column2: Little things if you look around.
column3: I went during some free time while on a business trip. It doesn't take long to visit especially if you don't have kids with you. Good for photos and people watching. Don't expect disney level amount of things to do or see but just go and relax. Good for getting some touristy trinket or watching the sunset over the hills to the north. If you like to fish you can do that here too.

If you are looking for a California experience, this is worth a visit. There are 2 large parking lots at the entrance. Lots of parking (we got there at 1230 on a Tues in the summer and there were still plenty of spots. Still spots when we left at 330). Go walk the pier, have a drink or lunch and ride the Ferris wheel. Dont bother with the coaster it is very slow. Don't bother with the wristband. Plan to spend 2 to 3 hours. Great photo opps.

Weird street performers, waaaaaay too many people. We got caught in a huge human traffic jam for 45-60 mins because there was some sort of concert going on at the pier. Apparently concerts are held on Thursday nights.It was awful.From far away it's pretty with the ferris wheel, but it's not worth it to visit.

The Famous SM Pier is just a collection of chain restaurants, junk food, vendors selling tourist junk and a few rides. It does overlook a great beach and offers incredible views, but only go there if you want to check it off of your LA sites to visit. Much better options are available to experience this great city and coast.
The end of our Route 66 had to be on Santa Monica Pier the actual end of the line!! Loads of interesting things to look at and buy as well as rides and great eateries!!

The pier gets way too crowded during peak hours. There are too many street vendors making way to much noise. They are so close they drowned each other out. All of the rides seem somewhat dated. It is worth 20 minutes of your time to walk out and back, but I can assure you that you won't do it twice.

We liked walking on the pier. A lot of little carts or pop up merchants all kinda peddling the same stuff. One interesting tid bit, old Route 66 officially end at t ghe pier! Public restrooms available. Parking is a bit difficult.

The Santa Monica Pier was horrible it was over crowded and there was trash everywhere. I was glad i did it but i would never do it again. The only cool thing were all of the carnival games which you could actually win at.

column2: Great place to Hangout in the Evening
column3: We visited in the evening about an hour before sunset. It was a Tuesday... and boy was it crowded. The parking lot was full so my husband dropped us off and went to look for parking. He ended up finding parking in an outdoor shopping mall about a 5-10 minute walk away.Great place to people watch. Lots of entertainers doing their thing trying to earn some money. Some were more pushy than others with regards to asking for tips. Lots of carnival like food to eat but also sit down places like Bubba Gumps. They have a carnival rides that cost a lot to ride on. The ferris wheel cost over $8 per ticket. It was worth it to us though.It is a great place to spend an evening and to see the sun set. My year old loved it.

column2: Good place to kill a couple of hours
column3: It is a huge pier complete with restaurants, street musicians, souvenir shops, and amusement park. There are beautiful sunset views.The pier has mostly street food but it's still delicious including burgers, tacos and funnel cakes.

Well it's still the heart of Santa Monica with lots of visitors and lots of overpriced stuff to sell for them. It is worth to spend not more than 15 minutes on it unless you are going to use a carousel or have a lunch. Some places are offering quite good seafood.

I arrived at the pier in the evening which was extremely busy. However it has much character. The highlight for me was going on the ferris wheel which was a good opportunity to take photos of the coastline.If you have time available I would advice to get a full attraction pass to take in all the rides on the pier which works out at a lot better value.
We had to go since we were staying in Santa Monica. I am glad we went, but not something I would want to do again.

I was not impressed with the Pier. I guess I had high expectations. There are only a few rides. We did not eat on the pier; we ate on the other side of the street. I would rather visit the Jersey Shore piers or the Galveston Pier.I did like watching the performers. The guy playing the sitar was pretty good.

It's the end of Route 66 but the start of hustle & bustle . The vibe is happy & friendly with an eclectic mix of all nations & tourists alike .Street performers, carnival food and views of the beach & ocean are great after mid morning if there around " June gloom " time .Walks either side of pier are worth it as Venice beach is south..Have fun

column2: meh. looks nothing like it did in it's heyday
column3: Having been to Santa Cruz boardwalk many times, I was expecting something similar. This had just a few rides, nothing exciting. The ferris wheel (which someone told us was the most photographed attraction besides the Eiffel Tower?!) was small and unexciting. Don't go here just for the boardwalk. But if you're already at the beach, give it a look
Bad wifi in the Pier and there is coaster ride around there. The only eye catching is the Route 66 end of trail sign
The pier had a vast amount of things to do outside of the beach area. We had dinner at Bubba Gumps and had a fun time on the rides and walking around.
Chincy and cheap carnival atmosphere filled with dirty people. Walmart on the water really. Take a pass.

column2: Finally Put My Feet in the Ocean
column3: After 4 years of visiting LA I got here, and put my feet in the ocean.Was just a lovely place to visit and sit and relax.Was a little disappointed the rides were closed for a private event but this was a spur of the moment visit so that part was our fault.

was a tat dissapointed with this visitwas very old lots of overpriced gift shops as youd expectfew singers and groups on the pier .we didnt go on any of the rides very busy when we wentjust on parr with scarborough pierr lol but hotnot really a place id return hyped up 2 much

We visited this in the morning as we were still used to eastern time. Wasn't very busy then but was getting busy by time we left. We paid $12 to park down on the beach next to the pier instead of on the pier itself which is more expensive. The area was kind of dirty but not horrible. We walked down the pier and then down the beach to the muscle beach area which my boys liked. Neat place to check out.

I grew up in LA and as an adult moved to a different state. Now that I have my own child we came here for a visit. It still has that nostalgic feel to it when I came to visit. Same rides and games. Many shops, restaurants, and street performers. Definitely a good night out with the family.

column2: A Must See But Just The Once
column3: We were in LA so had to visit the iconic pier, if just for photos, especially at the Route 66 End Of The Trail sign. Apart from that there was really nothing else for us to get excited about. There were amusements, rides, stalls, buskers etc which are not really our cup of tea but may appeal to others.
This place is ok, like many piers of city's that has one. Lots of little shop mostly souvenirs. You could visit this in 1 hour.

The usual stuff - food and rides but very busy. Suitable for families and there's a gimmicky sign indicating the end/start of route 66 for a photo and a small interesting information point at the end of the pier.

This was a stop on our Starline city and beach tour and it was somewhere i had dreamed of visiting after seeing in movies so often..It seemed a romantic and fun destination..In reality i was disappointed.The pier fun park area is looking a bit tired but it did have some fun rides for all ages.The iconic ferris wheel and a dark dingy amusement games arcade. The beach at Santa Monica has a wide sandy beach but it wasnt anything special. The boardwalk was so busy with skaters and cyclists.It is a great people watching place..A highlight was the muscle men showing off on the beach near the pier on swing ropes etc. Hilarious!I felt their seemed poor food or cafe options around the pier.We didn't get to Venice beach close by..i wonder if the beach is more attractive there and facilities a little less run down looking?

column2: Worth a visit even if it's just for photos
column3: We ere excited to visit the pier. It's a iconic place. The view were great and it was great for people watching. There were quite a few homeless people about but they weren't aggressive or intrusive. Probably wouldn't visit again but glad we went.
This place itself is nice; however, I do not like the crowd it attracts. I have visited many times, but do not like. Personal opinion.
This place is full of activities. It's beautiful & full of people. I loved the board walk. Kids enjoy a lot on the beach. Nice eateries too.
I loved the pier, I'm from a UK seaside town and piers hold a special place in my heart. We had hotdogs off a vendor and juts walked around soaking up the atmosphere. Highlight of SM for me.
