I love a pier. But this one didn't have much to grab me - limited food outlets and expensive rides ($8.50 to ride the Ferris wheel felt steep). Parking costs $13. Beautiful views along the beach. But we didn't stay long.

I booked our hotel near the pier but we enjoyed the other things we did more -- a surf lesson with Nick at Santa Monica Surf School, shopping on 3rd street, Venice beach skaters, AbbottKenny street shops.

We made this our first stop in LA. The weather was a little gloomy so we didn't actually venture down to the water, but the pier gave us great views of the ocean and the paddle board races that were going on. We stopped at a little burger stand for lunch. Seating was limited but the food was good. There were a bunch of souvenir stands set up along the pier as well that were fun to poke around. Our favorite stop by far was the arcade. It's filled with good mix of old (Galaga, Pac Man, Skee-ball, air hockey) as well as new games (there is this updated version of Galaga that plays on a huge screen). We skipped the amusement park itself but there were a few rides (roller coaster, tilt a whirl) as well as a nicely done carousel). If you plan to come out, definitely don't forget your walking shoes, sunscreen and a swim suit if their weather permits!

column2: Don't want to miss this out!
column3: I came here for a walk and didn't expect myself to spend around 3 hours here. The atmosphere was really relaxing here, with many performers which made it more special. Took many nice photos here and totally didn't want to leave, so I stayed to see the sunset and it was super worth it. Definitely come here!!!

First time visiting the Pier, we parked in the main parking lot which I think was $12. Lots of families and kids on the pier, which is nice to see. Plenty of places to eat and to shop. You also get a very pretty view of the beach and the ocean. Santa Monica was a bit congested but the pier was easy to find.

Known from thousands of postcards and movies - this is a must visit when in LA. The sunset over the pier is My favourite but the Sunrise is Beautiful too. Easy parking If arriving by car. Easy Walking acess from the Beach or Third street. Lots of food options on the pier.
This is my favorite pier to visit. We came here this year to mark the end of our Route 66 trip. The highway ends on the pier. Souvenirs are expensive, but I suppose that's to be expected.

If you're in Santa Monica you have to go to the pier just for the experience. You don't have to ride the rides to enjoy a stroll on the crowded pier. It's a great place to people watch. Stay away if you don't like crowds, but that's part of the charm of the place.
Had a nice walk on the pier watching the street performers and artist on a beautiful Saturday. THe views are beautiful.

A sight for sore eyes. Coming here always keep me relaxed (despite the long walks!) and calm (despite the diverse crowd!). Not as if I don't live in a small island with so much water and sand, but it's the crazy fun activities that you can do here and lots of deeeelicious fresh food available anywhere in this part of town.
Very historical. Pier is in good shape and surrounded by a very well maintained beach. Plenty of for pay parking nearby. Not a huge variety of food, and it is on the higher price side.

column2: Definitely a must do if you're visiting Santa Monica!
column3: We enjoyed walking the pier in the evening but found it much more enjoyable in the morning. The evening has a lot more teenagers and is elbow to elbow.The pier has a lot of food options and has plenty of live entertainment. There are a few shops but you are better off going to 3rd street for shopping.
Pier over Pacific Ocean with amusement park was the most fun kids had. Arcades and games!! Lots of walking!! But a beautiful view of Ocean !!!!!!

Unlike the modern theme parks, this place offers the traditional rides and food. In its unique way, it is a romantic place to visit. That is if you can avoid the crowd of tourists that flock the place. Still, it is a must see in L.A.

column2: Not worth much of your time
column3: This pier was a disappointing visit for me. I thought it would be a very "California" / "LA" experience but was let down and wouldn't recommend wasting more than an hour here. It felt dirty. Dining options seemed terrible. I searched for anywhere decent to eat and sadly, the Bubba Gump Shrimp Factory seemed like the best choice - ugh. Not too many things to do, even the scenery was nothing to write home about. Glad that I saw it but wouldn't go back in the future.
What a lovely pier. We spent a happy few hours wondering around and did a few of the fairground rides then had dinner at Bubba Gumps. Really pleasant time
The crowds here were intense... Great walk from Venice beach to the pier, but once there we left quite fast...

Its touristy, it can be crowded, it has carnival type rides and games but its still very cool. Highly recommend if staying anywhere near there rent bike or scooter and cruise down from SM/the pier to Venice. lOts to see and do. The pier has an arcade that had 4 way air hockey which I had never seen before. If in the area it should be visited

We had a few hours to kill before a connecting flight home and came here to see what was on offer. Whilst it would be amazing fun for kids its a very pleasant place for adult too, and until our visit I never knew it was the end of Route 66. In surrounding streets lots of great pubs and restaurants make it a far better option that hanging around at the airport.
A great area to visit, easy to get to on the Hop On Hop Off bus. Plenty of shops and eating options either on the pier or on the street. A great carnival feel

Lovely day out, went back a few days later. The pier is pretty cool and the beach is beautiful. Easy walk down to Venice beach as well. The actually carnival on the pier is pretty cool, lots of food and souvenirs and the area is white nice. Free WiFi in the city area. Worth a visit

This pier is legitimately made of old wood. We parked on the pier and as you walk along toward the amusement park, you are walking on uneven board planks. It is so nostalgic and lovely. You are able to see the water between the planks and see all of the nuts and bolts of the structure. The amusement park is nice. There are rides and games. It is clean and looked well maintained. The game stands were not annoying as some carnivals can be. The rides are colorful and there is a nice variety. We appreciated not having to pay for admission to the pier as some places do. At the end of the pier, there were people fishing and a nice restaurant that smelled really good. There were also bathrooms that were well kept - they seem to constantly be cleaning them.
Everything you might expect from a tourist trap. Plenty of overpriced trinkets and t shirts on sale. Pretty views off the pier of santa Monica beach.

The pier was really nice. Food and bike rental was expensive. But we had good food. The cafe between Santa Monica and Venice had really good food. But 11.00 for 3 tacos, pizza was cheaper I think around 10.00 but it feed 3 kids. Drinks are pricey but you can get a large ice water for $1.00.Bikes were 10.00 an hour.Entertainers were cool. Clean and fun.

column2: Worthwhile to take a stroll and go
column3: It's a crowded place with all kinds of 'tourists'/visitors, and has a very touristy/commercial feel.The construction of the pier is quite spectacular, and is worth the visit, but the cheesy atmosphere, commercial attractions and fastfood kind of restaurants don't make it a place where I want to hang out more than an hour.

This pier is a mixture of arcade style rides/games and tat shops selling you the standard tourist stuff. I suppose it is one of the things to do while in Santa Monica but from our point of view it wasn't anything special

column2: Longtime dream dashed by a thief
column3: East Coast girl visits the iconic Santa Monica Pier (her longing built upon memories of the movie "Lost Boys") only to experience extreme disappointment by a thief, surging crowds of tourists and a shouting crazy lady who probably could use a medication adjustment. Had a great Pier Burger so it wasn't a complete loss. Skip the Pier and head south to Venice Beach.

This was second time visiting Santa Monica Pier, I thoroughly enjoyed myself both times. Rides are good, if you have small children they will love it. I have a 17yr old so she is a thrill rider so we could a couple and that was enough for her. She liked the people watching and of course the snacks on the boardwalk.It's on pier so it can get cool so bring sweater or sweatshirt. We visited in June and it was still cool even on the hot summer day. So be prepared especially with little ones.

We visited in May on the Monday of memorial weekend. The pier was very busy but this just added to the attraction. There's plenty of places to eat drink and visit. The street entertainers are excellent. Plenty of police so you feelsafe as well.

column2: Family and friends...fun in the sun!
column3: A great outing for young and not so young. Places for fun at the fair with shopping stalls..caf√©s...ice cream and more. Boardwalk is very exposed to elements so be sure to have hats and sunscreen and lotsa water with you. Beach is big with super soft beach sand...no pebbles. Close to 3rd Str Promenade and Santa Monica Plaza.

Was really cool to finally walk the pier, lots of performers and people on the pier. Was busy with tourists but not overwhelming. We were able to shop and watch some performers comfortably without getting crowded. Ate ate bubba gump (see review) and had a great time checking out the old school arcade
A must see if you're in Santa Monica. Beautiful beach and views. Fun place if you have kids, there are games, rides, and plenty of places to eat.
Look, the rides aren't anything special but the pier is outstanding and the gondola high above the beach is a terrific view. It's a must see if you've never been and always beautiful to come back to.

While it is a sight to see I felt like everything was overpriced. It cost eight dollars to ride one ride. Which makes no sense considering the rides pretty mediocre. The games were at least easy to when it works super expensive.

We were so glad that we stopped here. It was nostalgic to see. We loved seeing all the people, rides, and activities with the backdrop of the beautiful water. This place was a total California experience for us. There are plenty of restaurants so that you can grab lunch. This was a nice way to spend the afternoon with my family.

There are good rides for kids, and overall a pleasant stroll by the water, with many options for food and drinks, peppered with some street artists.If one is in the area, its a nice detour, especially if the weather is nice....I don't see it as a major or must see LA attraction (actually Santa Monica....), but if combined with other places in the area, like the promenade, it can fill up a day by the ocean.

Stop by and meet the world with the non stop parade of electic tourists. Bring small bills to tip entertainers or others will guilt you if you stop and enjoy the music and fun. Santa Monica Police are helpful, friendly while remaining viligent, and guard your back. Be sure to spend time watching the rolling ocean waves. Worth at least several hours.

My husband and I stopped here. We were in walking distance from our hotel.It's a great place to walk around. You can people watch, see street performers, shop, ride the ferris wheel. If you walk all the way to the end of the pier there is a mexican restaurant with great views.

column2: Great Fun on Sunday afternoon / evening
column3: While in Burbank visiting Universal Studios with kids and grandkids, we decided to visit nearby Santa Monica Pier. It was great fun and a good place to "people watch". It was fairly crowded and very lively. We had an early dinner at Mariasol Mexican Restaurant at the end of the pier. Our grandkids enjoyed watching the few sailboats and all the folks fishing off the pier. The adults enjoyed the coastal scenery. It was quite windy off the Pacific and slightly chilly even for early June. Take a light wrap if you go in the afternoon / evening! Our only complaint was that we got ripped off on parking. We didn‚Äôt know there was parking on the beach below the pier (I think $12) and we had already parked at a private parking lot up in the city about 2 blocks from the pier for $25!

You have to see this, the beach is really nice, the pier has lots of fun rides/things for kids, some of the street artists are excellent (some are terrible but it's still part of the atmosphere). Nice restaurants and parks in the area.
Great place to visit lots going on make sure you get a picture of the end of route 66 .Plenty of eating places.
Santa Monica is the best place. I've lived in california for almost 5 years , and Santa Monica has the most nostalgic memories. It's beautiful , it's lively and its gorgeous !

column2: A Great Place To People Watch!
column3: Lots of activity on the pier and lots of things to do, including eating snacks and riding amusement rides. One thing we noticed that was new this year were the artists that draw people's names as pieces of art. We bought one for our granddaughter - all three of us watched her create it. Fascinating. And reasonably priced at $1 per letter.

Hung out here for a couple of hours with a walk along the pier, a cocktail at the bar/restaurant at the end of the pier. Then took a wander by the beach, great for people watching. Strolled along to Venice beach.

column2: A quite, family, and couple getaway . . . and walking distance to everything . . .
column3: I had decided to visit Santa Monica on a cuff, enroute to San Francisco; but, I am very glad that I had taken the time to stop by . . . aside for both Venice and Santa Monica being a walking city/cities, I had managed to explore the intimate dining places, and walk along the beach. The Pier's Amusement Park and the people were an extra bonus. It is a place to go if you are looking to just cruise around, and take one's time to just enjoy the comforts without any rush . . .
Very crowded but the kids loved Pacific Park and their rides. Felt kind of run down overall and a bit dirty.

column2: Interesting way to pass an hour or so
column3: Quite good as there is a bubber gump here, there's a few cafe bars were you can eat and some kids things to do...overrated

If you are visiting LA , this is definitely a place to be. This pier has its own geographic importance as being the end of trail for Historic US route 66. The pier hosts a beautiful amusement park as well as lots of options for foodies. A great place to spend your afternoon, you can enjoy various street performances. People also come for fishing.
Absolutely fun place to spend the day, nothing beats Santa Monica pier. Old world conditions and historical attraction.

We drove on a Saturday and all the car parks were full at $10 or $12. We found a short term car park just down the steps to the right of the pier which is $1 per hr - you can stay for a max of 2 hrs which was all we needed to visit the pier & beach as we were so close to the pier. I thought this was much more family orientated than Venice Beach. Loved the candy floss & popcorn on the pier. Well worth a visit.

Take a stroll down this pier and see the souvenir shops, the artists selling items, and a few people feeding the birds (even when there are signs not to). There even was a place to try using a trapeze. When you are at the end of the pier looking out at the ocean, the nearby rides are not too loud. You can just stand at the end and watch the ships, birds, and the long beach. Don't miss the signs explaining the piers history.

I had such high expectations for this place. I thought it would have some great shops and restaurants with a decent crowd. I was so wrong. There were homeless drug addicts fighting (nothing against someone with an addiction or anyone who is homeless, just not what I pictured), incredibly trashy shops (and only a small amount) and horrible selection of food. It was the worst part of my trip to the west coast.
Good for a walk along - would be fun with children. The restaurants and bars are good too! Fun fun fun!!!
This place is full of crazy people trying to sell you stuff, the pier is a poor version of Brightons pier. I wouldn't go here again, go to Venice beach, it's much nicer (and less touristy).

We caught an Uber from Downtown LA to Santa Monica. It was beautiful. Definitely an attraction to be seen. Friendly people. Entertaining crowd. Perfect ocean views. Wish I could have hung out there all day. Even the restrooms were decent. Nice shops just up a few blocks as well. We caught the metro rail back to downtown.

This is a must place. The vibe on the pier is great and there are some very talented artists and some not so much. Great views of the Pacific Ocean and some of the coastline. We played the Zoltar fortune teller which was made famous by Tom Hanks in the film Big that was fun

column2: Good walk and the end of route 66
column3: Good pier lots going on but when we went it was really busy and the weather wasn't great. We live in a seaside town in the UK and it felt a bit like flying for 11 hours to arrive in Weston Super Mare.

Spent half a day in Santa Monica. We walked along the beach and went to the pier. Sort of strange having a carnival on a pier. It was packed with people. We much preferred to walk along the beach. A word of caution for those with children. If you head toward the skate park you will see shops that sell "medicinal" Marijuana. I personally headed the opposite direction with my children.
Always love to visit the pier on my trips to Santa Monica. Fun visiting the amusement park and shops.
We really enjoyed the pier and the beach with lots of rides for all ages alongside a fairground traditional American feel
Was super busy and super dirty so I wouldn't go back again or believe my friends recommendations again.

When you're in the Santa Monica area, no visit is complete without spending just abbot of time walking the pier to the end. From the music being played, to the vendors, the fishermen at the end of the pier, and all of the people watching!This is a great landmark for the area. If you're heading there, you have to stop at the pier.
Pity spent only a day.. would have loved to hang around longer...Cycling was great fun with the family.. too short to have enjoyed more

column2: A must do at least once
column3: You are never too old for the Ferris Wheel. We enjoyed the view and the summer fair experience of the Pier. It can get crowded at times and tickets to the rides are not cheap. 3 people on the Ferris Wheel came to about $27But it was worth it.

The Pier was smaller than I expected, but definitely a place to experience! It's crowded all day and into the night. There are a bunch of restaurants, food stalls, souvenir shops, street entertainers, etc. to keep the place busy.

Everybody has to see the Pier..right? OK...you see the famous sign and then, walk through a crush of people, street entertainers, mediocre food, etc. to enjoy the experience.See the Route 66 sign, walk around...and then beat feet off the pier and go somewhere along the paved sidewalk to eat.Glad I did it...but won't be returning again.Thanks

Santa Monica Pier is a great place to have fun. There is rides such as the Ferris wheel, roller coaster, etc. There are a lot of gift shops so you can get something to remember your trip. There is a Bubba Gumps and other restaurants there to feed you and keep you going. It is a must but only if you want to have fun. :-)

column2: Very cool pier and some rides!!
column3: I took my 16yrs daughter to see the pier and we had a great time! We rode some ride and eat some food. Took pic of Route 66 sign and watched people on the beach. The day we went was overcast and about 66 outside. We walked all the way down to the end and eat lunch. Parking for the beach is $12 per car per day and public parking is around the area from anywhere $10-40 per 8hours. Most garages close at 11pm and if you miss getting your car then you have to come back in the morning. Beware that there is a lot of traffic on the weekends and police have zero tolerance for any foolishness!

We stayed right on the beach when we dropped into LA recently - the pier was opposite our hotel. Its a strange pier in the fact that you can drive down it - and there is a small amusement park on it. The main feeling I had is that its a bit run down and grubby! Like most of my LA trip, it was good to see - but I wouldn't have been too disappointed had I not seen it. The one thing about LA that surprised me was the homeless problem they seem to have.

column2: Short Walk on a Long Pier
column3: I took a coach tour through Los Angeles, in 2007. Karl, the driver, stopped briefly in Santa Monica so riders could stretch their legs. I walked up & down the pier that I had seen in so many movies. Scenes of Baywatch & other shows ran through my head. I paddled in the water then sat on the grass to let my feet dry before donning my socks. I will always be grateful to Karl for that little side trip.
Totally awesome! Good atmosphere and beautiful landscape.For all family! Many entertainment options.

Wonderful little seaside park to relax and enjoy the views. And the pier is full of interesting and exciting attractions. We love the merry-go-round which has a biorhythm machine on the side. For $1 you can find out why you are so happy or sad. Have you significant other use the machine and get insight into the rest of you day.

column2: The best way to end our vacation
column3: It was our last day before flying home, and our favorite part of the pier was the very tip...which was very relaxing. I wanted to try a hand at fishing, but enjoyed watching the other people fish. Straight after eating at Bubba Gump I decided not to get on the amusement rides my daughter got on the roller coaster.We would love to come here again, but we will try to stay at one of their hotels and come to the pier at night.

Had to see this for myself - seen so many movies and photos of the Pier ...Just awesome - Ate at Bubba Gump, love the white sand and tidy beach, took the walk down to Venice beach for a snack and a look see. Got a guy to take us back to Santa Monica Pier on is bike and seat thing :) One of the more relaxing days of my trip.

This is a very lively place to visit. The entire area is festive including the beach, the pier and the surrounding area. Walking through the main streets is fun. As you reach the pier, if you are a total beach fan, it is good to take a dip in the water. Than you move up to the pier where you can enjoy all types of food and drinks, fun and games including a roller coaster and a ferris wheel. Good place to visit when visiting Los Angeles.

Make time to spend walking the Santa Monic pier. It is the end of Route 66 so grab a photo of that. Walk to the end of the pier and then take more photos (or selfies) looking across to the beaches. Look at the performers, buy from the stall sellers, have an ice cream, grab a meal, and go for a ride or two at the amusement park. We were there on a long weekend so it was really busy, but this just gave it an amazing atmosphere.

Didn't really enjoy Santa Monica pier at all, it looked tired and was rather tacky. The amount of homeless people nearby also didn't make feel too safe. I might be being unfair as I didn't really know what to expect and the weather was also cold and dull which may have skewed my perspective but I wouldn't visit it again.
I think i was expecting more. Although a great spot i was a bit disappointed with the choice of places to sit and enjoy the pier. Still worth visiting.

We stopped as most people probably do because you see the pier in so many movies and tv shows. Along with the rides you see it has stalls, restaurants and buskers. It also has nice views of the beaches. You are on a pier so the surface is not flat but is ok if you watch your step.
This place is crowded and crazy and interestng. Great views, a few restaurants and some wonderfully tacky souvenir shops. Not to be missed.

column2: Fun way to spend a couple of hours
column3: Rides, drinks, food, sun, sea and fabulous views.We went on the big wheel, we could see for miles, malibu in one direction and Venice beach in the other and direct ahead views of Santa Monica and LA. Fabulous.Nothing more to say.

Hint: park at Parking Structure 7 in town and walk down to the pier; free parking for the first 90 minutes at that parking structure.There is not much to say about this pier - the rides in the amusement park are packed too closely, and there are the usual food stalls and tourist gift shops. Be prepared for a large crowd.

The place is easy to reach with convenience parking space around. Spending time can be 30mins to 2hrs depends how much you would like to achieve.ExperienceHad a 1hr walk and was quite pleasant. Although shops are a bit touristy, which is totally understandable, the busking around did enhance the walk experience. A lot of birds flying around.The ViewView is great and very wide- able to see both sides of the coast line. Just one minor point - the beach wasnt too clean, found quite an amount of trash along the waves. Yet also spotted a cleaner so believe they are trying to fix this i hope :)? Besides, Theres a sign of "end of route 66" so its quite special too.FeeDidnt spend any but the shops around are not too rip offFits family/ friends/ just chilling
went here with my wife. first time in California. we loved it! so much to see and explore. we will come back soon

A must see if you're in the area. Iconic tourist destination. Fair type rides, food, great ocean views and the "end of the road" on the iconic Route 66! Rides and food are a bit pricey, but it's what you would expect for a tourist spot. We rode a couple of rides, ate pizza, walked around the pier and my daughter swam. She was the only one brave enough. The water was COLD, but it didn't stop her! A fun tourist spot to spend a few hours.

Visiting the Santa Monica Pier was on our list of "must do's" for our trip to LA. We visited on the Saturday of Memorial weekend, so not unexpectedly, it was very crowded. It is a quaint old pier, famous as being the end of old Route 66. It has spectacular views back towards the coast of the beach and coastal road. Well worth the experience, but moderate expectations.

column2: You Can Say You Were There
column3: I've heard all about this iconic pier and finally I can say that I've been there. Went there with my teens and having seen the pier in photos and on the internet, I feel that there's nothing like being there. Although it was crowded, it gave the sense of importance and I didn't mind seeing people there with probably the same intentions I had as well. I enjoy the smell of food, especially the hot churros that are being sold there. People enjoying the rides, and the other attractions made me feel like I was part of history. Where I'm from, they don't have this kind of stuff so I guess it was something out of a book for me.The beach was interesting to walk in and the water was okay. Nothing like the beaches in Maui but that's hard to compare with anyway. ;)There are a lot of birds flying around and some looked like they were about to land on people. The worst thing about the Santa Monica Pier is the parking. Absolutely difficult to find any parking. We had to park up the street at a pay to park valet type of business. All in all, everyone enjoyed the visit to the pier. It definitely is something to go to so you can say you were there.

column2: Great for kids and the whole family
column3: The pier is a great place for the whole family. Just be aware of the California coastal fog in June its call June Gloom. It could be cool before 12 noon. The afternoon is usuallysunny, but the fog roll back in the evening. September is the best month.
If you're in the neighborhood why not check it out. It feels how it looks but there were a few other unusual things too like a guy walking around with his live snake.
This was my first time to Santa Monica and I gotta say I was impressed , it wasn't trashy I felt safe by far one of the best Piers I have been to.

Lovely place to spend the dayCater to all agesLocation can find delicious hot dog üå≠The sands on the beach are very clean and the water is shallow and fine .Highly recommended for families to spend a full day
Nothing special about this pier. Comparable to the ones in San Francisco and San Diego. It's worth a visit but I wouldn't go out if you way if you are debating other choices.
Found the Zoltar machine which was a blast from my past. Love the atmosphere. People of all ages looked to have a great time.

column2: A fun way to spend an hour (or more).
column3: Family friendly, there are a few dining options, from fast to sit-down. There are also several shops, and don't forget the amusement rides!!

column2: Crowded, bright, great for picture taking
column3: It's an amusement pier. Loud, crowded, the food is expensive and not great. BUT- you can get terrific pictures of the ocean, the neon, the rides and all sorts of things. You can take a picture with the Zolton fortune teller from Big.You can ride the ferris wheel and look out over the ocean and back at the city. You can look at all the people and think about how people have been coming out here from almost 100 years to hang out, fish, ride rides, eat treats and just enjoy being out. That and the cool photo ops made it all worth it. I would recommend eating before you come onto the pier though- lots of places just across the street.

We always stop at the pier and ride the ferris wheel, which is a lot of fun and gives you a great view of Santa Monica and the Pacific. It's very touristy but we don't care. The food is mundane, especially given the great food on the mainland.
Crap hole. Feels like you will get stabbed at any moment avoid Santa Monica pier, Santa Monica beach and Venice beach.

Visited Memorial Day weekend and was crazy packed with people. That was fine and totally understandable for the holiday and gorgeous weather. The whole place seems a bit run down and not very clean but it was packed with fun and food!

We caught the trains from union station to get there, which was really easy to do. I was disappointed of the pier not as good as I thought it would be maybe the smog had something to do with it but I felt let down. We caught a bus to Venice beach then walked back to the pier. I thought Venice beach was discussing with the homeless people camped along the walkway.
Spent a Sunday here with friends walking down the pier, there was a nice atmosphere and people playing music at the end. Nice way to pass a few hours in a chilled out way

Memorial Day. Everything was packed. The attractions on the pier consist of the normal arcades, entertainers, and artists, but there is also some different stuff. A small amusement park and a trapeze (sp?) school are also located there.
This is a pretty cool place. It's pretty big! Make sure to go all the way to the end so you can watch the fisherman.
It was a holiday weekend! Loads of people! Great vibe, lots of police controlling the traffic. Many restaurants and activities for all ages!!

We visited on our way to LA. The pier was very busy but a good fun spot. There are the usual souvenir stalls and entertainers for your amusement. The is also a fun park with rides if you like that. A good place for people watching

column2: Really cool pier with a lot of charm
column3: Really cool pier with a lot of charm, but can get really busy on the weekends. This is a do not miss.

This is a very touristy pier. It is the western terminus of Route 66 . There are several restaurants and lots of vendors and entertainers. The people watching is fun. There was a seal in the harbor. Parking is $12 but handicap parking is free.

I've been to Los Angeles a few times each year for my entire adult life. One thing that's still fun is visiting the Santa Monica pier.You get the sounds and smells of the ocean, some great people watching, and snacks!Great for friends, families, or couples. Oh, don't forget your camera!
It's ok to say you walked on it given the history, other than that, better carnival places to go to.

After driving cross-country to San Diego my daughters and I decided to visit the Santa Monica Pier for a little Pokemon hunting. Coming from south Florida we were not prepared for the cultural differences. You hear about crazy traffic all the time but nothing prepares you for your one hour drive to be three and a half hours. If you plan on visiting the area and haven't done so before bring lots of patience, it will be needed.Parking was amazingly easy compared to the traffic. We found a nearby parking garage the first 90 minutes were free with an hourly rate after that about $2.Food trucks lined the streets, street art & performers, carnival rides, the beach and the sun. Pets are welcomed to the park and Pier, but keep in mind the area is full of bikes, roller bladders, skateboarders, and other pets. Our furry companion has issues with skateboards, thankfully he's a tiny dog. We carried him a large part of the time.
Good for the youngsters out for a night as not much really to do in Santa Monica. A dated old pier, not for me couldn't wait to leave. It's a hive of activity and very loud.

Talented performers on the pier and around the area. I feel it's very crowded and there are chains like Bubba Gump which is not necessarily why I would come to the pier. However during Memorial Day weekend they did have a tribute to veterans which was amazing.

After hearing about this pier I was so excited but quickly felt super let down. Just so much hype for a dirty pier. I would never let my child on the roller coaster as it looks old and dangerous. Also parking is a nightmare. The parking attendant couldn't speak English very well so when we asked a question we have no clue what his response was. I guess we should be glad there was parking though it is $12. Glad I went to say I did but won't be back.

Once in Santa Monica, well, you have to do it. But once there, and except if you are addicted to hyper-tourist-y places, you realize you are losing your time. Do the Venice Pier or the Manhattan Beach Pier for a nicer Pier-experience.
You have to see it at least once in a lifetime, the iconic Santa Monica pier where the route 66 ends. Good food on the surroundings, games and of the course the beach!

Don't get me wrong, it's fun for the kids, great beach area, but it's a tourist trap. I've been there at least 20 times and it's always the same. Tons of field trips there, kids running around. However, as a traveler, you must take a ride on the ferris wheel at least once in your lifetime. The views are spectacular. Perfect spot for some great photos over the ocean.
Place muste see in Los Angeles, also Route 66 ends here today. Small amusement park located here. Good views to the beach and sea.

If you are in the area, you simply MUST see the Pier! It is what you might expect, a bit crowded with lots going on. Live music everywhere and some really interesting people watching opportunities as well. The "rides" are, well, a bit lame, but so what? The food eateries leave a bit to be desired but there are some really great places a short walk from the pier. Cheap souvenir "kiosks" abound, but again, there is better shopping a short walk into town. Have fun!

column2: a walk up and down the pier
column3: What a lovely day and place was packed and also looking from the pier the beach was packed too lots to see as things going on all the time well worth a visit
Weather is nearly always great. Apart from shopping it's always good to go for a walk along the beach. At the pier there Are several shops and street entertainers

As a joke my son told me he wanted to go to California for spring break. As we live in South Carolina he never thought I would say yes. We packed a Mini Cooper and headed west. His goal was to get to the Santa monica Pier and put his foot in the ocean. Well we made it, and he loved it. As we walked out on the pier I could see he was crying, I asked him why and he said that he was so happy he could not believe we were here. It was a trip we will never forget.

This is a cool place to stop if your in the area. It's like a mini amusement park on a pier. There are rides, independent "street" shows, fair style food, and restaurants...not to mention the amazing Pacific Ocean view. Beware of the "watch/bracelet scammers", they ask if you know what time it is, then put a bracelet on your wrist and ask for payment.Other than that though, it's a great stop for families.

After seeing it in the movies, I expected it to be a beautiful scenic pier. Unfortunately, its the usual tourist rubbish with overpriced eateries. I liked the wooden boardwalk, but that's it. Its a must see for all tourists, but don't expect much. We only stayed about half an hour
Nice place to visit, walk around, site see, gorgeous views of the beach and beyond, food and drink, souvenirs, bathrooms convenient, rides and attractions for all ages!

column2: Worth a look if you're in the area
column3: Worth a look if you're in the area. Wouldn't go to visit it especially.Food places and restrooms and a. Nice view.

Santa Monica Pier is huge, with many restaurants, a fair, and more than anything, with the very best people watching both on the beach and on the pier itself. Parking lots fill up very quickly during week-ends and in the Summer, so it is better to try to get as close as possible in the early morning.

column2: Definitely a great time and weather was perfect
column3: We really enjoyed the carnival atmosphere and our 5 year old loved the rides. There were so many things to look at and enjoy. A must stop if in the area.

We had to visit the iconic Santa Monica Pier whilst visiting LA. The pier has lots of gift shops and fast foot outlets plus the funfair. The best part is the views. Amazing views of the whole of Santa Monica beach and the surrounding cliffs. beautiful.
One of the places I wanted to visit while in LA to say I did. Cute place. Since I don't have small children I probably wouldn't revisit.

simply wonderful!!!!! Santa Monica pier has a unique magic !!! Perfect to go in couple with family or friends !!!!! The weather was very good, sun, fresh air and that helped to enjoy all the attractions a bit more. There are many vendors selling food craft and souvenirs. Watching the town from the pier was spectacular !!!!! Without a doubt a place they should visit !!!!!
After going to Coney Island and Seaside Hts the Santa Monica pier was nice but not that spectacular. Was anticipating something bigger

column2: Packed with entertainment day and night
column3: Located in the middle between the two large beaches. There are lots of people on the pier both day and night. They have a carousel park, and our teenagers said it was fun. There are also a number of restaurants and bars there to keep you going.

...definitely for tourists or a couple on a first date.There are a few restaurants and the usual trappings of a tourist area - trinkets, t-shirts, ice cream/burgers/pizza. Nice walk on a sunny day.Suppose it's good for families w/kids (12 & under). Some of the entertainers were quite good.
The restoration have been great it's a fun iconic site. Lots to see and do. People watching was loads of fun lots of characters.

That's what it is. Not really impressed, but had to visit to finish our Route 66 trip. Lots of vendors and beggars. You pay $12 to park on the beach next to the pier. Some amusements and restaurants... Really only there to look and leave.
Definitely should be on your list of things to do in Cali! So colourful, so beautiful. Great food choices, didn't get to ride the Ferris wheel though because some of us were a little tipsy!
Had such a fun time there. Since we live in CO, we knew that we had to see the ocean when on the west coast. The ocean was beautiful and the people watching was even better

column2: A Must See when in LA area
column3: Being from Chicago, Santa Monica Pier is like going to Navy Pier....A Must See.Always fun to take in the sights form the pier and people watch.

I mean, if you're IN Santa Monica for the first time it's worth a visit, but it's kind of lame and rough around the edges. Also, we went on the ferris wheel and had to flag them down to let us off because the operators were pretty inattentive would run it really fast and jerk it to a stop. Mostly though, I felt like I was going to get mugged the whole time. Great sunset view, though.

Visited the Santa Monica pier today, love how it is accessible from the red metro line to the blue expo line drops you off a mere 5 to 10 min walk right to the pier, from the Hollywood area. Water is pretty close to the pier entrance compared to the Venice Beach area which is quite far from the ocean front. There is a walkway you can take from the Santa Monica pier to Venice Beach area, it is quite a jaunt takes about 45 min to walk here. You can rent bikes to peddle there, which would be a better idea. Souvenirs and food are cheeper in the Venice Beach area, pizza and pop combo for 3.99 was great and pretty tasty as well. Overall for cleanliness and safety I would suggest Santa Monica area, if your looking for more of the beachfront atmosphere and are with a group of people I would suggest the Venice area, a lot of starving artists in this area.
This pier is the end of Route 66 and is a must see lots of places to eat and lots of attractions on this pier .

The Boardwalk at this attraction has the vibe of memory. Ferris wheel and other more exciting rides, a huge arcade, lots of shops, and places to snack or eat a meal. And then of course there is an enormous beach and beautiful view. Free public bathrooms. Access from Metro rail a few blocks away, parking, easy walk from town.

column2: Finally made it to the Pier!!
column3: Having seen this pier and the infamous ferries wheel on so many TV shows and movies I was glad I could finally visit it in person. While some may consider this a tacky tourist stop, others may enjoy the nostalgia I experienced including the views from the pier of the surrounding area. The pier offers a few spots to eat and grab a drink including endless souvenir possibilities. Make sure you spend sometime watching the fishermen at the end of the pier as they try their luck. You may also see a large friendly pelican strolling along the pier, a great photo op for those who dare to get close.Give yourself about an hour or so for a quick visit before you head to Venice beach.

We stayed nearby and made several trips to the pier. During the week it is a wonderful, quaint place with lots of fun vendors, shops and restaurants. During the weekend? Well... It's very crowded to say the least. No one's fault. It's a popular place. But try to go during the week.

Walked the beach path from hotel to pier, which was a treat in itself. PIer is very accessible and not too busy when we visited. Just walked around and had a funnel cake (to die for) and took in the sights. A great place to just hang for an hour or two.
Very little to do at the pier. At night it is a little sketchy. The ferris wheel did not look inviting. The beach and sunset was pretty.
This is a good sized pier, it offers food, amusements, coffee shops, bike hire, shops etc and is good to walk along and enjoy.

At least nothing special for us, as we have several such piers at our area, the Jersey Shore. The usual tourist shops full of the usual chachkies and trinkets, a few rides for the kids, but not tons of families present. There were some interesting characters and street performers who apparently take up residence on the pier. The pier is historic and iconic, so worth a stroll up and down if you are visiting the area, and the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier, Mariasol, was surprisingly excellent.

This pier is fun day or night. It does light up so pretty at nighttime and there is great carnival fun too. There are also a few restaurants to eat at if your work up an appetite or just want to stop for a bite ocean side. Date night or with the family you must go!
The pier , the end of road 66 , the sea shore , all in one spot that gives it the attention, the visitors and some ambiance too .Yes, all visitors must visit and say they have been there.

I wanted to love it. The ocean and beach were beautiful. The shops were hokey but you expect that from a tourist trap. The musicians playing on the pier were quite good. The pier looks a little run down though and the rides look like death traps. One thing to make me feel like this pier is not amazing was when we were walking the pier in the morning, police were fighting with this guy trying to handcuff him. I know this can happen anywhere for sure, but I found it quite off-putting. The food was carnival type food. I just expected more overall.

We visited the pier on our trip to Santa Monica pier, and got in using our LA go cards, which are such good value for money and I would highly recommend them. The pier itself has some nice places to eat and drink, and live music to watch when we were there.In terms of the fair itself, it is a good day out for couples, families, and groups of friends. There are a number of attractions suitable for all different kinds of rider, so there is something for everyone. It was such good fun, and lovely surroundings.
The pier is really nice. There is a small amusement park on it where you can have fun. Nothing fancy but just regular staff. Quite a popular place for a sun set watching.

It was a first time visit... a good visit. Lots of people, busy busy busy. After paying $12 for parking, we strolled around the pier and doing the touristy things. Great walk, nice ocean breeze on a hot sunny day. Splurge $33 on the ferris wheel ride for 4 which creates a memory of a lifetime.
Ride the ferriis wheel eat funnel cakes at night right on the beach! The beach is great for people watching and enjoying every moment.

We made a special trip to ride the Ferris wheel only to get there and find out Pacific Park was closed to the public due to a private event! I talked to the security people and told them we came from all the way from Indiana and wanted to ride it and asked if I could talk to management to let us in to only ride that and was directed to a place that was gated and locked. Super ticked AND disappointed! The Pier itself has the usual tourist gift shops. A few restaurants and food carts scattered here and there. What was nice tho was after going down stairs, there was a planking walkway to the beach. This keeps your shoes from getting all sandy!

column2: California Landmark in a Foggy Day
column3: We were very unlucky to visit on a terribly foggy day and were not able to see the waters of the Pacific Ocean. It was extremely cold as well. But this is a CA landmark that we have seen on so many TV shows and movies so we did not regret making the trip from Hollywood, CA to Santa Monica Pier. We walked around for a bit, took pictures at the Pier, and ate some Mexican food. We will definitely be back the next time we visit LA.

We visited the pier on Mother's Day for brunch. The pier is a fun place to visit with several restaurants. Most of the restaurants are seafood type places and the food is always fresh caught. We enjoy the beach scene and the pier and make it a place we frequent when we visit Santa Monica.

It's a hefty stroll out to the end for a nice view of the ocean, but honestly we enjoyed seeing this famed pier better from the beach! It was crowed and the street vendors hassle you--in addition to playing very loud, obnoxious boom box music. I suppose if you have children they may enjoy the amusement rides, but bring plenty of money for that.

We had spent the afternoon on the beach which was great. Busy but very clean and the waves were great but a little cold.Had a wander along the pier. It was nice but reminded me of a pier in the northwest of England with better weather.

Cool place to visit and check out the view. There are quite a few food places to choose from as well as souvenir stores. The people watching is one of the best parts of visiting here. Check out the sunset from the end of the pier if you can, makes for great pictures.
Go if you want to say you've been there. Over priced $8.50 for one ride per person. $14 for a burger. Not worth the price at all! Crowded and pricey! Parking was pricey as well.

Visited the Pier as one should when in LA and it looks like it is on its last legs (unless they want it to look like that).Nice to visit though and have a look and I must say the beach along Santa Monica is excellent, miles of sandy beach and very well maintained.

Some would describe this pier as world famous, as a U.K. resident, I've seen a few piers in my time.....it's nothing special. Forest Gump had the right idea, he ran to the end, turned around and ran off again. On a serious note, the pier is on a stunning beach, has a few fair ground rides and places to eat/drink. Worth a visit, but I would be surprised if you were there longer than an hour if not eating or drinking.

column2: Don't miss it if your in LA
column3: Santa Monica Pier is world famous and its worth getting out there if you're in LA. There are great views of Malibu out to the right/North and Venice beach on the left/South and nice surf (one of the locals said watch out for sharks but there were plenty of swimmers the day we visited). 3rd St Promenade is within walking distance for plenty of shopping and restaurant options. You can walk from here to Venice beach as well. The Pier itself is abuzz with activity including musical performers, heaps of tourists and locals, fisherman, shops and Pacific Park (a kids theme park with rides and activities). There is a coffee shop (Coffee Bean) for the coffee lovers. And photo opportunities galore.

If you want piece and quiet, then a good place to go. The funfair was not operating that day. Nothing seems to happen until lunch time when the eateries open. I would have thought lost trade for them.Interesting to see the end of Route 66 sign as we had been on parts before.
What more could you want from a pierBarsFood outletsEntertainmentFunfair Ridesall with a view of the beach and sea

Went for along walk from Venice to the pier at Santa Monica. The pier was as expected and worth a visit but not amazing in any shape or form. Great to kill a couple of hours and tick the"been there " box
Here with my 24&20year old daughters. More of a place to be with young children who may enjoy the rides. A couple of beach type shops and food vendors. Nothing to write home about.

What a fun place! There's the amusement park with rides and games. Then there's the pier with music, vendors. Such a fun vibe!! I parked at the short term parking, a few minutes walk from the pier. It's only 1$ an hour for a max of 2hours. But if you were to go back, I'm sure you can pay for another two hours ;). The cheapest place to park!
We had a great time walking along the pier and playing the games. We walked to the end to take a picture with the End of Route 66 sign. Beautiful beach!

We enjoyed our short visit to the pier. It was Friday night and the place was abuzz with people.There's so much entertainment options - both free and pay as you go. There's some shopping and plenty of eating and drinking options too.Beautiful views from the pier and the restaurantsThe night lights are gorgeousBusy place but worth the visit

column2: Take a walk, soak in the atmosphere, enjoy the view.
column3: I had a wonderful time at the pier, the last stop of route 66. But there is no need to stay too long. We walked up and down, listened to some music and took some fun pictures. There was a lively atmosphere and the view was great. Afterwards I highly recommend strolling along Ocean Avenue for some fresh beach air.
Typical beach pier with rides, restaurants and tourist tat. But as it's the end of route 66 it must be done. Very busy but all the fun and excitement you could hope for.
Typical beach pier. Rides and food vendors you could find anywhere. Very crowded on weekends. No big deal
Nice evening, not over crowded. Lots of pan handlers. A few gift shops. Few food places. Had to go check it out since here in LA
What a great time. I loved the atmosphere and vibe. The musicians playing were magical. I recommend this historical site.
Fun to take young kids to. Not very crowded during the week. Parking available but lots of traffic. Good place to walk to from the Loews Hotel.Free concerts on Thursday nights over the summer.

column2: This is a pier! Look at the ocean too!
column3: While the sights on the pier are fun with the rides, little booths, performers and variety of ages, sizes and demeanors of people, make sure to stop and remember why there is a pier! We spent an hour watching a seal surfing the waves right on the side of the pier by all the rides. No one else was even by us and the few who ventured over took a quick selfie and left. Maybe everyone else sees so many wave surfing seals that they are jaded. However, it was really fun for us and we were happy to experience it! Also interesting are the posters telling the piers history. We were very happy to slow down and enjoy the day on this vacation.
We were here on a Sunday evening and it was extremely crowded. I would still recommend going here, though. Great views from the end of the pier.

We parked opposite Wyndham Hotel, public park nice and cheap 90 minutes was free. The walk to the Pier is about 10 minutes. The buskers and the entertainers were fantastic. Micheal the magician is recommended. We got there just at sundown and made it back in the dark. Great lights with the Ferris wheel all lit. Most recommended to all. Just keep the little ones close since the crowds can be intimidating.

column2: Fun to walk along and get ice cream; soooo crowded
column3: Cool spot to walk along but it's so crowded and the buskers playing music are obnoxiously loud. Fun carnival food indulgences and souvenir shopping.

column2: Great atmosphere, entertainment - good ( not great ) food
column3: Caught the light rail from DTLA to Santa Monica and headed straight to the famous pier. A joy to behold as we approached, with the amusement park standing out , the sounds of street performers obvious and the beach holding all together. Not sure on the value of the rides although I thoroughly enjoyed the roller coaster. Some great musicians around different areas of the pier. Some cool stores to buy quirky souvenirs. Had the great Japanese hotdogs for lunch. Delicious.Came back for dinner. Disappointed some diners were already closed - was looking forward to ice cream but closed early. Many options were bit fast foody. Went for Gump in the end - was nice but would have liked better options. But great day nonetheless.

One of those must do's whilst in LA to say that you have been.Something for everyone from preachers on the pier to demonstration on the board walk to side show alley for the kids.Essentially it is just a beach though.
Love walking by with family and friends. Nice place to hang out, listen some music and eat. Then you should walk to Venice.
Everything goes on this pier! It's great. From solo singers, to teenage bands and good food, along with an amazing view

I've been to piers in other cities and this one is very similar. It caters to tourists, has a lot of tacky shops and overpriced restaurants. I went on a Tuesday morning and it was a nice visit. It was busy but not packed. I enjoyed the sun, the musicians and didn't buy a thing. I can see this being very fun for a family or someone who has never been to a pier before. It was a great walk and a gorgeous day. I have no complaints.
Nothing impressive here- just a couple of rides and the pier. If you are around the area go for a stroll. Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend you to plan this as one of your tourist activities.

The Pier has a carnival atmosphere. Lots of people having fun and some unusual ones busking. Plenty of Tourist shops. There's a restaurant right on the end (Mexican) where we had lunch and recommend it. There's numerous other places to eat too from fast food style to more restaurant style.You can also drive down onto the Pier and park on the Pier. Don't know if it cost.There's a 100 year old Carousel at the beginning of the Pier too which is inside a building.Has a great vibe and of course there's the mini theme park out there too. Great place to go.

If you've done a CA pier, you've pretty much done this one. There are some rides for children at the beach end. Tourist shops line one side with musicians playing for tips on the other. There are restaurants at the sea end with numerous fishermen. It is a fun place to stroll and people watch.
This is neat to see once but honestly was not very impressed. It is just a large pier with okay food and vendors.

We visited the pier as chaperons with a group of sixty high school students who were on their senior trip from Pennsylvania. There were many things to see, vendors, musicians and fishermen strung out along the pier. We had dinner at the restaurant at the end of the pier and also had a meal at Bubba Gumps which is located near the entrance. We spent several hours in the area and everyone had a great time.
Weather was beautiful and the pier was a fun place to visit. Lots of little shops and restaurants. Between the pier attractions and the beach you can spend a good amount of time here.

column2: A day in the sun and surf and walk along the pier.
column3: We had a few hours to ourselves and spent them here, we walked the pier and took in all the attractions...sights and sounds. The atmosphere is carnival-like, with several rides, including the ferris wheel and roller coaster. Come in the evening to see all the rides lit up! Many different places to eat, from burgers to fine dining.
Santa Monica Pier is a real classic LA landmark. It's very nice to take stroll on the Pier, grab a bite, and go on some classic rides. For travelers, I'd say this is a must visit when in LA.
this place very tacky nothing excited lots of old rides give impression of flea market few restaurants
Don't go on a weekend or Friday afternoon! It's bedlam! Sort of Brighton Palace Pier on steroids. West Coast Coney island. People are fairly fit and beautiful though. Great for photographers.
Really enjoyed walking on the boardwalk and seeing all the vendors with booths set up. Carnival type rides were neat to watch. Lots of food options and beautiful scenery.

column2: Ahh the Sun the fun and the food
column3: Santa Monica pier alive with characters, tourists , buskers , trinkets and amazing California sun light - Marisol provided some of the best fajitas I have had - parking on the pier was convenient and not super expensive -the beach and surf was amazing -all in all a must see !!
Bring a jacket along because it gets windy and cool. Sit down and enjoy the sound of the ocean and the coolness of the breeze of Santa Monica.
The pier has fun no matter where you turn. Restaurants, rides, candy, carnival food. When you finish at the beach for the day, go to the pier, a few steps away, for fun at night.

Great for everyone !Adult : great view of the coast , great restaurants -the Lobster , Bubba Gump Shrimp co and more ..for kids : so much fun with all the rides and below the pier a very smalll aquarium but great for little ones with hands one .Nice to walk to the end of the PierIf you like games there is the Arcade tooAlso close by ho to the 3rd street promenade for shopping and wailking aroundGreat place , I love it and always enjoy it

column2: Very busy! Not much room to move!
column3: As much of an interesting attraction the Santa Monica Pier is, it can get very busy which makes it seem crowded. Add to that the heat on some days and it's a lil unbearable. Though it is a must see spot if going to Santa Monica!
if you are in the area it is a must see nice scenery from the pier there are many shops and attractions and of course fishing if you are in to that
Nothing special about the pier. Same expensive rides and carnie games. However, walk out to the end to watch the fisherman fish. You might even see a seal make fun of their fishing!

This place is about what you'd expect: a little kitschy, a little trashy, a little classic Americana -- but generally fun. Rides, food, a little bit of shopping, an aquarium, the beach...what's not to like? There's no shade, so wear sunscreen and take a hat.

We are locals and have been coming here for more than 10 years. It is what everyone else said; carnival, tourist trap, etc. but it's also fun especially with smaller children.We had our twins birthday party at the enclosed carousel. Used to meet our friends from the valley every spring break and kids would play and ride until the passed out.In addition to the amusement park, we love the carousel and the small touch aquarium underneath. At the pier there is fishing, watch the surfers, and people watch in general. Awesome on a clear night when the park is ablaze with lights. At night you can grab a bite or beer and hear liver music as well.Parking can be pretty bad in peak season or if there is an event on the pier.

column2: Always a fun place to go to.
column3: We loved visitng the Santa Monica Pier. Great views of the ocean, fun at the rides. It's also easy to find a place to at. It gets a bit crowded on weekends, so if you can go there during the week, then that's a better choice.
Took a walk on a beautiful Friday evening surrounded by thousands of teenagers. Very noisy and certainly not for everyone
The Santa Monica pier is a must whether you live here or you're traveling here come right before sundown and eat at the Lobster/ next-door they have a great happy hour appetizers and drinks

column2: Quick weekend/weekday getaway for beach lovers
column3: On a weekday, my friends and I drove to Santa Monica Beach and it just took us 20-minute to get there but I doubt it on a weekend, the traffic might be crazy. We enjoyed walking on the boardwalk, taking picture, browsing some souvenir shops, while chatting. For beach lovers, it could be a nice place to surf, stroll or spread you beach towel and get a tan. But since it's a tourist area, it's a little bit crowded.
Obviously tourist shops, but was clean and nice. Couple homeless wandering around living under the pier, but that's LA

The pier is worth a visit. We were there on a cool misty night so it wasn't very busy. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Just one of those " well known spots " around LA that are worth checking out . Better beaches elsewhere if you are looking for a beach day though.
Even if you just come here, spend no money and just look around, it is so worth travelling to! The view back from the end of the pier is magical, especially at nighttime!

This brought so many memories of Baywatch looking down from the pier! Miles of sand either side. The pier has various little shops, amusements and places to eat it's also the end of Route 66. Great place to visit and chill.

Not worth seeing. The amount of homeless people is unreal. I had to step over their belongings on multiple occasions because they are strewn all over the walkways. There is no law enforcement, it really didn't feel safe. The pier is dirty and crowded.

We were pleasantly surprised at how clean the pier was. With so many people there we thought there might be trash, but the place was very clean. Plenty of people watching. Lots of live entertainment all along the pier. You can park on the pier. There is also an amusement park with a small Ferris wheel and roller coaster.Great views of the coast.

Well soon many people but I guess that's what it's all about. Lots of homeless just like Hollywood, we used the hop on off bus to get there. Cloudy day it would have been nice on a fine day. Lots of busker type people. Some good acts. Don't have kids so wasn't interested in rides. Was ok to say we had been there.

column2: Santa Monica Pier highlight is Big Dean's Ocean Front Cafe
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a must see at least once in your life. It is a fun place and has some old and very interesting game machines including the fortune telling heads! We have been there a few times and its always nice for a visit although the rides and food are not a big attraction. It's more the just being there, feeling the vibe and looking out on the beach which draws us back. But this visit we found something really worth telling you about: Big Dean's Ocean Front Cafe. It is not actually on the Pier but very very close, just a few steps away. This place is really great. The best burger I have eaten in the USA, very well priced and very lovely friendly staff. The kids had hotdogs and buffalo wings. Some in our group had their Double burgers. We were so impressed. We sat outside in very pleasant open area. The guy who served us heard our Aussie accents and went out of his way to recommend things we should do in Santa Monica. A lovely day at Santa Monica Pier and at Big Dean's.

We talk a walk along the promenade and were pleasantly surprised to find we could wander on and around the entire pier.A mass yoga session was in play with hundreds of participants near the shore, and as we wandered further out shapes in the sea became apparent and we were treated to not only seals but also a pod of dolphins....simply amazing.Sun was out so on we walked, we found the noisy buskers a little irritating and loud, they did not detract too much though.In the centre of the pier there is a small fun fair which whilst we didnt partake certainly looked like a great way to while away a couple of hours

I have no idea what we were expecting, but what we saw was a nice enough pier, which was a little run down. A few little stalls and a few entainers (one amazing violin player) . Took all of an hour to do the rounds, was nice to see the end of the Route 66. Worth a trip just to say you've been.

column2: The view from the pier is the best bit
column3: Worth a visit, on Ocean Ave, central location. Free entry to the Pier, lots of things to see, places to grab a take away to sit down and eat. People drawing portraits, paintings of local sights, talented buskers and cute automated fortune readers. Take a seat and enjoy the loveyl view out to,sea, back to Malibu or towards Venice, all lovely.
It's a fun place to visit. The Pier is very crowded and the rides are for younger children. There's a lot of fun games and I always like amusement piers.

column2: A staple when visiting the area
column3: It's an iconic pier. Lots to do and see. There's no shortage of folks with mental health issues milling around, but that doesn't really put me off. Lots of police presence to help tourists feel safe. Beautiful at night.

column2: A tourist spot, but a great view.
column3: We visited the pier just before sunset after eating and shopping nearby. It was perfect timing, as there was a beautiful sunset less than an hour after we arrived. It was a great spot for an after-dinner treat and people-watching.

column2: Iconic - But Don't Break a Leg Going
column3: I had such high hopes for the Pier - movies, music videos etc.However getting there - it's pretty run down and not at all well maintained.Visiting many other beaches and piers, such as Vancouver Granville, San Fran & Seattle - those happening Pier's are full of food choices and gorgeous views.Santa Monica is crowded and great for a young crowd - but the beach was SO DIRTY, trash everywhere and the surrounding buildings were run down.It definitely is a must to visit, just to check it out, and of course the classic Sunset photos - however if you don't have time for it, I wouldn't be too upset about it.UBER if you can, parking is atrocious!
One of the must do things in LA this pier appears in many movies and offers great sunset views. The Mexican Restaurant at the end is worth stopping at too.
Went to the pier on Sunday. There were 7 buses outside the pier. The walk was nice but it was wall to wall people. If you go do it during the week not the weekend. The view were very nice.

This was an amazing beach in terms of size and extras. Most of the time we come to California with the school we go to hunnington beach. Santa Monica was closer this year, and thank goodness it was. Just take a walk on the pier or take a stroll on the nice Beach which is so large it couldn't even be considered crowded.

column2: It's a must if your in LA
column3: The iconic pier is a mustWe enjoyed strolling along it, listening to the entertainers and people watching!Loads of places to eat and drink here too if you want to!Check it out.. plus parking on the pier is pretty cheap as well!! So no need to park miles away!
If you are looking for a walk in a good weather maybe some shopping, this would be the place. And there are also some good places to eat. I tried the Cheesecake Factory and I loved it
Enjoyed this so much going on, street performers, artists and singers all make for a good time. Plenty to eat and such choice all next to a great beach, and, there is no charge to enter.

Wow what a fab place Went on a Sunday when it was busy. Lots of facilities including beach cafe where you can sit and watch the world go by with no pressure to leave.We walked to Venice beach and found it weird and wacky But Santa Monica was the nicest.

We got to the Piet about 10am reason because they said to get there early. Glad we did! We got there and parked right on the pier. For the whole day 15 but we only stayed a couple of hours and it was about $9. Everything opens up at 11am. We enjoyed the morning and walked all the way to the end of the pier. It wasn't crowded and just enjoyed the beautiful scenery. At 11am we ride the Ferris wheel,got a funnel cake and just sat and watched the crowds. We then decided to walk down to Venice Beach!!!! Don't go there. Very disturbing. Embarrassment to Venice Beach. We felt very unsafe, many homeless asking for money for drugs. Horrible!! If you want to rent bikes from Santa Monica pier and ride down there but don't get off your bikes. Come back to the pier. Fun day at Pier but sad and scared at Venice beach!

column2: How can this not be great
column3: Classic fun, almost always great weather, a must visit if you are in the area. The ferris wheel is my favorite. Don't leave without visiting Zoltar!
Very touristic ... not my type of placeToo many people and good for those who like to travel in group like sheep's....good for those who like to travel by tours , by cruise or in mass ....
Nice place on the shore. Plenty of tourist gift shops, scenic views of the beach, authentic pier and also the Route 66 official ending.

I was here on a saturday which is of course the busiest day, good for the whole family, lots of people, good entertainment, flat fee parking is not hard to find. If you can come early then you can park closer to the pier. Washrooms are not bad compared to venice beach.

This is a place to return a thousand times , the places to have lunch are ok, the people hanging there are so cool and relaxed we were shooting some scenes for a great tv show and the people loves to get involved in the filming processesBesides everything there is always the possibility to check your future with Zoltar
Hey, it's the Santa Monica pier; does it need a description? It was fun to walk through and they had clean public toilets. Totally touristy but still have to do it!
Beautiful day, sunny, beach was full of people, great vibe on this street. Lots of vendors but was such a beautiful day. The pier is well kept.

column2: Fun just walking along with the throngs.
column3: Took my hubby to Santa Monica pier as he had never been. We enjoyed just walking along the pier and people watching. There are of course a lot of tourist, but the locals are also very colorful. Does not take long to walk the length and you are at the end officially of US Rte 66! How cool is that? You may eat, drink and be merry as much or as little as you want.

We visited on a Wednesday evening. It wasn't very busy which was nice. We rode the roller coaster. You get to go twice with one ticket. It was fun, but not a thrilling coaster at all. More like a fast train with a beautiful view. We also rode the Ferris wheel. It had an amazing view of the ocean.After the rides, we walked down the pier and watched the waves. We saw seals jumping in the waves. We saw fisherman which was cool as well. The sunset was amazing to see from here as well.

A wonderful day out for all the family. Lots to do and see for the kids including rides, fishing, many eating places and ice-cream of course, tourist shops, local arts and crafts, musicians and much more. If the weather is great you could spend all day.
This is a place with a few fast food small restaurants, a playground area and souvenir shops. Is nice for spending max 1 hour, for making photos and admire the ocean. It is also an expensive area.

column2: Iconic MUST SEE in So Cal
column3: We visited at PRIME TIME...Saturday night.Parking is a nightmare, get down to the area BEFORE noon and expect to spend $20 on parking....at a parking garage. Walked the 3rd street promenade and enjoyed the shopping and street performers. Clean and safe.....Great Saturday afternoon experience.

column2: A fun filled pier with great beach
column3: The Pier is a nice place full of attractions. The beach is great to walk and relax but crowded a bit. The pier has a park with rides for children and lot of eating joints and souvenirs shops. The best attraction for us is the Word Art vendors, they wrote your name or whatever you want in such beautiful manner that one gets really amazed. The beach and pier has ample parking space.One can find parking space in hotels outside the pier front too.

column2: Come here to enjoy boardwalk fun, rides and food. Don't forget the beach
column3: Famous beach with boardwalk and pier. It features good boardwalk food with amusement rides and fun.For relaxing times, enjoy the beach. Crowds may be much but you enjoy your time here.Head to boardwalk for food , shops.
Got sunset time ! So many people but not feel packed ! They have ride for people and food ! Also entertainment! Very nice !

column2: One of the best places in LA to view sunset
column3: We reached there just before sunset and managed to catch the setting sitting there. In addition to that it also has the Pacific Park and several shops and restaurants lining the Pier where one can spend time
Like the symbol of Santa Monica, pier is like top attraction. Fun park, many small shops and souvenir places. Street musicians, endless panoramic ocean view. a must see while in town.

This was the end to our most amazing Route 66 experience and it was not to disappoint. The sunset was something to behold and the pier is lively and vibrant. A great landmark and a walk to the end of the pier to look out over the ocean is a lifetime experience not to be missed.
Nice place to visit, but too many "junk shops" and chain restaurants. Needs something a little more polished to make it a destination for people without kids.

It is a great place to take a walk, the view and beach is great, we saw some seals swimming nearby. The pier has all sorts of vendors, such as food and souvenirs, as well as kids attractions. The only downside is a number of homeless people just outside the pier. I understand that's the problem of LA in general, and there are more downtown, but I feel that something has to be done about it to attract more tourists and families with children.
Hadn't been on a Pier like this since I was a child. How fun it is to walk around in the evening! Lots to see, great atmosphere. Good for all ages.

So...... we heard so much about this place that we decided to have a drive down to see for ourselves. Of course this still being L.A. we had to navigate the unavoidable L.A. traffic which took us about two hours from Anaheim because we were stuck in an accident which compounded our travel time.Anyway, we drove by the famous "Venice Beach" on our way to the pier. Once here, we were ferried into their parking lot which filled up with tourist pretty quickly. The parking lot itself is part of the pier and made out of wood.As we started out stroll along the pier you can see the beach for miles and bathers starting to gather for their "tanning session." The pier is dotted with concession stands as well as the usual "street performers" that you might see anywhere there are tourists.There is a small amusement section with a Ferris wheel and the usual stands for games. At the end of the pier you see others who go there for their daily walks to tourists taking pictures as proof that they were there. There is also a restaurant with spectacular views of the beach and ocean but they weren't open for the noon service.Overall, this small pier was a pleasant stop to wherever your headed for the day!
We went there for an afternoon. The pier is a must see when in the area. The rides were high priced, but you must go on the Ferris wheel. We saw whales about 1000 yards off of beach.
Watch people watch the sunset Good selection of a variety of foods.I feel safe there and parking was easier by using their parking.

We went there yesterday with a Bus hop on and off and it was a great view/ place to visit!End of 66, has a small park ( everything you need to pay), food, etc.The food there at the Pier is not great.We had the tacos and tasted awful.
Cool and fun . If u are in Santa Monica for the weekend and u have nothing to do, go ahead and have some fun on the Pier .There is enough to do and see .
Look at the sunset from Santa Monica Pier is amazing, a lot of young people, life, music and positive feelings, you need to visit. I suggest starting from 7pm
My tween loved the pier. It was fun with some rides, a ferris wheel and bumper cars and others. There are some seedy characters walking around but definitely a family atmosphere.

We were here on a Fri afternoon after a business trip before heading back to snow in Denver. It was crazy crowded and we decided to eat just off the Pier instead of at the restaurants available there. We did drive right down & park on the Pier. It was an experience for my kids. There were probably cheaper options but getting there around 3pm on Fri there were plenty of spots. It is a max of $15 and I think we were there almost 3 hours on the Pier, Beach & eating near by so pricey but chalked it up to being tourists.

Today is great out at the pier. It is a little windy but not over crowed. I never realized The famous Route 66 ended on the pier. Having a great day. The Carousel ride was cool and cheap at only 2 dollars for adults and 1 dollar for kids.

column2: Great for Pokemon and more besides!
column3: Super views from this iconic pier. The games and rides are on the tacky side, just like any pier anywhere, but what a fun and cheerful place. Bubba Gump's had wonderful shrimp and seafood. Make sure to ride the Pacific Wheel just as the sun is setting,The pier is renowned for its Pokemon. We caught loads of rare ones and the jewel in the crown was a super-rare Typhlosion!

I wouldn't say that the Santa Monica Pier is definitely fun to walk in in particular. I've only been here when it was dark and it feels like it was filled with kids, weird people and tourists. Although I would recommend to overview it in the sunset, then it's really beautiful. I would recommend to take a stroll by the beach and enjoy the view rather than be on the pier.
