This is the iconic pier you've seen in so many movies and TV shows. It's a nice attraction that allows you to walk on a timber board pier into the Pacific ocean. There's plenty of shops to buy your souvenirs. There's a sign on the pier announcing the end of Route 66. It was fun to get a picture under it. There are several nice bar restaurants on the pier along with some amusement park rides.We watched the sunset from the pier then enjoyed a nice dinner at Rusty‚Äôs Surf Ranch on the pier along with a pint or two of their red lager.We thoroughly enjoyed our time on the pier with it's history, view, and the surrounding beach.

column2: Wonderful place to people watch and feel the breeze
column3: This is a must see when in LA. It's a great place to see all kinds of people, experience good food and have a great time.

Our first time here and didn't expect such large crowds. The pier was packed to say the least! But it's an icon and must be walked. Enjoyed looking at it from afar especially at night. The solar paneled Ferris wheel is not to be missed.

We loved visiting the pier. We took the bus and it was very easy to get there. I would recommend going on Saturday morning when they have a farmers market going. It is a few streets above the pier. We just had the best fruit juice from a farmer. It is worth a try. The pier is beautiful and with a beautiful view to the ocean. A lot to see and experience. Loved the performers on the street, very entertaining...

column2: It was ok...nothing spectacular to see
column3: It was crowded, not that much shopping. If you like games and rides there was a good selection but nothing fantastic and I didn't even look at the prices. I wish there was more places to sit, maybe have a snack and look at the view. The best was at the end of the pier, there are stairs to sit and visit and have a snack.

Had a fabulous day here! The beach and sea are beautiful and the Pier is full to bursting with eating places, rides, stalls and entertainers! Lots of seating areas to sit and enjoy so much activity or just to watch the sea and look at the amazing views!There was lots of car parking but we didn't use it so don't know how much it wasWell worth a visit

We went to recover from a long day at Disneyland, and it was so worth it. We ate at Bubba Gump's, and it was delicious!The fog covers the tops of the buildings, the sea breeze, the waves.....everything is just perfect!
Such a beautiful place and relaxing and fun to enjoy with my family. I will never forget this place.
The Pier is Santa Monica itself.Also the end of the 66 route, the Pier is history.Walk, eat, and have fun.Enjoy!!

We loved this, and so did our daughter. OVERCROWDED though! It was SAT night, so I get it ... Parking was almost full, and so you know if you are not from L.A., traffic is always horrible! Regardless, you got to come here, it is a graet time, great views, great amenities, sky wheel, and all the typical stuff you'd expect. Pricey as all L.A. but hey, you live only once, right?

column2: Long Walk on a Short Pier
column3: Small amusement park on a crowded pier. If you like wall to wall people and touristy 'artists' doing caricatures, this is the place for you. The walk to the end of the pier and back takes about 15 minutes. Go visit the Getty or Griffith Observatory (with its view of LA and the Hollywood sign) instead.

What a horrible place this really is. Packed with street sellers and folks that are rude. Over priced and a total tourist trap. Seen it once and that is enough for me.Rides are rubbish and over priced along with all the shops on the pier
If you are staying in LA the pier is iconic and really a must-do. you won't need long there unless it is near sunset (the best time to go), but it is definitely worth the trip.

Too be honest as soon as I got on the pier I wanted to get off. It was CRAMMED with people... all tourists for sure. I don't think it is necessary going on the Pier when you visit Santa Monica. I much preferred the beach walkway down to Venice Beach.

We spent our first day in California here wandering along the pier & shopping. The pier itself is not really my thing but the walk along the beachfront area was lovely. The sea air was fresh & the weather perfect which was exactly what I needed after a long flight from Australia. We had lunch at a little Mexican place & spent our afternoon shopping in the pedestrian mall several streets back from the waterfront. Nice place for a wander.
What can you say... it has it all.People watching, ferries wheels, flea market tables, etc.Pretty cool!A definite must!!!

The pier is a must see place but we were disappointed with the attractions on the pier. It was a little bit pensive for what it was, but is part of the go la card scheme which if pairing with other attractions on the same day make it a better value location.
There's nothing out of the ordinary here, and it's small. Don't see what all the fuss is about. Nice beach, but I would give it a miss.
The Santa Monica pier was great well worth the visit. Great to see the wooden carousel. Beautiful relaxing day.
Tacky and crowded. Not recommended if you wanted somewhere to relax and enjoy. Better walking along beachfront

column2: Fun place and great sunset pics
column3: Enjoyed our time at the pier and great shots of the beach and sunsets. Highly recommend. Very fun rides also and a good value with the GO card in LA

What a fun walking city. What's not to love walking along a beach- walk to Venice Beach, Muscle Beach ....Many great restaurants and shops. The Bus Tour offered provides you with a great way to visit Hollywood, LA and The Grove. The Pier area is clean and entertaining. Many good hotels with great locations. Easy drive to Malibu beach. The Grove and market are a must see .

A must see location for any LA visit.Strange to see beaches so packed after our almost deserted beaches (by comparison) in Australia.We arrived at 6pm and stayed until 8pm. It meant we saw the beach/pier in daylight, the sunset and then after dark.We even bought some craft (name pictures) from one of the many sellers.My only criticism (or warning) is the traffic was absolutely terrible. It took what seemed like an eternity getting there and then leaving. Often only one or two cars making it through each change of lights. Worse when leaving at 8pm.

column2: Very tourist centred and pretty expensive
column3: We walked all the way up from Venice beach along the boardwalk and up to the pier. It was a lovely sunny day and we strolled fairly slowly for the 1.5miles. Once at the pier there is a lot to do but it's all for the day tripper, tourist or kids I reality so wasn't much of a sight for us. We stopped for a cup of tea and some water and was slightly out out by the $4-40 per bottle for a litre. It was busy as it was a sunny weekend, but everyone was in good spirits and it was fun to people watch...

column2: Fun to Walk on the Pier and See What's Going On
column3: We used to always come here in February, when the rides were closed and it was generally windy. Nine years since our last visit, we came in April - happened still to be a windy day, but the rides were active, shops were open and street performers were out. Enjoyed sitting at the end of the pier listening to a musician. There is a bar at the end where you can eat/ drink. The amusement rides are expensive, but might be a nice treat if you picked one (nobody wanted to join me on the ferris wheel). Steps at the beginning of the pier take you down to the beach.
A fun area to visit. Fast food, good food, high end food. Typical beach shops, street artists. Small, but fun amusement park. Best view of up and down the coast. A must to visit.

We walked down from the Fairmont. A nice easy stroll with amazing views of the ocean, sunset and pier. The pier itself offers lots of opportunities to buy hats, shirts and bags. Food establishments are also plentiful. The rides and games are fun and entertaining. The ferris wheel and end of Route 66 sign are great spots to stop and take a commerative photo or two. Bubba Gumps is also nostalgic. You really only need two or three hours to do and see it all but we'll worth the walk, time and money.
And loved it. Rides, food, stalls. Great people. Great vibe. Perfect views and photo opportunities. Iconic. Felt like I was in a video game üéÆ

This was smaller than I expected and mostly frequented by families. If you have kids, might be a good spot to check out. Otherwise stick to the beach and the entrance to the pier where there are some buskers and little shops.
Truly a gorgeous beach with miles of sand and a stunning mountain view. A large variety of restaurants and food vendors make it a very enjoyable afternoon destination.
Kids aged 10, 8 & 7 had a blast! Loved the Ferris wheel, the arcade, the personalities along the pier...Walt did an amazing drawing of our kids on the pier :)

It is a landmark that you should see but there is really nothing there. If you have ever been to a local carnival you have seen it but it is iconic so worth the trip. Lines for rides are long...very crowded. We bought nothing but I am glad we saw it.

column2: Beautiful and Fun Beach and Pier!
column3: Went for a short time on a layover, and although I've been before, I experienced it in a different way this time. Took a long walk on the trail (very well maintained and lots to see, be careful to look where you're going so you don't get run over by bikers), took a walk on the beach (beautiful, full waves, surfers), and walked the pier (fun people watching, rides and games, also pretty when you go to the end and climb to the higher observation area).The beach also offers various parks and even some benches for sitting! I took public transport so I'm not sure how parking is around the pier, and I'm sure it's super crowded at times, but it is a fun place to visit!

This is an old pier with basic fair ground attractions but we had great fun.The Pier Burger was reasonable but the buns were sweet.Bubba Gumps is a family favourite but we always spend too much there.The sign for the end of Route 66 is a fun photo spot.The Ferris wheel and roller coaster were basic but fun.All-in-all a great place to spend an afternoon or evening, especially with teenage kids, including the one still inside you.We had great fun playing the old arcade games from the 80s and fuse ball got competitiveA $36 wrist band lets you ride everything from 1100 to 2300 - great value.

column2: Great energy, fun to people watch and see the sunset
column3: This is my favorite spot in Santa Monica. Even if it is crowded, it is a lot of fun. I wanted to see the "official end" of Route 66 that is located right in the Pier. You can ride in the Carnival located in the Pier or just watch the musicians, and souvenir/artists stalls. Take an ice cream and walk to the end of the Pier to have a great view of the Sunset, people watch and see surfers in the Pacific Ocean.

column2: Nice to visit as the sunsets
column3: We wandered the pier as the sun was setting , and so was every other traveler and local . Very crowed. live music , local artists , plenty of souviners ,Locals fishing

column2: A visit to Santa Monica isn't complete without checking out the Pier
column3: It may seem a little cheesy, but Santa Monica Pier is a great experience. You don't need kids in tow to enjoy the rollercoaster - we loved it. Particularly at night, it's a fun experience. Wander down after a meal but don't expect to spend hours.
Lot's to see and do. Loved the atmosphere and the day we went, the weather was just awesome. Will definitely look at going back!
A timeless attraction with fun, food, great views, and entertainment! They even have a trapeze school there where you can watch others fly through the air or learn how to do it yourself

Here from Chicago, we visited the pier on a Tuesday afternoon. It was pretty busy with locals and tourists. Food and rides are expensive, but the carnival style games are pretty reasonable. Too cold to be a beach day for us, but there is plenty of beach access with beautiful views of the ocean and mountains.We liked it here a lot, parking was very close and convenient.The pier is a bit trippy...meaning, there are lots of random nails and effects in the walking surface that present tripping hazards, so be careful where you walk and wear comfortable shoes (be careful in those heels y'all)
Words cannot describe this place. It is truly one of the most remarkable places in the worldA must see for all!

The pier is alive with people, restaurants and the fun fair. Rides are expensive - $17 for two people to go on the big wheel. There are lots of people busking on the pier and those at the end were very good. Small shop to commemorate the traditional end of Route 66. You can park on the pier for $6 for a couple of hours.

column2: Great for a wonder. Great view of the sunset.
column3: We wondered through the Pier both day and night on our recent visit to Santa Monica. We found it to be a hive of action. The lights at night were beautiful. Great to have a look around at the stalls, restaurants, attractions and soak in the history of this place. Fascinating to talk to some of the people working on the stands. Very busy at times. Great views of the sunset. Great people watching.

This makes for a fun easy day out. You can walk around, ride the rides if you choose or just take in the view around you. There are food trucks on the street in a variety of tastes to pick from. The beach is right there as well. After a quick walk on the pier, ditch the crowd and head down to the beach.

column2: Carvinal Type Feel With Beautiful Views
column3: My wife and i went for the first time and we loved it. Lots of entertainment around the area. A great view of the beach and ocean from the pier. Good bars and we even rode the roller coaster. Cant wait to come back. Weather was great!
i walked there and was ok but not much really to see or do there and not in my opinion something i would go out of my way pier is very old
This is a busy and lively game arcade built on a pier. A lot of attractions, some restaurants and also a higher view of the ocean than what you get from the beach.
With a mini amusement parking shopping and food this is a great place to spend a few hours or the day!
When I visited Pier it was already night time. Beautiful view is waiting for you. People are very friendly and fresh air from the ocean will make your day.
Three of us visited as we were told we had to see it when we were in town. I expected more and it didn't live up to what I had heard about it, but still glad we went to see it.

column2: OK as a short side trip from the beach
column3: If you are spending a day at the beach, spending a hour at the pier is OK. They have a few rides which expensive and not that much fun...but more oriented for the younger kids. A few carnival games and some food available as well. We expected more of Santa Cruz Beach and Boardwalk experience and so were a bit disappointed but if you are there for the beach, stopping by the pier is a good use on an hour.

column2: Closes on forecast of rain rather than rain itself
column3: I stayed at a hotel in Santa Monica primarily to visit the attraction, but found that it closed earlier than I expected one night, and the next day with rain forecast they didn't bother to open.. which was unfortunate because it was bone dry until 2:30 pm. Most amusement parks I'm familiar with are kee open the food, games, and rides such as a Ferris Wheel going in a little rain, because the risk is more with rollercoasters. It was further disappointing because they didn't bother to note the closure on their web site... you had to physically go there to find out it was closed. Be wary if there is any rain in the forecast.
Lots of fun to walk down and see the ocean. Very touristy but still a must do if in the area. Very windy and cold in the evening.

The pier is like a small carnival above the water. There is a little amusement area and there are singers all along the pier. A few nice resturants with many places to sit and people watch. Ride the ferris wheel if you get a chance, you will get a nice view of the pier and the beach.

If you have never been to the pier you haveto see it. That said with the exception of the beautiful Pacific Ocean, the pier itself is loud, dirty and very crowded.Nothing pretty or interesting about this boardwalk. Just tacky souvenir shops, badrestaurants & tons of tourists.If you have kids, they may enjoy the ridesbut you'd better keep your eyes on them,it's really busy.
Its a fun pier, great place to see the sundown but around 6 it gets very windy so bring a jacket or something to protect you from the wind
Fun for the kids! And close to beach and hotel! Games were so rigged and we felt this was not good with kids.
We had a great time and a lot of fun at the Santa Monica Pier! The price are ok and families are very happy their!!!

Great attraction to visit, love viewing the beach, people watching and live entertainment. Good place to get souvenir's and take plenty of pictures. While we were there a photo shoot was taking place. Very friendly atmosphere.
Had a great time on the pier got some souvenirs and watched some of the street performers as well. Plenty of food outlets as well.

Best for restaurants with fresh Crabs alive and great prices in the stores.Second SFO for the view, sealions, alcatraz view.Third faraway could be Santa Monica Pier. Many games to waste money, few eat options nothing worthy. The parking is a nightmare in holidays.And the traffic to arrive and leave from downtown LA is an addional nighmare (45-75 minutes).

No matter anybody's opinion, it is a must visit in Santa Monica.There is a short and long time parking. The long one is $12 per day.Typical pier with stalls and rides. It is a nice short walk anytime of the day.After you are done, you can cross the bridge and go to promenade ave where are the shops and street performers.

We had a great time here with our friends! Even though it is touristy, it is worth the stop! We went in the evening, and the colors and views are amazing! Nice view of the bay from the pier. We didn't get to ride any of the rides, but we still had a great time.
Beautiful scenery, good eats, entertainment on the pier, rides and games for the family... just beautiful and fun.
This has been our third time coming back to this SM Pier. I so do recommend walking shoes, cash and a light jacket. Food is a bit pricy but well worth it. A must do in SM.

column2: A Place To See and Be Seen
column3: If it weren't always such a zoo, I'd given the Santa Monica Pier a higher rating. But apparently it doesn't matter what time of day one goes there, the place is always jammed-packed with sightseers and tourists and the usual throngs of weird-looking and weirdly behaving people--with Fridays and weekends being the most unbelievably crowded days of the week.The Pier's huge ferris wheel is probably it's most noticeable feature or landmark, and at night it offers quite a spectacular light show that can be seen for miles up and down nearby Pacific Coast Highway or if you're in a boat several miles from the shore.The Pier offers a slew of other amusement park-like rides, lots of fast food joints to grab a quick meal, and the usual collection of street performers, artists, merchants, arts and crafts booths, a few indoor dining establishments, an arcade and sightseeing attractions that seem to defy description. But again, the problem with Santa Monica Pier are the crowds. Most of the time it's like a zoo!

Found pier to be dirty and the children had no desire to ride anything at the pier. Had planned to eat there but nothing was appealing. Great for a quick visit and photo but full of buskers and people asking for money.

column2: Busy but Fun Boardwalk over the Pacific
column3: We visited this famous tourist attraction on a Friday afternoon. It was busy, but you could still get around. Parking is about $12, so be prepared. Plenty of shops, restaurants, attractions including a small aquarium with hands-on pools. The beach here is huge. If you are coming from across town, bring your traffic patience.

This Pier is VERY popular with locals & tourists particularly at weekends.Great for families with young children ( say 5 to10 years old) with most rides aimed at this age group , older teenagers will find less to entertain them

column2: Come early and buy an all day pass for the rides.
column3: My son wanted to ride the coaster here and he found it a blast. It is not Disney, but it is great fun for small to middle age kids.
Cool day but still very crowded with carnival riders and beach combers. Good food, rides and attractions!

What a great time--we rode the Ferris wheel and got awesome selfies from the top with that amazing view. Also grabbed some delicious coffee and listened to all the street performers while taking in the view. It's the ultimate American/socal experience to me--the smell of funnel cake, the music, and families having a great time. Worth the trip!

Not technically the Pacific, but close enough. The pier is crowded. The beach was pretty nice. My favorite part of my visit was the town of Santa Monica itself. Lots of outside shops and street performers. Some of them pretty good.

I walked from one end to the other, didn't see any rubbish, even smoking isn't allowed. The pier is historic with many rides for the young ones. It is full of little shops selling souvenirs and food also. There are a few mucin men sing or playing. Great place for a visit and a stroll around. It is also the end of Route 66.
great place to hang out, nice restaurants, amazing view.Hidden secret - you can park your car at the pier or at the beach and it is cheaper than at nearby places.

Nice views of the ocean, fairly reasonably priced rides and games. Close to nice restaurants and bars. Lots of street artists and very safe, as there is a police station/office right there! a must go place in santa monica!

column2: Great Please to visit if you are in the area
column3: Great place to go around with nice shops and restaurants. I'd suggest to drive down to the beach and the Pier and get lost in the crown while enjoying street performers, buskers and whatnot. The city also has free available wifi which is something pretty nifty nowadays

Santa Monica is amazing seaside town with a bustling pier! lots of shops for the shopper in you but you can take the Malibu star home tour from the pier and as the sun sets on the pier you can see Fisher men and have a meal in the amazing Bubba Shrimp from Forrest Gump starring Tom Hanks.

column2: Had a blast at the arcade
column3: Well we had a great evening at the pier, Bubba Gump, arcade and music. Well wort a visit, we never tried the attractions but thoe who did seemed to have a great time.

Love the live music at the end of the pier. Hang on to your small children. We did not do the rides but definitely plan on doing that next time. The parking was easy for us too. I recommend water shoes or flip flops for the Sandy beach walk after.
My husband and I visited (our second trip). You can spend all day on the pier. Great restaurants, games, rides. Fun for family or couples. Gorgeous views!!

It's your typical tourist place but if you enjoy that type of attraction it's fun to see and the views are wonderful. A walk along the beach is great and there are plenty of restaurants along the main drag. I do recommend the Ferris wheel to say 'you've been there' and the view is fantastic.. I had a good time!
If your in the area its a must stop. Overpriced vendors, but what else do you expect. View is great, parking plentiful
If you are in Santa Monica this is most definitely a place you want to visit. Really nice of the ocean, the beach and sunset. Filled with a lot of bars, restaurants and people doing street shows.

Well, the attraction is really worked! Excellent location for a restaurant but fairly have to say that the meal is tasty, service is good and Pacific Ocean is just in front of.. So, they served quickly (not very but still), I tried really good prepared salmon.. Expensive. And that is the only one minus..

column2: Fun in the Sun - Iconic Have-to-Visit Spot
column3: If you are in Santa Monica you have to visit the pier. There are a few restaurants but it is mostly just a carnival atmosphere. Be prepared to walk up and down a fairly steep hill (or drive).

column2: Nice Beach, Nice Views, So-So Rides
column3: Santa Monica Pier is nice to visit once. This was my second time with my teen son. I think the views are great, the weather is lovely, but the rides are overpriced and so-so. Really crowded on the Sunday I visited which was to be expected. So we went on two rides (roller coaster and ferris wheel...which cost about $36). If you plan to go on a lot of rides, get the all day wrist band. Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk much better. However, it was still fun despite the crowds. We enjoyed walking around the Santa Monica shops (3rd Street Promenade) better.

Having seen photos of the famous pier over the years I had go and see it fir myself.There's lots to do and see, however nothing appealed to me. Walking back to the car the guys passed me and I overheard them saying "this is like the poor mans Disneyland".Well it doesn't claim to be anything but a pier with restaurants and amusement rides rather like you found in any city prior to theme parks being built.Being the weekend it was crowded. Walking to the end I couldn't wait to walk back and get away from the jostling crowds.Should you go if you've never been? Of course you should. Would you ever go back? No.

Loved our short visit! Great stop at the pier for the Ferris wheel. Considered eating on the pier but went to Chacha chicken and it was amazing.Ferris wheel was hit with our kids. Great view and photo ops.
Great rides, fun games, and good food. You can enjoy a great time at pier or walk down to beach. Family, friends anyone will have great time.

We spent the day at this pierParking cost $15.00.The beach was clean and hassle free.We walked out on the Pier it was a fun afternoon.We had just come from Knott's so the rides had no attraction for our kids!However, they looked fun.The street performances were very amateur.There were some memories made we ate at the Mexican restaurant at the end of the Pier the food was fine but not amazing!It was a fun day the PIER topped off the memorable experience!
This is a cool place to hang out, grab a bite to eat, have some fun and just sit and relax. You can fish off the pier and they had yoga. Nice hang out spot.

We enjoyed going there and walking the famous pier. Parking is a pain is the butt. It's easier to find parking down the street along the tall palm trees and walk down. They have meters there but they are free after 6pm. Another must see and do for the Ca tourist! Go in the evening. You can get pictures of the sign at the entrance and then pictures of the pier at night.
Breathtaking views! What an experience. Shops, street vendors, arcade and a little theme park with roller coaster and farris wheel! Great beach views, good boat watching. A must see!

The pier offers great views but on nice days is extremely crowded. The rides are anywhere from $8.50-$12 per ticket, so I caution you if you are tourists bringing your family. Plus the line to purchase tickets will be close to 30 minutes. You go here because it's famous not other reason.
Good locationSunday is nice with family.Good burros üçÆüç©‚òïÔ∏èüç∑üçøüç∞üçöüçôüçπüç¨üé£üé£üé£üé£üé£üèäüèªüçΩüç∫üç≠üåÆüçåüçïüç§

column2: Ok, not was exciting as I expected
column3: The excitement here are the street performers and the tourist shops not the ocean. A few brave fishermen at the end of the pier. A handful of amusement rides and a big arcade. My kids we entertained for about 20 minutes. They liked walking on the beach more.

column2: great walks, people watching, crowds but empty also
column3: Amazing outdoors here: you find crowds but also can get away from them. Water is right next Plenty of eats. Even biking trails and rental bikes but then you have to watch where you are going because bikes share the lane with pedestrians.

The Pier has lots of fun restaurants to choose from for a variety of foods. The best time to go is at night so that you can enjoy the bright lights of the Ferris wheel and other amusement rides. Their are street entertainers to stop and listen to their instrumentals and/or singing. The area seemed very safe and was exceptionally clean.
We enjoyed our stop at the Santa Monica pier while on vacation. The kids loved playing games at the old arcade and we all enjoyed a ride on the big Ferris Wheel! The views are amazing from the top!
Super fun rides decent food ü•ò .Also a great üëçüèæ view of the beach üåä.Great location to see sunrise üåÖ and sunset üåÖ.It is charming. An good üòä for a fun day.
The most interesting collection of people. A wonderful place for a romantic outing. Great food at the restaurants. Parking isn't bad. A lot of fun for everyone.
We visited the place at the evening and enjoyed it very much.All the area of santa Monica is very nice. A lot of street performers, resturants and fast food.

We got parking at one of the parking lots on the beach, just past the pier and it cost us $8 for the whole day. It was an easy walk from the car along the boardwalk on the beach to the pier. Tip - (there are stairs from the beach leading up to the pier). Santa Monica Pier is a very busy area with tourists, but not crowded on the week days. There are lots of photo opportunities and at the end of the pier you will find billboards with the history of the pier complete with historical pictures (for the history buff).Also you will find a restaurant where you can sit, eat and enjoy the view of the sea. There is an amusement park with a huge ferris wheel, and along one side of the pier is a carnival style atmosphere with lots of small booths selling trinkets and fast food. We spent about 1 to 2 hours roaming around, taking photos and enjoying the scenery. MUST SEE experience.

Just as we thought it would be, condense Blackpool and add sunshine! Great views from the pier stunning beach which goes on forever, walk to Venice beach in an easy flat hours stroll, loved people watching.
Area is pretty. My family had a great time. A little bit sad, saw so many homeless people. But overall had a great time
I thought it would be expensive to do the roller coaster and Ferris wheel but it really wasn't. $8 per person per ride or buy a pass. The Ferris wheel had amazing views of the Ocean.
Fun for all ages. Shopping, rides, and places to eat are nice. It is a hit for everyone! We would definitely return to such a fun environment.
There is an amusement park on the pier which we did not go to but looks like fun. There's shopping and best of all was the views all around. We walk along the beach which was very fun and relaxing.
What a beautiful place this is! You can go for food and also for fun. They have a little amusement park and some shops where you can buy cali tokens. For day or night its great
Very busy at the weekend, it was great to actually see this place.Friendly people and plenty to see.

The pier was great to see but there are lots of strange people walking around. Do not be surprised if someone is screaming strange things at you just do not make eye contact. If you do not have kids the people are pretty entertaining.
Very cool place to hang out. Lots of people, but still fun and you can people watch too. Very iconic.

When in Santa Monica, spend some time on the Pier - take a camera. There are not that many theme parks such as Santa Monica Pier that are in as a good condition as this one. Make sure you check out the old penny arcade.

Fortunately the weather was nice. We went on some of the rides, but they are not much of you compare them to other parks, but we still had a swell time on them. Very family friendly, colorful place. The bathrooms were spotless (which is always a plus)Enjoy!
Santa Monica beach is truly amazing ...wide sands .clean .Crystal clear water ..everything I hoped it would be

Sadly this was a huge disappointment for us. We went in the evening so it was pretty with all the lights. But there are very few rides and they were expensive as you needed quite a lot for one ride for one person.There were a few stalls to shop which was the only nice thing.No place to really eat - think there was one restaurant?The public bathrooms were disgusting! Avoid at all costs!We expected more but it's not like what you expect when you see it in a movie!
The view is beautiful and entertainment was priceless. I did see a couple of homeless people lounging around which made it a bit uncomfortable so we didn't stay too long.

column2: Seen one pier, you seen them all.
column3: Typical pier with souvenir shops, food stands, arcade and amusement park rides. Some of the performers on the pier are pretty good and very entertaining. But if you've been to a pier before, then there is nothing here that will surprise. Nice place to visit, just to say you've done it.
Seen it over and over in movies, and it was exactly what I pictured. Tourists everywhere, the theme park on the pier, beautiful mountains in the backdrop, gorgeous ocean.

column2: What you would expect, rides expensive
column3: It was a good enough place to visit. Lots going on with street performers and rides. We thought that the rides were quite expensive for what they were - there were big queues so we just didn't bother. But still worth wandering round as part of a trip to the beach/ boulevard.

Loved the ice cream. Never realized this was the end of Route 66. Well placed entertainment along the pier, a great stroll along the boardwalk. Did not try the restaurant at the end of pier, but the location is incredible. Terrific photo opportunities.

I loved Santa Monica! The pier was very cool, as well as the beach! There was a concert going on when I was there on a Friday night. But I will warn you- I payed like a million dollars in parking that night. I parked at a lot a ways down from the pier and then saw that it closed at sunset... I ended up parking in 4 different places in one night, it was a disaster. But that was my own fault. Overall, a great time!

We visited in the morning it gets busy, we loved the Bubba Gump store and the seat outside with the suitcase & chocolates, there are lots of photo opportunities, there's a sign where Route 66 ends. We wondered along the pier listening to all the entertainers and the children spent a bit of time on the amusements. There are a few seats to watch the world go by. The beach is clean with plenty of space, we would recommend a visit 4‚≠êÔ∏è

We went to the small amusement park and had unlimited rides with our LA Go Card. Otherwise this would be too expensive. About $33pp for small rides. Definitely would not pay that for a family of 4. However once in, it was fun riding and looking at the ocean and beach. We did this in addition to a day of riding bikes along the ocean and hanging at the beach. After one ride on everything we left for dinner.

Nice view of the Pacific Ocean and pretty beach.The pier is the standard tourist trap with the expensive doodads and gift shops.The rides are expensive.We ate at Bubba Gumps in the pier and it was very good.This is a good place to stretch your legs and get outdoors. It is also cool to see the place that has been in so many movies and tv shows.

The pier is at the western terminus of old route 66. There are lots of shops and places to eat as well as a small amusement park. I loveFerris wheels and this one was nice with a great view of Santa Monica beach and the rest of the pier from the top. It doesn't take a lot of time to see what's there, but it's definitely something you should see when in the area.

column2: Nice place to spend the afternoon
column3: We spent an afternoon there just walking around and watching all of the people and activities.This would be a great place for kids since they have an amusement park there
It was ok. The weather was nice and it was fun to walk on the boardwalk. Not really for me. Reminds me a little bit of Daytona Beach or Myrtle Beach.

column2: The Pier was our second home
column3: We had a great time with the pier so close by. The rides are fun and it's fun to watch people on them. The carousel from the 20s is a must see. The ferris wheel has wonderful views. The eating places are varied. We tried almost all of them and were not disappointed with any.
The weather was perfect. The pier offers lots of options for food. Very laid back atmosphere. Lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance.

I suppose if you are in Santa Monica you have to visit the pier but it's not worth making a special trip to see it. Really tacky with cheap souvenirs and mediocre street performers. Seen it once but don't want to return.

column2: Fun way to spend the day
column3: Went to the pier and rode the rides all afternoon. Lines were fast and staff was very nice. Look for savings online before arriving to save some $. Prices as expected for ride bracelet and food. Kids had a blast and left exhausted. It can get windy being on the pier...even on nice days so layers, hat and sunscreen are a must. Photo is a view from ferris wheel.

We really enjoyed the pier from its amusement park to the locals playing music on the guitar. There is even a man that has tamed birds to sit on you for a photo opportunity. Amazing. Must visit this spot.

Parking is available right next to the pier on the bottom beach road. Was $12 on a Sunday. Pier busy, quite a few stalls etc on the walkway. Rides on the pier were expensive. Was nice to see but wouldn't rush back.

column2: Santa Monica icon - make sure to visit!
column3: The pier is crowded, touristy and slightly tacky - but that's part of the appeal! It's an icon that is well worth the visit, even just to say you've been to the pier that is so often featured in movies and on TV. We enjoyed strolling along the pier during the day and evening - the Ferris wheel was great to ride after dark. Don't miss it!

Santa Monica pier is a typical pier that is found in many places around the world. It has an indoor merry go round along with entertainment stalls shops, eateries and a fairground. It's a nice walk round before you get to muscle and Venice beaches.

The Santa Monica Pier is something everyone must see. There are plenty of shop and places to eat. However, most of them are tourist traps. I recommend going out there for pictures and scenery. The view from the end of the pier is very beautiful.

Spent the day enjoying the sunshine with a group of friends. We rented bikes for the day off the pier area ($20) and rode the strand, at lunch at a local bar, and watched the men of our group try surfing in the late afternoon. I highly recommend planning more time than you expect since you will end up doing a lot of people watching.

column2: A.must visit if in the Santa Monica area
column3: Historic, nostalgic, fun....all reasons to visit thie pier.Fun activities, rides and views as well as a decent restaurant at the end of the pier.Good place to take kids or just a romantic stroll.and enjoy the picturesque views all around
Love love this location. We went twice. Once when we got in and once when we left to catch our flight to burn time.
Good place! A lot of people and food for everyone. üòç a typical tourist place to see the wonderful sunset. üåû

column2: Not what it used to be
column3: We did the obligatory stroll down the pier, it reminds me of the old traveling carnivals from the '70's, dirty, rundown and more than a little sketchy. No reason to hang out more than the hour we did. Would never venture there after dark.
The Santa Monica Pier is an iconic landmark everyone must see at least once. There are many shops and restaurants to browse through while admiring the beauty and vibe of the area.

Too crowded. Dirty walkways. Plenty of homeless people walking around causing a scene. Plenty of parking here, not sure the cost. A few restaurants and souvenir shops. Plenty of benches. Nothing special to be honest.

column2: Great day at an iconic Socal location
column3: We were fortunate to catch some great November weather in southern California and wanted to spend a day at the beach for the first time. We were happy we decided to go to one of the most iconic Socal locations at the Santa Monica pier. We got there early and got a great parking spot in the parking lot next to the pier. Great atmosphere with classic carnival type food and gift shops. We also spent a good deal of time on the beach and in the ocean and enjoyed visiting the original muscle beach which is only a few steps away from the pier. Great family beach day.

Probably a place where you have to go, but once should do the job. The restaurants are not too appealing and the Pacific Park does not seem to be spectacular. And of course, everything's incredibly expensive.
I have long wanted to visit the pier in Santa Monica, and it was absolutely the first place I went once in Los Angeles. Certainly one of the most beautiful and spectacular piers to visit!
Super-traditional, classic boardwalk. New restaurants are kind of taking over, but the feeling is still VERY Southern California with a breathtaking sunset opportunity.
Spent half a day on the pier-lots to see including carousel, fairground, buskers etc. Lots of souvenir outlets, bars and food outlets-surprisingly good prices.

We tried to drive to the pier on Sunday about 4pm. We were staying about 2 miles away. The traffic was at a stand sill and long lines to the parking lots. Parking lots near pier were blocked off. At this point the traffic was so bad we had a 40 min trip back to the hotel. We asked about visiting the pier before we left - they didn't give me a warning about the traffic.

This is one of the most popular spots in LA for tourists. If you go on a sunny day you'll really be rewarded with a nice view. While it's definitely nice to see there's not much to do around. I didn't go on any of the rides at the park.

column2: Fun visit but more geared towards family with small children
column3: (Just to clarify we're an all adult family) we enjoyed our day however we went in late March very windy day and cold so we didn't get to enjoy any of the water activities it was a nice walk down the pier to see the sights and the shops . the amusement park is more geared towards families with small children or even young teenagers. We enjoyed venice beach more

After a day shopping in Santa Monica we popped along the Pier to check it out. Very cool and you can see where the end of Route 66 finishes. Also a replica of the Zoltar fortune teller from the film BIG. Great fun for all.

column2: Don't spend long, go to Venice Beach
column3: It's nice to see due to its presence is movies and games. Though the actual park itself is like a C grade Carnival. Spent only 30 minutes here. Best thing was going right to the end away from the rides and just reminding yourself about how amazing it is to be in LA. I do recommend going down the road to the Skate Park and beach side shops 1km down the road at Venice beach. Really cool vibe

column2: Nice point for a short visit
column3: The pier is really nice. But i hope you have some luck with the weather. Really nice atmosphere and cool restaurants and bars around. Try to avoid the restaurants on the pier, and use those from the main street
This has such a good atmosphere with different things going on and everyone enjoying themselves it's definitely worth a visit with a beautiful beach either side we had a pretty great day here

It was cool to cross this place off the list, but with people along the way encouraging me to take my 3 yr old there, I was expecting something better than it was. The arcade is ok I guess, but I'm not sure why you'd want to spend time inside when you could be out enjoying the sunshine, and the rides aren't that exciting, especially with a very little kid - we didn't partake.He was mostly interested in the waves crashing into the pier and I wasn't really taken by any of it - I've seen better views and the food on offer wasn't appealing. Could have skipped it!

column2: Historical place of the Cali culture
column3: Obligatory visit if you go to LA. Old theme park in a legendary broadwalk in a great place. Pure 80's
Great spot and cool to visit at night when everything is lit up. Lots of people around and it's nice and safe.

It was easy to get to from Pico Boulevard (Big Blue Bus 7) and it only cost $1 for two. The Pier was crazy busy--Saturday, on a beautiful clear day, blue skies, and hot. Just loved the whole busy atmosphere, the entertainment, the beautiful view, and the gorgeous beach. There is something for everyone,--little ones, teenagers, and adults. Lots of places to drink and eat as well as souvenir shops. The beach was pristine, beautiful sand, and small waves. Loved it as our attraction before going home to Ontario, Canada.
Beautiful time to visit at sunset. Great for 'people watching' too. Lots of food options & restaurants along the foreshore. The market stalls along the beach ... dodgy!

column2: Beautiful views, great spot to stop for anyone!
column3: Great views, lots of things to do, rides, an aquarium, great sand beach. Just make sure if you are wanting to do the rides, you check that they are running at the time (we were there in the off season so rides weren't always going). Lots of food and souvenir options, from fancier sit down restaurants to burger and milkshake places. Would be a great place to go with kids, lots for them to do! Also a beautiful spot to stop for couples, family etc! There is also a nice path down the beach, we walked down to Venice beach along it, well maintained with access to clean washroom facilities, as well as water fountains.
We wanted to visit the famous Santa Monica Pier! But once we were there.. It felt dilapidated. Lot of attractions were permanently closed, as were some food stands.

Lots of fun lots and people plenty of places to eat carnival rides for the kids and adults lots of free entertainment along the boardwalk and you're good to go where Forrest Gump turned around to start running back home
We walked the pier and had a blast. My daughter loved the rides and the sites. The music on the pier was also great!
We didn't stay in Santa Monica long but it's nice view I would like to go back and get to stay there longer seeing as we was in a rush.

Nice pier with a lot to do but watch out for people coming from venice beach smoking marijuana since marijuana is recreational there. Keeping my kids away from people smoking was a little bit of a challenge. I expected the pier to be more than it was though

We visited the pier pretty late in the night, just before closing but it's a fun place to be. Beautiful in the night. There are street artists, Singers, carts selling trinkets and food.The rides themselves aren't that cheap. 8 bucks per person for the Ferris wheel itself but worth the view.I'd recommend the Pier Burger joint!

My boyfriend and I stopped here while I was in town for business. It was a fun spot to escape for an hour or two. After seeing it once, I don't know if we would go back again, but I'm glad we went. As with all very touristy spots, expect to pay top dollar for any rides, food, or souvenirs you purchase. We rode the Ferris wheel, which has beautiful views of the coast and was worth the price.

We spent a day here with our teenagers. It was so much fun! We played in the ocean, ate lunch and dinner at the local restaurants, and rode rides at Pacific Park. Parking is close and there are changing rooms to change into and out of swimming attire. üôÇ
Visited Santa Monica Pier and Santa Monica Beach as our first stop in LA. Was clean and beautiful. Beach is huge and really very pretty. Definitely worth a visit.

column2: Don't rent your bike on the pier!
column3: You pay much lesser if you rent your bike from the shop steps away from the pier.Nice and relaxing to spend a sunday here, taking in the atmosphere, cycling along the beach to Venice, stopping along the way to watch people skateboarding and all sorts of other beach activities.
Very nice place to visit !! A lot of good restaurants of different foods and prices and a small park for kids

column2: You seen it this in many movies.
column3: This Pier is one of the places what I and many others have seen in the movies. Exotic place in St. Monica. Lot of people are watching different kind entertainment as the pier offer. Amazing to look at the people around. If you just visit and travel by car park directly at the pier. 2$ per hour.

column2: Get there early for a pier all to yourself
column3: We have gone twice in the last two months. Both times on a Saturday.There is a lot to see on the pier as well as surrounding area and with Albricht's for lunch, it could not be a better day.Once we were able to park on the pier, but if not there are lots of beach parking for $8 vs city parking. All depends on what you want to do for the day. The second time we ended up doing the amusement park in the morning, late lunch, and toes in the sand after to relax.As the day goes along the crowd gets larger, so the arcade with little ones is better earlier than later. However each time we leave the traffic is piling in to see the sunset, maybe we will stick around.

The Santa Monica Pier has always been a fun place to go to walk the pier and maybe ride some of the rides. This last time we went, things have been changed a little, with more development on and around the pier. We visited on a Saturday, and it was crazy busy with people. To me, it felt junky and tacky. I felt like I was at a sideshow of a rundown traveling circus with cheesy vendors selling worthless souvenirs and making tacky art. Maybe I've just gotten older and expect more, but it wasn't someplace I'd want to go back to, and I've never felt that way when visiting it before. It was sad.Parking was only $1 an hour, which was very reasonable.

We walked along the path and found it too difficult to find the access point so did not walk out on the pier. Very disappointing to see an enormous car park on the beach next to the pier. Saw the wheel in motion. The pier liked a bit commercial. I would suggest you walk to venice beach from the pier. That was amazing.
A must see in Santa Monica...was great to wander around and see the sights. Great little coffee shop on the pier and lots of local artisans selling their wares. We came away with a few gems.

Spent a whole day in Santa Monica between the pier, the beach and the 3rd St Promenade. Lots to do on the pier, fun for the kids and great food options all around, especially on the way to 3rd St Promenade.
Had a good time walking along the beach and the pier. Really great view of the horizon and the gorgeous sun setting over the Pacific Ocean
It is a nice place to take a walk. Some musicians and street performers make it a really nice promenade.It is not a 'must' to visit, but it is nice.
Always love to visit the pier, great atmosphere and love all the buskers & street performances.Then a quick walk to the shopping outlets.It's always a great day out
After hearing so much perhaps I over expected. It was a pier. With a carnival on it Beautiful sunsets.Paid parking.

column2: Take a long walk off of it.
column3: This place is a landmark however I don't really share in the sentiment. I've been coming here for years since I was little and I don't think it has changed. From the Rollercoaster to people fishing from the end, you always know what you will get at this place.

column2: Great Stop , Lots see and do
column3: Like the title states, this is a great stop on an LA trip. This place is BUSY. The roads here are small so prepare to have quick reflexes when entering and leaving one of the many parking lots. The Pier is amazing in itself, so much to do from rides to restaurants. If you're thinking about stopping by, just do it, it's worth it.
Fantastic. Lots of fun. The pier is a fun place to hang out. Lots of good food. I will definitely be back to Santa Monica
Very underwhelmed but this pier and expected a lot more activity to be thereA few restaurants and rides but that is all
We went on a Sunday. It's pretty & was VERY busy. It's ok here, the funfair makes this stand out on the skyline for miles, but we refer other smaller, less busy piers.
So fun! Enjoyed a fun crowd. Rode the Ferris wheel and had great views for miles! The roller coaster is very tame but fun. Just a great ambiance and tons of fun! Enjoy!!

My family and I love to visit the Pier when in California. Good food and fun for everyone, and the beach just steps away. There is hours worth of fun. You can really capture beautiful photos as well. The only thing is that it can get pretty packed here and parking can be a challenge at peak hours. Of course you have to pay for parking everywhere in California which is a bummer. Overall we love it here!

Amazing view of the sunset. It's really the a typical peer but what give it the points for me is the experience and fun factor. The view of the sun setting and moving into the night, lights going on behind is just relaxing!

column2: Grab a beer and hang put with the fishers
column3: Walk past the rides and attraction and grab a nice cold beer around an hour before sunset. Walk down to the end of the pier (more beer there) and watch the locals fish. The views and the sound of the sea are good for the soul. Then the suns goes down and the pier lights up. All is good in the world.
We had a lovely day , got an uber out to the pier , we enjoyed a stroll along the pier , browsing at the stalls and then down to Venice beach, it's a LA must do!!

My son and I came here while on vacation to the LA area from Florida. Such a beautiful place. The views are spectacular and it was so much fun watching all the musicians performing on the Pier. There was a violinist playing while we were there named Daniel Morris who was amazing to watch. Definitely want to go back next time we visit.

column2: a must see if in the area
column3: Fun place to watch people and buy expensive t-shirts. Several good restaurants to choose from I like Bubba Gumps. the sunset is very good from this location
As expected...nice walk along the promenade. We then had a great meal at the Cheesecake Factory. Good day out of the city
It was March. The crowd wasn't bad. The weather was great. It is very clean. Sometimes, you just need to people watch.

Being from NJ, and growing up with the whole boardwalk scene, I have to laugh about the area where the "surf music" emanated from. Being on the Santa Monica Pier was like being back in Seaside Heights NJ, just a different ocean. The weather, of course, is much nicer year round, but aside from that, fahgedaboudit! (And the traffic in the area is LA typical ridiculous)!

column2: Santa Monica is a lovely place but make sure get the right hotel for your stay.
column3: The beach at Santa Monica a little windy but great sunshine. Take a stroll on the pier a great place to have a walk or hire a bike there are Evan Segway's for hire if you are not feeling it üò≥

This place was below par for me .. lots of people on a peir watching some weird acts , bubba gump restaurant overcrowding and grubby , bad parking and rubbish everywhere .. I was expecting a bit more , not going to go back

We had a high recommend from Trip Advisor members to go, but at 9pm everything is closed already, can you believe it? Far away from everything, all restaurants and bars closes before 9pm on all Santa Monica. It was a waste of time.

We took the afternoon and drove from LA to Santa Monica. Traffic was a little heavy around 10:30 am on a Friday but it was manageable.The area is really quite lovely, even quaint in some areas.We parked in Public Parking about 5 blocks from the Pier and headed through the Promenade on our way to Pier. Lots of great shopping, restaurants, street musicians and people watching. Sun was shining and it was a bit cool so the walk was great.Heading over the "bridge" to the Pier was crowded but not claustrophobic. It was pretty clean and felt comfortable wandering around. It smelled of funnel cakes and sugar. Love it. We walked down to the end on one side and back down the other. Took a flight of steps down to the beach and went for a short walk past Muscle Beach.We spent about 2 hours wandering the Pier and the beach. Then we headed across the street for lunch.

I guess every visit to Santa Monica requires a walk along the beach and the pier. It was so crowded even though it's outside you felt like you were in a pack. Tourists mixing with a lot of the locals going for a day at the beach plus all the homeless people sleeping on the beach and along the walkway did make for the best experience. The kiosks and food vendors along the pier are kind of cheap and cheesy. Pass.

We arrived at the pier around 11am when the rides open. We were able to get parking right on the pier and it was only $2 hr or $10 for the day. It was a perfect time of day to go. It wasn't crowded yet and made for a relaxing stroll with the little ones. We loved the vibe of the street musicians and while the rides were expensive it was worth it to give the kids the experience of a couple of rides on the Santa Monica Pier. Going early was the key here!
A real tourist place and if you dont get to see it dont get upset. good for kids and not a bucket list of things to see.
A fun place to go. Places to eat and rides for the whole family. Vets memorial in the sand on the week-ends.

Lots of people however lots of space. There is alot of fast food, drink, some rides and people watching. There is entertainment and beautiful views of the ocean. Parking is hard as you have to park on the street so it could mean some walking.

Any visit to LA should include a visit to Santa Monica Pier. Great outlook - the clam seafood chowder at the restaurant on the left hand side (can't remember the name) was fabulous. Don't forget to get a selfie near the sign showing "the end of Route 66"

Parking was oddly easy enough to find( it was 5 pm on a Thursday in March so I don't know if that makes a difference) but I was pretty crowded which makes me a little uncomfortable with my young kids. But we just walked to the end of the peir. Watched people playing on the beach. And the street performers all over the place.I had been here before but it was in the middle of the night then.
Not bad for checking out the view but I wouldn't need more than an hour or so to see it all. There are some street performers, cheap souvenirs and fair or carnival food.

It's a place where lots of people have their memories of sunsets, arcades and fun to eat tid-bits and wonderful drawn portraits. Come here with your special someone or with a group of friends, and you'll find many wonderful places to check out. I highly recommend stopping by four specific places on the pier.1. 66-to-CaliThis is the original Route 66 shop, full with memorabilia and Route 66 authentic American made products.2. Soda JerksTheir sweet choices on Ice creams are truly delicious and budget friendly. They work with different renditions of flavors so you'll definitely want to get your sweets here.3. Pier BurgerQuite possibly the only budget friendly, worth paying food for at the pier. You get what you pay for and it's delicious as well.4. Arcades and ridesDefinitely the most fun you'll have on the pier. Highly recommendedDon't forget to watch the sunsets.

column2: Like a tired old British pier
column3: 2 Brits on vacation. Spent $25 on a taxi from our hotel to go to the pier having heard so much about it. Admittedly it was out of season and dusk but nothing was happening, except a couple of gift shops and a slot machine palace. We walked to the end - should have jumped off!
Beware of drug addicted locals. Average attraction for families with adolescents. I would not recommend for young children due to the drug scene and some squalid conditions.
I halfway expected to see NCIS: LA characters here. Clean, safe, with great street performers and good vendors.

Firstly, it is fun and historic and atmospheric, but I would strongly advise you to keep your senses on high alert, this doesn't feel like a safe location. There are lots of beggars and street hawkers from the moment you hit the pier complex from Ocean Avenue.Having said that there are so many tourists around that it gave me a feeling of security, safety in numbers.The pier and Ferris Wheel, is definitely one of those places that's on the bucket list. It has an old fashion feeling being constructed of mainly wood.Also get your picture taken with the "end of the route 66" sign. Pretty cool.There are lots of places to eat on the pier, but they looked expensive.At the end of the pier there are lots of info boards about it's history.So who knew that Santa Monica pier was originally built to pump sewage into the Pacific.Certainly not me until I read the history posters at the end of the pier.It also turns out that the original sailor that pop-eye was based on sailed from the pier as well.
My 5 year old was dying to come here to go on the merry go round and even though fog consumed the view it was everything we expected and more.

The pier is a requisite tourist stop, but why? Sure, there is a roller coaster, otherwise I recommend just sun bathing on the beach or renting a bike and rolling down the path. The pier was super crowded on Sunday and the food was subpar carnival food or tourist franchised. (Bubba Gump Shrimp).Don't get me wrong. I recommend visiting Santa Monica and the pier, but unless you are a teen or are visiting with kids, I would't budget more than 30 mins for the pier and certainly don't spend the $ to park on it. Any of 20 restaurants across Ocean Ave and on the Promenade are better plus parking is cheaper too.
The pier is a great place for a view and a few fun rides. The arcade is pretty old and the games are worn as well but a fun experience.

After spending some time in the LA area, evething begins to look the same. Just more shops selling tourists the same thing you see in any city. The beach looked nice and the view of the land was nice. Only spent about 30 min here and that was long enough.

The pier is an entertaining destination. Prices are a little high, but it's fun to people watch. I personally believe that this is more entertaining if you have children with you. It's a bit on the dirty side which is why I gave it a two. If you haven't been, one should stop and decide for yourself.
Lovely pier worth a visit as part of touring the area. Fairground rides and restaurants available although I did not try them.

column2: Will return, with kids in tow.
column3: Cute iconic area to check out. We went way to early in the morning and almost everything was closed. So we returned at midday and things were a lot more active. Food options were good and plenty of activities for families as well as a bar for adults. Great views

column2: Fun just walking on the Santa Monica Pier.
column3: This the idea place for family with children to go for fun. I truly enjoyed just walking on the pier. A must go place.

Loved the rides.Great evening out with family while visiting.Nice option before a few days of Disneyland coming up for us.Rides were ok.... expensive.Many food choices.Pier entertainment wad fabulous.Parking $5 just below the pier off to one side. Ample parking for the time we showed up was 6pm on a weekday.

We didn't have the best weather that day but I would suggest visiting here. It is quite the place for people watching! The pier had a bunch of kiosks and performers. We didn't eat on the dock but there are places to get a bite to eat.
Went there as 2 couples nearing the end of our hwy 1 trip down from San FranciscoPretty cool place all in all. Plenty to look at and plenty of history

Very lively place , for families, big or small groups and couples. Sunset will be a perfect time to take pictures. That is where Rout 66 begins and/or ends. different food choices, street artists, and many different souvenir carts. You can park on the pier itself, or use the city parking with 5-10 minutes walk to the pier. Usually colder than the city ,would be a good idea to take an extra jacket or buy one there as souvenir to take home

Large pier with lots to see and do, pretty views of the beach and LA from end of pier. Very busy and dirty, typical carnival type rides and food, nothing special. Nice to say I have been there, but not really worth the crowds if you are not going to ride the rides...take a picture from the beach, just as pretty!

column2: Like visiting a dirty carnival next to an ocean
column3: I did not enjoy my visit here. It was packed, loud and dirty. I felt like I was at a cheap carnival next to the ocean. There were literally thousands of people here the day I visited. May appeal to some but definitely not for me,

We stayed in Hollywood hotel, it is as near of everything so we look around and found the bus nearby that will take us to sta Monica pier. It takes about nearly two hours from hollywood. Sta Monica pier have lots of entertainment for children and the beach are nice and sunny and good for sunbathing . Lots of places to eat . Then we walked and found the town centre with lots of shopping and good restaurant . Sea foods and steak are good . We comeback second time by tour . I will never forget the experienced
We had a 6 hr layover today so we decided to go to the pier for fun. It was a great day, not crazy busy but enjoyable with 2 small children. Not much choices in food however something for everyone.

As far as motels go, a good one is hard to find. El Rancho was a haven after numerous motel stays. Not typical as rooms were spacious and the place is clean with in room dining set up. The staff pleasant. I would return.

column2: A stroll on a cool day
column3: A big, busy pier- lots to see and do. Saw some locals fishing, theme park if you pay entry in there is some good value deals (unlimited rides etc) Lots of places to eat. Aquarium under the pier which would be great for kids.

Went on a Sunday and it was way too crowded. Had to park a 10 minute walk away and spent a lot of money doing so. the rides had long lines too. Still is a fun place to go and bring the kids and not have to spend much money as long as you only let them take a ride or two.

We took the Starline hop on hop off bus to Santa Monica Pier. They have some rides and games there. A couple of restaurants. A very nice beach! It's nice if you want to spend the day at the beach!We didn't spend a whole lot of time on the pier, only because we aren't into the rides and games.. but we did take a nice walk along the boardwalk.. or you can rollerblade or bike. Great views! Ocean is gorgeous! The day we were there, it was chilly and foggy. Would've been a lot better if the sun was out.

column2: Fun but Could Do w/o Crowds
column3: Went for a visit on a Sunday and, as you'd expect, it was pretty crowded. Crowded, despite the fact that it was a cool and cloudy day, with winds too high for fishing.Nevertheless we had a pleasant time walking around and listening to the musicians. We let our inner child out at Pacific Park. Good quality of rides and a broad range of attractions. Just as fun for two grown-ups as it would have been for a family.I really only had two complaints: 1) that all of the change machines in the arcade were out of order, so we and many others didn't get a chance to play and 2) parking was a damn nightmare that resulted in us shelling out big bucks to park under a hotel. Serves us right for going on a weekend, but still no fun.
The weather was very cool but that wasn't Santa Monica's fault. The folks working on the pier were so friendly.I would go again but not in that same day the marathon was running.

To experience wandering along the pier with a warm churros was amazing. You don't realise how far you are walking from the start by the 'end of Route 66' sign to being over the water.There is so much to see and do, from going on the wheel to get stunning views of the coastline to seeing the carousel and of course - the shops. The pier is such an iconic place, featuring in so many films it was just so great an experience to enjoy.If you in the LA area this is a must see place to experience.

We loved the pier lots to do from rides to eating. We were there at sunset it was amazing and we left late into the evening we walked from our hotel Venice beach it was a beautiful walk. The pier offers all sorts of rides and every type of food drink or snacks you can think of. It's a fun place for all ages lots of vendors selling art and knick knacks and clothing. Highly recommend

In fairness, we were tourists as well when we came here. It was an overcast day in the off-season, yet everyone crammed into the relatively small area and it was hard to enjoy the sights when battling thousands of others for shoulder space. We found much more peace and space to enjoy on the beach itself.
Great Pier and area with lots of action! Many good places to eat. Nice beach. Parking was a little expensive. Lots of people having a good time.
Nice pier but Santa Cruz boardwalk blows it away, this felt a little more like for couples where as Santa Cruz caters more to families with children with lots more rides and attractions for kids.
Great place for fun, food and entertainment. People were surfing, fishing, dancing, sunning, riding the rides. It's a blast!
We made a point to visit the pier. It was fun to walk through the shops and enjoy the views from the end of the pier. It was also a great place to people watch. We had fun.
Avoid weekends and very busy and you will not be able to park,go midweek.Worth a hour or so wandering round, some good street musicians.
Went there on a Sunday was so busy hard to even walk around let alone park, I would go during the week if possible

We had fun on the pier! There was a lot of entertainment and food. We watched the sunset and it was Beautiful against the beach and mountains. The temperature was great during the day however at night it was really chilly. (Middle of March) great location for kids
Perfect way to finish the day, the sunset at Santa Monica is breathtaking, and not to be missed if you're in LA.

The Pier at Santa Monica has been the backdrop for many movies and TV shows. It is a bit of a walk from the Metro that we came from. There is a downhill walk going to the pier and the uphill walk leaving seems steeper but is doable. The pier has an assortment of restaurants, amusements, shops and street vendors. There is a beautiful indoor carosel and a ferris wheel that is lit up with neon every night. It is certainly worth a visit when you're in the area.

In west Los Angeles. It reminds me a little of South Street Seaport in New York. It begins a sunny blue sky day but as we were driving toward the coast, the fog suddenly appeared, as if out of nowhere. The street cleaner said, hope the skies will clear ‚Ä¶ unfortunately it didn‚Äôt. We walked to Venice Beach in the cold. As we‚Äôre driving back in the afternoon, the sun reappeared again, and hot 80 degree.

column2: A most of our holiday but somewhat disappointed
column3: We had to come here of course as staying in the area, def not like the movies...lol...We personally found the Arcade part of the pier, dirty, and congested, didnt feel like it was laid out at all, but thats our thoughts. As we had been given discounts for tickets being we flew Air New Zealand that was a bonus as certainly not worth the price we think, kids liked some of the rides, and the arcade games too, though compared to Disneyland and Vegas we found this part expensive, and the soft toys were really cheap and nasty some of the staff (as young) where rude and not really interested in doing their job, but we did come here first week of Jan so maybe thats why, kids working who didnt really want to work. The one person who was amazing was the gentlemen in the office shop by kids merry go round inside he was fabulous, helpful and informative, thats the saviour here. We did go for a stroll along the beach even though not weather for it, but a must when you here and that was cool, the kids even though cold as, still played on the beach, so I would say do visit but be prepared its going to cost you...

Nice place to have some random fun! Was there twice (2014 & 2016) and had fun. The best part was to see the sunset from out of the Ferris wheel !!! And the contrast between watching at the ocean and waves and the fun park!

The pier was super cute with an old timey feel. The bracelets for the kids were $60 for two to ride unlimited rides. We went during spring break and it wasn't very crowded. You can fish from the pier. Several street performers were playing music. The beach is right next to it. Pretty fun.

column2: What a great sight to see
column3: If you like honky tonk this is the place to see. There's a lot going on here and it's crowded. Plenty of food choices and things to do. This place is eye candy for kids. Great views of the ocean and mountains.
Perhaps walk down it to say you have done it but really I found it overwhelming disappointing. Too many people not enough to do looking a bit tired and old.

Definitely worth a visit if you're visiting Santa Monica. Sure it's a tourist trap but there's a nice vibe and pretty views over the ocean.Nice spot for sunset photo opportunities or nighttime pics with the colourful lights in the background.Not a huge choice in terms of food, mainly burgers and the very touristy Bubba Gumps, I'd recommend walking back off the pier and turning right, a block or so down is "Bruno's", where you'll find some hearty Italian food.
Beach was nice and the board walk was cool to pass time with. Seabrite was a cool seafood stop. Fresh fish and cold brews

Santa Monica itself looked as a very lively and jovial place. The people here were very friendly as one of the Uber drivers promptly got back my phone left in his car and dint charge an extra penny. Hats off to him. This Pier was damn colorful and it looks even more amazing during sunset. When the last few golden lights off the day sets in this place, the photographer in you springs up into action. This is one of the best place to get some perfect silhouette pictures if you are a serious photographer. There aren't much choice for food for vegetarians. That was a major drawback for us. The pier at night along with the lighting is a view that anyone would cherish forever.
This place is hyped and overrated. Way too crowded and hard to move around. We went midday on a weekday. Maybe that's peak but I won't go back another time to find out.

Took a Whirlwind Hollywood tour from Vegas and The Pier was our first stop. It seemed well kept and safe. The beach was beautiful and the pier brought back memories of summers past in a much more relaxed and simpler time.We were there before the ride section was really open completely for the day but between the beach and stores and rides, there is plenty to do for a full day of fun in the sun. Make Pier Burger a stop for a complete 60's pier experience

This a great spot to kill some time, enjoy the ocean breeze, take in a sunset, people watch, relax or play on the beach, stroll along the boardwalk, grab a bite to eat AND be highly entertained by some of the awesome street performers. I had a lot of fun here with my mom. We had just gotten in from our flight from Seattle and were looking for something low key to do. This was perfect. And we were surprised to see that it is the end of good old Route 66!

I felt it was too small compared to seaside heights or Atlantic city it was nice tho more for the kids there's also a small aquarium adults pay only $5 kids are free beach cleaner than newyorks and parking is only $6 there's bike rentals and bike lanes on the beach nice concession stand beach themed

I don't have much to say as I've been to many piers across the US and this one isn't anything special. It's about what you'd expect. There are some food options that are decent and there are a few attractions for kids but other than that and maybe people watching it's just ok. The only reason I'm giving it 3 stars is the sunsets there are gorgeous.

The pier was a great place to stop when visiting the area- be warned it is a very crowded area.The beach is beautiful but the water is cold- the kids don't seem to mind. Plus the view of the mountains in the distance is incredible.The pier itself is nice but pricey. So make sure to eat before hand or expect to pay a lot- we did enjoy a delicious funnel cake. The shops are way over priced!

We visited in February 2017. It was our first Pier visit ever and really enjoyed it. We have a daughter that enjoyed the rides - we did visit during the week and multiple rides were managed by 1 person. Taking a picture at night with the Ferris Wheel in the background was pretty neat. We would visit again!

First and foremost we enjoyed our time here. That said, there isn't a ton about the pier that's unique. Nice carnival rides, etc. and the views were good. I'd prioritze it lower if you're trying to figure out what to do in LA

column2: Its what you see in the films
column3: Nothing beats a nice walk along the pier on a sunny day. Some of the entertainment is a bit strange, but overall really good. Lots of good places to eat and drink. Loved it

column2: Great Walking and Taking in the Sights.
column3: The day we walked on the pier was cool and overcast, but it didn't stop people from walking up and down the boardwalk. Unknown to us, it is the end point for the fabled Route 66 (which begins in Chicago). There are lots of activities to temp the adventurous and even the more temperate in nature (the ferris wheel looked like it would be a cool activity on a sunny day).A great way to spend a lazy afternoon with good friends.
It's a big pier on the ocean with lots of entertainment to keep people interested. Good for the kids

column2: Food and shopping on the pier
column3: I had the best, freshest lobster tail Ive ever had life just $22. Ur was heavenly!!! When I finished that, we went. Ack forRound two...truffleFries with lobster for just $8. What a feast! The Santa Monica Pier has something for everyone.
Beautiful sunsets and interesting people. People doing street shows. Many restaurants around.Long walk all the way out to the ocean.The beach is beautiful
Beautiful view, restaurants and souvenir shops. Beach access and parking. Had a good visit there. Lots of food vendors too. Rides for the family. Glad we stopped on our road trip.

Spent the day at Santa Monica Pier and Venice Beach. Superb location for a stroll along the beach in excellent weather. Many bars and restaurants to stop on the way. Great atmosphere. Will definately go back.

column2: Beautiful place for a Half marathon!
column3: Last October I ran a half marathon on a gorgeous Sunday morning! It looped around the pier a couple times and we ran down through Venice Beach and then back on the bike path! It was a flat, scenic race as we watched the sunrise come out over the pacific. Definitely a bucket list run and I really enjoyed my time on the famous SM beach!

We decided to take a day trip to try a nearby restaurant and take in the pier.I am a So Cal native that had never been there. This was around Christmas time and it was extremely crowded which made it difficult to simply take in the sights.
