I'm not anxious to go back any time soon to possibly go elbow to elbow with sea of fellow tourists.There's plenty of chain restaurants that are family friendly with a small amusement park. Plenty of tourist trap shopping also. Pretty sight overlooking the ocean, but I can get the same thing with fewer people elsewhere.
This is a nice pier. There are many little booths with souvenirs and lots of carnival type foods. There are some rides. There is a nice view off the end of the pier.

We took the bus and a train there from Culver City. Did not take long. Weather was perfect and there was a slight breeze. There was live music playing in a few different locations on the pier. We bought some affordable souvenirs. A unique hologram type picture of my boyfriend and me. I bought a 3-D piece of handpainted glass work that was really awesome but unfortunately got broken on the plane ride home. I wish I could replace it but there was no business card with this gentleman's artwork. Ate lunch at the pier. Had chicken nachos and freshly prepared guacamole made tableside. Everything tasted wonderful! Beautiful view of the beach with mountains in the background. Got lots of great photos! I hope to be back again one day.

column2: Amazing atmosphere at both day & night!
column3: On our first night in LA, we visited the pier and it was all lit up and still busy with locals and tourists. I felt like I was on hannah montana the movie! We then visited during the day, later on in the week, and the atmosphere was amazing. Definitely a must visit for anyone visiting, so many amazing memories to capture and share with your family and friends!

column2: Beautiful views but pier not so much
column3: The beach was nice but the pier wasn't that impressive to be honest. You have to pay for parking, pier is full of people singing or playing an instrument in the hopes of getting some of your loose change. The rides for the kids are ok I was not too impressed with the variety of places to eat. However the views the homes around the beach amazing.

column2: Lovely sunset, fun and romantic atmosphere!
column3: Great ambience from late afternoon past sunset. Beautiful sunset view and atmosphere with the usual musicians and artists. Rides were all fun and family friendly and there were quiet a few restaurant options. Great way to spend your evening

My husband and I went to Santa Monica pier on a sunny Saturday March day.Plenty of place to park. Do your research before hand to find the cheapest, the one we used was $8 for the day. Get there early before 9am to miss the queues.The pier is free to get on with plenty of eateries and entertainment to keep you busy for a few hours. There's a fairground and arcade and numerous street performers and sellers.Great place to people watch and relax in the sun.(I was put off from going to Venice beach by the amount of reviewers who mentioned the amount of homeless that were at that particular beach. Whilst there were a few here at Santa Monica beach there wasn't so many that made it a problem for me.)
Great old syle pier - all the usual stuff pluse a gorgeous carosel inside. Lovely to walk along and just take in the atmosphere

column2: Eat, watch the beautiful views and have fun!
column3: Santa Monica Pier offers a lot of things to do. It's super touristy but that's not a surprise. Eat, watch the beautiful views and have fun!

Probably went too early in the day, but not much was going on. The beach is kind of dirty and homeless/beggars hanging out on the beach. The pier itself was mostly closed, at 10 am. We might go back at night and see if the atmosphere is a little different.
Great visit for people watching and seeing so many different characters on the pier is an eye opener. A must for all tourists.
Santa Monica pier was okay, nothing spectacular. The beach was better, but turn around before you get close to Venice beach because that area is very sketchy.

column2: Touristy but fun to visit with friends.
column3: My best friend had never been to Los Angeles before, so when she was here I took her to the pier (among other places). I had been there multiple times, but never on the Ferris wheel, so we did that together once it got dark. It was a lot of fun, and the view was amazing!
This is such a cultural icon! You can just sit and people watch all day!! From the tourists to the pier artists to the fantastic view, there is something for everyone!
Worth a visit if your in LABest to go late afternoon or early. Lots of souvenir shops.Great views of the coast as far as Malibu.

my wife and i took our two nephews aged 6 and 8 to the pier and they loved it. i thought that maybe we'd get an hour or two out of it but the boys just couldn't get enough. after walking the length of the pier and checking out the people fishing, we bought the unlimited rides ticket for the kids and they rode every ride at least 6 times, some maybe 10 times. throw in an ice-cream and we had the makings of a perfect afternoon and two very tired little boys who slept very well that night!

I included walking the length of the pier and people watching as part of my daily "get out of the house and walk" goal.It was sunny and a pleasant spring temperature on the day I went, and not too breezy.I enjoyed watching and contributing to the street performances, chatting with random people, and helping vacationers by playing photographer so that their family pictures would have everyone in the group in the photo.And of course I bought a couple of small souvenirs for grand-nephews along the way.Because there are so many things to see and do, I achieved my step goal and my time outside, interacting with others goal. It was fun.

column2: Good for a few hours visit
column3: Great for a few hours. There are rides, food outlets and plenty to entertain both adults and children.
This is fun place to visit. The ferriswheel ride is a classic must do. Good place to stop and have fun while touring the LA area.

Going to SM Pier is a nice walk on a pier with a lot of locals singing, painting, etc. for money. It's a great place to walk through then head to the beach on a sunny day. The pier itself is frankly over rated. However, the walking paths along the beach and the benches on the beach to enjoy the view is what makes the trip worthwhile. You can rent bikes as well to stroll along the cement path and bike for miles.

A great place to walk around, go on rides, eat, fish, just walk and bask in the sun. The big downfall is: parking-get there early to park on pier ( its $20). Handicapped is FREE and always have a spot for you in the pier!!

Of course, Santa Monica Pier is in 2 out of every 3 movies you've ever seen so it's fun to go have a look, but it's also a fun, relaxed place to wander around on a nice afternoon. Lots of shops and rides in the area, and there are tons of people fishing. We did not get a chance to see the aquarium, but we spent a good hour just wandering around. Also, lots of live performers so bring some singles!
I expected Santa Monica Pier to be more happening! Must say it was a bit of a let down but nevertheless, it's still worth a visit after hearing about it and having seen it in movies.

column2: Free live music and people watching
column3: Something for everyone - the kids will like the carousel and rides.Plenty of street performers to gawk at.Cleaner restrooms are at the end of the pier!!!Highly recommended.
Went to Santa Monica Pier as part of our trip to California. Beach is beautiful and nice to see where bay watch was filmed. It was quite cloudy when we visited which was a shame.

column2: Probably nice when the weather is better, ...
column3: When we where there in February 2017 it was drizzling, chilly and windy. Understandably, we didn't linger too long. There is a small amusement park on the pier that might be something for the kids for times when the weather is better.

Compared to other piers in LA, Santa Monica is my least favorite. It felt a little junky, too many people peddling goods and music. I prefer a low-key pier experience, where I can watch the ocean, chill out and relax.Not so much here, but I can see where this caters to a tourist in search of trinkets and knick-knacks.
We spent the afternoon walking around, people watching, enjoying the street buskers, great lunch at Mariasols, took loads of photos.
We loved Santa Monica Pier/Pacific Park!! It was fun and beautiful and lively. Great time with many things to see and do.
Just like you see on tv. But not sure why people want to visit it anymore. Overcrowded. Commercialized.Good churro.Locals and tourists combine for a carnival atmosphere.
The bad thing it's that all the restaurants where closing early the night we went ... but the site seen its good
Quaint, nice atmosphere, good views, short walk to city restaurants. Wait until the end of the pier before making any purchases :)
It's incredible how many people can fit on the pier lots of street performers people generally had a good time but nothing you have to do

If you like carnival food, gift shops and water, this is a great place. The end of Route 66 is also at the pier. We hit up the ferries wheel and coaster and had a blast on each. Friendly people, it was crowded even on a Thursday, but if you like you can always walk off the pier to the beach! Must see if you're in Santa Monica

It's a nice place to hangout with family or friends.There's an amusement center for kids and/or teens.When I was there, there were 3 or 4 local talents who were performing, so you can pick your own style.There were souvenier shops and snack bars too.The only negative thing was the traffic going there but other than that, it was one of the better places that I visited in South CA

I've heard so much about Santa Monica pier and beach in the past so I was so excited to spend a day there . I didn't enjoy it that much. It was dirty..... the city is beautiful though but not the beach
Spent the day riding around and loved it, great street acts, felt very safe & relaxed. Lots of families around too, amazing talent here
Visited the pier on a very windy and cold afternoon so did not enjoy it very much. Seems like there is a lot of fun for families with young children who can appreciate the rides.
It's our third visit to the pier and this time we had the kids to show it to. They loved it. There are lots of this for them to enjoy.

This was one of my favorite places in L.A. The pier was picturesque. I would recommend going on at least the fairest wheel if you can. We hired bikes for super cheap and took a ride down to Venice beach from the pier. It was about 7kms round trip, around 40mins super easy ride. Make sure you dont hit the sand and keep to the bike tracks.

column2: Fun for all - lots to do, or just wander
column3: Electric violins, drummers, acrobats, ferris wheels - it's all there at the Santa Monica Pier. Very county-fair, midway-like - lots of fun to just people watch. The Ferris Wheel is not expensive and you get a fabulous view of Santa Monica and the ocean. The ride lasts long enough to get a good look at everything. Lots to eat. Flying Trapeze artists do daring tricks-right there on pier.

column2: West coast version of Coney Island
column3: My son & I had a good time. We got on the Ferris Wheel and was able to take great pictures of the beach, the boardwalk & the sunset. Afterwards, we ate at Bubba Gumps.

Cute. Nice walk out to the pier. Great people watching. Chachkies being sold in various stalls and shops. Amusement rides were shut down in the evening by time we made our second trip down the pier... but beautiful light show on Gerri's wheel at night.

column2: Kid at heart, great for everyone
column3: End a long day at pier! It's perfect for everyone! There's plenty of options for food, games & local vendors. Feeling nostalgic, we jumped in a photo booth to capture the kid at heart feeling. Keep in mind a lot of the food options close early (after sunset) with the exception of Mariasols at the end of the pier. If you don't have a car, you can easily get there using the metro, connecting at union station (travel time: 40 mins-hour with stops). It's a fun activity that doesn't need to cost anything, just sit back, listen to the ocean, watch the sunset.

The scenery in the pier is great, but my wife was not to fund of the junkies that are all over the area since we have 4 young kids. Personally I loved the small amusement park and had a great time riding the Ferris wheel.

This was my second time at the pier. The first time was 10 years ago and I can't say much has changed. There are souvenir shops, an arcade, carnival type games, street artists, food stands, restaurants and of course, an amazing view of the Pacific, California coastline and beach. There is no charge to walk the pier, which is always a plus when on vacation.

column2: The Sign is the Coolest Part
column3: This is basically a fishing pier with some amusement rides on it. It's honestly no great shakes. Take a walk, enjoy the view and take a selfie or two and move on. There's nicer stuff to see in SoCal.
Pacific Park is small. Not very many rides. Wasn't very busy. First time here, guess was expecting more

column2: Walking along the Pier at night is a lot of fun!
column3: I forgot how much fun it is to people watch on a warm evening in Santa Monica walking along the pier. It is free and just a great deal of fun.

column2: Nice view but way too crowded!
column3: I live close to the pier. Drive by it, walk by it but have not gone onto it in maybe 10 years. There are always a long line of people walking on to it, mostly families and tourists.....Just not my thing I guess.

You'll recognize this famous pier from many movies, and that's exciting. The people-watching on the pier and throughout the several blocks near by is great! Nice restaurants and shops nearby. I didn't ride any rides--just enjoyed scenic views and interesting folks.

column2: The Pier that you must go
column3: There is tons of piers in California, but this one you must go. It¬¥s a mix of cultures and different people, beutiful view and always you will take a good picture and good memories from this place.H√° muitos piers na California, mas voc√™ n√£o pode deixar de visitar este aqui. Tem um mix de pessoas diferentes e voc√™ sempre levar√° sempre uma boa foto e boas memorias deste lugar.
as we were in santa monica we HAD to visit the famous pier.was lovely atmosphere, lots of hustle and bustle.If you get the chance its worth coming down at night as the wheel is light up beautifully!

We walked out to the end of the pier and it was very busy with stalls, cafes and buskers. The sunset is spectacular. There are a lot of rides and at night they are lit up, you get a great light show. There is food for all tastes and the price is reasonable. If you like people watching this is the place to be.

I really enjoyed Santa Monica, the whole place had character and had a great food/shopping district. The pier was smaller than I expected but was still great to walk on and look back on the beach and distant views. Didn't eat there as they didn't look as appealing as the restaurants on the third promonade. Will definately be back to Santa Monica.

This was the first spot we visited when we came to L.A. for our very first brief visit, and what a great place for our first taste of California! We had a relaxing afternoon strolling about, watching street performers, people-watching, popping into souvenir stores, listening to the waves and just basking in the glory of the Pacific and the California sun. Gorgeous sunset views as well!
Tired worn out and full of junk. So disappointing not worth a trip unless you want to see the end of route 66
Tons of people! Really popular attraction. Bathrooms were really clean given the amount of visitors in the area. Lots of entertainers and singers on the pier. We visited for about an hour.
Thought this place was about the ferris wheel and some decent restaurants. More like a fair with all kind of cheap stuff to purchase. The amusement park (t) looked like fun!
Lovely place, not just the Pier but the hole Santa Monica. The best place in Los Angeles. Beach, Shopping, places to go for a run, a beautiful Boulevard, lovely restaurants and coffee stores.
I like how they put it in altogether there. many restaurants and amusement park! Lovely to visit area and chill on the beach üåä

column2: No handicap/accessible access. Hard to get to pier.
column3: The pier had lots of people milling about. Hard to access if you have trouble walking. Have to cross over a bridge and it is an uphill pull going back. Couldn't find any accessible access. Once on bridge there are souvenir vendors and places to eat. There are musicians playing for tips. There is a Ferris wheel and a few amusement rides. It does have great views of the beach and water with places to sit. It was a nice experience.

Riding the Ferris wheel and eating fast food on the Santa Monica Pier while listening to live music is a quintessential experience to have when visiting LA even if it is just for 24hrs. We caught the hop on hop off red bus from Broadway which maximised our access to city sites and which allowed us to take time to visit great places like Santa Monica's Pier at our leisure.

column2: Great to tread the famous boardwalk
column3: We stopped off here to catch the atmosphere of the pier and it didn't disappoint with its entertainers and food outletsSpent a few hours taking in the amazing ocean views and entertainment

column2: Noisy, busy and full of people trying to take your money
column3: Ok, only went to the pier because of the Connelly book, the reversal and being Close wanted to following in the footsteps of the book and get a feel,for myself. Just what I expected from a pier, noise, stalls and poor food. Maybe it's my age, but this is no longer fun, perhaps 40nyears ago.....

column2: Another tick off the bucket list... do it!
column3: The great Santa Monica Pier... recommended by so many friends, I didn't know what the fuss was about until my visit. The Pier was huge! Restaurants, an amusement park, little bistros and stalls selling souvenirs and treats. Buskers plying their trade, people fishing off the pier, swimmers riding the waves. Even the Police Station at the end of the Pier was interesting. Lots of people playing on the sand, would have loved to stay to watch the sunset if not for catching my flight out that night.
We love the pier. Reminds us of so many movies. There is a great vibe there. We stayed at Venice Beach which was a nice stroll down to the pier.

column2: One of my Favourite Spots in LA
column3: This is one of my favourite locations in LA! The Pier itself is pretty good, but what makes it so excellent is everything in the surrounding area. You have Beach, Muscle Beach, Vince Beach, Shopping, Food, Craft Markets and so many sites from the movies.I really recommend hiring a bike from the pier and riding to Vince Beach.

We loved it here, especially the atmosphere. There are multiple stores to get your gifts and souvenirs and enough restaurants to fill your tummy. Make sure to try the roller coaster, it's not a record breaker but it's a unique experience to so this on a pier.
We went on a cold day.It was very nice to see the ocean, views and fisherman at the edge of the pier. We also took a stroll on the beach later on which was great with little kids
I didn't think that it was anything special! Just a few tourist shops and boardwalk food. The parking sticks too and is expensive!

Unfortunately there was not much to do, rides were terrible and so was the arcade, it felt very out dated, we were at the pier for 15 minutes then headed back into town, don't set out an entire day for this as you will be disappointed.
Fun place to visitPlenty of dining optionsEasy walk from Venice beachBike ride also an option from Venice

We visited on a weekday and no rides were on so was a little disappointing.However we still had a great day, and had a fantastic shake from the little ice cream parlour.Don't put $1 in Zoltar, he stole my money and didnt tell me my future :(

column2: Honky Tonk? Yes, but that is Okay if that's what you are in the mood
column3: I don't want to sound elitist. It is Honky Tonk but I visit it often. I like to listen to the music of the various musicians and they change a lot. I don't eat the food on the Pier -- there are so many things to try in the City. I like to do my people watching and I can't stop watching kids enjoy the entertainment and the games and the water.

We visited Santa Monica pier on a nice sunny day. Easy walk from Venice beach. Small amusement rides. Nice views. Multiple cafes/restaurants nearby. Can use city sightseeing hop on-hop off bus to get here. Nice place to relax.

If you are in Santa Monica then it is a must to visit the Pier, which is famous throughout the World.After crossing over the footbridge that crosses the Pacific Coast Highway, which is an attraction all on its own, you can walk either around the beech or across it to get to the Pier.There are all the usual attractions, big wheel etc and plenty of eateries, but above all a very interesting walk along the Pier taking in the various sites and impromptu entertainment that takes place off and on . It also has a sign up stating that Route 66 ends there!!Good entertainment value for all the Family.
Nothing special, the rides are for small children. Not a great selection of food. The strip mall close by is excellent for food and more to see.

column2: Cool day but bustling with people ... gorgeous view of SoCal coast line
column3: This is a pier overlooking a very long strip of SoCal that on a clear day you can see for mile .... it has the usual tourist traps of course but overall was a fun place to visit while we waited on our tour bus to leave. We spent over an hour just enjoying the scenery. On a hot day one could park and enjoy the beach as well. It was only 8 dollars to park for the entire day which is a bargain in any city .... that could change with seasons of course. The amusement park is quite small and more aimed at younger teens.
The pier is a place to go and spent some time to see, eat or entertain. It has something for every age. And offcouse have a look at the ocean and maybe spot some dolphins.

Crowded, great views of the city behind you and the Cali coastline... Lots of touristy shops, not high end at all.. An amusement park on site too, but didn't go, just looked at how quaint it appeared!! LOTS of bums sleeping in the area of park and grass surrounding the entrance, which was a bit odd, and disturbing.... seems to be a problem in many of the warm So Cal areas...But, anyway, a nice place to check out, but once is enough!!

A pier is a pier (unless it‚Äôs Chicago‚Äôs Navy Pier) especially if all the tourist traps and restaurants are closed. But, here ends US Route 66 so if you have to make a trip to the terminus, and you want to have something to eat or grab a souvenir check what times places open. Don't try to beat the crowd by arriving too early in the morning. (Midwestern thing I guess)

column2: Good place to eat and ride
column3: We arrived late afternoon and purchased tickets for the children's rides the attendants were really kind and helpful we only had five minutes until the children's rides closed but the attendants kept a couple open so little children could have a ride.
This is a must see as it is the end of route 66 ! In addition you have the Pacific park where you will have a good time. I recommend to try the Bubba Gump restaurant for a quick lunch or dinner.
The pier is a happy place full of music and people walking all over.There are some restaurants and a little park for the kids.The ocean view is beautiful.
I love walking along the pier, getting some fresh air, people watching and then having lunch or dinner. You can't go wrong here.

column2: Fun place to people watch and bring the kids
column3: We arrived late on a cool Feb afternoon and this pier was quite busy. It has the usual tourist carnies and rides, but we found the street performers and people watching the best show here. Backed by a great ocean view this was a pleasant visit. We didn't the food here, it looked and smelled too touristy, but instead went to the nearby Erven restaurant for dinner (which was excellent).

Police cars driving up and down the pier with surf boards on the roof is a hoot, the place is great to take the family, roller coaster and Ferris wheel , heaps of places to eat and they still catch fish there ! We were in Santa Monica for 3 days and ended up there every day .

My husband and I really enjoyed it. Parking was close and a fair price. Walking down the boardwalk was beautiful and had lots to do. Lots of street entertainment and vendors selling fairly priced and unique souvenirs. We rode the wheel and roller coaster at Pacific Park also. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The beach was nice too. We stayed and watched the sun set and even saw a sea lion off the pier.

Well it was for me. Pier was good and intact and forms the end of Route 66 so that made it interesting. Otherwise it was just the usual fair ground rides and attractions. Plenty of places to get food and drink. Parking nearby might be helpful for those who aren't staying nearby. Be aware of the number of homeless in the area.

Perfect place to escape the craziness of L.A.About 20 mins from Hollywood is this seaside Carnival. The Santa Monica Pier is the official end of Route 66 and the sign is out on the boardwalk.The boardwalk has all kinds of souvenir stores, food vendors and sideshows .It is fun, vibrant and a great place to hang out. The beach nice and the gym park right next to the pier is always full of people. Parking in the Santa Monica shoppping mall offer 90minutes free parking. Best spot for the iconic pier shot is on the left side of the pier down on the beach.

We parked on the pier. When we were ready to leave I went to go pay for the ticket. I used my credit card to pay for it, but somehow it declined. Therefore, I paid with my debit and it went through. Today, I checked both of my bank and they charged me the parking fee on my credit card and debit card. I was charged TWICE!

I am 70 and grew up in L.A. Basically the pier is the same as 60 years ago with modern lights. Great just to be there but nothing special. Parking is difficult and rides are cheesy. In my opinion, it is better to just walk on the paths.
Employees weren't pleasant and the prices were steep. It was surprisingly clean though. The beach was beautiful!

column2: Good place to relax and unwind
column3: We walked along the pier quite early in the morning and already the street performers and stalls were setting up. Was nice and sunny with nice views. Something you should definitely do while in the area.
Went here on our recent visit to LA a great day out had lunch at bubba gumps excellent food and friendly staff worth a visit
We liked the Santa Monica Pier a lot. The livemusic there is great and the sunset awesome. We did the beachealk to venice beach which is just a mile. Very beautiful

column2: A Pleasant Walk on the Pier
column3: Exploring the Pier on a perfect weekday morning is a slice of heaven. With excellent views of Santa Monica, her expansive beach and Venice beach to the south, the musicians and vendors set up their booths and the arcade staff tune video and pinball machines and get prizes ready. The Pier hums with productivity. Typical food choices (tacos, funnel cakes, ice cream, coffee, etc.) plus a nice sit-down resto at the far end of the Pier. Paid parking (on the Pier itself and below on asphalt) is plentiful, convenient and reasonably-priced. Historical plaques tell the history of place in re. surfing, fishing, coastal activity. It is the Western end of Route 66. And on the beach below is the Original Muscle Beach. Well worth a morning stroll.

We went here on the last week of December and it was a sunny day but got chilly at night. We really enjoyed our visit here and had a great view of the sunset. The place is packed with people, tourists and locals hanging around just enjoying the ocean view and seabreeze. One of the many places I love to come back again because of the ocean. Worth a visit!

Walk in the sand, ride the carousel, grab some good eats or just sit and watch the waves. The pier offers fun for all. It's a throw back in time AND the end of the famous Route 66! You can play in the arcade and grab some ice cream as well. Enjoy this very special place.

column2: Great Pier with a very nice Buzz
column3: The pier is excellent for a walk to enjoy sunset and the music played through few musicians. We have loved our afternoon walk during our short visit to Santa Monica. highly recommended, needs a bit of maintenance but in general, great place to be.

column2: The end of the Mother Road
column3: I had always wanted to drive Route 66 but my wife felt that the journey would be too long. So with a son living in San Francisco we opted for flights to New York and then Las Vegas, road trip around Nevada/Arizona/Utah, Death Valley/Yosemite ending in San Francisco. After a couple of weeks with our son we set off for Los Angeles for our final week. All in all approximately the same road distance travelled as if we had done Route 66! However I did get to stand at the end of the Mother Road and have the pictures to prove it. The pier is a busy bustling place by day or night. The entertainment ranging from German rock group to "Rock & Roll Jesus" to country to classical guitar and violin depending on the time of the day. Fast food outlets by the score, restaurants to tempt you in from the hot unshaded walk along the pier and tourist stalls selling hats, pictures, postcards etc An obligatory funfair with blaring music and at night a garish light show, If you come off this pier without spending anything then you have more willpower than the average person.This is tourist trap heaven, but then why come here if you don't want to be treated like a tourist?

You can't really give this place a miss! The pier has so much to offer with its own amusement park on it!Along the way there are various places to sit down and have a meal with many gift shops along the way.Walk down to the end of the pier and you may be lucky enough to spot the local and ever so friendly seal who was more than happy to put on a show for the crowd!

One of my favorite pier for a hang out. This pier offers some real cool shops, delicious lobster & beer and some spectacular view of the Pacific! And if you get lucky, you can enjoy some cute seals playing in the water! It does get crowded but who loves a barren or lonely pier either :) Loved it!

column2: Romantic @ Night Fun During the Day
column3: Catch this during the day and you can shop the little shops, listen to bands, and people watch all day!At night there's no better place to catch a beautiful sunset!!!!!!
Stupid, dirty, bad entertainmentSmell of urine all around. Homeless seemed to live with their stuff, nothing good here. Was expecting beautiful views and local talent. Need to change for sure

I went to Santa Monica for the beach, not the pier, although it looks like a fun, family-friendly place full of games and a ferris wheel, etc. The repeating music drove me a bit insane (I went as far down the beach as possible to avoid the string/electronic repeating version of "Closer") and I didn't want to spend any money‚ÄîI mainly just wanted a beach day. But it was still worth the visit! The end of Route 66, iconic, sits on the Pier, and since I'm from Chicago, that's well worth the visit. If you're looking for cheap postcards and trinkets to take home or send off to relatives, this is also a good place to go, but if you're just a tourist who mainly plans to be on the beach like I was, still worth walking up for the nice sign marking the end of the Route.

Went here on a chilly day not by choice but it was still fun. Lots of people watching, rides for kids and kids at heart, little shops, good food and right at the ocean. Beautiful views and awesome vibe from all of the surroundings you take in. Fun to be here even when it's chilly or cloudy, as there are games, food, shopping and vendors to entertain you. Definitely a must see for anyone new or returning people.

column2: Amazing place to be, the end of Route 66!!
column3: So iconic, the very end of Route 66!! So pretty and they have done a fantastic job rebuilding this iconic structure! Shops, restaurants and the historical "The Sting" carousel, it is truly a place to visit! Reasonable parking, beach, sand, sun, fun, food, people-watching, attractions, all in one place, a must-see! Immerse yourself in the California atmosphere here!!

column2: Old fashioned pier with fairground rides and cheap touristy shops
column3: The pier is nice to look at from a distance but it's a bit tacky, with cheap touristy shops and fairground rides. For UK travellers, think old fashioned beach resorts like Blackpool!Not really my scene but it gets busy so it must appeal to some!

We mostly came here to see the end of Route 66 sign. A picture is a must!We didn't go into the funfair but it looked like it had enough rides to entertain you.There were several little shops selling trinkets along the pier.

column2: Very crowed but the place to be
column3: Cool place with street musicians and artists ;) The amusement parc is in top condition and also quite nice to see but the prices are a little bit too expensive but you know nothing's for free ;) But for a short visit it is quite worthy ;)

This is a fun place to visit and walk around. I rode the Ferris wheel to get some great pictures of the beach and surrounding area. Grabbed a bite to eat at a hamburger stand near the Ferris wheel, not that great, but I got to sit down with some nice folks from South Africa who were visiting and talk with them for a bit. Took a few minutes to go sit on the beach and relax. Visited the bike rentals on the other side of the pier and rode my bike along the beach to visit Venice Beach. That was the best part of my trip. I highly recommend renting a bike. I could have rode for miles and got to see so much.
The pier is very busy, but nice. Wonderful place to watch the sunset and the people. Enjoyed spending time there.

column2: Yah, seen it, don't need to go back.
column3: I wish I didn't use a full afternoon of our trip to go to this area. So touristy and full of questionable characters and cheap food. Walk up a few blocks to eat and shop - 3rd street is a more worthwhile place to spend your dollars.

There is so much to see on the pier. Buskers, food, stalls, the ocean and the fun fair. No treip to Santa Monica is complete without the pier. Then head to 3rd Avenue for cafes and great shopping. Perfect day.

I used to hang here quite a bit when I was living in Santa Monica. There's always a good mix of people and artists to watch. Eat and drink at the Bubba Gump Shrimp restaurant! And take a skateboard down the hill :)

I never thought that I could stay in the beach and at the same time inside the amusement park. Also, Santa Monica Pier is the end of the famous Rote 66 and you can enjoy some good restaurants too, like Bubba Gump Shrimp.
I guess this is the best place to meet the sunrise with cup of Stabucks coffee, and be prepared to memorize the picture when Pacific ocean will drive the surfers next to you.

Visited here on part of a tour I was on and was looking forward to the visit as I have seen this iconic spot on many tv shows and movies. So great to see it in real life. Unfortunately for us we were on a strict time frame and were here before the rides were open. Will have to return next time I'm in LA later in the morning. The rides look perfect for children of all ages. There is something for everyone. The attraction its self is essentially free if you are not going on rides or consuming food. A great place to stop and take photos if you have the chance and the access. There are public toilets nearby which is always useful when your on the move.

As one of ending points of Route 66 trail, it's not just like the other pier, this place offers too many attractions that makes it very attractive enough to all travellers who make a visit to Santa Monica. From the sceneries, eateries, activities, entertainments and so on, you just can find at this location. It makes Santa Monica Pier is a lovely-a-must visiting place to be.

column2: Perfect for our 7 and 10 year old
column3: My two older girls loved this place. We did go back in the evening and it was more crowded which was hard to navigate with a two year old in tow. Not sure how it would be for kids over ten but mine could have stayed all day

Whole town of Santa Monica is beautiful, for me the most beautiful part of Los Angeles. The Pier is the end of the famous Route 66 so you must take a photo with the sign, come during the week or in the morning because it is really crowded on weekends

column2: A must do while in LA area
column3: Can be crowded and parking can be a difficult depending on what day you visit and the weather. The weather was cloudy so not as much people but still very busy. You can see live music from local artists on the pier.

We got a free ride on the Metro for the day so we decided to take the Expo Line to the end by the Santa Monica Pier. The ride was great. A little crowded but not bad. Beats driving then trying to find parking by a long shot!Anyway, the pier itself is a classic among piers. Harkens back to the '50s when the world was innocent and life was uncomplicated. You have your street vendors and artists there vying for your attention and money to sell you their tasty treats or trinkets. It gets a bit crowded in the afternoon, but you can find solace in a corner here and there. If you're an adventurer, then the ferris wheel is for you! We're not, so we didn't. Eating establishments and shopping are only a few steps away too!All in all, it was a great day to spend an afternoon or day strolling down memory lane!
Amusement park, restaurants and great people watching. The SaMo pier has it all. Take the day and walk to the end or spend some times on the rides.

You feel like a kid on the Santa Monica Pier. It is wonderful. Everyone has fun, everyone is laughing. Take a stroll, a ride, a drink or grab some Food. And if you didnt know: the Santa Monica Pier is the end of Route 66 :)

column2: Fun activity, with mini amusement park...food and fun!!!
column3: We drove out here and spent a half a day walking on the pier, riding a few rides and then taking a walk on the beach. We went in the off-season so clearly it would have been much more busy, but we were able to park on the pier so it was a short walk to the everything. We enjoyed the spectacular views from the pier and all the shops and restaurants on the pier.We rode the Ferris Wheel to get some better views, only about a 10 minute wait so that was great news.Overall, it was a nice half a day to spend in Southern California!!!
Ok so we didn't travel all the way, just the last few yards, but its the end that counts, lol. Its a great place for people watching and buying souvenirs.

I lived in LA years ago and I always enjoyed the pier any time of the year. Great restaurants and local scenery short walking distance away. This past May my family and I spent a few days enjoying LA and my little boy enjoyed the pier more than anything else. The rides were awesome and so were the games throughout the park. If visiting LA it should be on your list and you get to walk around beautiful Santa Monica as well. The promenade is a right up the street.

This is one of my favorite place in Santa Monica. Staying by the beach and seeing people having fun on the rides makes me feel relax. My teens enjoyed the rides. The air is refreshingly cool. There's ample parking.
Any season place, but definitely need to experience the concerts. Good music, cool crowds, great atmosphere.
lots of fun. the end of route 66. the legenderary road that starts from Chicago. On the road book by Jack Kourack. The panoramic wheel is solar activated, it was updated few years ago

It was surreal to be there as I had seen it on TV, films, pictures, etc. Arrived before 10am and was able to locate a good parking spot and we spent time at the pier and beach. We would have stayed longer than 2 hours and will come back at night to take in the lights, etc.
Plenty to do and many restaurants was good to visit the end of route 66 and walk out over the Pacific ocean

Great view of the Pacific Ocean. We ate lunch at the Mexican Restaurant at the end of the pier. The waiter took a picture of our family and brought it back to us in a frame to remember our trip by. We were on a cross country trip from Louisiana to California just stopping everywhere and this was just a bonus. Lots of activity on the pier and places to eat so you do have options. Weather was awesome. Water was cold! Too cold for me. I got in up to my calves and that was it for me. But had to get a picture of us in the Pacific. Make sure to bring a camera.

Quite a few things to do and see, though it won't come cheap. Rides and games are expensive, lots of people on weekends. A few restaurants, sweet shops, large game room and more. Paid parking, winter costs less ($6), summer is more. We enjoy the aquarium, small but educational.
It is as you expect it.. Wood pier. Nice beach. Touristy restaurants... But the smiles. Had a blissfully relaxing time just taking it in.

If you're anywhere near Santa Monica pier you have to go for a stroll on it just to say you've done it! It's pretty, has rides for the kids,and plenty of food choices. It's also the end of the most famous of roads Route 66!

column2: A bustling, fun place to visit
column3: My travel friend was amazed by the weekend crowds on the pier . The people watching is great, the views of the California coastal area is outstanding, the ocean is very scenic, and the amusements and tourist shops are really fun. We truly enjoyed our weekend time there. If you can, try to enjoy the sunsets if the weather is cooperating.
We met my long lost cousin for a great evening of fun and conversation. Great food and entertainment options.
It is nice place to go with anyone really. There is live music, rides, food, games right at the beach.
I went to Santa Monica several times during our stay in Los Angeles and we loved the vendors, waves, water and people. Many vendors and fascinating people/places to see. I can't wait to return.

This is a must visit especially with children, saying that who doesn't love a Ferris wheel. It's a great way to spend an afternoon and has restaurants/bars so you can have lunch, there is something for everyone.

What an amazing throw back in time. What's more eye popping than a Ferris wheel at waters edge. The walk to the pier is amazing and once you've arrived you're treated to a blast from the past amusement park. Also expect good live entertainment and great places to dine. Truly a very fun and entertaining day.

column2: Something for everyone on Santa Monica Pier
column3: We visited some exciting places on the west coast and east coast of USA however Santa Monica Pier was a real surprise. It is not to be missed because there is something for everyone. Musicians, of which I am one, can be absorbed by the live musical performances. The day we were there, we enjoyed a quality opera singer, an accomplished violinist and a band made up of an entire family, the youngest appearing to be aged about 8yrs. They belted out "you better find somebody to love" and the notes soared above the sound of the waves and the seagulls and the excited crowd. So many people visit the pier that the in crowd is separated from the out crowd to avoid congestion. The pier is the end of route 66 and there are plenty of souvenirs by which to remember this. Many came to swim and sunbake but tens of thousands come each day to experience the excitement, eat from one of many yummy food outlets, or just lick an ice cream as the sun goes down. We also met some war veterans with a sobering message. They were men of principle and courage, pointing out the futility of war in an area that could easily have been immersed in mindless patriotism. They had a section of the beach covered in red and white crosses, representing tens of thousands of lost comrades. "You got courage" I offered and the vets said they appreciated their local council for allowing them to be there.
Santa Monica pier and beach are great. Lots of things happening, rides, vendors and food.Awesome for families, friends, couples - must visit while in LA

I've visited this place whenI was younger, and it seems to be a tourist stop for everyone visiting the area. However, I was very underwhelmed. I'll first start off with the positives of the pier. First, the view of the ocean is beautiful. The pier itself is a great view too. There is a room at the beginning of the pier where a carousel is located. It's a very old one and it's an interesting place to explore. Other than that, the pier consists of some odd characters that consist of street peddlers and tourists. The shops consists of cheap "beach" clothing and other souvenirs. There's a few restaurants that seem okay (Bubba Gumps).

column2: Beautiful beach side fun place to spend a whole day with family!
column3: It's an amazing walking experience with the wind from the sea blowing into your hair and you can see people from all our the world having a good time with all the restaurants and fun rides!
Since I was very young, I've been going here, if you're from out of state this place is a must!!! Don't miss the opportunity
A bit cloudy when we were there but didn't detract from a lovely morning out. Nice views and some good attractions
Nice place to walk and enjoy the view of the beach. We parked a few blocks away and walked down, also enjoyed the nearby street markets with beautiful raspberries and strawberries for sale.

column2: Been There, Seen It But No Need To Return
column3: To begin with, the positives are the price of parking. At only $2 per hour up to a max of $10 per day, I consider it very reasonable for a tourist trap.Biggest reason to visit is probably the start/end of Route 66, plus it was a pleasant walk out over the beach.Other than that it is not overly well maintained, lots of expensive and tacky trinket shops, amusements, restaurants and buskers.The water views and surrounding scenery is great, but the ambiance on the pier was poor.

Lots to do at the Santa Monica Pier! Rides, restaurants, shops, walking, and the beach! This was our first time visiting the Pier, and it was a gorgeous sunny day. We walked down the entire Pier and took in all the entertainers and musicians, then walked along the beach. It was pretty cool as there were many people doing acrobatics and working out on bars and poles. Was quite entertaining! We also stopped along the shops as there were lots of spots for souvenirs. We found 3 hour parking which was perfect for us as we arrived around 1 pm. I would highly recommend to visit the Pier if you've never been! Its a must see!

Santa Monica Pier has obviously seen better days!Nothing much more than cheap, junk souvenirs, a few "buskers" and a couple of eateries, as well as the fair-ground rides. Highlight of our visit was realizing that Route 66 began/ended at the pier!!!

column2: Santa Monica Pier ... the end of The MOTHER Road - Route 66
column3: As a musician, I decided to visit this place for all nostalgic reasons. In fact, I took time to show the kids the different versions of Route 66 - with the CARS (cartoon movie) clip an excellent introduction.After spending time to go through the song, the sing along, showing documentary of Route 66, the kids have grown to like the song.When I stood before the sign, I felt a stronger connection to the song as I have traveled to some of these places named on the song. The song was no longer part of the American songbook but part of my life. I guessed that my wife knew it as she volunteered to take picture of the sign with me (without the family). Now, Route 66 has became part of my life. Flagstaff Arizona, Kingsman, Barstow, San Bernardino.... ...It felt strange to be at the end of the road but thankful to be part of this rich history.The Santa Monica pier was not too busy when we were there. There were 2-3 buskers sharing their gift of music. One of them caught my attention as he sang his guts out though there weren't many who paid him his dued attention.There were number of eateries and souvenir shops. The screams from the nearby theme park helped to add some buzz to the area. Walking to the edge of the pier, you would be greeted by a lovely beached who kissed the ocean in nearby horizon. The day was bit hazy and sun was hiding behind the clouds. But there is something about the ocean, the beach and the sky that released some sense of freedom.I love these vibes and could spend my afternoon people watching, listening to the busking and helping myself to the churros. We walked to the end of the pier where there were few restaurants and a gift shop.In front of me was a horizon as far as my eyes could see. Pacific Ocean held the skies along the horizon. The sky was dark and thus not too hot.Though you feel that it was tad "touristy" but do not miss this part of history. This pier has grown old with the city of Angels and I was glad to find some old charm mingled in the magic of ocean.
The Pier is nice for a stroll, but it's very touristy and a bit tired. Not really what I was expecting. It was good to see it, but absolutely no need to ever go back.

column2: You gotta come here at least to see it!!
column3: This place is iconic....and very crowded, especially on the weekends. But if you are visiting from outside the area, you just have to take a walk on the pier. For people watching, and ocean watching. It's a great place to spend some time on a warm summer's day
..., at least on a grey day, and frankly it only deserves 2/5 for the nice walk we had on the boardwalk from Venice Beach to get here...
Large crowds on sunny weekend days. Historical location with many movies filmed there. Was very surprised to see a Pacific seal over the edge of the pier.
This place is a must see. We where there in a cloudy day. But still good. The shopping is good and the feeling of the area is good.

We visited Santa Monica Pier in winter and was a little disappointed. The views were great and there were no queues for any of the rides. Being winter may have contributed to the lack of atmosphere. The roller coaster attendants were nice and friendly, but the staff in the little shops along the pier, seemed to be a little bothered by our presence. A few good things and a few bad things made the experience just average.

Great place to visit. The pier has a few restaurants and souvenir shops. There are people set up long the pier singing and painting amongst other things. Beautiful beaches as well. Parking is available on the street with meters but I recommend parking on the pier. The pricing is reasonable and you are a couple of steps from the entertainment.

Enjoyed strolling up the pier. It is very busy and full of tourist stuff but is enjoyable. Loved the big wheel and roller coaster - $8 each, you ride the coaster twice and get plenty of time on the wheel with some great views. Plenty around for coffee, snacks or a meal. Loads of other smaller rides and games. A fun hour and a half.
It's a Tourist Must! Get a photo, etc. Great Volkswagen Cruise in while we were there. Musicians on the Pier, great vibe. Never knew Route 66 ended at the Santa Monica Pier. Good Trivia to-know!

It's amazing how a Pier has so much to do! We came and ride the Ferris wheel (it's $8/person) to ride but it was well worth it to just enjoy the beauty of the water and the serenity of the waves at the top.

column2: Tourist trap, go if you must
column3: Supper toursity. There are so many better places to visit in L.A. Visit this place only if you need to do so in order to fulfill some sort of dream of yours.
It was a pretty cool place, make sure you walk the whole pier. Lots of different people and cool activities to do on the pier, make sure you ride the little roller coaster and have fun at the arcade

column2: Always a good spot for food and fun
column3: I've been to the Santa Monica Pier numerous times. It's fun during any season but it was a little less crowded when I was there in March (as opposed to summer). We had no problem finding parking and the wait at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. on the SMP wasn't bad at all. This is also a great area to take pictures since the beach is a nice background. Pictures also look lively and fun with the Farris wheel in the background. It's nice to sit and relax in the area too. We stayed in Malibu and drove up for the evening and it was perfect.

For the hype that people give it and the stigma that surrounds it, I was let down. It was not as good as expected and nothing which entertained the adults or the kids too much. Best thing there was seeing bubba gump from Forrest Gump.

column2: Nice pier with amusements and a beautiful carousel
column3: This is a very touristy pave but fun to go to. Check out the beautiful carousel in the merry go round building. The horses are so beautifully painted and it's just such a fun atmosphere. There are other amusements,rides,restaurants to visit as well. Then walk down Santa Monica Boulevard and the promenade for window shopping. There is also a beautiful park located close by which is worth seeing or sitting for a rest.

Our first visit for both of us , left us with an enjoyable experience overall. Like most tourist places it has become very commercialized and some what tacky. I rember watching movies when I was young that showed its uncommercialsed persona and its a shame I did not get to experience those times. That said its a great stroll to the end with beautiful views on either side of the beach. Of all the commercial activities the ferris wheel is worth it for the views you get. If you want to eat try the many restaurants in Santa Monica itself as those we saw on the pier were expensive fast food. A must whilst you are there is to have your picture taken at the end of Route 66 sign. One last thing try visiting during the week as at weekends it gets very busy. Overall an enjoyable experience just wished we had visited many years earlier to see it when it was less touristy!

I love this pier! But, only in bits....it has been a tourist staple for decades and continues to draw the crowds...herein lies my issue.....too many.....cars and people. Being a product of its success, the pier attracts huge weekend and summer crowds. To enjoy your experience here, try a weekday....it is the same ocean any way.

column2: You havent been to LA if you haven't been to the pier
column3: Its just superb people watching- from barely dressed in line skaters to tourists to ladies who lunch- the pier has it all. You can choose from a number of good restaurants near-by ( reservations advised most places) or just stroll the passing crowd along the beach.. Its just a traditional piece of California culture ( if anything is traditional in California),

The Santa Monica Pier is a great place to visit for anyone but I think it's also a great place for a date. I went with a group of friends and had a good time. It's definitely a cool sight to see as I have never seen a pier anything like it.

column2: Cant help but make your heart tingle.
column3: There is just something about Santa Monica Pier that makes your heart tingle, and you cant help but smile. A must do stop, even if you don't ride the rides, its worth the wander down. I did a round on the Ferris Wheel and the view was divine, and the sea breeze is amazing.
The pier is worth seeing if you are in the area. A great beach with a lot to do and a nice trail to walk/bike. Very close to public transportation, shopping, and yummy places to eat.
The pier contains a mini carnival, street artists, and a Mexican restaurant. It's a short walk, but it's worth it for the experience. Try going at night when the pier lights up.

column2: A nice walk on a sunny day
column3: The pier offers an amusement park, some niche shops, and a tremendous amount of people watching. We had a great time just walking out the pier and back on a beautiful December day.

The Santa Monica pier is an iconic landmark as it has appeared in countless films and television shows. I remember the first time I came to Los Angeles, it was my first time seeing the ocean and I was in awe with the pier and the also iconic Bubba Gump restaurant with the Forest Gump bench.Having lived in Santa Monica for years now since my first visit, I would still say it's a spot worthy to visit if you're in town.The pier has a somewhat outdated arcade, theres a few restaurants on/ along side the pier. There is a gift/specialty shop at the end of the pier with Route 66 and other Santa Monica/ Los Angeles souvenirs. There are also some historical facts and photos towards the end of the pier if you're interested in its past.I would say the pier deserves a visit, but once is enough :)

We were in Santa Monica for a day and after driving through LA I wanted a fun, relaxing stop in SM. Did the ferris wheel at Pacific Park, did the walk, got our picture at the end of Route 66 sign after driving it which was a must but other than that, nothing too special and crowded with tourists. We were going to eat nearby but decided against it and drove to Malibu. The walk on the beach was nice.

column2: Walk before dinner at the lobster
column3: Windy and a little chilly at night in October but a great place to Visit at night. Lights from the ferris wheel, street performers and tourist gift shops were all a thing to look at. I love Cali!
We came to walk around, and hopefully hit up a coaster, but most of the rides were shut down. Great place for kids, and having a bite to eat.

Went as a couple for our 2nd anniversary. Went at night and it was cool to see everything. Basically walked to the end, came back to the rides area. We did the Ferris wheel that was cool to get some good views. Gotta go once.

column2: Not bad, but man the singers there suck!
column3: Took a group of Chinese tourist there and good that they did not speak English because the vendors that were singing were horrible, we wanted to pay them just to stop! Nice place to tour around.

Santa Monica Pier is an excellent place to enjoy the sea and the sunset, and some of the musicians playing are really worthwhile listening to. But with the Mexican restaurant at the end of the Pier being closed ... just a short visit I would say. Still nice to hang out and dream away in the warmth if the sinking sun while listening to the sounds around you when you are in the mood to just hang out.
Santa Monica pier has the best amazing beach in LA. It's best to catch up little early but gives you the best view .
Eugh dooo busy you have to fight your way along it.Go see it once...that's all you need!!Felt safer in Venice, it's the new Santa Monica.

Another iconic thing to do in Santa Monica. We were very fortunate to have been staying two blocks away and so got to see this place in all her moods. Generally though, unless you come here early morning, it's gonna be crazy busy to get in (I mean literally queuing and walking at a snails pace to get in or out). The fun fare is definitely an iconic thing to see and photograph but really, it's like any other old fashioned pier, you get out what you put in. Lots of souvenirs to be had, the Route 66 officially ends here too and we saw plenty of musicians/bands/performers. Good to wile away a half hour or so at a time. I've enclosed pics of our first day on the pier, when it was so foggy and hazy, you could barely see anything! We also walked past early morning and I snapped a rare shot of it in quiet mode.

We were here at the beginning of February and it was kind of cold and very windy. So make sure you wear the proper clothes. We walk around the place and then got this awesome pictures of the sun set. Parking lot is big, but you have to pay for it.
Really enjoyed wandering up and down the pier. As you would expect, lots of souvenir shops and places to eat, with amusement park rides that have great lights after dark.
Beautiful place and very much enjoyed the visit; and a beautiful pier and attractions for the entire family. Well worth it to escape the madness of LA

column2: Great place to watch the sunset!
column3: One of the best places to watch the sunset! There's also entertainers to enjoy and carnival activities.
The pier is great. We enjoyed our walk on the promenade and after having lunch visited the pier. Lots of people, great energy. Be aware it can get really windy.
Pier was fun with great views! Loved the pier and ocean/beach scene with the mountains in the background! Expect to pay tourist prices!

column2: Classic must see when in LA. police need to rethink how they are serving the public.
column3: I love walking the pier. great people watching. I witnessed someone overdosed by drugs unable to get up. He was 20 feet from the police office. At the end of the pier there was a police car beeping at the crowd to get out of his way so he could park. why do the police need cars on the pier? they would be better suited to be walking the beat helping those in need and not disturbing the tourists
Awesome To see The most famous pier of all! There are street musicians, there is an trapeze school up there and of course plenty of options To eat and entertain. And see The sea!

Unfortunately we went when California was getting the most rain they have gotten in a long time so we did not get to enjoy the pier to its fullest but thankfully Bubba Gump Shrimp Co was open so we got to enjoy some drinks and stay dry!

This is an iconic stop for anyone visiting Los Angeles. Yes, it is touristy but that is part of the fun. We came here early (10 am) on a Saturday morning in January so it was not busy at all when we arrived and we were able to find parking right by the beach area for only $8. I know parking can be a pain here so I was happy we arrived early. The pier is fun to walk around for about an hour or two and look at the vendors and shops. There was one vendor who paints your name using animals/flowers. We ended up getting one for each of my daughters and it was neat to watch how he did it. The part I enjoyed the most was just walking to the end of the pier and taking in the view. It really was beautiful to be surrounded by the Pacific Ocean with the mountains in the distance.The reason I gave this only 3 stars is because of the amount of trash on the beach around the Pier. There was litter everywhere which gave a negative aspect to the experience.
IF YOU WANT to people see, enjoy the beautiful beaches and take in some amazing walks, then come here.Enjoyed the pier and seeing everything they had to see and eat.

Friendly, Family, Fun. Buskers, rides fortune tellers, you name it this pier has it all. While it's only a short walk plenty is packed in. Cafes, restaurants, candy stores. The views are breathtaking and the peace and calm of the sea is comforting. This is really a must and well worth a visit.

column2: A great old time amusement park
column3: We were here during peak season between Christmas and New Year's and it did not feel crowded. If you have old time fall fairs in your past you'll feel very nostalgic here. There are all the arcade games as well as a Ferris wheel and merry-go-round. You can walk from here along the ocean to Venice Beach so it can be a day long experience.
It was cold and windy on our visit to the pier but had a great time! Kids loved playing video games in the arcade and the merry go round was a fun way to end our visit.

We rode up from Venice Beach, there were plenty of locations to lock our bikes. Pacific Park is free to enter, then you pay for rides & games. The Coaster was definitely fun, we paid for two rides each, but each ride traversed the Coaster twice, so that made it worthwhile. It was the only ride for my teenage daughter and I though, the rest were kids rides. The fete style games were fun but can get a bit pricey, and there aren't really a lot of them. There is an arcade too, which adds to the pier atmosphere, however we probably had four or five issues with games not working after we had put money in them, they are clearly not maintained well or are just very old.A nice stroll to the end of the Pier gives a great location to stop and have something to eat, especially at sunset, and enjoy the panoramic vistas. There are a couple of restaurants but expect to pay Tourist prices.There are lots of little artist stalls up and down the pier too, as well as the usual Tourist traps (magnets, keyrings etc). Save your money and take loads of pictures instead.
My favourite location in the states. The pier is fun for people of all ages and is located on an amazing beach

I was staying at a nearby hotel and went to the pier just to be able to say that I've been there. I went about 7pm. There was nothing there really - a few lights and some restaurants. Nothing special. I liked the Route 66 sign.

column2: Buskers were awful but atmosphere was fun
column3: Iconic end of the road for Route 66 was a fun carnival atmosphere with people from across the world enjoying a slice of Americana. You can stroll around for free, shop for overpriced souvenirs, take in a bite at a number of unhealthy sips and suds places, and enjoy the sights and sounds of the beach. Was surprised by the horrible talent performing at various spots along the pier - would have thought that they could have found some talent in that area - but maybe it was the B team during January holiday breaks.

The Pier was Ok, not breathtaking, enjoyed the scenery but not much to do. Walking around enjoying the views of the ocean and homes that sat along the coast was a treat,not many restaurants and people walking around trying to hustle you on buying or giving.
Best views in town and always something fun happening in this place, a place for all ages and a lot to doNot very cheap for food and attractions but great place to watch the sunset!
I only found 1 gluten free option and that was fries at the burger place on the pier. They were great, i added bacon on top.

column2: Fun place to see and hang out
column3: Great place to hang out with family and friends. We didn't go on the beach, but we did see an amazing sunset! Lots to do and family friendly! Likely more to do when it's warmer. Several restaurants but limited in allergen and vegan friendly (for me).

column2: Peace and fun at the shore
column3: Beautiful pier, a lot of manufactured things one can get at stores, and people from all over the world can be found there.The park is very simple as it comes to the rides, but still a nice place to go just for the fun

We are from the east coast trying to avoid the cold and snow for a week. We aimlessly followed traffic on our way back from Palm Springs and surprisingly ended up at Santa Monica Pier. The bridge provided a separation from the hustling downtown onto a pier. Parking was amazingly easy. There were all kinds of roadside food stands, artists, vendors, and musicians on the pier; if you look far enough, your illusion may take you to Asia on the other side of the Pacific Ocean at the end of the pier. There was this wonderful musician playing guitar with all kinds of 70 R&R at the end of the pier, with a cool drink, looking at the Pacific Ocean, getting some sun in the middle of January, can‚Äôt get better than this‚Ä¶

Today was the first nice day in a while, and it was enjoyable just to walk out to the end of the pier, with a great view back toward Santa Monica's beachfront, and views up the coast toward Malibu and beyond. There were various people who were just set up and playing music for tips, who were pretty good. We didn't buy anything, so I can't speak to the food or amusement park.

column2: Tourist Trap but kinda worth it
column3: Its probably everything you think it is. Overpriced & crowded. BUT its the Santa Monica pier. id take any visitor here to check it out. it can be quite beautiful during sunset at the end of the pier!

Romance doesn't go well with me when mTraveling as it's always Business and too busy with clients but I had proposed this beautiful place for my friend's honeymoon, to include in his itinerary! It's truly a lovers beach and I enjoyed my stay! Love is all we need and hard to find it pure!

This place is just a must see for everyone visiting Los Angeles. It has a cozy vibe and the best view of the beach both ways. It's a popular place for both locals and tourists so expect a decent amount of people.Please do not hesitate to ask me about this place if u have any questions

column2: Another must see when in LA
column3: You cannot visit LA and not visit the pierThe end of the trail...Route 66They have reasonably pruced souvenirs, coffee, restaurants and street hawkers and entertainers for the adults and plenty of the rides and arcade games for the kids or kids in you. Even had the fortune telling machine like the on in Big. Bubba Gump shrimp !Fish off the pier and there is even a cleaning area with a sink. Not sure about permits but many people there with their rods.Parking is ample. Depending on how you enter you can park for less near the beach or on the pier itself for more.Walk to the other side to the boardwalkGreat place to ride as well. Some pedestrians still decide to walk on the bike path so you may hear the odd cyclist voice his anger to get out if the way. There is plenty of room to wall without blocking them.Beaches looked cleaned and maintained.Washrooms are plenty but could be better maintained. Take you hygiene spray, seat cover etc.you can sit near the food courts or at the edge of the pier and look out towards the horizon.In the evenings and in winter it may be cool so a windbreaker would be good.Summer or winter a must see.
Lovely illuminations on the Ferris wheel. Good atmosphere. The Mexican restaurant (Mariasol?) at the end of the pier is worth a visit too.

The iconic pier a bit too chilly and windy during our visit. The attractions were not operating when we went ~10:30am. Maybe they open later in the day. Because of that, we didn't stay long and left to walk to Venice.
The rides are nothing you would not see in a mall parking lot on a weekend. If you are looking to occupy any kids you may have go for it but it is not exactly the Brighton Pier.
You can't miss this place especially with your family: fodd, attractions and fantastic view!There is also a parking close.
It's a nice place. We hit a very rainy day, so less fun. Still it's definitely worth a visit. Make sure to stop at the game joint :)

column2: Old fashioned tacky fun and best view from big wheel
column3: Look it's a funfair not a theme park so if you set your expectations for cheesy rides, noisy sideshow games and candy, you should love it. It's definitely worth a look and as the headline says the view from the Ferris wheel is amazing.

The pier has a wide variety of things to do, the place has a really chilling music where ever you go, good restaurants, and a perfect view to the sea, i loved the arcade it was cheap and fun, the pier is a really nice place to go through.

column2: Fun place to explore for a few hours...
column3: Didn't ride any rides. Just explored the shops, the restaurants, and enjoyed the atmosphere. Great people working the pier. And great people on the pier! A great place to enjoy people watching, whether it's the guys fishing, the street entertainers, or just the crowds!We visit here every time we are in the area, which is now becoming an annual event!

column2: Probably one of my favourite places ever.
column3: This is our second visit to America and with that second visit to Santa Monica Pier, my wife and I absolutely love it here, we had a lot of fun on the rides, played some skeeball. It's just an absolutely great time.

column2: A must see for the view
column3: I enjoyed seeing this. The views were great of the pier, and the beach. Food was expensive and the homeless population was pretty big I thought but I would def go again.
It was beautiful! windy but warn! its $8 to ride the west coaster, you actually go twice around which makes the $8 worth it.

When I visited Santa Monica beach it was a really nice sunny day. The beach was clean and busy. I didn't see any litter as I have read in other reviews. I was approached by one homeless person. The only negative thing is the food places they have there. We ate at Bubba Gump as that seemed like the best choice they had. We had to wait around 50 mins for a table. Alot of the other food places didn't have seating. It was food like burgers, fish and chips. They could do with more restaurants. The car parks gets really busy there too, so it's best to get there early. The amusement park was good and reasonably priced. There are lots of small shops to buy souvenirs.
Make sure you go just to take a walk and enjoy the scenery. It's very expensive and not worth it if /when you can drink it or eat it beforehand.
,, nice walk , wonderful ice cream and we had lunch there in a sea food restaurant it was amazing a nice place , nice beach however it was cold in December ,

Santa Monica is the quintessential beach view one sees in movies and television programmes. Unfortunately it was wet and cold when we were there, but we enjoyed the walk to the end of the pier, the Route 66 information (it is the end), the views and watching the birds. Hopefully we can visit another time in better weather.

column2: Nothing was open at 9pm on a Thursday
column3: Even though the website says it's open and the lights make it seem like the rides and restaurants are open, but by 9pm, not one restaurant or ride was open. Views are beautiful but much worse than Navy Pier in Chicago or other similar attractions.

column2: Merry go round carousel was fun
column3: You might enjoy the carousel with your little ones. Our two year old always has a blast riding the animals; horse, pig or even a goat.
Much like the warf in San Francisco, Santa Monica pier is dominated by souvenir stores and sweet shops but the views are gorgeous. The parking is cheap and close. It's a fun stop.

Even though I don't do rides I love watching my friends be kids again and enjoy the rides. I loved walking the Pier and seeing families etc. Having so much fun and seeing Joy on others faces. The view is epic. Prices are reasonable. Listening to music and waves crashing and watching the sunset was enlightening and refreshing and made me feel relaxed. I definitely enjoyed my time here.

Although most things were closed, or shut down, I was still excited to be at the pier and see all that I did. I would definitely recommend coming here to others. I would love to come back in the summer.

column2: It's what you see on TV!
column3: All shows about LA have a Quintessential beach boardwalk trip. Most of the time, you're seeing Santa Monica Pier. Get on the ferris wheel. It's a gorgeous view. And you're right near 3rd Street Promenade so you've got loads of eating drinking and shopping just nearby. I recommend parking somewhere near 3rd Street, not at the beach. It's cheaper.
Such a beautiful place by night. Maybe next time when we have more time a proper day trip. Even though raining and night time you can see why so many people are drawn to here
Bucket list item checked off. Nothing like the sunset from Santa Monica Pier. Easy subway ride from LA. Actually visited there twice while on business for a week in LA. I highly recommend
One of those things to say you've done while in the LA area. Good place to watch people as well as the sunset. As expected, a madhouse on nice weekends.
Definitely put this on your agenda when visiting Los Angeles. We loved the atmosphere and took some great pictures. Great for families or anyone really

Wonderful place to take a walk and to chill by the sea. A lot of gift shops and singers to stop and listen.Also good food at the restaurants on the pier.One of the most beautiful Piers I have been to.

column2: Huge crowds turn up in the afternoon
column3: This is where Route 66 finishes and the beach begins. We visited the pier after lunch and there were not many people around. When we walked by later in the day people were turning up in droves for Pacific Park amusements. There were various buskers on the pier which were entertaining. Great views looking back across the beach to LA hills
Had a great time here. Nice view of the water, cute shops for souviners. Great play ground area for small and big kids.

column2: Excellent choice to hang out in the afternoon
column3: If you want to hang out and chill any saturday afternoon this is the option, just walk and feel the sea air and relax, the rest of the local amenities are optional
Fabulous place..Beautiful at sunset. Lots of eateries.amusement park lights up the night.Crowded with friendly people, we even spotted our first celebrity..Joey Fatone from NSYNC

It was nice to walk along the pier, good views along the beach a back to the hills. Along the pier there are buskers and performers, some of them were quite good. There are the usual stalls and amusement arcades with a few places to get food.

While staying in LA for a long weekend we drove to Santa Monica for the afternoon and it was just beautiful! We walked along the beach sidewalk and then down to the famous Pier. It was so relaxing to sit on the steps and look at the water. There is plenty to see and lots of eating spots too.
Ate lunch on the pier, shopped, watched the pelicans play, listened to music, fun day to walk on the pier and relax with family

Don't go on your own. try the carrousel it was in the sting movie. we had cod n chips and a bear, looked around the old time amusements. All in all we loved this place, reminded us of the 60s in the UK.
We had a lot of fun at this old fashioned pier - great rides and ambiance that takes you back in time!

As a tourist, you should experience this pier, and at least take a group photo under the neon pier sign. Take a ride on the majestic merry go round, take a shot at the bumper cars, & don't forget the solar Ferris wheel
Sooo much to do here - food, games and major people watching. Beautiful at ALL times of the day. Plan on spending the whole day if you can- walk from the pier south to Venice or north.

The pier is iconic, with the Route 66 connection on display and a great place to stop and enjoy the view while listening to busking violinists at sunset before a seafood dinner. Got some of the usual souvenirs and hats for the kids. Will take my kids back for the amusement rides next visit.

column2: Good family place to go on a sunny day - Park on the pier itself for $2 an hour
column3: First time here. I made a mistake and parked 5 blocks away because the park "scalpers" near the pier on the beach front street wanted up to $20 to park. I did not realize that you can "drive" your car onto the pier itself and pay only $2 an hour, so do it and save yourself a lot of walking. There is a small amusement park with a ferris wheel and roler coast and some other smaller rides for kids. I enjoyed the street musicians who played a diffeent variety of music - spaced every hundred feet or so apart. You can watch the surfers along the south side and see the north LA mountains and beach on the north side
