Didnt have much time here as part of a tour and it was quite warm and very busy.It was good to say that we saw the peir and had a walk on the beach but it could have been Brighton or Bournemouth in the UK only hotter.Managed to see the end of Route 66 so worth the travel.

We ate at Rusty's and another seafood restaurant on the pier. Both had fresh inexpensive seafood. It was fun to walk over the water, listen to children laughing and listen to the occasional performer on the pier.

I hate to give it a bad review, I really do, but the fact that someone visiting on their own is not allowed to go on the rides because they are built for two or more is a real kick in the balls. I had my heart set on going on the ferris wheel but I was told I could not because I was there by myself. So my plans for getting some nice pics from the top were ruined. The rollercoaster looked awful though. It goes around for ONE lap and that's it. 20 seconds long!The arcade is quite good, but they could do with a bit more retro stuff. The staff were mostly brick-faced and emotionless too. I realize that this is not Disneyland but there's no need to be so sullen and cold.

column2: Great day for fun in the sun
column3: I've been now multiple times to the pier and it never loses its attraction. My family enjoyed the the ferries wheel ride and the atmosphere here at the pier is marvelous. I can wait for more sunny weather to do this more often.

The pier has a number of fun activities but i must admit i did not longer much cause i was more interested in taking in the coast during my run. all the same, i think it would be a nice place to spend more time in just for a bit of childish fun.

column2: Ok, but not worth going out of your way for
column3: Visited while on a Hollywood tour that we took out of Santa Monica while staying in Anaheim. Ferris wheel, small roller coaster, and other attractions including restaurants, carnival games too. Nice beach to overlook from the pier and ocean views. Or skip the pier and view from the beach. Over an hour drive from Anaheim to see.
The best of the best, just an amazing place we had a lot of fun also we booked bikes and played volleyball beach

column2: Go at sunset for great views
column3: Definitely touristy but it was popular with the locals to when we went on Friday night. There are a few places for hot dogs/fair/carnival food but it's a great place to catch the sunset and watch people fish. We also opted to take a ride in the Ferris wheel. It was a little pricey but offered great views. If you have kids one of the armbands or combo tickets probably offers a better deal but we just wanted to ride the Ferris wheel. There are also touristy shops if you're looking for souvenir trinkets to take home.
It gets busy during the weekend, but it's certainly a nice day out (especially when the sun is out).

Decided to drive up the coast and visit the famous Santa Monica pier! Only had about an hour of sun left when we arrived, but the beach was clean and relaxing, then the pier itself of lively and entertaining. Great place for families, or even just friends looking for some outdoor fun!
Mediocre restaurants on the pier overcharging for captive tourists. Sunset was beautiful. Most street performers were depressing pictures of life, except for the viola performer.
I went at night and you get to see a lot of people having fun, playing music, dancing, playing at the ferris wheel, you can buy souvenirs and just in general have a good time.

We managed to get here fairly early morning and it was very tranquil and pretty. Got very busy later morning and also a proliferation of people begging detracted from the feel of the place.Fabulous beach to wander along though.

column2: End of Route 66 - horrendous to park on the Pier
column3: Having driven from the Grand Canyon along Route 66 through Williams, we just had to go to the 'Route 66 last Stop shop' at the end of Santa Monica Pier.Google maps showed that I could park on the Pier or just at the side. Well that's fine on on-line but very different in reality even though it was a Tuesday. We managed to drive on to the Pier but then the car park was full so had to drive around looking for a space elsewhere.Glad we made the effort though and this was also our first sight of the Pacific Ocean.
Nice place to have a stroll down and have a look at buskers performing arts singing dancers plenty of activities going on down hereWith the beach for a swim
Brilliant sunsets here albeit plenty of people and tourists here. Great for a stroll or jogging around the beach.
Nice stay Santa Monica u must visit the pier ... end of Route 66 ! Reminded me of smaller version of fishermans wharf ... it was just as busy and nice eateries ...
I thought it had something special because the Route 66 start or finish. Well, I was there but there is nothing special in the pier.

We had a 26 degree Celsius day, so perfect winter weather. Awesome views across the ocean in every direction. Riding the Ferris wheel gives the best views. Did the Celebrity Homes tour from the pier. Able to get down on to the beach, sand through the toes. Felt I could live in Santa Monica, which is quite a big statement from someone who lives in Melbourne, Australia (voted the world's most liveable city numerous times)!

Why bother?Dirty and nothing cool about this placeThe whole place is a stinky, over busy Mecca of people trying to find a 'cool' vibe.Steer clear or visit for less than two hours, go and poke yourself in the eye - more interesting and memorable

My wife and I had a great time at the Santa Monica Pier. We chose not to use the parking at the pier and use public parking about two blocks away so we could be close to explore the town some too. We really enjoyed the classic rides available despite their high price. Smaller, kids' rides cost $5 per ride and all larger rides such as the ferris wheel and the scrambler cost $8 per ride. We enjoyed the numerous local , music artists that were along the pier. We are supper at Bubba Gump Shrimp located right on the pier and greatly enjoyed our time there. This is a must see for anyone visiting the area.
Walked around the pier for a few minutes and loved the sunset that day. The ocean breeze is amazing as well as the views all around.
Nice part of spread out LA - walk along the beach and walk out to the end of the pier- lots of people watching to do

My wife and I visited in December 2015. This was our first time visiting the Santa Monica Pier. You never know who you might run into. We ran into actor John Schneider just walking around. He's a great guy. There are many shops and some amusement park rides as well. Definitely check this place out.
Saw seals swimming, awesome talent performing, great fun rides and amazing people watching! Muscle beach right next door? I love this place!

column2: Good thing to see but can be very crowded
column3: I think everyone should visit once but it can be crowded. There are rides and an arcade that have been there for years. I would trust the merry go round and the bumper cars but I find the bigger rides a bit rickety (though they have been there for years without incident). You can walk down to the water from the pier. There are a lot of homeless in the park above the pier. Can be windy so bring a jacket for kids.
Santa Monica is oft forgotten highlight for a visit to LA, and the Santa Monica pier an essential factor to include. At the very least you must see the pier, even if you choose not to explore.
For us this was amazing, after seeing it in so many movies then be able to actually hang out on the pier was amazing

It was nice spending an evening at the pier with the family followed by dinner. It was quite chilly, but fortunately, we were appropriately clothed.One of those activities that must be ticked off the bucket list, but I must say we all enjoyed it.

it was very busy - even on a chilly day. probably a fantastic place to take smaller children - to ride the carnival-type rides. the street vendors set up along the pier were very similar to each other. you'd see one selling something and walk a few yards & see another selling the same thing. there were some little souvenir places & t-shirt stalls in case you wanted to buy something like that. there were a handful of street musicians - which all were fantastic. and of course you could walk to the end to see the 'end of the line' - route 66, which was sort of neat. there were a couple of restaurants as well. worth it to see if you're in the vicinity.
A small park next to the beach which contains a lot of activities which suitable to all family members specially the kids
Good place to eat , rides and just have fun. If beach is what you need this is it. Fun place for day get away.
Awesome park for any kind of person. Incredible security. Great variety of attractions. And an amazing view

column2: Not a bad way to spend a day
column3: Came here with friends just touring around on our vacation from Minnesota. There's a couple nice restaurants on the pier and usually some street acts performing atleast when we were there. Decent activity to do for a good half day.

column2: Went there to book tour tickets.
column3: You can buy tickets there for stars home tours. Had time to kill before tour & checked out the pier for 2nd time, 10 years apart. Mainly for kids on pier but beaches near pier beautiful and massive.

column2: Nice activity for a warm day but pricey
column3: The pier and the surrounding beaches are definitely worth a trip. The view from the Ferris wheel is stunningly beautiful. The rest of the rides are ok, but expensive

Lots of people, lots of tourist trap shops, get up early in the morning to stroll around in comfort then be done with it. History of the pier is interesting; this can be read in just about any tourist brochure.

When we were there, it was packed with people, but lots of rides, vendors & pier performers! The beach area was very, very large, but it was a chilly day, so not many people on it! A fun family place.

We loved our experience on the pier with its street performers and vendors. On our budget the food and souvenirs were a bit pricey for us so we headed back to the Venice boardwalk for $2 tacos but the pier is a must see and an interesting walk. We were lucky enough to see a seal and actor Adrian Martinez who was super friendly.
Good activity for a stroll. Hawkers and art were pretty average. Nice casual outdoor activity. We didn't go into the theme park, didn't look like it was all that exciting
A great mix of quirky and historic. Great food too, especially the fresh fruit stalls. Iconic too as it appears in so many films/tv shows.

column2: Fun Time on Santa Monica Pier!
column3: We arrived at the Santa Monica Pier just in time to watch a gorgeous west coast sunset. There is a lot of parking available for a $6:00 fee. It is a beautiful area of Southern California with a nice beach, fishing, restaurants, souvenir stores, entertainment and numerous photo opportunities! There is a fun amusement park (Pacific Park) right on the pier. The unlimited ticket price was quite reasonable for the 15 to 20 rides on-site. When Santa Monica Pier is lit up at night the fun experience is unforgettable!

column2: Quick visit to the pier in Santa Monica
column3: Took me back to the fairs and carnivals of yesteryear. 14 year old had fun on the rides, although there are not that many. We ate at Bubba Gump's. OK food and a bit spendy, especially on the drinks. Would have preferred to come here during the daytime.
A must to visit if you visit LA. Very nice place and very nice view. I really enjoyed the walk there.

An icon of so many movies and the terminus of the famous Route 66. Packed on a sunny winters day. Plenty to do on the pier with numerous buskers and lots of cafes, coffee, ice creams and rides. A must do as part of a visit to the beach.

column2: Crowded and touristy, but great during sunset
column3: The sunset is the best time to visit as you get a beautiful sunset and watch the pier lights turn on. It's a neat experience to see this pier transform in just a couple hours. Be prepared for crowds!

Had such a great time at the pier. The views are incredible, a lot of restaurants to choose from, fun artists to watch or listen to and a nice walk on the beach. It's a great day! Parking is easy and affordable.

As expected it is very touristy but a good spot to see the sunset. I rode the Ferris wheel (costs $8). Great view but pretty expensive so a one time only thing for me. After sunset there are many great restaurants to walk to in the area. (Not on the pier itself).

column2: Very touristy but a must when you're visiting
column3: The end to route 66 is a must. The pier is crowded with people and vendors but very laid back. Parking was easy and if you like the beach, it's literally right there beside the parking lot.

We really enjoyed our day here. Plenty to do and see, including paradise pier amusement park, which the kids loved. Food prices are very high and eating options limited. Lovely 30 minute walk from here to Venice Beach.
Charming and lovely place to spent an afternoon. We arrived for lunch - at Bubba Gump`s. And spent entire afternoon, until sunset.Lot of shopping and diffferent attractions for all ages.
This is a fun place to go to enjoy the sites, ocean views, people, and sunset. Definitely worth a visit when in LA.
Nice restaurants on the pier. Did not take part in the amusements but excellent views of the beach north and sotuh.

during the week end a lot of people come here! There is a small luna park, and lot of stores, just for a fast meal or really restaurant. From here you can take a look on Santa Monica Beach and Ocean front or start a promenade to Venice beach!

My family and I went for a walk down to the pier and spent sometime on the beach. I was here 10 years ago and I can honestly say, nothing has changed. That's not the least, to say in anyways that it is a bad thing, that nothing has change. If they had renovated this place I believe that there would be a lot more people here, the prices for food and touristy items will sky rocket!My children are aged 5 & 6 years old and they loved every interesting detail about this place. Next time we come back to America we will definitely hire some bikes and ride along the main road.

Walking the pier is something worth doing, especially for people watching. The rides are more for kids and teens. There is a good restaurant at the end of the pier, with good drinks. Unfortunately, the famous carousel was c!osed. There are stands of stuff for sale, mostly junk.

column2: Fun way to spend an afternoon in Cali
column3: We had a fun time walking along the boardwalk enjoying the beautiful ocean and fun people watching.There are a few spots to grab and snack while you enjoy your day.
Lots of activity and great people watching in this central Santa Monica location. Many food choices. Great Beach and boardwalk experience

Since the age of myself and wife is beyond 50, this attraction was not so appealing. A little aged, pricey, and overall not so interesting for us. Maybe if we had been a young family....... On the positive side, it must offer wonderful sunsets.

An idyllic setting that should be a great trip for the family has been corrupted by the bums, vagrants and potheads that now litter the main entry to the pier. It is dirty, smells of urine, unwashed bodies and marijuana. I wouldn't recommend anyone bring their kids here.

we went to the beach and walked the pier. it gets crowed during the main portion of the day. the restaurants were a little pricy for what you got. Its one of those places that it was nice to see once but I probably wont go back for a while.

The pier in itself isnt so great. Its a strip of junky tourist stuff for sale, and typical pier food (churros). There is an old arcade which is not well maintained and a few rides that I have never been on. However, I love coming here for the great people watching and location. Its obviously right by the beach, and its a public beach so you can walk down and hang out there. The people watching is fantastic-if you are lucky you will see "Dancing Dave" a shirtless middle aged man dance around. I love watching him!! Its close to the promenade and Santa Monica place and definitely worth a visit.
This place is end of Route 66. There is many thing to do. I had to walking around city center and pier. I love to spend more time there.
We had a great day in the sun.This place is fun. Lots of little stalls and great rides for all ages.

How wonderful to visit this amazing pier that provides families of today with an opportunity to experience the same fun originally offered to others many decades ago! As you stroll along the pier, you will enjoy much more than a beach and ocean view - there are souvenir shops, historical displays, restaurants and a fully functioning amusement park and games arcade. My tween particularly enjoyed the roller coaster and Ferris wheel - not to be missed!
Had to be done, an upmarket Weston supermare affair but a nice relaxed promenade with plenty to do and see. #tourist attraction. Plus looks spectacular at night.
Was really looking forward to visiting the pier, however it is a tatty amusement pier with very expensive underwhelming attractions. $8 for one ride on the 1 minute rollercoaster!

Our great little visit to the Pier was fun and full of good ambience. The view to the ocean is fantastic with many interesting performers and fishing local people all mixed among the exciting little theme park. Great place to go with kids and maybe have a funnel cake :)
Even in the winter it's a great place to walk, glance up the coast towards Malibu and take in the gift shops and atmosphere.
This place has a lot going on and is quite busy. We didn't stay long and decided to walk to Venice. I recommend going at slower times.

column2: A must see when in the LA area!
column3: Visited Santa Monica Pier and Santa Monica near the beach. Pier is pretty cool. We were there at sunset, which was really breathtaking. Seeing the pier and iconic Santa Monica Pier sign light up was amazing. Parked at the mall that is attached to the pedestrian promenade. 3rd Street Promenade is worth spending some time walking through. Wish we had more time to explore but maybe on our next trip.

The pier had a real laid back feel about it! Maybe it was the time of year, being quieter at this time of year. What ever the reason, it made for an enjoyable visit. Worth a visit just to have a hunt for a souvenir, listen to the music, grab a bite to eat or just for a wander around!

column2: If in the area a nice place to hangout.
column3: The pier is your typical ocean boardwalk venue with food from grab and go to sit down dining. Vendors and performers are throughout and there are some rides for the kids and the kids at heart.

column2: Used to be a pleasant pier.
column3: Over the past several years the Pier changed from a quiet and romantic place to visit to an amusement park like attraction with crowds so dense on the weekends that if you let go of your kids hand, you may loose him. It's still somewhat nice to visit during the weekdays though.

My friend took me here just so I could say I've been. Wasn't exactly disappointed either. Loved seeing the views of the west coast and the Pacific Ocean for the first time. Had a delicious funnel cake. Though it was crowded I kind of expected that. The arcade though is a little outdated. Really needs an update.
Been there January 1 st. Too many people. Big lines. No free parking space. Just a few attractions for children. No point to go there at all. Walk on the beach is much better.
It was good to visit this place - good view. Go here around the evening time to see the sunset and then have dinner - there are good dinner places around.
What a great way to start off the new year.The views were great of the mountains and Malibu. Great for kids and adults wanting to be a kid.

Kids were thrilled. Us? Not so much. Probably would be more fun in the warmer weather but alas, that would be our luck. Kids had fun though and that's why we went. There are fewer than 10 rides for bigger kids.

This is a definite must do, but be prepared for lots of homeless people everywhere! At no point did I feel unsafe, but they are definitely everywhere. The place looks a little older and you might have to get over the fact it looks kind of rundown but once you get over that it's super cute, great views, lots of different artists and other people making things out on the pier, not to mention all the rides the kids can go on. You can walk a short distance about 15 minutes to the 3rd Street shopping Promenades where there is endless shopping!
Had a great time walking the pier shopping in the shops. Food from the food vendors was excellent. Overall we had a very enjoyable experience and made some great memories!

column2: I love that it's rickety, smells bad and that there's nothing better to do on it, than simply being there.
column3: Yeah there's a Carousel, a tacky, overpriced fun fair, an old school arcade, numerous fast food and chain annexes, but really, just walking out on the wooden planks. People watching and if you get there, checking out the catch from local fishermen & women. It's the only place you might feel you're in a much smaller city for the time you're on the pier.

column2: It is a pier, in California, with Fair Rides and games attached.
column3: It was a nice warm day the day we were there (in the high 70s). Nice walk on the pier and a nice walk in the sand and got our feet wet in the ocean. We parked at the pier.The rides and games looked OK, nothing that grabbed our attention.We live on Route 66, so to see the end of it was a point of interest.Lots of folks selling something, rocks shells, pictures, music, ice cream, funnel cakes and etc.Lot of people watchingIt was a good stop.
Amazing beach, weather was awesome in august. Food on the pier is great. Couple of good Italian restaurantsüòä

The idea of it being this amazing place may have made me a bit disappointed when it didnt live up to expectation. It was good and the views were lovely and i am so glad i went because it is a great place but it seems like a bit of a forgotten place in need of an update.
We enjoyed walking on the pier. There is no entrance fee and there are various activities going on such as painting your name in fun ways on paper and rice. There are rides, music, and food.

column2: You can't come to Santa Monica and not visit the pier
column3: After all it's what makes the town right?Pier goes out into the ocean with a lot of buskers which was good entertainment. Lots of souvenirs and a few really good places to eat. Must go.
Avoid. Full of tacky tourist stuff! The only good thing was the view of the ocean. The beach had more bins than people. The pier is resting on its Glory Days past. Not worth the 30 minute uber ride.

We had fun walking around the pier. The shops and vendors were interesting. Everything is a bit overpriced. The views are gorgeous. The amusement park seems fun and not too expensive. We rode only the ferris wheel which was nice. The views were cool from it as well. It was $8 to ride it. The beach was beautiful too.
The pleasure pier is nice. The rides are mostly for little kids but for adults there are a few things. I had fun reading the signs about the history of Santa Monica and the pier.

column2: It would be fun for a child
column3: I'm not a child and there is nothing of interest there for an adult unless you have some kids to take along or interested in what looked like average food options. Time wasted

column2: Worth a visit when in LA. Expect a crowd
column3: I've been to LA several times and I always make a stop at Santa Monica Pier. Parking close to the pier can be costly. There are 2hr free parking spaces on the road just 10mins walk away. Expect the pier to be crowded at all times of the day, especially sunset. Fun walk along the pier if you don't mind the crowd. Arcade games at the end of the pier are pricey. Several restaurants but nothing fancy. Lots of touristy shops too. Stay for sunset. It's beautiful sight.
A must do if ever in Cali! Loved seeing this iconic place! A little crowed when we were there but overall fun time. Ate dinner at Bubba Gumps & was great!

My last visit to this pier was 10 years ago. I didn't recall seeing the homelessness then. It is prominent now around the walkway to the pier. The smell of urine/feces was intense. It distracted me from thinking about the Three's Company theme song, the one with Jack Tripper. I took the 704 transit bus from Santa Monica and La Brea Ave. It was a 30 min trip. It dropped me off at the beach. There are many Amusement rides, and many places to eat, seated and at food kiosks. Many music buskers can be appreciated, too. There are several places to take some great photos. On the beach, there is a (or was while I was there) a series of crosses marking lost soldiers. To get back to Hollywood I took the Expo Rail line. Its a direct walk, 4 blocks up from the pier. I got off at 7th/Metro and switched to the Red line and got off and Hollywood and Highland.

column2: Excellent place to visit in LA
column3: We loved this location. The Warf is beautiful, historic and has so much to do (even if you just hang out). There are restaurants, rides and bars and it is especially lovely at sundown.The beach activities are also outstanding, with walking and running paths for all to use, and beach gym activities to participate in.

Just like the "Hollywood" sign, the Santa Monica Pier appears in so many Hollywood movies and it is considered an iconic historic landmark attraction that is known around the world. Travelers should read about the history of the pier before visiting it because to get a little sensed of importance and history of the peer. Santa Monica Looff Hippodrome building "which houses the carousel is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The pier offers everything for everyone, good food and good music, amusement park, sunset on the beach and even the sign that shows the end of "Route 66". If you do not like crowded places with lots of noise, you can sit and have good dinner and take a picture or two of yourself and the iconic gate to the pier. It is easy access from downtown Los Angeles by Metro Rail (less than an hour from the start). Then enjoy the great view of sunset on the pier or on the beach.

column2: Fun place to hang out and take pictures
column3: This is a great place for pictures with the beach and mountains as backdrops. Live music, rides, food and easy parking make it a good place to visit with the family.

We went before noon in the week after Christmas. We got a great parking spot ($6) and enjoyed the young families at the Pier. We rode the cute roller coaster and played games from our childhood in the Arcade. This is a family-friendly, affordable, clean place to hang out for a few hours. Our family loved it!
The Santa Monica pier is a must see if in the area. Plenty of things to do, just go for a walk out there and check out the people
Enjoyed the timeless attraction with the family. Kids and I rode the sea drain and roller coaster. Had a burger at pier burger. The kids rated it highly.

column2: Really nice place for a stroll
column3: I love Santa Monica Pier. It's a really nice place to stroll, take in the sea air, eat bad-for-you (but tasty) food and just generally chill out. There's a section of it which has all the rides on but that bit isn't for me (I'm too scared!) so I stick to the main boardwalk which I love.I walk to the Pier from Venice Beach so I can't comment on the parking etc. but there does seem to be loads available although it looks like it's a squash on the pier itself.The walk from the Pier up to Santa Monica, and particularly Third Promenade, is quite a nice walk and not too far at all. There are plenty of restaurants on the way too :)Enjoy!
Not nearly as tacky as I expected. The amusement park was low key. It was busy, but still nice to walk the pier.
Just a superb place for beach activities. The place lives up to its hype and can provide a great day for the outdoor lovers.
Nice view from the pier on the coasr. Gives direct access to the attraction park nearby. A few restaurants and fast foods around.
A must see do if in Santa Monica. Crowded and busy. Didn't ride the rides, but enjoyed the amusement park vibe. Lots of food options. Great views of the bay and beaches.

It was raining and cold today, so it wasn't very crowded, which was nice. There is a beautiful large beach area. The pier had games, food and rides. It's very well kept and clean. Nice experience. We just don't love the carnival type activities. But there really is something for everyone here. I would love to come again when the weather is nice.

column2: Get on the ferris wheel at sunset
column3: We went on the ferris wheel at sunset and it was so beautiful best view in Santa monica there are plenty of food places on the pier including Bubba Gumps

column2: Great but an expensive tourist trap.
column3: It's a fantastic place to visit. At the end of the pier you can spot dolphins and sea lions popping up out of the water.There is plenty of entertainment from the very artistic and talented to the crazy.I recommend a visit to here. But it's expensive and I would avoid buying anything on the pier.The aquarium is great and at only $5 for an adult and free for children under 12 it's well worth it. It's not very big and it's more about education but as the money goes to the research and upkeep it's worth every penny.

column2: A few hours of fun during a driving tour
column3: With your kids, 8 and 6, they enjoyed driving the Pacific Coast Highway to Santa Monica and going to the "carnival." Rode the rides with unlimited access because it was more cost efficient with prices at $5 and $8 per ride. Bracelets were $18 for 7 and under and $29 for others. Kids loved it and were happy with something special to do.
There is an array of things to do at the Pier for kids, families, and adults. It's a must for all ages, food, games, and people to see.

We visited the pier on our first trip to California this November. It seemed like a great place for us to finally see the Pacific ocean, and that there would be fun stuff there to do. The ocean and the scenery are beautiful! The mountains and the beach are very picturesque, as is the pier. However, we did not participate in any of the attractions as the rides were ridiculously over-priced and the food options, not great. I think this place is highly overrated in that aspect, but if you're just visiting to dip your toes in the Pacific, hang out on the beach, or for the view, then this is an awesome place!

column2: A must visit in your LA trip
column3: We spent about an hour here and had lunch on the pier. We had read so much about it and were glad to visit it. It's an iconic part of America. Take the time, walk to the end of it and soak in the views and people watch.

Santa Monica pier is tacky, glitzy, perfect! We rented bikes and ride from Marina Del Rey to the pier. It was a great way to explore. Rode the Ferris wheel, enjoyed the street performers, stopped for a beer It was simply a perfect, just what I expected Southern California afternoon.

column2: Great place to spend your evening
column3: Has lot of things to venture into or just spend time sitting. Lots to around as well or stroll on beach or take a dip or sip on. Great place for kids and teens. Rides and games on the pier. Parking can be a hassle and challenging at times. Next time around will try visiting during daylight.
Nice and relaxing as we visited in the off season however it was still reasonably busy. Easy walk along the pier and nice ocean views. Rides etc for the younger kids to enjoy.

Nice walk in the evening, The arcade looked fun for kids. Places to eat and shop for souvenirs. A long walk up and down the ramp to the pier for anyone with mobility problems (like a bad knee). Saw a few people struggling to push people in Wheelchairs up that steep hill.

column2: Busy and touristy but worth a visit
column3: Great to visit - quite touristy but nice atmosphere and views. A nice place to stroll along and nearby paths and parkland great for people watching.
Lots to see and do here. You love Pok√©mon? That's there too! Ferrous wheels, artists, ice cream parlour, great view!
A short fun walk along the pier,Fun park is good for young kids, roller coaster is not scary!!Great people viewing.Usual chain food outlets.

The Pier was a good place to people watch and listen to the musicians playing covers. It was reminiscent of a typical East Coast summer resort boardwalk. I wouldn't wheat here or buy anything here but it was worth the $6.00 parking fee.
Beautiful ocean views but terrible scenery in the park leading to the pier. Lots of homeless people and garbage lying around. Disappointed that this area is not held to a higher standard.
Rides, foods, gifts, restaurants, sand, ocean, artists, street performers. Etc. Very safe, nice people, clean and ear great shops!

It's a nice place to see if you're in the neighborhood anyway. The tide was low when we were there so we were able to walk underneath the pier, which was awesome.Caroussels and such are pretty pricey, if you have a child that is only able to ride 3 things (5$ per ride for kids or 18$ for unlimited).
Lots to do and see...parking is only 6 bucks...beautiful ocean views..pier has food and rides and nice arcade

Well, this is one of the places that you don't want to miss if you're around LA. The pier is lovely, and views are amazing. Very touristic spot, so be prepared for a lot of people. It was very windy and cold when I went there, but it worth.

An amusement park at the end of a pier and if you're lucky you can see some seals swimming around whilst people are trying to fish. Parking can be a real problem but luckily we caught an uber there so didn't have to worry about that.
Gray view! We came here on the hop on hop off bus and spent the morning walking around the pier before heading to Venice Beach.

column2: Nice for a walk in the evening and the sunset
column3: Arrived early evening just in time for the sunset, had a coffee on the pier and listened to the really good buskersA nice place to walk and chill

column2: We have visited a couple of times. It's just 'okay'
column3: We have visited a couple of times, once just adults and another time with kids.It's just ok. Nothing to write home about. The view is lovely though. On a sunny day it's worth going there to check out the beach from the pier.Hard to get a park.
This is a lovely area. There's dining, carnival type tides, amazing ocean views. If you're in the area, don't miss it.

We read a bunch of other reviews before traveling to LA and were a little skeptical about the Pier. We ended up spending half a day there. It was cool and overcast that day and not too many people. Only two rides where open, including the Great Wheel, which we went on. We loved it! It is not new and not high-tech, but it's got the carnival fun atmosphere and makes you feel like a kid again. We loved the view of the ocean from the wheel. Our son played at the arcades, we took some silly pictures in the photo booth and got some snacks. We loved watching the seagulls dive down for food... all in all, it was unexpectedly one of the best experiences we had during our trip to LA.

Santa Monica pier ended up being my daughters favorite stop while visiting LA. We only had 3 days and lots of places to go, ended up skipping couple of other places because she wanted to go back to the pier our last night there. Lots to do for all ages, definitely lots of people watching, beach, rides, food...options for everyone

column2: Must do but parking is terrible.
column3: Nice selection of restuarants and the amusement park is good for young kids and adults who don't like the gut wrenching ones in the theme parks. You can hire bikes and ride down to venice beach and the marina. Nice views , good to take photos. Would definitely recommend at least once.

column2: not a loot to see, very crowded.
column3: Went there in the evening. It was very very crowded, some street performances and few food-stands.The only think we liked are the artists who write the names in painting.

My family and come to this pier when we have friends visiting. The area is great to grab lunch on the 3rd street promenade and then walk over to the pier to let the kids go on some rides. People not from the area really enjoy it. It can get really crowded so beware. Also if you go online you can purchase wristband in advance at a discounted price sometimes.It you get tired of the crowded pier you can walk to the mall to shop or have a drink. The beach is also just down the steps so you can truly make a whole day of it there.

We walked up and back on the pier. There were some interesting restaurants and shops. We did not go on any of the rides, but the pier itself was well kept up and nice. Definitely worth a visit while in Santa Monica. I don't know that I feel a need to go back.
We didn't have long to do a great deal of sight seeing glad we choose Santa Monica pier. We got to see the sun set. The pier was busy and there is a lot to do and see
Seemed more like a poor quality tourist trap with very little true interest filled with cheap gimmicks and average quality food

Great place to enjoy the sunshine of southern California. Great food (garlic fries are the best thing ever). The shopping is not great, but if you walk just a few blocks East there are great opportunities for shopping. If you like sungazing, swimming, surfing, or people watching, this is a great place for you.
From locals, carnival atmosphere, ocean views, food, music and even seals by the pier, an amazing place to visit and spend a few hours. A must visit and a great day.
Gorgeous place to visit. Lots of fun. Brings back sweet summer memories even in December. Grown ups and young will adore this place.

My wife and I looked forward to this stop. It didn't disappoint it was a great place to visit and see in person. If in the area a must stop, if you have the day try a walk to Venice beach, well worth the walk.

Our family really enjoyed a relaxing day at the pier. The kids played at the arcade. We all enjoyed the weather. We decide to ride bikes as a family. We rented from Blazing Saddles. We all had a great time!!
Went during the day . Was nice to see but i was expecting more. Prices were a bit high. But the view from the ferris wheel was awesome
Arcade, nice walking location, with street performers, food shops and a nice view. I recommend this place.
Great to visit specially in autumn. Nice walk, shopping and games. Had a hotdog Japanese style that was great. Watch the sun set
Had a great walk on the pier and lunch at Bubba Gump Shrimp! The food and cocktails delicious and out server Raymond was amazing !

This has to be one of my favorite days of my trip. Visiting the Santa Monica Pier was such a great time with my husband the roller coaster is a blast and the ferris wheel is gorgeous views I must do when visiting the pier. We tried a bunch of little snacky foods and then finished it all off with a homemade milkshake. Walk down to the beach Wade In The Water and the sand. Great day all around

Having heard the hype about the pier, I had expected it to be grander. Not to say that it's not fun to walk around but, it just was as good as I thought it would be.I think children would have quite a good time there but for adults....not so much.
Must see, atraction, if you go to LA you need to visit the Santa Monica Pier, where you'll see the mark of the end of rout66, sunset is wonderful

column2: If you are in LA you must visit the pier
column3: The location is superb and the view is wonderful. Lots of great restaurants in the area. A must see.

Couldn't come to santa monica and not check out the pier. It was a lot of fun. You can buy an arm band for rides or pay per ride. We opted for per ride as we only wanted to ride 2. And wasn't going to ride multiple times. The coaster and ferris wheel are $8 per ride. It was right before they closed and the coaster was dead so they let us ride it twice which was nice. Enjoyable and nice evening.
While staying in Santa Monica, this was our nightly go to place to hang out with the family. Lots of activities to entertain kids. Lots of people watching for the adults. Fun, fun, fun.

It's a fun day out, with free WiFi for the teens. Cheap rides in comparison to other places. Just sit on the beach or around the peer. Safe friendly environment. Fairly busy though. The ferris wheel has a nice view.
On a tour of Los Angeles we had the opportunity to go to the Santa Monica Pier. The area is breathtaking on the day we were there.

column2: Always a nice place to hang out
column3: Stayed at the Marriott about 5 minutes away, and waling to the Pier was a nightly routine. It wasn't tourist season so it was really nice and quiet.

It's typical local attraction, its very nice in summer as beach and center of attraction of the area.There is nice coffee and restaurants.There is local Luna park facing the sea.Easy parking,no entrance fees.
Be part of history - the Santa Monica pier sign has been in so many TV shows and movies. Lots to see. End of Route 66. Lots of places to eat and buy souvenirs. Great picture taking opportunities

This is a very nice spot to see. Not a lot to do though and won't keep you busy for very long unless you plan sunbathing on the beach. The pier was clean and parking was nice and close. Looks best at night with all the lights on.

We decided to hire out a couple of bikes and use peddle power to get from Muscle beach through Venice beach and to Santa Monica Pier. It seemed the most popular way to do so. Santa Monica pier at sunset is amazing to see. The great party feel about the place is really amazing. Some great eateries along the pier and plenty of nic-nac shops there too. It can get user busy but I think it all adds to the vibe. Street entertainment here is brilliant too. A must see on your trip here.

Merry go round, ferris wheel, venders, restaurants and access to beach.Fisherman on pier along with carnival atmosphere and venders. The restaurants are many but the quality of food so so.Views from end of pier nice.
Obviously a tourist must do if in Santa Monica but it's truly dirty and kind of seedy. Didn't feel comfortable at all.
We really enjoyed the pier--nice ambience and views of the beach. Fun atmosphere and we felt like kids again playing the carnival games and eating ice cream.
We were very lucky with the weather here. Picture perfect day, lots of good people watching, stalls, street performances and nice views.
We trekked back here in a Lyft and we're pretty happy we did.Cold at this time of year but plenty of people around and stuff to look at. The lights are pretty. Shopping just up at the promenade.
I can't even begin to describe the vibe of this place. Finish point of the most famous Route 66, fishing, people and of course the movies iconic fairs wheel. You'll never find a dull moment here.

Great family adventure by the ocean! They have restaurants and also activities for kids and adults. Lots of people but great to experience this place! If you come to visit California you have to stop by and experience Santa Monica pier!!

This was an amazing part of our trip and definitely something to see as a tourist! We walked all the beaches and this was by far the highlight to see the pier! Everyone travelling to Los Angeles needs to come here!

We enjoyed a lovely evening on this iconic pier partaking of the numerous activities and eateries available there. There were many others there as well including sporting teams and servicemen & women and is was very pleasant to interact with such a diverse and interesting range of people on NYE!
Lovely pier I really had so much fun, you can buy tickets for 8$ for a single ride also you will enjoy the amazing ocean view and the ocean highway road
Still spectacular on a cold and windy day. Lots to see. Plenty of photo ops. Food options limited but decent options in the nearby streets.
Since i have visited many high class beaches around the world.but this beach is pretty average but people and atmosphere is geeat.

Tired or not, wind rain or sunshine this is one iconic MUST DO.I recommend a night stroll as the lights are fantastic and there is a great wee bar at the end of the pier to enjoy a well deserved drink. A great people watching spot. 10/10
Even though it's a nice place there's not a lot to see, wear pants and be prepared to get sand in your shoes if you wanna walk by the beach.

column2: It's beautiful but don't go on the rides.
column3: If you go to LA make sure to come here at night. They have all the rides lit up at night and sometimes they have fireworks. But the rides cost like 20$ per ride for one person and they're not good rides so I wouldn't suggest going on the rides. I would say come here but don't go on the rides.

column2: It's ok just to say you've walked the famous pier
column3: The pier was not that long. It was ok. Not as many shops as expected but it did have a small theme park area. Giant ferris wheel that lights up at night. Right next to muscle beach. A long strip to bike or walk for beach like shopping or just to enjoy the beach.

What a great place to watch the sunset over the water. There is also nice coffee shops and ice cream and food for dinner. There is entertainment including buskers and sideshow entertainment. Plenty to do and see. Nice places for dinner too.

My kids loved going to the pier. We've been to LA 3 times in last year and they always want to go to the pier. They love the amusement park & rides. Great restaurant "the Lobster " right there for fine dining üëç

What a surprise after our family of ten aussies spent the last three weeks touring around California,Nevada and Arizona to have our last day in LA visiting the Santa Monica Pier. We had no idea that this is the the end of the famous Route 66 which we had been travelling on for weeks,but what a way to finish our trip.Drive right down onto the pier,parking for a small fee,then wander along the picturesque board walk out to the end and check out the golden beaches and clear blue ocean.Lots of tourist shops and eateries to check out,we had lunch at Bubba Gump's seafood restaurant then headed off to LAX for our long flight home.Perfect finish to a lovely holiday.

column2: Classic seaside fun in an all-American style
column3: It's pier, packed with amusements, shops, food and fun. Done well and without rip-off prices. A classic experience.

We only visited the pier once even though we were staying in Santa Monica. Once is probably enough but we did enjoy our walk and Santa Monica beach is lovely. We shared a delicious hotdog and the atmosphere.

The Santa Monica Pier is a nice place to visit on a good day. The weather was in the mid 60's and the skies were clear.Plenty of things to do and see. The street performers were interesting, they ranged from zany weak talent to amazing talent. Rides, games and vendors. Granted it is a tourist trap so don't expect any deals on food or drink.But don't forget to take in the things happening on the adjacent beach area. There is a lot of things happening close to the beach. It's busy and there's plenty of fun people things to watch.

We went to Santa Monica pier in the Winter months and it was still beautiful. I can only imagine how nice it would be in Summer. There are some rides on the pier along with shops not far away up the road within walking distance.We ate at Bubba Gump there which was OK and it was a great place for some beautiful photos.
Nice views from pier and excellent beach area nearby. Amusements were closed when we were there. Lots of touristy shops around.
Great view, but lots of people!! We had a hard time finding a place to eat. Still, it was worth the visit.

The primary reason for walking on the pier,If you are not a fisherman, is the view. On a clear day you can see all the beach towns and Palos Verdes looking toward the southLooking north the rest of Santa Monica andMalibu. Looking west it's Santa Catalina Island. The pier also has a few restaurants and the usual assortment of rides and arcade games

Don't miss this historic site if you're in the area. We visited in early evening in July. Vibrant, fun, casual, carnival-like atmosphere. Bring a jacket, as it can be breezy and quite cool in the evening. Parking wasn't bad - inexpensive, well-organized and close to the attractions. If you're traveling Route 66, don't miss the "End of Route 66 sign" (which can be a little tricky to find - we used Pok√©mon Go to locate it).

Pier kept in poor condition, has not been renovated in decades, unsavory people go here thereby make you feel unsafe nor presence of Law Enforcement seen. Evening is even worse do not recommend anyone wasting time as a tourist attraction.

My teens compared this to the piers that they have seen at the movies, the disaster ones.Nice evening stroll. You can park by the beach for $6. Waited for the sunset which promised to be beautiful but then the clouds appeared and hid it. We did however take some good photos.Lots of typical seaside stalls and touristy things to do.

I walked along the beach from Venice beach to Santa Monica, it takes around an hour + if dawdling and taking photos.Didn't actually go onto any of the rides but appeared to have a good selection of eateries and 'tourist catchers'... Stalls.Great views.
Pier is fantastic but the food stands are pricey and not worth the spending. Entertainment from different musicians is a bonus.
Romantic and fun. Rides are expensive but worth it!!! I loved it!! Bars around there are nice too!!You can hear the ocean and see the waves from the ferris wheel.
The pier is a souvenir gathering zone with a few rides for kids. It is a historic place so, visit if you are near the neighborhood.
You have to stop by the pier, if at least for a walk. It's noisy and crowded, just like the old boardwalks.
This place makes me feel sad on so many levels. California coastal towns deserve better than to serve as tourist traps and public displays of failed civic responsibility.

The Santa Monica Pier is a must see attraction in California. The ocean view is beautiful, great selection of restaurants (I recommended Red O on Ocean drive for their brunch and bottomless drinks special), and of course the pier. The pier has rides, food selections, artists, musicians, magicians, and so much more. The views of the water is perfect for taking pictures with your significant other.

We had a great time visiting Santa Monica Pier. Lots of things to do, people watching, great food, wonderful beach, and tons and tons of great Pokemon to catch. My kids had a great time catching all manner of rare Pokemon on the pier where there were multiple Pokestops and Gyms. It seemed like 30-40% of the people we saw had a phone in their hand playing Pokemon Go!

My boyfriend and I were lucky and decided to go on a Thursday afternoon. It was quite empty, which was incredibly nice. We took a stroll down the pier enjoying the views and a few performers. Headed down to the beach after the pier.
We did a tour and visited the pier, worth the trip to see this iconic landmark and the sights around it.

Awesome place to visit. One side of town is the pier, which is very casual. Then, there's a bunch of shopping, restaurants, and hotels just a short walk away. This is a must visit if you're staying in the L.A. area.

Booked a return day tour from Anaheim to LA with Viator online and went with a Starline tour to Los Angeles, Hollywood & Beaches. Had a great driver & guide (Ken & John) who made the day even better with their local knowledge and jokes along with their great driving in that horrendous traffic.Loved walking the pier with its history. Highly recommended!!!
Very pretty close to the shops lovely long beach walked along the beach and it's a three minute walk to the Main Street for shopping Starbucks has free wifi
This is a great place for anyone and everyone. A lot of fun things to see and do. Some pretty interesting locals hanging around.

It's very touristy and people are not shy about bringing large groups or families. I had a challenge finding a place to lay out let alone get in the water without being watchful of stray kids/toys or just loud conversations.

column2: Bike ride from Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier
column3: We hired bikes for USD$15 each for 3 hours and rode from Venice Beach to the pier. It was a beautiful day and is truly a once in a lifetime experience that we will treasure forever! The day was topped off by seeing some beautiful seals putting on a show in the ocean at the end of the pier.
It's a fun pier for sure! The amusement park is so much fun for kids. It's a nice, safe area with lots to do.

column2: Beautiful place to spend a summer day
column3: We had a fabulous time on the pier! There are so many fun activities for kids of all ages. The restaurants are clean and inviting with a wide variety of foods to appeal to multiple appetites. We enjoyed fun souvenir shopping as well. We chose not to ride the rides, as we were more focused on the beach, but they looked fun!

The pier has it's own charm like the beach. Night at pier is like some carnival on weekends. I think that's how locals spend their weekends usually. You will get many food and drinks options, rides are there which I found quite expensive. There are souvenirs shops, shops selling random, quirky stuff and some street musicians. Overall you will love the ambiance.

Spent a very nice relaxing day in Santa Monica especially the Pier. There are several shops, a few restaurants and a lot of buskers. Just off the Pier you can walk on a wooden foot path on the beach. If you want a place to chill with a nice atmosphere I would certainly recommend time at the Santa Monica Pier.

The pier is was a nice stroll from start to finish with a few 'gimmick' shops along the way.The restrooms were clean and tidy so you didn't have to be too concerned about using them.There is a theme park of sorts along the pier but the day we went, it didnt have too many people occupying it. If you have come from Disneyland, these rides would be a real let down...really they are a glorified side park (which is ok for those interested).At the end of the pier is a restaurant which was well patroned and you also get a lovely view of the Pacific Ocean.

column2: Always a nice spot for the babies
column3: Great place for games and to people watch. There has been some great artist on the pier. Love how it lights up at night. Its a must go spot if your near by

column2: Must see because it's alway on tv!
column3: It's really great to stroll around the pier! It's so unique and interesting plus it's always on tv! You can go on a ride, shop, buy food and just people watch and then stroll on the endless beach! Its very busy so parking can be tricky getting on and off the pier, plus it weird to drive on the wood because it makes it seem like you car has flat tires!

column2: Lovely long pier with buskers and cafes
column3: The pier provides lots of opportunities to stop for refreshment on a visit to Santa Monica. There is a range of eateries. There are buskers. There's a trapeze school and there's a ferris wheel over the ocean.
Entertaining and great location, expected more food options. Saw a wild seal swimming next to the jetty which was great.

You get a chance check out the Santa Monica Pier they're super nice the whole entire period is jam-packed with cool Nifty things you can buy go ahead check out of the roller coaster and arcade games try not to eat too much before you go but I also got affordable drinks if you're older then 2.. You won't be disappointed!
During the off season the pier is not very crowded and the shopping and entertainment are relaxed and fun.

Take a stroll down and check out live music or vendors selling knick knaks.Read about the history of the place on boards posted around or just enjoy the view from the top deck.Rides are great fun as well. Totally different experience during the day and by night so make sure to visit twice.
What an great place to spend the afternoon/ night. Enjoyed the sights, rides and food. It's a must do if you are travelling and are in the area.
The beach was beautiful with amazing views from the pier. There are some good little shops and places for food. My favorite was the sea lion sunning himself and the dolphins jumping not too far out.

column2: A must visit if you're from out of town. Fun for the entire family!
column3: I grew up in LA and so I remember what the pier looked like before the amusement park. So visiting it the other day with my daughters, was very nice, unique, nostalgic and overall amazing. They loved getting on the ferris wheel, roller coaster and other rides.The old school arcade is still very nostalgic of what arcades used to be, before all the fancy new games and/or home game consoles.You can walk up and down the pier, there is also a merry-go-round. Overall, it's a great attraction, especially if you're from out of town!
What an awesome time. Night or day. Tons of stuff to do. Street performers were awesome. Bubba Gump Shrimp was awesome. Our kids had a blast. Great ocean view!!
It was very busy on our trip this time over labor day weekend, the sun was shining and there was plenty of people enjoying themselves. Good for a stroll and an ice cream by the beach
I love going here spontaneously! Cute area with vibrant people! There is lots to do and see and we're not even talking about the beach yet.

column2: My visit to Santa Monica pier
column3: Great tourist attraction you actually can park on pier. I tried the big wheel which kind of scary if you don't like heights. This pier was used in filing of The Lost Boys and the original Zoltar used in the film Big is there also. There's quite performers on the pier I'll leave for you to decide.

column2: A nice activity for a warm day
column3: We visited Santa Monica as a day trip while visiting LA. It's a lovely beach-side location with lots of shops and attractions.We think it's HEAPS better than Venice.
If you are in Santa Monica, visiting the pier is a must do. At least once. Nice views of the ocean plus, evening views looking back at the hotels is pretty as well.
Great place to spend time with the family, there are some snacks to buy and rides to enjoy.Great environment and mood.Very recommend to stay and see the sunset.

This was the one place while in LA that I wanted to go to. There were several shops and restaurants on the pier, and of course the amusement rides. Mainly, we were just there for the experience of being there. We ate at Bubba Gump's on the pier. Even at night, there was a decent view.
This is one of the well maintained and famous 3,5 miles long beach pier in California,where peiole of ages go with childern and enjoy

We had a great time going on the rides and seeing the aquarium at the Santa Monica Pier! It's not as big or as advanced as the theme parks but the rides and atmosphere were a lot of fun! The views of the ocean, beach and mountains were also breathtaking.

Went to see Santa Monica Pier the other day and the weather was great. Amazing views of the beach area, food of course gets up there, but it's for tourists, so eat cheaply before going. And there is a Bubba Gump Shrimp store the moment you walk on the Pier to your right.

column2: STILL GOOD FOR A STROLL INTO YESTERYEAR
column3: Never tire of a walk down memory lane; how many piers like this are even left? And remember how it was featured in the opening of the the 1973 movie, "The Sting."
If you want to have a nice sea front dinner or enjoy the Rollercoaster at the amusement park you won't be disappointed. Only been here once but I will definitely be coming back.
Located on west coast this popular sunset deserves claps! It's one of most beautiful sunsets in the whole world. Was amazing see and register this perfect moment!
My family and I walked from Venice to Santa Monica Pier. It was a great walk. Met some really nice people. A couple of very interesting ones as well.

View is beautiful, panorama wheel is boring and expensive (16$) Amusement park is interesting for young children <12. Many spots where you can spend money and regret :)))) Nice to see, but my suggestion is not to spend to much time there, LA and Santa Monica have more interesting spots than this

It may be crowded on the weekends in summer, it may take up to two hours from LA downtown (driving time w/o traffic is 30-45 minutes) to get to Santa Monica Pier, however this place has a special and unforgettable atmosphere that is really worth a visit. We rent a bike and we had a ride from the Northern end of the bike path in Santa Monica till Marina del Rey and we felt free, like enthusiastic children on their school holidays. The pier offer ranges from some fast food and restaurants, to The Pacific Park (an amusement park) and, to all Pokemon Go lovers, be aware this place is a real hub.If you are visiting Santa Monica, do not forget to take some pictures to and from the Pier, as this attraction is ideal for a modern postcard, to be shared on the social networks to illustrate America's best spirit. Leave the stress behind, it's time to live and spread good vibes.
We enjoyed walking the pier and visiting the shops and restaurants. A bit too much cigarette smoke, but we headed to the beach to avoid the worst of it.

column2: Beautiful beach, amazing ocean, and fun times on the Santa Monica Pier!
column3: During our recent trip to southern California, we spent part time at the Santa Monica Pier. After lunch at Mariasol, we walked along the pier and the beach while enjoying the sights and sounds of the ocean. Beautiful! FYI, parking may be a challenge. We parked in a parking garage a couple of blocks away and walked to the pier.

We went to the pier on Thanksgiving day!! It was spectacular . There were street performers. We even saw a sea lion inthe water. Best thing ever, we saw the actor Bryshere Gray from the show Empire just casually strolling the pier with a cute little female. Stopped and took a pic with him. He was really nice and even cuter in person.
Came here with family and had a blast. Started our walk and stopped to listen to and watch the various pier performances. After lunch we rode some of the rides.
A lovely vibrant area. Full of tourists and locals. Worth a visit with teenagers and there are plenty for them to do.

This place you see on TV all the time, next too Venice beach this location is very popular..The beach is huge and goes for miles....on the Pier the rides are great for kids, carnival atmosphere. Walking distance to the Santa Monica shops.....lots of people lots of fun.

column2: A flash back in time, best for kids under 11 or so
column3: The pier had a good vibe, but seems to be geared towards families with younger children. The food choices, rides, attractions, etc are more targeted for kids around 10 imho.We went twice (day and night). I certainly felt safer during the day so I would avoid taking children late due to the homeless population.

We went in the morning (no issues parking in the lot to the north of the pier) and enjoyed the long stroll down to the end of the pier. The place wasn't too crowded, shops were open, and there were a couple of street performers entertaining the visitors. We went up to the Promenade for a couple of hours and came back to the pier for lunch. The place was wall to wall people. In amongst the street entertainers were several religious screamers with loud PA systems (one within about 5 feet of the entrance of Bubba Gumps). This took all of the charm out of visiting. There was no way to get away from it - so we left.

My family and I had an amazing time at the Santa Monica Pier, they have a logo of attractions for the kids, you can enjoy shops and fresh sea food restaurants around pier. The Pacific Park has rides for the kids and adults, we would love to go back again..!!
Plenty of appeal for the kids, can be crowded and noisy. Usual pier shops, rides, takeaways, and restaurants etc.

I flew to LA just to visit the wizarding world of Harry Potter and to cross off one item from life long bucket list, riding a Ferris wheel on an ocean pier! It was everything I expected it to be and more!!! The whole place has a nostalgic feel and was a lot of fun. It's easily accessible and very close to Venice beach as well! Highly recommend this place.

Went for a walk in late afternoon - perfect timing. Watched the sunset and spotted a Harbour Seal in the water. So much fun. There are a lot of shops and restaurants as well. Don't miss the sign that marks the end of the Route 66.
As a teenager the pier is exactly what I imagined California to be. Our trip consisted of 2 adults, 1 teen, and 2 children under 7. We all had a blast!

Going to the Pier was a side trip during our stay in Pasadena. The pier was interesting, the views were pretty, but I was disappointed that there was nothing about it that made it special or separated it from any other pier along the coast. Access to the beach was very nice.

Nice Beach and a beach town. Good Pier to view sunset. Plenty of activities, on the Pier.Beach is clean, plenty of restrooms, shower, changing rooms.Can go to deep in the ocean, it's shallow, till a stretch. Not to big waves.

We were wrapping up the last day of our vacation. We drove from Universal City to the pier. Grabbed a parking place in the lot to the right (N) of the pier, and walked around to take in the beautiful sights, assorted smells, and interesting entertainment here at the pier.We didn't limit ourselves to just the pier, and walked back up to the main drag and headed north. Getting hungry we searched TA to see where & what we'd like to eat and found the #1 eatery in the area, so we continue to navigate on foot and timed our arrival right when they opened. The Hillstone was amazing, check the review.After our meal we grabbed a Starbucks and headed back to the parking lot by was of the 3rd street promenade, another great Santa Monica cultural and shopping experience.This is a great place and loved every minute of it. There is a large homeless population here, and never once felt unsafe or pressured in any way...Peace, Mattüòé

Santa Monica Pier reminds me of New Jersey, but with a little less character. The rides are very expensive, the restaurants are all just ok. And very crowded. The view is very pretty of course. Honestly it's a big check mark and the next time I'd skip it (I'd skip it altogether and do something else if I had it to do over).

column2: Nice Tourist attraction for a walk
column3: It is a nice and well maintained place. I would recommend to go there and take some pictures. Like any other tourist attraction, expect many many people there. Don't go if you don't tolerate crowds. Beautiful to see the sunset. I prefer Manhattan Beach, though!

column2: End of Route 66 sign is here
column3: Yep, it is in this pier where this famous sign is. Apart from that, just another pier. Quite nice actually. And of course the rest of the beautiful beaches around.

Your typical tourist trap. A lot of people selling random souvenirs and overpriced food. I would not recommend this even the views from the pier were nothing special that couldn't be seen from the beach. Much preferred the Venice beach or Hermossa beach area. Maybe with children's this would be better as the rides and buskers did not appeal to a couple in their 30's.
Felt the need to go on the coaster since I loved the scenes from the movie iron man when he flies by. So much fun playing the games and reenacting the 1,000 's of movies shot there.
The perfect plan is to rent some bikes and see the sunset across Santa Monica and Venice beaches. The pier is very cool but it gets crowded. It has free bathroom and showers.

column2: Worth a few minutes of your time
column3: Don't miss the end of Route 66 sign for a good photo opportunityThe view of the sea and beach from the end is very nice - you can also watch the guys fishing (and not catching anything!!!)

Visited here with a group of friends and it didnt disappoint. Walking up the pier you get great views of the city behind you and beautiful ocean views. We decided to have lunch at Bubba Gump, food was delicious, had a lovely stroll in the beach then went off for a shopping trip. This is a great spot for families too. In the night it too looks glorious with all the lights switched on on the pier and the other attractions there too.
Close to Venice Beach this pier is family oriented with get food. Enjoyed visiting but it would have been better at night. That is when more people are out and about
We enjoy the pier. It was clean and a family friendly atmosphere. Many of the shops were still closed, as we were there in the morning. Parking was only 1.00 and hour. We will return.

column2: Great Time With My 6 Year Old Granddaugther
column3: Perfect place to take your grandkids. Plenty of rides of rides for the "little" ones and the a few good rides for the bigger ones. We enjoyed the ferris wheel, bumper boats and several other rides she could do herself. The place is clean and well maintained. Parking is easy, right on the Pier. We will be back.

My wife and I took a Lyft here after visiting the Chinese Theater. The Pier is pretty cool, lots of vendors and places to eat, there is a Bubba Gump shrimp that we wanted to go to but we had already eaten lunch. The Pier offers some great photographic views of the norther LA shore to include the Malibu coast, and the southern Venice beach. Afterwards we walked south on the bike path to Venice beach which was about 20 min walk.

The pier itself marks the end of the Historic Route 66 and as such there are a tonne of places selling related items. There are plenty of places to get food and there is lots of parking. Watching the sun set over the Pacific from the pier was amazing and the photographer in me decided the pier was a fantastic backdrop.

It was abit of disappointment that they close so early!! I arrived at approx 8pm and everything was already shut!It was quiet beautiful from what I could see - but can't really comment as it was closed!
Best hotel in Los Angeles.Michele at the front desk made our stay better than what we anticipated.Will never stay elsewhere.Staff amazing, cleanly and beautiful rooms.

Our first visit was on a Monday evening for a walk around. We arrived at 430pm, so just perfect for sunset photos and evening photos of the LA beach line. The timber decking is a bit uneven so beware for kids and elderly. Fairly busy with people when we were there but I can imagine it to be more crowded on weekends/holidays. On the pier, we saw a few classy looking restaurants, buskers, arts and souvenir vendors. The further out onto the pier you go, the cheaper price for the same souvenir. There is plenty of fast food restaurants around the amusement ride area. There was plenty of families eating there, we did not. We spent a little time in the amusement area. Not cheap at $8 or $5 a ride but at $30 unlimited rides, you can make it worthwhile. Rides are good old school rides where you get to move somewhere, get thrown around a bit. Not just sit in a room with 3D glasses and go nowhere like many of the rides at DL or US. Rides are pretty tame, probably due to restrictions as set on a pier. The pier is well worth a look.
really love the views and atmosphere. mostly a tourist spot with a few locals working out. somewhat commercial, but I really loved the guy singing karaoke there.

column2: A place we had to see
column3: Of course we had to go to Santa Monica and Pier and ride the rides and take some photos. But it didn't really push any buttons for us that make us want to go back.
We stayed in a hotel just back from the beach. We walked the beach and board walk down to Venice beach. Easy walk and great scenery. We caught the bus back. Excellent place to stay

Our family took some Italian visitors for a walk on the pier with a lovely meal at Bubba Gumps right on the pier on probably the only rainy day of the year. It was still beautiful and bustling with life and color. We felt very safe. Yes, there are homeless people walking around and asking for money. But, safe and well worth dodging raindrops. The pier is very impressive and photo worthy for our Italian guests.
Nothing special but one of those bucket list places. The views are great so all in all a good place to spend an hour.

column2: Walked from Venice beech to the pier
column3: Parking was expensive at the pier and the main Venice beech, so parked half way and walked, really nice walk. Lovely beech, good walk ways and lots of parks on the way.

The pier is going down hill fast. There were a lot of people as it was Veterans Day. The pier is lacking in maintenance and the board are starting to wear down. My service dog got his foot caught and I fell. There are not many good food choices anymore either. Disappointed.

Came here with friends, spent the day walking along the pier taking photos with the amazing views. Just a short walk from the centre.There is a fair with rides, shops, bar areas for fishing and benches to stop and soak up the atmosphere.We watched a street magician and had photos with the route 66 sign.The beach has to be the biggest i have seen and so clean too.We spent two nights in Santa Monica and loved it here. Drove to Hollywood Universal around an hour away and stopped off for a walk down the walk of fame too.Ate dinner on the pier in Bubba Gumps which was brilliant and i would definitely recommend. You can sit near the window and have a perfect view of the sun set. I would book a table though for sure.Can't wait to return...
Heard about the specialty Japanese Hot dogs on the Pierre. They have many different kinds but the Original Japanese Hot Dogs was the BEST! Definitely eat when you are at Santa Monica Pier.

Highly recommend the pier for a sunny Sunday stroll pre or post brunch.Lots to see and some great views. Funfair for the thrill seekers and many other options for less adventurous. Watch the fishermen at the end of the pier or grab something to eat at Bubba Gumps.
A nice time on the rides. The food is very overpriced and average at best. Also, lines for rides can be long at times.

Beautiful venue with local artists performing. It's a very unique place that I've seen in TV and movies my whole life and it was great to see it in person. It has something for everyone in your family with amusement rides, great dining and bar options, and shopping. The fishing seemed to be good as well.
Had everything you'd expect from a pier , rides food etc. Easy location to get to from all hotels on Santa Monica front. Preferred this pier compared to pier 69 @ San Fran.
Lots of attractions, bars & restaurants. Don't forget about amusement park. Sometimes bit too crowdy but still worth visiting.
The carosel and the ferris wheel at night are the best parts. It was neat to see but nothing extradorinary. Very crowded on the weekends but a great place for pictures.

I really enjoyed spending time on Santa Monica Pier especially at night. It's quite busy but if you're happy just wondering around it has a great atmosphere- not even a child vomiting in front of me in the ice cream line wiped the smile off my face. We went on the little roller coaster which was a bit of fun and there's a nice view up there. (The old wooden boards are uneven to walk on, flats recommended).

one of the best places to visit in cali. It was so much fun, the rides were worth it, and they had great food. There were also many performers and it was nice seeing so many different things in one place. The artists were great, I recommend getting a painting done. they are really talented and don't charge much

We visited this traditional pier with its funfair and wooden boards in the summer as part of our Californian road trip. It is a must stop for anyone travelling Route 66 and fans of the Smokey and the Bandit/ Cannonball Run films!!

column2: A must in LA, a nice walk before or after lunch, very Californian
column3: For me it is the nicest beach to spend a day, not so isolated as Malibu and different kind than Venice beach.It has everything restaurants, luna park, beach, nice views to stroll around and..thousands of people.. can NOT be missed
Very touristy place, but you must see it. It's interesting all different kind of people that you can see around. There is a small roll coaster, that you have a great views of the beach!

column2: A wander back in time and Forrest Gump
column3: Thoroughly enjoyed our wander up and down the pier. Took our photos at the end of route 66 and at the Forrest Gump bench. Life's a box of chocolates and all that.

This is an iconic destination that can be enjoyed by night or day. At night it comes to life with all the lights of the ferris wheel and the roller coaster along with all the other attractions. Lots of good food places to enjoy and take in the view
One visit was enough!Lots of tacky shops and stalls.We wanted to visit because it's the end of Route 66. Pretty disappointing.
Nothin more than an tourist trap - not worth going unless you enjoy crowds, uncountable performers and souvenir shops

The view was great and after seeing in so many movies and video games I had to visit. I actually came twice. Once at day and once at night... and I totally recommend both! I didn't eat or play or shop, just walked around and I found that enjoyable enough. The restrooms are easy to access and clean... major plus!

column2: Nice hangout buzzing with activities, specially in evenings
column3: I liked the pier a lot - lots of things happening, great weather, buzzing with activities, right from street dancers to food. Its nice for a few hours of getaway.Parking wasnt too bad either.
Please make a point to include any visit to So. Cal with spending part of a day here, as well as Venice Beach. Words only describe what your own opinion will far outweigh.
Beautiful views, lots of fun activities for children, definitely the place to see when visiting Santa Monica. Had the opportunity to take great photos of the coastline.

I really enjoyed Santa Monica Pier. Overall it had a great vibe, and nobody really came across rude. We went at night and it was gorgeous all lit up. We never got a chance to go on the ferris wheel. I can't remember if it was already closed or what it was.Busy, busy, busy. There's always people running around, music playing, lots of talking, so it's not a quiet place by any means.
Was running along this Pier in the evening! Truly to say - its very spectacular:! A lot of lights! Just amazing!

This is a touristy but wonderful place to visit for all ages. There's a handful of amusement park rides. My daughter (22) and I rode the ferries wheel that has the most incredible views of both the ocean and beach. There's lots to eat and drink and there's a large pier. There was a seal hanging out in the water at the end of the pier while we were watching street performers. Highly recommend.

The Pier is a must see. If only to stand by the "End of Route 66" sign and have your photo taken. Have a bite at Bubba Gump Shrimp for a nostalgic trip down Forrest lane. The vendors are helpful and not very expensive and the general feeling of the area is one of merriment.
Went for a nice walk down the Pier, infortunetly we got there alittle too late and basically everthing was already closed, but besides that it was really really nice!!!
