Overall just a really nice pier with an amazing beach. There's rides on the pier which we didn't go on but many other little stalls. A few food options which again we didn't try as not all were open as we went around 10am and think most open around 12.

Went here recently with my husband. I had been when I was younger but he has never been. We went at night and during the day and both times the people on the pier making noise or singing killed the atmosphere and view.

column2: A fun park on a pier
column3: Lots to enjoy when the sun is out in its typical California fashion.Being able to enjoy the sea, beach as well as the rides makes this a special spot to visit with kids.
Typical tourist attraction with a midway, cheesy local restaurants, vendors, T-shirt shops, an arcade, etc.Worth seeing once. End of Route 66. No need to come back.

Some people may consider doing the pier as a bit cheesy, but it is such a beautiful location and the view out to sea is just gorgeous. Whenever I have work colleagues out with me who haven't been to the area I drive them down to the area for a wander around.Sadly there is a large street homeless community that live along the road side where you park, so the contrast between the 'haves' & the 'have nots' is stark, but sadly this is a sign of the times we live in.Make the effort to park a little way from the pier and walk down the beach front for the maximum impact. Then walk out to the end to see the Pacific!
Just like the pictures, not more than that either, but just good enough to have some lunch and buy souvenirs.

It's such a cliche thing to do, but you have to enjoy the small things in life! The quirky amusement park was very busy, but you could still easily walk around and explore the pier. Lots of tourists and visitors who don't speak English- a great opportunity to meet new people!
Have to get to the pier at sundown. Lots of energy, Ferris wheel gives you a great view of the city.

column2: Santa Monica is a must see
column3: I love this place so much fun and the pier is the cream on top it has great shopping great weather and beautiful sunsets as you eat at many of the great restaurants near the beach plus a lot of great people watching we stayed right across from the pier and at night the pier lights up it looks amazing

column2: A Nice Stop on the Pacific Coast Hwy
column3: My husband and I enjoyed our journey down the pier. There was plenty of entertainment with musicians every 30 yards or so. They are usually pretty good, too.There are plenty of souvenirs at a decent price. This is where we got some gifts for family back home. There are rides as well, including the only solar powered ferries wheel in the world.I would highly recommend reading the historical information about the pier. This can be found near the end of the pier on signs along the building.One of the unique facts we discovered is that the inspiration for the character Popeye came from a sailor who was out of the Santa Monica pier.
Allot of awful street performers and souvenir shops. Great food at Rustys Surf and Turf. Glad we did the pier before heading to Hollywood /LA. We spent about 2hrs including lunch. Not worth the time.

Not what it used to be , too many people and the person really looked tired , parking made difficult by a nasty attendant who insisted on making me park where he wanted , despite. Any empty spaces , I won't be back !

We visited the pier after dark. The kids had a good amount of carnival type fun. It was more fun just being in a different spot together I think. That night the power went out while ppl were on rides and didn't come back on. It was quite scary for my 5 yr old but overall we had fun.

We walked to the pier from our hotel and had a ball! Great people watching, wonderful musicians and artists. The Ferris wheel was beautiful. We had a seafood supper at Albrights. Yum! Many great restaurants to choose from plus delish ice cream and lemonade. It's amazing at night!

We visited here twice during our recent trip to California. We arrived around sunset and got some amazing photos of the beach and pier. Weekdays are quieter, I would recommend visiting on a weekend if you're keen to try out the rides, as this part is open later on weekends. It's a perfect date night, fairground rides, arcade games, talented buskers, romantic scenery. Every now and then you'll notice a herd of people running from one end of the pier to the other. This likely means a rare Pokemon has appeared.
Beautiful! Live music, even caught the sunset. There was the spot where Tom hanks from forest gump opened up the bubba shrimp place.

column2: Brings back memories from movie days of old.
column3: The board walk needs some replacement. But the views are great and several restaurants are excellent.
We were here on a busy and crowded Sunday night. Obviously popular with locals and tourists alike. Some nice music being played live. Must go at least once.

Wentbwith a friend to chedk out the beach. We choose a nice sunny day but wasnt too hot. We spent about an hour walking along the pier looking at the souvenir shops and out over the ocean. Its a great place to get some nice photos

It's exactly as expected - fun, frivolous and just what you want on a California evening. The colors sights and sounds are all spectacular and just plain special. It's not to be missed - a REAL California spot.

It was fun the scenery is beautiful and if you like shopping it's very close to that my kids love the Ferris wheel in playing some of the games even though it was a little bit expensive it was a lot of fun
Great place to take a walk after having lunch or dinner in Santa Monica.Wonderful place to bring visitors to see the world famous Pier full of arcades food and views up and down the coast.

Our kids thoroughly enjoyed the pier. I have no idea why they don't open until around 11 or noon - wish they opened earlier - messes up kids that are still young and need a mid day nap. Prices were reasonable and parking was easy.

column2: Very crowded but a must do
column3: Pier is always a fun time with concerts and events! If you are touristing than this is a definite stop and see he beauty awaiting here - fun times

We got off our bus tour for a few hours at the Santa Monica Pier. It is very old so don't expect modern things. I think this gives it some panache. You have the ferris wheel and rides, but it gives you that "old-timey" feeling of going to fairs, etc. when you were growing up. It probably could use a little facelift, but we had fun.
Always a fun experience to be on the pier at night with the lights and ocean breeze. The sights, sounds and smells are unique to this pier.
The Santa Monica Pier is a pretty nice place to take some photos and you can also purchase souvenirs there. It's a must-visit especially if you're on transit.

column2: It's like going to the State Fair, only on a pier!
column3: We were impressed by how much they were able to fit on this pier- I felt like I was at the State Fair with all the games and rides. We got custards at Route 66 while we walked around and played some skeet ball. Only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was because the bathrooms were disgusting, so pee before you go!

My wife, son (11) and I toured the Santa Monica Pier on a Sunday in November. Our only complaint was parking, the Pier parking was full ($12) so after we circled for a bit, we gave up and pulled into the lobster to park. It was $30, but it was right at the front walkway to the Pier. As we walked down to the Pier we noticed a HUGE parking lot down on the beach that you couldn't see from the main road. I think you have to access it from the Pacific Coast Hwy. We'd definitely park there next time because it was right on the beach beside the Pier and from what we could see from afar, about $18 for the day.The Pier was a cool place to see. The amusement park was for little kids (<8 years old), so we only did the Pacific Wheel. Definitely recommended since the view of the beach and the Pier was amazing, took lots of pictures. After the pier we walked down to the ocean to take some more scenic pics. All in all it was a nice relaxing day with tons to see.

column2: People watching galore and a ferris wheel!
column3: I didn't think I would enjoy this visit as much as I did as the pier looked so tacky from a distant with it's carnival and touristy appearance. But, hey, I was a tourist--so I just relaxed and took in all the smells, noise, crowds, street performances and beautiful views!The first thing you find when visiting the pier is that it is surrounded by lots and lots of free parking, which is amazing in itself. No stress driving around looking for parking. Next you get to stroll along a flat sidewalk towards the pier taking in the incredible wide and miles long beach. This is the brief introduction to the pier as you get to do some great people watching while they run, walk and bike by in all kinds of different and interesting outfits. As you walk onto the pier you catch the excitement of the children as they point excitedly towards the carnival rides and the giant ferris wheel. Reminds me of state fairs I attended as a child, and later with my children. There is something for everyone there. Shops, food and merchandise kiosks and restaurants line the pier and there were many excellent street performers. At the end of the dock you can watch the fishermen and look way out onto the horizon and spot fishing boats. There was even a seal diving and coming up for fish that entertained us for a while. Lots of benches to sit and listen and people watch. Walking back to your car go via the water, take off your shoes and feel the sand! Easy access via stairs and bridges over the freeway to visit nearby downtown Santa Monica and more restaurants and shopping!

We had our hopes set high for this and it was a big letdown. We thought it was going to be better than the Santa Cruz Pier we say a few days prior and it was no where near it. It was run down, lots of street vendors everywhere and just low end shops. It does provide a nice view out to the ocean and of the beach but that's about it. Would have definitely not made the time for it, if we knew this is what it was going to be. We ended up going to Long Beach and loved it better so stayed down there vs here.
Skanky. Old. Not good. Avoid and go to Santa Cruz instead. The beach is ok, but the fair is old and small and there is a lot of homeless (not blaming them, but the American culture)

The Pier in Santa Monica is alive. It was a beautiful evening and the pier offered a wide variety of things to do. We enjoyed ice cream and wide ranging fun. The amusement park is great for kids, but the scene off the end of the pier at sunset is something not to be missed. Even if the pier were not the end of the famed Route 66, a visit is a must do when visiting the LA area. I recommend parking in Santa Monica and walking down to the pier. Although there is parking next to the pier, walking down from Santa Monica provides scenic views and perspectives.

I think we did this weekend backwards. The pier is so zen. Great violin music, beautiful water. The girls are enjoying the rides. We should have stated here to get my zen on. The bathrooms are super clean too.

The end of Route 66, and I know it's brimming with tourists, but it's hard not to love the pier and its entertainment. It stretches into the Pacific and bisects two wonderfully picturesque beaches and stunning coast scenery.Vibrant is the word for the pier and it can now be so easily reached by metro from downtown LA.Take time out to visit, be a tourist and take in the beach life that is synonymous with California. The downtown Santa Monica shopping is worth the visit too!
Just to go walk and see different places to eat and lil shops to explore is what you get at Santa monica... a lot of kids tho so not too much on the peaceful side... but still good for the food!!
This was a great choice to bring my grandson to be loved it. He had never been to the ocean before so it was quite an experience for him.
Perfect view and local to invest some good time. Also good points to grab sone snacks and continue the trip
The Santa Monica Pier was really nice and had a carnival atmosphere . Great for family's and even seniors to enjoy themselves.

column2: Walking on the pier to view beach life and experience pierviews
column3: Many shops, and people walking here. Great view on Santa Monica beach and hotels. Attractive to bring kids if you are travelling with family and try on roller coaster etc.

Fabulously friendly, safe, clean! Lots of fun activities for the family! Several public bathroom facilities! Food & drinks are available including adult beverages! Super close to beach entrances! Sensational shopping!!! Beautiful at sunset or sunrise! Spectacular sight @ night! Love it!!!

This pier is everything I imagined it to be... its a 'must do' whist in Los Angeles plenty for the children to see and do little stalls..small fairground..ice creams etc. everything you expect to see on a traditional pier..

Let's start with it was a Wednesday in November. We went to purchase tickets at 5:15 pm. The little kids area was closing in 15 minutes, hours early. They said that the other rides close at 7. They had only 4 of the rides open with 1 operator going between 2 of the rides( figured this out after complaining). They abruptly closed ALL rides at 6:30 with no explanation. They were still selling tickets with 4 rides running at full price at 6 pm. All the games in the little kids are were closed the entire time we were there. I understand labor and sales, but there were people willing to purchase tickets. No one wants to spend $30 on 1 ticket with 3 1/2 rides working.......it was a beautiful night with temps in the upper 70's after a 85+ day.

Better off staying at the Venice beach boardwalk. This was over priced and underwhelming. You are constantly attacked by pigeons if you try and eat there and the theme Park cost $100 per person for a hsndfull of C grade rides which were all empty as it would seem we were not the only people who thought it was a waste of money.
Nice but a bit tired! Could do with an update.Nice little stalls with souvenirs and the views for sunset are recommended!!

column2: Forgot how awesome the Pier is!
column3: Haven't been back in years but in the eyes of my two year old niece, I fell in love with it again. The kid in you will always love here, then add the buzz, the buskers, good food.....Sheesh, I'm missing it already‚ù§Ô∏è

This pier is the same as it wss 10 years ago. It is still a tourist trap, and everything is expensive on the pier. Everything looks rundown and even sketchy(meaning a lot of homeless and gang members around it).The only plus is that it has a great view from the end of it. The best time to visit, is mid morning to mid afternoon, on a weekday, in the Fall, when the Santa Ana winds are blowing. You will encounter very few people and clear skies.

Nice walk to the pier, lots of buskers and people selling touristy things, bubba gump seat good to get a pic of, there is an amusement faculty $8 us for roller coaster ride, most places for snacks shut a 9 worth seeing the end of Route 66 üëçüèª

column2: Go For The History and The Great Photos
column3: Take photos of the End of Route 66 sign, the arched Santa Monica Pier sign, the ocean, Santa Monica, the Carousel, etc. Buy some souvenirs. Enjoy the ocean at the end of the pier. There are also "street" performers there, singing to a Karaoke machine, playing guitar, etc. For parking, weekdays are better. You can park next to the pier or even on the pier. Some kids will try to shake you down for money. One came up to me as I was buying an iced tea and asked me for a few dollars. I told him to sell the skateboard he was holding. I'm very generous to genuine people in need. This kid was not in need. Don't fall for it.
If you're an Aussie, make sure you slather on the sunblock before heading to the pier. The sun is completely different to ours, I got fried, and it didn't even feel that hot.

We headed over to the Pier after a day of sightseeing. Parking was easy and plentiful on the Pier. It was a beautiful night to walk and observe the lighted ferries wheel, shops, and restaurants, however I would of preferred being there during the day to view the ocean.
Bit of a let down..nothing but tacky touristy souvenirs for sale..lovely views. But not at all what i was expecting.

Very clean and beautiful. Parking wasn't too bad in price and you can park right by the beach. Lots of options for food, as well as places to get souvenirs. Many places to sit or stand to enjoy the ocean. We went on a Wednesday and there weren't many people so that was nice.

The pier is very clean and lively!We paid to ride the Ferris wheel because we knew the views would be worth it. It was pretty expensive to ride, and I imagine if you had a family it would get super pricey! But the view was totally worth it!

While in California I had the opportunity to visit the Santa Monica Piers. The weather was beautiful but there some fog that was over casting the closer you got to the water. To me it was crowded like Coney Island boardwalk in New York City. Lots of people. Lots of activities going on. I enjoyed the Santa Monica Strip. The different restaurants and other establishments. If you happen to go on the weekend, I suggest you park in the municipal parking lot. The max was $5.00. During the week it's more. Most people don't know so they tend to park at the meters which are limited to 2 or 3 hours at a time. What a nice drive.

It felt nostalgic to walk around the pier it reminded my of my childhood. There are kids rides and midway games. A few restaurants a lot of souvenir kiosks, local musicians, and artist. The view is fabulous.

The Santa Monica Pier is a must visit if in Los Angeles, food, fun, sun and great amusement rides, so iconic and seen in many movies. Third Street Promenade is a short two blocks away for lots of shopping, food and other services. Lots of parking, beaches, easy access.

Whilst the pier has great views and is worth a visit, the whole experience is a little underwhelming, the buildings and general look could be a much higher standard and we didn't feel comfortable to walk under the pier along the beach.

We were here about 6 years ago, and nothings changed. The shops and eateries are just as run down. I guess you don't come here for a MacDonald's restaurant experience? You come here to sample a snapshot of American culture, and there's plenty of it to see in all its undignified glory! Still a memorable, but certainly not uplifting experience.
Lots to do on the pier and wonderful places to eat. Amazing performers near the beach and ocean. Don't forget to take some cash!
Went for a walk, lots of people, shops, rides, tourists, beautiful seaside views, end of route 66 sign, where scenes from the movie 'Lost Boys' was set, grear spot for photos
Was able to try the ferris wheel with my cousins. Loved the vibe. I would've loved to go back during daytime just to see the beach.
Very nice. It is a great place to make tourism. Very nice food. Beautiful souvenirs. People from every countries. The bay is beautiful too.

column2: Good to say we've done it
column3: We arrived early for a tour and started in Santa Monica and walked down to the pier. Not a lot to see but worth doing to say you've done it.

This was our 3rd visit to the Santa Monica Pier over the years and I must say it was different from the last 2 visits. This time, the crowd was unbelievable. It was actually difficult to walk without bumping into people. The lines to get food/snacks were crazy long. We did wait in line to get a churro, which actually took about 30 minutes. We walked all the way out to the end and found a spot where we could stand for a few minutes to get away from the crowd. A lot of the people were playing Pokemon, so they were looking down at their electronic devices as they walked around. This was amusing for a while, but then became annoying! The views of the sunset over the ocean and views of the ferris wheel at night are beautiful, but I'm not sure it's worth it to fight the crowd.

The Santa Monica Pier is anything but boring. Except for the great ocean view and smell, there are many activities going on there. Kids park , artists selling their art, good restaurants - you name it..
Musicians of all types playing at the pier, with great ocean views, fun games and a variety of food options.

Lots of fun for the family. Dont forget to bring your wallet! The food, souvenirs, and activities are on the pricy side but it's one of those places that you have got to check out if you're in Santa Monica.

We visited here last night with our older son and found the pier to be filthy, tacky, crowded and definitely not worth a visit. Maybe seeing it during the day would have been better but all 3 of us agreed we wished we hadn't wasted the time to park and walk down there. Thought it was an added "plus" that when we were almost to the pier and went over by the trees to take a picture, we almost stumbled over 3 homeless people as well as about a dozen rats. Disgusting.

column2: Pretty from my hotel, but crowded.
column3: This place was packed the Friday night we walked from the Lowes. The view if the Pacific is nice from the Pier, but I would have preferred to spend my time away from the crowd.

I love Santa Monica Pier, it the nicest Pier the I've ever visited. I visited Ventura Pier yesterday but it's nice but does not have the buzz of Santa Monica Pier. Oh there is more on Santa Monica Pier including Bubba Grump fish restaurant and there are the amusements for children and adults alike. The Pier is magical when it's lit up.

Marks the end of Route 66!Worth going just for the signCouple of restaurants on the pierThere's a fun fair with coaster and Ferris wheel.Usually live music during the eveningYou can see fishermen and sometimes a seal or two hunting for their dinner!Nice environment

column2: Lots to do, but pure insanity
column3: When we went, it was so dense with people that it sucked most of the fun out of it for me. I'm told it's often that insane. We ended up leaving the boardwalk and walking along the beach.

We had previously visited Santa Monica however missed getting to the Pier which we regretted. So recently we had a couple of days to spare at the end of our vacation and made our way to Santa Monica primarily to visit the Pier. We joined the masses (end of summer) and walked to the Pier a short distance from our hotel. On getting to the Pier itself it was a collection of tacky retail outlets and some rides. Nothing stands out as a WOW moment. If you are in the area then pay a visit but I would not go out of my way to see it. I think it could do with a major refurbishment.

column2: An enjoyable stroll alog the pier
column3: The weather was perfect for our visit to the pier - clear skies & sunshine which of course added to the appeal of the pier. People-watching & sea-gazing amog buskers & stalls made this alovely way to spend a few hours.

There is something for everyone to do on Santa Monica Pier. It is showing its age, but it is still one of the best places to watch the waves and enjoy the sunset, Young people have plenty of choices for boardwalk rides when they are not enjoying the water. A few people were checking out some waves which were ok for surfing, There are plenty of boardwalk foods from seafood to hot dogs to pretzels to name a few. The EXPO line of the Metro system takes you from downtown LA right to the beach, no hassle, no parking charges, all for less than $4 roundtrip, much less for elders..

Spent a little over an hour in the evening here while on the way to LAX. Great place to watch the sunset. Food stands everywhere. Live music every few feet. Beautiful view of the Pacific Ocean. I would say this is a great place in which to spend an evening.

The pier has lots of restaurants and shops which stretch the length of the pier. There are some rides, I avoided the expensive and short rollercoaster, but decided to take a sunset ride on the Ferris wheel. It was fun and an beautiful view. Its crowded and changes to a stranger crowd after dark. Overall positive and worth the time!

The pier is fun to walk. There are vendors, food and carnival type rides. It you walk to the end there is a nice view of the Pacific Ocean. We were there on a Saturday and even though it was foggy and November it was still very crowded. Seems to be the place to be for regulars as well as tourists. Nice to see if you are in Southern California and have some time to spare.
A lot is going on. Maybe because I had been to it once. I was more taken with the Pier itself the first time. Second time. It just seemed like a Pier with lots around.

We visited the pier at the end of Oct and have to admit to being a little disappointed with it. The Ferris wheel was lit up but closed as were a number of the stalls and it was only 7:30pm. Not much to see except the Route 66 sign. Worth the visit but don't build your hopes up. The police station is pretty cool ..... from the outside!

column2: Fun way to spend a few hours
column3: A stroll along the pier, enjoying a funnel cake and possibly a ride on the ferris wheel is a nice way to spend an afternoon. We watched the sunset as well and strolled on the beach! Nice!
Went on big wheel and rollercoaster. Great fun! There was the usual range of tacky gift shops but a nice cafe at the end of the pier with a good live musician. Nice view at sunset.
I didn't expext it to be so touristic and full of people, but I think it's cool place to walk around. Nothing special, but great attraction to take nice pics.
Everybody knows the Santa Monica Pier. But it is nothing special. If you want to go there, do it. Nothing special.

This was my second time to this pier and I couldn't wait to show my the Santa Monica sunset from the pier! She loved it! I enjoyed it for a second time. This time we bought tickets to ride the world's only solar-powered ferris wheel on the pier and that gave us a wonderful view as well. A delightful evening!
Clean & well maintained areaSome good rides for the kidsPerfect spot for watching the sunset....Worth a visit

column2: A Must do if Visiting LA
column3: It's a pier :-)Good place to go, bit tacky but that is what makes it an experience.Places to eat which are good, had a good meal.Good view down the beach.A must do if visiting LA.
Had walk along beach walk to Santa Monica pier where we watch sun set over Mexican dinner at end of pier
Went out to the pier for something to do and thought it was a lovely place. Beach was clean, the view was wonderful, and there were lots of entertainment and dining options.

column2: Not a great place for a toddler on a weekend
column3: I hadn't been to the Los Angeles area in nearly ten years so I thought the pier would be a fun place to visit with my 2-year-old daughter. We went on a Saturday afternoon and it was complete mayhem. I'm sure it's a great place to visit during the week but in the future I'll steer clear of the pier with or without a toddler on the weekends.

I spent my childhood in and around the Pier. Everything from the carousel to the hot dog on a stick are fond places to recall. There used to be a ballroom on the south side called The Aragon Ballroom. The original Muscle Beach was a really big deal. Good times, better memories
Wanted to see this and glad we did. But too many people! ! And it was Tuesday! Excellent beach and boardwalk.
Nice...a lot of history so worth the visit...good for family outing. Nice picture opportunity. Relatively safe...didn't have much time to spend...didn't get to eat there.
Fantastic time & great to walk along night or day . Good view of the beach & easy parking .Been to over the years & the up keep is great .The perfect bay watch expectance .

I go to Santa Monica Pier one to three times a week! That's how much I love this place!Best time for Me to go- early am around 5am, which when it's a really light crowd of Fishermen, Walkers, Runners, Security, and Me. Everyone waves and speaks, it's like a second home.I prefer watching the sunrise as the birds skim the water and I've seen a few Seals as I sit on the end of the Pier.Of course I also go during the busy times so I can hear some amazing music, see some great Artists, and People watch. There are definitely some Stars on the Pier!!!It's pretty busy on weekends, lighter crowd during the week, and seems a date night for many couples.Families love the Pier with rides, rollercoaster, snacks, and games. I've had a fun ride on the rollercoaster many times with the kids! Every now and then I jump on to catch the view and hear the kids laughter, it's such a good time.I'll see You at the Santa Monica Pier!I Love YouZulekha Williams

The Santa Monica Pier is a must visit when traveling to the coast. It is the 'End of the Trail' of the Famous Route 66. I suggest going there during the day on a week day. The weekends are just to crowded. Even then it is a great people watching place. Families, couples, fishermen, street artist decorate the trail. It is a great place to get that best vacation photo. Be sure to walk to the end, since you are here you must see the whole thing! If you have a child along are a child at heart there are rides - the Ferris wheel, roller coaster and bumper cars. Some fairly good food available too.
The pier gets extremely busy during summer, not so bad when we went in December. Plenty to do for young children.

column2: END OF ROUTE 66 VIBRANT FUN PLACE TO VISIT
column3: The pier was bust and is the end of route 66. A variety of restaurants and fun rides for both adults and children. street entertainers were preforming and a fab place to watch the sun sink into the ocean

column2: Nice pier with lots to do
column3: Drove about 20 min, which was nice and scenic. Always fun to see what people are catching off the pier. The kids played some games. Some are a rip off but it's to be expected. The rides don't start till noon, FYI. Weather was nice. To park it is cash only. Quick little stop, but worth it.

We took the metro from downtown LA to Santa Monica Pier, great value at $7 day ticket on the metro.Lots of entertainment with singers on the pier & so much to see. A lovely family trip here, make sure you take a trip here

Well it's a pier - but it's THE pier. All sorts of fairground stuff, tacky shops, food outlets of dubious quality, forest Gump bench and fake shoes, the end of Route 66. Anywhere else you'd like it but that's all but this is Santa Monica baby and it's just awesome, especially for an overseas visitor. Been there three times and love going back. I do recommend a visit at first light when it's quiet and the ocean is calm. Just love it. Visit and enjoy
Great views, great rides. Really loved walking around and along the beach. Stunning beach stroll from Venice to Santa Monica. Loads of great Restaurants not far from the pier

The Santa Monica Pier is a fun place to go. Located right at the west end of Old Route 66! Shops, restaurants (including Bubba Gumps from the movie Forrest Gump). We enjoyed seeing the beautiful sunset from the end of the pier. There is also a small amusement park with the world's oldest solar powered carousel. In the evening the carousel has an amazing light display.
Great views from the pier. There are shops, food and a few rides. There are musicians playing and singing, fishermen and dog walkers. We bought some shirts for a pretty good price.

I have never been to the pier at any other time of day, but that's not going to stop me from declaring that 6-7 AM is the best time to visit. The stores and rides are closed and the sky is dark, but the bright lights of the rides are still on against the deep blue sky, making beautiful reflections in the ocean. The pier is clean and smells of ocean instead of fried food and people. It's very romantic in the idyllic sense of the word. Once the sun is up, the romance disappears and it's just a tiny little tourist trap.
The pier is kind of fun as you remember your days at amusement parks in iconic America. It's definitely worth the stop and the ferris wheel at sunset if you can make it happen is awesome!

column2: Preferred SM Pier atmosphere (+ Sunset) to Pier 39 in San Fran, quality entertainment, End of Route 66.
column3: Loved this Pier.A bit tricky to acess the longstay car park when traveling North - we drove up from Marina del Rey - but there is a park on the pier itself which works out a tad cheaper if you're staying for an hour or 2 although it's a tad small.Thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere and heard some of the best entertainers ever! Clare Means especially, but also an amazing hawaian/slide style guitarist at the end of the pier.Several places to eat with prices a little inflated cos it is an iconic atraction after all. The fun fair with big wheel looked good but we didn't try it. Just wandered up and down on a couple of occasions soaking in the atmosphere, sunshine and fresh air. Sunset from the Pier SO special!!

Fantastic, no other words to describe experience, you just have to go there, photos don't do it justice, fancy fishing at sunset off the pier, yes you can, get a photo with Forrest Grump at the end of Route 66 yes you can, at lest a picture of his "boots"

column2: Santa Monica --! Once in a life time!
column3: In fact I have visited here many many time ..And felt like a locals.Ocean / beach is beautiful .Seems currently locals walk or run and only tourist swimming sometimes .Here is safe even walking in the evening .

Lovely lit up in the evening with all the lights from the rides and fun fair stalls. Plenty to see and do as well as restaurants located all the way down the pier. Was a busy Saturday night, loved the atmosphere
While I didn't spend a lot of time here, it was very enjoyable just looking around and taking it all in.

It's a very crowded place since it's so famous but the beauty of it surpasses all the problems that may come with lots of people. Parking is very expensive and short term parking lot is incredibly small and always full. Lots of atractions over the pier, access to beach, food, awesome view of the Ocean and the city. Metro gets you right there in case you want to ride and not drive. Be careful with souvenir shops, walk all the way to the end of the pier where you will find the cheapest ones (and still overpriced)

It was exactly what I expected. I mean in the end of the day it's just e pier :). But it's a nice place to walk around get some good food and enjoy your day around the beach. If you have few hours to spare that's your place

This place is unique. The weather is great, the place is full and lively, you will see lots of people walking around, singing, dancing, fishing - it was a nice experience and the best part was the most amazing sunset! Don't miss it. Parking in adjacent lot.
People everywhere - locals and travellers alike. Vibrant, energetc, interesting and fun - put it on your 'must visit' list when in Santa Monica.

We chose Santa Monica to visit the SM Pier and check this off our bucket list. We were not disappointed. Very safe at night and lots of nice looking restaurants and bars nearby. Took pictures and enjoyed people watching. Drove down to Venice Beach- lots of difference. Very dark and a little scary just driving around. Passed walking around- SM seemed much safer and glad we stayed there. Daytime would be better at VB. Overall very happy we stayed an extra day.

You have to visit this iconic sight once. We were very disappointed with the Pier, thought there would be more excitement. But we figured it was the time of year and days during the week that we visited. It might be quite impressive during the summer and weekends.
Thought Santa Monica pier would be on par with pier 39 in San Fran not a patch,dirty rundown place seen it wouldn't go back !

I was hoping to see a place buzzing with people in a Carnival like fashion but was met with a place that was more snoring rather than buzzing. I guess I was a victim of mu own expectations. Small entertainment place, old rides, and few options on food. You should go here for the beach and wind, not for the rides.

The pier is full of things to see and do. Although it only needs an hour or so to fully explore. It's bustling and lively both day and night.One evening we ate in the Mexican at the very far end. Food was good and not as expensive as a lot of the restaurants in Santa Monica. They have a good value kids menu too. During the day we ate at one of the hot dog fast food restaurants, which was ok.We didn't do any of the main rides as they were quite pricy ($8 per person for the big wheel & there were 4 of us!) But the kids did really enjoy the beautiful old fashion indoor carousel which was only a couple of dollars. And we had a browse round the tourist shops and took in the beautiful view.We parked in the huge, empty car park by Muscle Beach (a 5 minute stroll away) for $8 a day. I believe the pier parking is more expensive and always seemed really busy.

Santa Monica pier is an iconic landmark and was on my bucket list to visit. Lovely views over the beach , lots of people watching. The Ferris wheel at the end of the pier is great to take photos. Along the pier there are shops, cafes and restaurants. The pier looked beautiful lit up at night

Just arrived to California will ne here for7 days and checked out the Cali beaches since I am from Atlanta wanted to check them out. The pier was beautiful with a ton of carnival games and rides. Me and the husband played skiball and rode the rollercoaster which was fun since we are adrenaline junkies...were able to see the sunset overall great experience

column2: Great crowded place for families with kids and visitors
column3: Must see jetty for families. Many public rest rooms, live music, gift shops, diners and a large amusement park with ferries wheel and small roller coaster.Entry from freeway and paid parking is around $12 per vehicle flat rate incl motorcycles.Visit this place and then head to the Venice canals for a complete day out.
Perhaps it would have been nicer if the weather was better. However it was just tacky.Walked to the end once then left. Lots of homeless sleeping at the entrance to the flyover. Give it a miss.....

We got there around 7pm on a Thursday and the ferries wheel was closed. So I was disappointed because I wanted to ride it. There was an arcade which I was not interested in. Along the pier there were some artists selling their items. Other than that, there wasn't really anything else to do there.

The iconic pier is a must see! The fun and excitement on the pier, the swimming, kite flying and beach activities in the Pacific and the shopping and people watching on the promenade--all a great day activity!

column2: Must see for Route 66, beach, fun and views
column3: End to the historic Route 66. Carnival on the pier as well as some restaurant and shopping/ souvenier stores. Great view of the huge beach. A nice walk for sure.

column2: It was the best California beach. Not now
column3: If you are visiting L.A, I recommend this place. It's typical American 1950 attractions. But only for one time. Nothing special honestly. Specifically if you are local or you looking for some higher class beach, this is not your beach. Lots of people and not a clean beach. I never go as a local
Nice place to walk around, see ocean views, rides, games, Ferris wheel, places to eat and the third street promenade. Check it out for a night out!

column2: Best Sea Food on the Pier!!
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is a Great place for Family, Fun, and Food!!! They have the Best sea food that you can eat while enjoying the view of the Sea. Very beautiful place for All ages, we'll definitely be back soon!!!

We drove to the Pier on a Friday night from Hollywood Blvd. We expected the traffic to be bad and to have difficulty parking, but it was the opposite. We paid $20 and parked at a restaurant next to the Pier. The Lot Attendants were friendly and helpful.The Pier is located at the end of Route 66, and admission to the Pier is free. No worries there are tons of little shops, restaurants, booths, games, artists/entertainers, and rides to spend money on. You can also rent fishing equipment at the end of the Pier. Beautiful view of the ocean, beach, and city skyline.We stopped at a booth to have our pictures taken and made into holographic magnets - pretty cool and great souvenirs.I should also note the public washrooms were extremely clean. I was shocked and impressed.Pacific Park is an amusement park located on the Pier. The rides are geared towards children, but still fun. We went on the Ferris wheel. This is a must-do. What a spectacular view!!!To the ladies visiting the Pier - don't wear heels, sport your wedges or flats.Overall, we had fun and would return in the future.

This is another place to stop on your costal drive it is very clean and the amusement rides are well maintained the ocean views are amazing and The performers on the boardwalk were amazing. There are people painting various scenes

column2: An amusement park on a pier
column3: An ordinary amusement park with an attractive location. The attractions can be very good for kids. Had a good fish and chips there.

The Santa Monica Pier is a fun place to visit. There are rides, shops, street food, buskers and other interesting things to see. The water views are spectacular and the beach is very nice. We also biked under the pier along the pathway and that was very cool.

This is a great place to visit for some old fashioned carnival rides and fun. They have many different rides for young ones as well as adults. You can also play on the beach and in the ocean (although we visited on a chilly day). The rides did not seem to be open at times, but we found that several rides had the same attendant-so if you waited in line somone would come over. You can park right next to the pier for $6.00. We parked up the street for 3.5 hours and it was $5. The only risk is that we were in 3 hour parking and left earlier because of that. The ride attendants did not seem to be too friendly, but if you look past that, it is fun. I would recommend buying the full day passes. It doesn't take too many rides to reach the value. Bring sunscreen!
Nothing special, busy and expensive just for a family with kidsIf you are looking for good food forget this place

column2: Could spend the whole day here
column3: Great place to swim, exercise, stroll or people watch. The pier contains a small amusement park and plenty of places to eat.
We didnt go on any rides, but it was nice to walk along the boardwalk. We took nice sunset pictures. Its iconic when you think of santa monica.
We lived Santa Monica and the pier was great....a great Bubba Gump restaurant and rides for the kids, very busy and touristy, but as you would expect.

We were so close to the pier that we somehow postponed our visit up to our last day in Santa Monica, we went on the evening and it was full of people, so vibrant, we had a wonderful time if it hadn't been for the chilly winds we would have stayed longer
Looks amazing at night can be very busy the beach is amazing a great place to stay and great scenery all day everyday we definitely be back

Nice place to people watch but a bit scruffy and tacky to be honest and with the fun fair only open Friday Saturday and Sunday a bit disappointing also half the restaurants/attractions were closed and those open apart from pier burger seemed dead and to be honest didn't look that enticing.

Good for the kids but expensive rides. Still it is worth it for the view from the top of the Ferris wheel.The street performers actually had very good voices and were a nice background sound. There are several eating places which looked good but we ate at Bubba Gump.We visited on a Wednesday but I think the weekends would be very crowded and parking would be a problem.
Way too many other things to do. This just wasn't worth the walk out to the end. Think cheesy and tacky tourist. The beach is beautiful and sunset is the romantic.

column2: A great attraction only the restauration needs to be improved
column3: Stock between sauwggy hamburger and a Bubba shrimp restaurant really you will not find the gourmet healty food restaurant in this area Sorry but this is all i can say.

It's fun - but it's no more than a pier. A sea of tourists and plenty of stalls to sell touristy things. It's the end of the Route 66 trail and that's interesting but there didn't seem to be much up-market offerings. But it has to be seen

We visited the pier for an afternoon. Had a wonderful fresh seafood lunch at the Albright. The rides were plentiful. The beach was in wonderful condition. It was a great place to take a walk down the beach, have lunch and catch some ice cream.
Santa Monica Pier is one of my favorite places to get away and walk on the pier and enjoy the beach. There is lots of people, fun and activities. This is a fun place for all ages.

I gave it a 4 star because it was free and it has a tremendous amount of history. The pier is 100% a tourist trap. On the upside it doesn't pretend to be anything else. Our family truly enjoyed renting bikes and riding along the bike path if you have time I would recommend that. I believe the one hour bike rental cost us $30 or so for three bikes. It was also cool to check out the end of route 66. I don't think you could spend the whole day here but a few hours is well spent to put it on the I have been here done that list.
Beautiful sunny day. Loved seeing ocean with mountains in the background. Enjoyed people watching and shops.
Great to spend an afternoon, or an entire day. It's beautiful. Plenty of activities for teens, kids and adults. Classic Southern California vibe.

I recommend you see the pier. Just be prepared to spend a lot on food and even on pricey pier park games and rides. Dirty pier but good place to say you've visited. Parking is an extra expense I recommend you park near metro expo line route and take the train to the pier. Also lots of homeless hanging around like most LA.
Never take a sunset for granted! This pier is full of fun for all. Plenty of parking and seemed safe. Thanks for a wonderful evening!
Easily can spent half a day here, between restaurants, street vendors and an amusement park. This place is great for both kids and adults that are young at heart.
From the welcome sign on Colorado to the end, the pier is full of sights, sounds, and yes, smells (mostly food).

column2: A must visit while in LA
column3: the pier is a multi functional site, for rides amusements and the occasional concert. Amazing view of the beach and the ocean
A seaside resort with great views ofMalibu . Can be very busy. Stop off for a meal and watch the waves break on the shore

We couldn't visit Los Angeles without a trip to Santa Monica pier and it didn't disappoint! Excellent live entertainment was scattered along the pier along with many unusual sellers of handmade keepsakes. Wonderful views and a lively atmosphere plus the end of Route 66, well worth a visit!
Quite far to walk. You "must" see it to know you were in Santa Monica. We did nit actually take the trouble to walk all the way to the end of the pier.
This is up there with the Tackiest of the tack. Filthy dirty with horrible shops and awful 'fun' rides. To be avoided at all costs, go to malibu pier

column2: The Expo Line Will Take You Here. Use It.
column3: One of Santa Monica's hallmark attractions is the Pier. The ideal place for your day trips is an Expo Line ride away. in time, with the arrival of the Regional Connector it will be a Gold Line ride away. There are a number of places to eat, a massive Ferris wheel and the beach. Plus, there are some occasional street entertainers to keep you company while you shop and look around. This is a recommended attraction for anyone that is planning to visit the great city of Los Angeles.

column2: Very busy but worth the visit!!
column3: I live in CA, but it was my first time to this Pier. Super busy, like, gave me anxiety at first busy. But that went away and the awe if it all took over. It feels like something out of a movie, old and nostalgia-y. There is much to see and do here, plan your time wisely. Definitely a kid friendly place! And please do yourself a favor and catch the sunset!

column2: It's tough to go wrong here: friendly people, sights and the Pacific Ocean
column3: It had been a few years since I last visited the SM Pier, so with a friend in tow who was a first time visitor, we explored. So many nice people and a fantastic vantage point to view it all!
Was buzzing with a great vibe and atmosphere, well worth the wait for the sun to go down, enjoyed the day.

Drove down at night parked the car $15.Walked around lots to see. Forced myself on the Pacific wheel, was glad I did once I got over the shock of the height the experience was fab with great views. The colours at night was beautiful. Got plenty photos also the end of Route 66 is there too!

column2: Kind of touristy but what a blast!
column3: SkeeBall, ice cream, and weird people. The trifecta of entertainment. You know people will ask if you walked the pier, might as well do it.

Large wharf with lots of shops, restaurants and funfair. There's even an old fashioned carousel so the pier is very busy. A small roller coaster and a few other tame rides make for a nice backdrop and fun place to go with the family. The usual arcades, slots and street entertainers give it a boardwalk type atmosphere. There's a Bubba Gump, where we've eaten before, that's also pretty good. A great beach and well worth a stop on your travels. Recommend

Cool place with lots going on. I went both in the morning and evening so saw both sides of it! Like the quietness in the morning and saw the sun rise over the city. And enjoyed the buzz in the evening with all the people milling around. It is a must see!!

We visited the pier and had a meal at the Mexican restaurant right at the end. A great exclectic mix of people. You can walk up and down for free, just watching the entertainers and the sunset. Lots of people trying to get you to buy their goods, but it's all quite fun.

The Santa Monica Pier is everything one thinks about when dreaming of LA and California. If visiting the area, it is worth the drive from LA to experience the beach and the pier.It is helpful to read up on the history of the pier prior to arrival as this will enhance one's experience. While walking on the old, oil soaked planks, one gets a better experience of its history with foreknowledge. It is a sturdy beast, which means the storms which destroyed previous iterations were powerful indeed.There is plenty of excellent parking near the beach and it is surprisingly affordable -- about $10 for the day.The pier itself has rides for the family and plenty of fun stops for food. It is for all ages and in our case, the teens particularly enjoyed the experience. It helped the weather was beautiful. It is not inexpensive, though not unreasonable. If traveling on a budget, bring a sack lunch and sit near the pier.The beach close to the pier can be a little crowded, so move down a bit farther. There is more beach here than one can possibly imagine. Showers, restrooms, exercise equipment, bike rentals, and bike paths are readily available.If leaving the pier for the beach, prepare as you would for any beach experience. Bring the sunscreen, towels, and sandals (the sand is scorching hot in summer), and expect a car filled with sand at the end of the day. We wished we had brought some binoculars for the kids to watch the boats far off the coast. However, use caution, don't be creepy and watch beach-goers. There are some creeps scattered among the families.

A fun place to visit with amusement rides. Great views in a wonderful area overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Lovely beaches by the pier. Santa Monica is one of my favorite places to visit in the U.S. Great for picture taking.
The pier is a great place. It has restaurants, bars, shops, rides, amazing views, and much much more to offer to those who choose to visit.
Loved my trip out to pier. Plenty to eat and drink. Rides for kids and lots to entertain. Usually has music going as many performers play live music.

Gone ghetto. Can't enter the pier without walking through the druggies on the corner. A Group of wanna be hippies feeling each other up openly smoking weed at the entrance. What a shame to make every child walk by this awful scene to try and enjoy the pier. Will never go back unless they clean up their act to be family friendly. Every restaurant had an hour wait and all the walk ups had no seating. Seemed like a waste.

It's just one of those things you HAVE to do while in LA.It's really crowded, but still a fun adventure/walk. There are some things to do (performers on the pier, rides, swimming on the beach, etc.), a few [priced up] places to eat and a gorgeous view of the ocean.We want on a cloudy day, and it was still beautiful.You don't have to spend a dime there if you don't want to, unless you bring a car, you'll have to pay for parking.
great little stop over walk out to the end of the pier and enjoy the view of santa monica bay easy in and out
The pier is awesome. Great access to the Third Street Promenade. It is great for families. Tons a great eating places and photo ops
This place is full of fun rides and sites - as well as restaurants for tourists - but who else would go here? If you have kids, this is a must do if you're staying anywhere close by.
A must go place if visiting the city. On the Peers there is a variety of entrainment. Very nice view of coast.
plenty to do and see great places to eat. they only thing is it is always crowded so if you dont like crowds stay away

column2: Beautiful spot with lots to do.
column3: We only had a few hours there but it was such a lovely spot. Would have loved to spend a whole day there and maybe stay overnight.

We visited on a weekend and there were so many people on the pier that half way through the walk, we decided to turn around! There were people everywhere, almost like a scene out of a futuristic horror movie with overpopulated earth.
Jammed with people and tacky commercialism, in what could be a very appealing destination. Nice beach on either side, however. A good family destination, especially compared to Venice beach.

Loved this place, would love to return as two days just wasn't long enough. One of our favourite places on our way along Route 66 right at the end. Highly recommend. Only downside a lot of vagrancy in the area

column2: One of my favorite places to vacation!
column3: I love the whole Santa Monica and Venice beach area. The Santa Monica Pier is iconic and my son loves the Pacific Park rides and old fashioned carousel. The roller coaster is pretty cool (not very scary) because once at the top, you have an amazing view of the ocean. There are many places to grab a quick bite to eat, and Bubba Gump's Shrimp Co. is located on the pier as well. We had dinner here and it was delicious. The wait was about an hour and a half, but we killed the time by walking the pier.

Somewhere I have always wanted to visit and it didn't disappoint. Not easy to park close buy without paying an all day parking charge but it's well worth the effort. Views are great and lots to see and do on the pier. End of Route 66 half way along was so cool.

Everyone needs to visit the Santa Monica Pier! This is a California landmark and a lot of fun. It is a complete tourist trap, but if you know that going in, you'll have a blast. Just be patient, embrace the beach vibe, and you'll be fine. There is plenty to do, see, and eat. If you buy a wristband for Pacific Park, be sure to ask for potential discounts. (Like Triple A). The midway games are a complete rip off, but also a complete hoot! Try a margarita at Mariasol at the end of the pier, and make sure you walk down behind Mariasol to hang with the local fisherman. The pier is always lined with local musicians, so take some time to listen because many of them are very talented. The day can get expensive, but it's good old California fun and the people watching is worth every penny!
It is an old peer build out of wood. On the end there is a restaurant. Nothing special. There are a lot of people singing, dancing or showing other talents to get some money

column2: Great atmosphere, just too many people
column3: Great times made here! Beach, ocean, rides, games, foods, many many sites including people! Get there early for parking.... or late for sunset. The weekday is better for quiet enjoyment of the beach, but weekends are great for many people type atmosphere. Kids absolutely love it!

Lots to do... arcade, rides, restaurants, views!We didn't ride all the rides; they are geared towards younger kids but we did do the Ferris Wheel which provides a great view of the water and of the Pier.We spent time in the arcade, played some air hockey and other a few other games. The games use quarters, and most games were a dollar a game.Not a ton of restaurants on the pier to choose from, as I wanted to sit outside, but it had a couple of nice ones nonetheless.Multiple souvenir shops; multiple people busking.... only thing I wasn't happy with... the people with microphones and speakers preaching about God and all my sins.

column2: Fun place with lots to see, do and eat.
column3: We went there near sunset for supper. It's a fun place to walk around. Lots of musicians, artist types selling stuff and lots of great places to eat. There are also lots of amusement park rides like a small roller coaster and a Ferris wheel. This is s fun place to spend some time.
I've always wanted to go to Santa Monica beach and pier! We watch it all the time in movies and tv shows! It's a great place with a good vibe! Highly recommend it!

We thought that - when in Santa Monica - one had to visit the pier. It was OK, but it is so much like other piers and seaside fairgrounds. Nice to have been on it - not what I would call a "must see" attraction.

I always enjoy strolling on old wooden piers. This one is an icon of the beach in LA. It has its tacky reataurants, vendors and buskers, and that's what makes it fun. Great views of the coastline, north and south.
Not sure if because it's a movie iconic spot or just an awesome vibe but it's worth a visit.There are great places to eat and rides for the kids and adults.Check it out!

The pier was exactly what I expected, nice an quaint - but very busy. Even though it didn't mean you couldn't get around and there were ample things to see and do from classic amusement rides to different types of food.The different range of people was great for people watching and the view was great in all directions.Be wary of cheap souvenirs a lot of people seemed to get duped by inferior products.If you're a history buff you'll love to see the end of historic Route 66 and what if offers.

Santa Monica is one of the highlights of visiting Southern California. The Pier along with Pacific Park make an excellent outing for friends or family. Lots of restaurants, souvenir shops and of course the Pacific Park theme park. If you are in the area, definitely swing by as you will not be disappointed!

We took a stroll down the SM Pier during the early afternoon. If was not really too crowded and walking was easy without having to navigate out if everyone's way. Plenty of gift shops and pop ups if you desire a souvenir. We had a delicious ice cream while enjoying people watching from a dining umbrella. Good times.

column2: Santa Monica Pier is a fun way to spend some leisurely time
column3: The best time to go to the Pier is right before sunset. There are lots of rides and games. Our purpose was to see the ocean, watch the people and catch the sunset. Succeeded on all levels. The Mexican restaurant at the end of the Pier did not have the best service, but we stopped there for cocktails and appetizers (tableside guac which was good), before moving on for dinner.
Great summer concerts and lots of booths and family fun. Giveaways, music, food. It was alot of fun!
Enjoyed a couple of hours on the Pier including great views. Watched the performers and road the fairly tame roller coaster.

Beach area with stunning promenade, pier nice to go there very busy but the experience of the trip, full of craftsmen and good restaurants, not far from the pedestrian has abundant food and a place to do shopping .. In short fun one complete

Didn't excite me too much, it is what it is, very overcrowded and full of tourists (me being one). If you are in the area I guess you have to go to tick it off the list but for me it wasn't anything special.

column2: First stop on my California trip
column3: Went to the Pier after collecting our convertible from the airport (the only way to see California). Fun to experience somewhere you see on a lot of TV shows and movies.

On a recent visit to the area, we attempted to go to the pier on a Saturday night (some of us in the group had been before and others were first-time visitors) and we could not get anywhere near it. The parking lots were all full, street parking was full, beach parking was full. We decided to come back on a week night. We returned on a Tuesday evening and had no issues with parking. Unfortunately, many of the attractions were closed when we arrived (at about 7:00 p.m.) which was surprising, but we still had fun walking around. Primarily because it is such an iconic location and is featured in so many movies/shows. We did enjoy the realization that it was the end of Route 66 and spent some time reading about the history of the pier. We watched some street dancers performing which was cool. All in all, probably worth a visit at least once, but definitely not something I would need to visit again.
Always a neat place to visit. It's the end of Route 66. How could it not be cool. The pier is always full of action
Visited with my sister loved it, hot day wish we had time to swim. Take a hat & suncream, it was very hot day.
We were lucky to be with friends in a hire car so we're able to see the lovely beaches & the scenic drives in the area. You can also get there be public transport. Another area worth seen if possible

You can not be in Santa Monica and not walk the pier!Fun place and good access to the beach from it.We had a nice dinner at the end of the pier and it was a good time watching the ocean and people fishing from the pier.Busy and crowded but that is the fun of it.

column2: Lots of colour, noise & fun - esp for kids
column3: You just have to visit the pier if you're in Santa Monica, even just to walk along it. Great place to watch the sunset - but my tip would be to go down to the beach on the south side and then you'll get to see the pier and its colourful lightshows in contrast with the natural sunset colours - fab! Another tip: look for all the colours reflected in the shallow water and the wet sand each time the waves recede - makes for pretty spectacular photos!

Brief visit to Santa Monica and we visited the Pier a couple of times. Wall to wall people - loud, pushy, with lots of rubbish being touted for sale. Despite that it was strangely interesting watching people - the merry go round inside was interesting as it was reminiscent of those of our youth - my wife had a ride and enjoyed the nostalgia - walked to the end of the pier fighting the mob all the way - bought a cheap hat to keep off the sun (it was also very useful when we got to the UK as a rain hat!) - had a meal at the Mexican restaurant at the far end (avoid the Sangria Rioja - cocktail that was just too fruity and sweet to be enjoyable) -Being the end of Route 66 we took the obligatory photo at the signpost. Overall it was interesting but the lasting memory was of people, people, and more people with heaps of junk for sale, Pretty outlook though when you got to the edges and the old merry go round was very nostalgic

Really loved it. There's beautiful sights, gift shops, live entertainers, food... & if you get there early enough you can even enjoy the mini theme park.Gets a bit cold in the evenings though, so wrap up.
Great views from the pier, the beach is lovely, although we was only in LA for 2 days so never had time to make the most of this area as wanted to see lots of sights
Very nice snapshot of Santa MonicaIt is a must see attractionAmazing sunsets, plenty of amusement rides for the family.

Lots to see & do & just as much fun people watching! We had a couple of hours here, lovely to watch the fishermen to seeing people enjoy the rides, watching the street performers, plenty of places to eat & good clean public rest rooms. Iconic place to visit at its the end of Route 66. Definitely worth a visit.
An iconic location that iffer so much more than just the pier. The adjacent city has a thriving shopping area with a lot of fine eateries and high end shops.

You just visit here if you are in Los Angeles whether it is on the beach or the pier both are great, Recommend going on the Ferris wheel as the views are great and it is only $8 each. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby.

column2: Walk as fast as you can
column3: I didn't enjoy the pier, and mostly because it is designed specifically for tourists. Even if you want to go to the beach next to the pier, I suggest a short walk/ride down to Venice Beach which is much less crowded.It reminded me of Coney Island or an old amusement park.Kids may enjoy it, and there are plenty of tourist-trap restaurants, if you're into that.

The pier was crowded but I was glad we stopped by. We spent four hours here just walking around and doing some shopping, eating and taking in the sights. Interesting people on the pier. A diverse mix of all cultures. Had a fabulous time. If you are in the area, it's a must see. The pictures of the ocean are just beautiful and we caught the sunset.

column2: A must see in Los Angeles
column3: Always wanted to visit Santa Monica Pier - its featured in so many films and books - and it didn't disappoint. Great views, epic people watching and a lovely walk along the beach. A must do for anyone visiting.

Yes you've seen it in movies and it is worth the visit. Parking can be fun but we parked in a meter park near the muscle beach area which was easy. Make sure you get a picture under the route 66 sign a third of the way along bridge. Will take approx 1 hr out of car.
The pier is a great place to visit when in the LA area. Good food and refreshments are available. Route 66 memorabilia is sold here also. Be sure to take a selfie with the Rt.66 sign!

column2: Nice place to stretch your legs
column3: Enjoyed walking the pier on a Beautiful Day! Great views to take pictures and enjoyed the shops. A nice thing to do when in Santa Monica.

column2: Perfect day for a visit to the Pier
column3: Started the day by walking from Venice Beach to the Santa Monica Pier. Venice Beach seemed dirty and a little risky (unsafe) compared to the beach and pier at Santa Monica. A lot of street vendors, shops and rides on the pier.

column2: A must see in Santa Monica.
column3: Day or night this is an attraction that can be enjoyed by every member of the family. Just be aware that the restaurants on the pier close at 20.30 at this time of the year.

column2: Nice place to spend the day
column3: The pier is a nice place to spend some hours if you are in between flights or if you have a free afternoon and also if you want to walk overlooking the sea
This is a must see at least once for anyone in the area. Always busy but well worth the time and effort.
If you're going to do this go early buy you will not be able yo move same afternoons and night but yes itsva time travel attraction like your in the past

column2: fun to see but very busy
column3: Second time to go here and went on a Sunday in early October. Very busy!! Walked over from 3rd street promenade and only one sidewalk down onto pier over highway just jammed with people. They should stop vehicle on Colorado and turn into a larger pedestrian friendly access. The pier has some rides and gift shops and a restaurant at end but nothing too exciting. Worth a first visit but not to return.
Beautiful setting.Have fun at the fair.Street entertainment.Traditional fairground food.Rides and sideshows, great family fun.

It was so beautiful! We ate at bubas and it was crowded but such an amazing experience at sunset only downfall when we where walking back to our vehicle out youngest needed the bathroom they lock the bathrooms at night and no business would let her use it :(
Just finished Route 66 and this is the end of the trail. We started in Chicago four weeks earlier and ended on the pier. Great

column2: Old Fashioned - but still a great visit!
column3: Have visited about 10 times over the last 25 years - it doesn't change much - but the sun always shines and the people are always happy ! Had a Mexican Restaurant breakfast once, but I didn't get it at the time - being used to a full English - guess that was my fault. Venice beach is great, just a few yards away with plenty of unique attractions and a nice little shopping mall, as well as market type stalls.

A friend showed me around Santa Monica when I was visiting Cali and took me here. I've seen so many shots of it on Instagram and in films and it was so exciting to actually be there. Save yourself some room to sample some of the typical American vender food, churros, hotdogs, tacos and my favourite- funnel cake (what I can only describe as a huge round pile of piped squiggly doughnut) definitely share one they're probably big enough for 3 ! Oh and obviously go on the rides before you eat... a must see for your la trip.

Beautiful board beach. Kids enjoyed a play with make shift sand toys. We saved some plastic cups from lunch but there are vendors selling toys and food, walking along the beach. Beach was cleaner than expected, with life guard on duty.
The place is full of people having a great time. End of Route 66 is there and is a must for a photo. Shops are great and it is a beautiful traditional pier. A must visit

Without a doubt my favourite place in LA, if not possibly the world. I cant describe what it is about Santa Monica pier but just has such a feel good factor. Its so lively always buzzing with people but if you go down the end of the pier you can still find a quiet spot. Absolutely love it

Go on a weekday!It might not be as crowded but everything is still open and you can find a good spot to sit, relax, have an ice cream cone and enjoy the beautiful weather.Or go on a Thursday after work and catch a twilight concert in the summer.
Is a nice place to go with family and friends, or even with a partner; had a lot of fun and will visit back soon I hope
We caught the train from USC. It was an easy train ride and walked down to the pier. Quite a few homeless people around. We hired bikes and cruised down to Venice beach which was an easy ride.

column2: Dont go out of your way
column3: Very touristy but if you're there check it out. Ocean views are nice. Prefer almost every other beach area and pier in LA. Promenade is like an outside middle America mall. Disappointing.

I've heard so many cool things about the Santa Monica Pier, when in reality it is similar to the fair. There are rides, games, an over-priced drinks. Bad idea if it's hot outside because there are so many people.

I ended up going to the pier the other day to go PokemonGo Hunting! I forgot how nostalgic the pier was! From the giant light up Ferris wheel to the roller coaster they have on the pier, nothing is more iconic to Los Angeles than the Santa Monica Pier! The pier was built in 1909 and was the first concrete pier in the West Coast! The concrete pier is all gone and made way to what we have today! Reopened in 1996, the pier has an aquarium, historic merry go round and hosts outdoor summer concerts, fishing and sit down restaurant at the end of the pier! Definitely a place to enjoy the Southern California sunsets and enjoy the warm SoCal nights!

column2: A great place for a date or with your kids
column3: An amusement park on the pier. An iconic landmark. However LA has so many other things to do, I wouldn't plan to spend much time here.
Even though it was very busy, it was still fun. The wait for dining is long but we walked around and shopped the vendors while we waited. Look for vendors on the beach making handmade items.

column2: Views and great people watching spot!
column3: Spent an afternoon on the Pier, as we have always wanted to do so. Great place to walk around, eat, drink, people watch! Several benches up and down the pier. Glad to experience this!
A great place for all ages. Lovely dining areas, entertainment for the kids, buskers. Easy access and plenty of space around you. A great place to watch the sunset.

The SM Pier has a boardwalk feel with various types of restaurants, a ferris wheel, and game arcades. It can be very crowded with everyone from out of town tourists, locals out for a walk, and street performers. It's a very festive atmosphere. Parking can be difficult, but I found that you can actually park on the pier behind some of the restaurants for a reasonable charge. Nice time to come is during the late afternoons and watch the sunset.

There is always something going on at Santa Monica Pier...yesterday it was Japan/America Kite Festival, with kites of all sizes and shapes flying high! Live entertainment can be seen in many locations along the pier. Restaurants, bars, shops, and rides also.
Great views fun rides and on the beach!! There are great restaurants and random entertainment along it.
What more could one ask for?On the tip of the pacific with awesome views daytime and night. It's a "must" destination in everyone's lifetime!

column2: Walk to the end of the pier.
column3: The pier seems to be very popular with tons of people around. Walk to the end, go way out there to where the guys are fishing below and then just take it all in. It seemed very peaceful way out there.
Walk the pier, go for lunch, then rent a bike and bike towards Venice Beach. It's a great day activity for beautiful beach view, lots of options for lunch and an active activity.

column2: LOVELY FOR COUPLES, FAMILIES- JUST TO STROLL ALONG AND TAKE IT ALL IN!
column3: This is a great place just to experience the street vendors and musicians on a sunny day! It's a great place for children too, with lots for them to do on the rides. There are many actors along the pier and very good musicians at times. Enjoy the stroll and for somewhere quieter, just walk along the beach and ENJOY!

column2: Really cool place, grab yourself a beer and enjoy the view
column3: Great view of the ocean of course. Lots to see and do as the area is generally really vibrant. Great place to kick back and chill in the sun
After hearing all about the great Pier and how iconic it was, I was left a little disappointed :( definitely need to go there but don't have your hopes up!
Legendary place with fantastic atmosphere ! It is really overcrowded but it is absolutely worth to visit!

Parked a few blocks away and walked down to pier. There is pier parking but was full when we went. Plenty of great restaurants and shops to visit on the walk over. Entering the pier had several street performers and people selling various things. Walk through that mess quickly! On the pier, kids had a great time at arcade and playing the carnival type games. Roller coaster and ferris wheel very cool also being right on the water. Didn't have a chance to go on the beach. Cool spot to spend an afternoon!
Very nice view.Beach ... Of baywatch....haha nice place to visit but just for a walk to see.. nice place for photo...

column2: Very interesting street performers at night!!
column3: Various food options, a few carnival rides and a roller coaster. Several street vendors and performers were there when we visited at night. Lots of people fishing. It was just something to see if you've never been there!!

column2: Must see when in Santa Monica
column3: Can't really give this a miss. It marks the end of Route 66 and offers a great view toward Malibu and Venice Beach. You can actually drive onto the pier and park but I would strongly suggest otherwise as the parking chaos is best seen by foot. Especially on weekends. There is a Bubba Gump and some other restaurants as well as fast food and sweets. Not to mention the roller coaster ride which is well worth the few bucks. Not for the thrill but for the view. Walk all the way to the end to enjoy the scenery and look out onto the mighty Pacific Ocean. Rest assured you won't feel lonely on the pier...Still worth a visit though despite the maddening number of people on there on a Saturday night.Have fun!

column2: Must visit if you're in LA
column3: Loved the area of Santa Monica, if I ever get back to California, I would love to stay there. You have to go to the Santa Monica Pier if you're in the LA area. It's as expected - big, crowded with a lot going on. Good for kids as there is a mini amusement park. The beach is wide with plenty of space for everyone. If you're from the East coast, think Jones Beach or Coney Island. There are a lot of nice restaurants in the area, in addition to the regular fast food places. There is a train which takes you right to the pier as well as public buses. The 3rd St Promenade has shops and restaurants as well and is within walking distance of the beach/pier. Venice Beach is maybe @20-30 minutes away and you can rent bikes to ride there. If you're driving I recommend taking a drive up the Pacific Coast Highway to Malibu, which is @30-40 minutes north without traffic. A nice scenic ride and worth the trip.

This was my favourite part of LA. My girlfriend used to live in la and used to hang out on the pier. There is a great atmosphere here with some rides to enjoy, some places to eat and also a lovely beach and the view of the ocean is unreal.

Our teenage son wanted to see the pier during his first visit to LA and we all enjoyed it. The crowd was in full force on Saturday afternoon and the numerous performers put on a great show. There was a very playful seal swimming around the end of the pier.

We went to this famous pier on the July 4th long weekend and it was like a zoo. Much too crowded to walk and could not avoid always bumping into others on the pier. It is a must see if you are a tourist since this old pier has a great reputation as a must see location . This is an iconic pier and is used as backdrop in many a Hollywood movies and the beach scene and nearby boardwalk is a true Southern California experience. For next time, however, we'll choose an off season day to avoid the crowds and the impossible parking and enjoy a more relaxing experience.
Eating a ice cream, seagull flew down took it funny story to tell I guess, nice views relaxing beer end of pier

This pier is a well known LA icon that most tourists will try to visit. Very crowded with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Best to park in the multi storey car park a block away, free for the first two hours.Going onto the pier itself is for the brave on a weekend. Jam packed with visitors. The usual souvenir shops and restaurants are situated on the pier.I cannot say that it is recommended.The near by Venice Beach might be more relaxing to visit.
