Legendary pier but nothing super and way smaller than compared to San Francisco pier 39. We did not try rollercoaster or any other ride and went during sunset, views were nice that time. Only few places to eat on a pier but visit the boulevard nearby which offers lots of shops and places to eat.

We were lucky enough to be staying close to Santa Monica Pier so went for a wander quite often. We were disappointed that the rides shut down so early, and the shops were closing even though there were lots and lots of people looking around. Some shops and food outlets weren't open at all. Perhaps its something to do with regulations??

column2: Fun. Must do the end of Route 66.
column3: We had a great time visiting the pier at the end of our Desert Trip vacation. There were people shark fishing, musicians on the pier and a great carousel.

Love Santa Monica Pier. No matter how many times Ive gone its just perfect in the mornings, less people, vendors just opening up. If you walk all the way to the end and find a comfy spot on a bench (right past the last restaurant) you'll see early morning fishermen and just watch the water roll in and out. Perfect for romance, R&R or just some quiet time.

It was a worth drive from L.A Covina to here with perfect weather as we don't have much when we left in Alberta Canada .If you want to relax in the area there are a lots to do with parking on the side as well .Shops and restaurant can be found in the area as well.Great scenery too.

The pier was absolutely packed on a very warm Saturday afternoon. We wanted to see the end of Route 66 sign, otherwise I would probably just have paddled in the Pacific.It was a great opportunity for people watching and the ice creams were great
Although there were a lot of interesting characters - I think my favourite was Rock n Roll Jesus at the very end of the pier. Couldn't visit Santa Monica without a least a quick walk on the pier.

My family and I recently visited this beach and had a great time. We ate at Bubba Gumps and had the best food. There is so much to see or do here and the shopping is reasonable for tourist gear. We will definitely be back!!
Loved it here. The pier had so much going on you could easily spend a full day here with restaurants and rides etc.The views were amazing from the top of the pier too.

We rode the ferries wheel and that was fun! $32 for the 4 of us seemed steep. If I wasn't so tired, I probably would have bought a day pass and gone on the roller coaster too! We had a nice walk on the pier and the weather was great.
Go!Very much fun even the rides are fun to do, and of course Bubba shrimp is fantastic experience.For young and old a great time,
Enjoyed walking around the pier area and people watching, great band entertaining at the end and several other street performers along the way.

The Santa Monica Pier is a historical landmark. It's a bit standard as far as touristy piers go, but the ferris wheel is fun and it was interesting watching the trapeze school for a bit. It's a nice distraction after some time on the beach. It can get crowded but early in the morning it's not too bad.

column2: Night view and leisure walk after dinner
column3: Its great for a walk after dinner and to see this part of the place in the evening ..Thou I went late, this place still has crowds and there are people fishing..Nice calm sea and the moonlight reflect on the water is so scenic..

The Ferris Wheel ride was so fun and gave us a great view of all of the lights of the city and boats on the ocean. They let our group of 3 have our own "tub" which was more comfortable than if crowed with 8 people. Can't wait to ride the Ferris Wheel in the daytime to get a different perspective. Also, on the pier, my 3 sons won a pink bear in a basketball goal game which was special and made me laugh at how they are still as competitive now, as young adults, as when they were teenagers!
Great visit, nice entertainment and nice Sunset. Must see if you are in the area! Also walking into town for some drinks/shopping is recommended

column2: A must visit when in Santa Monica
column3: Visiting the Pier on a weekend in October, we were treated to a peaceful visit. We even had a chance for a photo op with the Highway 66 sign WITHOUT waiting in line for an hour. :) The pier is lined with shops and activities as well as eateries and tourist info stations. We enjoyed walking along this famed pier and taking in the sights both on the pier and around it. A fun place!

First time coming to this place after going to universal studios too. It was raining during that time so I wasn't able to enjoy the place since it was still cold for me during that time. But even if its raining, I believe it would be very nice there to chill with family and friends.
Pier has good rides and views of city. We spent good time at beach right next and had food and rides at pier. It has large parking with easy access to beach and pier.

Great place really enjoyed seeing the beach, great musicians along the wall on pier too. Would recommend this to everyone who comes to this area .. A must see for sure. People seemed so happy to be here & you could watch people body surfing

column2: Nice walk on a clear day
column3: We walked to the end of the pier a couple of times during our stay in Santa Monica. There were lots of people. The food and service is good. The beach was nice but the water was dirty.

column2: Great place to watch the sunset
column3: This is a wonderful place to eat, listen to live music, ride rides and chill on the beach. I got to see the sunset go down and it was beautiful.

Have to say I was disappointed in Santa Monica pier, all the hype about it and I was more impressed with the piers in blackpool, didn't eat or drink on the pier, not sure if my expectations were high because of what I had read about it, maybe you have to walk down it just to say you have done it, but it would not be at the top of my recommendation list.

Great spot to head with the family, lots to see and do and Venice beach is just a 30min walk away.Pier was nice and clean and had lots to see and do, the carnival was fun and all the street artists were great to watch.If you get the chance sit at Bubba Gumps, have dinner and watch the sunset over the pier it's fantastic!

column2: Wow! A pier that you can drive onto (and park!)
column3: My wife and I visited the pier on a couple of occasions over the last few days while staying in Santa Monica.Firstly, it is wooden and cars still drive onto it to park! Amazing sound (thumpity thump!) can be heard when the cars roll onto the pier! Must be like being back in the 60's!Then you have all the attractions - the people, performers, fairground rides, food (Japadog!), drinks, Route 66 finale, the fisherman and the ocean and wildlife itself! I spotted a small shark one day, then a Sealion the next!It is th emost beautiful place to sit in the sun with a nice cool breeze on your face and just watch the world go by.Come and enjoy the experience, it doesn't cost a dime!
Was ok, but not very exciting.Saw and did everything including lunch, in an hour and a bit.Had a great omlette at Bubba Gumps.Good to tick off the bucket list, but thats about it.

We had a fun day walking along the pier and people watching, and catching Pokemon (there were tons). There are tons of people out on the pier and the restaurants are pretty busy (but not hard to get in).

It's worth while to take the walk to the end of the pier. It offers amazing possibilities for pictures of the coastline.It would be nice if it would be kept a bit cleaner ...which I understand is difficult considering the homelessness situation there.
Stayed in Santa Monica for 4 nights & had to experience the Pier, was so many different things going on, street performers etc lots of different people, was an enjoyable time : )

After what was a pretty amazing trip to California we had decided to waste some time before heading to the airport at the Santa Monica Pier. We parked in the paid lot right beside the pier alongside Bubba Gump Shrimp where the 'lot attendant' put a pink paper on our dashboard. My husband and I walked to the end of the pier, and rode the Ferris wheel, which totalled about 45 minutes.When we returned to our car it looked normal, until I noticed our backpack was missing, we then popped the trunk and found that everything was missing. At first we thought we someone opened the wrong car, this couldn't have happened. Wrong! In broad daylight, in a paid parking lot with hundreds of people around someone had broken into our car and robbed us. We were left with the clothing on our backs and luckily our licenses and credit cards. Our passports, luggage, camera, everything we brought with us, along with the souvenirs I had bought my family from Disneyland were all gone.I stayed with the car while my husband went and grabbed security who told us to just go to the police station. He had a paper, and number to call right away, like this was a common occurrence. In hindsight, that seems a little odd, why wouldn't we call the police to the pier? Didn't they want to see if there were any witnesses? Do they not want people to know what's going on there? That pink thing on our dashboard, did it mark our car?Anyway, we followed instructions and went to the police station, where they did forensics and unfortunately, we weren't the only victims at the pier that day. They explained that the thieves had jammed something in the door lock and that's how they got access. We were told it's an epidemic in Southern California and basically shown that we were just another number, and chances are we wouldn't see any of our things again.It was one of the worst experiences that I've had while travelling, it happened at 2:00 pm on a Monday afternoon. Luckily 3 days later and after applying for emergency passports, we could finally return hope with absolutely nothing from our trip.

I went and visited LA, we happen to visit the Santa Monica Pier. We had a great time, getting to enjoy the view and visit the different shops. We wanted to eat close by and choose this place.We were greeted very good, and seated as requested which was a view to the beach.Everyone was nice and we order the food, taking a normal time to receive it. The view was great of the beach and it was a great day.Everyone on my family loved the food, I wanted a Shrimp po boy and it was awesome. I asked for a local beer and received a complementary beer mug.Overall we like the place, and would recommend. They had free wi fi, bathrooms were clean. Great place.
Had a good day out on the pier where we found the end of the route 66 sign and shops and restaurants. Highlight was the leopard seals swimming at the end of the pier.
Nice place to stay a Sunday afternoon en enjoy the view and the beach.Didn't try any of the restaurant there
You can enjoy the pier day or night ! Just fun to walk and see people from all over. Had fun playing and getting on the fair type rides. Great view of the ocean and the beach!

The pier is huge and you have to check it out while you're here. There are several restaurants. You can ride a roller coaster or feeris wheel! I think $12 gets you an unlimited ride pass for kids under 7. It's a sight to see. And the beach and mountains are beautiful too.

Lots of fun. My mom and I rode the roller coaster. A great tourist area. Park in the garage across the street and the first 90 minutes are free after that it's only 1.25 an hour. Beware of people on drugs and people asking for money (this is allllllll of LA thought) overall a fun little stop with some great photo opportunities.

The pier itself is a interesting site but it was busy and many people were hanging around catching Pokemon whilst we were there. The rides were lit up at night which was spectacular but the local and tourists jam the pier for all of the restaurants, stores and rides. It has sign stating it is the last stop of Route 66.

Great area to take the family. Go there in the morning before the crowds to avoid a long wait for the rides. üé° Ferris wheel offers and excellent view of Santa Monica beach. Park is clean. Beach and water very clean. Mornings offer surf lessons.

Satan Monica pier is the end of Route 66. It even has a sign stating this. Parking is free and right beside the pier. Pier is a must see after seeing it in so many movies. Lots of little shops and souvenir shops. A few restaurants as well. Make sure you eat at bubba gumps. Food and service is awesome. Take a ride on the Ferris wheel and roller coaster. Then walk down to the beach and dip your feet in the ocean
Lovely place to go and enjoy the viewing even the activities which go around there. Taste also a hot dog from Japadog, there are gorgeous!

I love that there is so much to see and do on Santa Monica pier, unlike most beach city piers! From people watching to riding the Ferris wheel! Anyone of all ages will have a good time. Dog friendly too! Great history behind the pier too!

Easy access, very busy. Fairground and restaurants galore.light shows on the ferris wheel give brilliant backdrops in the evening. The access ramp gets busy at sunset, with everyone trying for the perfect sunset photo.

Enjoyed the pier, good souvenirs on offer, little funfair park, can fish off of the pier also! There is a bait shop too and restaurants! Entertainment and some questionable entertainment also! But all round a good pier!

This is one of the ‚Äòmust do‚Äô list. Standing at the end of Route 66 is pretty cool. The pier is definitely worth a walk along but I‚Äôd choose your time quite carefully as it can get really busy. I walked all the way to the end to listen to a busker with a beautiful voice and watch the fishermen. Lovely time spent there.

column2: This Is The End Of The Road
column3: Probably the best known highway in all of America is U.S. Route 66; also known as the "Will Rogers Highway" or the "Main Street of America". One of the older portions of the U.S. Highway System, US Route 66 was established on November 11, 1926. Originally starting from Chicago, Route 66 headed West before ending at the Santa Monica Pier.From it's original purpose of bringing sewer pipes out to the ocean, the structure has evolved into one of the most visited "Amusement Piers" still left in the US. It has also been the background for around 30 movies, 60 TV shows and 25 music videos.A leisurely stroll out onto the pier is a great experience. There are full service restaurants, bars, fast food and wandering vendors. Souvenir shops abound as well as a number of Santa Monica oriented craft kiosks. That arcade has over 200 games to spend your money on and you can ride on the only solar-powered Ferris wheel in the area. And then there is the Looff Hippodrome Carousel; built in 1916.From the pier there are beautiful views of the ocean and the beach. If you have the time, go swimming with the hundreds of other people enjoying the waves and the sun. My only caution is to stay hydrated and use a high quality sun screen. The sun can be very harsh when you are on the pier.This is a pleasant way to spend a family day so don't miss it.
I would have the say that this is one of the most iconic piers in the world!It's big, has shopping, dinning, and rides! It's a must see when in Los Angeles.

I really enjoyed walking down Santa Monica pier. There are plenty of interesting things to look at, a great view of the beach and the ocean, and it's a great place to watch the sunset. Not to mention 14 Pok√©stops - nearly all of them with lures.
Love Santa Monica Pier! It's nowhere near as big as I thought it would be - the atmosphere and location makes up for it!

column2: Fun way to spend an evening in LA
column3: Nice way to spend an evening walking around the Pier and the Third Street Promenade. Great people watching and lots of good restaurants and shopping.

This is a fun stop to make. Parking on the pier is $3 hr or park across the street for cheaper rate. The are venders, artists, musicians, people fishing, arcade, restaurants and Pacific Park. We rode the Ferris wheel to take in the views for $8 a piece. Lots of photo ops plus you can go to the beach. It's fun and it's a tourist trap but well worth it.

This is a great place, looks beautiful from afar. However once you venture down closer to the pier you begin to discover the real thing. Very dirty, there were people fighting and it was so sad to see so many people looking through the bins for food. Not a lot going on either, but has potential to be good!

column2: Good place to spend an evening
column3: It's a good place to spend an evening of you are near to Santa Monica. The lights and friendly traders are really good and the fresh air from the beach is also refreshing
This makes a nice way to spend an afternoon. Good parking available below the pier. Plenty of food options on the pier as well as inland. It's a little piece of old fashioned history.

column2: Cool area, and a fun stop for a few hours
column3: Between restaurants, activities and the view - a fun stop for a few hours. You will empty your wallet on the rides (don't miss the ferris wheel - breathtaking view of both land and sea); good seafood options (though not cheap).

We had to do the pier as that's where the Route 66 finishes. The pier is quite like any other pier but we did have some excellent seafood in the restaurant which was no that expensive. We had fun watching the fishermen but the steep slope back up to the road was a killer on the legs. Worth a visit if only to say you've been.

Dont expect thrillpark excitement at this boardwalk although it is fun. There is great people watching with the ocean waves right there crashing on the pier posts. The food was really good here but a little expensive. They also have carnival style games which were alot of fun but again a little expensive.
We visited and enjoyed it as a land mark ... Parking was $15 so if you're pippin for a quick look , find somewhere else to park.Some girl had her bag robbed at knife point so be careful !

When in Santa Monica, this is one things you must do.We loved the view of the ocean during sunset time.Maybe there were too many people for my taste, but I liked the experience anyways.Bring a jacket if weather is fresh because the wind over there is quite strong.

You can go on some sketchy looking rides (if you dare), get your name drawn on a piece of sand, and go to Bubba Gump Shrimp Co if that's your thing. We just took a leisurely walk to the end, looked at the Pacific...then walked back.

The Iconic Santa Monica Pier did not disappoint day or night. There is plenty of tourists shops, buskers and food to entertain all. We sat on the bench and watched the Fisherman, strolled the carnival and photographed the Legendary Merry Go RoundSanta Monica Pier is a place to visit day and night. The ambience changes with the different times.
We went to the Santa Monica Pier! We had a great time! A lot of interesting people! It was so interesting to meet up with different cultures!

column2: Must do if you are in L.A.
column3: Came down in the afternoon and the Santa Monica pier was well worth exploring, both on it and under it. Great people watching, a small fun fair and some novelty shops but the main thing for us was being near the water.If you like photography then this is a great place for sunsets. Get your spot early though as there were about 20 of us all under the pier getting the seating sun through the pylons of the pier (was still worth it, got some great photos)

Well you just have to go!A real eclectic mix of people. I could happily give it a miss but when in Santa Monica you have to have a look at the wheel and fitness fanatics. Plus side we saw some seals off the pier.

column2: It's a must-see part of any trip to Santa Monica
column3: Honky-Tonk on the water. Delivers the experience you expect. Happy crowds strolling a packed pier with neon lights, carnival rides and the usual boardwalk fare. It's a short walk down and back; you'll enjoy it!

The pier is a great place to find a little entertainment, shop and get a bite to eat. There is something for everyone here. Take a walk under the pier to discover the hidden boat. Be sure to stick around for the sunset.

column2: Fun filled area with great shopping
column3: I would recommend allocating at least half a day here, starting from Santa Monica pier. Shop at the various gift shops along the pier, play modern arcade games and old school carnival games, walk along the vast beaches, and try some churros along the pier.After which, head to the shopping area nearby with Nordstrom and plenty of chain stores around. Found a games shop with cool puzzles and games! There's also couple of good bars and restaurants in the area.Also this is the best area in LA to catch a lot of Pok√©mons if you play it as the lures are perpetually active.
Loved the view and had a great time here. Parking was fair and lots to do. Worth the visit to the end of Route 66.

This is definitely a must see if you are in LA - beautiful beach and fabulous Pier.Lots of street entertainment on walking to the pier and we were there at dusk on a Friday. We had a Pier burger and homemade lemonade which was tasty and for two of us it was about $20.Magic sunset and plenty of activities to do but mostly great photos to take home or post on Facebook !

My family walked over from a nearby hotel for the afternoon. The pier has a certain shady element that exists. There are also tons of homeless that frequent the place. It is just something that one needs to be aware of. I would go back, but one needs to be very aware of their surroundings.

column2: Popular pier attracts crowds ... so come early and leave quickly
column3: Featured in many movies, this place certainly attracts the crowds. But it is really a place that is worth a quick look, and move on. In the summer and on weekends, this place can become quite oppressive with everybody jostling with each other for room. And parking in the area is very expensive as The Peoples Republic of Santa Monica becomes more and more anti-vehicle. My recommendation is to visit this place at 8 am and move on quickly. You can say that you have been there but beyond that does not amount to much. It is not a particularly beautiful pier, just a busy one with a history.
Ok to visit, but not a must see. Lots of "street" performers, homeless sleeping on beach. Cleaner than Venice though.

We had a very nice time down at the pier. It was a lovely warm afternoon for a stroll down to the ferries wheel and got our selfs a shake all in all it was a very cool place to spend the arvo. But it was a Monday afternoon and it was still busy so if you are thinking of going on a weekend it will be packed. So maybe plan your trip down there.

column2: Great View from the Ferris Wheel
column3: Lovely old fashioned pier with lots to see and doThe view from the top of the Ferris Wheel is brilliant - and it is not very expensive at all.

column2: Classic Pier that is well worth the visit
column3: Santa Monica Pier is one of the classic piers found along the Western Coast of the USA and one of the key attractions of Los Angeles. Whilst it is a bit of a tourist trap, it is still a fun visit and it brings a sense of nostalgia with regards to what the piers must have been like at the peak of the 1920s. Two of my children (aged 6 and 8) loved riding the Merry-go-round which can be found in an original rotunda at the end of the pier. Well worth the visit.

Went here for an evening stroll. There were some restaurants and a small amusement center. Walked to the mall which was also nothing much. A lot of Pokemon can be captured here though, if you are into that. If you have other plans, you can skip this one. I can imagine it would have been a lot better in the afternoon though.

column2: One to tick of the list!
column3: It's a tourist trap-tacky stalls / over priced restuarantsIt is a great place to see the sunsetBut santa monica is full of amazing places
If you want to feel young again make sure to stop by and spend some time here. A few old rides, decent food and a great view. Also, Malibu up the road a few miles. Beach is enormous

column2: Touristy but still a must if in Santa Monica/L.A.
column3: Touristy but still a must if in Santa Monica/L.A. A lot of tourists even though it was a cloudy day with a heavy marine layer when I went ... but it would be cool if you brought kids because of all the cool rides and attractions there!!
The buildings/facilities are showing signs of wear and tear. The place could use a little cleaning and sprucing up. Great people watching.
we loved santa monica pier, after lay down under the sun there are many food places to eat or drink at pier.

Definitely a must do if in the area, it is super filmed location, so it is cool to walk through it in person. It is a great way to spend hours with the family with the rides, arcade and aquarium.Best part that we enjoyed about the Pier was seeing it from Venice beach at night, it is all lit up and a great light show to watch at night!

Had a great evening here and watched the sunset. The pier is quite kitch but you know that before you go. The theme park is very brightly lit. We went to dinner after a walk on the pier and had a great time afterwards with a night swim in the surf.

column2: One of the best places for tourist
column3: I love Santa Monica Pier. It's beautiful and clean. It's very busy but has shops, restaurants and of course a gorgeous beach. As with any busy city or beach there are vagrants but not bad considering other beaches in LA.

This is a great diversion from shopping and worth a look. A bit of family fun as the sun goes down while you wait for your reservation at The Lobster.Do wear flat shoes and take a wrap - even in summer it gets cold and the wooden floor is very uneven with lots of rivets.

column2: One to tick off my bucket list
column3: We visited here as part of our honeymoon roadtrip - we had an LA Go Card, where the all day unlimited pass was included. We only used it for a couple of rides (big wheel and rollercoaster), but it was great fun.
Restaurants on pier are good, views are good, sea life watching is good. We ate breakfast at Bubba gumps, it was good good, good value and super friendly service.

A must do part of any trip to LA. Easy to get to I recommend parking in the beach car park $12 fixed price.Plenty of entertainment on the pier and a great place to watch the sun go down.Every time I go there there are people fishing but I have never seen anyone catch a fish!!
A pleasant way to spend a fall afternoon and watch the sun set over the ocean. Lots of people but everyone was "well behaved" and just having fun!
If it's clean beaches with a pier for food and attractions then this is the place to go. Also some decent eateries
Fantastic atmosphere, only a breif visit however very enjoyable, kids loved it, has a little bit of everything for all of us.

column2: Iconic spot with a seal visit
column3: Takes a bit of time to get there but it's a beautiful place. I don't get the impression too any locals visit but the attractions are good. We were even fortunate enough to have a seal swim along side us at the pier!

The parking was terrible! Period! They block 90% of it off for residents past 6pm. You then have to pay $20 even at night. Once we up on the pier it was good to walk around and check it out. The crowd was ok at night and was pretty. I would not come back myself and waste my time for the cost of the area. Good for once in a lifetime or to bring the kids once.
Great place to spend time with your friends and family! Nice place to swim, eat, do sport, etc. Very clean, especially in the comparison with the next beach, the Venetian.

A fun place. Many buskers and street performers and most were actually very good. A few little rides and games around mostly for kids. We arrived late afternoon into sunset and stayed for dinner. Its got a laid back atmosphere. Many people were fishing off the pier. After walking the pier we walked down to the beach. The promenade with shops and restaurants is close by the top of the street and was good to add onto the visit. Worth a trip its good for all ages.
You can spend a whole day at pier. We had lunch in buba gamp. Ny kids like the rides. The small shop was lovely. We ate our ice cream near the beach and watched the sun rise.

Amazing views of the beach & lots of different things to do & see on the pier. It was very busy time of the year, so lots of people & very busy. Great day out. Loved walking around the pier. Great place for families & kids.

It totally felt like I was at a Fair. The Pier itself if hustling with life. There are restaurants, cafe's and you can fish if you'd like. If you like to people watch this is the place, get yourself a high vantage point and look away. So far on all my visits this place has always been crowded. Maybe on a Monday you can find it to be less crowded but not always. It is an awesome destination if you are playing hookie from work. You can get here by car, which will take you about an hour +. Or you can take the Metro transit system, the 704, the 4 or the Metro Exposition line which will drop you off like 3 blocks from the pier.

I personally went there because I was doing route 66 and the end is in the pier. However when there we go to eat usually at Bubba Gum( cant go wrong ) but I mean the pier itself is amazing where else can you find such a pier!

column2: A must see sight but should open later!!
column3: We loved spending our evenings on the pier when in Santa Monica - there are always street entertainers around, the sunsets are beautiful over the ocean and the restaurants are good. However, everything closes so early!! We were hoping to grab some churros or an ice cream but everything shut around 5ish every night (it may have been out of season but there were tonnes of people about) - same for the rides too. It was a day time only activity really...

column2: LOTS OF THINGS TO LOOK AT & SEE!!!!!
column3: There is so much going on at this Pier live music of all kinds something for every one people being funny & doing tricks, A guy feeding the birds, rides games and of cores the beach .....This was on my bucket list and it didn't let me down at all I would strongly recommend it to anyone.

really was a let down, I was expecting so much more but found the area very seedy and trashy and a lot of homeless. Weather wasn't great when we visited so probably didn't help us enjoy, but even with perfect weather I woukdn't visit again.

It's beautiful and has lovely views but there isn't a lot here. The buskers are entertaining and the souvineers are cheap and very cool. We probably spent less than an hour here but we didn't swim or go to the theme park. I only saw one homeless person unlike many of the other reviewers on here.

Just a really cool place to check out in LA. It's really a throwback kinda place with the old wooden boardwalk extending out over the water. It's is very touristy and probably expensive to eat or drink anything, but I did see a few reasonable snack options. You can get great views and pics here, and ride a small roller coaster.

column2: The Carousel Alone is Worth the Visit
column3: The Pier is fun. Unless you love arcade games and amusement park rides you do not need to spend more than 90 minutes here. Great for people watching. And then there's the carousel. All hand made and fully restored, no two animals quite the same. There is an old-fashioned ice cream parlor in the carousel building ( with new-fashioned prices).

column2: It's a wonderful piece of America
column3: What can you say it's a piece of history and an American icon. Still had charm and quirkiness in.abundance . But at night it comes alive and sparkles. Awesome and not to be missed as it still has that old cheesy smaltz

column2: A must see when in LA
column3: Pier full of things to do. Offers amazing views of the City from the water and the visible Smog over the City. If you can, rent bikes and ride along the beach!

Los √Ångeles is not a beautifull city , but this is an interesting historical pier and surroundings where its supposed to be the end of Route 66.In general I cant understand how American cities have soooo many homeless people everywhere affecting all ages . It's sad

My son and I had the most wonderful time seeing the most beautiful sunset ever. the people we met there were so friendly the food was great and the ocean was awesome. seeing kids so happy enjoying themselves in the water and sand was priceless .We walked and laughed and took so many priceless pictures to share with our friends and family. Love seeing all the local talent show their God given talent at the pier. for sure going as many times as we can while visiting Los Angeles in the future.
Wouldn't fancy taking young children along here at night. Lots of homeless and junkies but during the day it's a lovely place
Very nice place to visit with friends and family at anytime of the day but the views at night are wonderful.
The sand is nice. The ocean is beautiful. The place has a feel of a tourist trap. There is a lot of garbage around. Homeless people are sleeping everywhere.

Let's be honest, it's a tourist trap. We love it anyway, but that's what it is. The only locals are the fishermen, buskers, and homeless. Prices are inflated, it's very crowded, and it's got kind of a county fair feeling to it, but we still go. We go because it's famous, and we as tourists like seeing famous places. I've visited several times in the past, and I'll continue to visit in the future, because it is what it is, and I like it. The views of the beach are outstanding, and it's a great way to spend maybe an hour or so just walking along and checking things out. Unless you're planning to go swimming or bask in the sun on the beach, and hour or two is all you really need. There is also the Third Street Promenade and a fairly new shopping mall right nearby, so there's plenty more to do if you're trying to fill part of a day and make the drive to Santa Monica worthwhile. There's a Bubba Gump restaurant right on the pier that will charge you tourist prices, but if you get a table next to a window, it's a great spot to take a break from the sun while still soaking in the surrounding views.

I am sure this place must be awesome on sunny days but my visit wasn't that great since the whole area was covered in dense fog. However, it wasn't very cold and one could easily take a quick dip in the waters. The whole place is very lively with different street performers, artists, eateries, and rides for the kids that has made it a popular place. Nevertheless, I would love to visit Santa Monica Pier on my every visit to LA.
Rides cater more to extremely small children. Parking around was affordable and somewhat abundant. Worth seeing
Fun walk and view!! Many street entertainers along the way and many fun food stands as well as rides and an aquarium.

Took a day trip that included a stop at the Santa Monica Pier. Was very neat to see in person, lots of little gift and snack places. Didn't ride any rides. Beach was clean we went right up to the ocean.
I was a bit disappointed by what was on the pier. There were souvenir stores, food and an amusement park. Having been to Brighton pier I was expecting it to be alot bigger.

The pier is a must do for your first time in Santa Monica. The atmosphere is great and it feels like a vacation. You have few choices for food, great margaritas at the end of the pier and can have a little fun on the short rides.

This is one of those stops that I feel everyone should see and, experience. It was beautiful and had a special charm about it. It's not overly crowded on weekdays but with the lack of seating, you'll be better off bringing a blanket and eating on the beach.The biggest off put about the pier was the prices. While I get that it's a tourist area where they are looking to make a buck; paying $9 for a small keychain or $30+ for a cheaply made Tshirt seems like a bit much.One thing I recommend doing is the Ferris wheel. It's nice and slow, so you can enjoy the ride and view. It's absolutely beautiful as the sun is setting. It's $8 a person (as of 9/26/16) which is reasonable. I recommend getting the wristband and going on the other rides as well. After 3 rides, it pays for itself.

I love the Santa Monica Pier. I love looking at it from my balcony at the Loews Hotel, and it is a great backdrop for photos - especially sunset photographs. The Pier itself is fun to stroll along -with the sign that starts Route 66, the iconic Ferris wheel, lots of souvenir shops and places to eat. It is also lovely to look back at the coastline from the end of the Pier. It doesn't take long though to complete your visit, so bring your swimmers and have a dip in the ocean, or walk up Colorado Blvde and shop along the 3rd Street Promenade.

column2: A great place to see and be seen.
column3: Shops and restaurants with plenty of things to buy. Live music, people watching and the end of the famous Route 66 is the Santa Monica Pier.

The pier offers something for everyone: food, fishing, people watching, ice cream and cotton candy, shopping, rides and a beautiful carrousel. Make this your destination then go to the beach or walk or bike the pavement below. Watch sand volleyball, stop at a cafe for a drink or take a walk to the 3rd Street Promenade or mall for shopping.

This is touristy and fun for a day. The pokemon hunting is beyond awesome in you have kids and want them thoroughly engaged. The views and vibe are totally cool so its a must when visiting or if you are local and need a partial day activity go. Make sure to park a few blocks away. Easier to escape and who doesn't need some exercise.

column2: Cheesy, but maybe that's what you want?
column3: I liked being several hundred feet out into the bay, but everything else about the pier was a tourist trap crossed with a state fair. It seemed to attract tourist & people aiming to make a quick buck because it it attracts people.
Be prepared for crowds. Expensive parking. Carnival type atmosphere with rides, food vendors, loud music, craft artists. Good to see ONCE.

Lots to see and do along the pier.....Clean and family friendly atmosphere. We enjoyed a few rides and some fast food before wandering down to the beach.A beautiful stretch of the coastline and a great place to unwind and relax. All in all a pleasant few hours before we headed off up the coast.

column2: Historic fun walk on the pier
column3: We enjoyed this spot, especially the street performers. We saw some excellent singers on a Friday evening. Very very busy - might be better on week night. Beautiful ocean air, fun rides for kids. Not too many food choices here.

We might feel differently if we had small children who might enjoy the rides and the cheap junk, but to us, it was sort of a waste of time. I'm sure decades ago this was a big deal and we came because of its iconic reputation. But we walked down, turned around and walked back up.
Santa Monica pier is a must do. Its a real lively place with great sunsets on clear days. Various restaurants and food places to dine or eat on the go.

This is our 5 th visit to Santa Monica pier , we just love it and the atmosphere. We walked out and back and enjoyed the views and the stalls . Had a drink as was so warm today . Love it and it's a must if you are in Santa Monica, plus we have just driven Route 66 so we got a certificate from the man who had the kiosk on the pier to say we had completed the drive .

column2: A must see stop along the Pacific Highway
column3: A great beach with a pier that extends forever. Lots of shops and amusements. Don't miss the merry-go-round, one of the main attractions.
Pretty beach. Lots of superficial people showing their bodies. Great for a good perve. Great for summer beach side holiday.

Our first time here. Found it to be a fun and vibrant tourist area with many restaurants, souvenir shops, rides, a lot of surfers to watch, people fishing and a beautiful sunset with the mountains in the background. It was packed with people, so great people watching area. So many playing Pokemon Go! You have to stop here when in the area. Large parking garage not too far away. Loved the atmosphere.
Day or night this location provides everything and more for all. The roller coaster is our family favorite!!

The story behind the pier is evident if you hunt it out, maybe the local owners/council authority could make more of this? The pier is also the end/beginning of the historic Rout 66 ( depending on where you tart the trip).Sunset views from the right side of the pier are fabulous. I was surprised that there was not more places to eat or sit outside, maybe this could be addressed?A great location for a few hours of semi peace and tranquility, that's if your not disturbed by the throng of people.

Always overcrowded with tourists,vendors and some unsavory characters it's still an iconic sight in Santa Monica that should be visited at least once for the very least a stroll and some pictures. The Palisades park overlooking the Pacific ocean along Ocean blvd offers nice views of the pier so it can be admired from afar if you don't want to deal with the crowds but I do recommend seeing some of the amusement park,it's old time carousel and Ferris wheel are always popular.

A visit to Santa Monica is a must for a break from the hustle & bustle of LA. There is a beautiful big clean beach that's great for families with the permanent beach guards. You can stroll down the pier comfortably with it's fun fair rollercoaster and big wheel so iconic. There is plenty of parking and clean restrooms.

This may be just like any seaside pier, but it's worth a visit if you are in the area. It's got your usual pier rides like a rollercoaster, things to eat like frozen custard, and a few restaurants - even a Bubba Gumps. You can stay and have some fun, or just have a leisurely stroll around the pier. Of course, there's also the lovely sandy beaches. Parking is a bit steep at $3 an hour or $12 flat, depending on where you park. However, it's only a short walk to downtown Santa Monica, where there is some great shopping. If the sun is shining, this will all seem even more worth it.
Dirty , too many people , and lots off shady people hanging around, the homeless were everywhere and it's really in your face , we were gutted
Have been on many tours but this one is unbelievable. An amusement park, restaurants, vendors and if course people watching. Must do if in the area.

Having a really nice Navy Pier in Chicago I fell in love with Santa Monica Pier the first time we visited a few years ago. The place is so cool and has so much to offer, awesome beach, attractions, restaurants and of course the Pacific Ocean and the views (especially at night time). Most importantly for me of course was the fact that it's the very end of Route 66 that actually starts in Chicago!TIP: Definitely a must stop for Route 66 fans!

Great place to hang out and people watch. We went in the evening and the place was jammed, rockin' with huckster activities.There is a seedy quality so use common sense and you will be fine. Ferris wheel, rides and other stuff like souvenirs and a restaurant at the end of the pier.

The Santa Monica pier is enjoyable to visit. I havent been to the area for over 20 years after moving north years ago. My has it changed. These days it is a very busy tourist stop, as compared to years ago when it was a local hangout for surfers.

I didn't know what to expect when coming here, but it exceeded expectations. This place is absolutely beautiful. To see the mountains and the ocean coming together is a sight to be seen.Would recommend everyone come here on their L.A. tour.

column2: Lot of fun but nothing unique
column3: A popular and essential experience when in Santa Monica. Quite fun, but nothing particularly unique. There are many rides available, we can recommend the big wheel, which offers great views along the beach. There's a limited number of food options, with Bubba Gump's being the main restaurant. We enjoyed the Cookie Monster ice cream - but be aware of the after-effect of that much blue food dye! Really nice atmosphere along the pier. There is a large car park just beside the pier, but wheelchair access is slightly tricky, requiring using Bubba Gump's elevator.

column2: The best place to have fun by the beach
column3: so many attractions and shops to see and right next to Venice beach fun for the entire family you would come back for more then just one visit it is the end of route 66 as well.

Apparently it is difficult to think that an open place like this may become so packed. But at twilight, everybody flock in droves to this sort of iconic place in Santa Monica. It bursts at the seams. It isn't worth to bear such a "swarm of tourists", from my point of view.
Fun atmospere in a fancy city, why wouldn't you check it out!Tom Hanks had his fortune told by the same swammy I did.

Great place to go, beginning of Route 66, not to much to do here unless you have children as there is a lot of small rides for them. Bubba gumps is a must do quite pricey though but hey it's a must do, buy a cocktail and keep the glass, good souvenir and there are a few shops along pier as well.

column2: First stop from las vegas, nevada trip
column3: One of the tour offered in Las Vegas is a trip to Los Angeles California. The first stop on the Santa Monica Pier. this trip I did with my wife in a rented car. It is a place visited a day like Saturday. We arrived about 11:00 am and was packed. for parking chose the side of the pier. and on the pier you see many shows offered on the site. a familiar and relaxing atmosphere. time passes quickly in the pier. very good option to visit
At the end of a 40 minute Metro ride it was a bit of a disappointment to be honest. I was expecting the pier to be a bit old school and charming, it wasn't, it was crowded and tacky.
It looked like it might have been a fun spot for a family with young children, but not much to interest teens.
It is small but beautiful! there are some restaurants and the view for the sea is nice! You can see some sea lions swimming :)
Spent a hour here filling in some time. Something completely different to what I am used to and I got to try my first funnel cake. Good family location.
I really enjoyed it alot, there is nice shops for souvenirs and food. I also loved the park and the rides.

column2: Gotta go where the people flow.....
column3: I haven't been to the pier in years and I had some guests that I thought would enjoy the scene. We had a great time on the pier, some food, a roller-coaster, the beach, the water, the people! Just check it out, if you are in the area.

Visited the beach and the pier on a Sunday afternoon and the place was buzzing!!There are no end of street shows, gift stalls, food stalls and restaurants like bubba gumps. There is also the fairground which is aimed at younger children plus things like trapeze lessons.This is the end of Route 66 too! Place is well worth a visit if in Santa Monica or/and LA!

This is a busy place with an interesting mix of people, styles, ethnicities, foods and activities. It was crowded but orderly. We found we were among the oldest folks, and the least represented age group. We did ride the roller coaster, which I haven't done in years but did so to accompany our visitor.Having walked the pier and took a ride, I have no desire to return.

This is the biggest pier I've seen so far and its like a little village. Many shops, restaurants, rollercoaster, ferris wheel, carpark and lots of walking area sorrounded by water. Its something you don't see in other countries.

column2: Good for the first time visitors
column3: It's definitely a must when visiting L.A. for the first time, but very touristy and crowded. We spent 1-2 hrs there, took some nice photos then moved on to more genuine places.

It's a pier, it has all the generic pier amusements and some random people doing some random stuff which people actually stop to watch - this does go over my head! The beach is beautiful - just unfortunate we caught it on a hazy day.
The view was to die for. The pier was filthy as far as animals, bugs, and waste. I enjoyed the beachside away from the pier.
We had a great time. This place was awesome. My honey had a great time in the water. We had great food at pier burger spot. Great entertaining on the pier. Please visit...

column2: Old time pier complete with beach, rides, arcades, hot dogs, fishermen, the smells, and the Pacific Ocean
column3: Bring cash for a necessary $12 parking fee at the Santa Monica Pier. You kind of get dumped into line as you head for the beach/pier signs and there's no escape. They want $12 flat in cash to park in the sun. But, it IS next to an expansive, beautiful beach with mountains in the background, and it only a few steps up to the Pier itself and all that it entails. If you need a bathroom, try to wait until you are up on the Pier rather than the kind of sketchy ones on ground level next to the parking lot. Things have not been remodeled in a good while, generally speaking, but I think the point is to preserve that era - The Pier was founded in 1975 and it is a throwback to that time still. It has an air of 'hippie' about it and the boardwalk itself is very uneven and bumpy. Be careful, don't be put off but a person could easily trip if you are looking all around and not paying attention to the curbs and bumps on the boardwalk. There are shops, food stands, a Taco Bell, a fine Albright Seafood Restaurant and ever fun, Bubba Gump restaurant which houses a sort of movie Forest Gump memorabilia museum display all over the premises. Go for a stroll, a drink, the people watching, the fresh air and gorgeous view.
A nice pier but just a tourist pit stop. We had a wander about and then left to explore more of Santa Monica.

The Santa Monica Pier is nothing special. It is neat to see at a distance at night because of the unique lighting of the Ferris wheel and roller coaster. During the day it's just another very crowded place with lots of junk food, over-priced souvenirs, street performers, etc. I wouldn't recommend making an effort to visit the pier.

Everything about the pier is amazing - the food smells amazing, there are street performers and artists everywhere (one has the cutest boxer, I fell head over heels in love with her!), good food and phenomenal sunset views! Saw a Sea Lion swimming away, played a couple of video games at the arcade and spent hours just people watching and enjoying the place.

column2: It's a pier, with Tourists and Touristy things on it...
column3: That's it really, if you want candy floss, Ferris Wheels and to be pushed and shoved around , go for it..you better off heading up the beach to Venice..
Beautiful! Busy! Lovely place to visit with family that includes children. We took a stroll on the pier and dined at Bubba Gump. Pricey however oh so delicious. Spent an entire day in the area.

column2: Sunset was great, that's about it
column3: The sunset was brilliant over the beach and the photo's looked great but that was the highlight. The homeless unfortunately flock here of a night and they are on your entry down to the pier, on the pier and at the end of the pier. Some of the buskers have talent, others have none. The whole place after the sunsets has a strange edgy vibe to it and then the gangs come out. No police in sight either. Come for sunset but then leave. I have been to some very dicey places in the world and felt perfectly safe, i didn't have that here after dark.

Girls night out. Went on week-end. The area was alive with restaurants, beach goers, tourists and locals alike. The walk down the pier was short/ you can look at the beach as you stroll along -there is a large Ferris wheel and carnival rides on the pier. As you walk to the end you will see fast foods, sit down restaurants, gift shops and locals singing,dancing and playing instruments. You reach the end of the pier and visit a lifesaving museum. There is also a Mexican restaurant with outside seating...yup. We sat outside and had a refreshing drink.. A must see

We went in the evening and went on the ferris wheel. It is solar powered, which is very cool, and the ride is pretty long. After a hot day it was very cool, and gave a great over view of the city. The pier is hopping, there are lots of rides and people selling things. Really nice.

To mark the end of our journey across Route 66, from Chicago we made it to the pier! The end of the Route 66 sign was there, and we got our certificate from the Route 66 stand of the nice chap who works and is an ambassador for the Route.We want on a couple of the rides which was good and not too badly priced.Couple of entertaining acts along the pier, but have to say I recognised the place a bit after googling it turned out its the pier used for GTA! Very impressive rockstar!

column2: Best pier along the LA area
column3: A busy and bussling pier with a lots to do and see. Close to downtown LA and the traffic can be a nightmare...however never fails to impress.Great for all and of all ages....midweek visits are recommended.
We went there just to walk the pier and see what it was about. The aquarium was closed and had weird hours and the pier was smelly as well as the beach. I wasn't impressed and I was kinda bummed.

column2: Took the walk because we were there..Not what I expected!
column3: We visited at night and it was very crowded. Keep your valuables protected as it is a mix of street performers, tourists and the homeless.

It's kind of commercialize Pier at Santa Monica with lots of people, entertainment and foods. The pier itself had the charm with street performers and artists but the crowd made it kind of not easy to move about and not good for photographer like me.

This is a pier and a half. it gives you everything most imported bottles of water when its very hot. Stalls, rides , a big wheel ,people fishing , views of the beach for miles both sides. its one of the best piers I have ever visited.

We were there on a weekend. It felt like the entire state had descended on the pier. Here is what we learnt. Get there early, reserve your parking and grab a decent spot on the beach. Plan good or lunch else it's hours of waiting. Walk the pier it's got great performances. We in particular like the lady that did name paintings

This is a great place to come and collect pokemon! Lots of pokestops all with lures going all the time. It was also fun people watch, listening to the musicians and watching the dancers. There is an amusement park which is great if you have kids. The pier is a bit tacky, but still fun to check out.

column2: Great pier with plenty to do
column3: This pier was beautiful with plenty to do and great views across the beaches. It is a tourist trap so expect to be ripped off with prices, but certainly worth a visit. Parking is pretty cheap at $12 for the day next to the pier. We had already paid $20 to park on Sears though.

column2: Spend the day at the beach...
column3: And don't miss the amusement park! It hosts a couple of iconic landmarks, the beach is great (wide, good sand and clean) and the Pacific is so nice to swim in. Enjoy!

Was visiting my family in the area and we all decided to go and visit the SantaMonica Pier as we had heard so much about it.Well honestly the entire experience was pretty bad.. It took us 45 minutes to find parking.. Then it was so crowded that we were worried about the safety of the smaller children.. The pier itself had all the charm with street performers and artists but the crowd made it impossible to enjoy it.I feel it would have been better to spend the time at home

column2: Happy birthday to me! A stroll on the pier made the day....
column3: When I lived in Santa Monica, the pier was kind of a dump. So was most of the downtown area. Look at it now! It was a beautiful day and I thoroughly enjoyed the stroll and people watching. One suggestion....standard pricing for water. A couple places charged $4 a bottle, other places $2, which is reasonable. If you stay anywhere in L.A., the pier is simple to reach by public transportation...and so iconic. There are games and rides and souvenirs that will cost you, but the view of the ocean and the shoreline is priceless. It was a great visit that made me wonder why I ever moved away.
The pier was clean. People watching was fun. The funnel cake was great. Overall just a good fun day at the pier.
Have been here several times over the years and as there is only amusement and crap food, I only strolled through the masses.

column2: Great for people watching and wandring
column3: Lovely walk to the end of the pier- apparently you can often see whales off the end where there's fishing. Surrounding areas are lovely too- the architecture is well worth a look.

The pier is tacky and has fairground rides crammed on to it. The beach is much better. There is free WiFi on the pier so just sit on the beach next to the pier of you want it.Pokemon Go is also amazing in this area. If you live here there is no excuse for not having amazing pokemon

column2: Pokemon Go has ruined this place!
column3: I know, you're probably thinking "what a strange title for a review". Well, this beach is so crammed full of people (even on weekdays outside of school holidays) and I know the reason is Pokemon Go.If you walk along the pier, you won't get very far due to the thousands of people there (most catching pokemon). If you walk along the beach, you will be greeted with cigarette butts and litter everywhere.This is such a tourist attraction, but I'd suggest you forget the hype. (Unless you're interested in catching pokemon, in which case Santa Monica is great for that). But if you're looking for a relaxing day at the beach, take a trip down to Manhatten, Hermosa or Redondo beach instead --- cleaner, safer and way less people.
We stayed at the Lowe's very close to the pier we had nice walks from the hotel to the Pier every daySome amazing musicians , we had a great lunch and the views are amazing
Always fun to send time on the pier . Restaurant is nice and food is very good . Great area to walk on the beach or rent a bike!
You have to visit this spot if you are touring in LA. One of the icons of LA. Spots to take some pictures, availability and f food around, souvenir shops, and of course the beach!
Went to be surprised; however same as east coast - still had a great time at Georgie's hotel for appetizers & Oysters :) clean beach & clean part of the city

We always enjoy walking the Pier.Beach is huge and always room here. The treat is walking or riding a bike to take it all in. Make sure you notice Shutters , it's like @ $500 a night so check it out, maybe for a drink.

column2: Fun spot to people watch and have a drink over the ocean
column3: We were staying close by and walked over here a couple times. There are several rides(we didn't do any) had a big arcade my son enjoyed. There was a free concert on Thur night-packed but fun. Very touristy but we were tourists so enjoyed going and having a drink and people watching.

The Santa Monica pier is one of our favorite places to visit! The Summer Concert series was just wrapping up and drew thousands of attendees. Well worth planning a visit to enjoy on Thursday nights. Get there early to stake out a spot on the beach to enjoy. The volume on the pier was a bit too much for a geezer like me but, the music was fantastic! The amusement park on the pier was very clean and well run. As we walked through I was thinking of how much fun my grandkids would have had there. Great visit and good times!

Had a blast on the pier. We love visiting image pier every year we go visit Cali. It so fun to people watch and to sit back and watch the waves. We ate at the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier and they had the best free chips and dip!
Many different sights and sounds on the pier, from the homeless to struggling musicians ( and some are really good). Many gift and food choices and a great view of the beach.

column2: First trip to site see in California
column3: The Pier is so busy there is barely room to walk. Lots of performers taking tips. Good view of The Pacific.

Go for the view of the ocean and because it was the western end of Route 66. Go for the Albright or even for Bubba Gump (God help you). But go early. On a bright SoCal morning when there are no crowds it's beautiful. Late in the day it's the third circle of hell because of the crowd.
The pier is great, lots going on. Loads of little stalls to look around as well as e fairground rides.Had funnel cake...omg was lovely. Could only manage one between two as so big.

Went along one afternoon to the pier and also walked along the beach from Santa Monica to Venice. The pier is alive with people, traders restaurants and of course the amusement Park. The vibe was friendly and the whole place seemed pretty relaxed. We had a great steak at Rusty's. The mountain backdrop to the beach is just beautiful.
It's all going on. Tons of folk all out perambulating. Lots of nice street sellers. Fishermen and courting couples at the end.

The Santa Monica Pier is busy all year round. It offers many restaurants and tourist shopping opportunities. You can go any time and hear a wonderful variety of languages from all over the world and see a celebrity or two.
This place is fun during the day time for people watching and rides, and then at night looks spectacular as everything lights up! A classic California experience!

column2: Great location to spend a day
column3: Santa Monica pier is definitely worth the drive. Parking is available directly on site. Even if it's a bit expensive with 12 dollars for a full day. The beach is clean and simply huge. I recommend coming during the week, as on the weekend it is overcrowded. The pier offers all kinds of restaurants and entertainment. The amusement park with its roller coasters offer an amazing view of the ocean and beach. If you get tired of the beach and the pier you can just walk up from the pier to Colorado street until you reach 3rd street on the left. There is a mall and a beautiful open air shopping district with a cinema.
Fun environment and lots of things to do. Great day at the beach. Games for the kids and lots of food choices so you can spend a few hours with the kids and never get bored.

It was pretty cool to see it in real life as it has been in so many movies.The pier itself is great for photos.The beach is BEAUTIFUL we even saw dolphinsWalk to Venice Beach and Muscle Beach get a ride back in a buggy.Be prepared for homeless people everywhere and lots of smell of pot.The slight wind can fool you into thinking that you aren't cooking in that sun, so bring sun block and lots of it.Super fun and awesome for photos

Santa Monica Pier is in a great location for spending time with friends. Everything is here, a fair, food stalls, game stalls, ocean views, the beach, fishing spots, and so much more. It wasn't too busy when I went but I can imagine in the peak of summer this place would be incredible. Definitely recommend to anyone around the area.

We enjoyed the day here with our two teens. They rode the rides, played games and ate loads of junk food. The pier is great for the views, people watching and watching the sun set. Most importantly, the cost for a family of four to spend the day at the pier was very fair. This is a must do if you are in the area.

column2: Nice to visit - hire a bike
column3: Early morning is quiet with a chilled at atmosphere- nice for a walk and a coffee - late pm is very busy but so beautiful for the sunset followed by a nice mealWe hired a tandem bike with the kids and rode to Venice beach - really nice day out

Santa Monica Pier is referred to by most as a must see attraction. Certainly it was enjoyable, however your enjoyment will likely be determined by what you are looking for. The Pier was sun-drenched during our wander and good for people watching. The Pier offers great views, but you must compete with the crowds. Food on offer was standard American fare, lots of deep fried goods and sugar, incredibly over priced and in our experience, the service was pretty appalling.The Pier also offer carnival style rides for kid so and the young at heart, but be prepared to pay!
I visited the pier a Saturday morning and it was a perfect weather and a beautiful day as well. I went on the attractions and walked along the sidewalk of the beach area.

We parked near Venice Beach after touring that area we strolled along the promenade / boardwalk to Santa Monica Pier. It's also the West Coast end of Route 66 and you have to get a picture at the sign. There are loads of shops, cafes and attractions here including a small coaster. trapeze and big wheel. The views up and down the coast and the beach look great too.
Definitely a plane to see when visiting SoCal ! We came early in the morning for a beautiful photo ops and also at night for the amazing energy. Great for family fun.

Been here so many times..its so refreshing, great views of the ocean, there's games and kids rides as well as adult rides..they have shows and people making art along side the pier..a couple of restaurants and shopping stores with great souvenirs.You will have fun with the whole family as well as by yourself...
If you get a hot day it's great! We got ice creams, got the full pass for the rides and went on them all and had an evening of being big kids. Watch the sunset at the bar nearby and relax.

column2: A small Carnival over the Ocean
column3: My experience here was average. It seemed to be bombarded with tourists, and everyone was literally playing Pokemon Go. Nevertheless, still a place you need to visit when in the area. There's a Ferris wheel, a roller coaster and some other rides. Along with an arcade, Merry-go-round, and other carnival attractions. There's a lot you can do here and still have access to the beach. Don't forget the carnival food!

Took the bus from Hollywood. The beach is very nice and clean. The board walk is great. The pier itself is full of restaurants so no need to go hungry. There were many people fishing however, we did not see anyone catch anything. There are many homeless people living here as in Hollywood, quite sad.

Such an iconic pier as it's the west coast end of Route 66. Lots of stores, cafes and attractions here. Fantastic views up and down the coast. Only a short walk to Muscle Beach too so make sure you stop by there too.
Went there on Sunday afternoon. It was very crowded, but we enjoyed the views , food and people watching. Also noted too many beggars there and it's quite annoying.
It is nice to walk around and see it if you are there anyway but compared to the movies and TV it looked a lot smaller than I had expected

Went to the Santa Monica pier after renting bicycles, it was probably about a 7 mile bike ride. If you love people watching and the beach scene the ride will come and go in a minute with all there is to see from Venice Beach. The rides are a OK, enjoy yourself have a little fun can be very expensive, but well worth your time.

Enjoy the entire experience of sand and surf, sun and amusement park rides. You can walk on the boardwalk to ride the carousel and/or visit the aquarium. There is an arcade and also plenty of food stands.

Wanted to just get away for a day.. So we decided a drive to Santa Monica pier would be a great place to walk along enjoy the sites, have a bite to eat and enjoy the fresh air.well worth the drive,the day was beautiful! The sites,the families,the couples, visiting the places that have made memories for us since our kids were small. Great place to visit.
We bought a couple of day passes which were perfect for letting the kids run riot. They loved the roller coaster and the ice cream!

column2: Tourist trap but everyone should go once
column3: Good for kids or anyone who is going to LA for the first time. Once you've been you'll notice it in dozens of movies and commercials. Very safe, lots of police around, a carnival year round. One time we saw every single Ms.America contestant there for a photo shoot, the spouse was not impressed but I took dozens of great photos anyhow!

column2: Go for the experience, then go spend your time somewhere else
column3: Often seen in movies and on t.v., this well-known pier is extremely busy. It is a vibrant area with interesting people and activities for everyone. People tend to keep to themselves, and that's fine, but a few people were extremely rude. (If you walk on the beach and go under the pier, many people under there are sketchy and trying to fool around in the sand with their partner. They seemed angry that so many people were walking by while they were trying to "get busy," and some of them made rude comments at passersby. I didn't like the vibe of this area) The friendliest people were the fellow Iowans we saw who had also attended the Rose Bowl Game, and several locals who stopped to comment or ask us questions about Iowa. It was very funny to hear their perceptions of middle America, and some of them told us we (Iowans) were entertaining to watch. I got a kick out of that! A half-day here was enough for us as it is busy, touristy (we don't mind touristy in small doses), and not enough to hold our interest for longer than four hours.

We have heard so much about the place and how much charming it is, but once we reached the Pier we have a difficult time to find a parking then once we got one and start walking toward the beach we surprised by how much the place was over crowded and many homeless, We did not feels comfortable and we decided to head back to our car.I will never go back to this place and will never recommend it to any one.
This is my second time I come here. It is very nice to walk out to the pier and see all the people and the sea. You have also lot of restaurants here.

The pier has a carnival like atmosphere with small stands for shopping. The food options are scarce and the Italian restaurant at the beginning of the pier is full of rude employees. Great for viewing the beach but find someplace else to eat.
Catched the hop on hop off bus out to the Santa Monica the beach was lovely loads to look at eat at an things to see only a small drive down to Venice beach with also is a great place to visit

It was my first visit to Santa Monica pier ,the music was every where ,the sun was warm and the air was fresh . I don't know if it is always or just my luck ,but every one was very friendly . There were many white birds around us.the place were like a dream .
Had a blast here!! Spent the day at the pier. Shopping, eating, and then a few hours at the beach. Rode the farris wheel and completly enjoyed it!

column2: Nice spot for an iconic photo!
column3: Went recently at night. Number one thing to note, it was much cooler in LA at night during Sept long weeknd than I had anticipated. It was quite cold that night when we went. Definitely needed pants and sweater.I would suggest parking at the mall and walking down. It's a short comfortable walk and easy to find parking at the mall.We went on a Friday night and it was super busy. We didn't mind it being packed since it was so cold. Having more people around made it a tiny bit warmer!The boardwalk is nice and there are touristy shops for snacks and souvenirs as you make your way down. There were some performers along the way down too, which created a nice ambiance.The iconic ferris wheel did not disappoint. I'm glad we went at night because it was nice seeing it lit up. It was a little tough getting a good photo of it at night, but we still enjoyed the view.I think if it was warmer we would've hung around much longer. The attractions seemed more geared towards families with small children (which we were not).Definitely a good stop to make. I think it'd be a great date spot for those looking for a romantic destination while visiting LA.

We visited the Pier on a Sunday - it was very busy with people and the Pier has character but is looking a little dated. The beach and restaurants are a far sight nicer than Venice Beach so if you have to choose for a family I'd pick Santa Monica

The Santa Monica Pier must be seen. Though parking can be quite hard (as can the hideous traffic in and out of Santa Monica for that matter), if you are new to Los Angeles it's something you really should see.The pier includes a small aquarium, a historic indoor merry-go-round, several restaurants and eateries, a place to learn or try trapeze and trampoline, and a decent amusement park with a magnificent, solar powered and spectacularly lit ferris wheel that offers amazing views up and down the California coastline and the town of Santa Monica and beyond.Best of all, the people watching is pretty amazing. Make sure you also leave the pier and walk south along the boardwalk to get a real feel for Santa Monica. You may even want to continue walking south to Venice and muscle beach, or, better yet, rent a single or tandem bicycle and explore the area via an excellent bike path you can ride, skate or a run on.The area self of the pier can be a little rough at times, so just be aware of your surroundings, but it's something you must see and enjoy.
Beach was nice. We went during may so the water a cold. However the weather was beautiful. We went on a bike ride and ate at a near by restaurant on the pier

We parked at a hotel parking lot due to the pier lot being full..wasnt too bad of a walk. A few homeless people but no one approached us. We bought some souvenirs for a pretty decent price but workers were rude and kept talking to one another instead of helping. wasnt too much to see but could have been due to us going on a friday morning aroung 11am.
What can I say, I love a Pier, its nice to see that fishing is allowed on this one, so many in the UK don't allow people to actually use them. Well done to the Pier operators.

column2: Great beach and place for a day
column3: We spent a day on the beach, walked around, had some cocktails. Great place to jang out, you can ride bikes, you can go on the rides, eat, drink, sit on the beach and dream!

Took the hour long metro ride from 7thand rented bikes from Meg just up the street from the pier. Couldn't have asked for a better way to spend the day. The musicians and artists could hold your interest for hours then add in the tourists and you realize one day isn't nearly enough. Skip the restaurant at the end though and travel down to Venice beach for plenty of food options.
California as I had pictured it beautiful beach beautiful Pier clean busy beautiful homes and condos surrounding the shore we go back again in a minute !
nothing much to do n see on the pier itself. children may like the amusement park there. but there are lots of outdoor u can do nearby. n it is a great Walk from santa monica pier to Venice beach.

I think it's a bit obvious saying that the pier is tacky. It's a great location if you have never been to SM before but if you frequently visit I don't know anyone who has gone here twice! Tick it off the bucket list & move on.

column2: Just to relax and watch people
column3: It was a sunny and windy September, lots of tourists and locals as well. Nice place to relax, watch and meet people. A nice place to shops for souvenirs if you're a tourist like me. There was one guy, he's musician, playing guitar at the pier, he was good. Overall I enjoyed my visit.

Santa Monica is a place I've always wanted to visit and I was not disappointed. The pier area is great, lots of restaurants and small shops selling things. It's clean and easy to walk up and down even when there are large crowds. The bars and restaurants around are great and be sure to checkout 3rd street, a pedestrianised street full of great shops.

column2: Went to Thursday free concert Great experince üåå
column3: A lot of people came out to enjoy the free concert, everyone had a nice evening great for family's. Rides were closed, unfortually I got there too late. The rides do remain lite.
Nice time walking the pier and buying gifts. The Merry-Go-Round is still there and there's also a roller coaster put up from time to time they also have live shows on stage. Plenty to see.

Went to spend the day on the beach from Las Vegas, always a lovely day here plenty to do and the pier if fantastic for all age groups. Plenty of places to eat, lots of gift shops and not forgetting the rides especially the big wheel, with fantastic views. What's not to enjoy.

column2: Great for a look on a warm day
column3: Great place to go for a walk and see everything thats happening, lots of food and things too do for the kids too.
We hired some bikes. This place is nicer than Venice beach and there are less druggies around and more uptown cafes at this end. However having said that there are a lot beggars around.
Fun, Sports, Gastronomy, Park, Shops and Restaurants - specially for the weekends. Best spot for sunset

column2: Everything you'd expect - a place that causes you to smile
column3: Street musicians, amusement rides, carnival games, restaurants, gift carts, tons of tourists. It's just a happy place - a party for your senses - and definitely worth a visit. My husband and I strolled the pier for about 90 minutes taking it all in. I remarked, "it's just like I imagined" - which is a good thing!

column2: Like any other pier, plus amusement rides
column3: We were in LA for three days & kept planning to go the the pier but our schedule was just so busy... The morning we left LA, we decided to stop by there in the early morning. Everything was closed, as they don't open rides until 11 or noon, forgot the exact time. My husband and son decided to do some Pokemon hunting, they were able to find a lot of them by the pier. You do have to pay for parking as well ($10-15) and the bathrooms by the pier are extremely disgusting and gross, not to mention, no baby changing station. It's really just like any other beach with a pier. At the very end of the pier, is an area for fishing. We watched people fish and even saw a seal swimming through. The beach itself was dirty, I've been to nicer beaches in Florida. There were tons of seagulls and trash laying around.

We found Santa Monica itself to be really busy and congested. It's hard to find parking for just an hour or so. The pier area is quite busy. There are many other piers in California that are much less congested and a bit easier to navigate. I think this one is probably good for a visit of several hours and one where you don't mind walking long distances to see everything.
It's definitely a tourist trap, but with good reason. It's a beautiful spot that offers ocean views, good food, and a ferris wheel.

This place is so beautiful both day and night. The pier stretches out into the water for great views of the surrounding coastline and at night the colourful lights from the amusement park, Pacific Park, are brilliant and stunning, especially the changing patterns of the solar-powered LED lights on the giant Ferris wheel. The pier is a good place for a casual stroll. There are restaurants, shops, an arcade, the amusement rides, talented street performers, and the marker for the end of Route 66. A trapeze school is located on the pier and we were lucky to see the students practicing outdoors.For Pokemon hunters, don't miss this attraction and fill up on Pokeballs before arriving. There are plenty of Pokestops, with perpetual lures and hundreds of fellow Pokemon hunters. Great for both water and rock types, and also rare Pokemon.
