The rides were fun. Exiting the parking lot is a nightmare. The park officials do nothing. It took 3 hours to exit the parking lot. Ridiculous!

I've always loved visiting the pier when in LA. It's a great spot to watch the sunset and is an all round fun place to be. Now there is Pokemon everywhere. This can be either annoying or awesome depending on whether you play Pokemon go or no.
Went on a Sunday afternoon. Absolutely mobbed with people to the point it was tough to move. $24 for three of us to ride the ferris wheel.

This is great for younger Children with these rides but its a pretty happening place for all ages. We went here on 3 separate days at different times and thoroughly enjoyed our time (our daughter was 5)

column2: Nice view on Santa Monica beach
column3: Crowded and very touristic place with some shops, restaurants and a few roller coasters. Nice view iver the beach though.
If you are hunting for Pokemon Go, this is the place to be. Its also great for kids of all ages and serious people watching.

I loved it here. Was such a great atmosphere with amazing range of food and drinks places and a lovely walk down to the edge. Great music to walk along to and even though it was very busy it was still enjoyable.

We enjoyed our walk out onto the pier. Had a great lunch at one of the several options. Easy to sit outside and eat on picnic tables. Restrooms were accessible and in great shape. Shopping seemed pretty typical. Just a wonderful spot to wander.

column2: A really fun place to visit
column3: Beautiful beach! We went on the ferris wheel right at sunset, and it was absolutely spectacular! I guess during the summer, the pier offers free concerts on the weekends, and we went on one of those nights so it was full of people. The wait for a beer was ridiculous so we settled for roasted corn on a stick and churros (so good). They were handing out free boxed water and free snacks, too. Great place to people watch! We had a really fun time!!

Went on a Thursday and it was wall to wall people. Can't imagine what it's like on a weekend. We did walk to the end and found a very good Mexican restaurant where we sat outside with a view of the very crowded pier.

Spent the afternoon exploring and sightseeing at the Santa Monica pier.Lots to see and and do there. The atmosphere at the pier is carnival like. There is a carousel, lots of amusement park style games. A roller coaster , a Ferris wheel and more.Great places to eat like Bubba Gumps.Lots of junk food too like funnel cakes. Ice cream, dipping dots and pizza, burgers and hot dogs tooA must see if you come to Southern California. Perfect weather in August, warm and sunny and the water was great. The beach was full but not crowded.

Worth a walk down the pier if youre in the area.Plenty to eat and see and some opportunity to buy tickets for tours.Parking was $15 for the day so good value if you spend the day there or go on a tour

column2: Very touristy, but a must see!
column3: Not much variety in food available, but I definitely recommend paying $8 for a trip on the ferris wheel. We went around 3 or 4 times, so you definitely get your money's worth. A nice day trip.

A fun place to visit and spend the day. The beach is beautiful and lots of room to stake out your territory. We always save our appetite for Bubba Gumps located on the pier when finishing up our day. Can be a fun day for the family but be aware that their is a homeless problem that you might want to prepare them for but plenty of rides and arcades and food and drinks to complement your trip
A must see attraction. Great Beach, shopping and relaxation. Awesome views of the sun setting. Would recommend any first time visitor to California to go here for the LA vibe.

column2: Huge area and beach but lots of litter.
column3: I liked the idea of Santa Monica beach and the pier. The area was packed for a Monday. I thought the beach was pretty, but I was turned off by all the litter on the beach and in the water. The boardwalk and pier were packed and walking around was fun but slow. I didn't eat on the pier because the options looked just ok. It was a little cheesy for me. My kids loved it because everyone was playing Pokemon. We ended up going to the promenade nearby instead.

We have visited the pier before. This time, it was packed early in the day. Our teens made us leave due to the congestion. Didn't enjoy at all. We did however eat at the fabulous seafood restaurant outdoors. (The one that has Popeye by it) and their Poke and entire meal were fab. Also, cars were driving in midst of people walking as no one was managing the in and out traffic. It brought to mind some terrible person running through crowds, and we were all shocked at the congestion and lack of security or car vs persons supervision.

column2: Nice to see people are still enjoying it here.
column3: We spent the day in Santa Monica and had to walk the old pier. It was jam packed with tourists and locals enjoying the food, rides and souvenir shops and stands. It brought back many memories of our younger days. If visiting in the area, it is a must stop by, but you don't have to plan a lot of time here.

If you want to see other tourists from the rest of the World and the US go and look If not, don't bother. Not much besides tourist stores, expensive fast food and people peddling caricatures and lettering( not very good but not expensive otherwise).You can gaze at the beach and other sun worshippers for only so much time.Essentially the only good thing( in my opinion) is the price. It's free!!

Oh the tradition of going to the Pier. Its like returning to childhood with the walk along the pier. Ride the ferris wheel and more. This truly is a family place to be shared with the generations. It can seem commercialized with all the vendors, but it is a true Santa Monica experience.

Parking is $20. It can get chilly during the night so bring a sweater if going at this time. Fun to see all the attractions - a fun carnival type atmosphere. Cool eateries such as Bubba Gump Shrimp. A fun place to visit - Three's Company fans!?

column2: Too crowded on weekend with too many Pokemon hunters
column3: So sad that the pier was packed with people just looking at their phones hunting Pokemon! Such lovely views and sunsets , activities and restaurants to see , but the majority seem too interested in looking at their screens. I would avoid on weekends and hope this craze dissapears. It is however if you can get passed the crowds it's worth a look.

We wondered what the constant river of people going out to and from the pier was all about. A local told us "summer in Santa Monica." That's what it was. No special event. Just people going out to walk the boardwalk and go back in time. Played skee-ball for the first time in years.

column2: Rides, junk food, souvenirs, in short everything a pier should have
column3: I love roller coaster rides, tacky souvenir shops and junk food, so I was bound to love the pier. There's a good atmosphere, with lots of musicians and artists trying to make some extra money.There are various games where you can when a stuffed animal for your sweetheart, but I just ended up doing the roller coaster, which is slightly lame so you can take small kids as well. It was not very full, so the stuff let us have a second go for free, which indicates the fun, relaxed atmosphere.I did not see any healthy food options, so probably best to eat somewhere else and then get your after dinner fun here.
Well, this place is extremely crowdy, many activities and food available. Close to the city center and its many shops, restaurant, 3rd street ...

We have a stopover in LAX and wanted to lap up a bit of atmosphere on the Sunday evening. I read reviews of Venice beach so avoided it and went to Santa Monica but it took nearly an hour to get there, once there was unbearably busy really rather unpleasant and quite dirty. There are probably some nice restaurants but to be honest we should have stayed at the airport! In hindsight I should have tried Santa Monica boulevard.
Great place to walk, and eat. Beach not so clean. But that's a public beach for you. Night rides are great. Go eat at Bubba Gump!
Pier feels like a mini carnival with many food options. It's A fun day trip with your family. I recommend Rusty' Surf Rach for a bite to eat!
An old fashioned traditional pier filled with rides, restaurants and activities to keep everyone entertained, gets busy

So I had a bucket list holiday with my family to California before my 60th birthday.I couldn't wait to see this iconic pier. When we arrived in Santa Monica the traffic was crazy. My son and daughter in law had been several times before and were astonished at the volume of traffic and people. We made our way to the pier. It was shocking. The amount of people bumping into me.We wondered was there an event that we were unaware of. We had to keep a good hold on our 5 year old granddaughter.It was impossible to get photographs or stop and take in the sights. Eventually we realised why...POKEMON...It was manic due to people looking at their phones and not where they were going or the incredible pier which they were on. It was shambolic. The only saving grace was that our 5 year old granddaughter went on the pier rides and her enjoyment was the making of the day. Otherwise the 11 hour air travel and 30 years of waiting was sadly spoilt.I like to think I'm a pretty young at heart woman but technology ruined my lifetime experience. I also mention that we made 2 attempts to visit Griffith observatory and for the same reason couldn't even park.I managed to get a silhouette of the pier in the dark from further away and that is the memory I will cherish. I didn't get to see the pier as I would have liked ,just masses of phones and wandering bodies oblivious to the history or beauty of this landmark.

Located right next to downtown Santa Monica, the pier and all it's excitement is an icon of Southern California. This location is featured in many films and it is a great place to visit for an hour and have a bite to eat. We went on a weekday just before noon. Parking was easy to find and the pier was busy, but not overcrowded. A great place to just watch people!The cool breeze off the ocean was a welcome relief from the much higher inland temperatures. It allowed us to enjoy the outside more comfortably in mid summer. There is a huge beach there, if you want to spend the day, with nearby restroom facilities.There are many food options. We had a simple ice cream cone and a hot dog, and enjoyed them both.If you plan to fish, there are special areas for fishermen and women. I have not seen this at other piers, but it was a welcome site. There is also a bait shop on the pier.

I had the pleasure of staying at Santa Monica the first night in LA and loved going down to the Pier to check it out..My friend and I had a walk on the beach and up to Venice with our first meal being at Bubba Gump #HappyDays

It's worth a look if you have kids and/or you like a full time carnival. It has some rides (including a roller coaster) as well as salty fatty food options such as ice cream, hot dogs, funnel cakes, etc. Nice views. It does tend to get crowded so be prepared.

We visited Around 4pm so we could enjoy a walk on the beach and get a meal to watch sunset, we had a meal at bubba gumps which was fab with a great ocean view, afterwards we took a walk on the beach, to be honest it was somewhat disappointing it was dirty with mass amounts of rubbish ....The pier was lovely with a great atmosphere although as to be expect very busy st night time it looked fab with all the neon lights but wash awash with Pokemon people!!
Quite a bit of tacky stuff going on, music, street performers, and lots of tourist shops. Having said that, it is a Pier! Small amusements section and the usual Ferris wheel style attractions.

Took the train from downtown to Santa Monica to visit the pier and eat. Walked about 4 blocks from station to the pier. The place was packed but average at best. It is a beautiful location but so is the park near the entrance.
beautiful beach.lots to do.would recommend this area over Venice beach as more family friendly (less tramps and weed smoking)

It is very unique to ride a roller coaster on a pier. The Ferris wheel will give you great views of the area. The merry-go-round is good for all ages. There are many restaurants with either grab and go food or sit down. The pier also has vendors selling . It is clean and safe and a fun place to be.
The pier is nostalgic but the crowds are huge and everything was overpriced. Definitely a tourist trap. I'd suggest San Clemente pier or Huntington Beach Pier over Santa Monica
Bit of a tourist trap but nice all the same.Great views of the ocean and surrounding beaches with plenty of shops and places to eat. Definitely a place not to miss when visiting!

Well, we are not really beach persons. But if you are, you will enjoy the waves, Sands and sun.Not beach person can enjoy the views and sun.This is where the first American highway end, Route 66. So be sure you have your photo taken at the Route 66 sign.After that, walk across to cool down, shop and food.

The pier is great. It has a lot of history for those who can remember the heydays. The ferris wheel is always great because of the location. The amusement park reminds us of what was before the super parks came on. A great way to relax and enjoy a day on the pier overlooking the ocean and the beach right there. The Original Muscle Beach was there and a sign is now there at the spot. Route 66 ended here. A must see on your travels. Many shops and restaurants nearby for everyone.

We went on a Sunday evening after strolling the beach. We had funnel cakes and enjoyed the music on the pier. We did not have our kids with us but so much for kids to do there. This is definitely a great family place.

We visited the pier while on a tour of LA. It was charming. I can't see spending more than an hour or two. It's Boardwalk entertainment and little shops with food mixed in. There are also a few rides but we were there before that opened. It was a nice visit to make.

column2: Lots to see, lots to do
column3: If you stay at doubletree they offer all day passes for rides for less than 25.00 dollars. The weather is perfect now
A nice place to visit, rides and stalls aimed at younger children with some areas looking a bit outdated, we only spent about 45 minutes here.

A great place to visit once but probably would not go again as a bit crowded and the rides are dated. However it is an experience not to be missed if you ar in LA. Some reasonably priced eateries and of course if you a have travelled route 66 it is a must to get a photo of the end of route sign
The actual pier is a to visit just to say that you visited ...the restaurants and bars in the area are the true attraction.

column2: A nice place to walk around
column3: Didn't try any of the restaurant but they seem alright and you have to visit at night, it looks amazing.
Unfortunately because of work i did not get to experience more of the beach and during the day it was not busy. Would have loved to be there at the weekend or at night.
It's was for sure my best mini vacation ever.Walking town but if you want go to others place get a car so your stay will be perfect!!

We visited in August. A must do for any tourist!! Hustling and bustling with both tourists and locals. Very busy. Great food places and not too expensive. The rides were a bit pricey though.Great to just stroll along the pier and take in the atmosphere.

Went about 11 in morning. Still plenty of parking. Lots to see and do, rides and games. Great for families. We sat on the beach with some breakfast and just soaked in the atmosphere. Loved it. will say i was surprised at how messy the beach was. Lots of litter such a shame. However we had a great morning there.

I visited the Santa Monica pier in August to go swimming in the hot LA weather. The beach can fill up quickly so come early. The beach/sand area is massive (away from the water) so you will have lots of places to set up camp. Visit the Santa Monica pier for some food, people watching and a refreshing drink. There are many souvenir shops, arcades, ice cream shops, local crafts, the caricature artist, and the amusement park located right in the middle of the pier. It's a fun place to visit. The Boardwalk gets really crowded and almost uncomfortable so be prepared to navigate through a maze of sweaty, hot people. Bicycles are available to rent at Perry's (bike rental place) along with boogie boards. They (Perry's) also have lockers to store any belongings you don't want to carry around. A Convenient option if you don't feel like hauling around your backpack or if you don't want to bring any valuables to the beach. I thinks it's 5$ for the day.
This is a must see destination. There is so much to do and see. This is only the first of many visits.
This was a great place to visit! Ride the Ferris Wheel for excellent photo opportunities. Don't worry if it's cloudy at first, it will clear up.
The place is beautiful but in order to park there every time we found it extremely diffucilt.And pier is super crowded all the time.
Lots of people watching, street performers and water. Throw in an old time amusement park complete with a ferris wheel and carousel and goods time are had.
Traffic and parking a nightmare. Crappy food and cheesy merchandise. Very little to see and do there. Long walk from Venice Beach...big hassle.
We had a great time here...enjoyed the view, rides, and ice cream. If you have children this is a great place to visit.
so much to do and the rides are fu n for anyone at any age also so many activities you can ride a bike so many food places and games

This historic pier has been taken over by Pokemon thrill seekers! Our family of four including two teens aged 13 and 16 ventured onto the pier after taking about a 20 minute walk to get onto the pier from parking area. I couldn't believe how many people had their phones in their faces catching those creatures! They even had posted rules for safe playing of the game. The pier itself had beautiful old wood planks but not that much to entertain. There were a few rides and a few food stands. There was very minimal shopping. A few entertainers amused the onlookers. Overall, it was just another pier and not worth the time and money it took to park and walk onto the pier.

Hi guys, I have been in Santa Monica during my last visit in LA. I think this is a fashion and enjoyable little city not far from crowded LA. Passing through the Santa Monica Pier is a great emotional thing because here finishes the Route 66 and this place is definitely romantic and simply unmissable...enjoy!!

I used to walk or ride my bike to the pier quite often. It's a great place to enjoy the ocean breezes after a long walk or bike ride. The amusement park is cool and there are many restaurants including Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf with outdoor and shaded seating nearby.The carousal is a favorite and may be reserved for parties and there are many artisans and vendors as well.
Poor would not recommend . Too many homeless camped around . Too busy . Over rated . City over flowing with cars crime and homeless

All the kitsch you want -- fair rides, greasy food, ice cream, vendors hawking services, musicians. Biggest beach I've ever seen. Good for adults and kids, but I'd definitely keep an eye on kids as there are homeless people all around. Police station on pier as well. We walked to the pier every night from our hotel for ice cream. Very fun. Good people watching place.

Romantic walk along the pier. Brings back childhood memories with lots of new attractions.Lots of places to eat or something to drink. We decided to come early before the crowd and relax. People watching is a fun thing to do too.

there is a lot of hype about this pier. The amusement park is OK, not too many rides. It is very crowded and the crowd was a bit on the sketchy side. We went at night and I was not too comfortable to have my family there. Maybe it is different during the day. all the restaurants were packed.

Santa Monica Pier is quintessential Los Angeles. If you are in the area a stop by the pier and the beach is a must do. The pier is a great spot for grabbing a casual bite to eat and enjoying the very talented street performers. The pier is a special place where every member of your family will find something to enjoy. A relaxing ride on the ferris wheel is a great opportunity to take in the views of the beach, coastline, and pier.My family stopped here for a few hours at the end of our Pacific Coast Highway adventure from San Francisco to Los Angeles and it was the perfect way to relax in true southern California fashion after a few days of driving. And don't miss the chance to enjoy sunset on the beach!
Great sunset venue. Parking is scarce. Watch for Pokemon hunters.I have to type one hundred characters.

column2: Super mega crowded. Very tacky. Avoid
column3: I can't see the attraction to a pier rammed with people and buskers. Blackpool pier is better. It's like the Kings new clothes...Nobody wants to say what a dump it is. Avoid.

column2: Lots to do, great ambiance, huge crowds
column3: If you don't mind crowds, you'll love the specific ambiance of the Santa Monica pier. We particularly love to sit at the end of the pier, enjoying the amazing views, while listening to an up and coming singer.

extremely crowded during summer! bring a jacket for night time as it gets cool! roller coaster is awesome - you go 2 times for price of 1 - Bubba Gump shrimp is good - pricey - long wait - put your name on the list and then walk up and down the pier while you wait!
Its a very busy place but lots of fun. The rides are expensive but well run.Lots of food and drinks available.
Refer to my other review "Crowded" for the info....The other review is missing the photo of the savage seagull eating a pigeon, so expect the unexpected while visiting
Must see. Exciting. We went for a taping of the voice and it was very exciting I highly recommend it. Make sure you build in enough time if you're doing a taping of the show

column2: Not really sure what all the fuss is about
column3: My kids have asked me and my wife to go to the pier. Frankly, I did not see anything worth a visit except for having a nice walk around first the pier itself and then the embankment. However, I can easily imagine the pier being converted into a very exciting place on the town holiday occasions.

I have not been to Santa Monica since a trip with a friend in 1992 and with a few hours to kill before traveling home early the next morning, I insisted to my 15 y.o. son that we should at least experience an LA-area beach before we left.We parked a few blocks up in a public garage for a few bucks (do NOT park at the extortionately priced lot at the Sears) and walked down to the pier. Even on a Monday evening, it was packed with a wide variety of people. Truth be told, it was a little run down, with a number of decent looking restaurants (we ended up eating at Big Dean's off of the pier - see my review), food stands, performers of varying talent and vendors of all sorts with a fun looking arcade (although it appeared a little beat up) and the amusement park, which looked, a. crowded, b. expensive, c. somewhat run down, but d. still fun.People were also fishing off of the end of the pier and the beaches on either side of it were expansive and impressive.While I am glad that we went (the beach really is that cool), there are so many other attractions in the LA area, that I simply cannot call this a "can't miss". If you go, go for the beach and enjoy the pier for what it is.
Crowded Sunday visit - lots of talented artists to watch. Various carnival games for kids. Fun time for all ages.

This is the first time I've been to Santa Monica pier and I recommend this attraction to anyone who is looking for something fun to do.There is plenty do to and it's definitely kid friendly. There's plenty of shopping for those of you who need retail therapy. Don't worry about going hungry because you'll see food vendors and restaurants along the pier. There's a small amusement park which includes a kid size rollercoaster and a Ferris wheel.If you're looking for a place to kill time, then do it at the Santa Monica pier.
A must visit when in Santa Monica. Great views of the coastline and ocean. Several shops and food places to visit as well.

We had five teens with us and we all had fun! We walked along the beach and enjoyed watching all the people using the gymnastics area and the beach in general. Once upon the pier there was lots to see and shops to buy trinkets in. We rode in the Ferris wheel and roller coaster but having just come from Disneyland, it was just ok. Unfortunately for us, it was a free concert night with thousands of people one the beach and in a beer garden wiring for it to start. We would have enjoyed having dinner at the pier but it became just too busy. I would go back again and enjoy the beach a bit more.

Crowds aren't usually my thing, but everyone seems to be happy here - Great vibe! The street leading up to the pier is a nice walk, and the Pier itself is filled with lots to look at and do, great way to pass the time day or night.
If you come to Santa Monica you must go and experience the pier! We rode the coaster and Ferris wheel . Just seeing all the people .. Crazy fun

Nice beach and pier but the parking can be a challenge if you go in the afternoon , we ended up parking about a mile from the pier and the parking shut at 8 pm which is a shame as the pier shuts around 10 pm
It's fun to do it once.. Way too many people in the summer. Rides are expensive and so is the food. But if your in the area the pier should definetly be on the list

column2: Very busy, good todo but not outstanding
column3: It is the second time we have been and it is what it says on the tin. A great way to get to look back at Santa Monica withe lots of attractions if you like that sort of thing. The Mexican Restaurant at the end of the pier is very good (we ate there last time) but on the weekend the whole pier is very, very busy. Good for Pokemon Go but follow the rules.Worth ticking off the list.

We found it to be rather tacky, with very limited activities, few dining options & cheap souvenir shops. Its' redeeming features are the beautiful views of the ocean & shoreline it provides and its' cooling sea breezes. There are other more attractive piers on the Southern California coast.

column2: Favourite place to visit when in California
column3: I love visiting Santa Monica - more so just for the walk along the beach front with the cool houses then up onto the pier. The pier is little run down and the food available there isn't all that great. However for scenery and a beautiful sunset, its still one of my favourite places.
This is a must see in LA. Full of life and iconic from the beach. Amusement park looked ok but did not try it. Easy parking nearby.

Listen, you have the Pacific ocean, stunningly beautiful weather, restaurants for every palate and lots to do - what's not to like? Santa Monica Pier attracts all kinds of folks from everywhere and they have one thing in common - fun! Smiles and laughter beneath the California sun - it's what makes Beach Boys songs!! You will not be bored!

In the movies the pier looks amazing but in real life its a bit run down. Half the childrens rides where you put money into dont work, the rides are quite pricey and the actual pier on the weekend is overcrowded. Its ok for children and for adults the views are phenomenal as you look out over the sea and the beach
So many things to so on this pier.. Next time we need to stop and eat at Albrights restaurant.. They were having bands on the pier..

column2: Great for a cheap day out!
column3: My friends and I decided to go for a walk down the pier just to say we had been there and seen it. Its a lovely atmosphere, lots of street dancers and crowds. We went in the arcades and used the old fashioned photo booth which was fun too! Lovely views of California on the pier and beautiful beach at Santa Monica too. Lots of nice eating establishments within the area too.

Just a quick trip up this way before going to Buena Park and it was worth it. Parking is located right at the beach, but I didn't find it until after I already parked a little bit away. It wasn't a bad walk, there was a park area with a walkway along the beach area, which some picture-worthy memorials and cannons! The pier wasn't too crowded, but we were there during the middle of the day on a Tuesday. The souvenirs are a little pricey, glad I didn't pick up any of those little babies. We didn't check out any of the eateries this trip, but there is always next time! There is meter parking available, but if you plan to stay all day, just park right down on the beach area for 12 bucks. The rides on the pier were 30 bucks for ages 8 and up and 17 for those younger than 8, or somewhere along those price ranges.

I wasn't expecting it to be so nice after other reviews but it really was. We parked in the multi level carpark a short walk from the pier first 90mins is free or you can park on pier for $12. Beach water was beautiful. Food, gifts and rides available on the pierThe wood on the pier is knobly/uneven so be careful.

I really enjoyed my time at Santa Monica pier! There was a good buzz with lots of places to eat. It was a nice place to come for a stroll in the evening or during the day. It was always busy with lots of buzz.

I had always heard about the Santa Monica Pier and I guess my expectations were way too high. It was crowded and had numerous sales carts. Parking in the area was expensive and hard to find. A couple carnival style rides and food booths but nothing special. Save the parking fees and just drive by.
A must see in Santa Monica - ride the solar powered ferris wheel and stroll along the pier. Nice to hear the buskers playing live music and great views of the beach.
WOW! A must see in Santa Monica! great views super restaurants and always entering watching the street performances.
It's mad but amazing experience.it has the fun park and lots of entertainment along the pier.Such a great vibe and atmosphere and we went during the day.Well worth a visit if in the area.

Comming from the UK, we have alot of seaside piers, and Santa Monica Pier is no different to any of those, except the sun shines here!! It's free to enter, though parking is $10 or $2 for 2hr in designated places. There is a large funfair that takes up most of the pier (I didn't use it so don't know how much rides were but it seemed popular) and a fishing deck at the far end. Near the start is a Route 66 sign post stating end of R66 so that is quite crowded with people taking photographs. Other than that, it's just a pier that could be anywhere.

Not bad to visit if you happen to be nearby in the area, but I would not recommend it to go out of your way to visit this place.Alot of the games required at least 3 or 4 players, so if you just happen to be visiting as 2 people group, you're out of luck.We ride the roller coaster and it was quite fun

Loved this trip, extremely busy in July, enjoyed the sidewalk entertainment such as Nat King Cole artiste. Even spotted the odd sea lion being fed at the end of the pier. Car park huge and looked full, didn't attempt to park so close. Parked in one of the many private car parks in nearby Santa Monica Boulevard. Worth the visit . Great fun.

column2: Love the retro feel of the games arcade!
column3: Such a lovely stroll as the sun starts to set. Too busy in peak times as to be expected and getting a table at a restaurant is tough but the nearby food trucks provide a far more fun experience anyways. The games arcade took my partner back to his youth playing Pacman and Gallagher! Fun spot and something for everyone!!

This place is pretty cool. Personally, I feel that it's a bit over run by tourism attractions at this point. Still a fun event, make sure to check out the jumbo swings along the south side of the pier!

I myself am a big kid and it takes very little to excite me, the thought of the Pier really had my hopes up but I was a little deflated. Having been an avid GTA 5 player I simply assumed the pier wouldn't be as basic as it is on the game however there actually wasn't much more to it. Perfect for the younger kids just doesn't appeal to us big kids as much. Definitely worth the visit to enjoy the atmosphere and you don't have to pay entry or go on any of the rides.
My only disappointment was that there were no venders selling seafood. The food was also overpriced. Still, it's a nice day out with plenty of entertainment.
When you talk about Pier is always a difficult choice . I end my game Santa Cruz vs Santa Monica but the second one won . I don't know why it is special for me !
Clean and quaint - it was like visiting the nicest seaside town in the UK but with perfect weather and blue sea. What a wonderful day.

column2: Nice place to visit in the afternoon
column3: This place is nice to visit when staying in LA. There are many restaurants and things to do down at the pier and the highlight for the kids is of course the amusement park. There are also many restaurants and shops on the opposite side of the street from the pier. I can highly recommend to visit this place in the afternoon/evening to walk around have something to eat.
We really enjoyed it! The atmosphere and the vibe was really nice! There are many small shops, places to eat and some rides as well. It's family friendly!

column2: 2nd visit, just as fun, always pleasant.
column3: I drove my family to the pier for their first visit.Everyone loved it. My nephews rode the West Coaster which they enjoyed very much. Though we had limited time, limiting interaction at the venues, enjoying the weather and free entertainment, while watching someone catch fish is good if you've got to run.The pier is overall clean, family friendly.

column2: Iconic beginning or end of historic Route 66.
column3: A visit to the iconic Santa Monica Pier is a must for out of town visitors. There's a dozen or so rides (buy the multi ride wristband to save money) with the roller coaster and the Ferris wheel the most popular. The view of the So. Cal coast from atop the Ferris wheel is great, as is the view of Santa Monica. The carousel at the beginning of the pier is a must and was used in the movie The Sting. Enjoy the salty air as you stroll down the pier, with hundreds of other tourists. Here's an inside tip: along the boardwalk just under the pier a few hundred feet south is the original Hot Dog on a Stick. Its a little red free-standing building. It's not as neat and clean as the subsequent franchises, but have your pic taken in front of the stand that started it all.

We went to the pier on a Thursday in August, which was a concert series night for the summer, and that can explain the crowds. There are also lots of bikers that are a bit rude if you're in their lane accidentally.The pier is small but a great place to watch the sunset. It's a bit expensive for rides (each is $8). However, you can buy a ride band for $29.99. Which seemed a bit much for us, a family of four.Also, there is a parking lot next to the pier for $20. But, drive up a few more blocks and there's one for $3, if you mind the walk.

Spent the afternoon on the beach and then walked salons the pier. Such a great atmosphere! We enjoyed some icy lemonades and soaked up all the good vibes that surround the is area. Full of shops, takeaway foods & fun for all the family. Everyone is just so happy here!

column2: Very touristy and packed to the gills with people playing Pokemon Go
column3: It was difficult to enjoy the Pier when we visited around 10pm on a Sunday night. It was so crowded but mostly with people staring at their phones and bumping into everyone as they played Pokemon Go.The restaurants and shops looked fun but we couldn't get inside any of them due to the crowds.
A nice place to visit but very busy. Had a lovely vegeburger on the pier. Great photo opportunities and good views. Old style fairground activities.
The quintessential boardwalk, lots of rides, food and characters, but oh so crowded. Perhaps if Pokemon Go wasn't so popular, it wouldn't have been so packed. Great Poke-hunting

Beautiful place for a nice, scenic stroll. It does get quite busy but that's the charm of it. Very lively atmosphere and there's even a little carnival/amusement park on the pier called Pacific Park. Go for a spin on their ferris wheel and enjoy an aerial view of Santa Monica!
We had so much fun the food was great the peer was full of vender and rides it was fun the beach was full of people

I wasn't sure if this would just be another Venice Beach but it isn't. A much friendlier and happier vibe, I thought.The pier is full of things - rides, things to eat and everything you'd expect. Nice views back towards the beach. Definitely worth some time when you've had enough of the sand..!

The scenery at the Santa Monica pier is great! A great for pictures and to just relax after a long day. It does get slightly annoying with the huge crowd but it is well worth the visit. There are also great places to eat close by.
Love the pier and visited in August and my 2nd visit. Athmosphere is amazing and a must have photo opportunity under the end of the route 66 sign

column2: Dated, old, extremley crowded and not much to do.
column3: The pier is nice in the morning when it is first opening. Then later is becomes too crowded. Has nice views but not much else tempted me. Is outdated and nothing special about it.

The bright bulbs and carnival atmosphere allows a visitor to step back in time, although sadly these places battle to compete with modern day theme park attractions. Still the pier is fun to visit if nothing else but to people watch.

Loved visiting here have not been to a place like it, a place of fun where adults and families can visit together with rides and restaurants all on a pier. A couple of places that stood out were the end of Route 66 and Bubba Gump Shrimp.
Beautiful view to take anyone who wants to see California, can be very busy packed with people, view is worth it.

Loved this place,would go back tomorrow if i could.Just interesting to see how american beach goers live and this is a prime example.I think from memory there was a Ruby's Diner at the end of the pier which is where i ate somegreat american diner food like Chilli Cheese Fries

Santa Monica beach is stunning! The white sand goes for what seems to be forever.As for the pier - meh. It's something to do and see and then leave and go somewhere better for food that doesn't cost an arm and a leg.It's nice to walk to the end of the pier, take some photos from the end, enjoy the buskers....or not (all seemed to be singing about Jesus!!) and never go back!

My daughter and boyfriend asked me to take them somewhere. I was done with work so we took off to the pier. We only live about 30 minutes away and it was his only his second time going there. They had a great time we got hot dogs from Japadog that they both liked and walked around. Always something to see around the pier. It is one of the things you have to do when visiting from out of the area. But even if you are a "Local" it can be fun.

column2: Too many people on a pier
column3: At night it is beautiful with all the lights. But packed, you cant move and there is not that much to see.
Fun to play in the arcade but VERY hot and a bit dirty. Quite touristy and definitely no place worth eating at. Good people watching!

This was not our first visit here and wont be our last. The pier can get a bit busy during the middle of the day so i recommend going early, straight after breakfast if your wanting to get good photos without the crowds.

Visiting Santa Monica with my 13-year-old daughter and her friend, we did the obligatory stroll on the pier.Worth doing, if only for the photo opp.Seaside tacky done as well as anywhere, with gorgeous views of the beach, mountains and waterfront.

column2: Kid Fun with Ocean Breeze and View
column3: Gotta ride that ferris wheel for the view. The roller coaster is pretty basic, but fun enough for the 10 and under crowd. I'd say the sweet spot for kids between the ages of 4-10, but there is stuff for younger and older, too. Still plenty of teens running around, too.

column2: Cool if you're in the area
column3: There are some little rides, a ferris wheel, an arcade, small vendors, and people with assorted talents

There is plenty to do here with the rides and street performers. My daughter pointed out that it looked just like GTA(a video game she plays). There are also several restaurants to eat at including a Bubba Gumps Shrimp Co. I gave four stars because it is very crowded and parking is poorly managed. It took us an hour to get to the parking lot.(Suggest coming up through the neighborhood on the south rather than off of Pacific Coast Highway to the north.) There are several homeless people and the stench of pot hangs in the air.

Visiting Santa Monica Pier was a really fun experience. Strolling over the thick wooden boards felt like walking in an old school movie. In the morning it was still quiet, in the evening it got really crowded but that was also due to a free summer concert on the pier.
Quite nice place to spend one day. You can relax, fish, and spend a whole day. Nice atmosphere and good set up.

This is a great pier. It is big with plenty of places to chill and take it all in. It can be very busy. There are places to take in the view or you can enjoy the carnival atmosphere of the funfair. Good place to spend an evening.
It is exactly as it looks on movies. Feels like a lost opportunity though for tourists. Still gotta see it as Sheryl Crow sings......nothing like Santa Monica boulevard. Takes 10 mins to do it all

column2: Crazy busy but good sunset photo opp
column3: Went on a Tuesday night in August and was amazed by the number of people in the center of the pier which is where the rides and restaurant was located. I did not feel 100% walking thru the large and high density crowd. Instead we left the pier and walked on the beach and saw an amazing sunset and took lots of great pictures.

If your here you should decently go, if only to walk the pier and see the sights. I brought the kids and managed to get them off the pier without spending too much money, we did buy some fresh fruit to share. Took some pictures and then went onto the next thing, it was a nice little detour for the day.

I came here on the night on August 4th 2016. It was night so couldn't see much of the beach. There was some kind of concert on the beach so it was very very very crowded. Was hard to find parking, when I did find parking it cost $25 for 2hrs. I believe the person performing was Natalia LaFourcade based on the website. But I wasn't there for that, that was just coincidence. Walked the pier, looked at the shops and rides, proposed on the beach and went to celebrate :-)

column2: Straight out of grease! Just lovely
column3: This is everything you want in a pier without the tacky elements. Enjoy the views on the Ferris wheel and eating ice cream. Knocks socks off Venice beach!

column2: Great place to watch the sun go down
column3: We always like to visit the pier for a walk and sit and watch the sun go down over the Pacific. There are a few decent fast food places to get a snack and just relax and watch the sunset.Other than parking, which isn't too expensive, this is a free attraction which is well worth the visit.
I spent a few nights during my business trip on the Santa Monica Pier. There is always live music and acts to enjoy. The best time to be on the pier is during the sunset‚Äîit is incredible!

We went for lunch and had a great time. We took our two children (8 and 5) to ride the rides and play the games. To be honest, we had a fun time, but it was pretty short lived. I would suggest you bring your children if they are younger and maybe not looking for a wild rollercoaster. My daughter is an 8 year old ride enthusiast and she got pretty bored after about 45 minutes. Good luck!

Summer concert nights at Santa Monica Pier are great and free. Every Thursday throughout the summer, the pier hosts music concerts beginning at 7pm lasting to 10pm. Family friendly environment There is plenty of security on and off the pier and staff guiding pedestrian traffic. It does get busy so if large crowds are not your thing, might be better to stay away.

Except from the nice view offered from Santa Monica there is nothing unforgettable. If not too crowded you could have a nice walk on the wood deck, and get a nice view of the coast.I went there mid-July and it was crowded with hundreds of people playing Pokemon go... That didn't help to really appreciate the atmosphere I guess. Nevertheless it was not the best place I visited in LA.
Walk on the beach or jump in the waves, or just walk the pier and enjoy a nice Mexican diner at Mar y Sol. There are rides here for the kiddos to enjoy. Fishing is always a possibility too.

Perhaps the SMP is one of those bucket list places everyone should experience once, but we failed to see the charm. It was packed on an August Saturday to the point of being almost impossible to navigate around tour groups, honking cars, skateboards and bikes. While the views and people watching are superb, we were glad to get out of there after 15 minutes.

So lovely sea view, friendly people busy seen nice shopping around Santa Monica but very busy! And we went on a Sunday.You can catch to bus but bring a jacket for the evening the temperature really drops.
Lovely afternoon spent on the pier. Great views and plenty of shops and stalls. The beach is lovely aswell.

To be fair, I hate crowds and we visited on a Saturday afternoon. There was wall to wall people on the pier and the beach. The beach was filthy with trash and one individual who decided to deficate in public. It made my skin crawl to even walk on that beach. The view is beautiful but for me, thats about it.

Something you just have to do. Walk along the various artists and performers and enjoy the view on the sea and beach. Buy some tickets for the rides and then jump on your bike again to continue your bicycle ride on the fantastic beach trail.

column2: A great beach with lots to do.
column3: Very busy on a July Friday afternoon, but still a great place to visit!Plenty of great shopping and restaurants. Lots of beach and ocean to choose from. The pier is full of rides and carnival food like funnel cakes and lemonade. The pier even has a Ferris Wheel:)You could easily spend a a day or two here:)

This place is exceptionally busy and over rated. It offers a poor roller coaster, a ferris wheel and other fair ground attractions. The place was heaving with very few places where this let up.I guess if your staying in santa monica it's a must, however wouldn't travel to it especially.

Loved the atmosphere at Santa Monica Pier, we had gone at night, and it was very lively, couldn't get on the beach but the pier itself had so much to do. The mini amusement park. Lots of restaurants to eat, and the roadside entertainment. People playing music, etc
Its crowded, lots of noise, plenty of places to eat and drink some OK Bubba Gump for example. But the sunsets are to die for, really the best we have ever seen. If you can come just for them

You can't visit Santa Monica and not go on the Pier!. It is bustling with activity and amazing at night when illuminated.. Try the wheel as views across the beach are just beautiful. Tickets are priced but worth it!

A nice experience for anybody travelling to Los Angeles! Visited the pier for the second time today and again both me and my partner enjoyed the experience. Lots of entertainment and things to do. If your looking to eat at one of the restaurants on the pier then be prepared to wait. Apart from that great experience.
Amazing place. Full of peaople. If you don't like pokemon spillers, stay away. They are everywhere. Otherwise the caroussel and the restaurants are great.

column2: Wish we spent more time there!
column3: My daughters and I went at night and had dinner at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., we walked around the pier and enjoyed the sound of the ocean, something we do not have where we currently live. The atmosphere was fun and safe. I hope to go again next year.

It was great to see where they filmed Baywatch and get some photos on the beach. The pier is great and is the end of Route 66 which is another attraction of the place. If you get nice weather it's a beautiful beach.

It was nice to see so many people enjoying the beach. The rides were busy and the lines moved fast. It is a good place to go for a walk and people watching. A few restaurants were interesting to visit but there was a long waiting time. $12 for parking at the pier's parking lot.

There is a lot to do in the area ! The rides are gentle ! People are nice ! You can find cheap souvenir t-shirts . There are all kinds of food options (sit down restaurants also) they have a lot of activities around , surfing , volleyball, gymnastic bars , biking and jogging trail which goes on forever ! I went from Santa Monica to Venice beach and could have gone further . There are so many people here !!!!! We could not believe we found short term parking 2 hours in a tiny lot . The beach is very wide ! Water is cold ! This was the best place to watch the sunset !
If you like crowds, lots of crowds then you will like this place otherwise stay away....far away! Too busy for my liking.

Although it was super busy, it was a nice place to visit. Plenty of food options, there's the pier itself to walk around on, the amusement rides and the beach. Make sure to bring sun screen and a umbrella for those sunny days!

My wife and I visited the pier on a Thursday night. We could not believe how many people were there. We chose Thursday instead of Friday because we thought it would be less crowded. Everywhere we wanted to eat was over an hour wait time, even a little tamale stand. I know that people feel okay to smoke outside, but there were too many people smoking and it was unpleasant.

Went cause the kids wanted to collect Pokemon. Apparently this is the Mecca for Pokemon, everybody is on the phone collecting them. Apparently there are some rather rare ones here. I would not know as we sat and ate food while the kids Pokemoned. So if you have teens they will want to go here.

Boys wanted to see and visit Santa Monica Pier. Since we are from East Coast and visiting Vegas, we decided on an overnight road trip to LA. A must do of you have time. Staying in Vegas is perfect for visiting LA/San Diego for a day. Concert at pier evening we were ther. Free...able to our feet in Pacific and spend time on pier. It was nice to visit. Having a bit more time would be good, or get there earlier. Parking was crazy due to concert event.

Have to walk the Pier at least once during your stay in Santa Monica as its iconic. Lots of people strolling along, their is an amusement park, aquarium, stores, and food. Can fish off the pier. It is beautiful and great views.

This pier is always very packed but it's nice to visit with family went there with some buddies of mine. California weather is great all year long. Got on a roller coaster not very scary but hey it's ok.

We arrived pretty early in the day, weather was nice and not crowded; but really not much to do;our highlight was watching the seal in the ocean.we returned back in the evening and it was packed; go early if you like to get a spot for parking right next to it for $12 flat rate

column2: Too Busy In Summer And Parking Difficult And Expensive
column3: Interesting to see once and then best to be admired from a distance. Santa Monica is a difficult place to park as it is always so busy. It takes so long to navigate the streets and sometimes drives you to just give up. Once parked and there, it is entertaining and interesting to people watch

column2: Beautiful and Vibrant Place to spend
column3: This was my 5th visit to this awesome place. I liked to spend more times here while I visited LA. This place is a must on my visiting list. Not only as interesting place to shop, but it might be a vibrant place to enjoy, especially near dawn. Great views at sunset. As the end of well-known Route 66 this place is able to act as one of the most famous spot to visit in America. Great!!!

Its the end of Route 66. And its a huge Pokemon stop , if you are into that. The whole area is a great place to walk and take pictures.As you are going back to the street, keep right, and behind the ferris wheel, there are stairs to the beach.

We visited the Santa Monica Pier and were shocked. It is essentially a hotspot for homeless people - and nothing else.The place was filthy and was full of intimidating people, all intoxicated, doing some pretty disgusting things in plain view of the public.It's not for tourists to speculate on the socioeconomic issues that have led to the homeless crisis here but I urge anyone with a young family to stay away from this place as it is nothing more than dangerous.It's a shame because it's clearly an iconic place but it's been left to wallow by the city and is unsafe as a result.Stay away.
We went to the beach and the park we had an AMAZING time!! The Ocean was so pretty but really cold!! My daughter age 8 and niece age 17 and my fianc√© made memories and had a great time!!

column2: Meh, very crowded and touristy. Not my thing.
column3: We walked the pier on a Saturday evening and it was very crowded. It seemed very touristy and wasn't my thing. I hear they have a nice carousel and the view from the Ferris Wheel is supposed to be great, but we didn't do either. I don't plan on going back to the pier if I can help it.
You enjoy the beach and you have a wonderful time with your family and friends and you can take excellent picts from the place!!!

column2: Peir amusment, nastalgia keeps the rating up
column3: First off, you must really like nostalgic peirs or Hollywood history to even consider this a valid stop. Also, make sure your wallet has 4 times the amount of cash you expect to spend.The arcade I'd fun, and a historic road of my childhood. The rides are a half assed carnival attempt, but the atmosphere is fun and conceivably nostalgic.You can have fun here and create memories, but know what you're getting into.

Family of 5 visited for a couple of hours. Quite lively, the amusement area is full of screaming kids and the rides were fairly pricey, about $8 each. Different food options and little vending carts with shopping items and some live entertainment. 1 1/2 hours free parking in a multi story parking lot about two blocks straight up from the pier entrance. Nice looking beach area with paved bike bath and great ocean views with parking there too. Not sure of price. Waves didn't look overly high in this area.
You have to go for that reason alone. Beautiful views and fun attractions and several food choices! Route 66 last stop.
It's a good place to visit once, but I don't think it's worth going back to since there are many more places to visit in the area

Gotta stop even if busy. Walked the pier and rose the Ferris wheel which was really cool. Definitely a place for younger kids as they have games and rides. Overpriced parking at hotels that advertise public parking.

I've been going to the Santa Monica Pier for over 45 years and it's always interesting. The people watching alone is worth the stroll, and you should stop in to see the old merry go round. Although it's changed so much over the years and is much more of a tourist destination these days, it's still a great place to hang out.
it looks nice form the distance but once on the Pier; only hords of people. and during our visits hord with a mobile phone searching for Pokemon Go
It's an overcrowded, tourist trap site. However, it's still iconic. There're stores throughout the pier and a little theme park. The beach is fine.
This is a must see attraction. Lots to do there and enjoyable environment. The only negative is the traffic getting there. Take the exit before and go up the PCH to get there.

At a time when I needed a motivation. Fun, many different cultures, and near water. Son was also excited to meet ppl and laugh all day. He needed to be away to get ready for his life battle. He loved it!

column2: Don't dedicate a day but visit if you can
column3: Lots of people visiting the Pier, it is nice to visit if you are in the area but maximum two hours if not dining is more more than enough.
My wife has always dream about walking down this Pier and was so excited to do it with the kids. I liked how there was so much stuff going on and loved the food on the Pier.

column2: A concentrated place for fun, eat and views.
column3: Santa Monica pier is a perfect place for the first timer. There is some rides for the kids, snacks/drinks and a way to get a good look at the ocean life. Some days you can watch surfers doing their thing just below.
The pier was full on a Wednesday evening. I am sure it is partially due to the pokemon go craze and everyone trying to catch them all. Amusement park rides at the end of the pier.
Has lots of restaurants, right next to the beach, and some fair rides with old school ring toss and basket games

column2: Fabulous iconic must do when visiting Santa Monica
column3: Fab place to visit. Lots to see and do with rides and lovely restaurant/bars. Something for everyone here.

It's good to go and see but like all of L.A. That I saw it is filthy and full of rubbish. Look closely at the beach and there is rubbish everywhere and also what is with the amount of homeless people everywhere.i come from London so am used to city's but L.A. In general is a dump! Sidewalks are always filthy and rubbish just everywhere.

We were in San Diego for three days, and we're spending two in LA before heading to the Bay Area for the final days of vacation the traffic in LA was awful during late morning on a Monday, and it took a long time to finally get to Santa Monica. We opted for public parking in a garage off Fourth, which was convenient and inexpensive.We didn't spend much time on the way-too-crowded pier, but we were on the beach for a few hours. It was great.I can't imagine how crowded this area must be during more popular times.

Great entertainment for all ages. We bought the pass online to save a few bucks and got to the pier around 10 pm to ride the rides in the dark and see the city skyline. It was a Friday night and we waited about 30 minutes for the roller coaster and none of the other rides had long lines.

If you can't get a flavor for CA at this pier, then you just don't know homeless people like you think!Most are quiet, it's the rare "F U" shouting while they are walking down the boardwalk that bring out the true flavor of the beach.Stop for a hand drawn selfie at any one of over 10 "artists" waiting to draw you. Don't want a drawing? There are 5 more artists that are willing to draw your name in the color of your choice!Takes me back to Michael Douglas in "Falling Down" complete with the guy who needs a ride/gas money.

Crowded yet still room to walk around and enjoy the beautiful scenery. We went early morning and parked close by. Not much really to do unless you ride the coasters and just people watch. Great areas to take scenic pics.
One of places to visit when you are in LA.Beaches are nice, and pier is very cool.Nice place to go in couple or with family and kids
Slammed with people all day and night. It was nice to see it but it wasn't for me. I think if I had kids it would be helpful to occupy some time. But very clean and comfortable.

Very very busy attraction. Was cool to see because its famous and historical. But it's very crowded. Plan a lot of time to get through traffic (2 hours from Pasadena to Santa Monica), we valet parked at the Shore Hotel which is a cool place by the way, but it was $38 dollars a day, as we walked down to pier we saw beach parking for $12 a day lol. We visited the pier, had lunch a tasty lunch at Bubba Gump Seafood ($70 and 1 hour wait), bought mats, umbrellas, beach toys, sunscreen and water bottles ($68), then hung on the beach until the beautiful sunset. It was very crowded and there was lots of loud rap and Mexican music playing. Large camps of people set up and some left trash behind. A few homeless sleeping on the beach, and lots of pigeons. Wasn't quite the relaxing beach I envisioned but we made the best of it and had fun playing frisbee and taking pics of the sunset. I probably would choose a different beach next time when I'm looking for relaxation and quiet and less crowds.
We had a blast. The rollercoaster is quire small but what a setting. You must go for the views & atmosphere - lots to see & do.

column2: Great for a walk around, lovely beach
column3: This was a lovely intro to LA's beaches. Wide expansive space, lots of LA bodies showing off their physique and a cute pier with old school rides and an amusement arcade.It was a fly by visit for us but I wished we'd had longer to really take it all in. Great Zoltar fortune telling machine (same as the one in the film 'Big' in the arcade :) )

Not a favorite of large crowds and cheap thrills. It felt like We were visiting a road side carnival but instead was a sea side carnival. Parked our car in the nearby parking garage walked to the end of pier and back to our car within 40 minutes we were outta there!

I highly recommend going all the way to the end of the pier...enjoy the sights while enjoying a nice sit down lunch! Following lunch make your way back to shore and enjoy all the shops and vendors. Best restrooms are at the very end of the pier!
I could spend all day on the pier digging through store items, joining in on the rides, and eating for sure.

Not sure why everyone likes this place. We went in the evening and it was trashy and overcrowded. Maybe my expectations were to high. We have been to some much better beaches with great piers. I couldn't believe the amount of trash at this place. Please hire people to pick it up. Will never go back! So disappointed!

Don't leave Santa Monica without visiting the Pier. If offers a great young outdoor vibe. In the afternoons and weekends can get very crowded so go early if you want to avoid that. The pier offers restaurants, an arcade lounge, local artists and even a small attraction park with affordable rides. Also, the views of the beach are stunning so take your camera!
Nice place, good people, many options of food and an awesome sunset to see from the pier. I recommend it!

Great place to visit! Lots of things to see. Walk down the pier and see all the whacked out locals trying to entertain you for donations and see all the local artists make cool things with you picture or name. While your hear stop by 3rd st promenade.
Had a wonderful time and I cant wait to go back and bring the kids. We were there on our anniversary in June, so it was a little hot for us but well worth the trip.

column2: Experience the Pier. Experience the newest attraction - Pokemon Go Trackers
column3: Santa Monica Pier is amazing. You can go to just look at the water OR... you can ride on the carousel or other rides. There are several restaurants.It's now fun to watch the Pokemon Go players as they walk up and down the pier.

The Santa Monica Pier is world famous, and anyone vacationing in the area has to visit it at least once. It costs nothing to walk the pier, although there are carnival rides, a midway, and arcade. You can't beat the views. The pier has been featured in countless movies and television shows, too. Definitely worthwhile!

column2: Overcrowded and not worth the time
column3: The walk to the pier was awesome, but once we got to crossing the bridge to the pier, it was nuts! The place is way too crowded. The line for tickets for the ride was too long. The funnel cake and ice cream place was delicious. I would definitely not come back to the pier, but Santa Monica is still a beautiful place to stay and visit.
We have been here twice and it is one of my favorite places ever! The food is incredible at bubba bumps and the pier is something from a movie! Easter is cold and waves are swift but very enjoyable!
Pure bliss with every hour of the day. If you have never visited I highly recommend Santa Monica. I keep going time and time again and it never gets old.
Nice place with a lot of fun it is worth visiting Extremely crowded especially during weekends A lot of nice restaurants and shops

column2: Day visit to Santa Monica Pier
column3: My husband and I had a one night stopover at Santa Monica before flying home. We found the Pier very vibrant and fun to visit with lots to see and do. There are some really good buskers down there that kept everyone entertained. The beach is really beautiful. They have a carnival there that is lots of fun and some nice eateries there as well. We tried the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier which was not too bad. They will sell you an umbrella at the beach but we chose to hire a bike and take the ride to Venice beach which is good fun.
My daughter met up with friends and had a ball.. Great fun and excitement and great food... Safe and clean environment

column2: It was quite interesting at night.
column3: We visited on our way back from San Francisco. It was about 7 PM and just starting to get dark. It was the perfect time of day to go. The beach was just clearing out, so there are plenty of places to park, and the pier was filling up with people. If you are looking for a great place to eat, I don't think I would head there. But if you're looking for someplace cool to hang out, check out the sites and the lights and walk along the beach, it is your to go to place.
If you've made it this far they make it pretty easy to visit the pier. Parking across the street is easy. Lots of shopping, dining and people watching. Rides on the pier. Allow 3-4 hours.

Lovely day, had by all. Very crowded on weekends, so do it during the week. First n rides. The Aquarium is ice for young kids. The beach and water are beautiful. Ate st several different restaurants. All were good for vacation food.
It's good, near 3rd street promenade..However it's really crowded just because people are trying to find some pokemons
It's of course touristy and crowded but fun to walk up and down and maybe grab a snack. We rode the roller coaster which was surprisingly fun but a little overpriced.
Nice but not wow. we were on the hop on hop off tour bus and we went to see the Santa Monica pier. average theme park and below average caf√©
You just got to Visit Santa Monica Pier it's a Icon Must !It's just like you see in the movies.End of Route 66 .Loved it !
Beach is beautiful .. nice lively with people and street performers there singing and dancing.. some of the them were really good beach is very beautiful

column2: A cool place to hang out.
column3: A really great place to visit day or night, a great vibe with lots happening.great to people watch or partake in a number of thrills and spills of the fair rides

Went to the pier twice once on a Sunday, which was so crowded we promptly turned around and went into Santa Monica shops. Can back a couple of days later, much more manageable crowds, pier itself was underwhelming but the beach was great.
Went here on a Friday night with daughters 17 and 22. It was crowded with people. This place is dirty and scary. It has a beautiful view at sunset, butI would not go back.

column2: Fabulous Ferris Wheel with views over the beach & pier
column3: Loved Santa Monica Pier, lots going on with entertainers and shops. There's a nice fair at the end of the pier and the Ferris wheel is a must. Great views for miles.
Touristy and not in a good way. Skip it. Crowded. No great attractions. Small walkways for a lot of tourists. Santa Monica is a great town. No need to head to the pier.

column2: Many options for children (apart from the beach)
column3: Children will like this place, there are many attractions (games, wheels, train, aquarium, food) and beach near this place.

It's a pier. It's the "end of the line" for route 66. It's an amusement park. There's lots to do, little shops, the beach is pretty nice. Things on the pier itself are a bit pricy as to be expected. If you took children (and $$ to spend) I'm assuming it would be a great family outing. For bigger kids, unless you're into rides there's not much to the pier. A fun quick stop.

A must see on everyone's list while staying in LA. This is the end trail for route 66, the carnival on the pier is great for kids and family's. The beach has so much sand and the water is beautiful and warm in Sept.
This is one awesome place. So good especially in the evenings. There are fun rides and great scenic beauty.

column2: At least I can say I have been.....
column3: BUT, the one thing I promised myself was that I would go on the Ferris Wheel, see the amazing views.... No, not allowed! Single riders not allowed.... What was I to do, I was a solo traveller... Consequently it left a bad taste for me!

column2: Good Place for Kids of All Ages
column3: I'm over amusement parks (unless there is a superb roller coaster) but this is on the pier with lots of fresh air and the backdrop is the Blue Pacific Ocean. Win win!

Very beautiful and very fun. Didn't do any of the arcade stuff but was great to see and looks fantastic on photos!Every Thursday throughout July and August there is a free concert on the pier, we sat down on the beach and saw Borns. Was busy but such a special atmosphere - definitely go to this!!
It was a nice spot to stretch on our journey along hey 1. We parked a few blocks away at a bowling alley. Lots of street performers, good and bad. Crowded. Ate. Took pictures. Done
Good view to see the whole beach. There's a playing field for kids. Good place for taking photos. But it smells no good at the side walk to the pier!
Nothing bad about it, just nothing special My kids liked it from seeing it on all the movies. Rides are OK but a little expensive. Gets really crowded on a hot day.

Had to walk the pier, eat some popcorn, and take in the beauty it has to offer. Great history, timeless people watching, and looking back up to the shore was stunning. A must for anyone traveling that part of the pch
This is a nice beach and it has beautiful houses along the coast, but it was crowded. It could have been when we went, but it was busy and a lot of people go here. Check out Manhattan beach instead.

I have been at the Pier a couple of times before and found it rather nice. But this time itvwas so crowded with thousands of Pokemon hunters that it was no fun at all.I went back the following morning at 7am for a morning walk and it was much much better!!So ... A morning beach walk with visit to the Pier is the thing to do till the pokemon hype is over ...
My family had a decent time here. Unfortunately we all felt like he pier was too short. They should try to add to it. We spent $12 on parking but walked the pier in just 1/2 hour.

It's really just another ocean pier with the requisite number of rides, eats, shops, and other attractions. It's iconic, so you owe it to yourself to go there, The beach is great and watching the surfers is fun. Go to have a fun couple hours, but don't expect to be wowed

column2: A classic! You have to go at least once in your life!
column3: Nice way to spend a few hours. My son recognized the place from Grand Theft Auto!! He thought that was so great! The rides are kinda " hokey" but still fun. And you have to have ice cream!!
The rollercoaster is the best ride for teens. Typical Pier. Food offering was pretty limited. It was very very busy on a Saturday night.

this place is a family place. it has game rooms, roller coasters , bumper cars and nice restaurants to eat at. It was one of the highlights of our trip. We enjoyed the arcade , and it wasnt over priced.If you are going to do the rides, buy the wrist bands, unless you are going to let your kids only do one ride. The band is defiantly worth it.The peir itself is free to go on , the rides and games are not.

Enjoyed our visit to the pier, but was very very busy. The rides and side shows are quite pricey. We went up the big wheel which gives a brilliant view of the pier and the beach ($20 for 4 of us...) We liked the 'buskers' which added to the atmosphere.We used the Bubbagumps which was okay just not as good as we remember for last year in Orlando.
I was only for lunch , but there are several restaurants and an amusement park game for us and the beach to stroll .Always a lot of people there

My family walked from Santa Monica to Venice Beach in the afternoon, got a ride back in an electric car and capped the night off at the pier with the sunset and a ride on the Ferris wheel! It was a night I will never forget! The pier has all of the amusement park cravings, lights, music, games & food! I personally liked it better after dark. I found the rides to be a little pricey, ($8 per person for the Ferris wheel) but that's just me. Don't miss this iconic landmark!!

Lovely surrounding with oceans and most beautiful, crowded beaches and activities you ever seen.The pier boardwalk is one of most lovely and family friendly places in whole LA. There is plenty of domestic restaurants: shrimp or beef. Every 10 m there is street artists singing or dancing, entertaining the crowd. There is famous amusement park with attractions for whole family. Wether you visit the pier in the noon or late in the evening there will be a lots to see and do. Plenty of restaurants, amusement and souvenir shops. Get yourself a Route 66 sign on its very end destination, or grab a small surfing board when you already are there. You can park your car on the pier or some of huge parking areas surrounding beaches and pier. Parking on the beach parking costs about 15 $ or 18 $ on the pier- flat rate.You need to know that whole area is very crowded and located by couple of major highways so you will be waiting. Add this to your plans.But when you are there you will have a great experience whether you choose a budget or some more expensive visit.

The pier is as well kept as it can be. It was unbelievably busy but i suspect it would be like this daily. Lots of food outlets and souvenir stands. Saw it and probably wouldn't go back, but at least I've seen it.
Had a great time always when u get to see the beautiful ocean. Parking is always a challenge But there is now a train that will bring us here without the hassle of finding parking.
It was very busy when we went here. Lots of people walking around. We went to ride the Carousel and walk by the Pacific Park with my son.

column2: Must do, this place is Iconic!!
column3: It goes without saying that if you have you Have not visited Santa Monica and I should've gone down to the pier I would recommend parking further away and walking to the peer and enjoying all the sites that abound on the way.

We took the kids. The unlimited ride wristband was like $18 bucks! My daughter rode everything a million times. It was crowded, but the lines for the rides weren't long at all. there is something up here for everyone to enjoy. Expensive food!

column2: Great place to go , there are rides and shops and food and the beach view is spectacular
column3: If you want to go to swim it's a great place and I went to just walk and we bought souvenirs to take back to Dubai and there was many carts with food and resteraunts and there were rides and games for entertainment and people were fishing and I saw many many people playing Pokemon go - loads of poke stops

Visited here with my 14-year old daughter on a very hot Sunday afternoon in July. It was WAY too crowded. I've been before at night, when it's lots of fun because it's all lit up. It's like a mini-boardwalk. There are vendors selling trinkets, buskers singing for donations, ice cream shops, and a great little amusement park (which you can see on the picture). We did have fun, even though it was crowded. You can also fish off the pier, although I have absolutely no interest in that!
Nice place to visit. Very crowded. Parking is difficult. Third Street Promenade is nice but also very crowded.
Sunny day, nice breezes, lots of venues from which to choose, got a close parking spot! Great area for walking and enjoying a relaxing day.
This is a nice place at the Santa Monica beach to bring the kids to have fun. There are rides suitable for all ages. At night this area is flooded with people. Some even are soaking in the beach.

A great day or evening out with loads of fun rides, arcades, performers and plenty of choice for food! The pier does get VERY busy though so be sure to keep your little ones and all bags and belongings close and in sight! Would highly recommend a visit to this iconic part of Santa Monica!

Its a fun spot to visit, very crowded like expected,reminds me of the Jersey shores when i was i kid. Its a must see spot, just sit back and enjoy. It is a shame though that people dont pick up their trash on the beach.

We love this place!!! It's always crowded even on weekdays. We can hang out in here all day and night! The kids love the rides and my hubby and I enjoy the ambience of the place sharing a few scoops of ice cream or a funnel cake ala mode!
It was such a spectacular pier filled with life and laughter. Great activities for the kids and just has a unique and relaxed atmosphere.

The pier is an exceptional family location for all tourists and locals. You can enjoy a lovely walk to the Pier along the beach front. The Pier is an excellent spot to take family photos as well as scenic pictures it's worth going to the pier just for a family memory. I highly recommend visiting this iconic land mark.

I was so excited to finally see THE PIER! And after traveling the country over and seeing many of the landmark piers sadly the SMP was underwhelming. Same old same old. And much smaller than most pier attractions.

Not a cheap night but for sure something to experience once. We went about 5:00 and stayed for 4 hours. My kids enjoyed the rides and the games. The wrist band was worth it for them. I am glad they allow the purchase of a ticket for one ride.
awesome and if you like to have fun and be close to the beach, this is the place for you.... bring the family

Stopped here for 2-3 hours on way out of town. Parking , on average is about $8-9 all day. There are lots of car parks all along the sea front. It better to park further down and hire a bike to ride up to the pier.There are designated cycle lanes and everyone is on bikes, roller blades or scooters! The beach is sandy and had plenty of little cafes and of course the pier with shops and places to eat!

The Santa Monica Pier is iconic and a must see .. it is the end of Route 66. It is a very busy place, there are street performers and lots of visitors. The fun park is a great backdrop for photos and it was nice to walk to the end of the pier and look back. The beach is so wide but there were plenty of beachgoers. We got an uber ride from an LAX hotel to Santa Monica which cost $17 one way. I highly recommend visiting the Pier and Santa Monica in general.

We visited the pier at night for a couple of hours after a day of sight seeing in LA and Hollywood. It was a great time. Rode the ferris wheel, not cheap but worth it. Lots to see and do and the views of the ocean are incredible.

column2: A must do Santa Monica experience
