column3: Have had the great privilege to be on the pier a few times now. It is a great experience with lovely restaurants, shops and vendors all the way through. The view over land and sea is simply amazing and at sunset it is just awesome. Pick up some great souvenirs and trinkets as well as enjoy some good food and drinks.

column2: Santa Monica Pier is national treasure
column3: Love the Pier. I often walk there with my little dog, end to end. There is so much to see and enjoy. I love standing at the end watching the waves break and flow into the beach. Fishermen are there catching fish (of course). Entertainers are everywhere, musicians, artists, etc. People watching is great. The restaurants are quite good and clean. You cannot be in Santa Monica and not go to the Pier.

column2: Way to crowded for a family
column3: Me and my wife along with our 14 year old and 4yr old twins went to the pier and it was way to full for a family. Tons of homeless people along with locals who cuss and care nothing for tourists. Would not go again.

Had a fantastic time. It was a Saturday night so it was very crowded but not a problem. There were some long lines for food and rides but it all kind of Blends in with the atmosphere. My date and I had a fantastic time. Lots of fun being had by everyone singles, couples, and groups. Gives a very nostalgic feel. The pier is located right over the beach and has easy access. I made the walk over from 3rd Street Promenade and it's only a couple of blocks. I love visiting there whenever I'm in the Los Angeles area. It's also the end of historic Route 66.

column2: Iconic attraction. It'll already look familiar because you've seen it in countless movies and TV shows!
column3: Fun to browse. The kids will like the rides. And the whole family (or couples) will appreciate the ferris wheel at sunset....the lights, the sky, the ocean, the vista...the whole package:) The kids will appreciate the carousal on the other end of the pier as well, and the adults it's history! The history of the pier itself is very interesting...too long a story for here but you might want to google it:)
This last Sunday night it was so incredibly crowded, you start wondering if it would be possible to evacuate at all. As always it is so nice to be back here again!

Fun easy place to hangout or visit as a tourist. The rides are kind of old and the arcade games are old but it's a great view and it's easy. The Farris wheel is an awesome view of the city and every Thursday in the summer they have free concerts that are really fun. You sit in the sand to watch the concerts and you can bring wine to drink if you keep it low key.

Decided to visit Santa Monica pier for the afternoon. We parked at the promenade Wenger the first 90 minutes are free. Or afternoon parking cost less than $5.00. We ate lunch at the mall and then walked down to the pier. There were some street performers along the way. The pier itself has some pretty uneven boards, so be careful not to trip or roll your ankle. We rode the ferris wheel (8.00 per person) and called it a day. Fun, but not something is do very often.

What a place, brilliant pier with fantastic views. At the end of the pier if yiu go down at dusk you can actually feed the seals they come right upto you. Brilliant place my brother lives here and wouldn't change it for the world second visit planned already for next year.

column2: Ordinary peer with a chance to see seals.
column3: Nothing special really. A bunch of takeaway restaurants and some rides.I though it will be more special for being LA but nothing to envy Brighton' pier in the UK.The good thing is that if you are lucky you may see some seals
We visited for the day via metro line from Hollywood. We rented segways in Santa Monica which was a lot of fun. We stayed on a bike path that took us to Venice beach.

We were hanging there and had some lunch all together. The view is spectacular, rides are cute (didnt take any) and it is possible to have some souvenirs.Take a lot of photos cuz scenery is breathtaking. But, it might be windy so be prepared.

Went on a Sunday and yes, it was crowded. Parking was a major disaster with narrow spaces. Gridlock in and out. Pier was crowded like they were giving away free stuff, and the beach looked like a landfill. Suggest going away from pier, but if you have to go - be prepared!
This is an amazing pier and the beach is awesome. However, if you want to rest and relax while you are at the beach this is not the right place to be because it is quite crowded
Loved it. Great atmosphere. Good place to watch sun go down. Queues for big wheel very long so didn't do it. Probably not much point at night.

Santa Monica is a wonderful and relaxing place to vacation. Whether you just want to chill and relax on the beach or venture into the LA city attractions it offers both options. Would definitely recommend for families with older children who are able to do a lot of walking.
This is a great place to visit and walk around. There are many interesting shops and interesting people performing on the pier. The view at the end of the pier is fantastic

It was super busy, but worth the trip. We lucked into a parking space which cost $12 for 3 hours. The only downside to the beach was it smelled of seaweed and the Pacific Ocean was extremely cold. Lots of free entertainment of random singers for tips only. I spoke to an artist who drew caricatures- he said he would draw our picture (two of us) for tips from $10- my shoes; he would take anything offered. I saw a man who sold key chains for 1 for $6.99 or 2 for $10.00. The food and drinks were exceedingly expensive. The people were friendly. They had a park on the beach for children and an exercise place which resembled an American Ninja Warrior workout camp. You could rent many different types of bikes such as a regular bike, the ones which have a chair for a seat, tandem for two, 3 wheeled stand up bikes which they had manual and motorized. There were at least 8-10 rides mostly for children with the exception of the roller coaster and Ferris wheel.

column2: Tourist area with lots of people waiting to do something...
column3: If you want to just walk the pier it is good people watching BUT if you are planning on eating, etc. don't bother. It is crowded and made for tourist. It is fun though to see all the street performers and novelty items. Don't expect an upscale experience this is the West's version of Coney Island...

If you like the beach, but just watch it then a pier is the best for you.This pier has a lot of things in it, first bubba bump and a Mexican restaurant at the end of it also the fast food chains near the little amusement park. A LOT of street singer and homeless and of course tourist making their way through the pier. At the end of it, it is less crowded and you can appreciate the ocean in its entirety.

I'm glad we visited this iconic locale, but I was underwhelmed. I thought there would be more rides and things to do. Plus, the ones that were there were super expensive to ride -- $16 for two people to have one ride on the ferris wheel.

We were in California for a Disney Land vacation. We had a few extra days in California that we kept "plan free" so we could find things to do. We bought wristbands and rode everything a few times. We had fun. Loved the view from the ferris wheel!

column2: Took a walk but it was too packed
column3: After dinner, my wife and I took a walk onto the pier with some of her co-workers. The pier was nice and had a lot to off such as rides, food and entertainment but was too packed. We went in the early evening too so I'm not sure the best time to go would be.

The pier is probably the best known feature of Santa Monica, and it's well worth a visit. It's always crowded, but it is a fun place to explore. To park, you can either drive down the ramp to the pier and park in the lot immediately next to the pier, or you can park in one of the many lots around Santa Monica and walk down to the pier. The pier provides a great view of the beach, the coast line, and the surrounding mountains. It has the look and feel of an old-fashioned carnival, which is a big part of its charm.

column2: Lots of Lots of performers, bluest water, nice walkperformers, bluest water, nice walk
column3: Santa Monica pier was very nice. There were lots of things to see and do. They had lots of performers to entertain you, vendors, food, and amusement rides. It was very crowded on a Friday but a nice place to visit if you are near LA.

We were in Santa Monica for a day as part of our travels north and decided to explore the beach and pier.It's definitely worth a look as it is supposedly the end of Route 66.A few places to eat and some great views of the coast and just nice to chill out for a while.
I love this pier. It is a large pier always filled with people and excitement. The views from the pier to the mountains and then down the coast to other beaches is just gorgeous.

We've visited the Santa Monica Pier many times when we have vacationed in L.A. You can park below the pier if it's not too crowded, however we like to park at nearby Santa Monica Place and walk over (about two blocks away). Note that you can only park in the Santa Monica Place ramp for a maximum of 3 hours, so if you plan to stay longer, you'll need to park at the pier or try to find some street parking, which will involve a walk. Another possibility is to park at Venice Beach and rent a bicycle to ride over to the pier. (Bikes can be walked on the pier, but not rode.) We always ride the ferris wheel, so we can take pictures of the area. Great views! The ferris wheel admission is about $8/person, so is not cheap. It's a great place to watch street performers, shop for souvenirs, grab a bite, or just walk and look. Always an inviting place.

column2: One of the most iconic Piers in the world
column3: This is an amazing care as it is been here for so many years. It is been used in many movies so. They have concerts during the summertime on Thursday nights. If you're in the Santa Monica beach area it's definitely the place to visit. You could take the metro rail down to fourth street and walk a few blocks to the pier. This place is definitely worth a visit!!

We really enjoyed the Santa Monica Pier. We were there for about 2 hours, but we did not hang out on the beach. We parked at a hotel that was nearby and walked to the pier. We paid $20 to park, but we probably could have found cheaper parking. There is a lot by the pier, but I recommend getting there early because I think it filled up by early afternoon. We ate Pier Burger, and it was really good...and affordable. It was fun walking on the pier and looking in the little shops. I did take off my shoes and get in the water. There was a little amusement park there that was about $5/ride or $20 for an all day bracelet. We did not do the amusement park.

Crazy busy environment. Lots of kid rides but expensive. Great views of the beach.. But tons of people on pier.. The usual pier foods and shopping. A must see spot but doesn't need much time out of your trip
This place is very nice to relax, enjoy the view and having a beer talking with friends. Spetacular place.

Had a lot of fun, but bring your wallet. Do not go to the arcade, 2 out of the 3 games we played did not work and lost our money. The Ferris wheel is a must for great photo of the whole beach. All in all a very fun trip.
It's alot of people want to see crazy people or people who perform so come hereIt's not like Venice Beach. There is amusement park aswell

My kids loved this place packed with games and rides and lots of junk food. Great restaurants to choose from and shops along the way. Parking can be a bit difficult during the heavy times but once you get there it's great!
It is very hard to move because there are so many people walking very slowly while looking at their phones.
Crazy busy - too many people - nice to say we have been there but that is it. Shopping in the Promenade was good and so were drinks.

column2: A fun family afternoon while travelling PCH.
column3: We parked the car in the main car park beside the pier. It costs $15. The pier is the official end of Route 66. It's very busy but was nice to walk on to the very end. There are lots of stalls and outlets selling food, ice cream and souvenirs. Also plenty of toilets. I would recommend going on the Ferris Wheel, the views of this enormous beach are incredible and you can see over the city too. We never stood in queues for long for anything, not even ladies toilets! We watched a cheeky seal catching the fish as the fishermen threw them back into the water. Then we wandered down onto the beach and spent the rest of the day there. Make sure to find the gymnastic park near the pier and hire bikes too. Got some great photos!
I enjoyed the hustle and bustle. I'm sure I would have stayed longer if the kids had come along. The beach is great. Lots of families splashing about.
One of those things you should see while you are in Santa Monica but not one of the highlights of the place. Tourist trap. Ride the Ferris wheel, hot dog from Japadog

We visited on Memorial Day, so the crowds were thick. From the carnival foods to eat, the rides to enjoy and the people to watch, the Pier is a slice of all-Americana. There is even an indoor carousel, so if the weather turns bad, you can retreat indoors.

This was a great stop for us while visiting LA for the first time with children. The restaurants and the beachfront were very crowded but not unmanageable. Only one complaint, the bicycle/umbrella etc rental shop on the pier was blasting really inappropriate music. No one else seemed bothered. I took our kids out while my husband completed a rental - no other options within walking distance.

column2: Nice view from top of hill
column3: Walked down from Hill above to pier. Nice view,and pleasant walk.Plenty of people at different ages enjoying the area. Beach and pier well attended. Plenty to see and do.

column2: Too crowded and nothing to see
column3: We visited the beach and pier with family. What I love about the beach is how expansive it is. There is an incredible distance between the water and where the sand ends (i.e. Road, parking lot, etc) so there is plenty of space to run around and play. Now, we were there in May when it was still a bit cool (I'm from Florida so I get cold when it dips below 75). There were a lot of people! The pier was miserable because all you did was dodge people the entire time due to how crowded it was. There isn't anything special to see there so just skip it and stay on the beach. There were some fun street shows just off the pier though.
This icon pier at Santa Monica is the end of the famous Route 66.Its very tourist but the again what seaside pier isn't.Nothing great in terms of food.Lots of rides and tourist shops

column2: Don't leave Santa Monica without coming here
column3: Yes, it's very very crowded, but well worth going. Once you get on the pier, the crowds spread out and it's not terrible. There's plenty to do - amusement rides and games, dining, snacks, people watch, and of course look out over the beautiful ocean. Tip: don't park on the pier - park elsewhere and walk to it.

I absolutely loved visiting the pier. First of all, the views are amazing. During the day it is great to be near the water, but the sunsets toward night time are a must see. Going here with family and small kids is a great idea with the amusement park rides! So much to offer here with the games too.Also, if you're looking for a place to eat, there was a great Mexican restaurant at the end. I recommend this to all in the area! Any amount of time here is well spent!

column2: Such a lovely place to visit
column3: I have such fond memories of this place, from when I originally visited when I was a kid. To come back this year, brought all those memories flooding back. The pier itself I don't actually rate all too highly. It's the beach directly next to it that's perfect.You get a perfect view of the pier, and the ocean, and of Santa Monica behind you. The conditions are perfect, everything's right with the world. Visit Santa Monica Pier for that feeling.
We ate here- pizza was about $40 for 3 people, overpriced. Ice cream was also overpriced but good. The Ferris wheel was my favorite part. Kids loved all the pokestops more than anything.
The Pier is a must visit, to see the iconic Ferris wheel. The views are amazing, and the beach is lovely just below. There are lots of good quality restaurants along the pier.

I have been here a few times and it is a beautiful pier, however there must have been thousands of Pokemon Go players standing around on their phones, we were playing our own game of dodge the Pokemaniacs and it was quite fun. I always recommend taking a stroll down the Pier.

column2: NOT TO BE MISSED WHEN VISITING L.A.
column3: The Famous Santa Monica Pier is one of those sights that should not be missed, especially for those travelers who land in LAX from across the Pacific eg China, Australia, New Zealand , Japan etc. Santa Monica is only 20 minutes or so by taxi/car from LAX , is safe area and the Pier is a great experience to walk along the pier, see side shows, artists, souvenier booths etc and generally stretch your legs and overcome any jet lag. In summer it might be crowded, especially weekends as it; as well as the beach are popular with locals. Many films have been made here over the years too many to mention, but when you get home, you will recognize the sights.

column2: Okay for a quick walk after dinner
column3: It was nice walking around the pier after dinner. Unless you are into doing rides and the Ferris wheel.Otherwise it's like any other boardwalk in america. Lots of souvenirs shops and fast food.
The rides are fun and there are a lot of things to do. The views a amazing and the beach is right there.

column2: Fun way to enjoy the beach without getting in the water!
column3: Watching the waves, eating ice cream and a cool breeze while walking the pier, the shoreline and enjoying all the people was a great day. The pier offers food, drinks, ice cream, rides, and for those getting in the water, an outdoor shower to wash off the sand. We really enjoyed our day at the Santa Monica Pier. Then we headed for the Santa Monica Promenade.

column2: Lots to see, lots of tourists!
column3: We used the hop- on hop-off bus to visit the iconic pier. Although crowded, it has a great vibe and is certainly worth the visit. The buskers on the pier itself were hugely entertaining and the best we've seen anywhere in the world. It is easy to while away the afternoon just watching them. There are many food options, from quick takeaway to sit down restaurant service. Regardless of age, make sure to have a ride on the beautiful carousel. The only negative was the number of homeless appealing for handouts and cigarettes in the parks near the pier ( but we found this common everywhere).
A typical must see when visiting LA.Very crowded, rather outdated...Nevertheless worth a short visit.Has a real 'Zoltar' machine...

column2: Nice For A Tourist Stop Off
column3: Walking the pier is a nice experience. If you want to go to the beach, you can take stairs down to the beach. There are several restaurants and fair foods. There are rides and arcade games. There's souvenir shopping and plenty to entertain you as you walk the pier. I went here as a solo tourist and felt safe. No harassment at all.
We go back a lot. We are a family ranging in age from 3 to 72 and we all love it. We ride the rides, eat lunch on the pier, ride the carousel and take a swim. What more could you want!

column2: Hyde family of 4 from New Zealand
column3: Great place too visit but very busy in July and also very hot. We hired bikes at the Pier for the day - cost 64.00 that we thought was reasonably priced. Rode aƒ∫l the way down past Venice beach stopping at various shops on the way. Expect to see some outrageous people along the way. Fun day out for family

column2: Great pictures but didn't stay long
column3: We came here as a part of a guided tour and I'm really glad we got to see it. What I most wanted a picture of was the "End of the Trail" for Route 66. Since we live where Route 66 starts it was great to see the end.This pier was also the beginning of some great reality shows (Amazing Race and Great Food Truck Race Route 66). You do get some amazing views and awesome photos, but the family preferred the laid back Venice Beach with room to spread out and much more to see. That being said, Santa Monica is only a 2 mile walk from Venice and you should do it.
Always busy and bustling! Lots of stuff to do and lots of interesting people around. If you want a break from the beach then you should definitely venture onto the pier
The pier is a traditional seaside pier but with a number of quirky and interesting personalities with a variety of performances. Great fun for everyone
This place is by far one of the most beautiful beaches! Plenty plenty people but totally enjoyed it!!

Hahahahaha we couldn't believe it but obviously found ourselves in a Pok√©mon frenzy!!!!! Everyone was chasing them and it was standing room only on the Pier!!!! An experience in itself so we'll have to come again when it returns to normal.

It's an historical pier that now seems inhabited by a majority of Pokemon Go players. Heads bowed to phones, walking into you and blocking the walkways. Compared to previous visits this really detracts from the carnival atmosphere.

After dining at a water view restaurant, my wife and I went for a walk on the pier. There is dining, fast food and carnival snacks and games available. The views of Malibu and Palos Verdes were fantastic. The people were colorful. The downside were the small number of mentally unstable individuals milling around. I definitely was on guard around some of the folks.

It's a carnival on water. The views are great but the pier doesn't take advantage of anything tranquil or scenic- unless you're eating at the restaurant. But even then the walk in your business-casual outfit can be awkward. Walk out, snap a selfie, return to land and walk along the Palisades or 3rd street promenade ( tons of descent restaurants and street entertainment)

column2: great place, lots of people, lots to do
column3: Carnival, restaurants, scenery, gift shops, etc. Crawling with oodles of people is this place. parking is horrible as both the freeway i-10 and PCH1 both feed directly here. big beach to the north of the Pier collects thousands of people!
What a amazing experience at Santa Monica Pier. Beautiful people. amazing vie, great atmosphere. Love it so much. Will go there again and again.

The Pier was an amazing stop on our short holiday to LA from Las Vegas. A spontaneous choice, Santa Monica Pier surpassed the descriptions and delivered on the total "pier/carnival" experience. There was a HUSH dance party going on, rides and food of course, and the beautiful Pacific Ocean. People-watching is free, and we soaked it up...mostly watching the Pokemon Go players!I highly recommend this stop when visiting LA.
Really fun place with plenty to do and see, definitely a must do if you have a family with kids. Or if you're just a big kid like me haha!

We (husband, brother in law, nephew, and I ) all went to the pier to catch up on life as well as walk on the beach with playing in the waves waiting for our dinner reservations for Bubba Gump restaurant. It was an amazing time to walk the pier to see the sites, sounds and watch the sun set over the ocean. Great atmosphere and so much to do for all ages.

This pier has lived many lives, and is one of the most enduring features of the LA / Santa Monica coastal landscape. The rides are tame but fun, there are great summer time events like movies and concerts, and plenty of fun bars and restaurants. I personally just like walking on the pier. Its worth a look

We went around 630p on Saturday and it was still so crowded even when we left at 10p...with people still coming in. The views were beautiful. I suggest you get there early or off peak hours if you plan on eating at one of the restaurants on the pier. The wait is soooo long. The Albright was the fastest at 45min. Bubba Gump was the longest at 2.5hours. But they do have a few food carts for snacks and small munchies to hold you over.

column2: Exactly like you'd think it would be
column3: Don't be all surprised when you get here & there's folks & cool stuff to look at everywhere, it's RIGHT outside Los Angeles. The Pacific Ocean is beautiful & perfectly visible from here. Bring your camera & some loot & enjoy the atmosphere. DON'T FORGET YOUR SHOES! I DID manage to hook up w/ a large splinter that I wasn't trying for. Be blessed!
Santa Monica Pier has always been a family favorite. Although a lot of the time it is very busy, we still manage to have a lot of fun.

I guess the popularity of this place and presence of a theme park is what causes this place to be over crowded.Many people, less food options and only good if you have young kids.The beach is nice but crowded. Good view though, if you can manage seat at hotspot

Visited the Pier while at the Santa Monica Beach and it was a really neat place. The rides all looked fun and the lines were moving smoothly. I can just imagine how they looked from up in the air!!! Was able to see a sailboat and amazing looking waves from the Pier headed out into the water and a great picture opportunity!! Next time I'll be on the rides!

column2: Lots do do with a beautiful beach
column3: Set right into the sea, this pier has rides, parking, restaurants and things to do.The weather is fair, take sunblock for the day and maybe take a jumper for the evening.It's really worth it.
You can't not go to this pier and see the energy it produces . Went on a weekend and it was packed . If your in la don't miss it . A must see

column2: Old fashioned fun on a historic pier
column3: The Santa Monica Pier has lots of fun in different ways. There's the Pacific Park which has thrill rides (not scary) and the iconic ferris wheel. There are plenty of places to eat, from cheap to expensive. You can enjoy looking at the beach and watch the waves crash on shore as well as the Santa Monica shoreline. The pier can now be reached by the Metro Expo line which terminates just a few blocks from the Pier. Santa Monica Place and the Third Street Promenade are also nearby, so there are many shops and restaurants in short walking distance. Nice day to spend at the beach at the end the road for Highway 66.

We came in here to meet my partner's friend. This is the famous Santa Monica. Makes me remmber Baywatch time.. and all those movies that has girls on roller blades wearin bikinis.It was a good stroll..relaxing.I would definitely come back.
It is nice to have been here, to have seen it and experienced it. But too much commerce and too crowded for my taste.
We walked out to the pier and took lots of pictures. It was fun to see a famous place on a gorgeous day. We went in the shops but didn't do any of the amusement rides or activities.

column2: SO busy, which made it a little uncomfortable
column3: This was my third or forth time at the pier, but the first time going at night. Oh my GOSH was it busy! Honestly, every single phone I looked at had Pokemon Go on it, so I'm 100% sure that it was packed because of this. I even heard a few people talking about how there were so many there. If you go while this craze is still huge, then it will probably be uncomfortably busy as well. Luckily we only went to go on the Pacific Wheel so we did that and left. The line took almost an hour though.If you like carnival games and rides, then this is the place for you. If not I would say you can skip it (maybe after taking one iconic photo).My last thought is that for such a popular place, they need to keep their bathrooms cleaner. I don't have words for what I saw in a few of those. üò®

We recently drove over to the Santa Monica Pier after flying into LA. The pier is a piece of Americana that you've got to visit if you're in the area. We rode the ferris wheel and had a wonderful lunch at The Albright. We had a really grand time at the pier!

Santa Monica Pier was extremely busy the day we were there, a weekend . The beach beside the pier is beautiful but crowded. The pier itself has lots to see and do with a carousel for the kids which is under cover, great to get out of the sun for a while & a Ferris Wheel in the amusement park. There's ice cream shops, a Bubba Gump store, lots of other places to buy souvenirs or food. Great area at the end of the pier to fish. Plenty to see & do even if you don't want to swim at the beach or fish off the pier, great spot & very picturesque.

Having visited the pier years ago I was happy to be returning. The atmosphere is fun and lively. Great place to people watch! Love to go to the end and watch the people fishing.Seems to be even more crowded with Pok√©mon Go in full effect over the world.So here are my cautions ... have a charged phone, keep your kids close, hit up the Pokestops and watch for crowds running in a direction together because chances are there is a rare Pok√©mon that just appeared, avoid the weekends, and actually look up ... get your face out of your phone so you don't run into people because you will surely have people run into you.

column2: A great teenager and toddler mix of fun
column3: So fun and priced right for an arm band ride experience. Great for teenagers and toddlers 42" tall. The games were fun and the food was good. The artists and the souvenirs were well priced. Have to ride the Farris wheel!

I love Santa Monica, and the pier is fun during the day. The breeze and ocean smell is wonderful, and the old and new rides are great. I even enjoy the arcade where we play Skeeball and Foosball.In the middle of tourist season on a Saturday night, it is packed with youth and young families. I mean packed; extremely, scarily crowded. I would be afraid to bring small children there, for fear of losing track of them in the crowd. While I don't always mind being in crowds, I don't like shuffling along like the "walking dead go to disneyland", waiting in long lines for most rides, etc. I walked out to the end and back with several friends on a Saturday night in July. We rode the beautiful old merry-go-round, played in the arcade, wandered around a bit, and actually got got in a crowd that barely moved trying to get out. Next time, I'd maybe try a Monday night, go on a weekday, or wait til Fall...?
One of the most famous marks of the city , we enjoyed a walk through the pier , it was great the different crowds , must see attraction .

column2: Walked the pier at night- pretty
column3: Spent a beautiful evening walking on the pier. We didn't go on any rides but did enjoy the evening. They have little shops set up so it was neat to see all that was offered.

column2: A fun place to visit ... By Metro E line
column3: We came to the Pier to see the sights and enjoy the sunset. We found horrific traffic getting there and especially getting away. If you have to drive, pre-plan your parking location for Right-turns to quickly get you away from the water front. Better yet, park a stop or two away on the Metro E line and walk the three long blocks from the last station to the pier. Trust me on this one - don't try to drive right to the pier.

The pier has some good views along the beach towards the cliffs at Malibu.There are plenty of opportunities to spend money, with gift shops and restaurants, as well as the small theme park which has a ferris wheel and a small rollercoaster.

Walking along the broadwalk to the famous pier wow even tho it's on a slight hill it is worth the walk. Beautiful food and clothing stores at very good prices.*********And lots of Pokemon on the pier ******

Just a place at the shore line. Luna Park for the little ones, way too crowded burger restaurant though pretty good. Come here only if you want to have a day at the beach otherwise you can skip - does not worth the traffic challenge to get here.

column2: Ok but pretty much like any seaside prier
column3: Went with my girlfriend and it was a pleasant visit however didn't stay long as it's really more tailored to younger children. Good that we checked it out briefly but didn't hang out there too long.

column2: Cool sight, nice pier to visit.
column3: Very typical fight to visit in area. Enjoyable to walk around and see the "typical coastal" scene as you have in so many tv shows and such. Prices for the attractions are what you should expect for a beach attraction. Visited it before and like the feel of the place for walking around after a meal in one of the area restarants up on the walking street area.

column2: Great time was had by all!
column3: Came here for a night with my family in March, had dinner, ice cream, watched the sunset and rode rides. We had a blast.

Crowded, colourful, loud place wit restaurants, funfair and shops. As you probably expect the prices of souvenirs and food are ridiculously high but the place and the view from there are definitely worth to visit.

Spent a few hours there on a bright sunny day. Lots of buskers and entertainment. Plenty of souvenir stands and amusements for the kids.Quite a few places to get something to eat or drink as well.And of course it is the start of the historic Route 66, something that is well publicized.Worth a visit if heading to Santa Monica

column2: So much to see and do
column3: This is a magic spot to visit and chill and take in the vibe. Whether it is to play on the side shows or eat at Bubba Gumps or just people watch, its a place you can go again and again

Just a great spot to hang out during the day and watch people. Especially now that the train goes here it makes it easy to hit it up for a day of beaching/ drinking/ eating.Must see spot in LA next to Venice beach.If you're staying near Hollywood Blvd take note that in July 2016 it took us two hours to get to SM on the train. So plan accordingly. We heard it was one hour but not the case.
Loved the pier, so used to seeing it on television was nice to actually be there. People playing music and singing, great to stroll along and people watch.

Very nice area to relax, watch the surfers, eat some snacks. We met our Chinese friends after a busy tradeshow at the pier. So nice to be outside, you can either watch the history of the pier on the plaquettes, or walk down to the beach.

column2: Now it's done there is no need to return
column3: This place seems to me to be designed strictly for tourists. Overpriced, extremely busy and so not enjoyable. But I've done it now and will never return.
The pier was cool and very busy. We stopped by and kids went on rides. A bit overpriced but it's a tourist trap. It is a must see though.

Visited on Sunday 10th so very busy, very crowded but still entertaining. The whole of life is here from the homeless to bible preaching, musicians to tacky souvenir sellers. The area is definitely worth a visit and the Pacific Park has some fun rides ( how often do you get to have a roller coaster ride in such a setting? ).
It's worth one visit to say you've been. The arrival of the tram link to LA makes this very busy all the time. Free concerts are mega busy and you need to be early to get within 200m on the beach.

My first time to the pier was almost 20 years ago and it's still just as fun. Lots of people, lots to do, and the beach is fun for all ages. Rent a bike and head to Malibu or go the other way to Venice. So much fun.

One of the loveliest bays I've ever seen...sea is blue ...sky is blue...many restaurants are there...seafood and many other items besides drinks...it's always crowded...there are happy hours in many places...you can walk, swim, hear music, play arcade games...

I found my attention bouncing between the street performers like the rock-roll Jesus and the people that are taking in these performances. The fact that I was on a pier over the Pacific could hardly compete.

So cute and nice to see a pier doing so well! There are live musicians and fairground rides as well as shops and people making products to sell, we bought a little momentum from a man who painted the pier using just his fingers and these were only $10 so very reasonable!

column2: The pier is a beautiful place!
column3: We visited the pier on a beautiful bright sunny day and saw the amazing views up and down the beach. Was awesome to see how many people using various methods of transport on the path and the alternate gym equipment set up in the sand. Recommend visiting if your in the area.
Be prepared to park away and walk along the foreshore. This is ok cause it's all about the journey just to say you've been there done that. Still I do it every visit and I enjoy it.

I went here with my spouse, our 6 yr old and 3 year old. Everything was soooo overpriced and sooooo not worth it! There were hardly any rides, let alone rides for my young kids to ride. The whole place felt dirty. I am originally from the east coast, so maybe I'm biased on what a boardwalk amusement park should look/feel like. Who spends $35-$40 on four ppl to ride a Ferris wheel ONCE?!?!? Complete rip off! I'll take the east coast any day over this nonsense!

I know this is a very iconic LA landmark, but admire from afar--do not waste your time walking the pier, buying junky trinkets or braving the overpriced rollercoaster. Instead rent a bike nearby & hip on the Strand -the paved pathway that runs south to Venice Beach. You'll get a real sense of the beach communities while biking in the sun & taking in the beautiful ocean views!

We wanted to see Santa Monica and especially the pier while in the area. My kids and I parked quite a way from the pier and enjoyed a stroll along the promenade to the pier. We were struck by to things, the cleanliness and upscale nature of the Santa Monica area compared to other places we visited in the area. That said it contrasted with the HUGE homeless problem the area has. You could not walk more than 10 feet along the promenade without there being more homeless people sleeping out (this was late morning/early afternoon). I felt bad for the homeless and it is clearly a problem for the area. However, to have the homeless on show throughout the beach front area is a huge tourist problem for the local community. Overall we enjoyed the stay but definitely marred by this problem and not sure it is top of our list to return to.Santa Monica pier had quite a bit to offer, but on the day we arrived the pier attractions had a private event so we could not let the kids go on any of the rides :(

column2: Easy access to Pier-lots to do!
column3: The Santa Monica Pier was lots of fun. It is very crowded-packed to the hilt on weekends, but still worth the trip there. Much to do-bars, restaurants, the ice cream at Soda Jerks is delicious! The rides are great and the view and ocean breeze are fantastic. You can park right next to the Pier or go a few blocks into town for some cheaper parking lots.

Such a good vibe on this Pier!! Lots to see and do and eat!! Even the public sanitation stops were pretty decent - keeping in mind that on a busy day 1000's of visitors are accommodated. Visible POLICE gives a good sense of feeling save. Thank you SANTA MONICA‚ù§Ô∏è

You can't claim you have been to Los Angeles until you go here. The atmosphere is upbeat and the weather is wonderful. Take a sweater at night.You can eat junk food,people watch or have a nice dinner. And don't forget the rides
Massive crowds of dirty masses clamoring around with bratty kids and crying babies. If you're smart enough to read tripadvisor for this, don't go.
Sightseeing at thos famous pier is a must see while visiting this area. This is a world famous place. Well worth the visit.
I spent the day there and it was OK. Glad I went and had a look around but it might be better with going with the kids to play at he beach.

If you're visiting LA this is obviously a must stop but it's not really worth it. We didn't go on a ride, the lines were too long. It was way over crowded, especially the beach. There are other parts of Santa Monica to stroll around in, stay away from the Pier.

column2: Fun place to go to unwind
column3: The vibe of this place is electric. While there are always people and usually a lot going on, it's a perfect place to stroll and unwind.

From the Ferris wheel to dock performers, to the fishers at the end of he dock, there is something for everyone in the family to enjoy.All of the carnival favorites are included: funnel cakes, rides and roller coasters, carnival games with big tacky prizes. Here are charcature drawings, speedy name-paintings, performers singing or doing comedy. The restaurant prices range from a decent burger and fries being inland price to the restaurant and souvenir shop at the edge of the dock being a bit pricier.

column2: So crowded and expensive but fun!
column3: Considering the amount of people on the actual pier and the size of it it is massively over crowded! Although we went on a weekend so not sure if that's why! Also depending on what you want to do there it is quite expensive at $5 per game and $5-8 per ride so the fun can only last so long. We only went for about an hour just to check it out so its worth going if you're near the beach
Fun pier for kids and a must see if your visiting the area. The rides were not running during our last trip so they may be seasonal.

column2: Worth seeing, but big tourist hot spot
column3: Well worth the visit, but is a big tourist hot spot. Did a lap of the pier and then walked the foreshore to Venice Beach. Would recommend the walk, it was interesting and great to soak in the atmosphere.

We end up going to the pier over the weekend, while it is something I have wanted to experience from seeing this on TV, the experience did not meet the expectations. The pier was extremely overcrowded and in my view too congested to function properly. This gives you a chance to cross the final point on Route 66, but otherwise I think it is over rated.
Sadly this iconic attraction is very run down an unpleasant. Since I'm not a local I probably don't understand the appeal but I found it dirty and very out of date by any standard.

We visited the pier early and didn't find it too crowded. We were limited with time and too early, so didn't go on any rides. Lots of gift shops and live entertainment with street buskers. Rock'n'Roll Jesus was excellent. Wished we could have spent longer here.

column2: A first visit to the Santa Monica Pier
column3: We walked a few blocks from our downtown dinner restaurant to the popular Santa Monica Pier. Eateries, carnival rides, street performances and beautiful ocean views can be found on the pier. There were a number of panhandlers at the entrance to the pier. The pier parking lot was very crowded. A nearby downtown parking structure may provide a good alternative to parking at the pier.

column2: A must do at least once
column3: The pier seems to be a must do/see for everyone that visits Santa Monica. I would agree, but once you've seen it you probably wont need to see it again, just tick it off your bucket list. Great atmosphere, lots of rides, food choices and buskers. Bike hire just near to hire your bikes

I visited the first week on June I believe the 8 and it was busy but awesome enjoyed the pier . We ran into Bernie sanders could explain all the people but he lots of of restaurants and little shops . Everything is a bit pricey but it's the end of Route 66 what else do you expect .

A must-stop tourist site for those visiting Los Angeles. It's also the official end of R66 so a must visit spot if you've just done the journey from Chicago to LA (which we had). Plenty of restaurants, bars and other entertainment for all ages.

column2: Recently went to the Pier on a trip to LA.
column3: For some reason I expected it to be a bit seedy but it was quite nice and clean and good bathrooms. I noticed the beach next to it had parking for around $14, though we parked up the street at the Promonade, which ended up being $4. The carnival games are pricey (about $5 a game). They also have a nice arcade. Good entertainment that day, and even though it was during the week, it was completely packed. Great weather the day we went - sunny with a strong breeze. I recommend.

column2: Cross Country visit with family beware of kids with flip flops.
column3: My youngest was walking and the boards are dried out and splintering. We were walking after dusk and she got a three inch splinter that luckily did not break in between her toes while wearing flip flops. We parked at civic center parking for $5 for all day parking

We arrived on a Thursday night and the first thing we did was stroll down to the pier where we met thousands of people hanging out listening to a free concert. People were on the pier and on the beach around the pier listening and having a great time.The next day we went down to the pier again to see the rest of the sites. It was a very pleasant stroll watching the fishermen and women cast and catch some fish. It was just very peaceful and pleasant.

column2: People watching is the real attraction here
column3: Very busy with rides, food, stage acts, street performers, sidewalk vendors. At night it is quite pretty from afar. I wouldn't make a special trip to Santa Monica to see this. The beach is nasty.
Tamales, fresh fruit, funnel cakes, live bands, jugglers, ferris wheel, roller coaster, food food food! Oh, and the ocean. Bring sunscreen.

column2: Good hangout for the full day, combine with Venice beach
column3: Good park with lots to do for the whole family. Walk along the pier and take lots of photos. Combine the visit to the pier with a walk along the beach to Venice beach. Enjoy all the sights and sounds on the way.

column2: Great City and Pier was absolutely great!! Lots of Fun!!!
column3: Lots of food and activities in the pier. Great place to come and visit. There is roller coasters, rides, merry go rounds and fun for the family and it is on a stretch of beautiful beach!! Great fun and lots of food on the pier. Go there early as parking is always full!
I don't like amusement parks or heights, but I did go on the ferris wheel. The view of the beach was amazing. Nice for families or couples. Great afternoon.

Great place to remember the past with ferris wheel, roller coaster and fair type stands with games. A wonderful and beautiful merry go round. Fishing takes place of the sides of the pier with restaurants available if you prefer to be served! Weekends are very busy and crowded so be early and have patience.

column2: I wish I was here 40 years ago
column3: Today its just another check off on the LA bucketlist. Nothing genuine remains. Chain restaurants and touristcrowds.

I've been to the Santa Monica Pier on several different occasions, every time having FUN! There's rides for kids of all ages, the food varies from cheaper Taco Bell to fancier sit-down restaurants, & of course Santa Monica Beach. Depending on the date & time you go obviously varies on how packed the pier will be. I prefer to go later in the evening to avoid the kiddie crowd, & to enjoy the gorgeous sunset. Definitely a stopping spot while in L.A.P.S. My 7 year old son & I love the junior roller coaster :)

There is not much fun walking the Santa Monica Pier. Thousands of people is packed on this otherwise impressive construction, but the crowds make it unbearable to stay for more than fifteen minutes. Go to the wharf in Santa Cruz instead.
We were a short distance from the pier. I was very surprised to see how unclean and littered the beach and pier were...very disappointed.

This was a stop on our drive down the Pacific Hwy. We just loved it. Wished we'd had time to hit the gorgeous beach and spot some stars!The pier itself is very busy and fun, we stopped to eat at Bubba Gump and had a great view of the beach.Fantastic spot to stop with the kids!
It is a beautiful park to take picture... but if you want to ride, be prepare to spill the cash$$$ 8 usd for the ferris wheel...

column2: Good concerts Thursdays but no rides for kids under 5
column3: My daughter (3) kept begging to come here since she could see it from our hotel. When we arrived was disappointed none of the rides were for her age range. We went to disney a few days prior and there were tons of rides with no restrictions. Its a fun place to walk around but not much to do except eat funnel cake, ice cream, and churros.

Noisy, crowded, very commercial and kinds of a wasted of time. But, something to see once. Didn't eat but the line at Bubba Gumps was horrid. It is the middle of summer. Prices of the rides was kinda high. I did it...I don't need to do it again.

SM Pier has a special place in my heart as I grew up in this area and my dad worked a few blocks away. I have seen many changes there, but I so love the carousel and the ferris wheel. Be sure to check it out when you are in the area. There is a lot of history there as well as a great view of the beaches and surrounding area. Be sure to ride the ferris wheel!!

column2: No signs for parking and overpriced rides and food
column3: Waze took us past the pier and back again to the parking lot, which you couldn't enter from the highway. There are no signs for the large main lot, which is closer to downtown -- so be aware of this when trying to find the lot. The rides were $8 each and the food overpriced, too. We realize this is all part of the experience but was not impressed.
A must see in Santa Monica! Ride the Ferris wheel - it is a great view. The restaurants elections on the pier are plentiful. The pier is good for all age groups
One of landmarks you should visit, when in LA. Though it's pretty crowded you still can enjoy small theme park, view to the beach and food.
Pretty much nothing to see here accept a large crowd of mostly rude tourists and some terrible street performers. Really wouldn't recommend going.

column2: Pricey rides, but a must-do with kids
column3: Get the wristband for all-you-can-ride - it's worth it. Good food options and live music on the pier during the summer. They also have summer concert series. The ferris wheel is awesome.

The pier is fairly dated, seems like a typical tourist trap with a few rides for children only, we ate at the all bright which wasn't bad, however the entire area is purely a tourist trap, beach isn't too bad, but not to die for, the third street promenade is a pure strip filled with shops, shops that are available at ANY other place in the world. I would not go out of my way to come here again, half a day is plenty to finish seeing most of santa monica pier/third street promenade
If you're in LA, you gave to come here. Cheesy fun, cool views and an iconic landmark with plenty to do.
This place is great - it offers the beach, restaurants, shops, amusement park rides/games, etc. It was busy, but a lot of fun!
Do they call this a pier?It's more of an entertainment center.Rides, concerts, restaurants, singers, vendorsThis place is packed day and night.Very impressive!
Just like all piers it is crowded with stalls offering all the usual things you would expect.Nothing to make it stand out from the crowd. Very busy at the weekend.

column2: Great family location for a bit of fun
column3: We were travelling through the US when we took a bus tour to the pier. Was a great spot to visit. Plenty to do on the pier and the beach area around for extra activities.Wasnt very pleasant in the cold and rain. Some of the rides not suitable for younger children but there was still options. The cafe was almost booked out but the Bumpa Gump Shrimp was a great alternative.

After 3 days cooped up in Culver city, I was more than ready for the famed picture-perfect California and Santa Monica did not disappoint. The area is gorgeous with lots of shops and restaurants, and the Santa Monica pier itself is a vast area filled with restaurants, souvenir shops, rides and hundreds of tourists. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit just taking in the sights and sounds.

Fun but expensive. We enjoyed walking the warf. Use the bathroom at the end. Or by a drink in a restaurant(I vote buy the 2$ drink, cleaner and there is toilet paper).Live musicFishingFoodAnd people watching
It's the very end of Route 66, Always fun, crowded, except that on a weekend in the summer, plenty of shops and restaurants. Rides are fun too.

column2: Very busy on a summertime weekend
column3: Walked along the pier late on a Saturday evening - very busy. Lights on the amusement park rides pretty. Enjoyed watching the people fishing at the end of the pier and calligraphy, portrait and sculpture artists at work. Surprising how many families with very little children (and small dogs) were out this late.During the day on Sunday it looked even busier.
Great place for pictures, very entertaining for all ages. Food, drinks, amusement rides, pretty reasonably priced.

A nice place for a visit -- lots of arcade games, rides, shops and food. You can buy a mutil-ride pass for the kids, or take a stroll and buy some souvenirs. It's very crowded though, so try to get their off-peak.
Fun pier with great views and plenty of entertainment. However nothing particularly special compared with other entertainment piers.

Santa Monica pier is a great day out and now busier than ever. A cool little amusement park out over the pier and on the water gives you a chance at a unique experience to ride a roller coaster or Ferris wheel atop the Pacific Ocean. Lots of good carnival foods and now super packed and busy since the train runs from LA out to Santa Monica... A good day out for anyone who wants to spend some time down near the water without getting in the sand.

Coming from England we have lots of piers so this was nothing new to us however it matched the ones in England brilliantly. Lots to do for families and kids if you have them. It also signals 'the end of route 66' not not officially they moved it so that it was at the end of the pier but where it actually ends is just a plaque on the floor further down the road so this is the best place for pictures with a Route 66 sign

We were at Venice Beach but had a walk to the Santa Monica Pier.It is a crowded place and the prices for food, beverages and ice creams were almost doubled in comparising with the prices at the beach.The view is amazing when you reached the end and is worth the walk.
Fantastic view, a great day out, loved the activities. Nice beach and great day for a family hang-out.

column2: The end of Route 66- Santa Monica Pier
column3: Some years ago i decided to drive through the Mohave desert on Route 66, and its a nice memory. Last year we visited the Santa Monica Pier which has the sign saying end of Route 66, thats an event in itself. The actual pier is slightly tacky with fairground rides and hot dog cafe etc. You can have a nice walk along the wide beach. Its worth a stop along with Venice Beach, before hitting Santa Monica Boulevard towards Hollywood. The pier has been in loads of movies and tv shows , including Forrest Gump (there is a Bubba Gump Shrimp Company Restaurant on the pier, owned by the company that produced the film). We were too tight to use one of the pay car parks and parked a bit along the road in one of the small streets coming off the beach. We are returning this month and will surely again visit the pier. Oh and by the way your kids will know it well from the game Grand theft Auto. regards Banjo

Ended our visit in the pier where the Route 66 officially finishedPier was packed solidThere are plenty of traders offering food, drinks and souvenirs but my favourite was an old silver trailer full of Route 66 memrobillia see attached pictureThe pier has a fair ground with rides and these are priced at what you would expectThe usual beggars are on the pier holding up signs but they do not pester you like they have done in other citiesParking is really expensive $12 for 12 minutes! But we were told the pier offered cheaper parking but the queue was extremely long, but our hotel was only a few minutes walk and so parking was not an issue for usThe beach is sandy and very popularOverall lovely place would recommend

We don't have jetty's (piers) like this in south Australia, nor many in Australia, so visiting here was a treat. Felt like a real American. We had a great look around, rode the rollercoaster and Ferris wheel, plus played a few arcade games, and had lots of food to eat. We stayed here for 2-3 hours and had a great time. I actually enjoyed this better than Venice beach. Santa Monica Pier is actually the official end for Route 66. At the end of the pier there is a Route 66 sign and a little memorabilia shop there too, so we grabbed our souvenirs from here

column2: Great artist in Santa Monica pier
column3: Look for Luis he makes the most amazing 3D and regular painting. He's a young artist who can draw so beautiful. He's very nice and polite. He's frames are inexpensive around $12.

column2: A local tourist trap in all it's glory
column3: Holy crap this place is crowded!For being a local pier, it pulls double duty. You've got your local fisherman posted up angling for whatever bites as well as all of the locals grabbing a spot on the sand to sun and swim all day mixed with a giant surge of tourists who are there to see the sights and ride the rides.Parking isn't too bad from a tourism point of view but at $10.00, I don't think I would pay it if I were a local. You can get your kids a wristband for Pacific park and they can ride all of the rides unlimited for as long as you are there so that is a good value. The pier itself has a funland arcade as well as a Bubba Gump Shrimp Factory and a mexican restaurant called Mariasol. Other than those two sit down places, there are two different burger joints and a place that sells funnel cakes.There is always more than enough entertainment while you are on the pier because every aspiring local artist likes to set up shop and sell their wares to anyone willing to stop and look or listen. We saw a violinist as well as a man painting caricatures. An 11 year old girl who was either a pianist or a comedian or both but I couldn't tell. We saw street performers dancing and singing and preaching the word.There is no lack of things to keep you occupied while you're on the pier. We ended up eating at Mariasol while we were there and just enjoyed the sunshine and cool breeze before heading back to our hotel.I would suggest Santa Monica Pier as a nice tourist destination but I would also advise you to research it for busy times. Otherwise the traffic and parking and crowds can get a bit overwhelming.Have fun and thank you for reading.

column2: Masses of Humans Cover The Area
column3: I live in L.A. and used to go to this area a lot, until the over-development started. I went on a Friday in the summer, after not going here for quite a number of years. The traffic in L.A. has gotten to the point where it's unpleasant to drive to the beach anymore from my location in Hollywood.I was actually shocked when I arrived at the Third Street Promenade to park my car, at the number of tourists there. We walked down to the pier, and it was like walking in a herd of cattle. Moooooo. There were so many people here that I'd say this is not a good place to go to get any kind of California experience. If you love massively tourist-filled crowded events and places---and I mean crowded-- then this will be fine for you. For me, it was just awful! We walked away from the pier and things got a little less congested, but for me, the whole "vibe" of the place has changed for the worse. Too bad.

Nice to walk along and watch the fisherman to see what they have caught. Last time we visited someone had caught a baby shark but thankfully the pier police made them put it back.Stopped at Bubba Gumps for food
Worth a visit if in Santa Monica, but just a tacky pier like any British seaside pier but with the sun!The wheel was good value at $8 each

Always a good time at the pier and went to Pacific Park as well. Love the views and sense of timelessness and history. Definitely a sketchy element around so need to be safe and keep eyes open. Really did not find the vibe family friendly as night fell but oh those sunsets!
It is a really great Pier. It reminder me of Brighton Pier in the UK. A busy place with lots to do for all ages
A beautiful day to walk up the pier , plenty of places to grab a quick bite, plenty of people milling around , great views of the beaces
A fantastic place to wander about and watch the world go by. Although it was very busy, we also enjoyed walking towards Venice beach.
We had a great time at the pier! Lots to see and do. A must visit while in Cali! Also, go to Third Street Promenade while in Santa Monica.

I am sure it varies on when you visit, but on a Sunday in June the place is a zoo. I love the history behind the pier, especially related to Route 66, but the parking was treacherous and walking around was difficult at best. I would recommend going during the week.

column2: Classic. Good place to see the sunset!
column3: I like the Santa Monica Pier. It is a little messy, but it is a good place to see the sunset. Dogs are welcome. After that, you can eat something around. There is a huge parking lot close to the pier, just check the GPS and you will find it.

There really is not much to enjoy at the Pier.Go once, walk around and the few things they have and avoid all of the people.Even on a Thursday afternoon, it was a zoo and way too busy.It's a tourist trap that is not worth the time.

Lively place ! Music, entertainment and lots to do on the beach ! Ferris wheel , photo stops interesting characters found ! Must visit attraction ! Lots of diffferent places to eat ! Delicious slushes and food!

Santa Monica pier is great! The views from the big wheel are incredible. There are lots of little stores which sell lots of touristy items such as key rings and magnets which are good for gifts. On the pier is a restaurant called Pier Burger, the food is delicious, however it can get quite crowded which is to be expected. Prices of things to do on the pier are reasonable too. Overall, it's a great way to spend an evening and watch the sun set over the Pacific. Truly beautiful.
We got there early on the 4th of July and it was not too busy yet. Nice atmosphere and lots of people fishing. At the end of the pier there is a nice view over the beach.

Walking this wonderful pier was great. Just a little disappointing that we were not aware of the fireworks display being held on the evening we were there. The end of the pier was closed off and when we asked what was happening we were told by security they were filming. The next day we were told about the fireworks.

I'm originally from LA, and every year that I go back, I try visiting Santa Monica pier. But some of the prices have gotten outrageous. One ride on the Ferris Wheel (which I used to love) is $8! An unlimited pass is $28 (for age 8 and over), so I was only willing to get the $17 unlimited pass for my under 7 year-old. And the mini-bowling at the arcade is $1 (for 10 balls) -- I remember when it was 25 cents. At those rates, the Carousel for $2 is a bargain, and there's now a good ice cream counter next to it. At least it's still free to walk around and people watch.

column2: Pretty place and well looked after
column3: Really liked this place, although just walked through.Walked from Venice all along the front an is a nice walk.Santa Monica is nicer than Venice, although the latter has its charms (my 18 year old daughter assures me) I am sure, although they escape me for now.Venice canals are pretty and worth the extra walk though.

column2: YOU HAVE TO VISIT SANTA MONICA PIER WHEN IN LA
column3: Fabulous experience with so many restaurants and music and a great beach, feels like walking on a movie set, really cool!
When my grandson visits his favorite place to go is Santa Monica pier. He is now 15 & likes it as much as when he was 5. Reasonably priced & you can't beat the setting

This place is a must when travelling to LA. Better yet, stay at a hotel here if you can. It's clean, fun and a great beach. Warning - wear something on your feet as the sand can get really hot - and watch out for syringes - we saw a syringe cap though no actual needle as we traversed the beach to the water. A truly beautiful spot. Wish we had more time there.

Beautiful beach views, great restaurants, lots of activity on the boardwalk and that's all before you even get onto the Pier with the rides. Street performers abound. It's a fun place to visit for the whole family if you don't mind crowds.

It was nice to check the list of going to the pier. Rode the giant Ferris wheel which gives you great views. Lots of little rides and carnival type games. Not cheap - $8 a ride and $5 a game for most things. Several souvenir shops and restaurants too. Fun to walk out to the end and look at the views down the coast line.
Lots of people selling art, shops to buy stuff and food to buy. Want to ride a ride well more $$$$. Nothing really special unfortunately!

column2: Touristy, but you can't miss it.
column3: There are a ton of tourists, but it is really fun. So close to Shutters, and a lot of fun for families.

Visiting Santa Monica Pier brought back childhood memories of family outings to Blackpool in England. Although there is no Tower and most of the entertainment is on the Pier the whole experience was a mixed bag. I loved the "Old World" charm of the Roller coaster, the Ferris Wheel and the Drop ride but I could have done without the smell of fried foods and popcorn. The Views from the Ferris wheel are worth the price of admission alone, you are far enough out on the pier that you can see right along the coast as well as see the surfers in action. If you want to watch the pier come alive in the evening you should visit the Blue Streak Lounge at the Loews Hotel, makes for a great photo op.

column2: Tourist Trap but nice for kids
column3: The pier is iconic to Santa Monica. Lots of fun for younger families. Mostly a tourist trap. Watch out walking on the Pier as it is wooden and uneven.

Join the millions of people that have walked the historic Santa Monica Pier. Built in the 1930s, the pier has become synonymous with Santa Monica. It is filled with amusements, free theme park rides, shops restaurants, and even an aquarium. You can't go to Santa Monica without visiting the Pier. On any given day you can enjoy live entertainment from the area's locals strumming their guitars and singing popular songs. They are quite good. You will also see local artists painting, drawing and sculpting the pier patrons. There is a lower deck for fishing, lots of deck space facing the ocean, and restrooms at the end of the pier.
We enjoyed our day here, plenty to do and see. Worth a look. It was a bit dirty there which I wasn't expecting. Definitely not as nice as I thought it would be.

My boyfriend and I went to California for our vacation and of course we had to visit the infamous Santa Monica Pier. It was absolutely beautiful, we didn't really walk the boardwalk or visit any eats or attractions there besides the beach, but it was absolutely beautiful, it was more of a party/bar scene at some places, my boyfriend and I don't really do that but I'm sure the experience would be great. The beach was stunning, the waves weren't that bad and they sell Mangoes, watermelon, beach umbrellas.. etc, there's a man or woman walking past every five minutes to sell. Living in NY I'm not a fan of having stuff on the floor of the beaches and I didn't have that problem in California at all, the beaches were beautiful and clean! Be careful not to go too far because the waves do get extremely aggressive past a certain time and it randomly fluctuates, you don't want to be caught in the middle of a big wave because another one will come after that one, back to back. The shore is long, so it's easy to end up far in the water, so please be careful, you can have just as much fun close to shore.. Don't make the same mistake I did, I scratched my knee and was caught in the middle of multiple strong waves, I did like a million cartwheels and couldn't find the surface because they just kept coming, the shore was very far for me to get out of the beach.
Typical touristy pier. Not a lot of shops. Mainly street performers and a few small amusement park rides. We just found there wasn't much to see.

It's very carnival like and if you like that it is a place for you. It's not very clean and the bathrooms were filthy! Trash and dirty diapers everywhere in the bathroom. Maybe it's not always like this and just the day I came. I know it's a busy place but it looked like they changed the trash and cleaned the bathroom 2 months ago.
this pier is a waste of your time and money. The rides stink and the pier is way over-crowded. Over over priced waste of time

column2: A great place on a warm sunny day
column3: A pleasant stroll, some great restaurants, plenty of souvenir stalls, and overall an interesting relaxing place to visit on a warm sunny June day.
This is a great attraction that we just visited for the first time but will definitely be back to again. The amusement park is a great value and there are games for kids of all ages.
Unless you plan to hang out on sand at edge of water, a couple hours is what you need to see. Rent a bike ride down to Venice Beach and back. A morning in between both beaches is plenty.

When visiting LA, the Santa Monica Pier is definitely a nice distraction for one evening. Its about 20-min from LA by freeway, and a very easy drive (even considering LA traffic).Suggestions:While there is a selection of food, I would not recommend this as your dinner destination.Parking is insane and can get expensive. If you're a solo traveller, like I was, I suggest valet across the street from the Pier (the pink building). This is the safe and secure option if you will be returning late at night. Otherwise, there are parking structures about a block or to off the beach. There is a beach lot, however it's extremely difficult to access.Pacific Park was interesting, and obviously a must to actually experience the Pier.Definitely try 'Soda Jerks' it the very first place you come to, and in the carousel building. A bit pricey, but you get what you pay for, and it was good.There are transients everywhere, so I'd suggest be mindful of your surroundings, and respectful that this is their home.
The fun park is really dated and the games room is pretty average!The views are great and enjoyed cold beers at the restaurant at the end of the pier!Prob wouldn't go again!

We came out to the pier to see the Pacific Ocean. It had some nice views, but it was an overcast day. The place was busy with lots of people and street performers. We didn't ride anything, but just looked around. There were plenty of options for eating, if you wanted to stay a while.

column2: By riding the large ferris wheel we could see so much of the Santa Monica area. It was AMAZING!!
column3: We enjoyed walking to the end of the pier seeing people fishing & peering into their buckets to see what they were catching. At the end of the pier was a great Mexican restaurant where we ate. There was a "Pigeon Man" who was feeding the pigeons from his pockets & they were on top his head, shoulders, & arms. It was a sight to see!

This is a great place to visit Solo or with the family it's beautiful out and the breeze is blowing. There are plenty of things to do and lots of entertainment. The end of Route 66 is located here on this pier as well. Traffic can be a bit much to reach this location but it's very much worth it.

We went to the pier early one weekday morning and parked in a nearby garage. The Ferris wheel was a nice activity. We ate at a Mexican restaurant overlooking the beach. The views are nice, but there are a few unusual characters on the pier (for those with younger children). The pier didn't feel like a must-see for those who have seen other shore towns (like on the jersey shore).

Typical beach pier with tons of people and activities. This would be a great place to people watch if you're into that kind of thing. They have quite a number of street performers too, including a guy dressed like Elmo (similar to times square in new york city).

Santa Monica Pier is one of the main attraction when you visit the famous California. Santa Monica's beach is very popular and there are also celebrities who shoot a movie there and the place is very breath taking because of the fresh air and the ambiance. The rides are worth it and there are so many prizes that you can win when you play a game there. Santa Monica is definitely a goal in your bucket list!

While in Santa Monica you have to stop by the pier just to say that you've been there. There are some very talented artist there so be sure to check out their work. Stay clear of the arcade. It badly needs an update and the games are rather expensive. Also prepare for a uphill hike back to the Main Street. It is steep and quite a climb.
Pier has great eating places, fun fair and amusements, some street performers and great atmosphere. Good views easy to get to. Its also the end of Route 66, the famous east west road

We could not visit the pier up to the beach during our previous visit as it was extremely windy and cold. This time, being summers, we could do so and was great to be here. with vacations around, several families having great time and we enjoyed.

column2: Eh, if you want a tourist trap...
column3: Okay, so you walk out through the pier - it's packed with people, all the stuff being hawked is mass produced, and it's just not real fun. You are better served to get off the pier itself, go down to the large beach and enjoy the ocean or at least the beach/ocean view. Or rent a bike and ride the path along the beach/coast. Or walk the paths at the top of the bluffs above the beach. Or...

column2: Great place to spend an hour
column3: You will see all manner of people on the pier - all ends and sides of the spectrum.Rides are nothing great by theme park standards but they are funGreat views and lots of entertainment

We were there at late afternoon and there were so many people - probably earlier there are even more, but to tge point there was absolutely nothing breathcatching, regular beach, ugly pier and a smell of ... everywhere

The beach is well kept and it's nice to see where so many film scenes and Baywatch of course have been made.The pier itself is quite old now and very dated but I suppose that is part of its charm, especially the arcade with the retro games consoles the size of a house.We had a picnic on the beach which was a nice touch but there are some restaurants if you'd rather sit in.
Went to Santa Monica Pier yesterday with my husband and kids, it was nothing special. The beach is way overcrowded and to many bums.

Enjoy the sun, people watching and stretch your legs for some of the best views you will get in LA. You will find food and a diversity of souvenirs. the ocean is so beautiful and people is extremely friendly.

column2: Worth a few hours of your vacation time
column3: Great pier with food , carnival style entertainment, vendors , and people watching .Surrounding Beach is cool .Parking and traffic stink but it is what it is.
Well its worth a little visit but nothing overly special there are so many more things in area to enjoy see it and run

Took my daughter here and it was very enjoyable, unfortunately the amusement park was closed for a private party but the rest of it was wonderful. Get here early as it gets quite crowded in the afternoon.

Down town LA was a bit mad & cheap, Beverly hills was the other extreme however Santa Monica was just perfect, a great balance between the two. Make sure you take a walk down the Pier and 3rd street is excellent for shopping.

So my wife and I took a day trip here and I don't think anything could have prepared us for the craziness that entailed. First of all, we are from North Carolina and much prefer the sleepy, quiet beach side towns where the crowds are small and you can relax. This was 100% the opposite of Santa Monica Pier.While the sights and sounds were amazing and will definitely leave a memorable impression on us, there wasn't a ton about this spot that had either of us dying to come back. We love Cali and I know there are a ton of "sleepy, relaxing" beaches all up and down the cost but I'll stick with my NC beaches! Plus the water is so much warmer!
Has to be seen. Stunning in its beauty. So many good performers. A stroll away from shopping. Metro to LA takes about 50 minutes.

Santa Monica's post card is nothing but amazing!! My apartment was 3 blocks from there and it was a great place to go anytime! Sometimes I was at home and I thought "I wanna do something fun" so I'd go to the Pier watch the sunset, go at some rides at the roller coaster, play at the arcade, eat something...

column2: Santa Monica not related to Mr Clause
column3: But hey , it was good to see , wander, and buy an expensive hat to cover the lack of hair. Lotsa people, some good restaurants, and it's worth it to see them catching fish , and when we were there a school of dolphins testing the mobile phones on the Peir . Zoltan was there of course, buskers for the kids and it's close to the mall. Worth seeing , but maybe I should have gone to the movie tour, it's rather like the Gold Coast at home. We took the 704 bus back to west Hollywood with some friendly AUSSIE girls, a great adventure.Happy days

column2: Fun place! Great place to see the sun set
column3: I was impressed that in such a small place so much was going on! I loved the random musicians playing, the rides look fun and very chill! Some sketchy people around so be careful to go during day hours!
Solo traveller but nice walk up from vience beach.I recommend the walk.Looks good for.kids.and dates.

Cool place to stop for a meal and have a second to yourself on the beach while the kids are up on the pier. Decent carnival style food on the walk and some good restraunts to chose from if you want a classier selection. Fun place to spend afternoon but wear your shoes

This was the first time in California and wanted to see the attractions. The beach area was clean and spent hours swimming in the ocean and waves. Walking in the sand is not easy but you go slow and you will enjoy your time. Headed to the Santa Monica Pier to grab a bite to eat. Prices were a little higher than I would have expected but food was good. The rides were not free, suggest you buy a card possibly from Groupon if you have a family. The Ferris Wheel gave you a great view of the surrounding. Definitely worth seeing. Places to change from Swimming to Clothing also.

column2: People watching with incredible Pacific backdrop!
column3: Went to the pier with friends who had never been. Reminded us of years gone by and carnivals from our past...even enjoyed The Great Zoltar telling our fortune:)
Santa Monica pier is a very busy pier with loads of people. The views are good and there are plenty of things to do on the pier. Live music, ferris wheel and games. Albrights had good food.

Perhaps I had set my expectations too high but I was not impressed at all by the pier. The ocean is absolutely gorgeous and fighting your way through the crowd to the end of the pier is definitely worth it!
