I was not impressed by the attractions, the food options, or the street vendors. I think it is worth going so that you can say that you have experienced it but do not plan to spend the day here! As for the beach area, I just felt that although it was beautiful, it was just too crowded to enjoy the view. I would also make sure that you only visit during the day and avoid being alone. I was traveling with my two teen daughters and I did not feel safe.

column2: Have to walk the Pier to say you've done it
column3: Well this place is a bit cheesy though good for a stroll. Ate at Bubba Gumps but never again. Food blahhh though the staff are friendly. Hopped on the Ferris wheel because we wanted to check out the view from the top so that was good. Been there done that now though won't bother next time

I love this place. The walk on the sand, the pier has many entertainer(they were good), the restaurant, the food, and the view just spectacular. It is a big tourist spot. I love the Santa Monica Boulevard as well. The parking was a bit of a challenge but we found this parking building between Arizona St and third St. Just a walking distance to the shopping village and the pier.

column2: Nice to see but nothing special
column3: A place which is nice to see, but if you miss it you missed nothing. The view is nice... if the weather is clear. As we discovered, if the sun shines in Beverly Hills/WeHo, it doesn't mean that it shines on the ocean coast. The restaurants are more to tourists not for gastro tourists or those who like good/quality food.

We did not sunbathe or swim, but we took a leisurely walk all the way from Santa Monica to Venice Beach. Santa Monica is a nicer area with a variety of good food, recreation, and amateur entertainment. It's about a 1 1/2 - 2-Mile walk one way from SM to Venice. Venice Beach has a little more unusual visitors and I wouldn't have wanted to take young children there.
Great place, very crowded. Lots to do and easy to find. We didn't go down to the water, it's too far from where we needed to park and we were traveling with folks with health limitations
Parking is a little tricky, but once you do, it's a great time. We hit the beach and then hit the pier, where we ate, listened to live music and rode the Rollercoaster.
This is really the only decent thing to do in Santa Monica, so I only recommend it if your going to be visited but I don't recommend going to LA at all.

column2: Excellent Place to take Teens at Night!
column3: If you are looking for a nice family place to keep teenagers happy, the pier is excellent. They can walk down to the beach and then come up to meet you for a bite to eat. Take a ride on the ferris wheel and play a few games while the pier lights up all night long. Highly recommended!!
Great views of the beach and Santa Monica from the pier. Plenty to do with rides / arcades and dining. Must ride the Ferris wheel.
Lots of fun for all types of people. Street artists to rides, couple restaraunts this oier has it all!
If you grew up here...this place is the bomb! So much fun! Love everything except the crowds. The food is carnie food. The rides are fun but pretty old skool.
Very similar to Brighton Pier in England. Other than the rides, there isn't really any attraction. If you are in the area, go have a look, and walk along the beach. The pier itself wont take long.

column2: A day at the pier and beach
column3: Nice day to relax at the beach and later go visit the pier. Plenty of sunshine, fun, food and drink.
This was an interesting place for a visit. Being the end of Route 66, there are always a lot of people here & there are shops, restaurants etc... Nice views & a fun fair.

column2: Lovely to say you have seen
column3: Typical pier and fairground rides but has a warm and welcoming atmosphere. If you are in Santa Monica going to the Pier is a must-do

The amusement area is a bit kiddy, but has a historic merry go round. I recently read the merry go round was one of Marilyn Monroes favorite hangouts. Also the pier has a Bubba Gump restaurant that is delicious. And the views of the coast line are postcard.

You can't beat the Santa Monica Beach and Pier for a relaxing time and lots of fun. The shops and restaurants are always great, and you can just stroll along the Pier and take in the amazing scenery. There are always street performers too. It's worth the effort for parking and getting around all the people!

Crowded but very alive. In LA there are places to go to enjoy the quite and places to enjoy the hub-ub. This is definitely the one for the action, market, crowd, sea food and if you enjoy it people watching! Very alive and fun.

The Santa Monica Pier is part of the beach landscape in Santa Monica. A fun, charming place to spend an afternoon. The Merry-Go-Round has been there for years and provides the ability to thrill the kiddies and capture a glimpse of our childhood as adults. Many concessions, arcade and places to grab a bite. The food is average but the atmosphere is wonderful.

column2: Nice place to visit during the weekend
column3: Nice place to visit during the weekend. It's free of charge, plenty to see. Just sit and relax and watch the people pass by or listen to the (wannabe) musicians on the pier.
Disappointed, I was told that 15 years ago was a beautiful place. Now, the boards on the pier are uneven and splintered. It was dirty and on par with Venice Beach.

Now that I have so much family in LA, it is difficult to visit and see everyone. Luckily, Santa Monica is close to LAX and makes an easy way to meet up with them on the way to or from LAX. They have rides, a hands on aquarium, restaurants and an ok beach area---something for everyone.

We thoroughly enjoyed our time here, the weather was perfect to compliment the beautiful view from the Ferris Wheel. Kids will love the amusement park here as it is not too over the top. We are definitely coming back inJanuray when we visit LA again!

With several eating options and various attractions the Pier is a must visit in Santa Monica. It's perfect for families. There's burgers, seafood, ice cream, funnel cakes, and snow cones.The roller coaster is more for kids than adults. It moves slow.The pier is relaxing. A cool spot in a cool town. Don't miss the sunset.

Nothing spectacular but a fun place to walk to after a dinner nearby. This little pier is beautiful when it is all lit up at nights and a ride on the ferris wheel or the old wooden roller coaster is a fun, happy activity for an evening's end.

Cute pier prices not to bad but if your on a budget and a family I would take a picnic due to the cost plenty of places to sit outside the pierLots of homeless which was upsetting and at times felt frightened

This is one of my favorite places to bring visitors. There are bike paths and pedestrian walk path that you can enjoy the view of the ocean. It's great to visit around the sunset too. You get beautiful sunset pictures. While walking there you will see muscle beach( the original muscle beach is here not in Venice beach). Beneath the pier there is the aquarium and many restaurants and a well known 'The big dean'. On the pier there are amusement pacific park and many restaurants. Also you can. visit the famous carousel ,Mary go round ( the movie sting shot here. If you visit here during the summer time there is a free concert every Thursday night where you can sit on the beach with the picnic blanket on the sandIt's one of the attraction you shouldn't miss
I have the best memories of hanging out on the pier with my family when I was a kid. It it was so much fun to take my kids there and see them enjoy it as much as I did. Can't wait to take them again!
I like this pier - it's clean and the parking is convenient. The bathrooms were clean, the kids had fun on the rides. It's a fun place to spend a few hours.
All I can say is beautiful absolutely we had to go twice morning and sundown. We were invited to several beach parties and a wedding john Alys sa thank you. We nice people the traffic the traffic.
Not much open on rainy days and boy is it cold. Iconic, film location, beach and park rides and resturants. Much better sunny day activitie
Always fun but gets really crowded! With that said it was still walkable and a beautiful day. Ate at the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier which made the day. Food was just OK.

More crowded than ever, starting from July 7- Aug 8, Santa Monica Pier offers free concerts for the long summer nights. Grab a blanket, drinks and munchies to share the ocean breeze or dance away at the wooden deck.
Great for the family and good rides. It was $18 for a ride pass which is not to bad. Great food and lots of people watching
Great place for a stroll with pretty views and fun. Family friendly with rides, ocean views, restaurants, vendors, and a few stores. The arcade is very outdated however and most games didn't work.

This place is ok lots of bums/ homeless around its free to go look other then parking good to take kids everyone is real nice good place to take kids day are night safe area one place to park right next to the pier to the left its 30.00 to park and you can go park for a lot less and walk a block then pay that much
My youngest really enjoyed this attraction; play games and watching the waves. It was his first time at the ocean and it was great!!
Fairground entertainment, carousel, ferris wheel and roller coaster.Pleasant walk along the pier. Great for families,couples or singles. Clean, friendly. A few places to eat

column2: Nice debriefing place after power meetings
column3: I like going to the Pier after a busy day. It is a busy place make no mistake but the back drop of beautiful occean and the ability to hide in the crowd can be in itself a treat.It is SoCal as SoCal gets.
A very ordinary pier, with little things to do, nothing interesting at all, in general LA is not that much interesting, its reputation is far from it is reality, wouldn't bother to visit LA again

Even as a local love to walk down for a good walk. Go North if you want beach, so south if you want muscle beach and Venice, which is always entertainment. Great place to recognize places you have seen on TV.
Bigger than it looked from our hotel window. Rides, souvenirs, and places to get a bite to eat. Very crowded. But a must see attraction if you're in the area.

We have visited the Santa Monica Pier numerous times & still enjoy the stroll along the Pier. Although its very touristy its just one of those things you have to do whilst in Santa Monica.Its a great place to take pictures, people watch & generally a fab location for taking in the views of the beach.
Great visit on the pier, lots to do and see, rides,stores.,restaurants and fishing. A must see in Santa Monica. Beaches and lots of activities at nearby muscle beach
Spent an hour or so here and rode the Ferris wheel which gave wonderful views along the coast. Probably a bit expensive for the rides if you have a number of children, but it was fine for us.

column2: Where route 66 ends...Santa Monica pier begins...buckle up For a good time!
column3: I Absolutely love coming back to this pier as it just brings me joy! I don't go for the rides although they look fun, I go for the view and the feeling of endless summer that envelopes my soul. This place has a great ambience with plenty of street performers to entertain you along with incredible views of both Venice & Santa Monica. Find a bar stool or a bench and settle into a place called Chillax!!!

Its more of an atmosphere place.its a place to look at the street artists, Have a coffee, hear the waves, the crowd...niceIf you want to shop there's a shopping mall with in a walking distance.Park anywhere pablic, but expensive ($25 all day)

The sign onto the pier makes it seem like quite a grand place, but as you decend down to the actual pier it seems a bit tacky, that said it turned out to be a nice trip. The Pier itself is quite old & it shows in the planking you walk on but the attractions all seem good from watching the people learning the trapeze to the Ferise Wheel at the end. There are many places to eat from bergers & hotdogs to sit down meals. We ate at the Albright/SM Pier Seafood which was excellent, provided you like seafood which we do, on the whole a good evening out.

column2: Its nice, but its not necessary.
column3: My title may seem like it's not kind to the all famous Santa Monica Pier, but I say that mainly because the pier is quite similar to say, the Venice Beach Boardwalk. There are people selling food with carts, there are troubadours/howling "rappers" with $2 mixtapes, there is fast food, there are some touristy sights ... but unless it's just a check mark on your list, I can't see this as an exciting place over and over again. Hell, I sadly paid $5 for a coke here. I shouldn't have expected anything less, but still...Anyway, there's a beautiful beach to be explored, there are stores where you can get your own food/drink, and boom! Unless you need a roller coaster then you're really fine without the pier.That's why I give it a 3. Because it's not bad, it's just not necessary.
Live music, food choices galore, shopping, amusement park...and dont forget the beach! Great family attraction that you wont want to miss!

And it's worth going there. Just to have seen it.They have kept a lot of the old interior and it feels like the 50s but it's a classic tourist place. Nothing wrong with that.We took a stroll and that was enough and after we jumped in to the ocean and that was fantastic.

My first time to town so I'm sure I looked like a tourist. The pier and the area around it are filled with street performers of all types. Bums are out and about also so be aware of your surroundings and keep up with your kids. Some really neat sights and shops. All in all, it's a tourist trap and not a place where locals will be found much.
My kids loved it. Lots of people and typical board walk activities. The view on the beach and ocean excellent.

The pier has so many shops, places to snack/eat at & the view from the pier is breathtaking. There is a lot of fun for the whole family if you visit pacific park, too. Overall a fun experience. The only downside is that it was extremely busy (but that is to be expected).

column2: Beach is nice; pier ok for people watching
column3: The Pacific Ocean beach is impressive, stretching for miles. Beach volleyball courts, exercise areas, and occasional singers and musicians can be seen along the beach and in the pier. A few restaurants, a few amusement park rides and arcade that remind me somewhat negatively of times past. Food options are limited. Nice walk along paved areas along the ocean extending north and south of the pier. If you do choose to visit 2hrs is more than enough time. Parking options include from metered street ($2/h via credit card [or coins] with 3 hr maximum, a small lot for $1/HR (2 hr max) off Seaside on Appian Way, and various lots with a $12 entry (presumably no hr limit); there is also inexpensive parking at the convention center.

column2: Small & compact but enjoyed by adults & kids.
column3: Pac Park wasn't exactly the most memorable part of our trip but as with any touristy destination, it's crowded & overpriced. I guess it's one of those places you just have to visit to say you've been while in So. Cal.

This part of the greater LA area is quite clean in comparison to other areas of interest. The pier is entertaining and the beaches are relatively clean. There are plenty of options for food in the area and shopping can be done at the nearby santa monica place

Finally got to Santa Monica pier, arrived in LA yesterday morning on the red eye from Hawaii, almost no sleep, found that they have metro to Downtown Santa Monica now, although it was very full, was still very cheap, got to the pier and it was super busy, this added to the atmosphere though, everyone was in high spirits, the rides were going, the weather was great and just an all time high!! Definitely worth a visit

column2: Nice but can be found in lots of cities
column3: Santa Monica beach is huge! And the pier has some nice little rides and an arcade on it, but it is nothing very unique. Many cities have a pier with a Ferris wheel and some rides.
Loved the pier! Great places to eat, just a fun atmosphere! People performing on the pier, places to shop.
The typical "tourist trap" where everything is overpriced, yet it is a must see as part of a LA trip. The beach was very crowded with trash everywhere. Water very cold.
A Must see. Looks just like it does on TV. Lots too see, amazing ocean views, people watching galore. Food over priced as expected for such locations.Beach is awesome.
It was very crowdy when we were there in June. Nothing special with this place and I do not understand its popularity. A lot of commercial novelties are sold along the pier.

It was a late Tuesday afternoon stroll, sun was still up yet it was the breeze that gets me, it was cool & calming, the pier itself offers rides (from small roller coaster to a ferris wheel) & tons of food stalls so you don't have to worry about goin' hungry, various street performers, family & friends go around - some take a dip in the beach & some just take a walk enjoy the view. The pier is a picturesque scene right out of a postcard, you can take a walk or go run (for health buffs) or even bike & skate.

column2: Worth a walk if you are in the area
column3: it is mostly a tourist trap. However, if you are only going for the sights and not to spend money, it is pretty cool if you are in the area. Besides all the weird stuff at the pier and the rides, you get a nice view of the coast and the beach. it totally feels like you are watching a Baywatch tv show. The parking is a bit pricey but if they is all you are spending on this excursion, it is not so bad. Also, you can walk the Santa Monica streets from there.
It was a great place to visit. There were were rides for the kids. There was Music for music lovers a variety for every music lover. There were many shops and food places to eat.

We wanted to visit the SM Pier for a long time but didn't like the lack of parking situation. So we took the Expo Line! The ride was crowded by mid morning. A train had mechanical problems that resulted in the crowded train. Once we got off the last stop, we visited the park nearby before heading to the pier.I would describe the Pier as being like Pier 39 in San Francisco, but scaled way down. Very Touristy which is what we expected. There were so many kiosk vendors selling exactly the same things....from hand painted landscapes on a 4x6 mirrors to your name on a banner using hand painted artistic floral/bird/colorful fonts. You can even get your name on a grain of rice! I think the carney area was ok.
So many things going on at the Pier. Musicians, Artists, Trapeze School, Food Vendors and fantastic restaurants, Rides, the ocean waves, the sunset, and more. We'll visit again!

We went to meet up with some friends on our drive through California coming down from Alaska. We had our 2 dogs with is and we did not plan on taking them with us on the actual pier. We have monitored autostart, and it was December, and not overly warm, so we planned on leaving our dogs in the vehicle with air conditioner running. However the parking attendants/valet refused to let us leave the dogs. I guess it's the law no matter the weather conditions. So we nervously headed toward the pier with our 2 kids and 3 dogs (1 of which does suffer from social anxiety). The walk from the paring structures were a little far but mainly downhill which was fine.I was pleasantly surprised by how incredibly friendly everyone was. There were thousands of people and I think most of them stopped to talk with us and pet our 3 dogs. I have never seen such an eclectic mix of people from literally all over the world. We didn't come across 1 rude or impatient person the whole day. Even when our little dog slipped his collar and was running all over the place. People were running all over the deck trying to help catch him. It was pretty funny to watch. And I was so grateful that people were kind and understanding.My kids had so much fun at the arcade which was so crowded it seemed to almost burst at the seams.The only negative thing we faced was one of our pork tamales from a pier vendor was green with rot and mold. We didn't let it ruin our day and just ended up tossing it and not causing a fuss.As we headed back across the bridge we realized we now had to walk up hill. I'm not a fan of inclines and I'm not in very good shape. So it was a bit difficult because there were so many people in front of and behind us, we were unable to stop and catch our breath. Even my husband who is a mountain climber said it was a bit difficult to maneuver with so many people going at all different speeds. Obviously the main issues with the speed was that we had the 3 dogs and 2 little kids that we had to keep up with. We finally made it to the top and I felt a wonderful sense of personal accomplishment. I would totally do it again. Although maybe next time without the dogs.To top off our wonderful visit to the pier, we got to see the most amazing bright orange, pink and red west coast sunset.

column2: Looks great, but don't spend your money
column3: I spent $22 on Santa Monica pier, and for the most part was ripped off. Here's my itemised review:Busker - $2. There was a guy playing classical guitar, he was providing a lovely musical background so I gave the kids $1 each to tip him. Very good value in my view.Magnet - $5. Buying magnets at every stop for some friends back home. They're all a bit pricey, this one no different, but on par for value.Attraction, Basketball - $5. 3 shots at a basketball hoop costing $5. Expensive and poor value, but clearly advertised and very obvious what was on offer. No upset.Attraction - Waterfun Pacific Park (water pistol aiming game) - $10. Both kids played this (ie $5 each), it lasted 4 seconds - I am not exaggerating!!! The guy attending this (William) just shrugged when challenged. It's exactly this sort of attraction that gives these places such a bad rap.To the operators of this place - you should be ashamed of yourselves. Earlier in the day we rode bikes to Muscle Beach where we were able to borrow (ie free!!!!) basketballs and play basketball FOR FREE. To then spend $15 on attractions that lasted less than a minute was disgraceful.To other visitors - the pier looks lovely, has a great carnival feel - but my advice is to look at it, take your photos, enjoy the feeling, but keep your money in your pockets.
The pier and all of its accouterments: roller coaster and Ferris wheel, funnel cakes, games, loud music. Visiting once is enough. Seedy in places, but that's part of the history.

Nice place to people watch. I thought the amusement park was a tad old but the people seem to be having a great time. I would recommend renting bikes and cycling over to Venice beach for some interesting people watching. Lol. But Santa Monica is nice mainly for lunch and going out by the water
This is a must for everyone to visit. It was so much fun. Music, Games, Rides, Food and People. Loved it.
We drove from Beverly Hills to check out the pier and the beach. It was not worth the traffic and hassle to get there unless you are going to entertain small children.

The Santa Monica Pier is a great place for the whole family or just for one. There's Pacific Park which has a Ferris wheel, roller coaster and all kinds of games to play. Bubba Gump's restaurant is on the Pier along with other eateries from pizza to ice cream. You can fish or just walk along the Pier. Downtown Santa Monica is just blocks away with the mall and 3rd Street Promenade for great shopping. You can park at the mall, on the beach or take the Expo train that let's you off two blocks from the beach!

column2: Santa Monica Pier fun for all
column3: Santa Monica its a must do ! It might feel a bit tacky at first but once you get in the swing of thing you'll have fun . Easy Restaurants ( I loved retro' 60s Rubys - the same that's on Huntington beach pier ) and great choice of food vendors , Giant Ferris Wheel offers amazing views and pictures opportunity. It's a great spot for kids, couples and the whole family. Saturday nights are crowded , it better to go week days .
Great pier with plenty to see and buy/eat/do. Very very busy though. That was the only downside. Drive completely down to the pier before you pay for parking. It gets cheaper as you get closer.

Not a bad place for family fun & food. I walked there from my hotel one evening. The beach is nicely paved, lots of activities going on. It was this month in June and I was wearing my winter jacket. Breezy, so dress appropriately. Not a huge amusement center, but it's a pier...only so much space. I wanted to take a nice sunset pictures of the beach, but it wasn't as dramatic as I was hoping for. If my family was with me, I would have done some rides & games. But I just went to take a few pictures and see it for the first time. Enjoyed the peaceful walk there.

column2: A small tidy pier with various attractions and facilities. Lovely view of the beach
column3: We spent a pleasant few hours on this attraction. There were lots to see and some fun fair type rides. We went on the carousel which was very nostalgic. The aquarium below the pier is worth a visit
Great pier, very lively and the end of the Route sign.A must visit if you are traveling Route 66 and a great place to visit anytime. Try the bike hire and the frozen yogurt.
Visiting the Pier is a must do but nothing special. A few souvenir stores and cart vendors, the amusement rides, and a couple of restaurants to include Bubba Gumps. Ho, Hum.
Loved our time here.. Roller coaster was great and we even got to go around twice in a row! Food was great and we felt safe even at night.

Loved the pier, extremely live with good restaurants and great places to take pictures! The Ferris wheel is great and many good vendors with nice vacation tshirts and many singers and actors that are very friendly and entertaining!

column2: Santa Monica Pier/ Rodeo Drive/Venice Beach
column3: Rather than be rushed place to place with a guide and pay $795 for 6 hrs We took an Uber from universal studio city to Santa Monica Pier, walked to third street promenade, had a look at the shops and then walked down past the beach houses to Venice Beach / Muscle Beach then Uber to Rodeo Drive then walked through Beverly Hills to get to West Hollywood. Saw SUR and PUMP (going back to PUMP for dinner, stunning ! And great menu) then bus/walk to The Grove / Farmers Market for dinner then Uber back to universal. Brilliant day saw loads and Uber is definitely the way to get around and pick up great ideas from the locals. Make sure you wear your good walking shoes though !!

column2: It's an icon: bit tacky but a must do
column3: There are some things that you must do when you are in certain places: go to the Eiffel Tower when in Paris is one. Visiting the pier in Santa Monica isn't quite in the same league, but why would you come to Santa Monica and not got to the pier. This is the end of Route 66, an important piece of legend in the American story. It's also where Forrest Gump turned around on his runs across the country (although there is no market for that). The fun park is traditional stuff - which is not a criticism and the ferris wheel is solar powered. You can read about the pier's gangster past where the DA, one Earl Warren (later Chief Justice) went after mobster Tony 'the hat'. Lots of T shirts and souvenirs of various levels of tackiness, and restaurants and takeaways of varying quality, but even after all of that, it's still worth a visit to say you have been there.

Great view of the coast. Had fun walking the pier, lots of shops for souvenirs. The pier also has a small amusement park with Ferris wheel and roller coaster. Bubba Gump shrimp co is also on the pier!
Good atmosphere, good views of beach, good buskers ensure a good time. Did not eat here although there was plenty of options available. Bubba Gumps was popular.

We visited the Pier on a very hot day where the only refreshment was the cool ocean water. It is lovely to watch the people having fun at the beach.We rode the roller coaster with my 9 year old son and it was the first time for him. I thought he would be afraid but the coaster was gentle so I recommend it to other kids who are weary of roller coasters.We even had the opportunity to see a live Seal of the ocean. It was such fun.
Such a gorgeous site, so beautiful. This was the best part of our trip. Great food, entertainment, and view. Its a must see on any trip.

If you visit Santa Monica, you must visit the pier! Took our sons twenty years ago and always remember the big wheel and all the attractions. There is something special about this pier as it is featured in so many films and tv series. Set on a great beach with eateries such as bubba gump and lots of side stalls selling the usual summer souvenirs. It's a long pier and a great walk to see the beauty of both sides of the beach and beyond. The main entrance with its iconic 50's style illuminated sign, is the gateway to so much fun for all the family. It's a special place for all our family so a must see for us!Just visited last month and nothing's changed, still the great place it always was!

Lots of restaurants, an amusement park, double decker pier...love it!! Local artists sing and sell crafts. Beware of the beggars.... and plan to be stuck in traffic and spend 40 mins finding parking....just a fact of life.

The pier was fun - typical carnival/beach theme. Lots of people fishing, trinket shopping, playing games. The beach gets super crowded so get there early. Parking is $12 for the day. If you have time, rent a bike (7$) and bike on the trail - you will see people and things from all walks of life!
We had a very nice family day. It was crowded, but fun. Our small grandchildren ran around and played and went to the beach. There was also food for all. Just a fun outing.
Lovely. Excellent for kids and lovely views of the beach.Lovely post cards and tourist stalls for little bracelets.We started our walk to Venice beach from here.

column2: Nothing much to see... Kind of disappointing
column3: The third street promenade was better. Some of the restaurants on the pier are good. If you have little kids the rides are good for them. But not much for teenagers.

Rode my 5 year old daughter to the pier on a tag along bike. Fairly easy parking. Odd scene of lots of people swimming in front of a sign that said 'no swimming due to bacteria levels that exceed health standards'. There wasn't much for us among the attractions on the pier. We had hoped to go on the Ferris wheel but that whole section was closed for a private function. The pier itself is an awesome construction.

My visit to Santa Monica Pier was exciting! The pier was clean and trash free. Plenty of entertainment there from rides on the pier to enjoying the beach. One thing that stuck out to our family was a man who made sculptures of people by hand for very inexpensive $15. The rides were pretty cool too. Its a Fair themed type event. We enjoyed the fruit in a cup and dips. We will be back.

column2: A fun waste of a couple hours and a landmark worth visiting.
column3: Me and my LA man frequently will go down to the pier to play at the video arcade. It's definitely a tourist trap. But with that said, I wouldn't skip it while in town for a first time visit. There is access to the beach as well. It is an iconic California landmark. Go see it. If you have kids, they will enjoy it immensely.

column2: $12 per day convenient parking next to the beach and pier
column3: Someone asked about parking a while back. The closest one is next to the beach, a huge parking lot for $12 the whole day. Get early to get prime space. Easy access to beach and world famous pier. Just make sure you know how to get there, just underneath the pier, because the 2-way lane can be quite tricky due to the fast traffic on the roads.

Good place for people watching & tourist shops. If you have children & they like roller coasters and the like, then this is a great place for the family. We do not do rides, but they looked in good repair & people were enjoying themselves. We did not eat on the pier, but there are plenty of choices. We did catch a small car show & some clubs having paddle board & surf board races which were fun to watch. One can do some fishing from the end of the pier.
The pier is bustling with people and shops. It was a nice way to spend a morning and have lunch. The views are amazing! Check out Muscle Beach right next to the pier.

We stopped at the Santa Monica Pier as it was the symbolic end of our Route 66 trip. We arrived on a Saturday evening and it was very busy. There are plenty of opportunities for souvenirs, lots of rides and snacks. The snacks are expensive. We were able to take our picture next to the Route 66 sign and speaks with Ian at the Route 66 booth. He was a great guy!

column2: Not what you may expect if you want to enjoy a beach
column3: Very crowded...avoid parking just right before you get to the pier, I made this mistake and the park was very expensive 30dls, complete rip off. If you just want to go for a walk is fine but you may decide to walk along the corniche. We love bubba gump and we had lunch at the pier, just make sure you know what the drinks you are ordering...you may end up paying double the price of your bill with souvenir glasses.
So it's a landmark that one should check out but honestly that's about it. There's a midway with kiddie rides and overpriced food outlets. The best part is that it's on a nice stretch of beach.

column2: WHAT A GREAT WAY TO SPEND A COUPLE OF HOURS
column3: we thought this would just be a half hour stroll it ended up beingnearly 4 hours joyrides a little souvenir shopping and them some dinner what a great little place wish I had the kids
Plenty to do for families - Stalls street,entertainment, rides and food stalls. We visited in June at night and was very cold - so take a jacket!
Lovely place IF you like crowds and tourists ;)! Play some games At The arcade , have a meal At some Of The stands or just listen to music! Great beach!

It's an absolutely beautiful beach, world class. Nothing compares to getting soaked with water of Pacific Ocean.The whole set up to the pier and around the beach is very well planned with bike lanesMake sure go check out the fitness area where all the muscle men show their stuffs

column2: Lot of fun and options, can be crowded
column3: This central attraction of Santa Monica has something for everyone, with restaurants, rides and other attractions. It can be quite crowded and chaotic on the weekends though. Good for people watching

column2: Fun Way to Spend an Afternoon!
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a great place to spend an afternoon when in the Los Angeles area. With fun amusement park rides, arcade games, several places to eat, and a long stretch of California beach right next door you can't go wrong spending a few hours here with your kids on a sunny afternoon. You can often find discount tickets to the amusement park rides if you search online and plan ahead. Although Santa Monica Beach is often crowded, the added diversity it offers with the nearby rides, restaurants (Bubba Gumps and other nearby eateries) and shopping (just a block away from the beach) make it a really nice destination spot for a few hours or an entire day. I would definitely recommend Santa Monica Pier for a family outing with a variety of things to do close at hand.
Nice area but extremely crowded. Nice for picture taking but that is about it. There are lots of places to eat but make reservations
Very expencive parking, but a must see sight. The Beach is very large and Nice. But remmmber sandals - the sand is very hot ;)

column2: Great place for a walk on a pier and sightseeing
column3: While vacationing in Los Angeles we took our daughter and her friend to this beach while my husband and I walked the pier. Has great view of the coast, lots of little shops and Rout 66 info. This is the end of Rout 66 and has a map from Chicago to Santa Monica pier. Has an amusement park for kids of all ages. Buy a wrist band to wear to get on all the rides. Plenty of little eateries and typical gift shops. Great place to bri g the kids both day and evening.
Good price on the bracelet for children's rides. Lots of great vendors and random people performing to earn a living. Great views and nice clean beaches.

We went to the beach this morning here and arrived around 10:30am which was a good time. It got VERY busy around 1-2p. They had good parking, a nice beach, a nice pier with lots to do, a bike trail around the beach which we did with 3 young children. Great day Activity with kids

column2: Lots to do in a small space
column3: Santa Momica Pier is worth visiting. It attracts a lot of people and seems very crowded. However, it is still easy to get around and do things without waiting too long in lines. The restrooms are accessible and clean. The views are great, especially from atop the ferris wheel.Parking can be tough but if you drive around the area, you should be able to find a meter. If you are only staying an hour of two a meter should work fine. The public parking lot is usually full.

Santa Monica Pier just simply a good place to go, take photos of sunset, have a burger and just have fun.Close to shops and lots of food outletsNice to see diversity of people basking, doing magic tricks and just enjoying a day out

I loved the shops and musicians.Only thing is they don't allow single persons entry to the ferris wheel ride which was a shame, because I am a solo traveller and going on that ride was the main reason I wanted to go to the pier lol
I love this beach. There are so many great places to just sit and enjoy the sand and surf. A great place for people watching and kite flying. Clean with a playground for kids and on for adults too!

column2: Cool place but the action is at the Pacific Park which is ON the pier.
column3: This is an iconic location but there are a TON of people AND it doesn't have as easy an access or departure as I would have liked. We went primarily because of the Pacific Park theme park located ON the pier. The pier is free but the Park is a charge for the rides.
Caught the train to the pier. Great idea as parking is quite $$$ down that way. The pier was busy. Lots to do or just sit in the beach and enjoy the sunshine

The pier is a nice walk, some restaurants and shops on each side, you can enjoy z nice view of the surrounding beaches..it gets very crowded and most the attractions feel very touristy. I prefer to just walk on the sand and enjoy the sporting facilities that are free for all
Great view from Ferris wheel , took some great pictures there. Teenagers loved the pay one price rides .

Every time I travel to California on business, I stop at the pier either at the beginning of my trip, or right before I leave the state. It's just so much fun. So many things to do and places to shop and sight see. Not to mention that Bubba Gump is right there so even a decent place to eat.This a nice place to take your kids for rides too. Walks in the evenings are worth it. The sunset is quite beautiful at that time.

Awesome day trip here. It wasn't the best weather it being overcast but did not take away from the buzz of how fun this place is. Interesting walk to the end with a gorgeous view looking back across the the pier and beach. We went on a couple of rides and didn't have to wait long which is always great. Also went into the arcade and this is so much fun for everyone of all ages. Won a few tickets and the guy gave us more prizes to choose from too. Top bloke :) would recommend this place to everyone.
Such a cute place! The pier is full of food, fun and entertainment! Great place for families and kids! Also great for adults!
Impressed to see an amusement park that has been ongoing for 100 years! Esp enjoyed the Merry Go Round and soda jerks.
A great spot with something for everyone. A beautifully located pier with roller coaster and fun fair games. Plenty of food choices and a great way to look over the beach and city.

The pier is fun, lots of restaurants, bubba bumps is terrible but the Mexican restaurant is very good! Just a nice place for a walk, people watching etc... Good in the day and evening, the carousel is worth a look!

Lots of activity on the pier. Restaurants, shops, excursion booths, and amusement park. If you get your kicks on the historic old Route 66 the Santa Monica Pier is the end of the trail 2451 miles from Chicago. Highly recommended.

Had a wonderful time at the Santa Monica Beach and pier. A beautiful merry go ride was the first eye catching sight. The Pacific Park was filled with all type of activity and rides for all ages. There was attraction for everyone. Dancers, singers and vendors offering something you would want to pay for. Had dinner at Bubba Gump the food was delicious.

Very lively and fun place to be, makes grown ups become kids again - enjoyed it fully including the big wheel.Also played the penny slots and lost as usual, nothing changes lol. Great afternoon and evening entertainment for all.
Santa Monica Pier is essentially an amusement park on a pier! Lots of fun for the whole family. Food,rides, and street performers. There's something for everyone.
Great pier great food but it does get crowded during the weekends try to avoid the weekends other then that they have arcades games where you can win prizes and much more
The Pier had a nice old world feel, we visited on a Saturday evening and had dinner in one of the many restaurants which was very nice.highly recommend a visit .

column2: Little tacky but the sunset there is beautiful
column3: Take a walk along the beach, watch the seals and fishermen. The restaurants are overly expensive and not worth it I think. During the day it's really crowded there, so go early in the morning or later in the evening. The Ferris wheel and entertainment is little bit tacky but I guess belongs to the feel of this place. Interesting fact is that Santa Monica Pier is the end of the famous Route 66 that goes across US.
A nice walk and beautiful scenery. Lots of people doing and selling neat little things,and several different musicians performing.
Busy walk along the pier. Lots happening. Great place if you have kids as the have rides and lots of action. Pretty place. Entertainment too of dancers etc..
What a great nostalgic place. Lots of people, definitely more family focused. Typical pier fried foods and ice cream. But it's a been there done that place for me.
There was a great atmosphere. The rides were fun and there were a good few rides for young kids. The staff were friendly and the food was nice. I definitely want to visit again.
The pier has many attractions and things to do. Best to take the metro or Bus, as parking is expensive and difficult to find. Wonderful view of the ocean.

Probably the most iconic pier in the world but really not overly impressed with it all.So you to the end of it scrabbling thru the crowd listening too other tourists saying what your thinking , ok been their done that.

column2: Take a walk and see the locals fishing
column3: Lots of local folks fish off this pier, and I also saw one man harvesting mussels from the pier pilings with a special cage/scraper. Very interesting. Got very close to a seabird I have never seen before, standing on a post.

We walked on the pier to the end. Lovely old wood on the floor and great to see the pillars holding the pier. We went on a very crowded Saturday evening with people swimming, fishing, walking on the pier, going on the rides, eating. Lots to do and fun to visit. Parking very expensive though. Do visit the little Souveniers shops and the Desert/ice cream shop.
Great for family fun. The rides are maintained well and the variety of food offerings made for a good visit. We spent a few hours hanging out and enjoying the view of the beach and people watching.
The rides were expensive and there wasn't a big variety. They did let us ride twice in a row on the coaster, which was a surprise. Seemed. Very crowded on the pier. Lots of food and games.

The pier was a blast! Had a great time on the rides and eating at the amazing Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier. The ocean smell and the bustling people definitely made you feel a part of the Santa Monica beach culture.
Nice one time visit place. I liked the beach next to it. The information desk outside this pier was very helpful. Clean attraction
The pier is a great addition to the beach. Gives a little more to do than just walk on the beach. The view is beautiful. Malibu moutains grace the skies. Great place for familiea
It's more than just the beach. The muscle park is fun as is the bike riding. lots of great people watching too. Fun places to eat and little shops.
It was awesome. My wife and I went on the Ferris wheel and it was so cool. It's not too crowded and relatively cheap! A must!!
It's a place to go. Didn't really do much because not a lot looked interesting. Seems like a good place for families and kids, not a twenty-something year old guy like myself.
This place was a zoo. A ton of people everywhere and not much to really do here anyway. A handful of restaurants and a lot of street performers and some rides.
Spent an afternoon here, listening to the music and watching the most beautiful sunset. Heaps of places to eat and drink. Plan to spend a couple of hours just watching the world go by!

column2: A nice visit while on cycling trip
column3: Started out in Venice Boardwalk and cycled about 5km to get to santa monica pier. Stayed at the pier for a couple of hours for lunch before we cycled back. A nice and relaxing family day.
The pier was great, we stuck our toes in the ocean after finishing our route 66 trip. Took our pic at the sign. Went to the arcade. Everything was great.

The pier, for us was the end of a 14 day trip on Route 66 but This pier is great for everbody, young or old. It has all facilities you could want for all the family . You can just hang out or enjoy the rides and food. Vendors on the peir were all friendly.
While visiting family in Simi Valley my husband caved and took us to the pier. It was a fun experience. The rides were not anything spectacular but an overall fun time.
The old pier has been renovated after some huge storms in 1983 I think. It's getting rather dated now. Some good and not so good street entertains were the highlight really

Parking was jam packed but I appreciate tge culture and things to keep busy doing. Its a must visit if in the area. It was so randomly Foggy for a June afternoon but the people and food was amazing. We got a churro, pizza, and dip in dots. Great place to visit

column2: Just like you see in the Movies
column3: Amazing! The rides are reasonably priced, and you also get a fantastic view of California from the end. There are also a lot of street performers around, and they are defiantly worth the stop to watch and see what they have to offer!

This is a lovely place to visit the pier is nothing special but the beach is long and golden sands.We ate at one of the food vans parked in the main road just at the end of the pier & it cost $8.00 for 2 lovely bacon wrapped freshly cooked hot dogs you add your own topping(s).All in all good for a visit but not sure if I would stay too long.

column2: Hard to get a beer but fun all the same
column3: We walked along the beach at Santa Monica and towards the pier / fun fair. It was a long walk and so refreshments were in order. There was lots to do but only two places served alcohol (Bubba Gumps and a restaraunt at the end of pier). The local tv news was also filming live the day we came. Lots of "performers" on the pier. Hold on to your wallets!

Is good to see but a bit over rated and expensive so, very tourist oriented and I would say be careful what you buy as there are many more places with the same stuff for a lot less than buying them from the Pier.. Good for a wonder around just so you can say you have been there..
Excellent beach! Clean and many tourist the weather was just right; my wife and I enjoyed the live music the street performers played and the funnel cakes are very good.

The SMP is a great way to spend the day out. The pier has many attractions and things to do. You can enjoy the mini amusement park, the arcade games . Try your hand at fishing. grt your palm read and eat some good food. Best to take the metro or Bus, as parking is expensive and difficult to find.
I love the Santa Monica Pier area. The beach is absolutely beautiful! I live in FL where the beaches are nice,but something about the CA beaches are breathtaking!

The pier is the start of route 66, it's fun all day long, parking same as other beaches. Check with city for times of operation for the ferris wheel if interested in this attraction because is not open all the time. Shops. Restaurants and restrooms accesible. Actual pier is open all nigth but not most shops live music sometimes, fun, fun, fun.

Santa Monica Pier is one of the world's most famous, appearing in many Hollywood movies and other media. This is why we made it a priority to come here even before the famous beaches in the area.All in all, there was nothing interesting here at all. There was a small fair (I think it's permanent, with the ferris wheel and all) that looked low-end from up-close (not to mention overpriced), and even on the pier itself there was nothing to do, but for some reason a huge crowd of people.The only thing I found nice here was looking out into the ocean: the end of the pier was much less crowded, and constituted a very nice place for ocean gazing‚Äîbut how long can you look at the horizon? Not worth coming just for that.
The pier has great restaurants and you can fish, there are rides,arcade center for families and a beautiful view of the ocean.

Our family chose Santa Monica Pier due to all of the lovely reviews saying it is the best family beach in California that was within reach. We arrived around 9:30am and found the pier teeming with life. Aside from the various shops and activities, there were a few side performers that caught our eye. It was a perfect rounded environment and addition to the beach for a family to enjoy their day.

column2: Old and needs a facelift but worth checking out
column3: It's nothing like the pictures.... Very old and run down and the day we visited the smog was incredibly bad. The highlight is the bike ride from Santa Monica to Venice beach.... definitely worth doing. The bike shop under the pier is the best and it will cost around $20 for the day or $5 for an hour. Great fun, easy ride and worth doing...

Very enjoyable time for all at the Santa Monica Pier, Pacific Ocean Park. Great venues for young to old as well as the walk along the pier as you enjoy the ocean views, fisherman, carnival lights, street entertainers & dining facilities. Again Fun for All is to be had at the Santa Monica Pier and Pacific Ocean Park.
We didn't really have a go on any of the rides or eat at the restaurants, just passing through. Seemed like a really nice place though and had a good vibe!Busy though!!

Fun, active pier! Nice shopping and places to eat or get a snack. Buy a amusment ticket and ride the ferris wheel. Beautiful views. Take a barefoot stroll in the sand and go under the pier to see the structure, and how the waves encircle it.
We took our grandchildren to the pier this past weekend. they loved it and found a great street guy doing a magic show. The food was ok also.
Amazing amazing amazing. Just full of character and charm and lights and atmosphere and a fab ambience that at night becomes a mecca for all.

The Pier is very fun and entertaining for everyone. They have music, comfort food, rides, pets, etc. The price for the attractions is very good so you could definitely make an evening or an afternoon out of this.
I walked from the Venice beach boardwalk to the Santa Monica pier and Pacific park. A beautiful seaside view and great atmosphere. Food is pricey on the peer, but it's worth the experience.

Finished a Route 66 trip at the pier.A great finale to a long iconic trip.Large pier offering lots of typical seaside entertainment for all the family. All reasonably maintained and clean. Felt safe at all times.

Beautiful piece of the seaside community preserved as a new gem for others to come. There aren't many these piers left, and certainly not more than 140 of these old merry go rounds. Bonus, it's only $1 for kids to ride.It's worth the visit, not crowded in the morning but it gets very busy in the afternoon. Gorgeous sunsets!

If the weather was better would be nicer,...had a good meal at bubba gumps and learnt to share a meal... Huge serving sizes.. Nice walk along the pier lots to see and listen too ..lots of photo ops would have loved to have seen the sunset but another time

column2: I live in L.A. but this is only the third time I've visited the Santa Monica Pier
column3: Since the L.A. Metro, as of May 20th, extends to Santa Monica, I gave that a try rather than driving. It's an excellent tourist spot. At the terminus of the rail line is Santa Monica Pier, Muscle Beach, Santa Monica Place and the 3rd Street Promenade. Enough to keep a tourist busy all day. Although L.A.'s rail system is minimal compared to other areas, you can now travel fairly easily between Santa Monica, Downtown, Pasadena, Hollywood and Universal City Studios. For a tourist, these are some good destinations, although if you're only going to be in L.A. for a short period, I do recommend doing a tour. L.A. is just too spread out, and is easy to get lost.
The pier looks exactly like you could imagine it. Even if it's a bit crowded in the afternoon and during the evening. It still is a nice place.

This is a must do if you are visiting LA! It's a short drive to have loads of fun! We went on a weekday during the day to help,with finding parking. We found street parking at Palisades Park and paid $5 to park 3 hours. Beautiful walk to the pier. We spent a few hours walking the boardwalk, playing some games, and eating snow cones. View is gorgeous of the beach and ocean!
Some really good food vendors and rides. Its not the biggest theme park but it has some good rides at some decent prices. Is also the location of where Sharknado was filmed if thats your thing.

The view from the ferris wheel was absolutely magnificent. The pier looks just like straight out from GTA V. It was a cold day so everything was great. A lot of people, but adds to the liveliness of the place.
The pier is a Santa Monica/LA icon. Personally, I wouldn't waste my time. There are some nice photo ops with the Santa Monica shoreline in the background. All and all its just kind of a tacky place.

A true California experience. We have always been interested in checking out this pier made famous in so many movies.  We walked here from Venice Beach along the boardwalk/ promenade.  Upon arrival at the pier we realized it's a big amusement park with a sprinkling of shops and restaurants thrown in.  Not a disappointment as the views off the pier are gorgeous and the "people-watching" was world class.
Can't go to LA without a trip to Santa Monica and walk along the pier, great atmosphere with buskers everywhere playing quality music.

We visited one busy holiday weekend and enjoyed it. The parking garages were expensive at $30 per car so find a parking spot along the street if possible. Plenty of places to eat and walk around and a few to sit and have dinner like we did at Bubba Gump Shrimp Company.
Great place to be there on weekends, lots to do and watch with children. Lot of activities and shows. Do not miss the skate board arena which is treat to watch.
Hustle and bustle and full of day trippers and families enjoying the sunshine and with a clean sandy beach close by.

An OK place to visit once. I felt a little uncomfortable the the late evening rush to exit the pier just before nightfall, some interesting folk who were loud an rude sort of spoiled the famous "vibe" for us. To be honest I questioned our safety a few times while making our way back to the expensive parking garage at that time of evening. Go during the day and get out of there before late evening and you should be fine. Not to be all negative though, there were great views and good food to be had.

Just as I thought it would be, big, old, bustling, fun.We visited on a weekday and it was so busy, so many people, great atmosphere, great views of the beach and ocean.Went to the end of Route66, fabulous shop and lots of memorabilia. Lots of buskers entertaining the crowds.Well worth doing the touristy thing and going to Santa Monica pier.

Went at 9 pm to Bubba Gump and the pier was crawling with drunks and tweeking people everywhere! It seemed very unsafe and uncomfortable. The food was mediocre at best. We will not return and do NOT recommend taking children... $18 to park and the beach smelled like weed and urine.

Ive gone to Santa Monica Beach couple of times now, & its always a nice time when i go. Even to walk the peir & walk the beach is nice.Summer nights are always packed with people & full with good vibes.

From our terrace at the JW Marriott Le Merigot in Santa Monica, the Santa Monica Pier is a striking silhouette of curves and lines against a brilliant backdrop of colored patterns created by the clouds. Amazing and romantic.

column2: Worth a small walk and a ride or two, but thats it
column3: This is probably something you should do if you have kids, but just for a bit - you'll drop $40 for a few rides, but by and large its a pretty average experience. Lots of people and nothing healthy at all to eat or drink. The crowd is, um, interesting to say the least.

So many activities and shops. Very Clean. All the shops were visited were run by great people. The pier has several different areas for viewing or accessing the ocean. The Ferris wheel was our favorite spot! We were fortunate enough to see a seal!
It was lovely walking along the pier taking in views across the Pacific. Lots of nice foods to eat from candy floss to full meals. A must do f your in Santa Monica

Very beautiful place with lots of interesting things to see and people to watch :) We enjoyed the beach however, BE AWARE! Everyone in our group walked away with oil/tar patches stuck to our feet. And when I say stuck, it was awful. We came away with a higher sense of global warming and what we are doing to our environment when everyone is walking around with tissue stuck to the bottom of their foot just so their foot doesn't get stuck to their shoe. With a lot of scratching, picking and rubbing and 3 days later, it was all gone. Just BEWARE of your children getting this on their bodies, as we were all adults and thought we had avoided the black spots.....

column2: Sunshine, beaches, and the Cali Experience
column3: Absolutely gorgeous day for us. This was the first place we went after we arrived in California on our trip. The pier atmosphere was great. There were lots of performers around (some good, some bad, some horrible), lots of vendors with food, free samples, fishermen, and the carnival area. My students were super excited to see everything. Lunch at the Pier Burger was also exceptional. The beach is a quick walk away off the boardwalk in addition to a mall/shopping area as well. A great way to spend a few hours.

column2: Good place to kill an hour or so
column3: Took the kids on a Wednesday morning, very easy to find parking on the pier, and crowd was light. I had a 12 and 7 year old with me and they played a few games along the boardwalk but weren't interested in the rides. We walked down the pier, and spend a majority of our day playing in the water. Although it was overcast, it was really warm outside. Loved that the beach was not crowded.
Really enjoyed it the best bit of LA by far. The beach was outstanding. If I was going back to LA I would definitely stay closer to here. Great places to eat as well

column2: Worth a ten minute walk to see it...once.
column3: It is one of those things you see in photos and movies. So we went expecting it to be an entertaining experience. It is kinda of like a forever carnival in feel. dirty, strange vendors and stores selling cheap trinkets for the willing tourist. Wanna be Singers every 50 yards asking for donations or to sell their "CD's". If you go to Santa Monica take ten to fifteen minutes and walk the pier. Then go to the actual beach or on the walking path and enjoy the rest of your time.

I we loved Santa Monica it has an amazing beach next to the pier very clean with lifeguards all along the beach.The pier is great attractions restaurants and a great atmosphereThere is a pedestrian area for shopping outside with great variety of shops we even found a small sweet shop selling uk chocolate and sweets can't wait to go back amazing place would recommend a visit

column2: Metro Exposition Line to the Pier
column3: I've been driving all over L.A. for many years and used to visit S.M. regularly. But traffic is so bad that I hadn't been for a long time. When the Expo opened a couple of weeks ago I decided to give it a try. What a pleasant experience. From Pasadena to SM there were Sheriffs at each station, thus no unpleasant passengers or trouble. I discoveered that the beach area was cleaner than it was the last time I was there with a wooden walkway to the water. Restaurant offerings have changed for the better as well. It's only three blocks from the station to the pier through a pleasant area of stores, restaurants, and a complex that houses a museum, I discovered today. What a treat for freeway-weary commuters and tourists!
If you go to LA you have to see this landmark, issue is, realize everyone else wants to do so too. It is very full in the afternoons and can get a little sketchy!

I had not been to the pier since 2006, so for my husband's birthday, we took a trip to Southern California now that we live in the west.It was a Friday afternoon in October, 2015, and it was busy. We were able to find parking right by the entrance. It was so much fun to spend the afternoon people watching, having a nice dinner, and seeing the sun set over the Pacific.This is a great place to let go and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Took our 4 year old here and had a blast, good selection of games and rides. Good place to kill a hour or so with some good eating places on the pier as well.

We went here on our first day in Santa Monica. It was super packed but we had fun looking around and enjoying the views. The fresh fruit served along the pier was phenomenal and not expensive at all. It's worth just the walk around and to say you have been there.
The pier is great place to chill with family.We went in the evening and it was buzzing. We ate at Bubba Gump.

Loads of things to do and see on the pier, Bubba Gump restaurant too! Really easy to get to and plenty of parking nearby. End of Route 66 sign is good for photos if not completely accurate the actual end is before the pier.

We visited on a Tuesday afternoon. Even with a thick marine layer and cool temperatures it was very busy. We had to park quite a distance away. Been here before just as a couple. Didn't feel really safe with my family. Lots of homeless and vagrants. Dirty. Don't need to come back.
This is the end of Route 66, so walk the length of the pier for that reason alone. There are lots of good street entertainers and eating establishments. Enjoy the ocean view at the end.
Quite nice but this is a real tourist trap. Really busy, go early to avoid the crowds. Watch people fishing off the end of the pier

Gaze at the Pacific Ocean from a 130-foot Ferris wheel, powered by the sun! The view is spectacular, and is well worth the $8 ticket price. Hungry? The Albright, named for the nautical Albright Knot (fun fact!) serves up a good "Shrimp Po' Boy Sandwich" (ask for extra sauce on the side) and craft beer in a laid-back atmosphere. And just shy of the Pier, is where Route 66 ends; great picture-taking opportunity!
It's nice, but it's a pier....The ocean is beautifully blue, and the variety of people was amazing.
We took our grandson there after visiting a few other area attractions. He loved the arcade (who doesn't?).The weather was fabulous as usual and it made for a fun few hours.

It has the feel of a typical fair, only you're on a pier and the ocean and mountains act as a backdrop. The rides personally didn't interest me at all, but the energy was good and I thought it was worth checking out.
We were there early in the morning before all the crowd. Neat place to visit, the end of Route 66. We did not do any of the carnival rides but would be fun for children.
Took our 4 month old over to the states for her first trip. She absolutely loved the trip to the pier. The sounds and sights were good to keep her amused. A great place for a family outing
Pier takes you back to the 50s and could do with some loving care. Lovely to stroll around though in nice weather, which we had.

column2: A Must Go While in Los Angeles
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is a must visit for any tourist coming to Los Angeles. It is a long pier at Santa Monica Beach, right next to Palisades Park. The Pier has rides and a really cool old carousel (the one in the movie The Sting with Robert Redford). You can get a wrist band for the rides at about 29$. The Carousel is a separate price.The Pier is fun day or night. If you are here in the winter the rides are likely not open on the week nights.There is a ton to do right at the Pier. There are the fun rides, a game area with all the latest video games, there is cheap eats and a couple great restaurants.You will park under the Pier and there is a fee. You can walk from your car to the beach and the waves or up the stairs to the Pier. If you feel like walking Palisades Park is right next door and the view of the beach is wonderful.While you are there, your wallet will be in your front pocket. But don't worry, it is safe, there is a police presence. Please do not give money to the homeless there--ya, sounds cold--but you are just feeding their drug habit and Santa Monica has many places for food and shelter for the homeless.Have the best time.

column2: Road Warriors this is the end of Route 66
column3: We have traveled 3300 miles in 3 weeks (Route 66 + few detours). It was an amazing trip and we would do it all over again. When we arrived to Santa Monica it took us many hours in bumper to bumper traffic to get to the famous Pier, where we wanted to take a photo with the End of Route 66 sign. Unfortunately, as it was a Saturday evening and the amount of traffic and no parking spaces were incredible, we have walked there from our hotel on a Sunday morning and then we took the victorious pictures with both signs (one on the Pier, and the original one by the Visitors Centre booth). The Pier itself is very nice, the last Route 66 shop is definitely worth a visit. Beautiful vast beach. As we visited in May it wasn't too crowded.

A day at Santa Monica Pier was one of the best activities for my 11-year old daughter and me. We did all the rides at the amusement park. We visited the aquarium and had a delicious lunch. We would definitely go back with Dad and brother next time we go to LA.

My bestie and I stopped by here Friday night around 9pm. (We wanted to make sure we crossed it off the list. lol) There were a lot of little shops, street performers, and people doing caricatures and even a clay bust of your face!(that was cool!) There's an arcade, a ferris wheel, and other rides. If you go at night wear a jacket and sneakers, it gets really cold. My friend had to buy a $45 sweatshirt because she was so cold, and she had on a light blue jean jacket!

column2: Good day out if you have kids
column3: The pier has a few resturants that are usually very busy.The theme park has a few good ride for the kids.And you get a great view of the beaches in both directions.Also the start or end point for the route 66 travellers.

column2: West end of historic route 66: Loads of fun
column3: There are lots of things to do here with loads of fun, whether you are a lone traveller, a couple or travelling with your friends or family. There's something for every one. Great views. Water is cold even in the summer. Limited dining options but I'm sure you can find one that suits your budget.

Everyone of us had a great afternoon at the Pier. Watching people, making our pic in the photo booth - lunch at Albrights. The next time we came we had dinner at an Italian restaurant on the 2 floor- seemed a bit odd at first but the food was great. It is on the left as you are at the start of the pier.
We had some great nights at the pier. Being from England we had some high expectations of the pier. We particularly liked Rusty's bar. The staff were helpful and views spectacular.

The pier was fun. We got there early so we're able to park with ease and walk and enjoy the boardwalk before the crowd arrived. Wish we had brought our children on this trip because they would have enjoyed it. We were glad there was easy beach access.

column2: Visited as part of a roadtrip
column3: End of Route 66, enjoyed the vibrant pier. Much like Brighton in England. Touristy and theme park. Sampled Cookie Monster ice cream!

This is a nice wooden pier with a sound heritage and lots to do and see. There are amusements, cafes and shops to wander round as well as on the pier parking. There is also the end of the historic Route 66 sign which is a very popular photographic point. It has various historic signage with history of the beach and the pier. An interesting place to visit.

We went here twice - once in the rain, the other in sunshine. Don't go in the rain, its not worth it (luckily on our last day the sun came out!) The pier has lots of little stalls, eateries and rides. The beach is beautiful and a nice place to hang out.

We started of from the Santa Monica Pier where we hired push bikes to ride up to Venice Beach. The pier is good to walk along to see the side shows, shops but gets very crowded. To ride to Venice only takes around 20 mins along the beach, you get to see the original muscle beach where Arnie started of. Good little ride and you can take your time.

Santa monica pier has so much to enjoy from the rides to the beach .our family went to disneyland an we set one day aside just for santa monica pier but we should of set two days we spent half the day on the pier an the other half on the beach .they have way far the best funnel cakes. Kids enjoyed the ocean we bought them little surf boards at the pier they were pro sufers by the time we left lol we actually went back two weeks later an we are diffently returning

The iconic outline of the Santa Monica Pier beckoned to us as we walked up the beach after a day walking up and down the boardwalk to Venice.On the Pier, we people-watched while walking to the end past buskers and finger-painting artists, collecting pennies from the machines in the arcade and small amusement park. We had already had a full day, so didn‚Äôt linger long, but the pier was clearly a favorite of families, fisher-folk, buskers, locals, and tourists alike.This is a fun place to while away an afternoon, or to end your day with dinner at Bubba Gumps or another of the pier-side restaurants. Bring your change, whether it be for the pennies, the arcade, or the buskers.

If you're able to go, then do! Had a great sunny day here on the pier and walking along the beach. Weren't able to go further into town, due to timings. But would definitely recommend to spend the $8 and go on the Ferris wheel!

Great few hours to waste the time. Lots of things going on and especially for us as it marked the end of Route 66 which was a mile stone and this eve we planning on going on the Ferris wheel later for an evening out x

Santa Monica is beautiful but the pier is typical. Crowded on a Thursday afternoon. We spent about 10 minutes walking around. Paid $12 for parking. Lunch was good at the pizza place near the entrance. We enjoyed walking and more time on the boardwalk more than the pier.

Visited the pier late afternoon to evening in April. Weather was pleasant got a little windy. Sat at the end of pier watching the sunset, listening to music vendors, visiting with other tourists, and watching a seal begging for fish from the fisherman on the pier.
Santa Monica pier was great and a short walk from ocean view . Very pretty at night and good shopping during the day üòÉ a must see if in Santa Monica

Beautiful pier. Great place for a nice walk, for fishing, for dinner, for watching the sun rise or set, for people watching and more. Take the walk on the pier before or after shopping around (3rd street promenade).

Stayed in Santa Monica for one night only on our way to LA.Had a lovely main shopping area, as well as streets with lots of different shops too. Good for eating and drinking.Didn't really rate the pier, a lot like Blackpool in America, full of unlikely characters, felt a little unnerving at times. Very expensive for drinks and snacks. A lot nicer to see from a distance as opposed to close up.
We loved the beach but the weather was cold and windy during the memorial weekend. It's really great for the kids since there are rides, restaurant and all kinds of deserts are available.
Beautiful photo opportunities rain, hail or shine!! just what you need to make you smile it just exudes happiness!!

I had visited many times Santa Monica. There was wonderful again. Streets, people who have performed on the roads, stores and of course pier are fantastic as always. Santa Monica pier takes my breath away. If you wanna take a breath, there is best choice for me.

column2: Quaint place but fix the street entertainment
column3: An interesting combination of eateries. It's worth a visit for the view but they really need to tidy up the buskers. From reasonable entertainment to some old guy with mismatched gloves that simply stands there wobbling to bad music, without a word except for the almost illegible hand written sign begging for tips despite a complete lack of talent.

Great way to pass the time with lots of things for kids to do of all ages ! We did the Ferris wheel (great views ) and the roller coaster ! Good way to see down the coast line and grab a bite to eat in one of the many restaurants go on a clear day for the best view and take your photo at the start of Route 66 !!!
The Santa Monica pier is at the beach front. There are lots of activities on the pier. Shopping, entertainment, eateries, all in one place. A paradise for the camera click friendly.
Santa Monica Pier has to be seen. But you need to keep an eye on the weather.If it is foggy then you don't see much.Great to walk around and enjoy the fair and the restaurants are all very nice.

column2: Exactly what a pier should be
column3: We live by the sea and have a poor excuse for a pier, which no doubt was once great. Santa Monica pier shows exactly what can be done, including parking cars on the pier ! There is a small theme park for the kids and lots of different options to eat and drink. Most importantly there are fabulous views of the beach, which itself is immaculate. If it weren't so far away we would come back here again and again !

column2: Fun time for the whole family
column3: Great time for the family and especially children. Wonderful rides, food and all around atmosphere make this a wonderful and enjoyable time to experience. Parking is expensive at $12 per day but there are exceptions if you look around.
Walked around the pier, watched the street performers and were very entertained. Once at the end we are at the Mexican restaurant. Great food and the margaritas were great!

The famous Santa Monica pier, said to be the end of the even more famous Route 66, stretching from Chicago to Los Angeles. There is even a sign to have a photo with. The pier itself is great for a walk along, look out at the beach that stretches for miles and browse the fair, shops and restaurants.
Stunning beach great photo opportunities. Fun fair ground and lots of music playing by live artists (remember if you take a picture of them they expect a tip!) Also sell great churros.

I have lived in Santa Monica for a month to study english and I walked by the pier every single day. It is such a lovely place to take a walk. Sure there is a lot of people and it's quite touristic but it is a really comforting place. Everybody there looks relaxed and happy. There is always some kind of "crowd animation" like a dancing crew. Piers in general are nice but this one is particular and worth the bend.

There are a lot if things to do. You can enjoy the sun and the sand and of course the water at the beach. The pier has a lot of restaurants around teeming with tourists and locals. There's just really a lot of people so be careful of your bags and purses. Kids' rides are also available but we did not get on any as my partner does not do rides lol. Get prizes on small games around which are fun and entertaining. Souvenir shops are also around where you can get LA labeled stuff. Get a great view of the sunset by making restaurant reservations ahead.
Fun for the entire family. This attraction just continues to improve. The Pier looks much better than I remember growing up. Prices remain reasonable.

column2: A whole new level of tacky
column3: Full of street performers, average artists and cheap restaurants. The only good thing there is bubba gumps shrimp restaurant and that's at the entrance/exit. If tacky is your kinda thing then this is for you. If you like the finer things in life then avoid like the plague.

column2: Best what LA has to offer.
column3: Spend whole day here, hire a bike to ride to Venice beach, go for rides, grab a hotdog on stick and enjoy great vibe. Amazing place to be, might get super crowded on weekends and public holidays.

The end of Route 66. This was one of the stops on the Hop On Hop off bus. It was a sunny day, but the wind chill made the 3 of us buy hoodies when we were walking on the Pier. We thought the ice cream prices were high. Had lunch from one of the food vans back on the street, that was great value.

column2: Nice place to take a walk
column3: I visited on Sunday with thousands of people there.It's so crowded. However, since I have played GTA, this place makes me feel interesting.

column2: Pier and attractions ok but the Beach is great
column3: The boardwalk and the pier attractions are a bit second rate carnival and the aquarium under the pier is pretty lame but the beach is gorgeous. Too bad it was windy and cool or it would have been much better.

Personally I did not feel safe walking on the pier at Santa Monica . There were lots of homeless people and others openly smoking drugs using a glass pipe. If you can put that aside it was interesting seeing the different things on the pier such as bubbas seafood. There were a few eating places on the pier but didn't stick around long enough to enjoy as we didn't feel safe.

This is the end of route 66. Admission to the pier is free, but the theme park there is about $30. The beach is extremely popular and parking is usually full so you might be better off walking or taking a cab. There are volleyball courts set up along the beach and lots of vendors!
