You can buy art, clothes, beachware, postcards, etc. You can also rent equipment, but food and equipment around this area is expensive.

It was very crowded in the evening, less crowded in the afternoon.It's a classic must see in LA, however once you've seen it you probably won't return. Charming arcade with classic games like PacMan.The restaurants are okay.You can park directly on the pier or on the nearby parking lot. Romantic at sunset.

column2: Nice spot to spend a few hours
column3: This is a good place to spend a few hours on a nice day. There are rides, restaurants, shops, great view of the beach and lots of options for people watching. Parking is very limited nearby. It's one of those places where you have to go if you're in the area.

column2: Commercial but only one end to Route 66
column3: Always fun to take a walk there, see people fishing. The Lobster Grille at the beginning is worth the stop and the burgers on the Pier if you are hungry and cannot wait until 3rd street :-)
Went to the pier as tourists with my partner and I thought it was a great attraction. Lots to see and do and it is like walking into the set of GTA. Had a great time.

column2: Enough to do on and around the pier!
column3: The pier is surrounded by and filled with attractions, restaurant, ocean, beach and a lot of people. No matter what your age, you can have fun going to the pier. Of course it's one of those things you should see when in Santa Monica/LA.

Can't come to Santa Monica without visiting the pier - such an iconic feature of Santa Monica - lots of merry-go-rounds for the young but in reality the pier is fun for all ages.Has been a feature of the area for close on 100 years with wonderful views, particularly the sunsets and Malibu in the distance and lots of cafes for lunch and stores for souvenirs.
So pretty and peaceful. Granted it was windy and too cool to play in the water, but feeling the sand underneath my feet and enjoying the waves was great. Can't wait to visit again when it is warmer.
It is a really long pier, with a small amusement park near the front and a restaurant at the end of the pier. Roller coaster was short but fun, with great views of the park.

What an amazing place, full of history and culture, but also just such great scenery. Make sure you get to the pier at sunset as people local and visitors alike flood the pier for the best view, and while you are there check out some street artists and good food along the way

if you are in Santa Monica, and you do not know what to do, go to the pier. this place is amazing. Beautiful view and a little park in the middle. There are a lot of artists playing and singing and some restaurants. The best way to finish a day
Next to a wonderful Santa Monica Beach, where you can park. A short, fun walk to the end of the pier. Many food choices. A few rides. A good family destination.
Touristy. Good if you like crowds. Great food on the pier. You can feel the vibe even as you make your way down to the pier.

column2: Just came here for the fun
column3: Enjoyable!Best place for seafood and people watch. Kids will have a blast here. Just watch your step, you might trip on the wooden boardwalk because it's kinda uneven.
It is a really nice place to take a walk. The views of the sunset are amazing. You can also go down to the beach. There are a lot of people but it's worth to visit from time to time.

Well after a month long road trip and over 7000 miles to make it to the Santa Monica Pier was exciting. We arrived in time to see the sun set. The next morning we arrived and parked on the pier, we returned to the pier after a day out on bus tour and had dinner at Bubba Gumps. Another must do in my list, so tick !! Strolled along and enjoyed the street performers. So much talent. There are numerous souvenir shops and stalls, choice of eateries and of course, no trip would be complete without a ride on the Santa Monica Ferris wheel and a pic by the Route 66 end of the trail sign.

Santa Monica was lovely. From Hollywood cost about ‚Ç¨40 dollars to cab it bu worth it. If cabing around, uber cabs is a great & safe option. We saved a lot of money, just upload the app on your phone..The pier was lovely, rides, attractions but just pleasant to walk around. We walked up into town and was very clean & quaint!! We'd stay there if we returned rather than in Hollywood itself.

This was the ultimate attraction - we enjoyed seeing where Route 66 ends. Lots of attractions and activities for families. People of all cultures, buskers who were very talented. Lots of food places and of course Bubba Gumps.An attraction at the end of the pier was a seal swimming and people fishing off the end of the pier. The wind was a little cool but sunny but that didn't stop many going for a dip but the beach was quite steep - caution needed.
The pier has a wonderful old school feel to it, straight out of a film. Go and visit in the early evening as the sun sets as it's beautiful and still buzzing with people

Noce pier with a lot of shops and restaurants. If the weather is good you ll have a nice view on the sea. Its a very famous place although piers are quute common in california. If you're close to it you'll check it out anyway so you dont really need my advice.Cool historical fact: this is where the route 66 officially ends.
Great to see the pier, definitely worth checking out, quite a bit to do on the pier, arcade machines and a few rides you can go on.

It took us almost 3 hours driving to get to the pier from San Diego. We got there at 10:30am however the rides were not running at that time. There are public rest rooms on the pier. The souvenirs are cheaper on the pier then in the stores. Plenty of food & coffee to buy on the pier as well. You can walk to the dept. stores & there is a park nearby. If you go during the week you might be able to find street parking or cheaper parking in some hotel garages. For our convenience we paid $12 at the lot at the pier.

The surrounding beachfront and parks makes for a nice stroll here, but once there I find it too crowded for my taste, plus it has kind of a dirty feel. Makes for interesting people watching, but overall it's just too touristy.
This icon is really a rather sleazy tourist trap, but it is worth strolling down once to gawk at the other gawkers and all the hawkers. What you see is about what you should expect.
Although weather not so good but still feel relaxed and romantics there are market , can buy souvenir and many shops nearby

My son and I stopped by the pier and it was fun walking around looking at the beach and pier area. We rode the Ferris wheel and they gave us about a 15 min ride! It offers a beautiful view of the beach, pier and surrounding neighborhood.

column2: Great atmosphere to walk up and down
column3: lovely views - some good restaurants.Nice summers day walk and day outCan eat at Bubba shrimp or the Lobster
It was the end of a Coast to coast trip. It is a must see. Quite pleasant area with many activities. Slightly overpriced services but worth the penny.
Well worth viewing the famous pier. We walked from Venice Beach all the way up to Santa Monica Pier with a few stops along the way.
One of the places i loved the most. People watching and staring at the sun while having coffee. Very serene nice place to eat lunch or dinner walk in the sand

End of famous Route 66 is here. Used in many movies and tv series. Nice beach area and great pier with small amusement park. Has restaurants on it. Very nice place to visit. Parking is very close. If arrive from Santa Monica do not exit on the ramp but keep right to go to the close by parking lot.

Coming from the UK the pier is pretty much like a lot of piers back home. They have the usual arcades, stalls and rides. If you have children then you could spend a few hours on the pier, but be prepared to spend a lot of money too.

Found parking in the public garage a couple blocks from the beach. It has 90 minutes free parking. However, this is not much time to casually enjoy the pier, beach, or city shops. It is a really nice place to visit and shop. Wish we had more time to spend here. Rent a bike or stroll along the paved beach pathway. Will definitely return to visit.

Two adults went for a stroll on Sunday morning when it was not crowded. Clean, attractive pier with shops, restaurants and a small amusement park (opens later in the day). Great views of the beach and ocean scenery! Was fun to watch the fishermen on the end of the pier. Public restrooms are available. It's free to go on the pier but of course you have to buy tickets for the games and rides. There are pay parking lots at the base of the pier. You can also access the beach trail from here and walk up and down the beach. The pier is wheelchair accessible but it is a boardwalk so the surface is somewhat bumpy/uneven - take it slow.

We were disappointed by the Fun fair on the Pier - It looks enticing from afar - lots of colour, dominated by a Ferris Wheel, but up close, it all looks a bit dated and sad (and overpriced!), and badly needs updating. Even their lovely Carousel has been housed in a poorly-lit hanger, draining all the colour from what could be a delightful sight. Underwhelmed.

column2: Like Blackpool UK with more tramps
column3: Underwhelmed! I need to fill 100 words, maybe I should just write, tramps 100 times, the place was full of them. If you have kids, it's a good place to take them, it's way overpriced for food and drinks and the view isn't the best. But as a piece of nostalgia it okay. Did I mention there's tramps? That's 100!

column2: Sun, Seafood, Sights and Sounds of Santa Monica
column3: Lots to see at Santa Monica Pier. Started the day at the restaurant at the far end of the pier. Had authentic Mexican/seafood and ice cold drinks overlooking the ocean. We arrived about a half hour after the place opened and experienced pretty no wait and prime patio seating.The pier has an abundance of performers, fruit vendors, gift shops and food. The restrooms were clean and equipped with showers to rinse off from the beach.Families can also enjoy carnival games and rides right on the pier.

If you want to have fun with kids its ok bit if you want fun go to the beach but its cold. Just for take picsNormal si vas con ni√±os hay juegos mecanicos y playa pero helada.No es gran cosa. Mejor venice beach si eres joven o adulto soltero

It's a nice walk out to the end of the old wooden pier where there are small stalls along the way with a kiddy carnival at the end with rides & sideshow alley, there is a fishing area at the end of the pier, you can sit on the large viewing area & watch the passing parade & the waves roll in. We went on the roller coaster which was very tame & expensive ($8US), this pier is theoretically the end of Route 66 so there is a shop selling Route 66 souvenirs. There is a great Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier that I would recommend "Mariasol". It was a beautiful sunny afternoon but it did get windy as the sun went down, great spot for photos.
Nice Pier and nice to walk down it. It is not huge like the S.F. Pier 39. Had some good restaurants and shops along the way. Worth checking out if in the area.

My favorite part of the Santa Monica Pier is the far end where you can watch a few brave souls cast lines to fish. The ocean was magnificent the day I was there, and there was one clever sea lion hanging out near the fishing lines hoping to catch fish before the fishermen did.

I was there on a cold and blustery day in early April so, with the winds blowing off the ocean, it was very cold. It was beautiful! the ocean was as spectacular as I have ever seen it! I also enjoyed the shops and amusement park although it was cold.

This is always a great time. How can it not be.... It's way to cool?!?! We always enjoy having an ice cream come from one of the shops on the Pier & sitting on a bench overlooking the ocean, very, very cool!! The Pier is always full of activity and lots of action..... Especially Friday & Saturday nights. All kinds of performers & musicians are out showing off their talents. It's also a great place for pictures with the water in the back ground. If you haven't been to Santa Monica Pier, and your in the area...,, check it out..... It's a neat place.

Santa Monica is a beautiful place with sandy beaches, palm trees and beautiful people training, exercising or walking around. The pier is 10/15 min walk from the main road and it shows a beautiful part of LA

Santa monica pier is fantastic and really fun. Enjoy a day of fun..nice walk on the pier, the beach is clean, roller coaster, ferris wheel, old-fashion arcade, vendors, restaurants , music, shopping, close parking, a lot of fun, beautiful scenery, very cool. You will be glad you went take lots of pictures.

column2: Just a beacon and a pier
column3: Nothing very exiting about this pier. Weather was not the best, but if you know the piers in Blackpool or Brighton, nothing more here.Probably more fun with kids. This place is really families orientated.

This was a very pleasant surprise. I thought it may have cost to get in, but its free :)I went here on a whim, and am so glad i did. The pier was uncrowded, a lot to see (street performers, great little shops and a wonderful view of the ocean as well as Santa Monica) and a lot of fun. I bought one of the "finger painted" souvenir mirror pictures for $10, which was a great remembrance.There is a small amusement park here, which was fun, and very clean. The roller coaster is great, especially with the ocean below.

column2: family fun in the california sun
column3: really nice place to stroll, listen to the buskers, watch the surfers or the sunset, the shops are a little tacky, but what would you expect - its the seaside

This is the place you see in movies and I am glad that we took the time to visit even for a short time. We rode the roller coaster which was a short ride but they gave us another go for free as there was no one waiting.

We took a walk around the beach and took some photos. The area was filled with many beach goers and tourists alike. There were many interesting things like the theme park, souvenir shops and street performances!
The amusement park was a lot of fun for my 10 year old granddaughter & I. The beach area looked very nice but we didn't have time to visit.
Loved the pier. Went in may 2016 it was a little chilly but fun. Great place for friends and family. Great eats too

column2: Lots of fun for the kids
column3: Lots of rides for kids, great people watching place. Nice walk with a view to the ocean, people performing in the pier, snacks, etc...

column2: Classic amusement park fun on the beach
column3: I went to the pier with my 11 year old daughter. We had an absolute blast riding some classic amusement park rides, eating ice cream, and enjoying the view. We bought the unlimited ride ticket and went on pretty much all the rides. It was so much fun riding the roller coaster right near the ocean. The pier itself was also a lot of fun. People playing music and lots of souvenir stands.

column2: Great pier to have fun with the family
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is great for all ages. It's ideal for kids because the can enjoy the amusement park. It also has great restaurants with an outstanding view of the Pacific Ocean. You can also enjoy the sand and waves.

This place never gets old for me. It is always a lot of fun whether you are coming with your family, friends or a date. It is fun for all ages. Weekends gets crowded so be ready to see skaters and crowds. But, it is always a good time. Live music in the pier always entertaining with a variety of crazies which makes it funny or some good experienced singers and acts. Overall, a great plan on a day out or even at night. Don't forget to live the fair experience riding the rides and playing for prizes!!

I found it relaxing and amusing to just sit at the end of the peer and not only stare out at the beautiful ocean, but people watch, and if you are lucky, you may see some occasional marine life, like I saw whales, dolphin and a seal.

Wonderful place to visit. It was our last stop on our Route 66 trip and we really enjoyed it. My husban'ds goal was to ride the ferris wheel on the pier and he had alot of fun doing that. We also enjoyed the many artists on pier to include musicians, painters and those doing scuptures. We really enjoyed the sun and the ocean as well.

My husband and I came to be near the water and see the sights. We had a fun and relaxing time. Family friendly and a huge mix of people which is great to see. Shopping and great places to eat nearby. Has a romantic feel.

I have mixed emotions of the Pier. I think it is great to see one time, but not necessarily something I would go to, every time I visit. It is iconic, has shops that you would expect on a boardwalk, and restaurants. Not too crazy about the food at the end of the pier. You get a great view, but you can have it without eating in one of the restaurants. There are some good restaurants under the pier.

column2: Very clean and the view is just breathtaking
column3: We visited really early on a Saturday.Parking was easy. There is pretty much parking EVERYWHERE and it is $3.00 per hour.Very accessible.When we went, there wasn't as much people and shops were still close.Although there was an event that day, we didn't find it very crowded at all.We walked around the pier and it was windy, but weather was still amazing.There are bathrooms in the mid-section of the pier, it is very clean and well maintained.

We stayed right up Pico and had to walk down to the pier! It was beautiful! Lit up, and just amazing to see the ocean around it. Ride fares were steep. But, that's not surprising, most carnivals overprice LOLGood time, and we'll worth the walk.

column2: Birthday Get Away With A Friend
column3: I enjoyed visiting the Santa Monica Pier. Nice area...pretty view of the beach and lots of hotels and restaurants available

Went to the Pier early in the morning when it was not busy. Very clean but everything very expensive. A lot of history there and people friendly. Only downside all the homeless people begging outside the pier. It is free to walk the pier but the ferris wheel and merry go round along with food are expensive

column2: A Classic Attraction for the whole family
column3: Almost magical as you walk down the long ramp from the street onto the wooden floorboards. Fishermen, Pelicans, shops, rides, restaurants, and souvenir shops make it the complete afternoon.

When in Santa Monica you have to have a stroll along the pier. Nothing better on a hot day. Yes it's a bit tacky, but the lovely sea breeze, big wheel, musicians, and seals make it worthwhile. You can also get a great photo of Santa Monica and the beach. A pier with blue skies and warm sunshine, it's what all Brits dream of.

I just walked to the end for the beautiful views. Great if you have kids for the rides. I was there on Sunday afternoon and there were only a handful of performers.There's a few tourist shops for trinkets. You gotta get a picture under Route 66 end of the line.The beach was even more interesting with all the acrobatics and community yoga.

Loved walking here with my boys. I let them ride the roller coaster. They enjoyed that. We walked to the end of the pier an got to watch a seal hanging out in the ocean! That was pretty cool.Fun to watch the entertainers as well.

We love the pier! Fun to see some interesting people like the man who will tell you a joke for a buck or Zoltar machine that tells you your fortune. Go on the Ferris wheel! Such a treat to see the ocean and beach from that vantage point! And if you get lucky, at the end of the beach a sea lion might be swimming nearby the fishermen hoping for a free meal!

column2: All hype, nothing to see or do.
column3: This place is a real tourist trap. Parking is $20.00 if you don't want to walk eight blocks. Not a decent restaurant or store on the pier. Lots of people walking around but not really anything to see. Too many street vendors selling junk like magnets, tee-shirts, and post cards. If you miss this "attraction" you won't have missed anything. However, if you are into foreign tourists taking selfies, this is the place to be.

Probably one of the nicer piers I've been on and I've seen a bunch. Stuff for people of all ages and doesn't feel as fake as some I've been on before. Places to eat, drink, play games, rides, or just sightsee. Lots of people but not so crowded you can't move around. Great views of the mountains and ocean from there and plenty of nearby parking.
The pier is always a good time. There's tons of stuff to walk around and see and you can play games or ride rides. Try going at night when everything is lit up, it's that much cooler.

What a busy Pier this is!Fairground,shops,stalls,restaurants,cafes,this place has the lot,well worth a stroll along to the end,so much going on,could spend a whole day just whiling away the time on the pier.
The hotel where We stayed was walking distance to the pier so spend a couple of hours playing some of their carnival games.Just something to do.

column2: Know What You Are Looking For
column3: This is basically a giant tourist trap amusement pier, but it offers great people watching, great views, and an interesting perspective on LA. While it is packed with tourists, it's also got a steady flow of locals who use it for hanging out. If that sounds good to you, then by all means plan a visit. While there are pretty bla restaurants out on the Pier, there are lots of really great choices within a short walk. Nice place to watch the sunset.
nice place to hangout with the kids. beautiful views and fun rides. 16 dollars a bracelet for each kid. well worth the price.
Not the most amazing place but worth a look, pier is looking a bit run down. A variety of characters around. LA traffic was a nightmare coming from Hollywood!

column2: Go early to avoid the crowds
column3: The pier is a must and I'm sure it is fun for the kids, but it's crowded and has they same, typical stuff. We kind of just went to say we had been there. Still, the views of the ocean are very pretty.

There is plenty to do on Santa Monica Pier. There is a the Pacific Park amusement rides, fishing platforms, restaurants, musicians, the excellent view of the beach, and of course, the opportunity to take a photo under the end of Route 66 sign. I suppose you could say, "You get your kicks on Route 66 if you are on the pier."

So what do you do when your Hotel's 2 minutes walk from Santa Monica Pier. It's a must see and do, but this visit was made much more interesting because we met Ian, who was running the 66 to Cali kiosk at the end of Route 66. He is a mind of information, with fabulous historical anecdotes of the prohibition era and local history. His knowledge of Route 66 must be second to none, but he also appeared very knowledgeable regarding our Highway 1 tour. Whilst the Pier is an obvious tourist trap, it would appear to be a popular destination for locals on a Sunday night and the whole place was buzzing. Thanks to Ian for recommending Ristorante al Mare at the beginning of the pier, and for wetting our appetite for further American tours in the future.

The views are beautiful, there's no doubt about that, but I guess my expectations were a little too high on the amount of things to do. There's a few shops, a few places to eat, and expensive carnival rides. But the beach access is awesome and the views are too.

This was our first stop in LA. We all had our reasons for visiting here. It was in my favorite movie, it had rides for the kids and we had our first taste of American food here. It was a good to visit here after flying for 14 hours. We got sun on faces and and head plenty to keep us awake. It was nice to walk in the sand and water even though it was a bit cold in May to swim. The hop on hop off bus goes here and was good to see other parts of LA using this service rather than driving which looked very scary to us.

Going to the pier is better if you do it at night, there's more action. Sometimes even bands playing for free, like a concert. I once went when Santa Cecilia was playing. Eating or doing stuff there is kinda pricy

Took a wonder down to the pier when I first arrived in Santa Monica.If you have time then I would take a walk down but I wouldn't miss out on something else if you're short of time.There are carnival type rides and a lot of souvenir kiosks and street entertainers.Great for a walk to take in the feel of the area.Also great beaches either side, a short walk from bars and restaurants.
I was excited to come here but the excitement wore off quickly. There just wasnt much to do here.I expected more shops and some different items. Just the same ole stuff as any other beach

Quite disappointed with the Santa Monica pier, very very few rides and they are for small children. One vendor we talked to wasn't very friendly. If you skip this "attraction" you aren't missing out on anything

In my personal opinion this pier is kinda overrated. Its just some simple attractions/rides and some artists selling/making stuff and a Mexican restaurant. Fun to see for one time but other than that nothing special.
There was nothing going on, so just our bad timing. Lots of young-high schooled aged-people on dates which made for people watching.

I was very pleased we took the time to visit the Pier. The pictures from advertising sites do not do it justice. There are many things to see with Street Performers Entertaining and great food options! Bike rental is also located at the Pier. One recommendation is to be aware of a long incline in the walking which takes you to and from the Pier. If you have a need for assistance and/or unable to walk a fair distance both uphill and downhill I would suggest contacting the tourist information centre for accommodations. A must explore when in Santa Monica!
Wanted to see this place since it's been in so many movies. Route 66 ends here, muscle beach is cool and didn't know that Hot Dog on a Stick started here too. Kinda a cool place

column2: Touristy but you gotta do it
column3: Do it if only to say you've done it. Get some great photos of the beach and the pier and maybe some form of greasy sideshow alley food if you have to. Sit and enjoy the water and a local performer but mainly its the photo ops.

The pier was definitely fun. We walked down it and got to see people performing, just like if you are on the pier in San Francisco. There were little restaurants and coffee shops all along. I was a little disappointed that the ferris wheel was like $15 per person to ride. I really wanted to, but it definitely wasnt THAT worth it haha. So we continued to walk.We went down to the beach, the sand was HOT. The water was COLD. hahahIt was a nice time! Anyone looking to relax, walk and kill some time definitely go.I would totally go again if in LA, this time more prepared though because this time we didnt have much time to spend so we didnt bring towels or anything.I recommend parking a little bit away from the pier and walking. The traffic is crazy busy down at the pier. crazy busy. plus there was construction haha so it was insane.

What a blast this place is. Lots of great excitement and energy. Great people watching under the famous Ferris wheel overlooking the California coastline . We drove there and parked in the lot for a nominal fee and took the kids on rides and ate dinner there. I never knew that the Santa Monica beach is right next to Venice Beach. And driving along the beach after Santa Monica is Malibu. The whole area is so accessible and easy to navigate. Malibu beaches had surfing contests going on which were fun to watch. Also fun to swim by the Lifeguard huts from Baywatch on Santa Monica Beach !!! Once is not enough !!!

Well now I can say I seen it. It was neat to see but don't think I'd go back. It was busy with people and local vendors selling trinkets. Was there at dusk to see the lights coming on so that was pretty. Lots of little places to eat mixed in with the shops also. Good photo opportunities.

Santa Monica Pier is a great place to visit and also great for kids.There are many shops for tourists, restaurants and beach. There is a fun park for kids and lots of fast food.Also for those who don't know, it is the end of Route 66.Parking prices are reasonable.It's a fun day out.
The Pier is the end of route 66. Beautiful to see at sunset. The Pacific Park is in the same place so it's a great fun place for everyone to see.

We started at Venice Beach enjoying the weird and wonderful. The skate park is a great place to watch shredders shredding - who knew you could do a flip on a razorboard? Walked the boardwalk from VB to Santa Monica Pier. Past wide beautiful beach, vendors and t-shirt shops - and "medicinal" marijuana clinics. Nice walk - 30-45 minutes. The pier is what you'd want in a pier. Food, trinket&bead shops, t-shirts, rollercoasters, Ferris wheel. The ubiquitous Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. at every tourist trap. There's an aquarium beneath the pier. The pier's a fitting endpoint (or beginning) of Route 66 - cheesy, low-brow Americana. Why not - grab a corn dog and some cotton candy. Watch the fishermen feed fish guts to the waiting sea lion. Thrill to the street magician. Get your name painted in characters or on a grain of rice. Watch ocean swells hit the pier supports in succession while a guy plays Hawaiian music on a guitar. It's all good old-fashioned American fun - and after the wonderful weirdness of Venice Beach, you'll need a reset to semi-normal.

column2: Such a great place to visit
column3: We loved Santa Monica Pier, a great atmosphere, the people are love and the view is absolutely gorgeous. Plenty to do or simply sit and enjoy the view. Some nice places to eat and plenty of buskers to keep you amused or awed.
Stopped by here briefly. Very busy and very touristy, but still a cool place to visit and pretty beautiful at sunset.

column2: Great view from above the pier (neat downtown Santa Monica)
column3: This was just beautiful and the weather was perfect. I took great pics with my phone. I'm so glad that I stumbled upon the amazing view.
Very old and maybe historic, but sure could use some newer attractions. many areas are undergoing repairs, but look to be more of maintenance function.

You can really get a good LA feeling. You really have a lot to see here. From stores to amusent park. But the best is just to take a long walk and feel the vibes.Also you can not miss the end the end of the mythic route 66.

You can barely take a nice picture or appreciate the sunset. Is not the best place to buy your souvenirs (if you're going to the walk of fame you should by there).There's fun specially for kids, my friend and I had fun there because is nice just to be there, take pictures, see the pier, walk and browse around, but is too crowded.
Altough the beach area is nice, the pier itself is a small tivoli with some mediocre but too expensive restaurants. Parking is really expensive.
We had perfect weather as we strolled the Pier. There are shops, musicians, food, fishing, great views, and activities. Great people watching.

My first time here and it didn't disappoint. I love the atmosphere here. Good vibes. Smiling faces everywhere . Though I didn't try out the restaurants or stop by the shops, I thought of visiting it again when I have more time. But when one is here in LA, it's a must in one's itinerary . That's if you love the beach.
It's worth seeing specially for children. Adults also find charm in it. We all were amused. A plane carrying a big banner was flying. Below is a big beach . One can enjoy

We visited Santa Monica on a Saturday, so expected it to be busy, which it was. We didn't expect it to be as windy though, so our day of lying on the beach to catch the rays didn't go to plan.If I'm honest, I wasn't bowled over by the pier. I thought it looked great on Grand Theft Auto 5, but in reality it was very cluttered, busy (in terms of things, not just people) and wasn't as relaxed as I was hoping.I thought it was a bit of a tacky seaside resort kind of place, which I wasn't expecting. It was almost like Hollywood boulevard on a pier, with people trying to sell things and lots of food and gift places crammed together. I expected it to be quite upmarket, since the hotels in the area are so expensive and the houses even more so, but the pier itself just wasn't.Maybe it's just not my kind of pier, like Huntington Beach pier is.It's probably worth a trip if you're staying in the LA area and want a beach day, but unless you have small children or you're happy just sitting in a bar all day then I wouldn't bother planning a full day here.

I know people tell you this is a "must see", but I can't say Santa Monica Pier was worth more that a quick stop. There are prettier beach areas as you head up the coast, and none of the gimmicky tourist stalls. Next time I will just drive by and wave.
Very nice place, lots of shops, restaurant and bar around the pier.Perfect holiday trip with children. Car park 12$/day
The activity on the pier is boring but the beach and City of Santa Monica are great with lots of things to see and excellent restaurants.

There is parking on the pier but it fills quickly. a few places to near but they tend towards average. There are amusement rides, places to fish and benches to sit down. Worth a visit if you can park and endure the throngs of tourists

We visited the Pier 8 years ago with a group of teens and we're excited to take another large group (44) to enjoy the same experience. Large groups are dropped off at the visitors center and are expected to walk to the pier. We took the same path and there was a noticeable increase in the number of homeless. There were only two, to my knowledge, that approached the group and no hostile behavior. It was, however, a wake up call to we Midwestern travelers.
Very disappointing. It's not big, you can walk out and back in 20 minutes. Only a few shops, a few rides and places to eat. Skip the Bubba Gump, etc and enjoy the view instead.
You see this place on the movies and then you go there and it's really not anything that amazing. Interesting but average. Wouldn't bring the family back to see.

It was a nice day for visiting the Santa Monica Pier. After driving around Beverly Hills we decided to go to Santa Monica. We got to the pier around 11:00 a.m. on a Friday morning so there weren't a lot of people there.There seems to be a lot to do at the pier but we went mainly to visit the beach and to have a nice, long walk on a beautiful, sunny day.
It is fun to explore the pier, there is a fun fair and restaurants along it. It is also nice to take photos from.

This pier has activities for children and rides for adults. You can walk to the beach and the entrance to the actual pier is free. You must pay to get on the rides. Parking Tip: the majority of the places around offer a $20 parking, but there is a Public Parking across the Wyndham that offers first 90 minutes free of charge, this is a great option if you want to walk the pier, take pictures and be back :)

column2: Fun to visit - especially at night when it's all lit up
column3: When you mix a mini carnival with the ocean you get the Santa Monica Pier. It's just a fun place to hang out. Whether you go there to ride the ferris wheel or the mini roller coaster or to just walk to the end of the pier and stare out in to the ocean, it's just a fun place that should be checked out. Yes, there will be tons of people (great if you're in to people watching) and tons of vendors selling stuff but that's the fun of it. We visited at night so we could see it all lit up. It was a great setting. Lots of fun things to see and do while enjoying the sound of the waves crashing around the pier. At the end of the pier, we saw a sea lion swimming around where people were fishing so that was a nice bonus. Grab a funnel cake, ride the ferris wheel and just take it all in. It's certainly worth a visit.
Great place to take the family.Check out the interesting history of the pier.Plenty to do, recommend trying Bubba Gump shrimp co.

Out of all the attractions that we went to in Los Angelos, this was by far my favorite. I couldnt stop looking at the waves, and the rippling of the water against the pier. I absolutely adore the beach and this was one of my favorite places of all time.

We got there about 7:30, so most everything was shut down, but it was still fun to walk and watch the lights on the Ferris wheel and listen to the ocean. Even though most everything was closing, there were still many people coming and going.
Lovely area, very interesting. Great place to people watch. Hard to find parking but we managed to find a spot on the street. So much to see.

column2: great place to visit swimming good nice waves to surf or body surf
column3: The pier is great plenty going on kids loved the roller coaster $8 each per ride ...good swimming beach.., the water temp in April was chilly but couldnt resist ...good powerful waves to surf or body surf...can be a subject too a sideways rip I was told by a lifeguard there but the day I went there was none...sandy bottom gradual drop off...lifeguards on duty during the day.

column2: This has been my lifelong dream!
column3: I had a favorite show growing up called Rocket Power. It's based off of this pier so when I finally went I lost it. I was taking so many pictures and swimming with my friends/cousins. I vowed to go back sometime and I definitely will someday. The best pier and beach for me!

column2: Very long pier marks the end of Route 66
column3: Traveled the pier at night and had food at Bubba Gumps the light were on and the atmosphere was grate. Be warned tho at night it does get chilly as the wind whips up over the sea, so if your planning on spending the day and some of the evening take something warmer to wear :) will i return again 100% yes. loads of little shops and things to do...

column2: A must see if visiting Los Angeles
column3: A good day out for children of all ages beach very nearby once they have had enough of the rides and stalls on the pier. Great atmosphere.

column2: Great Pier with lots to see! Bring the kids!
column3: We've been to a few of the other piers near here,and this one was the best. Although the rides and food on the pier are pricey, it is fun to walk around to see the sights. Definitely a great pier to take the kids to!

column2: Great place to walk and take pictures
column3: The pier itself is always crowded, however, there are some great rides and market stalls. The pier is the perfect place for an afternoon walk or a great place to take photos of the ocean, Santa Monica beach or the coastline. It is definitely a must visit. Make sure to leave enough time, which was our mistake as there are also great stores on the blocks parallel to the beach.
If you are hanging out in the area- definitely stop. The rides and attractions are fun, go at any age

column2: this place is really cool - old rides and amusements
column3: We enjoyed the experience. Lots of good picture opps. It has an old roller coaster and some old rides. Of course, the ferris wheel is cool and has some great views of the ocean and beach areas.
Stroll the pier for some fresh air. There are places to buy food. When the Metro Line to Santa Monica is complete I will definitely take that to save on the hassles of driving and finding parking.

Santa Monica became one of the go to places for me any time I visit LA.I saw a lot of beautiful pictures online and always wanted to see it and after I did I fell in love.It has beautiful pier and there you can see all those musicians playing. Some of them are really great. If you get very lucky you can hear Daniel Morris playing his violin.My advice if you somewhere near Santa Monica, stop at the pier and take a walk along ocean. It's very peaceful there relaxing

The pier was nice to have a walk down, it's still well looked after and there was plenty of parking right at the entrance you can even park your RV on there but it was quite expensive.There are little souvenir shops and stalls with things to buy and the odd Street performer.There are three large restaurants one at the top is the Albright then bubba gump shrimp and a Mexican at the bottom. There is also a small food court area that sells tacos, pizza and ice cream and a few other things.You can also go fishing off the bottom of the pier.It's worth a visit if you are in the area and is a fun day out for everyone when doing Pacific park at the same time.

I just needed to walk around the pier and check the box. It was worth it. Nothing too exciting on the pier - an amusement park, bad fair type food and touristy shops. There is a restaurant at the end of the pier where a lot of locals fish. A neat thing I saw while there was a sea lion (or seal?). It was just 1 and very unexpected - a nice surprise. I believe you can ride the ferris wheel for $8 per person as well as some of the other rides. There wasn't anything nice about any of the rides - typical fair rides and games. The aquarium is right there on the pier as well but I didn't go. It is worth stopping by, walking around and taking in the views of the beach/city.

column2: Great place to wander and people watch
column3: We spent a lovely afternoon wandering on the pier and people watching. Our 3 year old was fascinated but all the hustle and bustle. We had food in the sunshine and enjoyed cotton candy too before playing on the beach.We didn't go on any of the rides but our son enjoyed the atmosphere and watching them.

column2: Gorgeous photo spot all year round
column3: I took my 8 year old twins here & there's something special about old fashioned theme park rides on a pier over the water. The rides are fairly ordinary, in the sense that you've seen them all before. But the beach view is gorgeous as are any of the hot bodies that rollerblade, cycle & jog the foreshore.
So much fun...walking down the pier and looking across the Pacific Ocean was amazing! Seeing local entertainment from all walks of life performing was fun. We thoroughly enjoyed it!

It's fun to go and see the pier but I found it to be very touristy all the shops are selling souvenirs or food. Which is to be expected but there is not really much else to see there. The Route 66 sign and some of the information boards were interesting so I recommend you go to the pier but don't expect to hang around all day.
Loved it, very fun, great walk, great entertainment, easy to find parking no problem, enjoyed hanging 0ut

We caught the Rapid Express Big Blue Bus which only cost $1.50 for all day travel for each of us as seniors. It was great to see the Santa Monica Pier and Third Street Promenade. It was well worth the visit.

column2: Beautiful, Clean, Reasonably Priced Family Fun
column3: Great place for a family to do while in Santa Monica. Burger and fries, merry-go-round, fishing, rides, arcade, and parking. its pretty much a must do.

column2: Beautiful in the day, Even better @ Night!
column3: Great place to visit when going down to the beach. I say park near there. Walk the pier. Eat at Bubba Gumps. So much to do.From there head to Venice, than Mussel!

Ok so it's Santa Monica pier - famous, iconic. It is hugely American with a carnival atmosphere. Nice to wander around for half an hour. Quite small and not that much of interest- not as buzzy and interesting as Pier 39 in San Francisco. Great Bubba Gumps if you like that ( we do) and good for people watching. Oh and if you happen to finish Route 66 in Santa Monica his is where the official Finish is posted in a neat kiosk selling t shirts and completion certificates.

Grand Theft Auto had it accurate! Lol It looks exactly like the San Andreas video game.Lots of available & affordable parking. Very clean, safe for kids & families. If you are into fitness this beach is for you. If you are not there a other things to do.The Pier isn't too long, I didn't go on any of the rides, but the view is beautiful.The bathrooms are plenty- no long lines and you can rent bikes and roller blades for an affordable price for the whole day.

column2: Take a stroll but don't get sucked into this tourist trap
column3: It's obviously a tourist trap. It's not bad for a stroll on a nice day. The street performers can be a bit obnoxious. Kids will enjoy all of the sights and sounds, but mine were ready to go after about 30 minutes.
Nice to see but nothing special for our bucket list. Parkingplace was full but for once nice to see when you have kids. And the beach is perfect with white sand

column2: Great short visit and reasonable place to eat
column3: Was able to meet with my wonderful daughter a Marine. There is a reasonable parking near the pier. And it's a great little walk. You could walk to Venice Beach but that's a long long walk. Enjoy the beach and some of the restaurants. I would stay away from Bubba Gump.

column2: If you like street life with characters and tourists
column3: A mini amusement park, lots of typical tourist stuff,food stands for the acute hungry.But that entertains most is to behold the crowds and a sea lion swimming far out on the pier
The pier is crowdy, but nice and friendly. You van see a lot of different shops, street performers and of course the fun park.

column2: Must see if you hate the hot weather of LA at the summertime.
column3: Our friends told that the lightening of the Pier made by led beams, using solar elecrictiy panels.And it is true. At he States, only in California you find environmental friendly solutions (eg.: our rental Tesla eas parking free, upon registration). So nice try, we loved it. Avoid Bubba Gump - try Pier Burger!If you are sporty - try the attractions of the trapeze school. Likes guaranteed after selfies there!Tip: the best shops are just 5min walk from the Pier at the 3rd street promenade. Much better value for your your money there..
If this is your first visit to Santa Monica the pier is must do experience - locals go for special events. The carousel is a classic; amusement rides are pricey; Rusty's serves a fair meal.

The Santa Monica Pier is a fun stop. There are several restaurants on the pier to choose from. The view of the beach with the mountains in the background is really amazing. Great place to walk around.

column2: Good for a five minute visit
column3: I took the Blue bus from downtown LA- really wanted to go to Venice beach but the bus went to Santa Monica, a block from the pier. I thought I might eat there, but the prices were tourist gouging level. Its a sweet place though, and if I had kids, would have enjoyed it more.

I was not impressed by this pier. I've been to many that were far better. All the hype about the Santa Monica Pier is not what it cracks up to be. More for kids to ride the rides. The "carnival food" isn't even great. I would skip it and take a road trip to the Santa Cruz Pier instead.

Driving along the coast you can already see the pier sticking out into the ocean. When you get to actually walk on it, you can feel the history and the reason why it is so famous and popular. This is one one of the great piers of Southern California.

column2: Good way to waste a couple of hours and entertain kids
column3: We came as we were staying in the area. I wouldn't recommend coming here if your not staying near by as it is a long way from all the other tourist destinations in LA. It was good to walk around and look at, but it is just like any other fair ground and wants to take your money except it's on a pier near the water which makes it unique I guess..

column2: Very nice pier, fun for everyone and an iconic spot!
column3: It's not a destination, but it is a very nice iconic location with a gorgeous beach and water view and fun amusements.

Lots of fun to walk around at sunset. But don't use the public restooms under the pier. They are disgusting-- I saw things lying on the floor that I have never seen in a public "family"bathroom. The bathrooms at the end of the pier by the amusement park were clean! There were workers in there cleaning them 24/7.

The pier was an active interesting place. There were carnival type rides, including the huge farris wheel, music, lots of people fishing. We mostly enjoyed the view, the sun was setting while we were there. It was beautiful.

a pretty cool place to visit and a must do for LA! We enjoyed walking up the pier checking out the people and the shops and taking photos of the beaches on both sides. Was very windy so wasn't as pleasant and glad we had jumpers. Plenty of fast food or restaurants options on the actual pier itself so you can have lunch/dinner if you wish.There is a hop on hop off bus booking office there too where we booked our tour. also bike hire and toilets on their peir.
We stopped for a short time at the Santa Monica Pier. The atmosphere was super friendly and laid back, and we saw a great street performance by the L.A Breakers, who were legit and very friendly.
Such a nice tour to do, rent a bike at Santa Monica and ride along on Santa Monica and Venice beaches. One of the real beauty of Los Angeles
This pier was full of people, food, fun... on our last visit many dolphins swam just out of the beach, with tourists. The Santa Monica beach is one of our favorite in the US, it is always so nice!

column2: A good place to see the sunset
column3: A very nice places with great winds, people performing live music, and a nice place to see the sunset.The walk takes about 15 minutes, the shops are nothing special.Provides a parking for 15$ and a quick access to Santa Monica promenade which is also nice to walk on and has a lot of places to dine.

Great place to hang out and listen to the waves lapping or crashing, live music playing, festival atmosphere. Places to eat, but ask how much your paying as we ordered a lobster roll and it was $17 per sandwich. Next door at Pier Burger we got a great burger for $5. Crowded but a must visit while in Santa Monica - beautiful scenery and carnival rides too!

column2: Nice, clean! Not much to do on the pier.
column3: Santa Monica pier was very nice and clean, however, there were only a few things to do on the actual pier. Restaurants, fair rides and games, shops and a small aquarium. It's great that it's close to Venice beach and the shopping district of Santa Monica. I did expect it to be larger though.

You have a lot of options once you are there: the little amusement park, shopping, eateries. Also you can see a lot of musicians and people performing magic tricks, very fun to watch.A must see if you are in LA!

column2: Santa Monica pier was a disappointment
column3: I was looking forward to visiting the Santa Monica pier and was so disappointed. It was dirty a lot of homeless and really not much to do. Spent about 20 minutes there and left.

Ok. I get it. It is a tourist attraction. But the crowd is over the top and parking close by required a small loan.I enjoy hitting local landmarks. It is what traveling is all about. But at some point the enjoyment of it is diminished by the crowds and cost. This place is there.

This is definitely a tourist spot. The pier was way too crowded as was the beach. Good for family fun or if it is your first time in LA. Otherwise skip this area and head to Venice Beach or Hermosa. Both are much cleaner and feel less like a tourist spot.

Had time to kill, didn't fly out of LAX for seven hours, so we picked a beach near bye. We had little idea what to expect and was delighted with what we found. The jetty, pier, was a good walk and we also walked the walk way along the beach. Plenty to see and do, but this is not Disney Land, so remember it is a local beach for the locals and you guessed it the tourist, We enjoyed lunch here then walked across the road to a farmers market, a local band was playing gathering a good following, we then shopped a bit along this main road, called a taxi from one of the shops and back to the airport, a truly relaxing day.

My husband and I ended our Route 66 trip here at the Santa Monica Pier (we started in Traverse City, Michigan!), and it was amazing! We were here both at night and late morning/early afternoon. The afternoon was fun getting to view the pier and watch the fishermen. It was my first time seeing the ocean so definitely recommend! There's all day parking near the pier and I recommend it. It was only $10 and we'll worth it.
A little piece of history along with honkey tonk. A good day, stuck a toe in a cold pacific ocean. Walked the pier and watched people as we all enjoyed ourselves at the official end of Highway 66.

This historic destination has something for everyone. Great views, fishing, amusement rides, shopping and lots of good food options. Just off the south side of the pier is muscle beach and the famous rings. Take your family and go to the beach, ride bikes along the bike path and enjoy some amazing people watching
Great view over Santa Monica Bay as well as amusements galore! A fun place to dine at Bubba Gumps or relax on the beach

Maybe I am cheating in some way. I lived down in that area in the past. The Santa Monica Pier is a great starting point to check out the area and Santa Monica its self. On the pier you will have entertainers, a roller coaster (not a scary one) a restaurant. From the Pier you will see to the North Malibu and to the south Venice Pier 3 miles south and Palos Verdes further south. It is fun to people watch and check out the waves rolling in.

column2: Day and night, you will have fun, and great memories!
column3: Lots of people said they always bring their first date here! The wheel is a fun way to start your date, the view is a delight! Fun and food for 2 to 99 years old! Souvenirs, funny photos, and games. They even have a place with very healthy food. Very clean bathrooms!!!! A treat! A gift! A memorie! A place to be!

First day in the USA, couldn't check in to accommodation till 1pm, so we decided to come here. Had breakfast at Bubba Gump, which was nice. It's a great place to relax and get over jet lag after a 12 hour flight from Hong Kong! (Jet lagged because we arrived 2 hours before we left)

The Santa Monica Pier has a yummy Mexican resturant at the end and fun rides for family! We were able to watch dolphins from the pier and enjoy the close beach as well. It's clean and has a safe feeling even when it's dark.
Great way to see the beach and visit the attractions and restaurants. If you have children you must spend the day there.
Yes it's pretty but I've seen prettier beaches. Not many options for food. Mostly just fast food. I'd prefer sitting by the beach somewhere quieter and nicer.
I really enjoyed this beach. It's clean great restaurants right on the pier, rides and rollercoasters nearby. Probably one of the best beaches in LA.

column2: A good walk with your better half
column3: You can walk here from venice beach till here. Its a good 20 min walk but worth it on a good day. You can try the different restaurants on your way. There is also an amusement park at the end.

This is a classic pier with a great history. It seems to have its own personality. The historical development, destruction by weather, threats by politicians and rebuilding over the years is depicted in photos and displays that are interesting. Places to eat, entertainment and beautiful beaches on the blue Pacific. It seems lots of locals here flock to the expansive sand beaches. Even fisherman are lucky, saw a nice-sized flounder caught right off the pier. And with all the crowds, it is surprisingly easy to find parking and get to it. A great day's or few hours' outing.

column2: Worth the walk but don't expect too much
column3: Its worth walking down to the Pier, its a great place to view the long stretch of Santa Monica Beach, there are a couple of good restaurants - The Albright and there is a Bubba Gump. The amusement arcade is very run down however the kids still had a lot of fun playing the old games. so stroll down and enjoy the sea air.
Lovely view and had a great time. Was good to see an iconic feature that has appeared in so many movies

The pier is beautiful it has a carnival with the ferris wheel at the end. The day we walked up we had a seal playfully in the water watching everybody. Beautiful beach just like you see in the movies. They have a great mall for shopping, more upmarket but really good fun to walk through and great restaurants. The food is clean and fresh recommend the cheesecake shop on the Veranda, views are outstanding
Nice old, pretty simple, not huge, beach was not very clean compared to others in America. Some nice restaurants, worth a visit. Looks like America in the movies for us Brits!

At the base of the pier is a bubba gump, nice food, but pricey. In the middle there is a carnival with a heap of food options bordering & lots of public toilets. And at the end are a series of steps you can sit on and eat you lunch if you like or often there is live music.
absolutely wonderful venue to walk along or sit and people watch. Very popular on weekends. Plenty of street art/entertainers to stand and watch

column2: Amusement Park Over the Pacific Ocean
column3: Amusement park on the Santa Monica Pier. Plenty of rides and entertainment you would expect, for all the family. Also shops and restaurants on the pier. Can be crowded, and pricey, so think about when you go. It's on the ocean, so weather conditions are a big consideration. Be sure to dress appropriately for the winds and temperature. Plenty of paid parking in an adjacent city lot; don't drive onto the pier. A short walk will take you to the town's walking mall area,where there are many things the see, and Many shops to explore. Plenty of nice restaurants too. An all day adventure at the pier and nearby shopping areas.
Awesome for street music and local talent trying to make it big and some tourist shopping. Rides for the kids, some food.
This small theme park is adorable. Such a cool place to come with friends to hangout and ride theme park rides by the water.
Just love the ocean .....Pier too commercialised. Very busy at night...great food. I did love the Carousel! Guess great family atmosphere.

The pier is full of restaurants and tourists shops in addition to the rides area. There is a separate pedestrian walkway. From the pier you have great views of the ocean and the coastline. It's free and there are plenty of shops to look around in.

I had a blast here! Its cheesy, cute and fun. They have a few restaurants to try and when you are done you can enjoy the pier. We had funnel cakes, played games and rode a bunch of rides. The best rides cost 8 dollars a person which is a bit over price. I loved the roller coaster because you get a great view of the beach. If you go at night, it can get cold and windy so bring a hair tie and a sweater!

Fun place for the little ones. Very reasonable and affordable with manyactivities to do including rides, bungee jumping, and good food.Close parking in the parking lot which are just a 10 minute walk away. Partly can be quite expensive however.The kids have enjoyable time there. We always go to Santa Monica pier on her vacation to Los Angeles. And I hope you enjoyParking like easy and one of the buildings parking lot adjacent to the area. A short 10 minute walk to the pier.

We stopped off here while driving through the area. It was a nice place to stop and look at the beach and ocean. We were able to have a good meal and went the aquarium. We watched the sunset which was very beautiful. I'd suggest stopping off here if you're in the area.

column2: Always a good time at the Pier
column3: Even if you are broke this is a great place to go and walk around the people watching in Santa Monica Pier is fan freaking tastic!! You can have a great time for hours and hours:)

I travelled with my 16 year old daughter and her friend, they enjoyed this stop very much. We went in February so it was very peaceful and beautiful weather.There were plenty of street performers, fairground rides and restaurants, as well as the iconic Route 66 end of the line sign, all great picture moments.The pier itself was good for a quick walk up and down and the Farris Wheel is a must do!! You can see forever from way up there!A must visit for visitors to LA

The concept of Santa Monica Pier appeared fun and exciting.......from a distance. Once on the pier it became a little less exciting, a couple souvenir shops, a few homeless people. Can't comment on the amusement park rides since that don't start until 11am.

column2: Let The Pier take you away....
column3: Friendships, romance, family time.. The Pier is for everyone and an absolute must-see experience in LA!

column2: Interesting Pier, decent place to kill a bit of time
column3: I wasn't sure what to expect when I decided to drive to Santa Monica Pier from LA to spend a few hours. I was pleasantly surprised that there was parking on the Pier itself, and not too expensive. There were a few restaurants and the usual t shirt and souvenir shops. Probably the best entertainment were the street musicians sprinkled throughout the pier, but you felt like you had to tip them if you sat and listened (at least a few of them gave that impression). There were lots of amusements for kids, so if I brought children, I probably would give the pier a higher rating. There is a Lappert's icecream store there, which is a favorite of ours from Hawaii. Other than that, there is not much to do, but a decent place to spend an hour strolling up and down the pier.
One of the many stops in LA if your in town. Has the whole fair vibe to it in the beach. You can enjoy the rides and the games or just enjoy the view watch the sunset. Highly recommended!

Just like the old English piers..... side stalls (with prizes just like those of the 50's !!!) But family fun all around you. Rides, mystics, Carousel, roller coaster, pirate ship and more. Home of Bubba Gump too ! Just watch the sun go down from the pier (take your camera's)
Loved the pier.Great huge beach with lots of sand.You can watch seals come up to the pier waiting to steal fish off the fishermen.The rollerfoaster is great fun!

Came here on a bit of a miserable day (weather wise).. But we made the best of it and enjoyed the roller coaster, played some games and enjoyed the shops. Finished off with a meal at the restaurant at the end of the pier!

column2: A must-see California landmark - the END of Rte 66
column3: We took a tour of L.A. while visiting San Diego and part of our tour stopped here. It was a strange day for us because it was 2-3 in the afternoon on a sunny day, but the beach and boardwalk was pretty much fogged in !! Our driver told us he had only seen that 2-3 times before at that time of day. But it was very exciting to be there since it is a landmark! There were performers on the boardwalk, one was a magician who was amazing !! We loved seeing this American and L.A. landmark

column2: Lots of interesting characters, much nicer atmosphere than Venice Beach Pier
column3: My husband and I parked along the beach, only had to pay $8 to park and got to enjoy the beach walk. Very interesting little shops along the way to the pier, lots of options for food and shopping. The carnival was very cool, and even the street performers here seem happier and more appreciative than Venice Beach further south. We grabbed ice cream from the Merry Go round place and walked the pier, great views clean water, beautiful beaches
Fantastic family fun - Santa Monica is a dream! The beaches the shops, the vibe, the pier - wonderful
Cool sights with some much to see and do in a day. Large shopping area where you can walk around and shop and grab food. Close walk to many sights located on santa monica beach

Santa Monica was very nice, and I would definitely return, but the Pier seemed grungy and old. Not much charm. We didn't have time, but I would have loved to rent a bike to ride along the beautiful path than runs along the beach.

Iconic spot in Santa Monica. Very tourist oriented with souvenir stands restaurants and a small amusement park. Good for an hour or so. Or more with children.Don't miss the historic carousel used in filming The Sting.You can eat here but there are better restaurants along Ocean Avenue.Bring beach stuff if you plan on swimming or sunbathing. Water is cold!

column2: It's the Santa Monica Pier, what can I say!
column3: Visiting this place after a 14 hour flight made it a bit surreal. We went for a look and a meal and were presently surprised. The view of the sunset from the end of the pier was awesome.

It was crowded but easy to maneuver around. Lots of places to eat. We stopped by Rusty's (see review). Several souvenir shops and, of course, the amusement park. Walked to the end of the pier just to say we did it. Several street performers on board. Interesting place to spend a couple of hours.

We went on a Sunday evening for a wander down the pier at sunset.It seemed that half of California had also decided to do the same as it was packed, although I suppose this was to be expected. On the pier there were plenty of street performers, fairground rides and restaurants, as well as the iconic Route 66 end of the line sign.The pier itself was good for a quick walk up and down, however the highlight had to be walking along the beach from the pier towards Venice beach. Here we were able to pick up food and sit and watch the sunset over the pier and Hollywood hills. As we got further away from the pier, it got a lot quieter and much more pleasant.A must visit for visitors to LA, although would probably advise choosing a quieter time to go!

Santa Monica pier is one of those must see things while you are in Los Angeles. Not really a lot to do there on the pier itself. There are a few little shops and a small amusement park. I have not gone in the amusement park it seems like it is more for younger kids. There is nice views of the ocean and to be able to see the city of Santa Monica. Was able to watch some Surfers surfing near the pier. The main thing is the beach and the boardwalk that you can walk down towards Venice Beach. You can also rent a bike and go biking up the coast on the nice paved pathways.
Small, touristy and disappointing. Venice seems much nicer. The restaurant we ate at was not good and it was very over priced. The Mexican place at the end of the pier
Spent two afternoons there enjoying the weather, people watching and just wandering around. Parked right on the pier for $3 per hour.

The pier was a great time. Took our granddaughter on several rides. She had a great time. Even as packed as the pier was last weekend, we still got on the rides within a reasonable amount of time. It was a bit on the costy side - $8 an adult ticket (each ride) but well worth the adventure for our granddaughter.
I enjoyed a stroll down the pier and back. Very crowded on a weekday afternoon. Very touristy. Lots of people and sights to see.

We enjoyed walking to the end of the pier. There were two musicians on the Monday we went. They were quite good and I put money in their boxes. We didn't ride any rides, but they looked fun snd well maintained. We enjoyed walking on the beach beside the pier. There was a wooden walkway on the north side of the pier for people in wheelchairs to get close to the water. It didn't go all the way down to the water, but it got close enough to enjoy the waves. We loved the gorgeous weather!

column2: How can you not love this place?
column3: If you love great rides, fun street acts and a variety of admittedly overpriced fair food, then what's not to love? It's right on the beach and it's a great place to go with the whole family and have fun. The parking can be a bit traumatic, but for CA it's not bad at all. If you're in Santa Monica and don't go you'll kick yourself, and who needs that?
I saw my only celebrity ever here. John Travolta was with his family here back 2000. Fun stuff to do and it was in the last Grand Theft Auto game.

Went here for the day, at 1st it looked a bit like Blackpool on a sunny day, but once on the pier it changed, great souvenir shops, and bars and great views over the beach and Pacific Ocean .Walked back up to main road and was spoils for choice at all the sea food restaurants.
Great place with houses, restaurants, roller coast, entertainment, souvenir shops. Great view to Pacific Ocean and the beach.We walked from Venice to Santa Monica pier. A very nice walk.
The pier was fun. Lots of high energy. Many shops and restaurants there and a few rides (which we didn't get to go on). Nice place to eat and walk and shop and look at the ocean!

This was my furthest stop West on my great spring break trip of 2016. It was a very relaxing stop as we got out, felt the sun, and dipped our toes in the ocean. Very fun for families I would say, a bit touristy for a group of millenials who require constant pandering. I kid, I feel I'm easy to please!Anyway, parking can be done right by the pier, but I parked in a garage a couple blocks away. Weather was nice so I didn't mind the walk. On the pier however, the wind was quite frigid!

The ferris wheel is only $8 per person, which wasn't too bad. There were a lot of touristy shops, and people walking around. I think it is something everyone should try at least once. The beach was super nasty and littered with trash though. I didn't want to be barefoot on the beach :/ Florida beaches are better.
Traditional pier loaded with amusements,food stands and a couple of rides.Very lively and popular venue with some typically tacky elements !

column2: Can't beat it on a nice day
column3: We visited Santa Monica on a lovely sunny day and couldn't wait to get on the pier. It was lovely to have a stroll on and I'm sure young families would have a great time.

I only briefly encountered the pier but the mad crush of people - on a Monday!- put me off so I swerved away and enjoyed a much better experience exploring and relaxing on either side. It wasn't even an old school kind of charm just seemed tacky. But the rest of the area all the way up and down to Venice Beach was great

column2: Good Fun On A Sunny Day!
column3: On Sunday afternoon, the pier was crowded but manageable. This is a fun old fashioned amusement park in a unique setting. The ferris wheel and the merry-go-round were fun excursions into the past. Admission to the pier is free, buy tickets for the rides. There are some nice restaurants nearby so you do not have to eat amusement park food unless you want to.

I'm always a fan of a pretty beach view and this did not disappoint. A picture from the beach on the southside with the ferris wheel in the background makes for a nice souvenir memory.It was crowded and we didn't venture to the chain restaurants on the pier or the rides.Tip, take an early exit at the bottom of the street ramp to your left across the parking lot and walk downstairs for beach access to avoid the crowds.
Walking the pier and the beach was a must for you LA visit. Very relaxing day, we had beautiful weather. Had fun playing the fair games with the kids.
Spent a few hours here, was nice, nothing spectacular.But dated but a few things for the kids to see.Parking expensive.

At the pier you'll find a lot of games which are made for teenagers or even younger people since the roller coaster and the rest of the games aren't as complex or "danger feeling" as the ones at Disney for example

Visited here with my husband. We had a great time walking on the pier and then we rented bicycles and rode along the beach to Venice and back. So much fun! Must visit if you are in the area....such an experience. Add your time at the pier to your visit to 3rd street promenade and you will have a full day of fun.

This is a lovely location and the original Muscle body beautiful beach.Lots of people working out and having a great time. Pier is good.You can hire bikes and cycle along the beach it's a fab place for a day trip if your staying in L A.

column2: You must come here once in your life
column3: Great fun for young families and people of all ages . Something for everyone! For more value get there early and grab an unlimited ride pass.

The pier exceeded our expectations. The fishing spots were perfect. We even saw two sea lions or seals looking for a free meal. The singers on the pier were talented and friendly. You must try the hotdog food cart that was featured on Food Network. Delicious! This historic landmark must be on your things to see if you are in the area.
There is a lot to see and do on the Santa Monica Pier. Great gift shops and beautiful view! Fun place to stop.

The Santa Monica Pier is a well known icon in need of an update. We were disappointed. It's expensive to park at the Pier. We had a nice lunch walked to the end of the pier and then drove away. The fun park is for children 3 to 7. There needs to be some added entertainment, facilities updates, to the pier area to maintain its icon status.

column2: Must see when in Santa Monica
column3: I absolutely love Santa Monica Pier, best to park in the city and walk to the pier if travelling via car. Parking is charged at a premium on the pier.From rides, good food and the aquarium, Santa Monica pier has something to offer everyone for a morning or afternoon stroll. Why not try Bubba Gumps, shrimping good. Or stroll right to the end and witness fisherman hard at work trying to get the daily catch, or listen to the numerous amateur singer talents lined along the pier.Well worth a visit
rent a beach cruiser bike and cycle down Venice boardwalk until Santa Monice pier. The pier itself offers some rides for kids as well as restaurants and coffee shops. Worth a visit.
Very touristy and filled with all the things you'd expect to find at such a place, but a pretty view of the ocean and good to walk off a bit of lunch after Ivy at the Shore.

Spent an enjoyable few afternoon hours walking the beautiful expanse of beach from Venice Beach (with all the surfers) to Santa Monica pier. The beach gets more crowded close to the pier, which is Alice with rides, tourist shops, and buskers. Had a tasty Mexican meal at Mariasol at the end of the pier, enjoying ocean and beach views as well as live music by pier performers. Recommended.
Lovely if somewhat damp afternoon strolling around Santa Monica.You can't come here without walking down here!Better in the sunshine though!

It was a very windy weather. ...The huge waves and sea water was a very cold but nice. ...My son enjoy getting our feet wet and walking around the pier. ...The Pacific park was a plus. ...Snack shops was good too. ...We basically enjoy our day. ...No matter what you can win a small stuff toy/s on games. ... my son got a small cat stuff toy. ... Just be sure to get the wrist band for unlimited rides and make time for it. ...We enjoy the funnel cake and ice creams. ... it was so yummy. ... plus love the street performer near our table. ...We can see some people are fishing, some walking there dogs, mostly family with young children playing and some are tourist . ...A very nice place for family with young children. ...
Nothing spectacular. Just a pier with lots of standard carnival fare, food etc. nice views but crowded and nothing particular worth doing. A guess a check off the list kind of thing.

Well were do I begin let's see anyone from jersey will understand what I'm about to say this place is like seaside heights. Nothing special very crowded and over priced. The pier itself is small. I mean it's a landmark which is why we visited but don't expect anything special . The beach though has spectacular views as the sun goes down. There is a bubba Gump shrimp on the pier which is nice. Also lots of homeless in this area and lots of weed smoking you can't get away from it the smell is everywhere when walking to the pier not while on the pier though. The third street promenade(outdoor shopping area) a few blocks down is beautiful, worth the trip for that great restaurants and shops. It's a cool area just not that impressed with the pier.

Great old pier lots going on here. Funfair at end where children given free tokens to use rides/stalls. Lots of shops and lots of restaurants and places to eat including bubba gumps. Great place to very beach.

We never miss a trip to the Pier. One of the highlights is to walk from Venice Breeze Suites along the beach and people watching. This area is one of the most exciting and never fails to impress. 12 trips in 11 yrs and we never get tired of it. See you soon LA. Roll on September 2016.
Great for families! Lots of things to do! Nice walk! Food is not that great! Things can be very pricey just like any other touristy destinations.

We went to Santa Monica Pier because that's what you do when in LA. Now that I've seen it I won't be back. It's not how it's pictured on tv however it was an overcast day when we went. It seemed a bit run down and in need of a face lift.

We went to the pier on a whim and it was great fun! Parking in the garages are cheaper than at the pier itself.There are plenty of shops and eateries and there are fun rides and games for kids (albeit expensive). The Ferris wheel was a fun way to view the area ($8/ticket). The bathrooms in the ride area were surprisingly clean. A few hours is enough to explore the area (maybe more of you bring kids).The beach is beautiful and clean. We ate at Del Fresco across Ocean avenue. We tried the Lobster first but it was way too loud.There are some shady characters hanging around when it gets dark so I wouldn't stay long past sunset.

column2: Great to experience if your in the area!
column3: We liked Santa Monica Pier it's got some great little street venders and has a good vibe. Saying that though we did think that there was a lot of hype over it for what it is. Santa Monica is quite expensive to park your car so if you don't mind a walk park on the outskirts which is free and walk to the pier.
Such a lovely place. It's fun to visit The Pier. Good to rent a bike or bring your own roller skates. If looking for a lazy day, just bring your blanket.
Like a lot of Hollywood unfortunately this place is dishevelled. Would have been great twenty years ago. Now it's just a pier with some tat.

column2: Good place for fun and food
column3: We enjoyed this area with our 12 year old. Lots of places to eat (we ate at Bubba Gumps) and the view of the beach area from the top of the Ferris wheel was fantastic. Long journey to Hollywood so keep that in mind.
My family and I always come here whenever we're in LA. The pier offers a lot of activities and has one of the best sunsets ever. The ferris wheel is the best way to watch the sunset.

column2: Large Pier with a Lot of Attractions
column3: You have probably seen this Pier on TV many times. It is a very impressive structure sticking out into the Pacific. Loaded with many attractions. You will find locals and tourists here.

Our first day in LA we jumped on a tour bus down to the pier, rode on the Ferris wheel before hiring some bicycles and riding down to Venice beach. Such a great day out, Ferris wheel is worth the $8 just for the photo opportunity. Don't recommend the milkshakes, not much flavour. But hiring bikes and riding the bike trail is a must do!
We took the hop on hop off bus to Santa Monica which was a great ride in itself. Santa Monica Pier is lovely to walk along. Lots of places to eat. Definitely worth a trip out to have a look.

This was the slowest roller coaster I have ever been on.
