Designed for younger children as it slow's down but my advice would be eight year old's and upwards.The park closed too early in April in reflection to the rides, as we were on our Easter break.Saying that, their were other areas in the park which were open and we enjoyed that. It was good to see the locals fishing at the end of the pier and see the photographs of it's history.

column2: A lovely place for singles or couples. Couples, your wife/husband will love you.
column3: The only thing hard about it was the parking. Don't drive!!! Take the bus, or some other type of public transportation. Hear me, if you drive your car, you will be sorry! OR get there early. Other than that, Bubba Gumps restaurant, and walking down the boulevard IS THE BOMB! There are other restaurants and attractions. I rode the ferris wheel and the roller coaster, I enjoyed both. If you are in Santa Monica, get here.
Visited So Cal with my wife and 3 children, from Georgia. We enjoyed seeing the people and activity on the pier.

I traveled with a group to L.A. for an event, but with a day of play. We chose Santa Monica Pier for that day and we were quickly making other plans. Maybe it was the weather or the fact that it seemed more like a carnival than a fun outing, but we were so disappointed! We were there for about an hour before moving on. Disappointing.

We went when it starting to get dark, early April. It was chilly, but we still had so much fun. My son rode every ride probably 10 times each! He's 5 years old. So much to do and play. Great place for family fun activities.

I visited the pier with my sister. This was my first time to CA and the first place I went when my plane landed. I love CA and I love Santa Monica. The pier was a great place to spend part of the day. There is lots of entertainment on the pier and s great Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier. You will find yourself wished away by the tranquility of the sea and the beauty of the landscape.

After a day with Amazing LA Tours we walked down to the end of the pier. We enjoyed the artists and entertainers n the pier and had drinks and dinner at the Mexican restaurant at the end. Enjoyed the view f the beach and the water.
We did the Hop On Hop Off Tour and this was one of the stops. We were so glad we got to see this. It was a beautiful view of the ocean and vendors and music all around.

I've been here when it's busy and when it's quiet. I prefer earlier in the morning before everything opens. Walking on the pier is refreshing and has great views.We saw a sea lion off one of the docks along with lots of guys fishing. Not too many homeless people so you feel safe.
Parking is terrible and expensive. Otherwise, beautiful and great for family fun. Theme park type rides, live music, stores, ect.

Amazing place, European part and european style city.I love it so much.. Go in the breezy weather of April before it's too hot in mid summer.Nice place to have a walk.We saw sea lions in the sea! That was lovely.

column2: Nostalgic Santa Monica Pier is a place not to be missed.
column3: Went on a rainy day and enjoyed the historic pier and the colorful people who make their living there. It's a fun place for the whole family, with lots to see and experience.

It is no doubt a place for the family, you have all the rides for the kids and adults. it's a great place to enjoy with young family. The whole day pass for the kids is worth it. you also have the Forest Gum restaurant there and very friendly staffs. Nice meal too...
Great vibrant area, great beach! Lots of restaurants and walking pathways along beachfront. Plenty of accommodation nearby no need to have a car as tours plentiful.

column2: The pier has a good selection of eateries....rides & arcade.
column3: I haven't been to the pier in quite sometime.....stolled the pier & saw lots of choices for rides.....cheap & expensive eats & an arcade. People fishing off the end of the pier...didn't see anyone catch any fish though.

We visited the Santa Monica pier while we were in the area. It was a interesting place to see. There were plenty of shops and amusement rides. There was also a wide variety of different things to eat. It's worth a stop if you're in the area.

column2: Crowded and not worth the visit
column3: After spending 15$ for parking, it is a disappointing location. Not much to do. The food is expensive and not particularly good. Don't eat there.It is a good starting point for a stroll in Santa Monica beach boulevard.

If you're looking to find where Californians hangout, head to the beach. It took about an hour on a red metro bus down the length of Wilshire Blvd to get to Santa Monica Beach and pier costing $1.75 each way. The beach was beautiful and the pier packed with tourists. A great place to spend the day discovering the beauty of Southern California.
hi, we was been before there, but i think it is not so intresting for lovely couples. BUT, if you have a children must have go, i cant belive it the park! Every childrens LOVE it.

...and this one was not good, reminiscent of many of the UK's piers before many of them got their act together in last decade or so. Rather dilapidated feel, terribly touristy. Amusement arcade contained seriously old machines. Didn't try the fairground rides which, to be fair, looked fantastic lit up at night. If you are in Santa Monica, you will probably find yourself wandering on to it at some point, but go with relatively low expectations.
Save your quarters for the games, the rides however cost around $8US Open till very late at night, great fun for the kids!

Great west coast pier that takes my memory back to the good old days of POP, or Pacific Ocean Park. Lots of things to see and do. Santa Monica Police have a station on the pier so you are safe and unmolested. We enjoyed the people watching, souvenir shopping and riding the Ferris Wheel!

Fun rides and games for the kids. Beautiful scenery for adults. This is an LA icon and should be visited at least once. However, like most tourist destinations, things are overpriced and the businesses are very run of the mill touristy (i.e. Bubba Gump Shrimp Company)
If you go to the Santa Monica pier, wear a sweatshirt. Good time with your spouse. However, leave time to go shopping at Third Street Promenade.

Loved the pier and its rides - the big wheel and coaster being the highlights. Bought wrist bands for us all spent an hour their in the morning, returning later that day for sunset (great photo opportunity) and an authentic night time fun fair experience. It did not disappoint and my 3 kids (6-14) loved it too. Rides had reasonably short lines despite the place being busy which certainly helped.
We went yesterday and even though there was a light rain the pier carnival rides were still operating.
Lots of fun and they have an ocean!!! LOL. Actually it was pretty cool, saw my first wild seal. A boardwalk that goes out over the water rather than along side. Rt 66!
This pier is nice enough, and the beach and area surrounding is nice for a walk. The downside is that it is always to crowded and buzy.
Had a great time. Kids enjoyed the rides and soaking up the atmosphere. Hiring bikes nit expensive.Great time though.
Great family fun.Beautiful view. Awesome beach. Something everyone, restaurants, amusement park, beach or even people watching. A great way to spend the day
I went there with my family and friends. We parked the near by and walk there. Its a relaxation place and We had a great time. Check out my photos.

This was the highlight of our day touring LA. Great views of Santa Monica and its beaches from the ferris wheel. Fun roller coaster is not too scary for children. Each of these larger rides were $8 per person, so it can get expensive for families.
If you are visiting Santa Monica or even LA the Santa Monica Pier and Venice Beach are must visit place though both are a bit tacky and dated.
The only downside is that it was rainingand cold the day I visited. However the beach was clean and beautiful. Would recommend.
A must do but a bit of a let down, was expecting a bit more. Had dinner on the pier at Bubba Gump's which was nice.

This is the end of Route 66. There is a ferris wheel, roller coaster and more. Walk to the very end, you'll find a Mexican restaurant and some great views of the ocean. It can get chilly with the wind, so be prepared if going any time soon. There are clean bathrooms and a handful of shops and little food stops. Great place to see.

I have to admit. I am addicted to private practice. This is why I had to go there. There is a very cool ferris wheel, and a nice coaster as well. All the lights and the people make this place a legend. Very liked it.

Carnival food. Carnival rides, priced a little too pricey at $8 a person a ride but get the $20 unlimited wristband for savings. Lots of local musicians and fun. Restrooms. Access to beach. If you go on beach be ready for tar. Bring baby oil or cooking oil to get off. Two blocks from the pier is tons of shopping. Would definitely recommend

column2: Old School Fun at the Pier
column3: This is a great stop with kids. The view from the pier is wonderful. There are rides and games for the kids and a nice mexican restaurant, Marisol, at the end.
One thing on my bucket list is driving Route 66 from Chicago to Santa Monica. The beach itself was nice and relaxing. I enjoyed just sitting and people watching.

Took a walk around and down the pier! It is a touristy spot but I love to experience everything at least once in my life!The views are pretty awesome. I would suggest you hop on the Ferris wheel you might spot a dolphin or 2 in the ocean. Take cool pictures and just enjoy the fresh air.
Cost $56 to go on two rides for 4 people. If you had to pick one ride do the roller coaster or the Ferris wheel. Or just walk to the pier and take a look and don't even waste your money
I love beach and This is so nice ,relaxing view , nice weather,fresh and foggy ...we stay 6hours here walking around taking picture ...

column2: Lovely beach, but the pier itself is a little tacky
column3: The pier itself does not have many great attractions, and is a little tacky. However, the beach is lovely and it is a nice place to settle for a day out with many food places nearby.

You have to come here because ... Well... It's the Santa Monica Pier! It's pretty standard as piers go with beach shops, fast food and some small rides. It is also right next to a nice beach so you really could hang out for a while. Parking is pretty easy and not too expensive but can get backed up.

Great place to take younger kids as there is just enough for them to do without going overboard like some of the larger parks. Plus, this is on the water and has wonderful views. there were quite a bit of people there and the rides were expensive but everything flowed and the place was very clean.

column2: Something you just have to do
column3: We visited in late MarchNot especially busy and although the sun was shining the breeze was a little coolNice to get so far out into the ocean and go to the pier as it is something of an iconBought some souvenirs at the gift shops and went into the amusements area which was not too crowdedHad a "hotdog on a stick" for lunch - not great but glad we tried itWell worth going to simply because it is a little unique and a Santa Monica icon
Must do attraction in Santa Monica. We took the kids to the arcade which was well priced.Also watched the fishermen and managed to see a sea lion at close quarters!

This was one of the best attractions that I have ever visited in America, it is exactly how I had imagined it to be, old and authentic with some great sites. Great place to sit back and have a spot of lunch and watch the goings on in the pier.

A buzzing pier at the end of Route 66. Small trinket shops and a boardwalk with panoramic views of the beach, city skyline and surrounding rolling hills. Of course you have to take a token ride on the pier Ferris Wheel however at $8pp it makes you rethink the decision. Parking is available on the pier at a very reasonable cost.

We loved Santa Monica pier-visited on our first night in the country-made it just in time for a gorgeous sunset. Even though it was the end of November there was still quite a bit going on. We loved seeing all of the Route 66 memorabilia-we all have a love of music!! We ate at Bubba Gump's but missed having a ride on the ferris wheel as it was closing time for the attractions.

column2: Great for tourists not for me.
column3: This amusement park is located on the pier making it a fantastic attraction. Its always way to crowded and full of junk food restaurants. Not for everyone.
Nice day nice walk. Shops along the boardwalk selling souvenirs etc. Ok. Only one filthy public toilet cubicle so not great for kids

column2: Worth a quick look, bu not particularly interesting
column3: Extremely touristy and not unlike many other of these types of attractions with funnel cakes, rides, photos, trinkets, etc. There is a good Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier.
Lots of different people and things to see. Street musicians. People fishing. Saw a seal in the water. Was cleaner than I expected.

The pier itself is interesting people watching. The midway is good if you have little kids who won't benefit from big rides. The setting is beautiful and unique, but the standout feature is the bumper cars. Fantastic pneumatic beasts.

Santa Monica pier is exactly what I had in mind from growing up watching American movies haha! Arcades, roller coaster, food + a killer view! I really enjoyed my time here and it doesn't take long to make the most of Santa Monica pier.

column2: Cute attraction after seeing Venice Beach
column3: It was a small Pier. Cute for a look around, not many rides or games. There are stores about two blocks away you could walk around
Really cool pier with a lot of rides cool place to walk around. Its not as clean as it should be but the rides are clean and well maintained.
I have always enjoyed this pier, fun for all ages. Cool shops, restaurants, and people watching. Enjoy the beach or just walk the pier.
Nothing interesting to see or do here. Clearly designed for the tourists and it interrupts an otherwise nice stretch of beach and coastal cityscape.

column2: Um, Who Doesn't Love the Beach?
column3: Had some free time to hit the coast while on a business trip. Had never been to Santa Monica. The pier was just as cool as it seemed on TV/Movies. Loved the old board walk makeup of it. Lots to do, see, and eat. We mainly took in the views and people watching, as well as grabbed an ice cream cone. We also hopped down onto the beach for a little bit, so our 6-month old could check out the sand, and get his feet wet in the Pacific. All in all a nice place to relax for the day. Next time, I think we may even try out some of the rides.

Great seaside carnival to visit. We used this to visit as part of the Go LA card attractions. Kids had a great time. It's open for limited hours, opens late in the day and is available till night. Some good rides and lots of food options available.

column2: The rides are boring but the view is great as is the location
column3: We don't really do the rides as they are pretty lame, but it's still exciting to come here. The kids love that it is something they recognize I've from movies and video games

column2: Famous pier worth a look - parking caution
column3: We heard that this was the famous pier we'd most likely recognize from some TV/movie sightings and that it was worth a visit. It was. But perhaps because the day was so windy, it was good for a stroll out and back and that's about it. No huge time commitment needed, unless you wanted to lay out, eat or go to the ferris wheel or shop for trinkets. Great photo opps, including at the sign noting the end of Route 66. Note that parking is available off a lower road right at the pier. We drove in from the south and jumped at a hotel's parking lot on the coastline road above, which cost us several times the $6 onsite fee. Ouch.

To get my family of 2 teenagers to enjoy themselves on a family vacation is something of a joke. We didn't ride any rides or even touch the sand, but we didn't kill each other, had fun with a magic pier performer when my son was called up to help, and had an ice cream. Over all, a nice time!

column2: Had fun but didn't stay long
column3: My sister and i met in Santa Monica on business and decided to go on an old ride we used to enjoy as young kids. The scramble. It was fun.
I lend to be there, it's a beautiful place and good for pictures. It's not a awesome place but you can see the things you saw in some movies. Nice.
Took the open top bus from Hollwood to Beverley Hills and changed route to Santa Monica where we spent the afternoon in the area. Very nice afternoon and stroll on the pier.

Visited on a partly cloudy weekend day and was surprised by the number of sunbathers and swimmers on the beach- it wasn't particularly warm! The pier itself was very crowded. There are street musicians along the pier, and other typical touristy kiosks and shops. The rides and Ferris wheel at Pacific park are neat to look at and make a great backdrop for pictures. We didn't ride due to time constraints but they appeared to be well maintained. We had a decent lunch at Pier Burgers- the shakes were phenomenal!!

This isn't a must see when visiting LA. I had my son with me and he wanted to ride the rides. There are a few souvenir shops, maybe a restaurant or two and about 5 rides. The Ferris Wheel has some amazing views and you feel as though you're on the Pacific Ocean. Don't go if you're afraid of heights.

column2: Fun but were there on a cold day
column3: Definitely something to see. Unfortunately were there on a cold and windy day so we didn't stay long. I think it would be great on a pretty day.
Enjoyed visiting the most famous peer. Lots to see as you walk the entire peer. Street artist are very talented and enjoyable to watch.
Lovely old fashioned feel with the benefit of newer restaurants and the rides and attractions. Very busy

column2: worth visiting but gets very busy
column3: We did this as part of the hop on hop off bus, it is worth a visit as long as it is a nice day and you have a few hours just to wander, look at the shops etc. If you have the time you can do the amusement park. Most of the food places had lines but did turn around food pretty quickly.
Lovely pier with interesting attractions for a pier (games, restaurants and a theme park). Pretty heaving though, and traffic is a bit of a nightmare.
Ideal for fun afternoon, nice walk, lots to see, happy atmosphere, kids will love it, nice restaurants, range of stalls to shop from.
Nice beach, nice pier! So much to see like little shops with souvenirs, people who sell self made souvenirs etc, musician. Many people who walk there. We saw seals playing in the water!

column2: Nice tourist attraction to spend an hour or 2
column3: Been here a couple of times, most recently on a family vacation. There's something for everyone - video arcade, amusement park, souvenir stores, food stands, restaurants and of course view of the beach and waves. Pleasant way to spend a couple of hours, nothing much more than that.

The iconic Santa Monica Pier is a must see for tourists and locals alike. Plenty of things to eat on the pier. From the latest trendy food on a stick to more traditional sit-down seafood restaurants. Street performers and artists line the sides and local fisherman at the end trying to catch a little sum-sumthin for dinner.Then, of course, there's the entire amusement park. Rides, midway games and an arcade. Major family fun.
The beaches were beautiful! Pier was just what I thought, awesome. Would be a fun day trip with kids. Even saw see lions at the end of the pier.

This jewel in Santa Monica's crown is fantastic. I've been to a few seaside fun park/piers and there's a nice authentic, timeless charm about this one. Irregular (but sturdy) planks, quaint fairground attractions that need to be seen in the evening as the light show is impressive and half decent food joints make this well worth visiting.

So expensive!! It is $8 per person, per ride to ride the roller coaster and that price is regardless of age. The place becomes very expensive very quickly. The lights of the pier are absolutely beautiful as an addition to looking out at the ocean.

I sat here on the pier just to enjoy the sights and sounds and eat some lunch. It wasn't too busy at this time of the year, and there was some unusual activities you don't normally get at a pier (eg the Trapeze school).

column2: Stroll before dinner at Blue plate
column3: My family has been here 4 months ago. I was last here over 20 years ago. So impressions then was pretty hazy. The huge wooden boardwalk was charming and as the evening sunsets it's teeming with crowds on a very chilly night out. Lots of small stores along with live music entertainment. Artistes and bust carvers on hand to custom anything for you. Lots of ice cream and sweets peddlers and the carnival park for rides. It's worth 2 hours without food and could be a lot more if you include rides and a meal. Good view of the coast lines before dark and the night view is great.

13, 11 & 8 had a blast just goofing around on the attractions. It's not a super polished, super-smiley theme park but it isn't really meant to be. Just go with an open mind and with the intention of having fun. Kids especially thought the big tyre dodgems was brilliant and couldn't get enough!!

We love going to the pier every time we visit LA.It's not going to be for everyone as there are lots of people and kids.But it's a must do for your bucket list if you're in town.I like the carnival type food that you can purchase on the pier.Also lines for the rides are very reasonable.Let's not forget the spectacular view!

column2: A tourist attraction but a bit of fun.
column3: Quite touristy but a bit of fun. The beach is very nice.We found it easy to get there on public transport.The walk along Muscle Beach to the pier is fun. Lots to see. Hiring a bike is a nice way to get along.The pier is colourful and has the usual souvenir shops and food outlets.Some good photo opportunities here and the kids love it

We stop here every year on our spring break trip. Love the family friendly rides and vibe. Just a really cool visit. For better food and prices, stay off the pier. We ate at a tiny little joint on the street at the end of the pier. Super reasonable, fast, and great clam chowder and also chili bread bowls. Wish I could remember the name.
Cool and fun place to go to during the day or night! Fun place for people of all ages! Either to go on rides, enjoy food, enjoy views, or shops! A must go when in the area!
It was extremely crowded place with zero romantic feelings as I though when I was watching to a photos on Internet. This is too commercial place. Manhattan Pier is MUCH better!

Since we were staying up the road, we figured we would visit the Pier to see what was going on. There is a small amusement park but mostly it is just a touristy area with people selling wares and performing. There were 2 sea lions right in the water swimming around and looking for food.
Santa Monica Pier was a lot of fun. Great people watching. Went and it was a bit cold but over all a must see when you are in LA

column2: A historic pier that charms all
column3: Built in 1909, it is certainly a piece of history that charms you the moment you step onto it or rather set your eyes on it.Take a stroll, watch people, gaze at the sea, eat and drink or simply ride on the historic wooden horse carousel, you can do all these and probably some more.A great place to spend some time.......
We've got there mid afternoon and it was packed with people but still fun. Worth the visit id you like people watching. The weather was fantastic!!!

We thought this pier was a great place to visit, but the rides were really quite expensive!! $8 for one ride! I know you can get a wrist pass, but if you only want to go on a couple of things it makes it a very expensive visit.The parking on the pier was good, being up higher from the sand blasting of the beach area.We walked from here in to the main shopping area.I found out that this pier was where the idea of Popeye began, love things like that!!My children loved the arcade & the balloon popping game, lots of fun to be had with those games.Carole : )

This place is full of people! Food is not so good. They advertise they have a lot of food carts but I only saw two kinds. hot dogs and churros. They do have Taco bell and 2 more spots of burgers and pizza and maybe some icecreams and creps, but nothing WOW! Food is not a good thing here. just som fun for kids.
We spent about 30 mins walking up and down the pier last Saturday after spending an afternoon at the beach. Lots of "interesting" people and attractions. Very fun!
We arrived early, around 10am and things were just opening up, it was nice to have a stroll along to the end and see the fishermen, we had a coffee then took the kids down to the beach.

Great people watching place. Lots of things to do. Don't miss the inside carousel at the beginning of the pier for a very affordable ride. Lots of places to eat, music to listen to and shopping. Parking available on the pier. Go - it's really fun!
My first time in California and so happy I got to experience Santa Monica. The views are amazing. Lots of people and very busy. But worth it.
My kids love it here. Al day wristband is $30. Not that many rides but the rides that are there are pretty fun. And the view of beach is great too

This iconic location was a priority for me. Nice area where you can do a lot or just relax by the beach. I could see that parking would be a problem in busier months though. Hopefully we can come back some day to spend more time there.

To start the weather was windy and in the low 60's. The pier is nice to walk out and take pictures. Places to eat had good and bad reviews, some are a chain. Looked like kids would like the actives on the pier.

Nice walk on the peir but very windy just as well we wrapped up warm the rides were very busy and cost between 4-8 dollars per ride you buy a wristband for unlimited use we decided just to walk because they were so busyPlenty of food outlets although a little expensive again they were crowdedLovely views down both beaches

This pier makes you move back into time.. And that's how we started our trip on the Mother Road aka Route 66..The pier is dotted with shops, kiosks, eating places. The atmosphere is fun and joyful. Souvenirs too are not exorbitantly priced.It's a good place to chill and hang out all through your evening.Take a few rides on some old time rides and let this time machine of a place take you back in time.Loved it.

Long weekend and Spring breaks made for a busy pier but the weather and attractions made up for it. Plan to arrive with some time to get in and down there. It's a longer walk than it looks like from Ocean Ave. especially when you have a bike and/or littles.

column2: A unique experience of California style enterntainment.
column3: The place is just great in food, scene an plain fun. Great place to go with kids and adults. Don't miss the restaurants and the games.
If you're on Santa Monica visiting you have to go to the pier! Fun area - rides for the kids, a little shopping and great views. Highly recommend.
Loved the ambiance, the beach, the park and the restaurants. Very good stores close by. The pier is a great place to spend the day and relax. Loved it!

The Pier gets mobbed on the weekends and very crowded later in the day taking the fun out of the place. If you go I would go as early as possible on week day when you can enjoy its low key family friendly charm.
Do it ! Eat at Pier burger ; ride the new Ferris wheel and just be that tourist family for a few hours around sunset !

column2: Kiddos and Young at Heart will love it!
column3: An old-style amusement park that is still fun, clean and very reasonably priced. Lots of fun food vendors to. Makes for a fun throw back kind of afternoon!

A playground for all ages, a must do is the Ferris wheel, the view is phenomenal. All day entertainment provided by the buskers, crowds and fishermen. We enjoyed a Mexican lunch and just to make the visit perfect a sea lion put on a show in the ocean by the pier.
A very pleasant place to visit... great backdrop and scenery surrounding it but the carousel is gorgeous and a real attraction... the end of route 66

column2: Worth a visit, but not a destination
column3: The Santa Monica pier, is a good part of a day trip to the California coast, but it is not the sole reason to go. The pier has a lot of cheap clothing and souvenirs, a few interesting rides and some great views of the beach, but would not entertain for a whole day.It is however an icon of the area and must be visited, and is located on miles of beautiful beach which makes it a must for any tourist looking for a real feel of California life.

column2: Not as exciting as I was expecting!
column3: The day was beautiful but not warm enough for us to take a swim so we just walked the pier and took in the scenery. It was a really beautiful beach and there were heaps of people on the beach and on the pier but it just didn't have the carnival atmosphere I was expecting. There were a couple of shops and some buskers but nothing exciting enough to keep us there for more than an hour or so. After Universal studios the rides didn't compare so the kids weren't interested. The thing we got the most amusement from was seeing the Zoltar Fortune Telling Machine from the movie 'Big' and telling the story to our teenager.
Great to finally walk the pier. We all rode the Rollercoaster. Good fun great view.Spent some time on the beach. Was already very busy in March.

It's hard to describe why this is a must visit attraction. It's like a carnival atmosphere when lots of people are there, an amusement park with some quality cuisine on offer. The night time is certainly pretty with lights and rides for the children (and grown ups alike). The day time was relaxed with good buskers and activities to watch. It's not a huge place but certainly worth a visit to see the historic carousel (or merry go round), the trapeze school, Ferris wheel and roller coaster. Grab a selfie with the Route 66 sign too. Lots of Pelicans about and a great view up the beach with the iconic life guard structures in this great open space makes for wonderful photography. We dropped by twice for the burgers there, they were busy but worth the wait. Seafood seemed a popular choice too, and a gaming arcade appeared popular with the younger people. A good range of souvenirs available and access to the walking track if you're up for a stroll.

column2: Beautiful at night, shopping in the day
column3: We went with our kids at night, we went to the arcade and amusement park and burritos for dinner. Before hand we went to the shops. Great walk and atmosphere with buskers playing great music.

This was our first time in Santa Monica, and the pier was great! We spent a long time just looking at the turquoise waves rolling into the shore and crashing into squealing visitors. The only downside was that the beach was BUSY. And by that, I mean REALLY BUSY. The whole shore was covered with visitors and bright umbrellas!We took a walk along the pier, seeing many people singing, caricaturing, drawing and sculpting for money. We also got to see a big brown seal bobbing up and down in the waves!This is a great place to go in Santa Monica, but make sure to bring jackets - it can get pretty cold down there!

column2: Nice way to watch the sunset.
column3: We enjoyed walking on the beach, heading to the end of the pier and watching the sunset. It was a little busy and crowded.

column2: Touristy: Beautiful view of the ocean and sunset. Otherwise dated
column3: I take visitors to the Santa Monica Pier because it offers a beautiful view of the state beach, distant mountains of Ventura and a stunning sunset. Plus the state beach is right there with free admission and dozens of volleyball courts in one area of the beach. It's free to board the pier and walk up to rides or restaurants, but riding requires tickets purchased on site. The arcade accepts cash on site. The restaurants are chains, so I eat at the Promenade instead. **Parking is $10-20, so try to find cheaper street parking across the pier or near/behind the Promenade and walk over. There's a great board walk on the land, just above the beach and before the pier--it's great for strolling or running. Head back to the Promenade after for shopping, dining and people watching.

If you like watching people, go here. If you want a casual stroll, don't. The highlight of this last visit was coming across a young man getting on one knee and proposing to his girlfriend! Pretty neat to witness.
Over crowded. Overrated. Nothing worth buying or eating here. Nice view of the beach though! And I guess if you like to "people watch" this place could be considered interesting!

column2: i loved this place, wooden walkways great shops, fishermen, and games for kids
column3: I saw this on food network so i wanted to go see it and it was very enjoyable from the people singing on pier for tips, fishermen trying to keep the sea lions from taking their bait, amusement parks all very fun and enjoyable. Crowded but alot of fun !!!

We took a tour to the Santa Monica Pier, wanted to see the Pacific Ocean, was a wonderful experience. Got to leisurely walk the beach and the pier. Paid tribute to the veterans for peace set up on the beach.

My husband and I from FL visited Santa Monica pier during our trip to Pasadena. We really enjoyed the pier. Lots to see and do. We enjoyed the local vendors who were selling art work. We actually bought a piece as a souvenir/gift for a friend back home. Beautiful views at the beach. We have a lot of stunning photos from the sunset we experienced. Nice place!

We were in town for 3 days and found sunday the best as the Pier was full of stalls.Great place for the kids with the old amusement rides ... too bad the height restriction stops us from going on them !The beach is nice to stroll down (even when windy).Some of the stores look tired.
Watched the sun set from the pier and it was awesome! Lost of food and rides. Great for kids families. Must see attractions. Stay away if you don't like crowds and dirty beaches.

This is our first time here... Vey busy place with plenty to do for everyone of all ages. We went to the amusement park, but I feel it's a bit expensive for such a small place.. About 27.00 per person unlimited rides . On the beaches there are trails for walks and bikes and many other things that have wheels! Beautiful beaches with mountains to the side...
We enjoy our visit to the Santa Monica pier, the atmosphere was so relaxing and my teenager was mostly smiling at everything she saw. This is definitely a place I will return to in the future.

Loved Santa Monica pier! Very old style amusement park but modern rides & games, a great place to take children, we enjoyed the atmosphere and the restaurants, people were fishing and a seal was trying to steal their catch, excellent to watch! Loved the setting over the Santa Monica beach
This is a great place to take the kids. Like an old amusement park from when we were kids they have all kinds of rides for all ages lots of games and fun food
Had a great time at the pier the kids loved it riding the ferris wheel was there highlight while mine was Bubba gump shrimp good food and the staff where very friendly.

Hey if your driving past you have to stop.First stop on a long road trip from LA to San Fran after getting off a 14hr flight.Great pier for a walk, we were really early hence didn't go to any of the attractions but had a lovely crisp morning, walked the pier and fuelled up on some coffee and burgers (which were great).I imagine this place would be pumping in the summertime, we were there in January, but actually thought it looked beautiful in the winter.

column2: Main attraction in Santa Monica with great atmosphere
column3: I think this place was not too special. But what made it special was the atmosphere and the crowd! People came from all over the world just walking along the pier, taking pictures, eating, enjoying the amusement park. Such a great crowd! And I was one of them.... I came at the right time in the afternoon just before the sunset so I could enjoy it. Not a perfect one but it was great!

I haven't been to the Santa Monica pier since I was a kid. We were in the neighborhood and stopped by for a visit. Lots of tourists, super busy place with a carnival type atmosphere. A few places to eat, but more than anything, a great place to people watch.

It was about 30 celsius when we visited Santa Monica so a visit to the pier was a perfect chance to sit enjoy the sun and do some people watching.It is such a busy place with so much going on - restaurants, music, hawkers, kids, couples, olides and a fun fair. There really is something for everyone and everyone really does visit. It looks quite old and worn in places but there must never be a quiet time for any renovation to take place.We grabbed a coffee and sat and listened to a musician and watched the world go by. Not sure there was a lot there to make a day of it unless you combined it with a day at the beach.

Was only in LA for 36 hours to see Kobe play before he retired. Chose to visit Santa Monica over Hollywood and I couldn't have had more fun!! I was about half way down Santa Monica Pier when it started to pour with rain. I took cover in Playland Arcade and played video games for the next hour...such a great time!!

We walked around the pier at 10ish, then rented bikes and rode all along Venice and a little further. If you plan to rent bikes, rent them under the pier ( $20 for the whole day!!). Parking along the beach is only $6, but hourly up on the pier. Lots of fun shopping, goings on and people watching. We ate at Simzy's in Venice beach. Fish tacos were excellent!! And they had an ever rotating board of beers! Great find and our server was great! Kids had the stuffed apple pie donut for dessert! Mm, mm, mm! We hit the beach after and played in the waves, so fun!

Fun small amusement park... I believe there are some good coupons on line,bso check thosebout. Most rides are $8, so of u plan 9n going on more than 4, get the wrist band pass. You can have lots of fun here in 2 hours, but can also make a day of it.Enjoy!
It was very nice. You can enjoy the view of Los Angeles from the sea. There are interesting shops there and especially very nice bars and restaurants.
Cool place! Has small amusement park, the best fair like food, awesome booths with cool gifts, and the most amazing view. Must visit!!
This was a cute place but very crowded. Lots of street performers. We got something to eat and had to eat it sitting on the ground :(

Old fashioned carnival with games and amusement rides, a variety of very talented musicians and singers abound, fishing off the pier, great for people watching, down below on the beach or on the pier itself, interesting history of the pier told through pictures. neat place to visit! The pier is free, but the amusement park rides and games are not.
Great place for families or couples . Rides are fun , reminded me of the old Coney Island in Brooklyn. Beautiful beach view as well.

No expectations!We dropped by Venice beach and then found out that Santa Monica Pier may be a little more family oriented.Great place for families!We rode the Ferris wheel and roller coaster on the pier, very coolWalked the beach...Great day at Santa Monica Pier!

column2: The Pier followed by walking the 3rd street Promenade is a perfect day
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a great LA Beach experience. Lots to see, rides, attractions. Then go down to the sand, and after shop and window shop at 3rd St Promenade. Lots of fantastic stores, along with amazing street entertainment You literally can spend the day and night here, and find so many great places to eat.

I was lucky enough to see Kazaa, the Cirque de Soleil show on the beach in the tent. It was truly amazing watching these incredible athletes and performers go through their stunts and actions. Multi talented with amazing skills. Cirque shows are to be savoured like the food and the service at the adjacent restaurant the Lobster. First class service and you have to have the Caesar salad with your steaming hot lobster. I will always remember my wonderful experiences on the Pier.

Santa Monica beach is by far my favorite beach ever! I love the vibes, the people are so nice and friendly, the pier is amazing (there's so many shops, rides, games, food, etc.), and more. There's so much to do I never end up swimming in the ocean I just hang out on the pier. It is crowded, but so worth it. The view and sunsets on the pier are so amazing. Also, the pier lights up at night, which is so beautiful. Make sure to bring a camera for sights and money for games, food, and rides!

While staying in nearby Venice Beach, we walked up the well-designed sidewalks and walkways to the Pier.It was mid-afternoon on a sunny Wednesday and the area was packed with tourists and locals. The pier itself does have a few rough spots, being a real wooden deck, so you do have to watch your footing while dodging strollers and street artists.It was fun to walk along, feel the ocean breeze, and see the "sights" but I wouldn't recommend spending any money. There are better restaurants in Santa Monica and more fun to be had (for free) playing in the sand along the beach.

It was my first time going to the Pier and it was a weekday night. It was kind of cool, but also kind of underwhelming. It wasn't very crowded, and going to the end of the pier was nice with some guy playing some cool music. However, the park part of it all was kind of underwhelming and a little trashy. The roller coaster looked quite boring and there were only 2-3 people on each round. No wonder.. the prices are insane for a boring ride. If I did any of the arcade/ rides thing, it'd be the ferris wheel. If you are in the area, I'd suggest going in the early afternoon to spend time at the beach, have dinner and then watch the sunset from the pier. I wouldn't make the trek up here if you are are staying in Anaheim for Disneyland, etc. Can be cool, just not worth any hassle.
Not my thing really but lots to look at and a few places to eat.It is very popular, always loads of people there.Felt safe enough, just not my thing
Inviting atmosphere and beautiful weather. The restaurants were a little too pricey. But it is fairly crowded. The beach is open and large.
Really cool spot , the pier is full of little shops and food stalls with a fun fair at the end that's seen in so many movies so great to visit.
Good visit for teenagers. Food was OK. What you would expect from fast food places at a fair ground. Bring a jacket as it can be cold in the evening.

Living in the hostel on 2nd Street I took the walk the first evening in Santa Monica. Crowded like nothing. You have a great view and maybe get some nice pictures at dusk/dawn. Itherwise it is very touristy, overpriced and who knows the quality.I was mostly hanging on to my purse not to be picpocket...

As the end of Route 66, this place has historic, scenic, and entertainment value. We brought a group of college students to spend a couple hours enjoying the various entertainers (pigeon man, magician, singers), shops, and activities (beach, ferris wheel, etc.). They enjoyed their time and found the "people watching" to be fascinating.The only downside is the traffic. We were there on a weekday at midday. We found very reasonably priced parking right at the pier, but getting there (and out again) was a bear. The one expressway approaching it was jam packed and the surface roads were equally awful. That's LA, I guess.

The pier is itself is very nice and offers lots to do and see. There's restaurants, street vendors, street performers, rides, and more. It is very busy however and very touristy. We also had a very hard time finding parking.
Its lovely and stunning but very busy and expensive. Its really cold on a night so wrap up warm!I really recommend going on the ferris wheel.

The worst thing about LA is the traffic...getting to the Pier will take you the better part of a day. Once you arrive, parking is easy enough to find in the parking structure and there are things to see on the Pier, but it isn't a must see. The food is overpriced and it's crowded but if you are there for the ocean...it's a nice stop! The beach had great sand and you can't beat those waves.

For all the times you've probably seen this icon on TV or have driven by it, I think you might want to actually pass on coming here especially if you have small children. This area has so many homeless people asking for money, rowdy adults, and dirty trash all over. Instead, maybe a stay on the promenade will serve you better.

I loved that walk at the beach and after that to go to the pier to see all the attractions and things I had always seen in TV. It's worthy going as you cannot go to LA and just miss this. It's a must, whether you like it or not, that's none of my business, but it's an amazing place and at night is really cool with all those lights.
Went here on a trip and stayed for a while it was alright but not great.Most of the stalls were closed and the fair was half closed as well.

Had a great time on the pier. Bought the unlimited ride wristband and enjoyed the rides. If you are looking for a thrilling roller coaster this is not your place. The rides were exciting enough though and have a great view. If it's not too busy they let you ride twice. Plenty of carnival type attractions, shopping and food for every one to find something they enjoy.

Seagulls are EVERYWHERE to be seen and almost felt. They fly right above your heads. In this time of the year it is cold and windy, so maybe you should weat jeans and a sweater, which is something uncompatible to go to the beach... I went in the afternoon and I'm guessing it looks better at night with all the lights.

within easy walking distance of down town Santa Monica,.. Bristling with eateries, & bars, and souvenir shops,.....Free musical street entertainment,.....and the amusement park,. and great views of the beach,...A Place you will remember for ever
Interesting, fun things to see and do. Neat to see the end of Route 66. Great beach access just off pier. Was a fun experience.

column2: Good Mexican Food, Better Funnel Cake
column3: This is a place that you must visit if in Los Angeles. Although it may seem similar to other piers and can be crowded, the Santa Monica Pier is a destination that you'll want to say you visited.

column2: You only need to see this once
column3: Very touristy and grungy. Not enough nice shops and food places. Can take some nice pictures of the coast from the pier .. But not much to do other than that.

This place is very busy and I can only imagine how much busier it can get in the summer! One of the places to tick off the list when travelling to LA. Parking was a breeze, great views of the coastline from the pier. Definitely worth a walk down the coast once you've been here

First time visiting the peer, must say i was not at all impressed, from the access point to the end. They should have kept it clean, without shops and carnival style rides. Just go to the beach instead and stay there.That's it folks. Hope you Enjoy!

column2: Seems to be in a tv show
column3: The pier and the beach are exactly as seen in movies and tv shows, especially during weekends. The crowd walking around, young people playing all sorts of sports, the ocean, the sun...everything contributes to the wonderful atmosphere you can breath there. It seems you are dreaming...

column2: Touristy but still a must do
column3: We went with two teen daughters on a Thursday night. We parked a couple blocks inland for free and walked to the pier. Seemed very commercial. Typical street fair stuff. Nothing special as far as food or entertainment. Still worth walking through and taking a couple pictures.

column2: Not worth it for most people
column3: Fun to read all the five star reviews - there are plenty of beach piers with rides on the east and gulf coasts that are cleaner, nicer and not full of panhandlers and homeless to the extent this is. I get in Southern California this is a bit of an iconic attraction but it goes in the same book as the Holywood walk of fame or manns Chinese theater. Just drive by it and you'll be just as happy. If you're from western states where these things are a novelty than caveat emptor. Really I think the city should put some money into it and clean up the vagrants and peddlers. I'll not ever need to see it again.
Awesome! Fun pier - we parked the car and walked around the pier. There's restaurants, shops, theme parks, etc my favorite was a guy playing a guitar by the sea

Visited for the first time yesterday & me & my daughters LOVED it!! It was the highlight of our vacation. My youngest is in a wheelchair & they were extremely courteous & understanding to us. They allowed us to enter the rides via the exit, which really helped when it came to dealing with the wheelchair. Definitely planning another visit soon!!
I visited this on my way back to LAX and I regret because I needed a full day unrushed. It is an absolutely beautiful place to spend the day. Will make some time next time.

column2: Quick and easy - basic amusement park plus food and bikes
column3: Fun rides, some games, but this was an easy fun place to visit. Decent food selection close by including a Starbucks. Sit down restaurants as well that are fair to decent dining choices. You can rent bikes close by and bike around along the beach path.

column2: Absolutely just as I remember it from when I grew up in L.A.
column3: My review is a little late. We took our kids for my oldest 9th birthday. We couldn't do Disneyland or Knotts due to financial reasons. But decided to get them to experience something different. Boy did this trip bring back some wonderful memories of growing up in Los Angeles. Being that we're from San Diego. We have nothing like this. My daughter braved her fear and got on her 1st coaster. My boys did the alligator ride. But the highlight of the trip was the shark museum. I do apologize to the employs there. My kids were a bit to excited and tried to grab on to one of the sand sharks. But wow. What a wonderful day it was. Hope to make it back soon :0)
It was a great day to go.. Loved the people watching going on. Love that so much diversity. If you get a chance well worth the drive.

column2: You can't come to LA and not go to the pier.
column3: Visited the pier, it is a must see on any tourist list. Okay during the day, lovely at night with the attraction lights on. Typical tourist spot, nice views of the beach and overpriced souvenirs but very glad we visited.
Great place beach needs to be maintained though there was lots of trash wish there was more dining close by with easy parking.

column2: Fun place to get your kicks
column3: Located at the end of Route 66, the pier offers a vast array of family entertainment. A Ferris wheel with breathtaking views of the pacific, a roller coaster, the buccaneer rise, and lots of midway and arcade games. Very clean, not rowdy, and plenty of places to eat (ristorante and bubba gump). And don't forget to get funnel cake at scoops!

Took our three year old granddaughter out to the pier to ride the rides and see the sights. An all day pass is almost mandatory for anyone wishing to play on the rides; we bought a single adult ticket for Grandpa for the ride where our grandchild was not quite tall enough to ride alone. There are about six rides suitable for young children, and she rode them all, many twice and had a great time. There was not a lot of time spent waiting, and the rides were about the right length of time for short attention span children. The park attendees were friendly and helpful and all was good. When we went to get some snacks and some ice cream things were not so wonderful. Pricing is ridiculous, bordering on price gouging, and the service was unbelievably slow at the concessions we visited. Seating space was barely adequate even for the relatively uncrowded day. Plenty of parking--we parked in the short term lot for a dollar an hour which was a steal but there is an all day lot as well for those with more stamina. Overall a good score, but the quality, quantity, and value of the food concessions needs to catch up to today's standards

column2: Wonderful walk on the beach...must visit
column3: We drove here after a day in UCLA, touring the school. The traffic was long but it's all worth it. People are just enjoying the day swimming or just relaxing. Its a good place to visit, to relax and just enjoy the sound of water.
What a lovely beach! Beautiful setting with the bay. Cool old fashioned pier made of wood with carnival rides and games.

All shapes all sizes!! Beautiful place to go as soon as you land in LA! So much to do already don't know where to began!! Food is great! People are friendly! Mellow weather sunny with a cold breeze!! Perfect
Has to be done if in Santa Monica but a bit like all piers - full of tat and busy resturants. The big wheel was fairly crap - ages to load up and then just a couple of turns

column2: A lot of fun with family and friends
column3: Loved this pier. Have a lot activities to do. I liked the rides and wheel wow what a view of the city. If you go in evening the lights on the wheel are awesome.Lot places to eat, games and vendors. If you have time to visit only one beach and want to have entertainment this would be the beach of choice.Walk to the end of pier for a good view of ocean and u might get to hear some live music.We sat on the steps facing ocean quiet scenic.The beach is safe as they have police patrol.Off course beautiful beach.

Really enjoyed the pier and pier area. Nice/clean/felt safe. Visited during the day and at night. Looks beautiful at night all lite up. Very nice area on a great beach. Worth a visit. Don't forget to get a picture of yourself at the end of Route 66 sign!

The pier is iconic to Santa Monica. You must go out just to experience it.We ate at the restaurant on the end. We grabbed a quick bite to eat with fajitas and drinks.We did not ride any of the rides..but would have if we had time.It's a carnival scene packed with people..but worth seeing once.
Wanted to eat at the end of the pier but the wait was over an hour. When you haven't got that much time you can't sit around.We also saw a pelican sitting in this pier - a great find.

My grandson visits every summer & this is his favorite place to go & I do not get tired of taking him. He started going when he was 6 & & at 14 still asks to go. Beautiful setting on the ocean. Typical small amusement park rides but the atmosphere is fun & upbeat. Of course for this grandma the Ferris wheel is a must.
Very nice views and that's about it. Very tacky, much like an amusement park. Not even any good restaurants along the pier

This was a great walk to the end. Gorgeous day as always, busy, happy tourist and a nice view of each side of the beach, park and ocean. Would recommend it for sure, especially if you can think of all the films that have used this location!
Very safe and friendly (aside from the homeless at the entrance), wonderful street performers and lots of souvenir options and amazing photo ops.

The Santa Monica Pier is an icon you have to visit when in LA. We had the opportunity of taking amazing pictures, and be prepared to be surrounded by giant seagulls. There's a carnival, lots of food, great little shops and spots, and great sunset views. You will not regret this experience.

Really good place to spend a few hours, end of the famous Route 66, indoor carousel, and roller coaster with plenty of places to eat. Right on the beach that takes you to Venice beach , cycle, skateboard and surfboard hire close by.Don't forget to take a camera üòé

This is the last stop on Route 66. This is your typical pier boardwalk with restaurants, shops and vendors. They have this Japanese hot-dog vendor that sells hotdogs with seaweed and other toppings. You have to try when you get there. Also there is a churro vendor that is delicious. You have to be careful when eating though as the seagulls will take your food from you right out of your hands. They also have a mini amusement park with a Ferris wheel and other rides. This is great for families with small kids.
Santa Monica original - the ferris wheel, the games, the people, the pier food for a fun day for the whole family.
Plenty to do & see whilst walking Santa Monica beach. Worth a walk up the infamous Santa Monica pier to take in the beach & sea views as well as being at the end of Route 66!
The place looks good, and it's nice to see the ocean, but there isn't much to do in the pier (may be good to families with children because of the little amusement park on the pier).

Loved walking the pier on my recent visit. I was pushing an infant in a stroller and it was a bit bumpy. The shops and drinks from the vending machines are really overpriced. But the pier and view and weather could put anyone in a good mood.
You cannot go wrong visiting the pier!!! Lots of rides, games, food and great for kids. Beautiful view and beach too!!!

column2: a great place to visit with a great view of the ocean
column3: There is nothing like the santa monica pier. Its not even expensive like going to an amusement park but it will give the kids and you the same fun.A lot of rides , games, food and the view is outstanding. Its clean and efficient so lines move.The crowd is not rowdy safe to bring the family in. The kids would love it. I take my grandson there as often as I can and he loves it. unlimited rides ticket is the best way to go. Weekdays is the less crowd. I hope this helps.

It was a cool spring day and we needed something to do. Never been and it was worth the walk. The crisp ocean air and fun with the fam. It can be a little expensive but budget accordingly and it's a good time

column2: road construction and expensive to park
column3: Road construction and we were new to the area so we overpaid to park $20 Cheaper parking around the area so look for it. We paid $8 the next weekend in a different location. Entertainment scattered along the pier and we say a cute sea lion

Pier full of people. End of Route 66. Beach wide and nice. What else do you want when you travel? If you want a quiet place don't come here. Just on the left of the pier is the Santa Monica muscle beach. Go and enjoy people having fun.
Fun place to go with the kids. Roller coaster was fun but ended quickly. Parking lot is hard to get to if you're coming from the south. You have to do a U turn and backtrack.

Had great afternoon at the pier. Kids loved the carnival and rides. On a warm day the beach would be great. For fans of Route 66 I recommend visiting the Route 66 kiosk on the pier as they have some great information and facts about the old highway.

It was cold when we were here but it was a lot of fun. Walked up and down the pier, rode the ferris wheel, very romantic. I got an ice cream cone and it wasn't very good. I would love to come back when its warmer and go down to the beach. I could see this being a very crowded place in the summer.

column2: Nice bad sad to see so many homeless people
column3: What a nice city and the pier was excellent to see. Well worth a visit for everyone, only word of warning is to be prepared to see a lot and I mean a lot of homeless people, which was truly sad and some change goes a long way, only wish the US government would help these people more

column2: Always a Treat... beautiful sunset here.
column3: I absolutely love the Santa Monica pier. Unobstructed Pacific Ocean views are the highlight when you reach the end, with all kinds of great people watching, vendors, food (including great funnel cake), an amusement park and entertainment along the way. Also a wonderful place to watch the sunset. must see for any visit to LA. Recommend parking (off the Pacific Coast Hwy) right under the pier which was reasonably priced at less than $10.
Huge tourist trap! Lots of people in a small area. The nice part is that you can walk down over the water.

Have been here many times. There are plenty of carnival rides to go on, carousells, and food to eat on the pier. Even if you're not interested in these activities, it's still fun to go and hang around particularly on a nice day. This is located near plenty of interesting things in the area.

I had some spare time one of my days in LA and I decided to come here after I've heard about the place.Place is well kept, clean and organized to a certain extent (not many people were there). I walked around the pier enjoying the view and ended up staying at the end of it for a good 30 min enjoying the water with some great background music (street performer).I just wish there weren't so many performers in the area. To much background noise from their performances. There was one every 10 meters.
We have visited this pier a few times with our kids. Always fun, festive and clean.There are a few rides,ice cream shops, local cuisine and snacks.
Great place for the sun lovers and beach walkers. Fun activities for children and families and plenty of food to choose from. Walk the pier and begin your journey along Route 66!

column2: The Pier is full of all kinds of attractions~
column3: From the Pier you can get great photos of the pacific, (beach front), carnival rides, restaurants, gift shops, and specialty "booths all over the place" from t-shirts, hats, keepsakes, etc... I felt it was a little crowded - but very open and friendly area.

column2: The Jersey Shore of The West Coast
column3: If you love carnivals and the smell of the ocean this is the place for you. We had such a good time! This unique attraction has all the fun of an amusement park conveniently located on the beach. This is a great place to bring your kids.
You really shouldn't miss this, even though it isn't truly a 5 star. Musicians play on the pier and there is an old carousel as well as rides. You walk out to the end to see people fishing.

column2: Great for a change of pace
column3: Arrived at Santa Monica pier on the hop in hop off bus which I must add is a joke if trying to locate stops throughout route ... Anyway the Pier has lots for all ... Fun rides great dining and an awesome Route 66 stand the guy is the most knowledgable on this iconic route ... Cheers

One of my favorite moments on our trip was the bike ride, we went on, from one side of the pier to the other side. A young man with a 2 seat cart drove us to the area where the food and entertainment were, and gave us his phone number to text when we were ready to return back to our vehicle. It was a fun, and exciting to catch a view, of beach without the pain of walking miles across and walking back, since I am not big on walking too much.

We used uber ($30) from Hollywood to spend a day at Santa Monica pier and it was one of the best days during our visit. Weather was perfect and the atmosphere was great. Also a great spot for fishing. We enjoyed the rides at pacific park (had a coupon for 20% off unlimited rides which was a bonus) and walked to Santa Monica Place (shopping centre) for lunch. There were plenty of food options at the pier too. Would definitely recommended to others headed to LA.

column2: Nice views and great photo ops!
column3: The pier is a pretty standard tourist attraction, from what I could see. You can grab a burger and ice cream, buy some lame souvenirs (tacky tshirts or California state license plate magnets with your name on it), and ride some carnival rides. We didn't do any of those things though. We simply walked out to the end of the pier and back and enjoyed people-watching and the views of the waterfront. The ferris wheel does make for some great photos. I also loved seeing the Route 66 sign. I'm from Chicago and have seen the starting point of Route 66 and now the ending point at Santa Monica Pier. If only I could find the time to drive the whole way! :)
Rented some bikes at Santa Monica beach and rode them down to the pier.The view from the pier is beautiful, we grabbed a piece of pizza and tried the stands at the carnival.great walk along the pier.
OK, you go there because it's famous, but that's about it. Maintenance is not that great and I would name it 'past glory'. Better spots in my opinion are Hermosa beach and Redondo beach.
Just a super market disney world like on the pier... Even police is part of the show! Fast food only, except the Lobster rest at the entrance..
I loved it and I'd love to go back. I haven't been yet there in summer but I heard that it's spectacular evening and night time. It has a lot of night life

My family stayed at The Viceroy hotel just a few blocks away. We strolled the promenade nightly for restaurants and shopping but always ended up at the Pier. The sunsets are amazing to watch whether you are atop the Farris Wheel or dining at the Lobster restaurant! There are endless activities including an indoor arcade and amusement park rides. This place is great for a first date or a family night out!

column2: can find nice magnets and a decent place to eat
column3: you're better of going along ocean drive or santa monica strip to find a nice place to eat, the pier is just like your typical fun fair with popcorn stands and hot dog sellers - overall it was very crowded in march so i can't imagine it in winter but it's a lovely idea as it gives you something to do once done at the beach. AKA people painting your picture, nice souvenirs and a quick place to eat if you're into fast food or the whole day at the beach/fair experience.
We had a great time! Different things to do. Everybody was happy some stuff were little expensive, but overall the experience was excellent

I cruised down to the Santa Monica Pier early one morning before everything was open. I noticed a restaurant at the end of the pier, a Mexican joint, it looked like a place to eat while waiting on my husband to finish business meeting that evening. I had high Hopes of a fun pleasant time while he was busy. The walk to the pier was pleasant. The actual pier and surrounding at the evening time was vary carnival like. I didn't feel comfortable solo and the Mexican place I thought would be great was ran poorly. Such a waste at that location. I sat at the bar for 5 min and no one acknowledge me. I was thankful after the observations while I waited. I was not in my element. I like clean bars/restaurants that are ran in a higher standard. I left and walked across the bridge to Del Frisco's. Like I mentioned it was a pretty walk to the pier with the Farris wheel lit and the roller coaster ect. Just getting there came the realization of a low class carnival.

I have never been to the Santa Monica Pier before, so we went to check it out and check it off the bucket list.I was a nice walk to the end and back, but there's not a whole lot to do there. There are some food concessions and a Bubba Gump restaurant, and a number of amusement games and rides. There were a number of buskers performing - the violinist was really good, while the old man was singing his own songs. As you get closer to the end of the pier, you'll see a number of people fishing.The S.M. Pier might be better for families with younger kids to enjoy the amusement area. Otherwise, you can walk along the beach.We were done in less than an hour.
The pier was packed, 5pm on a Saturday. Parking was $15. The pier views were gorgeous! We played some skiable, a few arcade games and had a great time!!

My three year old had a blast playing , and runed around the beach all afternoon, it really has a breath taking view at the top of the deck , I wish we woud of gone at night it probally looks beautyful

column2: Nice Pier with a lot of history.
column3: Well worth a visit if you are in the area, it has lot going on, and you can access the beach and the cycle path from it.
An experience that transforms in the movie of his life. The time on the Santa Monica pier is infinitely eternal; is the magic that dictates the notes to the soul eager to sing.
There is nothing interesting, just a pier with some regular restaurants, a simple amusement park and small shops, that's it.

Great exercise nth walking and biking to the Santa Monica pier. Food Vendors only take cash. Nice trapeze set up with catch option available - fun! Pipes still there, great steps at the end of the pier to sit and watch the waves or throw your fishing line off the end of the pier. Fun for families, reunions, cousins, dates

A must see place for tourists when visiting Santa Monica! I loved my visit to Santa Monica pier. It was great to walk along the pier and take in a very different view to what I'm used to. The rides were a bit more terrifying than I thought they would be, but then I'm not used to rides! The pier also has an interesting history that I was previously unaware of, going back to 1909. There are also lots of places to buy all the usual touristy things, arcades and plenty of places to eat. Not to mention the beach is right there! It was a nice experience for a couple who just met.
Stopped by on way home when most shops were closing but was worth to see even in the dark, especially since someone was feeding a sea lion and we dont often see one

A visit to see the end of Route 66 is a must for any visitor to LA, a walk up the pier and along the beach to Venice is a nice way to pass a few hours. Lots to do on the pier as well a fair, arcades, shops, takeaways and restaurants.

column2: Fun times for a lone traveller
column3: Came here nearly everyday during the week I stayed. Always something new to see or do. Buskers, market stalls, food and drink, the beach. What more could a girl want?Travelled from Melbourne Australia and it felt a bit like home.
A highlight of my LA trip and well worth a visit. Play a tacky arcade game, grab a Coke and watch the sunset. There is something for everyone and well worth a visit- especially at sunset
It's tacky, touristy, full of tat and terrible food. Worth a walk to the end to spot the surf.Theme park looks alright. Definitely a place to get your fridge magnets and Route 66 garbage.

The pier is fantastic but the crowds are huge and aggressive. Parking is a crazy nightmare. Once you've parked the activity is great. Lots of fun for families but you MUST keep little ones close. It's just that busy. We were lucky to see an amazing sunset. I'd suggest you go but be ready for a crazy crowd.

column2: Very touristy but worth a visit
column3: Santa Monica Pier is another one of those obligatory sites you have to check out while you're in LA. It's a great scene with beautiful views, but incredibly touristy. Everything is kind of expensive and samey, but I'd recommend a short visit if you're a tourist in the area.

How can you visit Santa Monica and NOT go for a walk on the pier. Sure, it's crowded and busy, but it offers one of the best views of the bay, beach and mountains. Definitely worth it to walk all the way out to the very end for some spectacular views! I think the best time of day is around sunset, but there really isn't a bad time to go.We did not eat, drink or buy anything, but there are plenty of places to spend your money if that's what you're into. We mostly enjoyed it for the people watching and the great photo opps!

column2: Good place to enjoy the water!
column3: Having heard and seen this site in so many television shows and movies we had to go see it for ourselves. It is a great place to either stroll the pier or if you want to go in the ocean the public beach is right next to it. Great views of Malibu and Venice Beach on both sides of the pier.
Make time - to visit Santa Monica! (my favorite place)Watched the sunset on my first night on the Santa Monica Pier.Took a bus from West Hollywood (about 45 mins.)

column2: Pleasure away from the city life
column3: I'm the kinda girl that always love the beach and this beach stole my heart. It's family fun through and through and makes it an relaxing element for the kids and magic for the parents. Amazing beach all in all. I'll be back!

Hands down this was a special treat for the day during our tour of Hollywood will definitely visit again. Traffic wasn't too bad coming into the area in the boardwalk it was a lot of shops to buy nice souvenirs and keep sake items for memories there were people painting and drawing and just all kinds of stuff. The ice creamand funnel cakes are amazing definitely a place you should visit once in your life!!!

Lovely Pier, and loved watching the friendly seal at the end of the pier who clearly is used to the public ! Very busy I assume because of television publicity, but definitely worth a visit. Beautiful to watch the sunset here.

Check off my list: Ride the ferris wheel at the Santa Monica Pier overlooking the Pacific as the sun sets. Other than the awkward walk thru the smelly homeless park to get to the pier, this was an experience I will never forget. The rides, the food, the people, the views...all come together perfectly at sunset. There is city parking only a few blocks from the pier and better than average bathroom facilities. We also caught a tour leaving from the pier and saw dolphins in the water.

Yeah it's a bit tacky and yeah it's very touristy, but I really loved Santa Monica pier, unfortunately we just missed the last ride on the big wheel (which closed strangely early for summer at 5pm) but we had great fun in the arcade and watching the buskers at the end of the pier. The whole place just had a really nice chilled out atmosphere that reminded me of UK seaside holidays as a kid.
Nothing is open on the pier in the mornings, but a fun place to enjoy the morning, watching the fishermen and the waves. Fun little history section at the end of the pier
Great spot to check out when in SaMo. Nice views and a few good places to eat and drink. Obviously a big spot for tourists on the weekend, but beach access and great spot to take some pictures.

We kind of always expect more from these kind of experiences and places. This one is more about history than anything special today. Nothing is about quality yet somehow you want to see it and be part of it for a short time.Yes it is cheesy, run down and has a bit of a strange feeling to it yet at the end it ends up meaning something to you.It is really part of the California history.
Who doesn't love Santa Monica Pier. Do yourself a favor and go in February when you can park right on the pier.
Feels like you have been here before since you've seen this place in so many films.Tacky stalls selling touristy stuff.

column2: A walk along the pier - had to be done!
column3: Everybody says ou have to visit the Pier. I suppose it's a little bit of fun walking around the attractions and passing Bubba Gump! Views are wonderful at the end of the Pier and there are plenty of places to eat, whether you choose healthy or junk!

Great view of the ocean with carnival type atmosphere. A couple of restaurants on the pier premise and plenty of food stands for funnel cakes, churros and ice cream. We went Saturday evening around 6:30 pm and it was very crowded. Pier parking was full but if you look carefully there is convenient inexpensive parking on 2nd and Broadway. Traffic is terrible but manageable. Several rides but long lines. I would not recommend for very small children - too congested.
The SM Pier is a small kiddie oriented boardwalk. Fun to stroll and people watch, families with young children and teen couples flirting. Good for a few hours and some carnival food.
Take a fun walk down the pier and check out some awesome rides, art work and do some fishing! Also, if the weather is good, take a dip in the Pacific Ocean!

column2: Brought out the kid in me!
column3: The pier was awesome! Great food, great views, fun rides, great for people watching, and a beautiful beach. Best of all it didn't cost an arm and a leg to park!

column2: The pier itself is not much
column3: However, this park is like all other coastal park, you can picnic around there, go for a swim, rent a bicycle etc probably just not during winter
I guess this is one of the things "you do" when visiting Santa Monica. It was interesting having a look at the shops, we ate at Bubba Gump shrimp which was nice.

Really enjoyed some time at the pier. Grabbed some food, visited the gift shops, caught a bus tour, saw dolphins and a sea lion. I was surprised by the rough boards of the pier lol. A little touristy but enough to see and do for all ages. Great facilities too.
there's a great view, lots of activity, good restaurants and history! very interesting the pier history!!

What's there not to like? Santa Monica Pier has to be one of the highlights of my PCH trips because it's what I have expected from SoCal: Beautiful, relaxing, and festive! Lined with so many shops and restaurants of various kinds and price ranges plus a mini amusement park, you can be here for any reason to eat, shop, or simply stroll. Santa Monica is already a beautiful city, but I think this pier alone is definitely what made me love Santa Monica as one of my favorite cities in the world!Whether you are on a PCH trip or a LA getaway, you cannot miss this famous pier!

Best apartments in Pelican Stay!!!Every workers are very polite and work-hard. In all times Nicole and Brian were helping me to find the best apartments and with a good prices. All customers are very friendly!!! All apartments are very clean!!!I will continue to rent apartments from Pelican Stay;)And to everyone my suggestion is to stay with Pelican Stay!!! They will find the best choices to everyone!!!:)

Went one evening. Lovely place to visit. The big wheel has mesmerising lights on and the whole ambience of the boardwalk is lovely. There's touristy things to buy but also you can just walk along the pier and enjoy sights and sounds

We had so much fun on the boulevard! We road the ferris wheel and my daughter road the rollar coaster. We took pictures and walked around. It was fun to people watch. There are games and rides for everyone, including little kids. The beach is right there so you can walk or sit on the beach. There are plenty of places to get food and there is an aquarium. It is worth the trip! Parking was not a problem for us, although we did go on a cloudy day. It looks like there is plenty of parking. You need to pay a small amount to park.

column2: Don‚Äôt Miss to Take a photo of the End of the Route Sign.
column3: The 106-year-old Santa Monica Pier with the Pacific Park, a family amusement park with Ferris wheel, is reasonably popular with visitors. You can also find all kind of seafood restaurants, caf√©s, shops along the pier and Ocean Avenue. Beaches populated with surfers and sun-tanning lovers come here to spend a day and neighborhood. Santa Monica Pier is the location of the end of legendary Route 66. Don‚Äôt forget to take a photo of the End of the Route sign. Route 66, which ends its 4,023 km (2,500 mi) journey a few blocks away at Olympic and Lincoln Boulevards.

This is a great pier for walking, having some fun, eating, and people watching. They even have the fortune teller machine like in the movie "Big". We ate at the Bubba Gumps on the pier and the view was perfect!
