We visited here as part of our SoCal stops. It was chilly to start the day but cleared up. The pier us very busy and a typical "tourist trap." It's famous, so we went. It has a lot of little souvenir shops, arcade, etc...the boardwalk along the beach was nice. Unfortunately, we were there during a marathon and leaving was a nightmare driving!

Just like in the movies! Ferris Wheel, beach, boardwalk. Can easily spend a day here, take your time and walk for miles down the boardwalk to take it all in. Lots of fun snack type foods, go ahead and indulge!

Super friendly staff at this store! The pier is pretty boring after 8pm as everything is closed but the arcade is fun it's just pretty expensive about $1 a game. The churros are good but it's cold at night I highly recommend going during the day there's also very cheap parking $2 an hour by the pier and there's a heavy police presence so it's very safe

I had time to kill after a cancelled flight so jumped on the flyaway bus from LAX to Santa Monica. The bus stops right outside a shopping centre with lots of known name shops including Tiffany. I walked from the mall to the pier along the beach and its stunning. It is a little sad also due to the large amount of homeless people around the area. The pier itself is great with amusement rides etc.The beach is spotless and I highly recommended if you are in the area.

Great place for souvenirs and even has a cute little theme park. The best time to go would be around 5pm to catch the sunset as it's simply stunning. The typical Cali scenes with the seagulls and orange sunset.

column2: Not a place to go king crab not open properly
column3: Bad review all the way. Not much in deserts. Hair in the bread even though reply was that they got them from outside but v r having it at their Resturant so I don't care where they r coming from.

column2: Such a beautiful place !!! Don't miss a tour or visit
column3: I really didn't know what to expect as I have always seen it on television but thought it was too good to be true but oh my gosh it was so amazing. Unfortunately we were on a tour so we only got an hour we did the Ferris wheel which goes around so many time they were very generous and the views were spectacular. We didn't get to go to the end of the pier as weWe're short on time but the run up the bridge for the pics and back down for the sights of the beach on each side was breath taking. Honestly don't miss this if you can go make sure Santa Monica is a definite a stop over.

Took my teenage niece here for her first view of the Pacific. Gorgeous day. Fun people and relaxing time in beach.Despite the crowds there is real peace here.Also took a walk to Third Street Promenade for food and shopping. Nice day.

The pier was like many piers I've seen...with the exception of an amusement park! Aside from the rides, lots of shops, street vendors, solo music acts with an open guitar cases and tourist trap restaurants. Can't deny the beautiful view of the ocean, beach and seaside...pretty incredible. I'd recommend anyone going here to watch the sunset. Glad to have said I've been here.

column2: Loved being at the end of route 66
column3: The pier has something for everyone, it is really family friendly and I was shocked at the public toilets...immaculate, so clean, tidy and smelt nice too. There is a really nice bar called Rusty's however don't go to the roof top bar place (I can't remember the name but we went there and it was awful so we didn't stay.
Breath taking! I'm ready to go back even though i've done it twice!Great souvenir and coffee shops along the pier! Stunning views of Pacific Ocean, beach and mountains.
What an iconic location. The pier, the lighted ferris wheel and roller coaster. Packed with so many people, but beware of homeless in area. We didn't have any problems,but you have to be careful.

My husband and I devoted an entire day to Santa Monica and the Pier. We arrived early, before many of the other tourists had arrived. The Pier is probably the best at this time of the day. Not to hot, not too busy.There is a lot to see and do. Shopping, food, sand and surf. The crowd can be a little overwhelming at times, but that seems to be LA in general. There was also a creepy looking Minnie Mouse mascot hanging around which freaked me out.Would recommend.
The pier was nice but very busy. I also felt like it was dirty around the pier I liked mission beach pier in San Diego better.

Expect the regular beggars, barkers, and buskers. Nothing to aggressive but still somewhat off-putting if you're not used to it.Parking is $6 at the pier for all day but no in and out privileges. This is a good deal if you want a quick in and out. Across the street it is as much as $15 but can get cheaper further inland. The pier is rough for small wheeled strollers but doable. You can walk all the way out to the end for free.

column2: A must visit, just because it's there!
column3: Visited my son who lives in Irvine so we made the trip to Santa Monica Pier. I'm glad we did. Such a lovely old pier with a carnival atmosphere of old. The smell of the ocean, the kids running around having fun, the seagulls and oh, the seals up close and personal! We sat on the pier and watched the cutest seals just hanging out and being friendly while the fishermen caught them lunch. It was lovely! Watched the sun setting over the water, grabbed an ice cream and just relaxed .A must go to when in Southern Cali.

Great time on the pier with two early teens. They loved the rides and snacks and all the action. Wish there was better options for renting chairs and umbrellas for the beach once you are tired of the pier attractions

We walked the pier and stopped in at the bar for drinks. I asked the bartender to make me a Bloody Mary but not to make it so spicy. It was perfect. We had chips and salsa with our drinks. Not very expensive for a touristy place. Next time will stay to eat. Looks like a nice Mexican restaurant serving freshly made guacamole table side.

You can't visit Santa Monica without a visit to the pier. There is parking right on the pier (a little pricey) and lots to see and do. Old fashioned arcades, street performers and great carnival like food.
Definitely something to check out if you are in Santa Monica. Although prices can be above average on the boardwalk, it is a nice place to visit.
Nice view of beach and surrounding area. Older wooden structure but seems sold. Looks like fun rides and arcade for the kids. Feels a little scary later at night without activities or lights

We rented a car for the day and drove down from L.A. It was a nice day so we parked the car in the large lot and walked up and down the pier. We stopped and grabbed some lunch and people watched. Quick little walk after lunch and we were off. There were many pier performers set up playing lots of music and vendors selling nick nacks up and down, as well as lots of people tanning,playing volleyball on the beach,and fishing from the pier. Nice little get away from the hustle of LA.

column2: Great walk but avoid during weekends
column3: The Pier is a very entertaining place and hence can get very crowded during the weekends.We enjoyed our walk on the pier thanks to the different entertainers (singers/musicians), little shops, great view of the beach/ocean, restaurants.For a first time in Santa Monica, I'll definitely recommend it!

Santa Monica Pier combines amusement rides, food stands and restaurants, souvenir shops, street musicians, fishing areas, and the terminus of historic Route 66. The attraction we liked best was the classic merry go round beautifully restored in its historic building complete with an old fashioned soda fountain. You can ride for the antique price of only $2. We also rode the Pacific Wheel, more of a viewing platform than a true Ferris wheel as it turns so slowly ($8). People-, bird-, and wave-watching add to the fun.

I love Santa Monica and it's Pier! It's such a great place! Lots of people from all over the world, and so cozy! Love the beach around it! And the Pier has a few nice shops! Nice food! It's awesome! If you're in LA, you don't wanna miss Santa Monica and the Santa Monica Pier!
yes its honky-tonk and a little touristy, but its a great vantage point to see the santa monica beach and the pacific ocean....kids will love it

Had a great time. Ate at bubba gumps - very nice. The beach is beautiful. Also Had lunch at season55. Absolutely great. Service by Bobby was awesome and the food was fabulous. Definitely a must see place
The rides kept my kid well amused. They are well laid out taking up every possible inch of usable space and still permitting easy access.

It's Sunday afternoon and we decided to go for a walk at the Pier. The little amusement park is really great. I enjoy the peaceful sound of the waves. It's nice to walk barefoot on the sand watching the sunset. A little downside is it's too crowded and it's hard to look for a parking.

column2: literally watch the sun set. Beware of "public parking" by Sears, cheaper spots closer in.
column3: The sun sets very quickly, and you can actually see it go down!. Definitely a highlight of our trip. Beware of the shady parking in the Sears parking lot, it's $15 dollars, while the esplande is a dollar an hour and is just down the block.

column2: Way way to busy on weekend
column3: Visited Santa Monica pier on the weekend . That was a huge mistake if you don't like massive crowds , bumper to bumper traffic etc. Had to pay $20 to park at the Sears three blocks away , took me over 30mins to get to the pier once off hiway and it's only 10 blocks away , it is just chaotic. Not sure what it's like on weekdays that may have been a better option for me. Definitely would never go back on a weekend.
The pier in Santa Monica has lots of attractions for children of all ages. Rides, gift stores and restaurants combined with a great view of the beach and surfers.

column2: Loved the pier, loved the amusement park
column3: Many dining options, some shopping, and an amusement park with the only solar-run Ferris Wheel. Stunning views of the beach and ocean from the pier and a little bit of a sense of stepping back in time on the wide-planked boardwalk. A must-see if you're in the area.

The Santa Monica pier is an icon of the LA area. That is not to suggest I would put it first in my list of things to see and do, but it would make the top 10ish list. There are places to eat, some better than others and some not worth your time at all so be sure to check out reviews before ordering a meal. It is a relaxing way to spend a few hours enjoying the coast and people watching.
Such a great place to visit. So much going on. Definitely worth a stroll down the pier and the coastal views are spectacular.

column2: Best for families - not so much for solo travellers
column3: Santa Monica Pier has a festive atmosphere and some very good food but would be most enjoyable with family or friends instead of solo. Plenty of activities on the beach and be sure to rent a bike from the Pier to ride to Venice

When we come here we stay just across the road at the Windham and love coming across here in the late arvo to have a stroll past the shops and stalls. Been here about 4 times and still havent been on the rides lol... maybe next time

Walking toward the pier - you see the iconic Ferris wheel! The beach is absolutely beautiful. The view from the pier is breathtaking. There are several tourists shops and of course the arcade. My kids enjoyed the rides and ice cream. Definitely a place worth seeing! Bring a hat and sunscreen- it gets very hot!
Great place to visit, beaches were amazing and we enjoyed visiting the Bubba Gump shop on the pier. Very clean and tidy, and you can pick up some great souvenirs from Santa Monica.

This is an iconic piece of history built around 1910. It's free and houses a fun fair and loads of eateries and ice cream parlours etc etc. You can even park your car here and they have their own Police Station! This is the final stop of the famous Route 66! They are currently doing some engineering work there but you must visit and be able to tell your friends your were there! Remember to take photos
Beautiful area, lots of shops. Good choices of food and stores. Great for family and kids. Nice walk along the beach and fresh.
The only drawback-crowded. Everything else: shops, shows, restaurants - as I expected. Enjoy the view!

Very fun place, great for the whole family. Lots of interesting people including musicians, buskers and food stands for a quick churro. Pretty iconic place, was a must on my stop in the LA area. Not dissapointed.
Fun place to spend the day. Ride are good and some are historic. Plenty of food choices. Go fishing right off the pier. Cool boardwalk...parking on site but not free

column2: Stuff to see and a nice walk
column3: As piers go, the Santa Monica pier is probably rather ordinary. Theres an amusement park section, a few restaurants, a variety of carts pushing souvenirs and stuff and perhaps the best thing of them all, a spectacular view of the bay. If your expectations are low, you will be pleasantly surprised.

This was our second time visiting Santa Monica. It's one of my favorite areas in California. The Santa Monica Pier has a fun carnival feel. There are various rides including a feriswheel and coaster. Various musicians perform on the boardwalk and artists create caricatures and other works of art. The end of the pier has a restaurant and many fishermen (although the health dept discourages anyone from eating fish caught in that water). The Santa Monica Pier is lauded as being the end of Route 66. There's great people watching on the pier. We were there the day of the LA Marathon (which ended at the beginning of the pier), so it was an interesting mix of tired runners, families, and foreign tourists.The bike path (south to Venice Beach and north to Pacific Palasades) runs underneath the pier and there is a large parking lot on the north side.

My friends and I spent the afternoon at Santa Monica Pier after a super stressful week working in LA, and we had such an amazing time! It lived up to all our expectations from movies and tv shows. It was a sunny day, the water was this gorgeous shade of blue, we could see surfers on all sides of us, and even spotted two seals at the end of the pier! We only rode the carrousel, but it gave us such a perfect view of the pier and memories we will never forget. It was so cool walking up and down the pier and people-watching. There were tons of places to eat, and get crappy coffee, and lots of cute little gift shops. We also used the photo booth and surprisingly got such a nice set of photos, I highly recommend!Santa Monica is definitely worth the trip!!!!
Scenic place to spent a while. Great views in a typical well known place.Kind of bohemian atmosphere .

The weather was a bit cold while the sky wass so blue and the sun was really smiling at us and trying to touch our skin.The birds were all over the blue sky. What a sight to see.People were seating at the beach and feeling the cold water.Great relaxing day we had at the Pier.

column2: nice view of sea from pier point and drive on the way to santa monica is beauctiful!!!
column3: nice pier point to spend evening and ot of activities to near by. We drive there on thanks giving so it was closed

Returning to Santa Monica after several years, we made sure to revisit the Pier. It is everything a good Pier should be, over the sea, noisy, colourful and full of happy people. Food outlets in variety, musicians, fun fairs and well supplied with seating. We spent hours enjoying the ambience and the general feeling of goodwill created by visitors making the most of the day. Go if you have never been, and go back again if you have.

Without a doubt this is the best pier on the west coast complete with amusement park, trapese academy, indoor carousel, various lower level fishing piers, restaurants, shopping, and views of the beaches. Parking is available for the day or by the hour. You can also walk to it from Santa Monica if you decide to visit the sights there, e.g. Third Street Promenade.

column2: A must visit for first timers
column3: There's so much to do at the pier. You can just people watch or enjoy the food and activities. Pacific Park is fun for the kids.

column2: Touristy, but a must see while there.
column3: Fun visit, nothing terribly unique about it but definitely worth seeing. Can get crowded and the walkway over the bridge is narrow, but again, a fun way to spend an hour or two.

I went to the pier that was of course full of people.. However, I didn't feel crowded or overwhelmed. We walked up and down the pier people watching, looking at the waves and taking in the ocean breeze.. I had an amazing guacamole and onion hot dog from this stand. (please forgive me I don't remember the name.. I'm sure they are there everyday). But beware of the seagulls!!! One swooped right down stole my friends hot dog right out her hand.. lol.. Please visit and there are also some great shops in that area too..

column2: Nice Old Pier but needs some TLC
column3: Only a few shops. Interesting acrobat school to watch and the fishermen at the end of the pier are nice. A few rides and restaurants. But everything looks a little too run down. Beautiful ocean to watch though!

Santa Monica pier is such a great experience. From the carousel to the restaurants overlooking the water...there is something for everyone and you won't want to leave. The ferris wheel lights up at night and it is just mesmerizing.

The pier is easily accessible, could be a nice walk while outside, but once you did doubt if you comeAgain unless you come with kids... Cause you surely gonna see a lotOf them.Nice colourful pier at night, quite chill during December (which is good reason to hug your better half)
Was a nice place to walk along. It's a beautiful place to see the ocean. Though it was very overpriced. We were after a coffee and was almost double the price, so we ended up going elsewhere.

We had a great time on the pier and determined we will stay in the area when we return. There is a lot to do for kids, but as an adult couple we had fun too. We enjoyed the musicians at the end of the pier while watching the sun set.

There is literally nothing about this pier that makes it stand out in any way. There is nothing charming, no decent places to eat, the fair-ground is rubbish and it's packed. The only redeeming feature was that the parking was not as expensive as I expected (I think it was $6).There are tons of tourists milling about taking pictures (of what?) and anything there was too expensive.I can't believe all of the glowing reviews for this entirely below average place.
We were amazed at the number of cars parked on the beach and wondered where everyone had gone. We found out. The pier!Having just eaten it was a relaxing end to the day. Interesting and entertaining.
Great place to walk, people watch and enjoy the ocean. A must see when you visit the city. There is parking on the pier but it can get really busy. Walk along the beach after visiting the pier.

I loved the Santa Monica Pier. It was one of the best things about my visit to Los Angeles. There is so much to see and do on the pier. There are performers and music and there's a little amusement park, akin to Coney Island, but on a smaller scale. Great fun. Definitely give it a visit, get some sun, sea and fun all in one spot!

We were there over a Saturday, right after New years ... so many people it felt as we were just being pushed along in a mass. A must-see place but not somewhere we will go again during peak holiday time. My mom (she is 5'2") felt intimidated with so much activity around her - didn't find it relaxing or enjoyable. Bad on us for going at the wrong time. Good for people watching though!

column2: Too crowded. Too expensive. And nothing special.
column3: Have you ever been to a county fair or crappy amusement park? Then you've been to the Santa Monica Pier. Do you love waiting in line for 20 mins to go on a Ferris Wheel? Then this is the place for you. If you're idea of a good meal is Bubba Gump Shrimp Company, then hooray for the pier.The beach is beautiful. But I'll be skipping the pier next time.
Took a pier walk on a picture perfect day. Cool and breezy. Lots of fun activities. Be sure to Ride the historic merry go round! Or just sit and enjoy the people watching.

Santa Monia pier is a place you must visit. Although don't go thinking its alive with action in Jan as its winter so its slow and most was shut down. I have been in summer and the place was alive and vibrant and was electric with rides food atmosphere.You must go if you are in the area if you don't you will miss something unique and wonderful. It really has a life of its own and having been there when its going great to quiet its seemed sad in a way as you knew what it can be is like and i so wanted to show others my experiences and it wasn't the same.But go see it the colours sound and music are brilliant.
Came here last night. Walked the pier and played some games. Not a lot to do on the,pier unless you want to take a nice stroll. There are a few rides and carnival,games as well as some restaurants.

I was so glad to be able to ride the antique merry-go-round. The last time I was on this pier was 40 years ago & it was closed but I could see the stilled pretty painted horses beckoning to me inside the long time locked up building. I remember feeling sad at the time...But not this time!!! I rode six times on the pretty antique merry-go-round and got off 'swimmy headed'... lol..then for a nice walk to the end of the pier . I'm glad the Santa Monica Pier was brought back to life...it made me happy...

The famous pier needs some work. Its basicly a bunch of souvenir shops, artists and jesus enthousiasts all trying to get your attention. The ferris wheel is fun and the view at the end of the peer is nice, but skip the rest and have your food elsewhere.
I was expecting more from this pier. I was disappointed. It was run down and somewhat boring. The view from the pier was awesome, however.

column2: Awesome place to spend a few hours
column3: Great place to walk and check out vendors, shops and restaurants. Terrific views of the ocean and beach with great sunsets. Amusement rides are fun for the kids but a little expensive for the size.

Nice beach area that's really photogenic. It's a bit touristy but still fun. There's a merry go around for the kids. A Ferris wheel and other rides for kids or young at heart. A few stores selling souvenirs and such. We brought a hot dog from Japadog and a coffee to warm us up at the coffee and tea leaf. Love how this place lights up at night. Can be quite romantic to stroll here.

No trip to Santa Monica is complete without visiting the Pier. Its not to everyone's taste but its worth a look. Either ride the iconic roller coaster, play in the arcades or walk to the end of the Pier and watch people fishing or watch the sun set or rise. It just gives off a great vibe especially on a summers night!

column2: An enjoyable evening doing not much of anything
column3: The Santa Monica Pier and nearby third street promenade create an enjoyable evening of simply wandering. I can't see there is much point to it - we aren't big 'carny' folks and so the rides and games are lost on us. But the beautiful weather and people watching turns it into a nice walk. The end of the pier gives you some great views of the shore and there always seem to be street performers on the pier and the promenade. And there are lots of restaurants on third street to satisfy.

column2: Classic tourist area‚Ä¶ worth the visit
column3: Fun place to experience. A west coast Coney Island.Beach access from the pier. Easily accessible washrooms.

The pier, Santa Monica, and the whole experience was just wonderful! We loved every second of it ! Very relaxed but fun and lots and lots to do! We cycled along from Venice beach and it was my favourite day of our entire trip! Highly highly recommend !

The Santa Monica Pier has a wonderful history and it is still a wonderful place for families and children of all ages from all parts of the world.We stayed just a short hike up the hill so we were able to stroll around the beach watching the sun come up and the pier watching the sun set. We saw lots of great birds and made friends with a seal one evening when we watched the sun set at the lower fishing dock.There are rides, shops, restaurants and street (pier) entertainers. There are cool buildings and a great pier with lovely lamps.The gorgeous weather helped us enjoy the beach and the pier. We will be back.
Visited the Pier while staying in Santa MonicaVery good Place to Visit.Reminded me Of Brighton and Hove in the Uk.Good for A day Visit.
It's a beautiful location. Lots to see and do everywhere. Locals are the best. Bring your sunglasses and sunblock lots of glorious sunshine. The sea is very cold so wading is better thank swimming.
if you travel with family and young children this place is suitable. personally not interested in this kind of amusement.

This is the end point of route 66. It's awesome at night with bubba gump's shrimp, a tiny, overpriced, crowded amusement park, and great views. Tons of people and great street performers and people watching!

This pier is what could once be found on English seaside resorts and still does on some. It has all that you would expect from stalls to bars and a fair ground, recommended for a pleasant afternoon of fun.

column2: People watching, or the sea view
column3: Loads to see and a must when visiting Santa Monica. Whether it is people watching (and you will see all walks of life) or just taking time out admiring nature, your time on the pier will be one to remember.The pier in the sunshine has a different vibe to the one at night, let you decide which you prefer.

A walk along the spare is a must for anybody visiting Santa MonicaIt is really naff with all sorts of rubbish she stands in shops located upon it but this all adds to its uniquenessIt's a very lively place and well worth a walk to the very end where you will find the fishermen in abundance
I guess I had bigger expectations. I was very disappointed and nervous on the pier. Not what I thought it would be. I will never go back.
take a look from afar but don't dwell long - tourist trap and pretty much full of nutters. Sounds fun but is pretty gross.

column2: you are not going to miss the pier ,are you?
column3: This has everything a pier should have .Restaurants,coffee shops amusements and fairground rides.And fishing [although they say you shouldn't].Wonderful views of the beach in both directions -looking north up to Malibu and south you can see planes taking off and landing at LAX.Just sit with a coffee and watch the surf crashing on the beachand when you tire of this it's just a few minutes to the delights of Third street Promenade
friendly place for all could be family ,with all age group , for couples, for kids and even for you alone you can meditate , just relax , spend some time do nothing.

Honestly, I expected a little more going on, on the pier. However, it's a wonderful stroll with a fantastic view. If also great if you're a Forest Gump fan as it's the pier he jumped from after his run!
The buskers and general goings on make this a must do on the list. Wandering with an ice cream watching the waves roll in is what it is all about...maybe a ride or two.
Not a great attraction for adults. Lots of teenagers hanging out. Reminded me of cheesy Jersey Shore attractions. Ferris Wheel looks good from a distance but that's it for me.
Best to go right before sunset for beautiful pictures. Nice place for a walk n light food. Bit cold at night even at summer

This is one of the famous spots for making films.Originally called POP Pacific Ocean Park.Great to just hang out.GReat for family and a date..Strolling around the smell of the salt air the sounds of the ocean plenty of things to keep you looking.This is an L.A. must experience. .
It is a fun place for people watching and entertainment. There is a fun zone for the kids. It is crowded during the weekends, so try to find a public parking before getting to the pier.

I had seen the Santa Monica Pier many times in movies and tv shows, so it was cool to see it in person. We went back many times while on vacation because we couldn't get enough of it. Beautiful scenery and cute carnival atmosphere!

Heading to Santa Monica Pier was Up there on my bucket list, mainly because of the Route 66 sign! But the Pier is gorgeous, lively, and the folks are super friendly. We checked out every stall, and shop as we wandered down the pier - also took the obligatory selfie at the end!! Spend some time here - you wont regret it!

column2: A place to chill and watch the sunset!
column3: We spent a few hours walking along the beach and pier enjoying an ice cream & watching the buskers!I don't know of to many other piers that have a roller coaster and ferris wheel built on them?, our kids enjoyed these two rides.I also learnt that Santa Monica pier is the end of the famous Route 66 drive.We managed to catch a beautiful sunset as we left this iconic area.So many things to see and do in LA make sure this is on your list!

column2: A Little Amusement Park on the Pier in the Ocean
column3: We had never been to Santa Monica before and so we were delighted that our hotel was within walking distance of the pier. There is an entrance to the beach to the right of the pier with a place to wash sand off your feet for when you are leaving the beach. There is a Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier which is good for lunch as the view of the ocean is better during the day. They have a small roller coaster and Ferris wheel with some other rides and games. There are stores, restaurants, street vendors and street musicians everywhere on the pier. It is a long pier and a good walk.

column2: What you expect - geared toward kids
column3: The pier is fairly crowded but in the morning it is quieter and a lovely walk. It has the end of Route 66, which is cool, and has the usual carnival style food and a Ferris wheel, but almost everything is geared toward kids under 13. Definitely for families rather than friends. Oh and don't go on the Ferris wheel at sunset - the sun sets into the Ferris wheel so you are basically blind.

column2: Fun in the sun in famous Santa Monica!
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is famous for a variety of items This is where Route 66 ends and where one of the few ild me fears wheels actually still run.Although modest in size this is the home court advantage view at night when much of the So Cal Pacific coast line is lit up. You can see Santa Catalina Island and Malibu as well!

I couldn't go to LA and not come to Santa Monica pier! My partner and I had a great afternoon being kids again on the carnival ride and eating food. The Ferris wheel was fun with great views! If you have kids I'd highly recommend bringing them here!

We visited Santa Monica pier during a trip to California! Not sure what to expect when we turned up but was wonderfully surprised! Watch out for the traffic if travelling back into LA during rush hour! Big mistake
You can't go to LA and not visit Santa Monica Pier, it's an interesting walk out over the Pacific ocean surrounded by street performers (of vastly varying quality)Definitely worth a look.

Beach area is huge and maintained very well, clean, tidy. The pier is quite interesting, worth visiting for a pictures at the end of Route 66.Rest of it appears in movies a lot, so no need to repeat.Overall check it off your list, it's also quite popular with locals, it's a beach on the pacific after all.

Well I've seen this pier dozens of times in movies, tv series , videogames, my first feeling was that it was smaller than I thought, I was walking along the pier until the end, the view from there was nice, Muscle beach and Venice beach, and front of you the Pacific Ocean,then I walked toward to the amusement park, I was surprised that the attractions were not cheap. Finally I was eating at Bubba Gump Restaurant, nice views and nice food. Well, it's a nice place but honestly I expect something more, it's wrong to idealize a place before visiting.

column2: Beautiful end of a LA tour
column3: We went there as part of day tour and it was great. The sunset, the ambience, everything was excellent. For me it was surprising how small the Ferris wheel was, I had seen it many times in the movies and I thought it was bigger. It's also amazing to get to see the Route 66 sign. A great place to walk and have dinner or just walk around and see the sunset.
Such an iconic spot therfore a must see. I have to say I preferred it at sunset. It looked absolutely stunning with the orange sky behind.

A must place to visit. Carnival rides, snacks available and restaurants. And the ferris wheel its a must. At night there will be some street performers. So try to go before it gets dark to enjoy both day and night scene

column2: One of the best pier in California
column3: Open until midnight with a lot of things to do. Good for family and couple and spectacular view. Not missing if you are around here.
It is nice place to have a fun or to try some rides. It is realy good place for family and kids. Beach in Santa Monica is beautiful. You can spend all day there.

The best time to visit the Santa Monica Pier is at sunset. You can walk to the end of the pier and watch the sunset over the Pacific, pretty spectacular, especially if your from Ohio!My husband wanted to ride the Ferris wheel but I was worried the line was too long but in really glad he convinced me! It is a must do. The sun has set so it was beautiful at twilight with all the lights. The ocean and views of Malibu were wonderful!

My husband and I loved this place.Santa Monica was one of the destinations during our honeymoon and we were so glad that we were staying within walking distance of the pier. It's spectacular. It's amazing.We stayed in Santa Monica for 5 nights and each day we had to visit the Pier, sometimes more than once.It's such a lively spot. The street entertainment around there is always so entertaining and enjoyable.The views are spectacular. Especialy if you take a ride on the big wheel. It's so amazing at night time. Breath-taking views.The best part by far and a memory that will never leave me is watching the sunset from the beach - such a warming glow covering the entire area. A real sight to behold.

My partner and I weren't originally planning on seeing Santa Monica pier while visiting LA but are so glad we did. Lots of things to see and do and plenty of food options. Make sure you're there for the sunset in the afternoon, it's really beautiful.

column2: Watched the sun set over the Pacific!
column3: Spent a couple days in the Los Angeles area, and really wanted to visit the beach. This was the first time any of us had touched the Pacific Ocean; it's a beautiful sight! We even saw a couple pelicans just hanging out on the railings. The traffic in the area was insane on a Tuesday night (by our small town standards), but we didn't care, and it was still one of my favourite things we did.
Sun was setting so evrything looked great. Quite busy but enough room to move. Some of the structures are shwoing their age.

We had a quick stop over in LA and decided the pier was a must do for us for the one day we had.The pier at night is absolutely beautiful - freezing (end of Dec) but well worth it.We wandered around looking at all the arcade and carnival style games, the roller coast and heaps of kids rides all look amazing at night.. magical with at the bright lightsThe Ferris wheel was great fun and again gorgeous views over the pier and ocean - very romantic! I think it was fairly priced for what it is (staff, maintenance etc)Snacks and drinks are there but we walked a few blocks and had dinner at a pub instead
This place was great with nice view and games and shop .. The small shops for artistic work art was great .. Live music and lovely atmosphere just loved it

column2: Very nice place for a walk
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a nice place to enjoy a walk around. You can also rent a bike and go around and the place is adjacent to several attractions around

column2: Best admired from the distance away from the crowds
column3: Having just driven the Route 66 we felt obliged to spend some time on the pier and, of course, have our photo taken under the "end" sign; that is, once you've battled past the hordes of tourists. Crowds of tourists aren't really our thing, so this put us off spending too much time here. If you love GTA5 then another bonus is checking out the pier for its gameplay similarities. It was really fun, like stepping into the game. Mostly, this pier is best admired from the distance in the evening. Take a lovely walk down the beach, away from the crowds, and enjoy the beautiful lights.
I had an unfavorable experience with the t-shirt stand named 66-to Cali on Santa Monica Pier. Dan Rice, the owner, was impossible to do business with.

The pier is a good spot to grab some LA merch, take a ride of the ferris wheel or just to walk down and people watch. Really nice walk from the pier along the boardwalk to muscle beach and venice beach. Bikes and rollerblades for hire along the boardwalk too. And a few places to eat

they really have everything, it an Icon, and fun and you can park on the pier. Musicians playing, a great fun center with lots of games, win prizes, fun park rides, great food. Bubba Gumps is here too

column2: The Sun Worshippers Delight - Santa Monica Pier.
column3: The 106 year old Santa Monica Pier on Ocean Avenue in Los Angeles is a tourists delight. The wharf out onto the bay on Pacific Park has just about everything - amusement parks, rides - the Santa Monica Looff Hippodrome (carousel) is a historic landmark. You get a splendid view from the top of the world‚Äôs only solar powered 130-foot ferris wheel. There are games, excellent sea food, fun stalls with all kinds of souvenirs ‚Äì T-shirts, guide books, entertainment ‚Äì we saw a fat albino snake slithering around a person‚Äôs neck, and ofcourse, the gorgeous fiery sunsets. Just below the carousel is the aquarium - home to more than 100 species of marine animals and plants. You can even learn to fly! The legendary Route 66 ends it 2,500 mile journey which cuts across the U.S. a few blocks away at Lincoln and Olympic boulevards - take a picture at the End of the Route sign on the Pier. You can spend an entire day on its endless beach with tanned bodies of muscular body builders, sun worshippers and surfers. There are wooden walk-aways along the beach that take you right to the water. The Santa Monica Pier is well connected by road ‚Äì the Big Blue Bus and rail ‚Äì so have fun in the sun!
A must see in LA. Great views of the coat and the beach, good atmosphere. Quite touristy but still with a nice cachet.

column2: A must do especially on a sunny day
column3: The family and I stopped at the Pier mid morning and thoroughly enjoyed it. The view itself of the pier as you walk from the street down is really cool. Then as you make you way down onto the old wooden pier you will find a heap of things to see, from people busking too a few different places to eat and drink.It is a must do on a sunny day as the beach and coastline looks great from out on the pier. Its awesome to stand out on the pier and see the waves roll under and the surfers trying to catch a few. There are a heap of great places to take some really good photos of both the pier and coastline.The rides are a bit pricey but other than that it was well worth the stop. Whilst we parked a block back in a public car-park the parking along the beach was reasonable cheap as well.

There is so much to do. You have one of the most beautiful beaches, food outlets, walking trails, Route 66 sign, fishing, relaxing, shopping, amusement park and much much more. We had so much fun here.
This pier is kinda lame in of itself. But if you're into campy stuff, I do recommend it. Has a mildly creepy aura, which is the best thing about it.
Nice place to see the ocean and the beach where baywatch was filmed. Street musicians adding a bitter sweet flavour to the pier which kakes it very special
The pier was everything we thought it would be charming and classic. live music on the end of the pier on Christmas Day was just fabulous

Lots of fun and entertainment. The amusement park is fun and cute. The views of the end of the pier are beautiful. Sunset and evening are by far the best times, the food stalls open up and the place comes alive.There are street performers are,, interesting. Some are good others should not be there
We visited the puer on our trip from Australia and thought it was wonderful! The atmosphere and variety of thibgs to look at and do was amazing. The beach is also lovely, a must see when visiting LA!

This was the best place we visited in Los Angeles. Lots of public parking a block from pier. Enjoyed the shops on the pier. Beautiful views of Pacific Palisades mountains. Also nice walk from pier to Venice beach. I suggest to rent a bike.
Make sure to come with walking shoes and be ready to walk. This pier is best experienced on foot. Watch the people; enjoy the water.

My hubby and I went to Santa Monica pier we walked along the beach and everything else was fun! We also rode the Ferris wheel and it has a beautiful view of the entire beach and the pier I recommend this beach to family's specially because they have a mini adventure park

Being a Santa Monican I hope I can give people an insight what this pier really stand for. Its fun and exhilarating and youthful. This pier has been here for all children since I can remember, it's the summer destination of all Angelenos. You would see picnics all over the surrounding park, children enjoying the arcade games and Ferris wheel,Which I might add was recently replaced. Its the Westside version of east coast Coney island.The adults have their choices of restaurant, and if you're a healthnut, running along a beach should be a treat. The Pacific ocean does have its beauty... After all who could resist that?
A must see in LA, parking can be tricky (go early) and many cool dining spots for lunch either on or off the pier. A good morning walk.

column2: Iconic place to visit in LA and you must stay for sunset!!!!
column3: If you visit Santa Monica parking at the pier is EASY and cheap at $8 for a whole day. The pier itself has some food and coffee places (fairground food don't expect amazing choices)It's a fun place to visit. If you park here I would recommend hiring a bike HERE and then riding down from this point down to the main Santa Monica centre. The bikes at this end are much cheaper than anywhere else (having walked past a load of of much more expensive hire places)Food choices here are not so good.... But the experience is 'funfair'. Only fun when it's sunny.....and leaving the car park after the sunset has gone is a bit slow so be patient!
Beautiful place, specially at the sunrise and sunset moments. The seagulls are the attraction, besides the park and the view. If you are in Santa Monica you have to go there!

We love the Santa Monica Pier and all of the surrounding area. This is such a fun place to go. We love to walk on the boardwalk and this time there was a great violin player which we watched and in the back ground watched the sun set. Doesn't get any better than that.
Very happy. Wish my hotel was in this area. Good for families. Tons of food and shopping. The rides were pretty fun too.

column2: Interesting collection of stuff and people
column3: While on our trip up the coast to eventually get to the Getty, we stopped off at the pier (or son had been there the day before with the marching band). We didn't have long to stay and despite it being December in California, it was colder than the locals would have liked, and it actually lightly rained for a moment. Many of the street performers and artists on the pier were kinda cool to experience. Now I can say I've been to the end of Route 66.
This area was unlike anything found in the South...truly a one of a kind experience! Out visiting my daughter and we had a blast!
Great place to finish your forest gump run lol. Great views and restaurants for sea food in area. Beach is very nice to see and relax.
This place is nice, really worth the visit. There are some good restaurants there, some place to buy gifts too. You should go there in the sunset, the view is amazing.

Family and out-of-town friends for a stroll and a snack. Fun crowds, nice picture opportunities and walking distance from the beach (obviously) and the Promenade. Gret free concerts during the summer season (Thursdays?)

I've been to santa Monica a few times and always make it a point to go to the santa monica pier & walk on the board walk. There is a ferris wheel, games, booths with souvenirs, etc. The view from the boardwalk is just beautiful.The beach is clean and it is a short drive to marina del rey & Venice beach!There is a lot of parking nearby in case you dont want to park on the beach (can't remember the price). There are meters you can park at for $2.00 every 3 hrs.Highly recommend this beach for a visit!

We walked down to the pier because, well its Santa Monica Pier. I really wasn't impressed. Didn't seem like much more than a pier with a couple rides, restaurants and souvenir shops.Now the view was stunning so I was glad to walk out there but it was a quick peek and that was it. Everything is super expensive on the pier.Quite a few homeless people around.

My son loved it. I went during the winter and the rides were closed, but the weather was nice. I rented a bike and rode around the pier with my son, which was nice. The route 66 sign is a must for pictures. I made the mistake of parking away from the pier for $20. As I walked to the pier, there were cheaper parking garages and inside the pier it's free!
Great place to spend your afternoon. It has nice views, good food and fun. Go all the way to the back. See the muscle beach too ;)

5 hour stopover on trip from NZ to Aspen. Nothing much at LAX, so taxied out to Santa Monica pier. Great afternoon in winter sunshine; meal at Bubba Gumps; few "kids" games on pier... Didn't try Roller coaster due to kids apathy, but looked pretty cool for the pier! Dipped ankles in water, and took lots of photos! Had thought of going to closer beach for walk, but worked out fine.

column2: Nice excursion for an hour or two
column3: Lively Boardwalk with interesting people watching, shopping, gamEs, and food. Great views of ocean and beach, if a bit windy.

column2: A great get away and fun place
column3: This was close enough to Vegas for a day trip. A great opportunity to visit the Pacific Coast. A fun place to visit/experience.

Overall, I had a good time. It's definitely an iconic place to visit in Cali. There is much too see and explore. Many food options; the funnel cakes were the best. We didn't go on any of the rides, but could tell people were enjoying themselves on them. At night, it's even more lively with people playing music and people fishing off the pier. If you're in the area, I would give it a try.

column2: Fun place to stop and site see!
column3: We were traveling down highway 1 and stopped here at Santa Monica pier. Fun place to stop and grab a souvenir for people back home. We enjoyed some ice cream as we walked the pier enjoying the vendors working for tips. Beautiful picture options along the pier and we even took some videos of vendors. Now we can say when we see this setting on a movie, that we have been there!

column2: An interesting distraction-but not a main attraction
column3: I remember coming to the Pier as a kid and this visit brought back some memories. Not as grand as I remember, a bit gritty actually. If you want good food, eat at the places near the Pier not on it. Great place for some nice views.
Great landmark to check out and do some serious people watching or chill out. Good for family or individuals! Check it our
This pier is a lovely place to go for the day. Plenty of places to eat and a fun park on the pier itself. What's more it is the official end of Route 66
A must do if visiting LA. Beautiful beach and a walk along the pier at sunset was breathtaking. Include a wander to the local shopping mall for great prices with loads of variety.

column2: Make the most of it going to the machines !
column3: This place is good. However, I will not give it 5 stars because there is not much to it other than some restaurants, the aquarium and the machines. The machines were fun, we bought the tickets that included all of them (cheaper this way). If you buy them separately, they are about $8 a ride, which is ridiculous. it is a good place to take pictures and walk around the beach. after a few hours there is not much to do. i do recommend this place though. visit everything the pier has to offer and don't just stand there looking at the ocean.their funnel cakes are actually good and BIG. 1 funnel cake is good for 2-3 people.great place to take tons of pictures.
Lots to see and do. Good shopping and eateries. The rides on the pier are small but have a great view. Rides are VERY expensive. So be prepared for $8 rides.

As grandparents, we take our 5 and 7 year old grand daughters to the Santa Monica Pier occasionally. It is great entertainment for them, and the ride operators really do care about the kids. Recently, our 5 year old grand daughter got onto a ride, and became very frightened. The ride operator saw this, and stopped the ride to allow her to exit. The ride operator then re-started the ride so the others on board could enjoy it. We recommend the SM Pier as good entertainment for families, and the all day pass is a real bargain.
Very beautiful place with lots of things to do, restaurants, shops, cafes and everything else. Parking is also no issue, however be prepared to spend a lot!
I always liked to visit Santa Monica pier to cheer up, get some ice cream and enjoy the view. I once witnessed the screening of Modern Family.If you go to LA you should at least spend an hour there.

It's one of those things, when in Santa Monica you need to visit the pier! It really is worth a wander, or maybe a burger, or even a ride on the roller coaster. And at night, it looks very special from the beach, all lit up!
Very well maintainedLots to see and even if it was hazy it was worth seeing itIt is good for young and old and lots of room so you didn't bump into each other
The rides on the pier were family based or for younger couples, no high thrill rides. But it was lovely just to walk along the pier checking out the sea gulls and eating some funnel cake.
The parking right on the pier was very reasonable at $2 an hour. Much better to park on the pier than walk up the ramp. Nice view interesting thing to see on pier. Many performers.

column2: Life and buzz of Santa Monica
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a hive of activity. Famous from so many TV and movie shows, the Pier is the official end of Route 66. Packed with people and fun and games at Pacific Park. At the end of the day, there aren't many better spots in LA to watch the sun set, whilst the fun at the Park kicks on into the night.

column2: The county fair suspended over the waves
column3: An iconic location made famous in movies and television. And you probably need to go there once in your life. If nothing else, to take a photo under that famous neon sign. You may also discover that sometimes things look better on the screen than in real life.Expect lots of tourists, trashy vendors selling souvenirs , carnival rides, and junk food. Exactly like the county fair suspended over the waves. There is a nice view of the beaches all the way up to Malibu from the end of the pier.

Plenty of parking in the lot right next to the pier and beach. Car parking is a reasonable $8 all day. There are many food places to choose from. Rides look great. A nice place to people watch and see street performers too. Lots of clean restrooms on the pier. I think a half day on the pier is plenty of time.

I wasn't too fond of Los Angeles, apologies, yet coming out to this side of the area was definitely giving me a clue to why ppl love this area. Relaxing area and nice scene. Not too crowded. I'm not sure where all the parking is , but the main pier had a parking that you have to pay I believe 3 bks every hour. Put this on your to-see list!

It's always been a dream to drive to Santa Monica then take the coast road to Malibu. Hired a Mustang Convertible and done it. The pier is well maintained and the beach spotless. It's obviously combed every night and the weather was stunning (21 with real feel of 23) so it was quite amusing to see locals in woolley hats and coats. A nice location for the bucket list.

We had fish & chips for lunch and walk along the pier. It's a scenic place to visit with nice restaurants. There is quite a few things to do, bike hire & amusement park, but we didn't do them so can't comment.

column2: Overpriced and packed, but nice view
column3: If all you're looking to do is people-watch and take in the view of the beach and ocean, you'll be okay. But if you plan to eat, do the rides, or play games, be prepared to over-charged and disappointed. We were bummed to find that many of the boardwalk games (skeeball, whack-a-mole) were really beaten down and not working correctly any more.
If you plan on making it a day make sure to rent bikes for a couple of hours and ride down to Venice Beach. The ride is about a half hour one way and is amazing :)

We made several visits to the Santa Monica Pier during 2015...and, without a doubt, the beautiful carousel, located there, became a favorite of our two (almost four-year-old) grandchildren! The carousel is beautifully restored and featured the wonderful music that was meant to go along with it. As I recall, the cost was a reasonable (for California!) three dollars a ride.

We went just after Christmas, and it was chilly and windy, but sunny. The pier is great for just taking a relaxing walk, seeing all the people and some musical performers, or having one of the several calligraphers create a piece of art out of your name. We enjoyed the ferris wheel views and did a couple of simple easy rides (coaster and rocking ship) with the kids to relive the joy of a few years ago when the kids started on these fun theme park rides (they've since graduated to the super fast thrill rides). The rides were expensive, but surprisingly, the coffee place (Coffee Bean?) was reasonable (I think). As expected, pretty crowded and tough to get parking, but going early on a weekday helped us during the holidays. Just a quick couple of hours having fun doing nothing!

column2: Great Places to visit because it's close to Venice Beach, shopping, food and restaurants bike riding and much much more.
column3: I just love the sights sound and smells at the Pier - along with Restaurants Venice Beach and the street stalls that offer all sorts of amazing gifts and souvenirs.Great atmosphere üòÄüòÄüòÄ

column2: Always wanted to go. And didn't disappoint.
column3: Our visit to SMP on NYE 2016 was great. This place has been on my bucket list (I live in Australia).Lots to see and do, and we have the souvenirs and photos to treasure. We opted not to go on any attractions at Pacific Park, purely because of price (we were heading to Disneyland the next day and that would be enough amusements I think!). Even though it says "California's only admission-free amusement centre", it was USD$8PP for the ferris wheel - and for 7 of us in the early evening (read: dark,a bit windy & getting cold) was not justifiable. We ended up having a great wander after some time on the beach, and then enjoyed a delicious dinner at Bubba Gump's.
Such a great place to visit! Plenty of things to do and also plenty of places to sit and do nothing but relax and people watch!

Very crowded, even on a rainy day. Full of cheap junk and bad food. You may want to stop here if you have never been to Santa Monica before, but dont' make a day of it. If you have kids, they may like it more than adults.

Its got a little theme park on that isn't very good. There are a few cafes on there too but other than that... It's just a pier. It looks really good for a photo but in terms of entertainment, it'll be fun for 5 mins.

column2: End of the road for Route 66
column3: What an iconic location this is for fans of Route 66 or the Forrest Gump movie. Forrest Gump famously ran to the end of the pier here and turned around and went back across the US. A great location for kids as it has the pier amusement park and a number of novelty type gift shops and eateries. For a lifelong memory, make sure you get a photo underneath the famous Santa Monica Pier sign.

column2: So much fun on the water
column3: Great arcades to keep the kids entertained indoors to get a little respite from the sun (but I don't know why someone would do that). Great views and enjoyable atmosphere all around.

We spent 5 hours on the pier and had a great time.Food at bubba gumps was yum, but a little pricey ($US 100 for a family of 2A/3C) we're not big eaters and only had 1 drink no dessert.Rides were great fun $8 for bigger rides and $4 for smaller rides

Just a few minutes driving from there and I was already in Santa Monica‚Äôs Pier. People love piers here in the US and I still don‚Äôt understand why every single beach has one‚Ä¶ I mean, a pier is something nice and useful, people can park small boats, fish, they have restaurants and amusement parks (as they have here in Santa Monica)‚Ä¶ But why do they need to build it in every beach? Whatever... Stayed there for a while, enjoying the beach and finally getting into the sea water for the first time! The water here is so much colder than in Panama, but it something I‚Äôve promised to myself I would do! And I did, on the last day and one of the last things on my trip, but the mission was accomplished!
Great place to visit, we had seen it in so many movies and to see it now in real was great, had a quick meal which was good, watched the sunset which was surreal, enjoyed the visit
Excellent views from wheel and local artist busking was amazing seeing so many different talents. While family enjoyed the day there

By day or by night the Santa Monica Pier never disappoints. The magical lights on the ferris wheel, the rides, the pop-up vendors, and all the different people. Spend a few bucks or just walk around for free.

We went to the Pier on a weekday. We went about 10:00AM and it was overcast all of which contributed to it not being very crowded. It was a relaxing pleasant visit. The price of food and souvenirs was outrageous, but we expected it to be. There were two musicians playing which added to the atmosphere of the place. We walked from our hotel, but parking looked to be difficult to obtain and expensive. We had a hot dog and garlic fries at the place that suceeded Inkies' Harbor Grill. The hot dog was OK the garlic fries were horrible, too much grease. We fed them to the pidgeons which aggressively encroach on all Pier diners. The place is truly and American icon. Visit the merry-go-round.
Great place! Entertainers, funfair, places to eat and drink with fabulous views of the beach. Added bonus of seals as well. Worth a visit.

A have to visit when you are in this area, the walk out to the end of the pier is beautiful. Lots of buskers but no one gave us a hard time. We never got on the rides but they looked fun, great visit.

column2: The breezes off the pier was great!
column3: There is really a lot to see and do on the pier. There is an amusement park (that I did not visit), a few restaurants, vendors, entertainers, fishermen/women, people clamming and a couple gift shops. The gift shops are overpriced (as I would expect), I did not eat at any of the restaurants (however Pier Burger smelled the best) but I did stop and smell the air. I watched the waves crash as the sun went down, I watched sail boats and surfer/body board riders, I watched kids splash and parents laugh. It was a great place to relax, that was until I went back on Friday night . . . it was more like Disney. LOTS of people everywhere; it was difficult to navigate your way to the end of the pier. We did stop and get our picture taken at the end of Route 66, so that was pretty cool. Overall, I strongly suggest that you see this at least once while you are in the area.
Ordinary pier - which does have some movies credits to it's name. Fun if you have kids.Very crowded.
Reasonably nice place, not much queue for the rides, lovely view. Could use a clean up. Worth a 1.5 hour visit max.

The Santa Monica pier is totally overwhelming and overkill. It seems to attract everybody, period. It should be checked out on a weekday and make sure that you spend more time on the beach than the pier.
Pleasant stroll along the iconic western end to Route 66. Busy, fairy floss/hot dog filled, arcade ride location.It's fun and free and a nice spot to watch the pacific swell roll in.
Love the beach; love the atmosphere- so relaxing! Worth to visit as a family or a couple- can be fun for family or romantic for couples.
Love the ocean view! People singing on the sides... Great ambience amaizing food places around! Way more intretaining for kids than anything. It is awsome for the view!
Crowded, like i Expected IT to Be , good, a lot of food places, attractions, people who adore the sun, fishing, would visit again

Had a great time at the pier and on the beach with my 6 year old. Collected shells, rode on rides, ate fast food and ice cream... made an entire day of it! Very fun, and a great way to "relax" if you're on vacation.
We stayed just a hop and skip from the pier. We love walking the pier. So much to do and see. Great views.

This is a great stop for photos. We went early and beat the crowds but we did not get to see the carnival or vendors in full swing. Still we had a good visit. I took a photo with the Zoltan fortune teller machine from the movie BIG. We also bought a kite to fly on one of the many beaches along the Pacific Coast.FYI There is an $8.00 fee for parking.
We visited this place last September. We rode the ferris wheel and really like it. it was hot but not that hot that day.. lovely experience

This was a nice spot to look out on the ocean. I've been on piers with more restaurants and things to do so it wasn't the best pier ever. However the view of the beach is neat and in the back a cool viola player made the mood. Would be a romantic night for date night.
Met up with wife's childhood friend had food and drinks at one of one of the few restaurants located on the boardwalk. Afterwards, we went out to enjoy rides and a good time.

My wife and I went with a friend we were visiting to the pier. It was a cool experience. It's a good size pier and has a lot of little stands selling trinkets. There's and arcade and an area where you can get on some rides. A definite destination of you have kids.
It was a nice walk love it, I went with my sister and we walked around and ate. We went early in the morning like at 9 so we had parking and it was good .. not to crowded
Our new favorite place!!!!!! So much to see and do, my son had never been and now he never wants to leave! Will definitely be back
I was there on a business trip and went to Santa Monica Pier for looking around. Deeply satisfied of the relaxing and joy atmosphere. Best on sunny days
Well with the visit to walk the pier. Great activities for the family with all the rides. And the view of the Santa Monica mountains is wonderful.
Being from the UK I have seen better piers, just not with better weather. This one was just too crowded, maybe it would be better visited on a more British weather day ^_^

column2: All the fun of the fair
column3: SM pier has it all lots to see and do day and night. Wonderful views afforded by the big wheel or try your luck at the stalls on offer.
Santa Monica Pier is where is action is.... Be it street performances or street shopping or great food this is a one stop shop for all your needs..... We had an amazing time at the pier....

The one thing that stands out about the pier is the fact that this marks the end of Highway 66, which ran from Chicago covering a distance of 3,940km. Apart from that, there's nothing technically spectacular about the pier as it's just a structure that juts out into the Pacific Ocean. However, the city successfully turned the pier into a great public place-making, making it one of the must-see places in California. Among the activities that people do here are to visit the amusement park, aquarium and fish. Or you can just sit back and people-watch. I did just that and I thought this is what defines the Santa Monica Pier
A good place to go and check out if spending the day waiting for a flight. pretty easy to get to with bus.

Fun visit today, easy to park at the mall and then walk to the pier. Plenty to see, eat and do. It looked very crowded but by the time we got to the end of the pier it wasn't crowded at all. No charge unlike other piers we have visited.
we spend a wonderfull time at the Pier and saw the most beautiful sunset. Also the nice Mexican Restaurant is worth to visit with many delicious dishes. We would like to go back there!
If you're in Santa Monica, you have to go to the Pier. It's a nice walk and people-watching opportunity and there's lots of fun, w/ live music and great views.
Spent a few hours on the pier. Loads to see and do. Well worth a visit. We went as part of a day tour and found it to be well worthwhile

column2: Just the place to wind down!
column3: A lovely place to wander and enjoy the scenery and people watch. You can spend a lot or nothing and still have a great time. Watching the sun set over the Pacific Ocean was beautiful - particularly since I usually watch it rise over the Pacific Ocean. At the end of the pier are bleachers to watch the sunset. Obviously everyone else enjoyed the sunset too as most clapped as the sun disappeared.

Amazing place to go with children or on your own. One of the most famous places thanks to various movies. Great rollercoaster - lots of fun! amazing ocean, lots of activities to attend to. Love this place.
Spent an afternoon here on our recent trip to California. It was New Years Eve so it was very very crowded. But my teenagers loved it!

We are a family of 4 (10 yr old boy & 13 yr old boy) this was our first trip to California. 3 full days and on the last day we went to Santa Monica Pier. It was wonderful ! If you only have 1 day in California Santa Monica Pier is a must. There are so many amazing things about this place, everything you dream about visiting California is here. Our boys loved it more than any other destination & Hollywood Blvd is about even. We live near the gulf coast but this beach was amazing!1. Everywhere you look is beautiful !2. The pier is filled with amazing people and talents! ( & yes some homeless but that is common anywhere around these areas)3. We loved eating at the Mexican food restaurant at the end of the pier.4. Seals can be seen swimming about5. The rides were great and worth the $30 all you can ride bands!6. Popeye was a real guy from here!7. Loved Zoltar from BIG at the game room.8. The ice Cream was soooo GREAT !9. People watching was entertaining10. OH & then theres the Beach, no matter how cold take your shoes off and dip your toes into that amazing water & sand!11. even though we had our kids with us it felt like we were on our first date together. Laughing , playing in the arcade & holding hands. When the kids are having fun so can the parents!Even if its chilly take an extra jacket because at night it get cold.

We almost didn't come to this place, but the timing was right, close to sunset, so we made the trip.A few tips: Come on to the pier and park on the left. That parking is on a half hourly basis. Parking on the right is flat fee.Bring an additional layer of clothing, it gets cold.There is a lower deck all the way at the end that is closer to the water and better for pictures.Enjoy!
Absolutely beautiful. Can't describe the sunset--you need to see it for yourself. It's unforgettable.

column2: A fun day in sunny California
column3: The pier is lovely, you start walking to it from the famous "Santa Monica Pier" sign on the boardwalk and start your way through people, bikes, musicians, artists, the sign of the ending of "Route 66" and at the very end you'll have incredible views of the sea.
Went here with my boyfriend on our LA vacation. It was very beautiful with a lot to see and do. Definitely worth a trip if your visiting LA
Beautiful yet very touristy area of SM. Rides are fun, food nothing special, but the views of the ocean, ah, gorgeous. Weekday visits are best.

column2: Great place for the whole family.
column3: A must see if you are in the LA area for a day or an entire summer. Its the old time carnival that I remember as a kid surrounded by ocean. Cotten candy, fired dough, corn dogs and everything that is bad for you if only for a day. Worth the trip.

column2: Cool place to be but mostly fun for kids
column3: We visited in December when its cold so there's not many people playing at the water except for near the pier. However the pier was more lively. The pier offers a cool view of the bay and ocean especially at the tip and also from the ferris wheel at the amusement park on the pier. The amusement park at the pier mostly features fun for kids.
Didn't really find anything special about the pier, it's ok for a walk along, but nothing to get excited about.

Last day in L. A. And took an uber down to the pier. Small amusement rides, ice cream, vendors, restaurants , merry go round. Fun! Worth the time to stop and enjoy this with the shops nearby. Put it on the list! Oh yeah, forgot the beachüòÄ

Honestly! Feels like riding a rainbow! Let you inner kid out and have some good fun! No matter if coming on your own, with friends or family - this will be a memorable experience to make you smile long time after your visit!
Always a fun place. Always seems crowded but nice. Always a tourist favorite. Parking can be difficult. Nice place to get right up to the ocean.
just look at it from afar...way too many people for a few little rides. it's a total waste of time. food choices are minimum. view from Ferris wheel is probably only reason for going

We had fun on the rides at the Santa Monica Pier. Perfect weather. Our toddler had fun on the rides. We even had a brief conversation with a movie star there with her toddler.Plenty of parking. We went on a weekday about noon time. View is great. Ocean is beautiful. Plenty of bathroom facilities. Musicians playing music on the pier.

column2: So much more then we expected
column3: We have been to many piers in California. Santa Monica actually had a lot of action going on. A little amusement park, an arcade, an aquarium, shopping (very little) Lots of food vendors. Best of all some incredible views and great place to people watch.Parking is fun because you actually can park on the pier.. It is $3/hr I believe but it was really simple to find parking.We walked around and took in the beautiful view of the ocean. Didn't really partake in any of the amusement stuff. Got some food and walked along the beach. Not much in shells in the area, mostly muscles from the pier and a few oyster shells.A few people were walking around with metal detectors. So this seems like a decent place for that.Great views, nice beach, lots of food, and a little bit of shopping. Makes this a nice place to visit. Though families with younger children (mine is 18) may benefit more from the amusement park aspect of it.

This is a proper old time beach pier. My favorite part is the arcade with skeeball, air hockey, and other fun games, but there's also a cool old carousel, musicians, beach food everywhere. Even a little drizzle did not deter.

column2: Not sure it quite lived up to our hype but still a pleasant experience
column3: The pier was busy and quite commercialised. I don't really know what I was expecting but for some reason it didnt really live up to my expectations. I think our highlight was watching the kids paddling in the ocean thinking its amazing they are on the other side of the Pacific ocean now. Parking was relatively easy and the pier itself was quite busy. We didnt go on any rides but the kids admired them. Dinner was a choice of any quick greasy cuisine on the boardwalk or we could have waited for one of the restaurants. All in all, I'm glad we visited. I think next time I'd take some time to explore the other beaches in the area and sample a slightly more upmarket restaurant.
Lots to see and do. Many eateries. It was very crowded the day we were there. It was a beautiful day, so people were out and about. Some were swimming. Lots of activity and lots of people.

It was very windy and cool while we were there the 1st day but the pier is fun and the views amazing. It rained the 1st day and most of the shops and places were closed. The 2nd time we went over there it was sunny and many of the places were open. The pier is a lot of fun and a must do if in the area! I bet in the summer this place is really amazing!

column2: Fun walk with lots to see
column3: Restaurants are touristy but this is a tourist place so you get what you expect. Lots of street performers to look at, trinket stores and you can walk on the beach when you are done.
Great scenery, fun, full of life and full of people. I had a hotdog there, unique and delicious.Full of people that make the place alive!

We visited this beautiful place at the beginning of December 2015 & I have to say it is definitely one of the most loveliest scenic places ever. We made our own way there rather than getting a tour bus and we took our time and looked around . We found it was the best way to do this than worry about a tour bus and the time restrictions they put on you. We spent the majority of the day enjoying all the ambiance that Santa Monica has to offer .The pier itself is very clean, their toilets are also clean and the views from wherever you walk on the pier is absolutely stunning . Going around in December to the pier , we were lucky that we missed having the huge crowds that you see in their summer season & it was so much better in December. Even though it is winter the weather was hot and sunny and without the huge crowds shoving and pushing . There are a lot of souvenir shops, restaurants and an adjacent fun park catering for the young and old. If you are a fan of the movie Forest Gum, they have a huge store called Bubba Gum ! You can buy all then souvenirs relating to the movie. They also have the famous Route 66 store and in there you can buy all the original clothes made in USA and various souvenirs relating to the famous Route 66. Don't forget to stop and take a photo next to the end of the road sign "Route 66". There are people busking playing music instruments or singing . It is a lively place to visit. If you are in LA you have to put Santa Monica Pier on your list of sightseeing.

column2: Fun to watch people and waves
column3: It is very close from the downtown and has the pier.Kids are having fun at the small amusement park.It is a nice place hang out for a while.Parking is $3 per hour.

We visited Santa Monica when we were staying in Long Beach. The traffic was a disaster but a walk in the pier makes you forget about the traffic. A nice view and while we're lucky since there was a sail competition going on.

I had the opportunity to watch the sunset at the Santa Monica Pier, both were during the winter but both were perfect! This is such a nice place to be with family or friends, they have parking lot, a lot of restaurants and souvenirs stores.

This is such a fun place. Lots of people and there is always something unexpected that happens. Great food and good place to bring kids to, they have ride there and other child friendly stuff. I just love being able to go to a place like this that by the sea.

Very very crowded at sunset but heck if you are visiting CA Go. We were serenaded by a wonderful musician with classic 60's music while we waited for sunset. There are bleachers to watch from. The sun slipped over the horizon with polite clapping from the crowd. We rode the Ferris wheel $8. ea then hightailed it up the ramp to wait for Uber. Of course it was surge but so was the crowd and we were happy to leave

This pier is another famous Land mark.Like any other pier its having all the fun filled activities like rides, dining and shopping.Great fun for kids and of course burgers are great .Also good for spending time.
Really cool spot...lots to enjoy with the roller coaster and bumper cars...and more. If your a dare devil type like me you'll do the trapeze training üëç
Lots of people, great to visit. Really enjoyed going there and having a look. Big pier with plenty to do. Travelled Aug 2014.

My husband and I were visiting from Illinois. So of course Santa Monica is beautiful. We spent quite some time walking the beach in the morning. Then we walked to the Pier. The Pier looked like a great place for families. They had plenty of food choices, shopping places, clean bathrooms and fun rides. We never felt crowded or unsafe although there was plenty of people. We spent about 2 hours walking around looking at homes down the beach and then walked up to the street where the hotels and restaurants were. Too many homeless people everywhere once you walk up to the main street making the vibe a little more stressful and less safe. But i'm sure its that way in most big cities. But nothing like that at the Pier. The beach and Pier were beautiful. We didn't stay in Santa Monica because of the high prices but if I had to do it again I would. Just too beautiful to pass up.
This is a must do activity. Walk, take photos and watch people. The crowd is half the fun. We played old fashioned pinball machines and watched fishing by locals. The buskers are quite good.

column2: Always Fun on a Nice Day
column3: It can be a bit crowded, depending on when you go, but it's always fun. There are street musicians, shops, and, best of all, the pier itself. Great views at the end of it, and you just may see a seal or two.

We always enjoy the pier and for us no visit is complete without having a Pier Burger, in my opinion one of the best burgers around. People watching is always fun. The carousel is exceptional and the kids love it. If buskers are your thing there are lots to choose from. The rides are also fun. If you go to Santa Monica you need to visit the pier at the end of Route 66

Had a great time. Go listen to the water. It's so powerful. Make sure to spend time with the artists there. They have so much talent to offer this world. Was able to pick up some one of a kind pieces that I will cherish forever. Also tried Churros for the first time. Find someone to split it with...they are massive.
Its really fun to walk about the pier and check out the shops, restaurants and unique people who make LA such an interesting place. The ferris wheel is fun and reasonably priced. Plenty of photo ops!

column2: An enjoyable place to spend a couple of hours
column3: There are some fun Route 66 landmarks at the pier as this is the 'end of Route 66'. We are big Route 66 fans, and we enjoyed experiencing that aspect of Santa Monica.
