There are lots of little souvenir shops on the pier, restaurants, bars, and the amusement parks to entertain you. The ocean views are lovely and the breeze keeps you comfortable. We visited the pier during the afternoon and later at night when the ferris wheel was all lit up. It was quite pretty and added to our Santa Monica experience. The vibe on the pier is laid back and fun.

It was neat to see the pier, kids would love it, but as a couple it was ok. Nice to see the ocean and view all the people. They have some shops and a great bar/dining place below the pier that is awesome! (Can't remember name right now).

...but worth a visit. The restaurants are a little expensive, as are the rides and it is usually quite crowded but it's a fun time if you go on some rides, eat and hang out on the beach a bit. The roads are very busy so one must have patience.

We came here after dinner in Marina Del Ray. Parking was $6 in the nearby lot. We strolled along the pier to check out all the attractions, vendors and restaurants. This is a great place for a family, friends or a couple. It was lovely all lit up at night. It also is a great place to people watch. It felt like we were at the local fairgrounds.

column2: See the beach and all its splender.
column3: The Pier is fun for the whole family. Its a place to take people who come and visit from other countries. On a clear day you can see the Palos Verdes Peninsula and Catalina. A must to see.

Go to a trailer park followed by a creepy arcade in Florida instead. I'm half kidding. I guess there's some kitschy flair but I wouldn't consider it anything other than a waste of time. I know - what a snob ;)
Nice stop off the board walk but it's not a destination I'd seek out! It's $8 per ride on Ferris wheel or roller coaster. We didn't eat there -- food didn't look good or healthful.
Good to see, nice stroll, interesting to watch a film crew filming a part of a movie down below, nothing spectacular but worth a visit if you are in the area
Short morning visit to the pier, beautiful day. Had a ride on the roller coaster which gave a great view over the beach.Mainly went for the view and to get some photos. Worth the visit if in the area

We met a young homeless girl there. Very sad situation, she was going to jail the next week. She had on someone else's clothes, five sizes too big. Her name was Jessica. She was someone's daughter, someone's sister, someone's friend, maybe someone's mother. Please don't act like she is invisible!!!! We sat and and bought lunch for her. Don't just stare!!! Please don't notice the amusement parks, the beach, the boardwalk, But notice your fellow human beings.
Just a famous pier with tonnes of people, the iconic rollcoaster, restaurants and people selling stuff.

We had a great time at the pier. They have a smaller amusement park with various rides, ferris wheel and a roller coaster plus games. The ride passes were reasonable and the line ups to get on the rides were no more than about 10 minutes.
Such a lovely view. Went on the Ferris wheel ride and merry go round! Fun and busy place! There are amusement arcades, places to eat and drink, and gift shops!

Although it was very windy and cold when I went I enjoyed a nice walk at the pier. There's plenty to see but I especially went there to see a beautiful sunset. It's just the perfect place to go see one. To bad I was cold because I would have loved to go on the ferris wheel or roller coaster. If you're hungry there's little food shacks that you can choose from. Everytime I visit Santa Monica I just stay long enough to see the sunsets!

column2: Get Your Kicks at the End of Route 66!
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a great place to spend some time with family or friends. I've been here twice. Once with family and friends and more recently on my own. There are shops, restaurants and for the young and young-at-heart, there is Pacific Park with a roller coaster, Ferris Wheel and lots of other fun rides. Movie buffs will remember that Forrest Gump ran all the way to the end of the pier and then ran back to the East Coast again. Of course there is a sign calling attention to the fact that old Route 66 ended at the Santa Monica pier (which everyone likes to have their photo taken with). And if just remembering that Forrest Gump ran to the end of the pier is not enough for you, you can eat at the Bubba Gump shrimp company restaurant or just buy a souvenir at their gift shop! And as Forrest so famously remarked, "And that's all I have to say about that."

The pier has games to play, a few rides to enjoy and delicious food!We had the japadog stand and it was so delicious! It's a Japanese hotdog and the flavours are out of this world.It's a cute date night idea if you don't want to spend a lot of money but are looking to get out and do something.The water itself is actually really clean. While it was a bit too cold to go swimming while we were there in December, we put our feet in.
if you go to LA you have to go to Santa Monica Pier. We had a great few hours there. Strolling down the pier and beach. Food and drink available

column2: Stunning from the beach at night
column3: Come down to the beach at night and watch the lights on the ferris wheel, it is just beautiful. Also fun to ride at night!

The pier and the adjacent playground did not offer me anything unique or new. However, there were four things that seemed appealing: 1) the Sunday exhibition of the veteran peace makers next to the pier on the beach. It is very informative and it gives an inside-out picture of war against terror from the American people's perspective. 2) trampoline and bouncing experience with training 3) getting your name written on rice grain by the Latino artists 4) buying an unbelievably realistic finger and brush painting on mirror and glass (don't hesitate buying your Santa Monica Pier souvenir there from the Latino painters starting from USD 5.

My husband and I were in the area and stopped by on the way to see family--what a neat attraction! We were surprised that parking was available on the pier. There are lots of little restaurants and shops, in addition to the affordable amusement park area. Great place to take photos and selfies.
I visited Santa Monica Pier @ November 2014,Nice place to walk on sandenjoy nature Viewsmany restaurants therealso for bike loversPaid parking close to beach
Walked around on a pleasant day, arcades, amusement park, live music. Plenty to see and do. Lots of touristy shopping but the view is amazing.

We were here for the afternoon and went to the aquarium, Bubba Gump for lunch, rode the carousel, and walked under the pier. The amusement park was too expensive for us but it was a nice time out in the sun.
Free to visit and lots to do and places to eat. Amazing sunset pictures and great picture opportunities of the coastline. Lots of history and of course the end of the line for Route 66

column2: It is wonderful place for people watching
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is one of the better places for people watching in Santa Monica. Several restaurants, gift shops and a amusing park. Love just watching the people on the pier.

column2: Not sure what the big deal is!
column3: This was our first trip to Santa Monica. Based on recent reviews and hearing about this place from others we decided to stop by. Not sure what the big deal is. First of all you have to pay $8 to park. Then the pier was so crowded we walked half way up and back then left. No need to go back here.

Great venue for families. Rides that offer unlimited rides possibilities or a single ride. Artists that watercolor your name and portrait. Photo opportunities with many views. The Route 66 ends here sign was one huge attraction.

This was a nice attraction. Although I had already been here, it is nice to come back to, especially to see the sunset from the pier. The rides are fun and there is plenty to see, do, and eat right on the pier. Do note: towards the afternoon and near sunset, the pier does get very crowded.
I was there for 1 weekend and it was awesome. Going in the big wheel at sunset is one of the most romantic things one can do. Truest worth it.
The pier was not amazing in any way but nice to walk out on. Our hotel was right across the street, so we came out at various times. Fun people watching.

We came in Dec and pretty early in the morning so the area was quite a ghost town.But we liked the quietness, just walking along the pier and the beach. It's a few minutes walk to nearby 3rd street promenade and Santa Monica place. It's definitely a nicer shopping experience on a weekday morning when there was no crowd. :)Tip though! Don't park at the beach. Parking is free for the first 90 minutes at the parking structures 1-6 for 3rd street promenade. Park there and walk to the pier!

The vibe was feel good all over the place. The carnival was a good place to start. If you're not a fan of the rides, taking pictures against the backdrop will do. I love that there are several acts performing along the pier. Musicians, singers, magicians... The musicians have actual cds you can buy.It's a good way to spend the weekend with kids or just hang out with friends.

A lovely place to stroll along and soak up the atmosphere. Some quaint shops and interesting places to browse. The most fantastic place to enjoy the amazing sunsets. Enjoyed strolling around the ambient carnival and even had to have a go on the roller coaster.

column2: A clich√© - and a good one!
column3: I am a sucker for hotdogs, beer and carnival rides, so it is hard to give an unbiased review! Just a fun place to be and soak up the atmosphere. Well worth a visit. Walk to the end of the pier for great views of the pier activity, ocean and Venice Beach.
Neat to see an old style California attraction but was too touristy for us. Recommend go to end of pier climb up to enjoy view, then leave and eat elsewhere.

The Santa Monica Pier is a must do.It cost nothing to walk out on the pier, but you must find a place to park, which might cost a few bucks.There are many things to do and see. Talented street performers are everywhere.It is a great place to catch the sunset.

Parking is reasonable and convenient. The pier has several rides for kids, which my 3 year old enjoyed alot. I would recommend watching each ride first, a couple were more aggressive than they looked as they were stopped. Free entrance into the park. Rides are between $4-$8 or you can buy an unlimited ride pass for $16-$26. Several restaurants and shops along the pier. Nice views of the ocean and the beach is easy access. Beach is huge and seemed clean. Water was too cold at the time to go in. L.A. water is best in summer and Fall for temperature.

We were staying Hollywood and wanted to visit here.The tours of homes often make a stop here as well. We just wanted to visit the pier and dip our feet in the ocean.We chose public transportation (bus) and it worked great...only one transfer.This area is beautiful!We did not ride any rides but enjoyed the carnival like atmosphere.The beach was perfect!Of course the water was cold this time of year but we had fun wading for a bit.Would not hesitate to come back again!

column2: Stopped for a few hours while passing through
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is pretty cute. It's family friendly or great for solo travelers like myself. There are a few public parking ramps nearby. I was pretty surprised when I found that the parking ramp only cost $1.00 (which I think was for the first hour or two) and even after the first few hours the prices were incredibly reasonable.The pier is filled with shops, rides (roller coaster, ferris wheel, etc. ) and plenty of food choices. There are several street performers, mostly playing music and/or singing. There are a ton of restaurants all within waling distance of the pier as well as coffee shops and some shopping.There were public restrooms just before entering the pier, although they were not super clean, they worked. I think you can purchase day passes for the rides on the pier (around $25) or you pay around $8 per ride. The ferris wheel is 9 stories high and runs completely on solar power. There are nice views from the ferris wheel.All in all, a good stop if you have time to kill or the family wants some entertainment.
Just a nice place you must do if you are nearby. It's a nice pier with a lot of amusements and restaurants. Worth spending a hour.

column2: I guess it's okay if that's your sort of thing
column3: Went between Christmas and New Year's and it was packed!!!!! with tourists. Typically cheesy, overpriced boardwalk-type stuff. But worth it just to see the sign where Route 66 ends. The beach is nice.
A good place to visit with family and friends. People enjoying a walk along the pier, waiting and watching sunset.

A definite tourist trap...but a check the box attraction when in LA. Great people watching and a nice view as well. Worst an hour or two. You can also visit the 3rd street promenade which is also fun ! Make sur to walk up the stairs and get an overall view fron the second floor of the building at the end of the pier. See my picture....

On pier parking. Excellent! Enjoy the people watching and the great little shops, food and coffee carts, and restaurants. Great ocean and beach views and some street performances create a nice family experience. Great place to spend a day without spending much money.

This has a carnival setting. Lots of street performers lining the pier, which made it fun and entertaining. Plenty of places to eat, like Bubba Gump's, which was a good place to go. If you go early in the morning, not much is open and there are lots of street people, but that could be said for anywhere in Santa Monica in the morning.

column2: A great walk with lots to see
column3: We spent 1-2 hours walking down the pier. We saw a fantastic magician, looked out on the beautiful ocean, and our kids rode the merry-go-round. Very cute. A nice experience. Highly recommend if you have a few hours to spend.
It was nice and pretty but nothing fantastically special. Nice place to stop for some food but not to spend loads of time.

We have been to LA a few times, but never walked to the end of Santa Monica Pier. Its a lovely walk, buskers all along the way of all kinds of music, a variety of fast food places and rides for people. We just walked to the end and back and really enjoyed it. Early morning walk is less crowded.
Excellent food, great shopping, but mostly great people and activity watching! Been going to Santa Monica for years, and always spend a few hours enjoying the atmosphere of the Pier.

column2: Fun but really for young kids
column3: Gorgeous views and something to see but no rides for adults. Street musicians great people watching and eateries a definite must see!

column2: Had a few days in LA
column3: If in LA this should be on your list. The aera is nice, clean and beautiful. Has something for everyone. Shopping at 3rd st. Promenade is only blocks away. Great beach and picture taking opportunities. I recommend not driving get the metro card and take advantage of LA great metro train and bus
Forget about all the touristy stuff going on along the pier. Just take in the views of the Pacific Ocean and coastline from Santa Monica to Pacific Palisades.

Santa Monica Pier is a must see if you are in SM. There are plenty of car spaces available close by, the pier has an aquarium, small theme park, carousel, restaurants, buskers, novelty shops and amazing coastline views. It is free to walk along the pier, we also took a ride on the ferris wheel ($8 each). They allow you to take your camera on the ride so you can get some great shots from the top. So many talented buskers along the pier as well, worth stopping by to admire their talent.

column2: Must go to tick the box...
column3: Worth a visit. For the pier itself you can count on an hour and a half. There's parking right by the pier for 8 Usd or you can use others parking lots close by for a higher price but closer to the walking areas.View is nice, you can see lots of different people visiting, there are coffee, restaurants and souvenir shops. There is a mini theme park but the rides are not ready worth it. Its mostly for younger kids to enjoy. All overpriced but considering the location it is as expected.Moving away from the Pier you can take the beach walkway that will take you all the way to Venice beach.In the start of that path you can see a lot of people practicing all kinds of exercises which is quite interesting to watch. Its a combination of gymnastics by using bars and handles and doing some really interesting routines...

The Santa Monica pier is one of those places you want to see particularly if you have seen the film Big. It's nice and it's fun but small and the movie makes it to be far bigger than it is. Not a lot to do some street vendors and performers we had lunch at bubba gumps. Very touristy thing to do.

My family and I never get tired of this place. It's always a good idea to watch the sun go down and people watch here. There's almost always a singer or musician at the end of the pier. Yesterday was a violinist playing the Titanic song. We park in the parking structure off Colorado before 2nd Street and walk straight onto the pier. It's cheaper than the parking lot at the beach.

I had a great first experience here. It's very clean, there are amusement park rides, places to eat and shop. We just walked around to sight see. We even saw a celebrity walking around there. You never know who you might see. The only negatives I noticed were all the homeless people.

Our family loved Santa Monica walking the Pier and beach and eating at The Albright which is pricey but super quality food which everyone loved!! Place was clean and trendy and very very good. Eat here. Visiting Pier and beaches in late December so dress in layers although it was an amazing sunny day.
This is one of the most famous spots in America and I would say the real US melting pot where all come together, regardless. Great place to come and see all living in peace.
First time to visit the place and all I can say is that the place is relaxing. One can also indulge in having a food trip while walking or dip in the beach just a few meters down the pier.

Santa Monica Pier is a must if you're visiting LA. We came in late November and walked from Venice Beach to the pier (which took about an hour) and watched the sunset. Bring something warm to wear if you're here this time of year. The Pier has many shops, great restaurants and rides for thrill seekers.
Loved the pier was on holiday with my 8 friends. Weather was beautiful so we had a wonder round and went on the big wheel, followed by going to bubba gump

column2: Just like the good old days
column3: Good, clean family fun, just like fairs and fun parks used to be before technology took over. A gorgeous walk along the pier with plenty to see including albatross, seals and fish. The rides are old and cranky but fun nonetheless. Beware of pick pockets!
Okay for one visit stalls for retail not great food is mainly fish not much choice but I went seen it had a good day couldn't go everyday if I was on beach holiday Venice beach lot better
We made a run over to Sant Monica from Vegas for the day. The pier is a must see attraction. we enjoyed the walk out to the end, heard some good street music and loved the ocean.
It is nice place especially due to near the Pacific OceanI saw firstly an oceanAnd beach is very long, I want to be here in summer holiday :)
Not much here other than rides and rubbish food. It does have bubba gump shrimp co which was funny. Not impressed better stuff to see

The Pacific against the backdrop of the mountain and curve of the shoreline just opens your heart but try to ignore the signs about all of the contaminated fish that you can catch but cannot eat. And look out to sea away from the cras human mess of tacky joints nearby. I expected better from a major LA landmark.

So happy places exist like this. Carnival rides, games, fishing dock, novelty shops! Just nice family fun. We even attempted to win a prize or two. Whac a mole is still the best game. Be sure to ride the iconic Ferris wheel. Expected better local food selections, mostly chain food like Taco Bell and bubba gump's were on the Pier.

Although not the original end point of Route 66, it is a special place no less. And there are a number of Route 66 gift shops on the pier. Talk to the guy in the Route 66 booth midway along the pier - he is full of great travel stories and a great range of Route 66 gifts - even a completion certificate.
The breeze was cooling at night. It was extremely colorful and lively with many street games. For those coming to LA, please do visit this awesome place.
Super fun vibes on Santa Monica, lots of homeless beggers which is a shame because it's an awesome place, just not ideal when people keep asking for money!

column2: Touristy but still a must walk if you have not been there
column3: It is very touristy and better looking from afar but still a nice walk through and people watching; wouldn't eat or buy anything there ...

column2: Beautiful Beach With Nice Views Of Homes
column3: I liked seeing the homes along the coast. The Pier was clean, safe and fun although limited with number of shops, etc. It would be a great place to just sit and relax while watching the Pacific. I liked it.

Great amusement park on the pier. Rides a little pricey, but it's the experience. Nice walk down the pier, a few places to eat. West end of Route 66 too.Nice beach area too.Recommend to spend at least 2-3 hours ( shorter if not going on rides). But worth the stop.

Spent day at Santa Monica and enjoyed both the pier and the beach very much. The pier is free to access and has many attractions such as a Ferris wheel. There were also buskers adding to the festive atmosphere. Food and drink expensive but you could take your own picnic.

We visited Santa Monica Pier during a group tour. Wish we had more time here. Amazing scenery from the beaches to Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. Everything was super cool. Lots of places to eat, lots of things to do.

column2: A Fun Wlak - Must-do Sunset Experience
column3: An amusement park is an amusement park wherever you go, but, if in Santa Monica, this is a must-do activity. Very clean, very family-friendly and not at all seedy, it is especially neat at sunset, offering many wonderful photo ops from the pier itself as well as looking back at the pier from street path above.

column2: Must be in your to do list
column3: You can't go to LA and not visit the Santa Monica pier. But I have to admit it's a lot smaller than I expected. If you're not into fairs and stuff, it's a max 30 minute walk around and you're done. But I suggest you look around, take in the breathtaking panoramas of the coast, get your compulsory selfies with the Ferris wheel, and visit one of the restaurants or cafes. I went to Bubba Gumbas for a beer and prawns. I didn't do the aquarium because I'm planning to come back and take the family, who'll be a lot more into all this than I am. It's a must-do as a tourist, but don't expect too much of it.A good tip: it's close to the airport. You could do it on your way to or from the airport. I went on my last afternoon before I had to fly home later that evening.
We returned to the pier for a repeat visit. It allows for good views back to Santa Monica, but had nothing rally further to offer (probably more child orientated).

column2: Always fun and something to see
column3: Nice place to visit during the day or evening. Plenty of parking and 3er street promenade is close by. There is a rollercoaster $8 on the pier. Restaurants, shops and arcade games.

Our recent visit to the pier was so much more than we expected. Walking distance from downtown to pier. Be aware steep hill to climb down or up. Lots of great places to eat fresh seafood and other things. Vendors play music of different genre as you walk. Plan you trip to end at sunset at the end of the pier, well worth the wait. Beautiful. We went on a weekday night so it was not crowded. A really fun place to visit and some great photo opportunities.
The Santa Monica Pier is a great place to sit and watch the sea, the scenery, and the world go by. Great eats.

It's a major fair! There were a lot of rides and games. We only did the games as my partner hates rides. We enjoyed the view of the ocean too. A lot of souvenirs can be bought at the place as well. You have to make reservations probably 1-2 hours before sunset at the restaurants so you get the best seat and view. Careful though with your stuff. There's a police precinct but not much police visibility.
I played a game called GTA, it looks the same! Beautiful, and i even saw a dolphin near the dock where people were fishing. They even have mini roller coaster.

column2: Fun way to spend a couple of hours
column3: Beautiful view, fun atmosphere. You can watch Pelicans dive for food, buy art from vendors, listen to people sing, eat, go on rides, spend a little money, a lot of money, or nothing at all.

Came here in November 2014. The weather was surprisingly warm and we managed to come at a great time when there was barely a crowd. Very family friendly and plenty of places to eat. Not a huge place, but rather a cute pier where you can spend the day and enjoy a couple rides and the beautiful beach.

I think all visitors must visit this place at least once. But it has a romantic feel to it... It's a nice place to return for a quick meal or merely a funnel cake while enjoying sunset or watch tourists go by or just enjoy the singing of the baskers.If you are lucky, you might catch a glimpse of a sea lion in the waves.

column2: Scratch one thing off my bucket list
column3: I am a big fan of Route 66 and I have always wanted to visit the Santa Monica pier because that wad the western end of Route 66, the Mother Road. I loved the large sign designating the end of Route 66 and found it to be a beautiful place. It was enjoyable just to walk around & visit the shops. I also was impressed with the quality of street musicians on the pier. I listened to 3 and they were all very impressive.

This is a fun, but not very large amusement park. Views of the ocean and city are great, but ride passes can be pricey since you pay for each attraction, and parking isn't cheap, either. Worse case scenario, you'll pay $25 for a multiride package per person and $10-$15 to park and walk at least a quarter-mile on the beach to the pier. I loved the place and had fun, it was just more expensive than I expected.
Classic icon known world wide! Always expect to see foreigners and tourist groups here. The pier has enough entertainment to easily last a full day. Don't forget to watch the sunset from the pier!

column2: Been around for a while, but still great
column3: This one has been around for a while but it still has the magic. Wth the beach right there and all the rides, food available on the pier and all the pretty girls this place is heaven on earth. I didn't try any of the restaurants on the pier because there are some absolutely wonderful places to eat on the other side of the street. This is a great place to relax and spend the day, and I highly recommend you catch one of the bonfires on the beach after it gets dark.

The Santa Monica Pier is one of the few if not only oldstyle piers left in California. A few decades ago the pier was going to be torn down and the citizens of Santa Monica thankfully stopped it. The pier still has an old fashioned fun zone with skeetball and cotton candy. Also has a ferris wheel, roller coaster and rides for kids along with the usual pier food. No fancy restaurants unless you consider Bubba Gumps fancy. You should visit if you're at the beach. Very busy in the summer.
This little boardwalk brings excitement to your day. It boasts amazing views of Santa Monica from the pier, as well as amazing views of the Sunset.

I wouldn't call this the most fascinating place in Santa Monica. It's fun to visit maybe once or twice. Mainly just gift shops and a few rides, and a couple of restaurants. Good thing is it's right by the beach so you can visit both at the same time.

column2: Over crowded and not sure what the fuss is about
column3: The lines are very long for anything. The boardwalk is partially outdated and needs to be replaced. There are too many people that is is uncomfortable. Don't waste your time.

I took my friends here to check out the fun things the pier bendirs have to offer. Although the parking is not the greatest, once you get on the pier, the sound of waves and seagulls calm the nerves and melts the stress. There are many street enrertainers on the pier and we felt safe at all times. We did not get on any of the rides, but we did eat. The food was like any other carnival like places including the prices. This is a great place to get away for a while even if just for a day.

column2: After a paddle in the pacific a walk on the pier
column3: Always wanted to paddle in the pacific, then we walked along the beach to the pier and walked down the old wooden pier. It was lovely. We then had a meal in Gumps on their which was great.

This place has beautiful scenery from the streets of palm trees down to the beach and the pier. Its got loads of restaurants on the ocean avenue strip and the pier is full of laughter, fun activities, shops and musicians. A violinist was playing 'my heart will go on' - celine dion and it was beautiful. So pop down and you might see him!

column2: Looks nice, but one visit is enough
column3: This iconic area is a bit of a let down. There are a couple of restaurants and an out dated theme park area. There is little shade and nothing to actually do if you are wandering. From the beach however it looks interesting and is great for photos.

We knew it would be quiet in the winter, so we weren't disappointed that there was no 'hustle and bustle'.We thought the views back toward Santa Monica were great. The historic Carousel, games arcade, restaurants (especially Bubba Gump), ferris wheel and information on the pier's history and lookout at the end of the pier were great.Worth a visit any time in our view.

column2: Must Do Tourist Spot End of Route 66??
column3: We decided to take Big Blue Bus #12 from hotel in Westwood for $1 to see pier & beach. Must say it's pretty in pictures and overhyped; however, I'll always have good memories of having been there. It was worth it. Yes there are beggars & handlers, but that's all tourist spots. We just went with clothes on our backs. I just thought it was bigger based on pictures/TV, so you can easily see it all in under 2 hours. We didn't ride the rides as I'm currently unable. Learned pier is supposedly the official end of Route 66. Nice since that's the only part I've been on! Restrooms were big disappointment as they looked like they had not been cleaned in months.

column2: Fun place with a good atmosphere
column3: We took our 13-year-old twin boys here. Being from the Jersey shore the boardwalk/Pier had very little to offer in the way of games and rides.It was a nice walk with convenient parking. They were vendors and musicians along the pier. Most of these people are very talented. Pier also offers fishing. We were lucky enough to see a seal floating in the water. It appeared to be looking at all the people that were looking down at it. LOL
Personally I didn't see a great deal to attract people here , reminded me a bit of Blackpool !! Only warmer and without the rain , lol, still nice to stroll along though , felt safe enough too ,
Love this place! Clean and fun. Great access to the beach, could have sat there all day and watched the waves.

column2: It wasn't what I had expected
column3: I guess when you have constant images shown to you on tv it can sometimes be disappointing. It was way too busy and crowded which made it so hard to move and see things. There were so many people begging for money and food which was sad. It was more enjoyable to see it from a distance at night with all the beautiful lights...gave it a slight romantic look!

column2: A nice stroll by the Beach
column3: This is a nice pier. It has tons of stuff to do for everyone. The mini amusement park is great for families. It's good for couple who wants a nice stroll by the beach. There is also and area dedicated for fishing.

column2: Kinda Dirty Tourist Trap That for Whatever Reason You Feel Obligated to Visit
column3: Maybe the best way to experience this pier is to view it from afar, while chilling on the beach, soaking up the warm rays. The food is what you would expect from a tourist trap, the rides expensive, and each inch regulated to someone trying to sell you something. If you can push through all of this you can get right to the end where you can take in the ocean. But then again you can do this on the beach as well.

I don't know why people would give this such a bad rating. Ok, you may see a couple of hobos, but they won't hurt you. In fact my friend and I laugh when we see hobos doing funny things, they don't harm. The rides are fun, with nice restaurants. Ocean views, rides, food, and just a good place to hang out with performers and arcade. Great place. Don't listen to the bad reviews.

column2: Perfect amusement park for our family
column3: It's small enough that you don't spend a whole day, or a whole pay check. The people are nice and it's in the center of everything so there is lots to do in the surrounding area!

if you are in Santa Monica this is a must. a stroll down the pier through the carnival getting a fake tattoo or eating some peanuts. watch the fishermen and the other "ecentrics" and enjoy people watching while waiting for the sunset.

column2: Stop over from LA to SF
column3: We passed by Santa Monica Pier from LA to SF.. The night view is nice and we enjoy the cold breeze while walking there.....
A bit dated and cheesy but we went on the big wheel at sunset and it looked beautiful. Went to watch the buskers at the end of the pier afterwards which was nice.

column2: Love this place for sunset on the pier
column3: I feel alive walking the boardwalk of Santa Monica Pier area, watching the weird and the wonderful people with everything from wacky bikes to interesting characters on the monkey bars practicing their tricks on the rings. The surfers surf, the dog walkers mix with the skateboarders and it just reeks of life being lived. People chilling, doing what they do. I usually offer to do a photo or two and meet some nice people. The pier is good for a stroll and there's the usual tourist tat to buy, but some of it is fun, the singers on the pier are brilliant to listen to, and my favourite is being there for the sun setting at the end of the pier. Magical. You can see that people have fun in the Fayre ground too, not my cup of tea really but it's great to see people carrying round massive teddy bears they have won on the games in the Fayre. Always a great afternoon when we go.

column2: Its all about the day you pick.
column3: I am just saying it right away, I loooove this tourist spot. It is still nice to visit from time to time even if you live in LA. I would take a stroll on the pier anytime, good weather or bad weather (LA bad, no rain, tempertures above 60 etc etc). Parking and crowds is the issue, stay away on high season saturdays and sundays, and also holidays. Parking is not a problem out of season, just use the lot next to the pier, it is quite affordable out of season too. Enjoy and take pictures, enjoy the sunset if you can, make time to walk on the bike path a little bit to, its really nice!

The Santa Monica pier is pretty much what you'd expect, it's what you see on the movies tv shows etc. it's made and run for tourists from bubba gump shrimp to souvenirs to the iconic Ferris wheel everything is there.. It's not something to spend a whole day at you can be in and out within an hour or soo and seen and done everything there is to do there

There's two crowds today crowd and then the evening crowd the evening crowd is a little more fun sometimes they have concerts in the summer on Wednesdays but it's a good family place to go if you especially if you want to bring your kids and ride some carnival rides
This is spectacular. The pier is simply incredible...there is an unbelievable view, just like the movies. Fantastic!

Went here on my own and walked down the board walk to venice beach, must do it if you are in the area however avoid at night time due to lots of homeless and its pretty scary.Would go back if I was in the area again.

column2: Nice way to spend an afternoon
column3: I really enjoyed walking out on the pier. It's extremely relaxing and there are shops and restaurants on the pier, as well as amusement rides.
Very nice oppertunity to pass 2 hours near the sea. There are nice resturant near by. The sea shore is greate for running or cycling.

We timed our visit here to coincide with the sunset and were not disappointed! There is stadium type seating at the end of the pier where you can lounge comfortably while you wait for the sunset. There are also many rides, shops and restaurants on the pier.

column2: You have to visit this place
column3: While you are closer to Santa monica of course visit the pier and breath deep i loved it with surfers and buy some gifts drink some on the pier
Even though I have lived for a few years in San Diego, I had never been to the Santa Monica pier. It was interesting but will definitely not go back.

We were coastal cruising the west & stopped in Santa Monica. It was pretty chilly outside (being from the south anything below 60 is cold) so that was slightly uncomfortable. The pier itself was cool though! I didn't ride any of the attractions, I just walked around and checked out the different views & kiosks set up. The views are gorgeous out there. It's an iconic stop that should definitely be made by anyone passing through!
Visited the pier from the Hop on Hop off bus tour. A must see, plenty of food avail and fantastic beaches.
No doubt about it, The Pier is looking a little tired but for some family fun and glorious night time views, this is a nice place for an evening stroll.

It is a very nostalgic place to go. Funner when the kids were younger. It can get crowded so I try to go on Thursdays and Fridays and avoid the weekend. Love eating at Bubba Gumps even though the food is average. The view from the pier is amazing and the beach is the best in the USA.

I stopped briefly at Santa Monica Pier as I was about to start a roadtrip. The pier is clean and there's a lot of live local artist that sing and do small performances. There's a few places to eat and as you look back towards the street, you see the mountains neighboring the ocean and it's truly beautiful. It's just a simple pier, but the atmosphere feels very nice. The parking was $6.00, and if I were to suggest something, I'd say to park here and rent a bike to take to Venice Beach to have ease of parking and a quick adventure. Would stop here again.

The pier itself is ok just like any other pier with rides, fairy floss and carnival games. The kids will love it. Your wallet won't. Lots of buskers singing and making ballon animals. Ocean views are nice. Venice beach about 15 minutes up the beach. Again famous for its name. The pier is Good for an hour walk around. Head up to Santa Monica itself now that's worth the trip.

column2: "FUN TIME FOR ALL" Santa Monica and the Santa Monica Pier.
column3: Santa Monica is definitely a spot to be saved on your "Bucket List" of things to do on your travels along the Pacific Coast. About 20 miles from downtown Los Angeles, Santa Monica is just like you've traveled to a beautiful far off resort somewhere on an exotic, tropical island. Yes, it's kind-of touristy but that's just what a far off island would be like, take Oahu, which is a good example. Santa Monica is a "laid-back" trendy beach town with loads of shopping on the 3rd street Promenade as well as the "Santa Monica Place" which is an outdoor sunny shopping Mall. Nice classy stores to shop in and "browse" around in. It also has several fine eating establishments on the second level where the restaurants not only vary in price but you have a wide array of food to choose from. Ahhhh yes, what a way to spend a sunny lazy afternoon with so much shopping to do!The Santa Monica Pier, which is just a short jaunt from the "Santa Monica Place" and the "Third Street Promenade" it shares a panoramic view of the Pacific Ocean where one can choose from an assortment of restauants that reside on the pier. And If you are a connoisseur of seafood, BUBBA GUMPS' SHRIMP COMPANY has the best seafood gumbal that "SHAKES RATTLES and ROLLS" to the sounds of the crashing waves along the sand. Also on the pier is "Ocean Park" an amusement park for the kids and "ADULT-KIDS". Carneval types of games as well as rides that are fun for those who likes a little "exhilaration" high above the pacific ocean! Those that are less enthusiastic over the "Scary Rides" will like the slower pace of a beautiful restored carousel.Yes... you must visit Santa Monica if you come to California and for those who live in California who haven't been to Santa Monica for a while, Santa Monica has changed a lot and you need to re-visit it as well!
Before entering LA from the North, stop off here for a fun filled few hours. Beautiful beach, plenty of places to eat

I'm not one to do lots of "touristy" things when I travel, but this was really fun. Although crowded, there are great views AND lots of Route 66 stuff (it ends nearby). Beaches on either side also have a paved path for walking, and it's just a few blocks into Santa Monica. Well worth an hour or two. Parking next door, but not cheap.
For me, coming to LA means going to the Santa Monica Pier. Beautiful beach, beautiful day, great way to take in the sights!
It is part of Santa Monica's scenery so it is worth it to visit once. But in the end it is only a wheel, no need to come several times, it's enough to have it around on pictures

Loved it. Very traditional old pier steeped with history. It has an old rollercoaster and ferris wheel, that lights up the skyline at night. Old wooden pier (the beams do not show the water below. I know some people are afraid of that) with amusements and a restaurant/bar at the end. We spent a couple of hours here which was enough but could easily have stayed longer. It's free to go on the pier.It has a lovely indoor carousel at the entrance. I found a Zoltar machine (from the movie "big"). Bubba Gump Shrimp clothing is here too. This pier is the end of the line for route 66.

very underwhelmed at this experience. all the standard stuff, over priced poor rides, ferry wheel and slots. if you want to say you've done it go ahead but don't get too excited. Zoltar machines and Bubba Gump shop hint at enough memory of Tom Hanks but apart from that, save yourself a walk

column2: Come at night to see the led ferries wheel
column3: For a change of scenery, come at night to beat the day crowd. The pier lights up and the pace slows to a more relaxing atmosphere.

column2: Good place to visit and see the sea
column3: The pier is nice,modern yet homely,not good for wheelchairs,they have a fantastic and oldest Merry-go-round that is worth looking. The sea is great here.
A Must when visiting the LA area! You will recognize the famous pier and ferris wheel that is featured on many TV/Movies. Carnival atmorsphere

column2: Perfect for a relaxing walk after lunch or dinner
column3: Just walk all the way down the pier, listen to musicians, enjoy the ocean and beach view. Perfect for a stroll after a nice meal on ocean ave.

I was there during a week-end in LA and this was the best part of the trip! The beach is huge, the sand is soft and "gold" and the ocean is amazing even though you can find some seaweeds. Furthermore there's a bridge just on the ocean and some rollercoasters and bars.

Spectacular view of Pacific sunsets. There are rides on the pier for kids. Drawbacks are that it is very touristy and homeless people everywhere. If you're in the area I suppose it's a must see, but I'm certain there are more serene beach locations.
Amazing atmosphere, fun for all ages, music, food, walks along to see the beautiful view, nice weather, close to many other things.
After the sun goes down the place looks magical, pretty windy and cold an November evening but still amazing...

I was in Santa Monica on business and took time to visit the pier for an evening meal and a beer. It's quite atmospheric and reaches out into the sea, so has a lot of different attractions, not least the very talented buskers who pitch up regularly. We had dinner and a beer which were God value for us hard pressed Euro currency travelers. Well worth a visit

It has a kind of charm attached to it that can be experienced only when you visit the place. The crowd is beautiful. Lots of places to eat sit and unwind. Infact during my stay of 2 days on LA, this was one of the places I loved the most.

We had been on the beach in afternoon the best. Is clean there is s huge cycling track to the pier the rides on pier are Asif Shaikh 9979871910 great & thrilling the sun set is a must watch if you are on the pier.
had so much fun here, felt like i was in the movies. it was great to see and be apart of the festivities.
Start of our Route 66 road trip, yes we started at the End, but a must stop. Colourful and bustling with a pleasant atmosphere.

I was cruising around Santa Monica and came accidentally down to this area. It was early sunday morning and there was police just going to close the pier. They said someone made a big mess there during saturday and they had to close it for cleaning. They kindly let us walk to the end of it and then quickly back. I didn't see anything unordinary though but have to be thankful for the kind policemen.Apart from that unfortunate thing, this place has nice ocean view. I would definately go back there next time I'm in the area.

Me and my cousin and our family went for a short one hour trip to the pier, it was crowded, (it was close to Thanksgiving, so we knew it would be packed) the rides are nice, wish some of them were longer, the shopping was great, and we had a great time.

column2: It's a Pier! Go on a Weekday. Avoid Holiday Weekends.
column3: Been before and it's a lovely place to visit. We travelled from Minneapolis to visit family for Thanksgiving and stopped in at the Pier. It was very packed. Our daughter and her cousin were able to ride the coaster without an exhausting wait, so that was good. We've been several other times, but Saturday after Thanksgiving...not a great idea. However, stthad fun for the hour we could handle the crowd.

Something for everyone; Beach swimming, amusement rides, music and restaurants. The really young ones will love the beach and the teenagers will dig the amusement park. Music performers line the port and there are many restaurants to choose from. Worth a long afternoon visit.

I've never been to the pier and I am now kicking myself for not coming sooner. Parking was simple, right on the pier $10 for the whole day. The beach was easily accessible with a great walkway if you don't want sand in your shoes. The pier itself has a nice little amusement park that can be done in a few hours and if you subscribe for coupons not too expensive. The food was normal stuff but pricey. The entertainment was interesting. The view at the end of the pier was worth the cold breeze. It was picture perfect. Great place to not spend a lot of money.
Very fun! An evening well spent! Rides and some fun games. Had a great time walking around with my cup of coffee.

Since we live in the Midwest, far from the ocean, any chance to walk on the beach is enjoyed! Lots of little shops with touristy items , a small amusement park & a few restaurants are all on the wharf. It was cool and windy the day we were there, so not as pleasant as I am sure some days are. The Route 66 end at the end of the pier was a fun piece of trivia!

This pier is worth walking to the end of as everyone gathers there to watch the beautiful sunsets. People fish and we also saw seals as well. Lots to do on this pier including rides. Stay until dark as the Ferris wheel lights up with such pretty colours and patterns and is worth staying for. Lovely food as well at the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier.

The pier is a nice place to spend some time. There's a small amusement park and a few restaurants. Views of the Pacific are great. Unless you're dining there or doing the amusement park rides, it's probably an hour long visit, more or less.

column2: One of those places you need to see, just because it's there.
column3: I have so many great memories going to the Santa Monica Pier. As a teenager in the summertime, to the time I went with friends when I was 35 years old. the attraction for the crowd, the noise and of course the ocean air is something everyone has deep within them

Awesome! I haven't been on a ferris wheel in years!!! This was so worth it! I did this on my very first day within 2 hours of being here... I stayed at a hotel on the beach right next to the pier, so it was easily accessible!Just one of those things that I can scratch off my bucket list!I totally recommend checking out the pier!!If you don't have kids, there really isn't much to do... we went on the ferris wheel and then left
It's a fun little place to stop in. We didn't do any of the rides but we walked up and down, took some pictures and then left.Worth a visit!

This place is a place where things are happening. Everything seems to be here. Fishing, beach, pier, amusement park, aquarium, tons of first class shopping, bike rentals, and miles of walking paths along the coast. There are lots of homeless people there. This is a place that you can mingle with the most wealthy or the most poor. Whatever your looking for, this place has it.
its very touristy on the pier itself, but makes for some fantastic photos at night from the esplanade.

I'm glad I've been to Santa Monica Pier and can tick it off my "must see" list. There are lots of tourist shops and some really good musicians busking. Overall though it's a bit dirty and in need of some love.
This is one of my best spots when I visit LA, Love this pier compared to any other pier. So many activities to do. A day well spent
Lots to see. Excellent people watching. A great place to take your kids for an inexpensive hang out.

Santa Monica is filled with trend setters, entrepreneurs, tourists, and drifters... so quite a variety to be a part of or speculate upon.The ritzy vibe of Santa Monica Place is nice... then if you keep walking around, you can find the not so glamorous parts... Its all good, I always feel safe though.Anyways, the Pier is so cool, such a fun spot to check out. A+. Also, its been in numerous movies, so you just have to check it out to feel the vibes.

I grew up in Colorado, and the great California attractions seems like just something you see on tv.Well this is just like the movies and MORE!Attractions, concession stands, quirky gift shops, great restaurants and breathtaking pacific ocean views.I definitely recommend tourist to take the time to schedule the pier as one of their destinations. Worth all the traveling! Great California weather in late fall/ almost winter is the cherry on top!

Ever since I first visited LA back in 1990 this place has stuck in my mind. Always a pleasure to return and hang out. This year was no exception as my partner had never been here and it was a pleasure showing her around. We walked along between the Pier and Venice beach many a time day and night.Can't wait to return.
Great views of the ocean and surrounding areas. Visit at night also to view the pier lit up. Saw seals playing right off the pier where fishermen were fishing off the edge.
We think it was a bit expensive for the offer but the Pier was a nice place to spend the Sunday afternoon with the kids. The food options are so-so

This pier never ceases to amaze. Its vibrant and lively to be at. There was so much activity and the crowd was having a good time.The seagulls and pigeons are also part of the scenery along with the hometown artists who tend to provide free entertainment. The rides are good too and so is the small but entertaining game stall area.The beach is massive for someone from where I come and the water was pretty cold. My 2 year old had a brilliant time of it.Would recommend anyone who is visiting LA to come here. Tip to park in the lots near the Santa Monica Plc. There are 8. First 90 mins is free. The app store is also huge.
You can't not enjoy a stroll along the pier in Santa Monica with everything that's going on. It's a great place to people watch and take in the sounds of the eclectic buskers.
This needs some major work by the local government...as a traveler i was very disappointed at this landmark. as a family don't waste your time.
Perfect day to walk the pier. Lots of "street" entertainment. Fun just watching people. Have not dined at any of the restaurants on the pier.
The last time I had been to a pier was the one at pismo beach. But loved the santa monica one much better.

We are visiting family for Thanksgiving and flew in through LAX.We thought about visiting before getting here and happily confirm our plans once we got situated this first morning.TripAdvisor pointed us to to Pier's website, and from there we called and confirmed details about parking - abundant right there, off PCH, on the beach level... And also atop the pier, and about the rides at Pacific Park.We went and had lunch, and walked the length a couple times. The sky was cloudless and sunny and that made for a bit do a tan while we enjoyed seeing the beach, the water, and the seagulls and pigeons.Our daughter asked the artist to write her name in a grain of rice, and the artist did an amazing job of that, and she added a heart and 'Santa Monica Pier 2015' to it before hanging it on a bracelet... The artwork is amazing... And so small I needed a macro lens on the iPhone to see all its exquisite details.We also enjoyed some racing games at the arcade before departing to visit family.We recommend visiting the Santa Monica Pier to all, whether they appreciate it as the fun end of Route 66 or not!

It is like visiting an small amusement park by the beach. There is always something fro everyone. A nice cool looking shirt, a souvenir, ice cream, video games, rides, the view and of course you pick the company.

column2: Great area of fun and food
column3: This famous spot is a fun place to visit. There are lots of food vendors, cafes and restaurants, as well as shops and stall holders. It is an easy walk from the public bus, as well as the Hop on Hop off bus. The big wheel is very colourful at night, and the area lights up like a fairyland after dark.

column2: A very cool place to spend the day.
column3: This is a fun place and it is very close to the 3rd Street promenade. Combined the 2 make for a very fun time.

We loved everything about Santa Monica Pier and the beach is amazing. So much sand and so many things to look at. People doing work outs and tricks on the bars great to watch. The Pier was just so busy but exciting to be there. The rides are at a medium price, and plenty of places to eat. Well worth stopping in and having a look around.

column2: An icon, and priced like it
column3: First the great: This is the classic Santa Monica Pier - the western end of I-10 and icon of so many films. With a lighted amusement park (the Ferris wheel and carousel are especially famous) over the Pacific at night, this probably comes in second (after Monterey Beach Boardwalk) as the best amusement park location on the Pacific. It's a great stop on the 20km-long beach walkway, and besides the amusement park, sports restaurants, bars, fisher-people, vendor-people, surfers and sunbathers below and all manner of humanity strolling, watching, and enjoying life above.Now the not-so good. First: don't even think of trying to park here. Yes you can (or at least could: they may closing it down). But this might be the most expensive paring lot on the planet. Park 4-5 blocks away and walk. Second: everything else is very expensive too. That beer, the burger, the Bubba-Gump shrimp all come very dearly. Location, location, location.Now the balance: it's free to enter, look around, and take some pictures with your selfie-stick. Everyone else is. Do do it if you're in the area. It is an icon. Just be prepared to spend the equivalent of a mortgage payment (at least outside of California) if you want to make a day of it here with the family.

OK, it may be classed as a tourist trap, but I can never resist walking on this pier. There is always something interesting, whether it be locals, buskers, shops or just the view. There is a fun park for kids and plenty of basic food options. Near the end of the pier is a picture display with a little history of the pier. Don't forget to also walk underneath, equally as interesting from below.

Santa Monica Pier is definitely one of LA's most famous landmarks, it has become part of LA's tradition, more because of its cinematographic history than for its beauty itself. It is the end of Route 66 (it has its corresponding sign, for the perfect souvenir picture). It is also home of a Zoltan Fortune Teller arcade (based on the movie "Big" staring Tom Hanks) and hosts a "Bubba - Gump" with its own Forest Gump bench, chocolate box and shoes. In short is a nice place to walk around, remember some films, admire a "Bay's watch" like beach and take a look around Santa Monica's neighborhood, the Promenade is also highly recommendable. A perfect time to go is before sunset, so you will be able to see the pier at day, live a sunset over the sea and get to know the pier also at night.

column2: Just to say I was there
column3: The pier is just OK. I cannot see anything too spectacular about it but you cannot go to Hollywood and not go there as it is in so movies and literature. You do not need to spend too much time there but fit it in on the way to The Getty museum
Go by all means and there's an army of cleaners and people making sure the homeless are moved on, good for large groups!

Santa Monica pier is great, full of weird and wonderful people. Arcades are good for all ages. We didn't try the fair rides as seemed quite expensive.Good amount of fast food/restaurants although expensive.

column2: Unexpectedly impressed! Will spend more time in Santa Monica next time!
column3: I wanted to see the pier however visiting Santa Monica wasn't on the top of my list. We ended up visiting Venice Beach in the afternoon and enjoyed the markets and incredible sunset. At night the police come and shut everything down. There is a heavy police presence there so I wouldn't suggest going to Venice Beach at night. Once it was dark we moved on to Santa Monica and explored the pier. The pier it's self was fun but after a few rides there isn't much to do, so we had dinner at Bubba Gump's it was great, very different to anything I had had before. I saw so much in the city of Santa Monica that I would love to explore next time I go to LA. I would suggest spending about 3-4 nights there if you have the time!

Beautiful beach view and entertaining. The lights of the rides at night is a classic view. Bubba Gump Shrimp House! Parking was simple on a Thursday night in November and it wasn't too busy on the pier but the restaurants were still pretty packed.
this place is neat and expesive. nothing is cheap and no bargins. it's worth the price. the views and its clean. beaches are amazing and magazine like

column2: Was able to catch the sun set
column3: On the previous trips to LA I never had time to stop at the pier....my regrets. This place is beautiful. To be able to stand and watch the sun set or stand under the pier and take pictures...nothing like it. A must visit while in the LA area.

column2: Historic pier , rides, food and fishing :)
column3: In the summer they have Thursday nights live concerts on the pier starting at sunset. Beautiful carousel as well as fun rides for young children and a ferris wheel.

This was the most exciting spot in the area of LA. We went around sunset and it was beautiful. Everyone at the beach is working out, taking pictures, hanging out and others riding bikes. It's a place where you can be surrounded by so many people but at the same time be aline with nature.

We made it to Santa Monica via the yellow route on the Starline Hop On Hop Off Tour. Had we drove, it is unlikely we would have found parking at the lots near the pier were already full (around 11am). The pier is very touristy and was quite congested when we visited. This was my first time seeing the Pacific, and there are some great spots at the end of the pier for photo ops. We didn't go on any of the rides, but we enjoyed "people watching" and taking in all the sights. A lot of musicians playing on the pier to make a little extra money, some that were quite talented!
Looks nice lit up at night. There isn't much in the way of shops or restaurants on this pier. However, you can get onto the beach easily on a wood walkway.

Every time I go to LA, I make it a point to stop over Santa Monica Pier.Whether it be day or night, I enjoy hanging out in this area. It's a nice place to spend the morning with kids. Play on the beach and watch the waves.At night, the lights are amazing!

column2: Total tourist trap but you just got to do it, kids enjoyed it
column3: Yes, the Santa Monica Pier is very touristy, but it is fun to go through the shops, ride a couple rides, have lunch, and watch the surfers. My daughters (11 & 9) loved it and wanted to stay on the pier longer but we decided to walk down the beach more instead.We got there early around 10am and had no trouble finding parking. When we left around 1:30pm though the adjacent lot was packed.

column2: Always going back for a good time!
column3: It's a classic, something you fantasise as a child and somewhere you want to go back every time you're in L.A.

column2: Have to Walk it, and the Beach
column3: A "must include" activity, which should include a walk along the beach, participating in some of the beach activities, and enjoying the scene on the pier.

1) I love their location - right on Sta. Monica Pier; entertainment galore!2) Food - lots of delicious seafood selection3) FANTASTIC SERVICE - they have an awesome system where you just flip the red sign "STOP" and in seconds, someone attends to your needs, questions or request. Restaurants should learn and adapt their terrific customer service.

It was a very windy day when we visited and although we enjoyed the pier, we really liked watching and participating in the athletic equipment and activities on the beach more.It's more for families with young children ready and willing to part with their money for junk food and rides.

Was a nice sunny day but very windy. Made it to be for a quick visit. Was nice though I can see it being packed on nice days! Had a nice walk on the huge beach. They keep it so nice and clean by the way.Some of the games and rides were not open. Not sure if that's due to the windy day b
Great relaxing morning. Beautiful sunny day just wandering around the pier. Had lunch at Bubba Gumps . Great for all ages
Spent a day down here and really enjoyed it. Would recommend hiring a bicycle and riding down to Venice beach. Lots of food and clothes shopping around too
This is a fun house of retail stores selling souvenirs and Hot Dog On A Stick is nearby. Funhouse complete with Ferris wheel.
Fun time, but dont see us going many times. Roller Coaster lets you 2x in a row since its really short...... Worth a visit
Its a little place to chill out near the beach area , can be cold in evening and can be fun with family and friends . You have restaurants and bars for some good time
It is a cool pier with a good bit to see and do. It just gets really crowded on weekends so be prepared to dodge all the people trying to snap pics on the pier.
Nice place to sit and listen to the ocean. We did not ride and of the attractions but it was still a nice place to sit and feel the wind.
Lots of rides , souvenirs shops and amazing beaches right next to Pier.For food , there is a street 400m from the Pier which has good restaurants and fast food joints.

My wife and I visited the Santa Monica pier while traveling through California back in March. It was relatively close to our hotel and we figured we couldn't be that close and not check it out. We visited at night while it was all lit up and it was a really fun atmosphere. Lots of activities and places to eat, but just taking in the overall sites are the big draw. We walked to the end of the pier and watched the fisherman and enjoyed looking down at the waves crashing on the beach. If you are in the area, you should certainly stop by.

A beautiful view of the ocean. Many restaurants and shops to stop at. You can fish from the pier. The beach is there too in case you want to swim (too cold when we were there). Above the pier is a park that is really nice to walk thru - a few statues and a great view of the ocean and pier.

We arrived here after about 30 hours of travelling with no sleep so we were feeling pretty average. Had breakfast and then walked down the pier to check out the sights. There was a public, free yoga class going on at the end of the pier which looked pretty cool. I had a swim in the ocean before we left to check in to our hotel and it was very refreshing. Worth a look and if you can go when all the rides and stuff are going it would probably be quite fun, if not a little bit expensive but good.

This was on our must-see list for our Cali coast road trip, and it didn't disappoint. Parking was easy-in and easy-out and was $6, which I thought was going to be more. Great views of the coast and plenty of sunshine made it a nice stop. The public bathrooms could have been cleaner, but otherwise, this is a recommended stop.

The Pier is lovely. Full of people and their kids. There are many restaurants to chose from and the view is amazing.My only complaint was how little you could do. Like, sure, you can eat and enjoy the games, but they are mostly for little kids, so it gets a little boring after a while. But it's a nice spot if you want to be lazy and enjoy the sun!
This pier is a must if you are visiting Santa Monica we went in the morning before all the rides opened and it was quiet at that time but it did get very busy later in the day.

Visited here on vacation with my 20 year old daughter. Don't understand why this remains a tourist attraction. It's just a long boring pier with far too many dirty bums. The view of the ocean is great and it was nice to be in a place that has been in plenty of movies. Glad I can cross it off of my bucket list. Worth a trip if you must do the typical tourist attractions

Loved our time at the Santa Monica Pier. Acted like tourists and enjoyed the pier.Went before our early afternoon plane and walked the pier. Saw some wildlife and caught some rays.The boys think it was great and didn't know why we didn't live closer. Local music, fun colorful locals, and even some kind of camera crew where all there for us to enjoy. Certainly not what we see at home.

The pier is so lively and worth a visit. We went to a walk, and then decided to stay for lunch and hit the roller coaster for a couple rounds. Really a great time had by our family and my son of 10 said it was one of his Favorite places he's ever visited just due to the cool vibe.

As we drove from the Vegas to LA on Route 66 we thought we had to visit Santa Monica! The pier is a little dated and needs a bit of TLC and the rides are a little pricey but it's well worth a visit to see! And if you can make it for sunset it's absolutely breathtaking.
This is where route 66 ended in the days. Great ambiance and nice place to go in the evening. We felt secure and enjoyed the amusement park at the end of the pier. An iconic place in L.A.

The Santa Monica Pier is a typical ocean pier complete with rides, attractions and arcades for kids. You'll find people selling various items and mediocre, chain-type restaurants. I recommend walking up to Ocean to eat.

This place has a great vibe and special views. What a spot for such a mixture of people and things to do. It is even the end of Route 66. Loved the setting and the atmosphere of music people and amusement.

column2: Good trip, not much to do
column3: I was a bit disappointed with the pier, it was very orientated towards young children. Other than a few restaurants there wasn't much to do. It is nice to relax on the beach and check out the mall across the road though.

column2: " The End of the Mother Road....."
column3: A must Do on any trip to LA. The Pier is an Iconic part of Califorian and American History. We visited on a weekend and the whole coastal area was packed. The beach was as wide as I have seen and the pier itself is home to Restaurants, Fun park, and vendors selling hats souvenirs etc, Buskers and Hotdog stands.The Pier is not the real attraction, but its the people that visit, that makes this place so special.
We spent Halloween on the Santa Monica Pier. It was a real buzz. Lots of people dressed up as well as buskers to watch. The highlight was riding the ferris wheel watching the sunset.
The rides are over priced...but must visit when you are here. Go early in the day to avoid the bigger lines.
Every age group will have a great time just walking the pier, shopping or riding the rides! Definitely worth a visit!

Good old style fun, but a little dated and could do with some renovation, although the oldness gives it a certain charm.Better at night than in the day when it is all light up and you cant quite see it looks like its going to fall down

It was our first visit to Santa Monica. Visiting 'The Pier' was recommended as something we 'should do'. We followed the advice -- it's very much like any other tourist attraction --- restaurants, souvenir shops, arcades.
I went in november 2014, it is a nice pier with some attraction, a good tex mex restaurant ( I takes a good margarita!) .
I love the pier and the surrounding area, I want to go back someday. This place also the end of the 66 route. Worth to visit.

column2: Something to Experience but Not Necessarily a "Must"
column3: When asking people where to go when visiting Los Angeles the Santa Monica Pier always gets a mention. While one of the more exciting piers along CA's southern coast due to the amusement like rides, it is still just a pier.But being a pier you do benefit from amazing views and the occassional wildlife spotting. Seals are a frequent occurrence.Like other tourist spots the fair is expensive, so you're better off purchasing food and souvenirs just off the pier.Go to say you went. Linger for the amazing food and overall vibe. But don't go out of your way to cross town and make it an afternoon.

I had a few extra hours to burn in LA and I wanted to visit this famous pier. I instantly was inspired to eat ice cream on the pier......and that's what I did!The people watching is amazing as are the views of the sea and land. Go to this pier and eat ice cream!
I have seen this place in the movies so many times so it was an awesome buzz to be there in person. Always a lot of activity happening.
The beach around the pier is my favorite in Southern California simply because of childhood memories. The pier itself is older and not as fun as it was when I was a kid.
Going one time might be enough. Not a big fan of this place and is kind of pricy for what u get. Didn't like it that much. I would rather take the kids another place and spend money differently.

There are fun rides at the Santa Monica pier, including the ferris wheel. A great place to come with kids or enjoy a flashback to your childhood. The place is really an institution and worth a visit. But, once is enough.

A walk along the pier provided great views and photo opportunities but the offerings on the pier consisted mainly off yacky tourist rubbish and low quality buskers as well as the inevitable people soliciting for cash. Didn't try the restaurant (s?) but tbe fast food outlets were not tempting. Disappointing -apart from the views
But much more, a kind of myth in fact, this pier is really lovely, with musicians, painters, scupltors, just name it, the feeling is great and the place is very secure

I went with my 7 year old after dark to see the pier all lit up for night, and what a great decision! Was so beautiful and nostalgic, with the full moon and the stars. And of course, it's California so it was still very warm, we played in the sand at the beach when we needed a break from the lights and sounds of Pacific Park (the amusement park on the pier). Would SO go back.

A place you have to visit, our family had a great morning here and returned back in the evening. We had a few drinks at Al Mare what a view and great service. Teenagers enjoyed the amusement park and aquarium then finished up at Buppa Gumps for dinner watching the sunset. Great sun sets

Of course we had to visit the pier! We thought it was very nice but seeing it on tv, I was expecting more than what we saw. I guess it seems bigger on the small screen, but it is still worth a walk through to say that we did it.
Nice place to take a walk and enjoy the view of the beach and moutains. Don't need a lot of time to see the whole pier.
This is a very tacky area with same being said for the numerous souvenir shops/goods being sold here.

column2: Fun for a visit and photos
column3: Definitely a must do for Santa Monica but be sure to allow for the great photo opportunities at sunset and in the evening!

My brother and I visited looking for touristy stuff and a bite to eat. I wasn't too thrilled by it but I was just at Mission Beach in the San Diego area a couple months ago and there really is no comparing the two. This pier has a few rides, but I'm not sure what ages would really enjoy it. There is a couple of touristy shops and kiosks, but not as many as I thought there would be. The beach was clean and parking was easy at the garage across from the police department. There were a couple of good street performers who added to the atmosphere. Overall it was a nice taste of California for my brother, but it is definitely not a place with much nightlife or even a reason to spend more than a couple of hours.

The day we went to the pier the wind was ridiculously strong. The Pier looks cool. Has a mini theme park with rides on it. Has a beautiful merry-go-round inside the ice cream shop at the start of the pier. Rides are only $2. Took some good pictures on the beach and Santa Monica from the pier. Sunset may be a good time to hangout there. Just too windy the day we went!

I'll start by saying this - I'm a big GTA player. And for me, the highlight of my entire trip was going to the Santa Monica Pier. However, nothing could've ever prepared me for the real life experience I had. Everything about the place made it more interesting, vibrant, and attractive. Will go again, indefinitely.
Come to have a short walk while sunset time, very nice and I love this place, yes, its a tourists place but is still nice to me. sometimes some tourists place is not that bad.

The views off the pier of the ocean was amazingRoute 66 the end of the roadwe didn't do any of the rides it looked liked fun I'm sure the views from the Farris wheel where greatwe looked around the shop on the pier went for lunchthen we put our feet in the ocean walked in the sand great afternoon

I walked from Venice beach down to Santa Monica pier and id highly recommend this....Arriving to the pier i was blown away by the energy and vibrant atmosphere, so many stalls and street artists, the pier is busy so keep the little ones close

The pier is a fun place to take the time to walk around and enjoy the views, the people, the atmosphere, and good food. The "public parking" buildings are very pricey, if you go to the pier, park directly in the piers parking area, it is the cheapest around, and puts you right by the pier.

After a day on the beach, the pier is a great place to relax in the evening - it is very safe with some fun food places - I would highly recommend the Malibu Veggie Burger from "Beach Burger" at the entrance to Pacific Park (where the roller coaster/rides are). My family voted it the best vegetarian burger ever! No contest! $6.50 +tax. Also their garlic fries are STRONG! (But amazing!) :)There's a very small aquarium under the pier which entertained us on the Sunday morning. It's not big but the staff are fantastic - very well informed and great at explaining things in a way that really captured my kids' imaginations. It was such a bargain too - $5 for adults and kids 12 and under are totally free. It only opens a few hours per day, so check opening times before you make plans.There is a carousel located near the aquarium - definitely worth a look and a go at only $2 per adult and $1 per child with an old fashioned ice cream shop located alongside. Beautiful.There's a Bubba Gump shop/restaurant which does have some specific Santa Monica Pier t-shirts and is fun to browse in.This is the end of Route 66 too so there are some fun photos to be taken by the sign on the end of the pier. There is also a good, 1980 type arcade with classics like pacman, air hockey, Zoltar and similar.

It's INCREDIBLY BUSY on a Saturday evening. But to walk off Ocean Drive onto the pier and out to the end, past the colourfully illuminated Ferris Wheel is a treat for the eyes. Plus you get to see a sample of the eclectic mix of Californian Residents and Visitors.

Drive onto the pier and park directly on the pier for $2/hour. Don't get scammed by the other signs for "public parking." One place across from the pier wanted $20! Yikes! A late lunch at the Albright ($60 for a family of four) and some selfies on the Ferris wheel (a bit overpriced at $8 per person) made for a nice albeit expensive memory.

Easily accessible with good parking facilities, the pier is a "must visit" for anyone driving the Pacific Coast Highway. It is the end point of Route 66 and there is plenty of memorabilia on offer, including a great photo opportunity at the end of the pier.There are a few fairground rides -the big wheel really stands out -and places to eat. A great visit all round.
Great place for a walk. Very chilled out place that is good for families. Felt very safe. There was also a Thai food festival when we were there so we ate a lot of fantastic food.

column2: Must see when visiting the LA area
column3: Visited with my boyfriend on Halloween. The first thing I noticed was how busy it was, but that's to be expected with such a landmark. It had a fun blend of people, music, food, and attractions. It also abuts the beach which was very clean and made for a fun afternoon. Definitely see it at least once.
The pier is pretty cool,lots of people with different activities going on. I wouldnt spend more than half an hour there though,and Santa Monica beach isnt a greart place to chill out.

Santa Monica Pier was on our list of places we had to visit. While we were not overwhelmed we were not disappointed. The pier has some rides, although not many, restaurants, shops and games. Fun place for kids and sits on the beach. There is tons of parking, but if it is a beach day get there early because it is hard to find. The one great thing are the sunsets over the ocean which are stunning. Nothing special about a pier with rides, but we enjoyed ourselves.
