I enjoyed seeing the pier. We got there early and it wasn't crowded at all. The beach around the pier was huge. We found parking on the street. Plenty of place to eat. Great view from the end of the pier. Plenty of people were fishing at the end.

Landmark place, it is very nice and family oriented, but also ok to go for a walk and appreciate the beach from here if you are alone or with friends, It has some very well known commercial restaurants, if you are in Santa Monica definitely a place to go for a quick walk and maybe have a beer or dinner if you are with your family

column2: Fairly touristy but still worth it
column3: Super touristy attraction. There was a sea lion at the end of the pier which was the high light. The view was beautiful and a great spot to snap a picture of Santa Monica in the background.

The Pier was absolutely buzzing. Crazy busy with tourists, locals and bikers who were reaching the end of their Route 66 adventure. It really was wonderful. Plenty of eateries available, you name it, they have it. The amusement park reminded me of English Piers, colourful, happy and lively.Buskers, seals, old style cop cars - atmosphere plus.
Kids can run around....the beach is just close by. Restaurants are limited of choice though. But the atmosphere itself is worth the experience.
Cool place to walk about. Very touristy prices so I would suggest you only browse here. Lots of food options at a beautiful location.

Santa Monica Pier Great place to spend few hours just sinking into cool sand, listening to the various musicians who happen to be around and watching people. There are many restaurants and pubs to just chill. Don't forget to take a photo at the historic end of Route 66

Visited recently and had a great night on the pier- plenty of places for food and drink, some very talented musicians busking along the pier- leaving enough space so as not to have to play over each other.It was great watching the fishermen at the end of the pier, made me jealous I didnt bring my own rod!
Just walking around with lovely weather, treating ourselves to ice cream at the carousel and letting the kids spend some time with classic video games at the arcade made for a lovely afternoon in LA.

My kids were dying to go "to the edge of the Santa Monica pier" after having performed in a production of Xanadu in NYC. The piers houses rides, shops and restaurants much like an amusement park. It sits on a beach and is very crowded. Restaurants are packed. Really enjoyed it but not sure that I would make a special trip back. A must see. Lots of parking but its tough especially on a nice beach day. Great sunset views from the pier.

Full of vibrant colors and amazing street artists. The area is well kept and cleaned up given the high number of visitors it sees in a day. Pacific Park, particularly the The Ferris Wheel and Roller coaster are great fun. The pier has a number of touristy shops that add to the general atmosphere. An absolute must do if you're going to be in the LA area.
Lovely to walk along something I've seen on to etc. Lots of buskers there and people to watch. Food stalls too with great views of beach and ocean

My favourite part of the trip was reading the history of the pier.. Which is posted on boards near the piers end. Really interesting. Everything else is much like piers all over.. Overpriced tourist stands and lots of sea.

column2: A must see when in LA!
column3: Wonderful old fashioned pier filled with food, fun and street art!Try the rides or just stroll along the pier ...Part of old Santa Monica!
Nice place for a swim as water doesn't get very deep until far out. Nice walk along the boardwalk and the beach.

column2: Nice place to explore and walk around
column3: Great place to spend an hour or two or more if you want to sit on the beach. Has a lot of history. We go to the Pier most times we are in LA as I love to look in the shops, listen to the various musicians who happen to be around and watch people. The Playland is fun if you have kids or are young at heart and the carousal is a must do if you have never done it before. There are various restaurants available if you want to have something to eat. Parking is plentiful and the Farmer's Market that is held on Saturdays is close by. Great fun!

column2: The background from so many movies
column3: Beautiful day in California, stopped by the Santa Monica Pier!! Fantastic. Very clean.. Lots of vendors.. Great views of the beach. Can't wait to go back.

Came here to complete our Route 66 trip. There's a lovely shop where if you show your passport you can get a certificate for driving Route 66.The pier itself is pretty, nice to walk to the end of the promenade and there were some seals when we went.Definitely a must, especially if you've just driven across America on the Mother Road!
If you are a tourist just go here. See a place you've seen in dozens of movies and people watch.I'd say take half a day to stroll the pier and have dinner. Always interesting musicians.

Very dirty place with poo and pigeons everywhere! As a tourist, I was expecting something different...maybe my expectations were too high. However, I definitely will not be back anywhere near that place!
This is a pretty good place to take your family if you are close by. A little dated but still fun. The pier is the very western end of Route 66. Pretty cool.

I was on a short business trip and had one afternoon to sightsee. Went to Santa Monica, whole area is charming and touristy. On Sundays it's pretty full, but I guess it's part of the charm, still you can stare out to the ocean and feel relaxed. Don't forget to take a photo at the historic end of Route 66 and with the ferris wheel as background.

This place is not worth seeing. Older places can be charming, but this one just feels dirty, tacky and rundown. Save the expensive parking fees and just drive by it. It looks much better from the road than it does in person.

For us, the greatest way to reach the Pier was to walk there along the Pacific seashore from Venice beach. It will take you about an hour, but it's well worth the effort! Great views and great food and drinks at the original Bubba Gump!

column2: Cute place, not as exciting as I would have expected
column3: Its the end of the old Route 66 trail. The pier is full of a few shops, some kinda sub-par restaurants, and fast food. It was nice to say I have "been" but definitely not as exciting as would have expected. It does have the little theme park full of a few rides and games, that made it nice.. I recommend but don't sleep if you miss out.
This is a great pier with plenty to see and do here. There are shops on the pier and the fun fair but that doesn't open until 11. The pier is clean and fun and a must see

column2: A bit of bling on the coast
column3: My wife and I visited the pier over the period 22-27 Oct 2015; it has all the razz-a-mataz of the early 1900s coupled with modern day fairground rides. The was a water conference from the Agha Khan Foundation (AKF) whilst we were there, as well as numerous tourists lapping up the trinkets that could be bought, including many T-shirts and souvenirs celebrating the start of Route 66. A good picturesque landmark and well worth visiting, and a stones throw from Santa Monica, literally across the road. Use 'The Big Blue Bus' company to get you here, it's $1 on any route, with most routes going to Santa Monica. Well worth a visit.

Got to the pier around 6:30 and even though there were still a lot of people walking around the staff was closing up for 7. Kool place to walk, hangout, people watch, but check hours since they change with the seasons.
We stopped here whilst on our road trip and it was very interesting the pier had lots going on so you would not get bored.

It's a great place to visit. Wonderful Santa Monica beach with golden sands. Mast time, you can enjoy with ur family n friends. Do cycling there. Also the art n work on pier is must to see. Do shopping on pier specially buy the souvenir. It's great deal.

column2: Kids luved it and a must do attraction
column3: We were visiting Santa Monica and this is an attraction that you have to visit simply to mark off the list. The kids had a great time on the rides.Songs have been written about it and movies filmed their so now we have been there.

I traveled to Santa Monica Pier on Wednesday, October 21st for the sunset upon arrival into LAX. It was something I had always wanted to see from there. I'm happy I did it. The sunset was beautiful with the thin clouds in the distance. Full of vibrant colors while listening to a street artist play by the bleachers. The area is well kept and cleaned up given the high number of visitors it sees in a day. The Ferris Wheel and Roller coaster light up at night for amazing pictures too. An absolute must do if you're going to be in the LA area. Cab ride from LAX is $35 depending on traffic conditions.

Great pier for a stroll with your love. Many small shops and activities including a museum and a school for trapeze which is fun to watch! Also, seems to be a very popular hot dog shop at the front of the pier, but I did not find the hotdogs to be remarkable.

column2: Don't go after dark!!! Full of shoeless crackheads!
column3: Was disturbed by what we saw. Within first few minutes on the pier we were propositioned by drugged man with the question "Eat pills?" One of several..... Couldn't wait to leave! Expensive parking in lot for such a short trip. Visited during day once before and it was a decent, family place. Not much there, but historic place with at least one visit with your camera. The Mexican restaurant is NOT good!

The main attraction in Santa Monica is the pier. Always very busy but definitely worth a visit. It is also the unofficial end to Route 66 so be sure to have your photo taken next to the sign. At the end of the pier there is a tribute to one of the most famous Route 66 personalities Rob Waldmire. The views from the pier are great. There is also an amusement arcade with some vintage games in and of course the famous fair. A trip on the Ferris wheel is well worth the money. There are many souvenir shops selling various Route 66 memorabilia and Los Angeles and California stuff too. A great place to people watch and relax.

column2: A must do in Santa Monica
column3: I came to LA for a bachelorette party and I can't imagine us leaving without visiting the pier. Lots of cute restaurants.. Make sure to snap a pic of the Classic Santa Monica pier sign and ride the Ferris wheel if you can for an amazing view. Great spot to bring kids as well.
A lot of attractions. Very colourful at night. For those who not like seafood, there is nothing to eat there...
Nice to walk and people watch. Plenty of shops and food. Access to beach. Birds are a pain but soon you forget they are there. During weekday it was not crowded. Parking is ok.

column2: Must-see for tourists and locals alike!
column3: Beautiful views, shops, kiosks, musicians (pots and pans used as drums), guitarists, singers, artists, bicyclists, skaters, restaurants! Just strolling along the pier is a great experience. There are a lot of colorful characters and everyone is very friendly. A fun place to visit!

Well, you pretty much know what you are going to get if you come here. It's a really touristy place. After you're done walking around a bit, head away and go find a nice bar or restaurant away from the crowds and enjoy the area

We took the 1hr local bus trip to here from our hotel in Hollywood. Local bus only $2.50 each. Beautiful view and an iconic place BUT some aspects, like the arcade are looking very old and dirty. We only needed to spend 2 hrs there.

column2: Fun for kids and adults alike
column3: Walked across from the promenade.Beautiful sunny day. Lots of people about.Fun rides available along with options for F&B.You can also take some handy photos with great backdrop views.Well recommended.

column2: Good spot to hang out but too busy
column3: Was here on a business trip and this was the first stop getting off the airplane. Of course it was too crowded and hard to find a parking spot. They did put in a lot more parking spaces in the shopping mall close by.The pier is nice but it's not that great. There's a ferris wheel and some street artists. We walked around for a little bit but there wasn't much else to do there. The beach is huge but you can see the smog... even at the beach.
If you are here escaping a Canadian winter, this is a lovely place to walk and relax. There are lots of 'beach people' in the area, so best to go here during the day.

Great for all ages. Rides for children . Food and beautiful ocean view. Parking is $12. IF you are disabled no parking fee. A long walk to Venice Beach about 6.00 miles but great view and side walks divided for walkers and bikers skaters ect. Makes it saver for all. If you get tired there is a metro car that is free to take you back to the pier. Just ask sidewalk benders or security. Seats 5.
I loved it here. There are plenty of parking around but in town some give first 2hrs free and its a pleasant walk to the pier. Lovely views acrross to Malibu.

The Pier is a one of a kind very interesting place with many different things to do. Part amusement park, part shopping at vendors on the pier, part eating snacks/fast food, part seeing the ocean and birds plus there is a small aquarium. Lots of families there. A fun atmosphere

Watching the sunset here on the last night of our holiday is a moment I will never forget. It brought tears to my eyes.The pier is well maintained, has a lot of good food options and a good vibe.A must to visit when in the area - you won't regret it.
Good place to stop by, just be prepared for the crowds. Have yourself a hot dog and watch the sunset.

We love visiting this place, my kids love to hire bikes and ride along the beach. The weather was pretty terrible, but it was still a nice hot day. The pier is old but it has a nice twist to it. The rides are great fun, good to go when the crowds aren't huge. Food is great, we visit all the time.

We love the Santa Monica Pier. It's a fun, lively and entertaining setting. Lots of people, but that is to be expected. A variety of food vendor options (pier food... hot dogs, hamburgers, ice cream, etc.). When the sun goes down it's a beautiful setting with all of the rides lit up and the water splashing against the pier. Fun to walk up and down, shop, listen to music or just sit there on the bench enjoying the view. The beach is gorgeous!

column2: Pier was okay, the ocean was disgusting!
column3: The pier is an average tourist attraction and super busy with people. All of Santa Monica is super busy with people, though.The ocean is extremely dirty in this area and the water was a disgusting green colour and the foam that comes off the ocean onto the sand was this horrible green colour and it smelled quite bad. Yuck. I could not believe people were actually in the water.Not a whole lot to see at the pier - some restaurants, vendors, kiddie rides, etc.

column2: Lovely, old fashioned pier with modern twists
column3: Much enjoyed the pleasant stroll in the sun with much-needed minor breeze for relief.Plenty to see and sample too

column2: Very Nice Pier / Beach with stuff to do for Kids
column3: This place was very good to have lots of food to eat and also enjoy the kiddie rides on the pier and go to the beach for a swim

column2: Must do in Santa Monica area
column3: We visited on a weekend and the pier gets mega busy, but in someways this is an advantage because it gives a real buzz to the place. If you don't get too bumped it is enjoyable!
Absolutely no fun. Difficult to find good food. Dirty and without no real attraction. For me, a complete disappointment
A classic to walk on. Rather crowded but fun for the kids. The rides are not that expensive. The restaurants are rather expensive and poor quality

This place is something youd see from a movie. it is so spot on to what my expectations were. Went on a thursday and it was pretty dead so when we brought rollercoaster tickets they let us ride again for free. Staff are helpful and friendly. Would recommend this place 100%

column2: Real California history. A must see!
column3: Lots of reasonable parking and good food right on the pier. Great photo opportunities from the ferris wheel. Lots of vendors and good entertainment. Just a great place to find complete relaxation. Its nice to be able to stroll down such a historic structure! Truly a must see if in southern CA

The Santa Monica Pier is one iconic location of LA. Further to the rollercoaster and the Ferris wheel, the rest is unnecessary. But it is a visit to pay on your first trip to LA, of course. Parking near Santa Monica Pier can be challenging (or just expensive).
Bring your family, your love, and spend a leisure day here. You can't say you've lived, or visited the LA area without visiting the pier.

We first visited on a weekend. The pier was very busy which made it impossible to enjoy. We went back on a Monday which was so much better. All the attractions and shops were still open and we were actually able to stroll along and take everything in rather than constantly try to fight our way through crowds.We took the bus to the pier and we were glad we did as we saw a sign saying parking was $12. There was an amusement park on the pier with basic fairground rides that looked well maintained. There were also lots of souvenir shops and restaurants.The iconic "End of Route 66" sign was here and like most people we had our photo taken by it.

Yes I know it's a bit outdated, quirky at some points, with those old fashioned game halls and photo salesmen, but that's exactly why you shouldn't miss out on this charming spot in bustling LA. Great beach vistas at the far end of the pier, where, if you're lucky, the old man in red will play golden oldies on his guitar.. What else?

Nice day- warm late spring dayNot overcrowdedThe area is nothing special but I suppose you have to see itVenice beach is a bit cheap and nasty- the canals are so-soWe hired bikes which made it enjoyable

column2: Fun place to visit for the attraction of it
column3: Went to Santa Monica Pier with the family because my wife said they had to experience it once in their life. Honestly, it was fun walking the pier and seeing the sights, but I don't think it was a do-again. There is only so many times you can see someone playing music, or buying gifts, or ride some rides. It was a fun time, don't get me wrong. Just don't expect to spend all day here, because you will be broke and bored. Also, if you like buying shirts, don't expect to get lucky if you are larger than an XL. None of the shops on the pier carry anything bigger than an XL, even in a hoody. I like hoodies that are 3X or 4X, so I can wrap myself in them. No luck. The traffic was packed on the pier, but it was still a unique experience that my kids were glad to have been to.
We were at the Santa Monica Pier on Sunday, September 27, 2015 during the eclipse. While there we rode the Pacific Wheel.
We biked from our hotel to this Pierre and was not dissapointed! A lot cleaner than Venice and a lot more activities to do! Great athmosphere, though it can be really packed with loads of people!

The Santa Monica pier is a beautiful place. I've been before and it's always exciting to go back. The pier is always busy with entertainers, games, rides and laughter. Take in the scenery and enjoy some ice cream. Take note...single riders are not allowed on the ferris wheel.Beyond the pier you can find great restaurants and shopping on the promenade.

column2: Another tick off my bucket list
column3: Missed this back in 2010 and finally made it during a 9 hour lay over. So pleased. Great place to contemplate life while peering over the expanse of the ocean. Plenty of food choices if required. Lovely spot!!
Definelty something to see! Busy, and fun.The Ferris wheel is most interesting, because it is run on solar energy.
lots going on & plenty of shops. Lots of places to eat & the place had a buzz about it. Would have gone back again had we had enough time
A classic pier and amusement park with a roller coaster for the kids and lots of things to do. And people watching is only half of it!
This was place us packed with things to do. the scenery is ideal and great for people watching. there is a ton of parking and lots of sightseeing right off the pier. I enjoyed it!

Since we went in October, it wasn't busy and we were able to park on the boardwalk parking area. The parking was only $3.00 for an hour, which was more than enough time to walk the pier, take photos etc. Yes it's pretty much a tourist trap, but still neat to see.

column2: End of Route 66. Pacific Ocean. Nice views
column3: One of the things you gotta do when you visit. After all it is the end of Route 66. Worth a walk to the end. Carousel is fun for kids. The Pacific Park rides are lackluster with the exception of the ferris wheel. Aquarium is tiny and probably interesting only to the under 5 crowd. Mostly chain restaurants, best local place to eat is Duke's Surf Cafe [burgers, chili fries, beer] under the carousel on the strand. Great views at the Mexican joint on the end, food is mediocre margaritas good.
This Pier was very nice. A good walk from our hotel. Great atmosphere. And family friendly. A little entertaining.

The pier in Santa Monica is a great place for fun near the beach. There are a number of shops, rides, and restaurants on the pier. There is even an interesting shop at the very end of the pier. The pier can be very crowded on weekends and holidays and for its concert series. You can also visit the beach adjacent to pier and make a whole day of it.
A must do! A great pier to watch the sun come down, a few good restaurants , souvenirs and amusement park rides. A great place for photos. I recommend going at night when it is all lit up too.

Lots of people watching. The views are great! Make sure to walk all the way to the end and also up the steps to the highest point. What a nice view of the bay! Take time to ride at least one ride. The souvenir photos are fun too!!

We had plans to meet up with family near 3rd Street Promenade, so we decided to spend our day on the pier and beach. The pier is a fun little tourist trap. I always enjoy walking down piers and this one has plenty to see. They have rides, an arcade, restaurants aplenty, and of course souvenir shops. The rides were overpriced for us, but could be fun if you bought an all day pass. This is a fun quick stop if you are already in the area.

We visited the pier while in the area and had a good time. It's a tourist trap with lots of little shops to get your fill of all the Route 66 memorabilia and LA apparel you want, but also had the carnival rides and a variety of restaurants to enjoy.
We were a bit disappointed as we thought that the pier would be different. Very touristy and tacky. Views were great. The sign stating that it was the end of Route 66 is the only thing worth seeing.
We visited the pier to see the 'Route 66 End of Trail' sign which was good as we'd just completed the drive from Chicago. Otherwise it's just OK with what you might expect from a seaside pier.

Our family spent the day here and although it is old and run down we feel it is a must see. The arcade is fun for kids but super dirty...the view from the pier is beautiful and there is a lot to do with restaurants and the amusement park and beach. Our daughter loved it.
Great view. Kids enjoyed the amusement park but they were shutting rides early which was annoying. Nice views

column2: picture perfect carnival atmosphere on the pier
column3: A great place for a stroll on a sunny afternoon! Great street music, restaurants, tourist shops and lots of happy people taking in the gorgeous views and ocean beauty. It gets crowded from late morning until closing, so bring your patience.
I was jetlhgged and over-tired, yet I spent the entire afternoon there. There were so many gift stalls, it was crazy! So nice, the seabreeze making the really hot day bearable.

column2: A gorgeous place to watch the sun set.
column3: I love Santa Monica pier, it is worth visiting after a full day of being a tourist this is a place you can unwind. The sunsets are not to be missed here! Rt.66 ends here and at the very end of the pier is the "Last Stop Shop" the final store on Rt.66. A fun place full of history. There is something for everyone-a small amusement park for the kids to include an old carousel. An aquarium is also right here at the pier. Lots of places to eat and things to do. Plenty of gift shops and the beach is just a few steps away.

column2: FIrst time being on the west coast
column3: We were in town for the weekend for a business trip and I Have never been to the pacific ocean. Going to the Santa Monica Pier is a must do for everyone. THe atmosphere is so warm and inviting and well worth the drive.
Great place to visit, just to walk down the Pier and sit and watch the people to eating at one of the great outlets.It is a must in Santa Monica

column2: Back Porch Cinema at the Pier - No Movie
column3: We love the pier. The pier gets 5 stars, but we went to their first night movie last Friday, and they couldn't ever get the projector to work... at least not while we were there. For a movie that was supposed to start at 7-ish... and we left at 8:20PM... well, we were disappointed. We really wanted to see Big Hero 6 which was slated to show. I don't know if they ever got it going, and if not, whether they will show the movie another time, but we were disappointed. Overall it was still a fun night, though. We love the Pier!

The pier is great for all ages, there are some really fun rides at pretty good prices. And an awesome wheel with a great view of Santa Monica! Worth a go!There are some lovely shops And restaurants suitable for everyone, even just take a walk down there,some great views of the sunset!

column2: This pier is amazing! Great time and place to be with the family.
column3: We've never been here so decided to check it out on our trip to LA. And we are very glad we did. The views from the Ferris wheel are breath taking and the atmosphere is great.Quick tip- place is packed so be patient and keep a close eye on the little ones. Rides can be pricey but if you're riding them all multiple times then get the unlimited pass. The walk to Venice Beach sounds long however it's a beautiful walk, highly recommend it.

column2: Too many people; not enough fun
column3: I've been here several times and every time I visit I notice an increase in people. There are far too many people on the pier to have an enjoyable time, especially on the weekends. To get a hot dog, I had to wait in line for 10 minutes. The restaraunts are overpricedand and the amusement park offers boring rides for a hefty price. If you've never been here before then I guess I could understand coming here, but it's just a tourist trap with little originality.
I was in the area for work, but would love to visit for leisure sometime. Cool place - shopping, entertainment, and restaurants all on the pier.

column2: I'd rather go North to the Beach
column3: I had to see it. I'd only seen it from a distance, at night, so I had to see the Santa Monica Pier. I'd much rather go to Monterey, Carmel, or Santa Cruz, but I'm glad I at least got to see and walk the Santa Monica Pier.

column2: Iconic and eclectic; usually crowded but rarely dull
column3: The world-famous Santa Monica Pier is a Southern California landmark that offers food, fun, entertainment, rides, and activities to its visitors. Seeing its beautiful, iconic, multi-colored neon sign at night is a must-see right up there with the HOLLYWOOD sign and Grumman's Chinese Theater. The nice thing about the pier is you can stroll to the end and back in well under an hour or you can spend an entire afternoon or evening on it by dining, riding some rides, watching the entertainers, etc.
Fun! Brought back many memories of kids fishing from the pier. The beach was very nice. Parking was simple and there are many nice restaurants in the area. Great place to spend the afternoon.

If you are in Los Angeles don't hesitate Santa Monica pier is a must see. You can have a fun morning in the park attractions, have a good lunch in the restaurant that are in the pier or the ones near it. And in the afternoon you can walk the pier while seeing the dusk.

We visited Santa Monica in winter - which meant that several of the stalls and rides were closed which was unfortunate. Check what is open before you go. We were able to ride the ferris wheel though and that was great. We went just before sunset and so got a view of the Cali coast during daylight and then took a few more rides as the sun was setting - made for some great photos and views. It is an iconic location and while in some ways it is not exactly spectacular - we were still pleased to have visited it and to have had this experience. Some great phosot son the boardwalk too as the sun was setting in the west over the water.

If you're looking for a day/night event when in the area--this is highly recommended! Check out the operating hours online first if you plan to ride (we got there late on a Thursday and they were already shut down)! Surf & souvenir shops, food (fast food to fine dining), kiosks, artists, musicians, and romance! This pier has it all! A bit of a bumpy ride for someone in a wheelchair, stroller, or walker, but it is doable.

The pace is slow, the sights are great, the sun is shining. This all makes the pier a nice place to visit.There are quite a few spots to eat, drink, and sit. Buskers improve the atmosphere and add a little music to your step.The Ferris wheel is definitely worthwhile getting on. $8 a person and you get the best seats on the pier.

I enjoyed my few hours at the pier. The beach was nice and the water was pretty. It was neat to see the rollercoaster and rides. The6 had a few shops and restaurants. I bought a snowglobe and the good ol fridge magnet. Also a really cute sunhat. Nice spot. Id go again.

The pier is a great place to stroll or do activities and entertainment. It has a few restaurants, including Bubba Gumps seafood.The pier has a lot of history and is right off the city streets, 2 blocks from Santa Monica Blvd and on Ocean Drive.A great place to unwind and relax, even though it is very busy at times.

Fun, eclectic outing with all the traditional beach front stands. Historic Merry-Go-Round. Street Buskers. Ice cream and gift shops. Carnival rides and vintage games. Several restaurants and food stands. Great beach and ocean views. Second tier fishing deck below main pier traffic. Police presence. Free concerts offered. Enter from street, beach walk or sand.
I went in there after dark, a lot of people walking around while enjoying the food and the sights. Souvenir items were a bit expensive but I can't help myself to get one.

column2: Fun to go to if you haven't been
column3: Santa Monica Pier is run to go to if you've never been. Once you go, you can check it off your list and never go again, but you've got to go once.

The pier is a great place to people watch and enjoy a ride on the roller coaster. Not a lot of good food choices on the pier. Most places are over priced with mediocre food. Grab a cheese dog from hot dog on a stick for a snack. Venice is a short walk away with more dining options.

The first beach we visited was Santa Monica Pier. It had so much to offer ‚Äì the historical carousel, the aquarium, the arcade, the pacific park with a Ferris wheel and roller coaster, and plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from. There was ample parking available for a very reasonable price; we only paid $2 for two hours. What made it even more convenient was that parking can be reserved in advance at discounted rates. Worth the visit!
